text review: beautiful hostel and friendly staff.
first stay at a hostel and i couldn't have enjoyed it more!

i would definitely state again when i come back to downtown los angeles. it was perfect for someone who is just visiting a weekend and needs to place crash. the rooftop pool was amazing and relaxing. overall, the place was beautiful and the folks staying there were also really nice.

this place looks good on the website, then you get there and it's even better.  imagine if soho house did hostels, this is what you'd get.  it's essentially a really nice hotel, which happens to also have dorm rooms.  staff were really friendly and i met some great people there.  the rooftop pool is lovely to!  rooms are very comfortable with great bathrooms as well.  not sure i'm ever gonna find another hostel that'll match up to this one!

amazing stay! i didn't want to leave.    free breakfast in the lounge was a bit underwhelming, but am i even allowed to complain about a free breakfast? especially when the rest of the facilities are absolutely killer... i can't wait to come back.    xoxox

amazing hostel, the rooftop bar is as stunning a place to hangout as you could ever ask for! drinks are pricey for a hostel, but it’s l.a. so that’s to be expected. rooms were very clean and well maintained, bed is large enough for anyone up to about 6’4 or 195cm. not the most social hostel, most people tend to stick to themselves, but altogether, amazing value and a sense of luxury that is rarely felt when staying at a hostel. i will definitely return and would recommend anyone to stay here.

freehand la was a very fancy hostel (more like hotel), but there were just a few things that did not make it my all-time favorite hostel. the check-in process took awhile, due to a technical issue on their end. definitely an older adult vibe. was told it was happy hour at bar, but when ordering drinks told there was no happy hour that night (weird). very pricey bar!  a bed in our room was not clean & seemed someone recently slept there, which makes me wonder how clean the rooms actually are.....

awesome venue. staff were very friendly and helpful. the accomodation was all modern, private and very comfortable. overall was far better than what i expected. the bar upstairs has a cool vibe and is an awesome place to socialise. would stay there again.
by far and away he best hostel i've stayed in - totally worth the extra cost. also thought the atmosphere and mix of people was a lot of fun. will definitely stay here next time i'm in la!
warm and welcoming staff, brunch is very good, beautiful property and very well connected to downtown la. highly recommended!
(pros) has separate bathrooms for each room, nice big lockers, badass receptions (cons) shower head is weak, water taste funny, surplus for taxes and safety deposit is a bit high.
this is the best hostels out there, it’s more like a hotel type, but you only pay hostel price. i like it awesome. you can’t go wrong. true voice from heart.

staff specially downstairs bar staff are bitchy and rude. don’t work in hospitality if you’re gonna have attitude. you won’t get deposit back into account either. however! food and rooms are decent and while i have complaints against most staff there are decent people! just too clicky etc. not for people who aren’t into popularity contests or social clicks! but that is l.a. for you
fantastic hostel definitely y=the best in la

overall this is a very good hotel, locqtion is near everything and the room is very fancy and more like a hotel setup vs a hostel setup    since this were more like a hotel, there arent many chances that people would be able to interact between fellow traveller
excellent hostel. one of the best i've ever stayed around the world. will definitely stay again next time i'm back to la.

amazing place. more of a hotel than a hostel, great service, super awesome rooftop pool with strong wifi signal everywhere. i was in town working remotely and had no issues connecting, making calls, etc. pool side. it was a wonderful stay! quiet rooms, super clean, lively hotel lobby. will definitely stay again!
one of my favorite hostels so far.. sooo nice and clean, beautiful place with awesome pool and bar.. a bit more pricier then most hostels but def worth it!

this place is just beautiful.! the dorm was small, but cosy and the genius design of the beds , and layout of the room gave more privacy than usual in a dorm and made the room appear much bigger than it was.  at night, it was quiet.  staff was super friendly and helpful and the rooftop-terarce is  just beautiful.  the inner city location was great for getting around. i am not sure whether i would feel safe walking around there late at night (but that is always hard to judge in anohter city)
the hostel was amazing! very clean, staff are friendly and great ambiance! there is a very nice roof top bar/pool and a very nice israelan restaurant at the exchange. i would go back anytime.

we only stayed here one night. we wished we had been able to stay a few more days. it was a great location. this was my first time staying in a hostel in the states. it was very clean and safe. the staff was very helpful. when we called to ask about parking we were told the valet was the best option for $44 and we may be able to find something for $30. however we found a place right down the street for $12.

excellent clean hostel with solid wooden bunk beds with minimal shaking.  every bunk has an light, electrical outlet, a curtain for privacy and a shelf that can hold a lot of personal items.  rooms also have their own bathrooms opposite of having to go outside.  every bed also has a dedicated locker for valuables.    location was perfect for me as i was in town to attend a kings' game at staples center, the hostel is located a 15 min walk from the arena.

i loved everything about freehand. louis (i could have his name spelled wrong) checked me in even though i got there about 2hours before check in time. he also recommended activities for me to check out. lovely place!
more like a hotel than a hostel, not great for solo travelers who want to find people to chat to. but the rooftop pool and bar make a great place to chill out.

first class hostel, the whole stay with rooftop bar and pool was truly a hostel experience that i never had before. very near the metro station so you can base yourself there and tour the other areas of la at ease retuning to these amazing surroundings at night to relax.
had a wonderful time at this location. staff was friendly and cool, the facilities were good, the place is super clean, and the aesthetics of the place was amazing.

no laundry although the website said there was. kitchen was small and common areas were public to everyone. the lounge was more of a dining hall style. could not take your own food and eat at the rooftop which was disappointing.  room was good although there was no bin in room or good storage for big suitcases (especially when there was 4 big suitcases in the room at one time).

really nice hostel.   highly recommend it.     only issue was the shower didn't drain well so there was a pool of water you stood in while showering.     otherwise a really nice hostel (better than the motel i stayed at and paid significantly more for during the rest of my trip)

really great hotel! stayed in a mixed bed dorm; beds were comfy and you had your own locker and charging points at each bed. free wifi was very handy, breakfast was good and is a 5 minute walk to the train station. staff were friendly and very helpful, would stay here again for sure!

great overall stay! this place is pretty much a hotel the entire hostel is one of the nicest i have seen for its price. affordable and really good amenities. rooftop patio is amazing, especially during the night when its converted to a social gathering space. my only small complaint would be that the breakfast area is small so it may be tough to find seating. also the location is in downtown la so it's a bit travel if you want to go to venice beach. i would definitely recommend this place.
the rest room didn’t have a lock 4 a reason  it’s overpriced compare in what i had in sfo
great location and great price.    be careful about the parking, there are some places very close with good prices and some places where you have to pay 40usd+ for a night!
besides getting double charge which was a computer error, the staff worked with me on that. friendly staff and nice and clean.

this is a great hostel. the dorms are on one of the floors of the hotel which benefits from a rooftop pool and bar.   both the bars on the ground floor and rooftop were well stocked and had a hipster chic vibe to them. with no real space to socialise it's not the best option for a solo traveller - it definitely feels more of a hotel than hostel especially as my room was empty on my last day.   that said for the price and he overall vibe it's well worth a go, especially in a group!

i stayed at freehand for one night & it was easily the best hostel i've ever stayed in. great location as it's within walking distance or quick uber to everything, sites and local stores which made it really convenient. my four bed female dorm was extremely comfortable and very clean, with a spacious private bathroom. the complimentary breakfast was great, so were the bars and restaurants in house - the rooftop was my favourite! staff were very friendly & so helpful. highly recommend!

amazing stay at freehand los angeles! the atmosphere here is great and everyone is really lovely! free breakfast and an awesome rooftop pool are definitely a plus! would recommend this stay to anyone looking for a central hostel in la that makes you feel at home. couldn’t have asked for a better stay, loved it. :-)

i stayed at freehand while i was at a conference in la. this is an awesome place to stay! the facilities were clean, staff professional and friendly, and the environment fun, yet safe. i chose an all female room. on my last night, there was a mistake with a male being assigned the room, but the staff quickly reassigned rooms after bringing this to their attention. the rooftop bar and pool are really cool. it should be noted though that the music is loud, so be prepared with earplugs!

freehand la is the best hostel/hotel i've ever stayed in. great interior design & materials (linens, beds etc) to the level that you won't get from many good hotels. amazing service. and of course it's very clean, safe and well located. i wouldn't stay anywhere else in la.
amazing experience. can't wait to stay again, the pool on the roof is a highlight!

clearly the best hostel i've ever been to! it's even better than most of the hotels i've visited. i would definitely come again! the only thing i didn't really like was the breakfast, but it's included and so it's totally okay not to have lots of different choices for what to eat in the morning.
very helpful staff, very clean and new. kitchen could use take-away cups for coffee :-)

for 4 days, probably the best hostel i have ever stayed at. the staff were amazing, the rooms were clean and the location was central to everything. i would definitely recommend this hostel to anyone who is going to la.
this was one of the best hostels i have stayed in. great location and fantastic rooms. would highly recommend.

the freehand has the backpacking game down! i had such a great time! the staff was engaging, funny, and as excited as we were to be there. i hope i get the chance to stay there again!    p.s. i'm also super tall and the beds were more than spacious, something i'm not accustomed to in even the highest rated hostels. +++

a fairly decent spot - in a trendy area and enjoyed the swimming pool. however, the staff weren't always around and the rooms themselves were fairly small in size. plus the food and drinks were more expensive than their peers.

freehand is a really nice place to stay! the beds are outfitted with little nooks to store your bedside needs plus a charging port, which is super clutch. the overall vibe of the place is incredibly styled and elevated. it felt like i was living in an instagram post! i'm disappointed i didn't get to stay longer to try out their rooftop pool/bar, but if i come back to la, i'll definitely be looking to stay here again!
wonderful place in the heart of downtown la, the rooftop bar and pool has wonderful view!
the hotel has a great envirnment and good facilities. it’s clean and it safe. it’s in downtown la which there is a lot of things to do as well and close to everything.
make sure you check out the rooftop bar and pool!!!

beautiful space, i love 1920's architecture so i was excited to see this reno! the staff was friendly and helpful. restaurant is great. coffee was a bit overpriced and there are several great shops close by with a lower price and better pastry selection but it sure was convenient for the last day before heading to the airport. lots of plants which is always awesome. it was very quiet in the rooms, although my bed never got made and the trash wasn't emptied every day. clean overall though.
the location was perfect. the room was really nice but a bit dark. the top bed was a bit hard to get into but very comfortable.

ok this was my very first time staying in a hostel and the freehand far exceeded my expectations. everything from the decor to the rooms to the staff were excellent. i will definitely stay here during my next visit to la a great location as well absolutely loved this place!

it was my first time to stay in hostel and i had an amazing experience!room was clean,staff was really nice and friendly, location is great, subway station is really close and few nice places to eat too. atmosphere was welcoming and friendly and you can meet some cool people by staying in this hostel.

so nice pool on the roof over looking. downtown la staff great location great whole foods great bed great shower great everything is so great no words to describe just come and you will seeand then you will. oh my god i mean it
a bit over my budget but you get what you paid for. beautiful place. excellent service. great location.
great place to hang out and lodge but bartenders’ customer service is a thumbsdown.

it's the fanciest hostel i've ever been to. it's hotel-hostel hybrid, very new and clean. i stayed in a 6-bed mix room, which has its own bathroom, and it is spacious. the breakfast is just so so, but overall, it's worth it.

staff were super nice, from the moment you get there until you leave. the pictures on the website are accurate, i think its much nicer in person. and the people who bunked with me were very respectful and interesting. there was a sense of privacy and regard from other roommates. i would visit again.

hands down the best hostel i've stayed at. super luxurious, decor and aesthetics on point. immaculate bathrooms and rooms. each bed has their own reading light and feels super private. they include a towel in the bed price, which is awesome. will def stay there again.

my experience might be different from other people but to me this hostel was not really a hostel that makes it easy to connect with other travellers. it is because it is also a hotel. it has a fancy bar and a fancy restaurant so when i ordered a soup that cost almost $10, i was surrounded by glamorous couples dressed up to impress. i was dressed in normal comfy clothes and it made me look like i don't belong there. the hostel was too impersonal and too posh. i would not stay there again.
best hostel i've ever lived in! you can not find second one like this for the same price

best hostel i have ever been too by far. brand new so everything is in good shape and the atmosphere is excellent. location is good for downtown, close to the metro redline so getting to hollywood, universal studios, and even santa monica beach is quite affordable and easy. also, the roof top pool is amazing - looks just like the pictures. would highly recommend. note - i would say this is a more mature hostel, ages seemed to be more late twenties/early thirties based on my experience.
clean rooms, great staff, location made it easy to get around downtown. large personal lockers were helpful too.

the place is really cool, it has an incredible rooftop with pool and the whole place is impecable. the price was just perfect, i think because it is still in construction and there are some facilities that are not working.  highly recommended
this is a good place if you looking for hostel in la.
excellent place to stay.  i really loved it...:)
beautiful hotel with rooftop pool in the heart of downtown los angeles. 7th street metro station a few blocks away, easy to get around los angeles.
amazing hostel!
best hostel ever ! fancy design. close to the metro station.

this is a quite fancy hotel with the option of shared bedrooms and a basement kitchen. you can get the comfort of a pricey hotel for the not so pricey room rate. it opened a few months ago and it's located on a historical building, so everything is extremely new but some things are still under wraps. i think the main issue are the elevators, right now only two are working and run quite slow. public rooftop pool is a letdown, as it's often full of outsiders and guests can't enjoy it that much.
could be the best hostel i've been to. amazing rooftop pool!
the staff at freehand la was superb and very hospitable. my roomates were very respecting and respectable.
it doesn't get any better than this. great location, cozy and clean rooms, gorgeous rooftop! worth the money!

its the high end of the back packing lifestyle that's for sure. room and bed and bathroom we fabulous. you get to mix well with the people who are paying hundreds of dollars to stay here.  you will only ever buy one drink thats pretty pricey by cheap travellers standards here but do it on their amazing rooftop pool bar. great transport hub for all of la. supermarket just down the road and cool little bars and restaurants all around makes this an easy choice to go back too.
amazing place!! staff are all so friendly! everything is very nice and rooms are clean and bunks are very nice
one the best hostels i have ever been. the only problem i found was that the swimming pool wasn't opened.
really lovely place, with incredibly helpful staff. great bar and i enjoyed the access to the gym.
wonderful place to stay! really lovely and accommodating staff! i would recommend this place to all my friends.
great hotel/hostel in a good location downtown. the pool area and communal area wasn't ready when i was there but imagine it would be amazing once opened.
it's good, new and modern. the kitchen wasn't finished so that no kitchen or laundry.

such an amazing stay! super friendly staff too made it feel like i always had company on my solo trip. the atmosphere is also amazing, the location is perfect and the price was so good. would highly recommend!
i really enjoyed it here, however i was disappointed as it was advertised to have a roof top pool. however this was not yet completed...

everything was so nice !      i suggest the following:      1) a microwave to warm up my food . . . . .   2) some hot water facility to make my own herbal tea.  3) a central/common kitchenette for additional convenience.
beautiful looking place - private rooms are new and amazing, staff are helpful, location is pretty good near metro stations and common bus routes around downtown and the rest of la.
a must stay! lovely place and i had a wonderful time. clean, staff was amazing, great food and bar.    i will stay again.    thank you.
great hostel. super clean, nice new and modern. a shame the roof top pool and bar weren't open. would definitely stay/recommend again.
great place to stay in downtown, free breakfast was convenient but not always packed correctly, friendly & helpful staff.

it was very enjoyable staying here. it covered all the basics apart from laundry facilities. the atmosphere was good but the staff are better. everyone i spoke to was extremely helpful so i can't fault the service. the location is very good in terms of accessibility however be cautious in the evening. the only negative (apart from not having a laundrette) is it is difficult to meet other backpackers unless you attend breakfast or are comfortable taking a gamble on talking to someone.
amei o hostel, só acho que ainda podem melhorar no breakfast, fazendo com que haja interação entre os hóspedes, senti falta disso nos cafés da manhã ...mas de resto é sensacional!

a pretty building with comfortable, modern rooms, the ensuite bathroom was especially beautiful! we were happy with the price, less happy that multiple advertised amenities (including the rooftop pool and kitchen) were not yet ready. quite odd staying here, this is a combo hostel-hotel-restaurant-trendy downtown bar. if you have nice clothes to hang out with la locals you might enjoy it, as normal backpackers you are totally out of place. stay elsewhere if you want to meet other travelers.

amazing place! i will definitely stay here again if i return to los angeles. staff were all super friendly and accommodating on my arrival, never received such terrific service before. location was central and convenient with public transport close by and lots of places to eat in close walking distance. beds and pillows were comfy and clean. lobby was super cool and made the place memorable.

really clean and new hostel-style rooms in what is really a hotel. included breakfast was a plus, however nothing fancy - some mornings included more stuff than others. the staff were very friendly and always happy to help. the location downtown felt as if it was in a fairly safe area. due to this being a hotel, there was no real hostel community feel. the other guests in my room seemed to only stay for one or two nights maximum.

amazing place to stay. gutted we arrived so late from lax and had to leave early the next day so we didn't get to make the most of the place.   i would definitely stay there again, staff were brilliant and we were upgraded which was a lovely treat after two days on airplanes/airports!   highly recommend freehand
i really enjoyed my stay, showered head pressure could be better but other than that was perfect!

stayed for a week at that place. in my eyes it deserves 5 * out 5. usually i dont squander with perfect ratings like this, but freehand is outstanding in many ways. and that is mainly due to the fact it is a new facility (summer 2017). every unit (e.g. lift, toilet, bed) is in very good and clean condition. in addition different other positive aspects:    - beds are remarkably solid and firm. no squeaky metal bunk!  - good location "7th metro center" substation nearby.  - friendly staff
great location and great staff! it's 80% hotel and 20% hostel, so the atmosphere is a hit or miss. everything else about this hostel is above and beyond!
very good, would stay again 10/10. don't be put off by the number of reviews, this place has just opened and is incredible.

sorry, i cannot give this place a better rating for now. as a hotel? 10.0 for sure. as a hostel? for now, it doesn't satisfy the hostel requirements in my books. they are in the process of finishing a common area with kitchen and a rooftop pool and bar, which will be amazing i am sure. they provide towels and there is a cool lobby bar, which is very pricey for backpackers. this is a fancy hotel, with dorm rooms. huge plus, there is ac. however, as a solo backpacker, good luck meeting people.

freehand only opened two weeks before my visit so a few of the facilities were still unavailable but despite this i loved it here. the staff were incredible - super helpful and friendly, rooms and beds were very clean and comfortable with regular housekeeping, great restaurant and bar, and just good vibes all around. definitely not your standard hostel (it's more like a hotel with shared rooms available), 11/10 would stay here every time i'm in dtla.

the pros:  it’s a hostel so the price is cheaper when compared to the nearby hotels located in downtown la, about a 20 minute walk from the convention center. working thermostat. separate bathroom and shower. separate bathroom and shower.roof top pool and bar.indoor bar and restaurant. free gym. personal storage cubes.    cons: bunk beds were low. everyone hit their heads at least once. the elevators were down a few times. the staff helped drag all our stuff to our rooms on the 8th floor.

the freehand la was amazing! the staff were so friendly and helpful and the whole complex was incredibly modern and up to date. i would whole-heartedly recommend staying here. it's affordable, its a great location and the staff will go above and beyond to make your stay at the freehand and la truly excellent.

probably one of the nicest hostels i've ever been to, and it'll be even nicer when the rooftop pool opens! beautifully designed, high-end place, a far cry from the typical metal bunks and sparse rooms at most hostels - they have really awesome wooden bunks with outlets and semi-privacy for each bed plus spacious cabinets. fresh towels/sheets daily, fast in-room wifi, great location in dtla. only negatives: slow elevator (but they have one!) + could have more social events for hostel guests.

from the great roof top pool, to the regular excellent freehand rooms, and amazing staff this is a great hostel (also boutique hotel) it is in the middle of downtown la so the area is sketchy and will be a few years before inner city development makes it quaint, but easy access to everything and subway only a few blocks away. i really enjoyed my stay here.

i wasn't able to stay in the hostel because the building work was yet to be  completed.     the owners put me into a sister property, the line la hotel.  they have me a complementary  night and for the other nights, only charged the hostel rates.     this was excellent customer service.
they had super customer service. i didn't actually get to stay with them, because they weren't open yet. so they put me up at their sister property and they were beyond awesome!
great hostel! friendly and helpful staff, amazing location.

very nice restrooms and showers ensuite. beds are very nice. location is great if you want to stay in hollywood. no pool, but the patio area is nice. good wifi everywhere. towel included. breakfast included.  if your primary goal is to see hollywood, i would recommend this hostel.   if you are just visiting la, i would recommend stay at venice beach or santa monica instead.
great organised activities run by the staff. nice patio and lounge room to meet new people. clean hostel with big kitchen.

fantastic hostel with large dorm rooms, super clean facilities, great location (especially for universal  studios) and very helpful staff in particular steven who runs the hollywood walking tour and runyon canyon hike... great guy!

didn’t feel super safe. a couple really weird incidents.. one inside of the hostel & one just outside. a friend of mine and myself were locked out at a bad moment. decent cleanliness. some nice staff, some that left us out because of a situation just outside of the hostel but made the decision to leave us locked out. i get it that it was a hard decision, but probabaly not the wisest.
great staff, good location, amazing free breakfast. excellent hostel.

this hostel is as good as advertised - the location is unbeatable, the staff are super friendly, and there are many activities planned for every day.    only issue for me was quite a major one - it had been a while since i'd stayed in a hostel dorm room and the curfew wasn't enforced so my roommates were awake with the lights on until 2am each night. i eventually made the switch to a private room, but even then the staff members would be talking loudly outside as i was beside the kitchen.
nice place, great location. would recommend for a l.a tourist

after staying at a few hostels in the la area usa hostels is bar none the best!  lightyears ahead in the details and quality over the others.  you won't go wrong at usa hostels.  i stayed there for 14 days max stay!

the stay at the hostel was good. the rooms were relatively clean, including the bathroom. the addition of a free breakfast was good, although the choices were pretty small.  i was able to fit my small airport sized carry on in the locker, which included a power outlet for secured in-locker charging. the bed was good. it included a privacy slat which included an outlet and reading light were good as well. everyone kept to themselves, no issues.
very happy to stay here. i would come back definitely

nearly everything about the hostel was great! staff were extremely helpful, they ran tours around la, free breakfast every morning meant there was one meal everyday we didn't have to worry about, clean bathrooms and just a very friendly atmosphere. the only thing i didn't like was that there weren't any privacy curtains for the beds in the dorm i stayed in. overall a great experience though!
nice hostel.
i loved staying here  one day when i go back to la, i would love to stay here again

i only stayed for one night but the location was perfect and the facilities were great. i went on the night walking tour and the staff running it were extremely knowledgable and helpful. being solo traveller and my first time in la i was initially a bit hesitant and a bit disappointed in la but once i went on the tour i saw what it really had to offer and thanks to the usa hostel staff in hollywood i was able to make the most out of my 30hours stay in la!
a localização é ótima, perto de praticamente tudo e fácil acesso aos locais, os tour que o hostel oferece são muito bons, super indico.

good location, clean and secure.  the only issue i had was with some staff.  not all, but i arrived 25 minutes before check-in time and he refused to check me in, only to watch him check in another guess 10 minutes later.  also, there were two extremely noisy and loud and rude girls in my female only room.  i asked to please be more respectful and they refused.  i brought it up with staff downstairs and they basically just said they have free earplugs.   other then that, everything was fine.
molt ben situat, net, cap problema. recomenable, hi tornaria.

nearby flyaway, hollywood street. good breakfast. and prepared earplugs for sleep.   but the bed creaked whenever upper person moved. it is noisy than i thought. however, if use earplugs, it does not matters.   i recommend this hostel

overall the hostel was great, rooms were nice enough with dividers around the top of the bed which is nice for a bit of privacy. the breakfasts are great with a really good selection. there is lots going on with shuttles to the beach and tours pretty much everyday. there is a good guest atmosphere we met a lot of other travellers. most of the staff were amazing and couldn't do enough for you but a couple appeared rude and quiet arrogant. a great stay!
very good hostel. good atmosphere. many young people . the pancakes were a real highlight in my stay

it is great. the people who stay there. the staff is amazing. great location for anyone who wants to explore hollywood or even dtla, just a few steps from the metro. very clean.ifelt a part of a community, like a family. and i will definitely be back. keep it up hostel of,hollywood.

the best thing about this place are all the activities that are constantly going on! staff is nice and friendly, but they rather hangout with their other staff friends than with the travellers, so its a bit frustrating sometimes. the rooms are super clean, although they can become a bit hot if the fan is not turned on at its fullest. lockers are big and spacious.
i booked two nights and i only wanted to stay one. they staff said i would be refunded for one of the nights and i never got my refund.

for a hostel, this place is pretty clean. don't expect hotel cleanliness and hospitality, though. for example, expect to dress your own bed with the linens provided and you have to wash your own dishes after breakfast. you only get one medium sized towel so if you want a new towel, you have to get it from the reception desk. kitchen seating area is limited so you're likely going to sit with strangers to share a table. also i was put off that they used "leftover bread" to restock the breakfast.
just great!!! we will come back next time we visit the city!!!
wonderful service, great atmosphere, perfect location, and oh my is this place clean. i can safely say that when it comes to hostels in la, this is the only place i’d stay.
staff were all very friendly and easy to talk to. there are plenty of interesting activities to do as well which is fantastic.
great a bbqm jjkh  to do everyday, very clean and also have quiet zones after a certain hour so you can actually sleep! great hostel! 10/10!

i really enjoyed my stay at usa hostels hollywood. the location is excellent, the staff were nice and accommodating and the security was really good (even allowed me to store away extra bags for the duration of my stay). i also loved the activities that are run by the hostel.

the staff at the desk was very rude and at times was partial towards me. no reasons for any partiality. talking to someone with a smile will not create any problem. i don't know why but the man at the desk was again and again asking me to show the room key as i was moving to the outer open area of the property (in a span of 15 min he asked my room key 5 times) . the same guy did not allow me to keep my bag in the luggage area reasoning it to no space when they had enough for another 30 bags. bad

by far the nicest hostel i have ever stayed in, and this is considering everything from security, cleanliness, helpfulness of staff to the expanded breakfast with fruit and bagels and the patio where everyone is socializing.  have stayed in many hostels all over europe, but none have been as satisfying as this one.  thanks for a wonderful stay, would 10/10 recommend!

the ensuite room with bunk beds was a little on the small side but it was clean and cheaper than a staying in a hotel. there is plenty of parking in the area and the hostel is a short walk to hollywood boulevard. we underestimated the size of los angles and its lack of public transport. we ended up keeping our hire car that we had used to drive down from san francisco as the distances between attractions/areas of la are huge and uber was going to cost too much.
what a lovely hostel! free breakfast and coffee in the mornings and the staff are all very friendly.
best place to get to know people. the tours they organise are either free or a fair value

really good place. stayed as a single female traveller and felt completely safe the whole time. not a party hostel, but, there is a good atmosphere. there are a few bars within walking distance which was good. breakfast was basic but until a little later. would stay here again if ever in hollywood.
all i can say is perfect as any hostel can be...i had a great time, and actually i did not sleep that night 😁
직원들이 굉장히 친절했고 화장실이랑 침대 상태는 좋았어요. 숙소에서 나가자마자 워크오브페임이라 좋긴한데 공항에서는 멀어요. 어차피 la는 우버타고 다닐일이 많아서 위치가 엄청 중요하진 않은거같아요. 전반적으로 좋았지만 같은방쓰는 한국분들 새벽에 너무 시끄럽게하셔서 잠을 설쳤고 그거빼면 만족해요.
the breakfast was simple but good & the rooms and bathrooms were super clean!

it's a decent hostel that offers a lot of cool activities. the most activities i've ever seen and the tour guides are enthusiastic although they've done this a whole lotta times. the location is just off hollywood blvd in a sideroad that looks kinda sketchy but is actually pretty safe. hollywood is pretty trashy, though. the common room is the kitchen or the cool patio (which is not as practical in winter). i think in summer, this is a pretty good hostel, in winter, there might be better options

if you are looking for a party hostel then this would be ideal. however it can be extremely loud at night with music (as there are speakers outside of the rooms even though the party is downstairs). very hard to get to sleep. one evening we also had somebody walk into our room (private room) with their room key which was concerning. great location if you want to be close to hollywood.
the staffs are friendly. there are a lot of activities. however，all the bed sheet and towel have a very strong smell which i found unease. the rest is perfect
made lots of friends here! would be nice if staff were a little more engaging though. free breakfast each morning was fantastic and the place was kept really clean.

was ok.. nothing too special.. i did like the way they store luggage in the luggage room. beds were ok. staff were friendly.. they should really have a swipe on the main entrance instead of having to show staff to let them buzz you in

i really enjoyed my stay at usa hostels. the location was central to most hotspots in la/hollywood, so i enjoyed that. i've staying in various hostels around the world before, and i was pleasantly surprised by the facilities at usa hostels. the bathroom in the room was clean & nice. the bed were comfortable and i felt i had some type of privacy, even being in a room with 7 other women (i know it's hard to believe, but it's true.) my favorite part was the patio space in the front of the building.

very chill hostel close to the sights in hollywood very easy to start conversations with fellow backpackers (something i found is not the case in a few other american hostels - other cities) it might not be as flashy compared to other hostels but it makes up for it by having much more social staff and guests i had a blast

so i stayed here for one night in a solo room, and it was tiiiiiiny. probably the smallest room i'd ever been in honestly. the outside area was really nice and the atmosphere was good if you were looking to go out. i stayed in another hostel right down the road though for the same price and had a way bigger room, but a more quiet scene. it all depends on what you want, but overall this was a nice place.
the best hostel in la! awesome atmosphere and lots of (free) activities. you‘ll never be bored in this hostel. breakfast was also the best compared with other hostels in the us.

located on hollywood blvd, this is a fantastic hostel and has very positive vibes. they organise a lot of events and have some really knowledgeable staff.   had a great experience and would surely recommend this to others.
really nice hostel! facilities are great and the staff is very nice. coffee/tea all day long

weird location right by hollywood, but hollywood is dirty and slightly unsafe at night. outside courtyard was fantastic, kitchen was great, breakfast was included. rooms were large and beds comfy, loved the privacy panel. staff were great at keeping tabs on everyone going in/out. loved the thanksgiving dinner.
very good location and amazing bathroom within the room. staff very helpful and really helped me enjoy my stay.
very pleasant experience staying at the usa hostel! everything has exceeded my expectation except the location is a bit rough at night.

the building itself felt safe, but it is in a very bad area. it is close to the hollywood walk of fame, which turned out to be a horrible area after dark (5 p.m.). urine and pot smell, homeless people, beggars everywhere. some receptionists were completely stoned while working. during their kitchen shift, other employees were talking about getting high. this just gave the place a really unprofessional vibe and it made me feel like i cannot rely on the staff with anything.
love it! stayed here on two separate occasions. best hostel in la.

highly recommend this place. super central, so easy to walk anywhere. free shuttles to santa monica organized by the hostel, free dinners and lots of group activities to make it a sociable atmosphere. this is one of the best hostels i’ve stayed at and i’d definitely go back. staff are really friendly. only negative i’d say is the check in time of 3pm is pretty late especially when check out is 10am. pub crawl isn’t worth doing, better off doing arranging your own thing since the location is easy
great staff, comfy beds and great places to put things so they're not stolen, great to socialise with everyone, good facilities for the bathroom. terrific
great place .. highly recommended
would stay again
excellent i had a great time and met great people!!!!
good location to many bars and gimmickie shops. one issue: the smoke detector in one of the rooms was low on battery so beeped the whole night.

i last stayed at usa hostels back in 2008 and i had a very memorable experience.  fast forward to 2017 and the newly renovated hostel looked terrific.  it did bring back memories from 9 years ago and i still recommend this place.  i had no complaints overall.  it was also central to everything that i wanted to do.  staff were really nice and very helpful if you had any queries on how to find your way around and how to get to where you want to go.
good location, facilities
really good hostel overall, beds are very squeaky and lockers are really loud but that can’t be helped. location is great and they offer loads of tours.

great location right off hollywood blvd and only a few blocks from the heart of the blvd. hotel was extremely clean and had great facilities. good security with desk monitored 24hrs and only allowed in door with room key shown. this was good considering the street we were on had a lot of people sleeping on the street at night. staff were friendly and down to earth. room was really nice and spacious and bathroom was modern and clean. bed was really comfortable and nice big lockers. breaky average

i have stayed in the hostel, because there is hardly anything cheaper in the area with the same quality. they offer a lot of free stuff - breakfast, bbq, drinks, activities... really very generous. only downside - if you are looking for a place to have a good night’s sleep, don’t go for this hostel. i’ve stayed for a weekend and both fri and sat night it was so loud and noisy with strong bases that you couldn’t think of sleeping before 3am... but what else could you expect in this location ;-)

tl;dr - great hostel and staff. wish there was a bar.  the night staff deserves an award. specifically the assistant manager and the reception guy with shaggy red hair. the check in system went down for almost 3 hours and they couldn’t check anyone in. when i arrived around 11:30pm, i begged to just be put in a bed and they made it happen! thank you thank you! the rooms were clean and comfortable (although mine was baking hot - i swear the heater was on). breakfast was ok. wish there was a bar.
i loved the hostel, it was really clean and i felt really safe!

the hostel had a very good location in hollywood, los angeles. the staff was nice and the hostel was clean. the breakfast was good. the hostel arranged activities almost every day, unfortunately i couldn't participate in any of them because i was sick my whole stay. i think the hostel gave me good value for my money and if i ever go back to los angeles i would stay here again and hopefully get a chance to see something of the city.

this hostel is value of money, good location.a bar named tao near here is really cool!one tip for you: if you take grey hound come from sf,it's better to drop off at san ferendo which is closer than la downtown.

stayed at the hostel for 2 separate nights and had great time. staff were very friendly and accommodating and there are events organized everyday. great breakfast spread in the morning and enjoyed spending time both at the indoor lounge/kitchen and the outdoor lounge too.  its about 4 blocks away from hollywood/vine metro train station where you can catch the bus to lax airport. great place. great stay. will definitely come back again :)

some of the night staff weren’t very friendly, when i left my key card upstairs accidentally ( i was with a friend also staying at the hostel) they wouldn’t allow me to enter but also refused to look me up in their system. in that sense i guess you could say the security was a little too good. however, the beds were comfy and had outlets in each bunk and nice private bathrooms. they seemed to have lots of activities, however, we didn’t participate in any of them. close to hollywood!

i had a very nice stay at the hostel.  the one thing that you need to watch is parking.  i brought my car and had to utilize the public parking areas.  the average cost for parking overnight was 20 to 30 dollars.

great location n proximity to metro. in house tours n activities were free or cheap n tour guides were good fun. great brekky supplied for free, pancakes, toast, fruit n coffee. mmm. i stayed 4 night in a 6 dorm room, comfy bed with ensuite. the individual lights on each bed were handy. thx guys. i can highly recommend this hostel n would stay again no problem
try to request a room *away* from the disco hall, because it is really hard to sleep to the thump of 1980s music.

i stayed at this hotel for a week while in hollywood. i was a bit apprehensive at first, because i understand that hollywood is a bit touristy. the hostel was fantastic though, rooms are cleaned everyday and the staff are so friendly and helpful. i really enjoyed my stay at usa hostels, i would go back in a heartbeat.  in the dorms, i appreciated the metal privacy screen with a shelf and charging plugs beside it (usb outlet also!).  free breakfast was fantastic, the free events are top notch.

they have everything it needs for a very good hostel. the location was excelent, the staff very friendly, a fair breakfast, a lot of activities every day and very nice facilities. beds were perfect, lockers with sockets inside. could not think in one sigle thing to improve the hostel.
best hostel i have stayed so far!! great staff, activities and atmosphere! i'd definitely stay there again next time!
all the activities make the hostel a great place to meet people and to see as much possible of the city in a little time. the atmosphere is amazing if you're traveling solo.  the location is perfect!

where to start, first hostel is very nice, rooms are spacious and clean. biggest advantage of this hostel is that he is located in hollywood, and you really need 5 minutes to walk of fame. the hostel offers a lot of activity’s every day, like a free beach shuttle to venice beach and bar crawl (must do), free hollywood sign tours, hollywood night tours and beverly hills tour. one of the best values for your money! would definitely stay again.   p.s. the staff is awesome! kevin is real mvp!
great place, good pub crawl. would come again

i had a great experience at this hostel. the staff were friendly and helpful, and i really enjoyed all the tours the hostel offered. location is good, right between two metro stations, but the area in general is a little sketchy. the atmosphere was great for meeting new people!
nice hostel, very secure and very close to hollywood blvd. would recommend!

very social. rooms fairly spacey. easy to meet people if you hang out on the patio or attend the hostel activities. sketchy people hanging around the hostel but security is good so feels safe. would go back again and recommend for someone who wants to stay around hollywood.

booked into female only dorm room. woken up by male staff member at 2am shining phone torch in my eyes and yelling at me that i was in the wrong bed. turns out desk staff never told me to hang my receipt on my bed when i checked in. i was definitely in the right bed.
in the heart of hollywood. free breakfast and nice patio.
great place to stay with an amazing staff
great location, right off of hollywood blvd. rooms are very nice and clean!

love the fact that they have events everyday! it was my first time staying at the hostel and i felt like everyone wanted to get to know each other and get along to chill or to go out and explore! loved it! also i will specify that steven was an amazing tour guide! hiked runyon and never thought i could! super awesome! this whole experience was worth it!
good place to stay, a little bit expensive but everything in l.a. is around the same price, the place was clean and they have a lot of activities, staff are really friendly.
nice hostel. friendly staff, next to hollywood blvd and sunset. bars and restaurants close by which is always good!
great atmosphere. good security, staff was ok. great location in hollywood. i like the activities they organized. beds are kind of small but fine. i've had a great time in la. totally recommend it!!

nice, clean hostel, with good facilities. i especially liked the sockets in the lockers for charging phones and the free water refill station.  quite loud at night though and a younger crowd. not suitable for those travelling with kids.
got the chance to meet lots of friendly travelers, different activities to join everyday, very clean building and rooms, and great party atmosphere after all :) i'd def come back ! recommendend 👍🏻

they play the worst music ever really loud down the hall and the vibe is so bad. the staff don't care don't help with heavy bags and seem relatively oblivious to the needs of those staying there. the pillows are like a bag stuffed with cotton balls.   never coming back ever.  hollywood is a like a porta lou at the end of a week long festival 🙃
this was my 4th stay here.everything about this hostel - the atmosphere, the location, the design of the rooms, etc. and especially the big front patio with the piped in music- is excellent.
loved this hostel!! i will definitely be back !!

great location and they run loads of tours which is helpful. we had private bunk room for 2 of us and it was barely bigger than a cell! warning! also if you are a light sleeper this is not the hostel for you as tends to be very noisy. can't fault the facilities or location though right off hollywood blvd, would go back.

this was a great hostel, going into a big city like hollywood was intimidating but never felt like i needed to be nervous with this hostel. staff always made sure i was taken care of and had a good time! would love to go back

my time at this hostel was really good. the hostel organised activities each day and night which was great in getting to know other people. the location was right on hollywood boulevard which was great however i would not book in this area again as it was far away from all other attractions. security was fabulous especially at night with showing key cards. breakfast was great with a good spread and even pancake mix. full kitchen facilities are also available.
stayed here over 4 times, love this place

great experience. would recommend more group activities like heading out to bars/nightclubs at night with the hostel and others to join, and also group events where residents can all go to universal studios together !

i stayed in the 4 bed dorm ensuite and thought that this was a solid hostel with all the important features- spotless rooms/bathrooms, outlets inside the lockers and by your bed, great breakfast and staff who are friendly and very helpful- one of them, jake, even offered to help with a personal errand! amazing. oh and they have 420 friendly outdoor seating. really what else can you ask for? except for it to be cheaper. but then again, its hollywood/ca/usa so price is still right for what it is.
location is perfect. just was so hot when i went and no air con or pool etc. but breakfast set up was good and staff provided free shuttles to beaches
i spent 2 nights at usa hostels and it was wonderful. the place was so clean and everyone was so nice. i can't wait to come back next year!

best hostel ever. extremely clean, friendly staff, free breakfast in the morning. right in the center of all the action in hollywood...you can uber anywhere in la for cheap. i made a bunch of new friends in just two days from all over the world. you won't regret your stay here. i will be back 100%. thanks guys

by far one of the best hostels i've stayed in. bathrooms were very clean, power outlets and shelves next to bed were convenient, lockers were big, and it was great meeting new people on the outdoor patio. location is a bit seedy as it is in hollywood but didn't feel unsafe while at the hostel. would definitely stay here again!
สถานที่ดีมากแต่แพงไปนิด
rooms were clean and had everything you needed. staff were friendly but lacked introduction as we were not aware of any of the activities or facilities the hostel offered.
it was my first time staying at any hostel and my experience was awesome.  i would definitely stay here again.
fantastic hostel i would recommend it to absolutely everyone!
plenty of activities, super close to hollywood boulevard. charging stations at beds and in lockers (they know their audience).
excellent experience! definitely will consider again!!!
loved the hostel! came on my own and met so many cool people would recommend it to anyone going to la
staff were very helpful.  room clean

a lil far from the main strip in hollywood. rooms smelled funny. smell wuldnt go away. staff were ok. breakfast standard. although no milk which should b apart of standard breakfast. if theres no milk why bother offering breakfast at all.

the location is good just off hollywood boulevard. i booked to go on the beverley hills walking tour through the hostel which was $15 - that paid for our bus fees there (3$) when we got to the end of rodeo drive the tour guide said we were 'free to do what we wanted to do' and directed us to the bus back which we had to pay for!! didn't really see a lot of beverley hills either. the kitchen is very small and cramped  for the amount of people staying at the hostel and breakfast is ok.
loved the lockers, people, and vibes!! met some amazing people and would definitely stay here again!
clean room and comfortable beds, sufficient if you just need a bed to sleep on. very central location to hollywood, easy to get around.

usa hostels hollywood exceeded my expectations! not only was the location convenient, but the facilities were some of the best i've seen in any hostel. the staff were all super nice and happy to help out.

superb hostel, my first time staying at a hostel and they have set the boundary. location was close to everything i needed and the use of über helped as well. everywhere was clean, beds were comfy also. free breakfast was great to. staff always try to make your stay comfortable and there is plenty of activities on each day.
much better than the sf
usa hostels is a place to go where you can feel at home and meet people from all over the world!   the staff were super friendly and i really couldn't have asked for more!  thank you usa hostels!

this hostel is possibly the best one i have ever stayed in. it is in a fantastic location in the heart of hollywood. there were so many activities organised through the hostel that i didn't need to plan my days as it was done for me, fantastic! katy, louie, tony, kevin, carlos and all the staff make it their mission to make sure everyone is having a great time. thanks a million to you all. hopefully see you all again!
well run. a good option away from the beach. helpful vibe.
one of the best hostels i have stayed at. very clean, nice rooms that are cool in the summer. some good group activities too! the staff i dealt with were helpful and positive.
this diamond in the rough was fantastic.  the shower in my room had hair on the floor which was not cleaned out during my stay.

this hostel was fantastic! first time ever staying in a hostel. staff were really friendly and helpful, atmosphere was great and everyone staying in the hostel were friendly and just wanted to make new friends. new bathrooms in each room, comfy beds and a substantial breakfast in the morning! would definitely recommend this hostel to anyone :)
excellent hotel great friendly staff, nice kitchen and breakfasts!!
hostel was in a great location and was accessible to public transport.  staff were helpful when you asked them questions. overall was a good stay.

this is actually one of the nicest hostels i've stayed at. staff are super friendly and helpful, lots of activities and lots of free things/ events makes it good value for money. unfortunately i was travelling with a few other people and we already had plans for the short time we were there, so we didn't get to participate in any of the hostel's activities. but this place is perfect if you want to meet new people or don't have anything set to do yet.
one of my favourites. perfect central location, staff were very friendly, outside lobby vibe was incredible, very easy to meet other travellers & locals, perfect for a solo traveller like myself.

this hostel claims to offer discounted entry into universal studio parks and a shuttle bus service to san fransisco. both claims are false and therefore misleading. the "discounted" tickets were the same price on the universal website. also apparently the shuttle service to san fran no longer operates. please remove it from your website. the only major downside to this hostel was the staff. they came across as rude and were vague when giving you information . they were not welcoming in any way.

hollywood is quite run down which we had not expected and there is not an awful lot to do in the immediate area however the hostel was really lovely despite having noisy people in our room. the beds were super comfy and it was lovely to have breakfast before we started out.
nice clean and modern hostel, staff were very helpful and friendly. beds were great and had outlets on each one.
convenient central location. very secure. friendly, approachable staff who were welcoming and so helpful and informative. recommend 100%!
loved my stay at the usa hostel! would recommend it for all of those who are looking for a great place in hollywood and i'll definitely come back!

i didn't love my stay with usa hostels, but i wouldn't not go there again. la certainly wasn't my favourite city, and the location of the hostel didn't help either. i liked the facilities and cleanliness, but the staff could have been friendlier.
awesome place right in centre of hollywood. amazing staff who chill with you.
great hostel. friendly staff.

amazing place to stay if you are staying in hollywood, staff were amazing, tours and activities were great fun and the hostel had everything you needed. everything was clean and it was only a short walk to the subway station (5 minutes) and bus stops (1 minute).
this is a really safe hostel, and the location is very good. and the activities are interesting and the activities are worth to pay.

everything was really great at usa hostels hollywood - especially for my first visit to la! the hostel was in a good spot to check out hollywood, the beds were comfy and facilities all you need. the best bit was the staff and staff run activities, notably the beverly hills tour (which includes a mini boom box), the friday night pub crawl and walk to the hollywood sign. i made really great friends throughout - thanks guys

really great facilities - comfortable and clean beds and bathrooms. definitely a place to party if that's your thing. staff are really friendly and super helpful. they also have plenty of breakfast options and lots going around.
very sociable hostel with good facilities and fun staff in a central location.
10/10 will definitely be back.

decent hostel. not the cleanest--showers were a little dank. not the friendliest staff either. the sister hostel in san francisco is much better. but, good location in hollywood--easy to walk many places.

first time staying in a hostel was very pleased with the experience. staff was very friendly. great value in your money. clean facility. free breakfast and dinner which was really nice if you're trying to save money. and free shuttle to santa monica beach was also a great perk.

i met some really crazy people here, heard many interesting stories. i would say it was a very unexpected yet exciting experience. this values more than facility and the comfort of the room, and the room is pretty good.

nothing to complain about, i decided to stay here because i´ ve been to usa san francisco and usa san diego, so i had high expectations cause i had the best time in those two. good breakfast, good location. but the fact that they didnt have shared bathrooms beside the one in the room, made people come in and out the room all the time at every hour making lots of noise  the atmosphere so and so
great hostel, helpful staff.  great value for money.

stay was good. felt very secure with the doors past reception being monitored by staff.   the room was good, was cleaned daily as far as i'm aware although still felt slightly dirty but then that's hostel life.   the room had a locker for every bed which you bring your own padlock for. secure.  the worst part about it was that there was no aircon, only a ceiling fan which didn't do much to cool down the room it just pushed the hot air around in a circle.   at night it made it horrible to sleep.

i was staying here mostly to go to e3 so i didn't spend much time in the hostel but it was really clean and the staff made everything seamless. if how looking to stay in the hollywood area, i would recommend staying here.

really great hostel with fantastic staff, it's a shame that it was dampened by the fact there was construction going on, not quietly, the lounge was closed for renovation, the washing machine and dryers were out of order, and the wifi was intermittently dropping it's connection, which is frustrating. they also do not cater to gluten free in the included breakfast, so i had to purchase my own bread. besides this, very good hostel and most of the staff are great people.

great hostel right in the middle of hollywood. large kitchen available to guests with breakfast provided free. decent rooms and bathrooms. awesome outdoor area with lounges and umbrellas for shade. its a shame that the hollywood area in general is not the nicest place, very run down/dirty, but this is not a fault of the hostel. really close to the hollywood walk of fame, chinese theatre, etc. difficult to get to sites in other areas of the city due to la's terrible public transport.

the atmosphere was great, was really easy to talk to people, make friends and mingle. breakfast was extremely good, you can make your own pancakes. i felt very safe in the hostel, entrance is always locked so not anyone can just walk in and out.
loved the patio for hanging out. breakfast was good, staff helpful, handy location and near the metro and buses. party hostel (quiet after 11 rule not enforced) so light sleepers you've been warned!
very good hostel. lots of great activities for the guests
good location. security in place for after hours and having a noise curfew in place allows you to get enough sleep if you don't feel like partying.

best american hostel stay. they have lots of group hikes, tours, pub crawls and parties. definitely perfect for solo travellers and those who want to have a good time. rooms were spacious and clean, good sized lockers and the staff were really friendly and involved!

location was superb, incredibly near to hollywood boulevard. also easy to locate if you are taking the $8 shuttle from the airport. i stayed in a 8 bed female ensuite, and i especially liked that the dorm was big enough for our luggages. the privacy pod by your bed and the strong wifi are two facilities i appreciated that the hostel provided for its travellers. the bathroom was kept clean but can be a long wait sharing with 7 other females. breakfast is simple. overall would recommend!

great spot! i think what really made this place extra special was the hostel activities (hike to hollywood hills) and the patio which was super condusive to mingling with other guests/staff. only 10 mins from the main touristy bit of the hollywood walk of fame, chinese theatre etc.. kind of a sketch area but whatever. no matter where you stay in la you will have to cab around to see everything (ie west hollywood, melrose ave, etc) so we were fine with our chosen location. overall very happy!

amazing hostel, stayed at this and the san francisco branch. both great hostels with good communal areas. the bunks are comfy and well designed, especially the privacy screens and the lockers are big. plenty of organised events,of which i would have attended if i stayed longer. i felt very safe and welcome, and would definitely stay at one of tt he usa hostels again.

the location is perfect. easy to use public transportation nearby. they have pretty high security so i feel very safe staying there. staples for breakfast. nice patio. i'm very satisfied with my stay there :)

second time i've stayed here and i really like this place. great location for hollywood and also megabus/boltbus. always stuff going on, some at a cost and some free. the breakfast is top notch for a hostel. the only thing a will say is that it attracts a young crowed which can lead to noise at night with people coming back from bars and clubs at whatever time in the morning. so if you're a tad boring i'd maybe look somewhere else. but i would definitely recommend this place.

hostel was undergoing renovations (which are needed) so there was a lot of banging/drilling early in the morning (before 8am which is supposed to be quiet hours). there was no running water at times with no advanced notice (told the morning of by posters on the walls outside dorms which is of no use when you wake up inside your dorm and go to use the ensuite). staff were unfriendly, patronising and rude, i felt uncomfortable asking them questions, which put me off joining hostel activities.

great location from a tourist perspective. walk of fame around the corner. loved the activities! bed was great, room have bathrooms in them. not much to fault except the guy who checked me in was quite rude, more interested in being on his phone.

travelled the us for six weeks and this was my favourite hostel! location is great, staff were fantastic and meeting other travellers was so easy! heaps of events and everyone is down for a good time. only booked 3 nights originally but ended up staying for a whole week. highly recommended for other solo travellers.

great hostel if you're looking to meet people. activities are hosted out on the patio such as beer pong, bbq etc. they also offer day activities such as walking tours to beverly hills and hollywood sign which both were good. the staff is super friendly and helpful and hanged out with the people staying there. overall clean areas, nothing special. breakfast is great and towel is included. lockers in room and you need to show key to get in – felt safe. pods make the beds more private. great stay!

really enjoyed my stay at usa hostels hollywood. stayed for 5 nights and will be going back again for the last 2 nights of my trip. ideal location for hollywood and surrounding areas. plenty of worthwhile activities as well. i stayed in a 6 bed mixed dorm with en suite and i was more than happy with the set up and bathroom was cleaned daily. would 100% recommend!
very nice hostel, very well located and friendly staff

they are centrally located to where i needed to be (downtown), and to be honest there are a ton of great things to do around the area. i got everything stated they give so the value for the money is great. the staff were mostly accommodating, but one guy came into our room and watched videos on his phone for about 2 hours & it made me uncomfortable. they could clean more (sweep/mop), and the place was under construction so it was loud during the day starting at 7am despite still being quiet hrs.
awesome location with a good price. this is the spot to stay with friendly and informative staff. you will be in the center of it all and can easily take the bus, ride share and subway.

only stayed one night but thought the facilities and location were excellent. we had a 2230 train to new orleans to catch and were very impressed that even after check out, they let us hang around and use the shower facilities (good to be as clean as possible before starting a 3 day train journey). we were very impressed and grateful.

all together, the hostel was good!  bathrooms were clean but had a smell (i think the base of the toilets needed to be clean). beds and rooms were clean, comfy and secure. they had lots of events to get everyone involved! karaoke, free bbq, etc.. and they offer different events and tours daily. the staff were great, and the included breakfast was too. hollywood area in general gets a little sketchy at night, but it's a great central location and easy to get anywhere by bus from here!

hollywood the neighborhood isn't for everyone (i.e. me), but the usa hostel was excellent. staff was very friendly and helpful. and accommodations were much better than some of the higher priced hostels nearer the beach. fair warning that it takes 90 minutes on the bus to get to the beach; the hostel has a occasional group shuttle if you can wait.

what a delightful hostel!  the rooms were nice, the kitchen well-stocked with tools, and the patio was fantastic.  it was nice to have a bathroom off of each bunk room.  the included breakfast was a nice surprise.  the bathroom off the room in which i stayed had just recently been nicely renovated, but the shower faucet handle fell off every time someone touched it.  the staff was generally friendly and helpful, if frequently busy.  i would definitely stay there again.
all perfect, clean comfortable and the bed setup gave more privacy than other hostels.     only thing i would say is the shower was a little weak.

great location in hollywood near walk of fame. can also do lots of tours from hollywood boulevard and get to universal studios easily. very clean spacious hostel with big lockers. staff were helpful and daily activities were great. break was amazing!!! spoilt for choice. definitely a nice safe choice for anyone wanting to explore la and meet new people.
my favourite place to stay when i'm in los angeles!

the hostel is very much like the hostels in europe.   the staff is super friendly and have a good spirit.   i stayed at a mix dorm (only girl) but it was nice. the hostel is a bit noisy but that is okay. the toilet and bath is in two seperate rooms at the room. that is nice.   it was a okay breakfast.
the location was awesome and super close :) friendly staff !

this hostel is amazing for all backpackers and tourists looking for a friendly atmosphere, close proximity to hollywood blvd and hostel organised trips and tours.     i would highly recommend to those travelling alone.     but, there is a 'constant' party vibe where certain groups of guys (some of who don't even stay at the hostel) are smoking and drinking all day and night, in the front courtyard. they're not all tourists, and they can leave a bad vibe and make girls feel quite uncomfortable.
great trip and had a great stay. staff were super friendly and the trips i went on were fun.
the hostel was very clean. had activities throughout the week, which included pubcrawls and walking tours among other. the breakfast with pancakes and fruits is perfect to start the day!

staff were friendly, i didn't really like the area. would use usa hostels again - in fact i stayed at the san diego hostel of theirs! the price is quite high but every hostel is in la so it's all relative. thanks team

great hostel, but it is so close to the clubs. night time if your sleep is so sensitive you can have hard time sleeping. they may need to schedule more shuttle for beaches. area is full of homeless people. if you go out late prefer somewhere close to the beach.
definitely a great place to stay, rooms are well maintained. welcoming friendly and accommodating staff. as a solo traveler i really enjoyed meeting other people on the group activities.
good value for money considering hollywood, really helpful staff and i slept like a baby. was travelling alone and also felt safe

usa hostel was a good place to crash for a couple of nights while i explored la. the rooms are small, there's one bathroom between 6 and the beds creak but as long as you have respectful roommates it's fine. just be aware if you need to get somewhere at a specific time, you might want to be the first one in the bathroom.   breakfast is a nice touch, fruit, oatmeal, coffee, bagels. didn't try the diy pancakes as i'm vegan but the rest was enough.
really great hostel! staff are very accommodating, breakfast is good, beds are comfortable and people are lovely! good area!

rooms were a good size, one bathroom between 8 girls though can be difficult and there's only about 2 communal bathrooms for the whole building so would help if they had a few more. breakfast was good, activities were good.. maybe a bit too expensive but apart from that it was an enjoyable stay.

conveniently located in hollywood, but backs on to a big carpark which was very noisey at night time during my stay (people hanging out in their cars playing music). overall pretty basic but the breakfast was good.

staff was super unhelpful and not interactive. spent a lot of time with themselves and frequently cancelled trips for the quests. many of times they would give wrong or bad information on the city and where to go as well. they also spent of lot of their time chatting or complaining or gossiping about which skin tones they liked the best. would definitely try a different hostel next time.

ok location,  easy to walk to the main attractions, although not always a pleasant walk alone later at night. rooms good and the ensuite is a bonus. good breakfast. came here from the sister hostel in san diego which had a much better atmosphere and staff. i found the staff (although not all) to be unhelpful, keeping themselves to themselves and not getting involved in actives or with guests. verging on rude when i checked out. planned trips were cancelled last minute without much explanation.

the kitchen is very well equipped and clean. the rooms have their own bathroom. the beds are a bit squeaky, but have usb charging ports, a shelf and partial walls for some privacy. the outdoor lounge area is nice for chilling and the location is great. the lockers require a lock with a thick shackle, but they can be bought at the reception.
stayed in a private for a night either end of our trip to california. nothing to complain about the hostel it is great.

great hostel in a convenient location right between two metro stations. staff are friendly and helpful. the hostel is located quite close to the clubs around hollywood and has a large car park next to it where people gather at night so it can get noisy, so i do recommend bringing ear plugs with you so you can get some sleep.
stayed here on a stopover to london & loved every minute of it. the location is perfect and i met so many cool people. definitely hit up the bar crawls, it's an ideal way to met others.

the hostel is conveniently located for visiting the attractions of la but i chose not to walk around at night as it was a bit seedy (lots of sex shops on hollywood blvd around the corner). overall it was very clean for a hostel, but i did find stains on sheets i was given! (they were replaced) the staff were unfriendly and cliquey. i didn't feel inclined to join in the events because they weren't welcoming. the only activity i signed up for, the beach shuttle, was cancelled without notice.

stayed at a bunch of hostels in la, this is easily the best. staff are great, rooms are great, kitchen/facilities are great. they offer shuttles to beach, walking tours and pubcrawls daily which is good because there's very little to do in la as a backpacker if you do not have a car.  not much of a vibe when i was there - but that depends on the guests, not the hostel. the music in the front courtyard is either to loud to have a convo or was just half a dozen people staring at their phones.

the hostels location is and isn't good. it isn't because it is in a quite dirty area and is about 6-8 blocks from all the good stuff on hollywood blvd. i also wouldn't say it is the safest area especially for anyone travelling alone. breakfast was good but could do with more variety and space to eat. the patio at the front is a nice area to chill out. there are some cool activities you can do with the hostel and at night it is a great location for bars in saying that noise can get a little loud
we had a wonderful time, the location was great, just next to hollywood boulevard. the hostel organized fun activities and the staff was fantastic.
great location, right the the hollywood boulevard. best place to stay if you plan to spend your day in hollywood.

right in the heat of hollywood,not for the faint hearted.bit of the seedy end of the strip and can be grubby area,but dispite the hostel undergoing some room renovations the place was spotless.very helpful staff,always around.nice lounge area outside,a non smoking part which was great.bad point:non hostel standard lockers,small normal lock useless and needed to buy a big bulky lock.although luggage room on ground floor,had to bike lock my case as well as didn't feel secure leaving it without.

if you're into partying and meeting loads of people (like i am), then try staying at one of the banana bungalow hostels. this was the only problem i ran into - i had a hard time meeting people but i appreciate the effort the staff put into organizing events. everything else was superb - the rooms were clean, the breakfast was good (i loved making the pancakes in the morning), staff were friendly, very close to hollywood blvd., and i didn't feel unsafe walking to the hostel at night.

i think for european standards this hostel isn't great but maybe compared to other hostels in the us it's really good? i'm not sure. cons: the breakfast isn't very nice and the rooms aren't the most attractive - the place generally doesn't look as good as the pictures. i stayed in a girls doom and they put a guy in my room for a day or so. i complained and they move him which was good. pros - good location and lovely staff.
great staff

thanks for the stay, it was an overall pleasant experience. a few things to consider is the noise, we chose a private room due to our short stay and really long flights on either end of our trip but the rooms didn't seem to block any noise from the hallway at all. the food in the vending machine was also a few years out of date which some people may complain about, we are the chips lol but thought you may like to know! we felt very secure and the hostel has good facilities!
we really enjoyed staying here! the hostel was really great, nice staff, clean and a very good location.

the location and facilities are great. the people (staff and guests alike) were a bit more distant than what i'm used to -- even though the hostel seemed pretty full, it wasn't particularly lively.    we also had a bad experience with the people in our room who were noisy and would turn the light on in the middle of the night -- though that's hardly the hostel's fault.    overall, good experience besides the atmosphere.
nice location & tasty breakfast but some staff people were not really friendly!

the location is excellent and close to many things in 1 to 5-mile radius.  the staff was professional, always available and so willing to help and answer the best they could and anytime they were friendly, too!  the front desk didn't have extra umbrellas, or nail clippers and non-humidity hairspray (1 of few the things i couldn't bring with me through airport security), our room was very clean and not even a little debris.  large lockers for every bed, but only 1 bathroom in each room! :(
