loved the hostel! all rooms have a tv, ac, heater, kitchenette, and full washroom in the rooms, the rooms are spacious and secure. only complaint would be the beds make lots of noise, mattress covers are broken & not sure if they are sanitized.. found a condom under the bed, but the hostel is so worth the money and somewhat questionable beds.    hostel has lots of activities and even free meals and free booze some nights! they had a band, basketball, pool, ping pong, taco night,bbq, karaoke etc.

checked in and quickly checked out 30 minutes later. the girl at check in provided me with zero information about anything, she didn’t even give me any indication as to the direction of my room. i would’ve left without any sheets if i hadn’t remembered to ask as i left. once in my room, a parade of ten or so (in my dorm of 6) drunk, rowdy people were in and out every few minutes, so there goes any security. fine if you’re just there to party i guess. the whole place was just unwelcoming.
staff was terribly friendly but i survived well enough

my first hostel experience. great location and great dorms. they have washrooms and kitchens right in the dorm. i felt comfortable and safe. it's great to meet people from around the world. all in all wonderful first time experience.
good times here! free parking

stayed there for 3 nights, and didn't have blankets on two of the three. was only able to get blankets because someone from the bedroom was there during the day to grab it for me. when i inquired about it for the second time, staff told me "i already told management, what do you want me to do?"  you better get breakfast as soon as it opens - 30 min after it starts there will be no bread (good luck to find bowls/plates/cups - they were always out of at least one of those). heating was terrible.

banana bungalow is a very good hostel. staffs are really friendly. nice location which is accessible to many places. i like all the activities organized by hostel.  it would be perfect if there are cleaner coming in everyday.  another point to improve is every bunk should have their own charging port as this would be more convenient.  overall, i’m satisfied

i liked the atmosphere at banana bungalow hollywood, but i think the management should set a quite time. that's because in the night other guests were really loud and for me and my roommates it was difficult to fall asleep.
everything was very well !! i can recommend it !!
overall staff were nice and helpful  price is cheap and pleasent stay here.   overall i felt safe here

this is a good hostel and a pretty decent location. we had a private room for two people and was much bigger then expected!  we felt super safe the whole time as you need a code to get into the building. it is a bit of a walk to the centre of hollywood blvd and the hostel is located at a bit of a dodgier end but as i said, it’s super safe.  the flyaway bus is great - i would recommend this to anyone traveling to/from the airport.  breakfast is regular cereal and fruit but great an easy meal.
good was the breakfast. bad was the rest. the staff was unfriendly, the room didn't match to the one i booked, it smelled like pot everywhere and the atmosphere was scary. i didn't feel safe.

great spot if you are out to explore. was worth the money since la is so expensive. the only thing i would like for the next guests is that they actually put a mattress on the bed in room 105. i slept on a box spring. i thought it was just a hard bed but no it was actually a box spring. the hostess was nice and so were the people staying.
best hostel of my trip! great location, great people and a fantastic atmosphere! i miss this place already! thank you banana bangalow!

staff not helpful at all. the only decent person was the breakfast guy - which is free, so a bonus! (toast and cereal)   rooms arn’t that clean - found bugs in the room.   location is alright, i’d personally stay out of the city and venture in for the day as there really isn’t much to do in the centre.   uber pool is the best way to get around!   wouldn’t return!!

i really enjoyed my time here and made some long term friends! definitely recommend! the bathrooms and floors are only kinda clean but clean enough. it's located on hollywood boulevard but in a little less busy area what is nice. i would definitely stay here again!

it was "mostly" fine for a budget hotel. it seemed clean, however within my one night stay i had encounters with 3 different small cockroaches in the room: one in the metal rail of my bunk bed, one in the cutlery drawer of the kitchen and one coming out of a ventilation opening.
very calm warm friendly fun family like atmosphere ...i would stay for as long as they would let me:)

the breakfast was nice, but all served in disposable, non recyclable tableware. too much plastic waste, especially when the communal kitchen is fully equipped with reusable plates, mugs and cutlery. the location was quite close to the griffith observatory and the hollywood sign as well as many restaurants and a metro station. some members of staff were not the nicest towards guests, as if any question was too many but overall was nice but defo some places where improvements could be made easily!

good location to visit hollywood, but a little sketchy looking and set up with a motel in the same building.  staff was a hit and miss, 3 really cool people but one awful one that seemed to think she was doing me the greatest favor in the world for booking a bed in a room that was half empty.  overall decent at best.. worth it most for its location in my opinion, maybe the weekend activities are good, i’m not sure since i was there during weekdays.average in my opinion
stayed here for 8 nights, great place, staff is amazing and the atmosphere was aslo really good. made a lot of new friends and would definitely go back there!

it’s a good hostel for solo travelers since it’s easy to meet fellow travelers and also the histel has got several events every week. however, i saw cockroaches at the bathroom most nights and also at breakfast i had to double check on the toast i chose because once it was expired and moldy.

the place is conveniently located near the high way exit. but parking is limited  (free) and i have to pay $10 parking outside the hotel after going around the hotel for 15 min without finding a free street parking. it should marked as limited free parking. also the hotels is kind noisy when people come back from outside and talking after 2:00 am.

banana bungalow is my favorite hostel yet, and i’ve stayed in my fair share of hostels. the little kitchenettes are perfect and the stafd is lovely. i also love that they lend us both sheets and a towel , the only downside is the shower really . the water pressure was awful and it went from  cold as ice to boiling in seconds and back again with no warning.   all together though, it was awesome. a very party and socially oriented hostel. perfect for travelers looking to meet other travelers.

good hostel in a great location! fun activities in the evening, although the dinner was cancelled one night and we weren't informed until we turned up for it which was annoying as we would have eaten elsewhere before coming back to the hostel. they lied and claimed the chef was ill when in fact i was speaking to someone the day before who the chef had told he wasn't going to be doing the next dinner so they clearly knew in advance and hadn't bothered to find a replacement or inform guests.

really nice place on hollywood boulevard, close to the main restaurants/places to visit - the staff is nice, while the rooms are not always clean; however, they made me change room when i complained. there is a bus from the airport directly to holywood boulevard, 10 minutes walking from the hostel (only downside: no indication of this bus at the airport). greatly recommended.
i couldn’t use a blanket. the night was a little bit cold.
really lovely atmosphere here, you will meet lots of cool people! dorm rooms are fairly basic but not bad. really enjoyed staying here:)
stunning place, really great feel to it. doesn't feel as much like a business as it does just a place for travelers to hang out.

great for travelers, lots of trips and events daily. good facilities and staff and good free secure parking. location was ok, ubers are very cheap. room seemed cleaned however i got bitten a few times and found mites on my clothes. the windows are very thin and our room seemed to be next to the bins and building works going on so was very loud in the morning. not a bad stay, i would recommend for travelers who aren't too fussed, it personally wouldn't be my first choice to stay again.
i had the best time! the hostel made it easy to meet so many awesome people, the activities they planned were really fun.

stayed in a shared dorm. reallt noisy outside as there seemed to be no curfew or "quiet hours" so there was a lot of noise even after midnight including people playing basketball. the bathroom in our room was only seen to once our of 3 days stay, and with 6+ people using it it got pretty gross really quickly.

old converted motel. very secure parking with gate entry off street.   pros: location, price, facilities (apple computers, table tennis, pool table, sport equipment)   cons: really unclean, staff were pretty unfriendly (bar one), weird dirty kitchen in room, fridge didn't look to have been emptied in some time, shower didn't work correctly (didn't switch on and off properly).   personally, wouldn't stay here again.

i had a really positive experience with most of the staff, they were welcoming and helpful. there was only one staff member that was pretty rude towards me and it felt like she was very annoyed and irritated by just me being in the room trying to check in and check out, i wasn't asking for anything special or anything. the facilities were great, i loved how there was a kitchen, lockers and storage space in the mixed dorm. i loved how they had cool activities for the guests every day of the week.

we booked a 6 bedroom dorm and were checked into an 8 bedroom dorm, with only one shower this gets pretty crazy.   everything is dated and old and possibly the worst beds you can sleep in.  breakfast is super basic cereal and bread, but they do have almond milk if you can’t have regular milk so that’s a plus.  it’s in a really dodgy part of hollywood if you turn right at the entrance instead of left.  it communicates badly with the other banana bungalow in regards to events and stuff !
better than i expected, excellent option to be in la, good atmosphere, nice place. totally recommended.

the staff are amazing, and great at organising loads of activities. our room had a bathroom and small kitchen which was perfect. no particularly clean, but everything worked. breakfast is excluded, and sufficient. would recommend staying here, as you are within walking distance of most sites, and have good transport links close by.
security gates open when a car pulls up so people can just walk in from the street. also there were not enough electrical plugs (less than 1 per bed) to charge electronics.

2 particular staff members were unapproachable, rude and unhelpful. we met another guy i think from oz who was so friendly and helpful. rooms were downcast. the window fan overlooked another guest’s bed so was turned on/off at their convenience(probably because of the noise they had beside them). this was during the oct heatwave,making the rooms very uncomfortable to sleep in aswell as smelly. the building looks great and has a great vibe but with the negatives mentioned made it disappointing
awesome hostel, really close to walk of fame and a lot of eating options around. staff were nice and friendly.  complete private rooms, full kitchen ;-)

not the cleanest hostel or in the nicest of areas. but they 100% make up for it with personality. the guests are all really chill and down to party, there are tons of activities every day. you will never be bored and its super easy to make friends. recommend it, if you like to meet people, have a couple of drinks and go on nights out. had an amazing time.
i would recommend!!

an old converted motel. was weird to have a kitchen inside even though no one used it. there was food left there from previous people. it was quite dirty. the cleaners don't clean everyday so the carpet and bathroom were filthy after a couple of days. good common areas and easy to meet people. front desk lady was a bit unfriendly.  many chances to go drinking and clubbing with free shuttles. super squeaky beds and no power outlets. the more you pay the better the facilities which is a bit unfair
a seriously good spot to get your hollywood on.  as near to most things in l.a. as it could ever be possible to be.
great hostel with good vibes. very generous with food and free alcohol on the club nights! staff are super helpful, shoutout to sol who was just awesome.

first hostel i’ve ever stayed at and i wasn’t disappointed. great location to most attractions, friendly staff, good facilities (pool table, imacs, printer, tv, basketball court, lounge/stage area.  you can see the staff make an effort when hosting/organizing events.  i was happy with my stay and would stay there again. the best thing about this place is the price per night and it’s location.

me encanto la estancia ahí, estuve 5 días y el ambiente super juvenil, las fiestas en la noche, hice algunos buenos amigos, el agua caliente a toda hora, definivitamente me quedaria nuevamente sin pensarlo dos veces

stayed in a private room with a queen bed.     pros: room, bathroom and kitchen were very spacious and clean. good location, only 5-10 min walk to walk of fame, and easy to catch the subway anywhere else. good value for money.  cons: music playing till late in the night, it would be nice if the staff turned it down as it's 24/7 reception. only 1/3 staff members i spoke with were friendly. it would also be nice if the breakfast staff wiped the tables from the night before.

very cool place! be aware that hostel world call the dorm rooms different to what the hostel offers. we order a 6 mixed private dorm, and there was 8 people all together in our room. but banana bungalow was awesome, great place and would highly recommend

location was handy, parking spot was super easy & safe, breakfast ok. in one of the corridors, there was a strong smell of puke for a few days. also, our room had a "tipping envelope". i haven't seen these even in that many hotels earlier, and they feel weird in a hostel environment.
each room has its own kitchen! really cool set up and very social environment
pretty good value for money . rooms were cleaned daily, staff were mostly helpful and welcoming. would definitely book again for a short stay in hollywood.

be careful! this hostel is full of cockroaches and insects. the cleanliness was the worst i've ever seen in many years, and the hostel staff didn't apologize or did nothing to us. we had to sleep inside of our car! the only good point of this place is the location.

it turned out to be a different hostel. im registered with hostel international. the place i went to said "vibe". i lost my next day of work as tgeir alarm clock did not work. cotinental breakfast was "downstairs can't get even a cup of coffee"! i was over charged ($47not$33 and next day i was asked to pay for a 4 seater for myself!! $100)( this is attrocious for a disabled person in a wheelchair! )from the rate online and i'm still chasing to find the reimbursable booking fee($7.?)

normally hostels booked via hostelworld take a 10% deposit and you pay the rest on arrival. this hostel took all the money after the booking so i had trouble getting the rental car. be aware of that !!!  the hostel is pretty chill direct on the hollywood boulevard. party isn't that good due to california law closing pubs on 2am.  if i would to my trip again i would prefere a hostel close to the beach.
roommates are friendly, staff is helpful & nice. fair price in la & good for backpackers. location is fine, near to hollywood/highland:)

the ladies at the front desk were not very informative when we checked in in regards to where rooms/lounge/activities were. didn't feel overly welcomed. but the breakfast attendant made up for it as he was chatty, energetic, and informative about the area and nearby events going on. it's nice how the two bungalow hostels get together for certain night events.
nice hostel with great events and lots of socializing and fun. definitely would stay again.

each room has a kitchen rather than a communal one. the female staff seemed disinterested but the male staff were friendly. the location is good as it's close to a metro & shops but i felt unsafe in the area. there was no atmosphere when i was there and the activities which involved driving were cancelled because their driver was ill. the breakfast was good and i was happy to see they supplied non dairy milk :)
recomiendo mucho este hotel! todo muy nuevo, estaba lleno y súper tranquilo. no tiene aire pero dormimos bárbaro con el ventilador. resultó mucho mejor de lo que pensábamos!!

staff were really accommodating and friendly. free breakfast was a nice plus. free drop offs to venice beach, universal studios and griffith observatory. beds were not very comfortable and rooms were hot.
i don't think the location is safe enough. except this, everything is fine, value for money, good breakfast.
great place, i definitely going back, thanks!
a little bit far from metro. nothing much i recommnd of this property. facilities just so so. breakfast their provide was a bonus but just cereal and toast.
good decent place to stay if you there to party.

helpful and friendly staff. parking is very important as the region does not have many free options. however, if you are arrive late, there’s a chance it’s full. provate room is fine, considering its price. very good price-benefit ratio.
fantastic atmosphere, great location and staff. will definitely stay again
first ever hostel stay! was great :)

the staff were nice. they let my friend and i stay in the party room when we arrived early. the facility cleanliness was disappointing. there were roaches in the room, crawling on the dining room table. the bathroom was not the cleanest either. the bed was okay, loud and squeaky but pretty comfortable. the free breakfast was a plus!

we did not enjoy our stay here. the manager is not friendly at all. parking is rubbish. only a few spaces first come first served. very noisy, party's every night and screaming in early hours of morning. didn't feel in a safe area. breakfast was not good. we stayed in hi fishmans wharf in san francisco before this and this was 10x better and cheaper.
good location but not much atmosphere. reasonably priced for the location. kitchen in the dorm rooms is great. very clean.
i will highly recommended 🍌 banana hostil. very nice and kind  people! !!😃😄😍

awesome hostel! there is so much for guests to do. they have fun activities set up to get the guests together. the private i stayed in was awesome, it was equipped with a kitchen and its own bathroom and tv.  the breakfast was decent.
great place to stay if you’re looking to meet people and party. cleaniless could be better. staff were so nice, mo and sol were especially friendly and great, we had a fun night out with them.

i  had issues with my original roomate as it was a non smoking room and he continued to smoke in the room and i have asthma which caused problems. i told reception and was moved and was happy where i was placed in the other room. the rubbish left after other guests was not cleaned away properly. the wifi not reaching the rooms was annoying. overall it's an awesome place and warming people make it a cool place to be. it's location is awesome you just walk up and see the stars!!
we had problem about parking and night personel behave us rude .

bearing in mind you get what you pay for, banana bungalow is top value for money. the rooms are clean and the dunny and shower/bath in the six person room my son and i rented was functional. there is a free breakfast of toast or cereal and a few times a week a $5 dinner which was good and plentiful. it's probably more a a young person's hostel but i'm 59 and didn't feel out of place and there were a few other older souls too. it's also close to hollywood and the metro. i'd stay again.

best hostel i have ever stayed at in terms of atmosphere! met so many great people and the karaoke night and organised nights out cannot be missed! most guests were solo travellers, i was with 2 friends but it is the perfect hostel for individuals as everyone is so friendly. rooms are standard. definitely a hostel for the younger generation which was perfect for us but if you are seeking a quiet place to stay i would recommend elsewhere. loved it and would definitely return!

this was my first time in l.a, it was also my first time staying in a hostel and i've got to say it was an amazing experience. the hostel is a short walk from the walk of fame as well as amazing places to eat and drink.  the hostel its self has a fantastic atmosphere with its various different party night and it's chilled and welcoming feel. i made a bunch of new friends and made some fantastic memories.  and to top it all off when i messed up my flight the staff were very helpful! i'll be back!

i really like the location but i prefer the other banana bungalow, i know this isn't the hostel's fault but even the other travelers seem more friendly and fun comparing to this one. other than that, it is an okay. it is clean, safe, have a good breakfast.
very easy to make friends here! atmosphere is a big 10/10 for a hostel.   tip: don't underestimate the parties they offer during the weekend! to much fun :)
was totally unsafe, checked about early due to an altercation with another patron. would not recommend to anyone travelling by themselves

great location,great rooms.. it's a motel converted into hostel beds.. which makes it more interesting!  i had a great time in l.a.. they have good freebies and activities.. good social gathering..  breakfast not so great!   and  reception isn't as informative or personal as one would expect.. but i guess that's more like the american way!   in all would definitely come back if i had a stay a couple of nights

awesome place to stay in a terrific location, just a 5-10 minute walk from the main strip of hollywood boulevard. staff are great, accommodating and friendly and arrange activities pretty much every night for all to join. plenty of space to socialise with others but also to isolate yourself and have some time on your own. metro and bus stops are nearby so getting across the area is easy. definitely recommend staying, would 100% return to banana bungalows if i visit la/hollywood again.

this place had amazing events in the night time, a variety of things to do during the day. the rooms were well insulated as well from the noise so you couldn't even hear the crazy karaoke unless you left the room. its location on the boulevard may seem confusing at first - as in you think you're miiiles away from the heart of it but in reality it's only a few minutes walk away. also very near a bus stop and a variety of places to get food.  wifi was spotty and could be improved.

it was the best hostel what i have ever been ! our room was large, we had an own kitchen ( !!! ) and bathroom as well. they took us to the universal studio by shuttle for free. the breakfast was simple but enough and you can get omletts for low budget. they organized many programs for us for example karaoke, beerpong, stand up comedy

the location was perfect, close enough to easily get to attractions, but far enough that you got some quiet time. the layout & breakfast area was great. staff was very helpful & so much fun. we were there friday & saturday nights, there was a great party/get together, only $20 for all ypu could eat & drink. they offered shuttle service to the clubs & made sure everyone was safe. i was very happy with the experience, would stay there again & highly recommend to anyone wanting to enjoy hollywood.
really enjoyed my stay here:) super vibey place and kept clean and tidy ✨🙌🏼
great place to stay. it was clean, full of life, and awesome location. i highly recommend it!

i stayed in a 6 bed dorm and it has its on bathroom and kitchen which was great. location is very good, walking distance from hollywood and highland (busy section of hollywood boulevard). the hostel had organised events most nights so would probably be good for lone travellers. there is a free breakfast which is cereal, tea/coffee, toast with peanut butter and jelly or nutella. it was nothing special but it was free so no complaints!

absolutely nothing to complain about. i got the impression this place had recently turned into a hostel from a former motel. they have daily activities and a table tennis table but due to the motel set up didn't quite have the perfect hostel vibe. our room faced onto hollywood boulevard so there was a lot of traffic noise.
this place is amazing. definitely would recommend if you are willing to socialize. i met so many people around the world. everyone is friendly. i am so sad to have left - i cried.

good value for money considering the cost of accommodations in la. the hostel is pretty stylish and location is awesome. atmosphere was okay but they could try to organise more events, pub crawls etc. breakfast was not great, only some lousy bread and pb (skippy:( ), cereals, at the end the best thing was nutella........ all the rest (eggs, bacon etc.) isn't for free and even pricey!! (6$). that could definitely be improved with at least some juice, fruits, jam and better products!

great atmosphere and the staff are always available to help and recommend.  the location is awesome really close to the walk of fame and there is a metro station close to the hostel.  a great place to stay in hollywood!
good and with some great travellers, and also some terrible ones. also, lots of the 'free' elements included were cancelled without mention or apology. comedy night was great though.
i had the best time at banana bungalow. met some amazing people! would go again.
very nice location and fhe staff was great.

this hostel is in a great location for people looking to explore hollywood. in a half day hike through griffith park, you can see the griffith observatory and the hollywood sign. the hollywood walk of fame is right out the front door. there are two world class comedy clubs a very short cab ride away (the laugh factory and comedy store). i stayed in one of dorms and found it very comfortable. there was an ac unit and a mounted wall fan for hotter nights. i'd stay there again and i'd recommend it.

fab place! and only walking distance from walk of fame but a little bit sketchy if you walk on other side of the road. great staff and facilties and fab that the sleeping area was separated within the rooms.
good all round

good location close to universal studios, hollywood sign and the walk of fame, although the walk of fame really isn't much to see. was a bit disappointed with hollywood, it's a pretty grungy place and around 1 hour from santa monica pier. i would definitely recommend staying in venice beach which is a much nicer area if you're planning on staying in la for more than 2/3 days (especially in summer). otherwise, the hostel was nice and the rooms were a good size with the kitchen being a plus!

all perfect, the only thing i didn't like was that they do so much waste about plastic plates in breakfast for example. but i think is a la thing. i saw it in the other hostels as well. it would be better if they give us regular dishes and we wash them ourselves to don't do so much plastic waste.

excellent hostel, location is good not to far from metro and 5 blocks away from walk of fame. staff was so helpful, especially mo he is such a great person though! atmosphere was so good for solo travels  i would definitely come here again.
i had a great time staying at the banana bungalow. i will definitely stay there again.
great location, close to walk of fame, enjoyed the free drop off
i loved there !!! really great vibe

you cannot beat the location! major land marks were 15 min away. fun bars were nearby. love that there was free parking in a secured location.  i stayed in a private room and it was very clean and in a quiet location. great hostel overall.

awesome place. from the attitude over the phone to check in to check out. everyone here is good vibes. room was super clean and had its own kitchen and bathroom with shower. there are planned activities everyday. there was free food and beer. the guests all seem to be in a friendly mood as a place like this would have that effect on people. i recommend this place very much. i would definitely go back!
good location, short walk to the main attractions of hollywood, but there isn't a designated smoking area
upside:   affordably priced.     downside:   it's a party atmosphere here, if you are looking for a peaceful time, that will be difficult.
friendly staff. down to earth. perfect place just blocks from downtown hollywood.

great place. much more social than many hostels in the us. i wound up not being a huge fan of hollywood boulevard, but it was good to get to see it. i thought that the atmosphere here was really nice, and my dorm had its own bathroom and kitchen.

staff were extremely rude and mostly unhelpful! apart from when they were trying to scam money of you! one member of staff offered to help us get to 6 flags and it was only when we returned we found out he was overcharging us for an uber and lining his own pockets! rooms were disgusting and looked although they hadnt been cleaned in weeks and the shower so was so dirty it was unusable!  also booked a 6 bed room and was given an 8
awesome hostel!!

the hostel is in a great location if you want to stay on hollywood blvd and the price was extremely affordable. the room i was in had its own bathroom and kitchen area and everything was clean. the staff were extremely nice and helpful, and the guests staying there were very friendly. guests also have access to wifi, tvs, computers, pool table, basketball court, ping pong table, and places to hang out and visit. there are also scheduled events for guests that the hostel coordinates.
hostel is located at far end of hollywood boulevard. rooms are spacious and clean. staff was helpful and free shuttles help explore la.

very good!  coded security door to get in, key cards for the rooms.  my 8-bed ensuite was split into 2 rooms so it wasn't a mass of people in one area.  it also had a full kitchen (more or less), never seen that before!  they had event nights (open bar, food, and entry to bars) both nights which was great for meeting other guests.  they interact a lot with the sister hostel in west hollywood so you'll meet two hostels worth of people on the event nights!  lockers are small-ish.  would stay again

we stayed in the west hollywood banana bungalows before which we did prefer, although the location of this one is great for exploring hollywood. the rooms didn't have air con so they were boiling and there was a kitchen in the rooms but very little in the kitchen so you couldn't really do much with it. the organised nights put on here were really fun though!

we had an overnight in la and wanted to visit the hollywood sign and santa monica. the hollywood sign was easily accessible in an uber and santa monica was a bit of a hike (about 1.5 - 2 hours) via a bus or uber. when we arrived we were told it was taco night so ended up getting dinner and breakfast for free which was awesome!! the room itself was spacious and had its own bathroom and kitchen. beds were comfy and air con was fine for the time of the year.
such a great place to stay!
great hostel, friendly staff , free breakfast, walking distance to hollywood sign, a lot of freebies

i loved staying at this hostel. the location was perfect, the facilities were great, the room was wonderful and the overall vibe of the hostel was awesome. the planned activities were a great added bonus too. i had lots of fun, partied hard and met loads of new people. i even booked for an extra night the day i was due to leave as i loved it so much. will definitely be staying here again!

this hostel is in a great location. some of the staff are very friendly and helpful but there was one who was in a consistently bad mood and not very helpful at all.  we were in a room with three bunks for a total of 4 nights. there were 10 people including us who were there these four nights and the bathroom was cleaned once the entire time. also if you do go here bring hand soap as there's none. i've never experienced this before at a hostel, especially one that charges so much. not worth it

an ok hostel in a great location. the staff were often not very friendly and asked as though they didn't want to help you. quite expensive for what it is, despite this i would stay here again if in la based on location.
great hostel to explore hollywood. events are on every night. staff is great.
i will completely recommend this place !! friendly staff, helpful and smily ... i'm happy i could had met the people at this place

nice place. easy to get to things within hollywood. a bus ride to the observatory. i was there on the 4th july and they had a bbq and party there which was good. friendly staff and guests. clean place with en suite and a kitchen in each room.

my arrival time to the hostel said 10am but the rude blonde lady at the front desk said that i had to wait until 2pm to check in. she had a really bad attitude when i brought this to her attention. it made me decide to never stay at banana bungalow again! i am not going to be paying for this level of poor service.
one of the best hostales that i've been, great locations, great rooms and great people and the best good price

if i was someone who really wanted to just sleep this is not the place, every night there was a party going on in the bar. in saying that i had so much fun and met a lot of awesome people, it's a bit of a walk the subways and food but would definitely book here again!
good location, friendly staff always ready to help, and overall very positive experience.
the room was not cleaned in the 4 days we were there, eventhough we left the sign by the door. the location was pretty good.
loved my time here!

staff were friendly, great breakfast, atmosphere was good, but spoiled by loud music from hostel speakers (not even from other guests) blasting 24 hours a day. if you want to sleep, earplugs are a must!

great location near hollywood and super friendly and helpful staff members! i'm horrible with names but there was a british guy who gave us so many tips about things to do which was a fantastic help. free parking was great and well organized by staff, just wish i could have stayed a little longer and timed my trip better in order to enjoy the activities that were on!
great hostel had a great time here.
great location, very helpful staff, actually nice rooms, great vibes!
good value. had no problems here.
great place within walking distance of hollywood walk of fame and metro station. secure parking, lots of activities.

this was the first time i ever stayed in a hostel, and it was an excellent experience. the people were fun, the location was great, and i would definitely stay here again. the only reason this review doesn't have a 10/10 is because on several accounts my key stopped working and sometimes the 24 desk wasn't staffed. i just would have to go downstairs to get it fixed but it was still hassle when you're up and down the stairs and sometimes someone wasn't there to help. still, i would go back!
had a awesome time. stuff wasn't allways nice and helpful. location is really good.. metro and bus isn't far.

loved the banana bungalows, had a private room for me and my boyfriend and it was huge with its own kitchen and bathroom. only complaint would be the air conditioning wasn't good enough, we only had a fan in the bedroom and a vent in the kitchen window. social side of it was great was lots to do bar crawls comedy nights bbq's plenty of opportunity to meet new people. it was far from the beaches though, about an hour in an uber to venice beach. definitely recommend!

pretty quiet when i was there. clean rooms and although i'd booked my two nights separately, they offered to sort it so i could stay in the same room, easy. walking distance to attractions on hollywood (including nice farmers market on sunday mornings) and easy to get to and from the airport using flyaway bus.

free breakfast was great, and the private rooms are really good value for money - they are huge and the kitchen is nice.     location isn't perfect, though can walk (about 15 - 20 minutes) to central hollywood district.
would definitely recommend this hostel. clean, great location and friendly staff. lots of activists going on, breakfast available and free parking.

booked this hostel because it's advertised to have free parking. given that we had a rental car we were counting on secure parking, particularly because la can be 'sketchy'. when we arrived at check-in there were no parking spaces and cars all squeezed in behind each other. when we asked reception about this they advised that parking was on a first come first served basis. had i known this prior to booking i'd have booked elsewhere!
good location for exploring hollywood. clean, comfy, good breakfast. felt very secure. i could have stayed there much longer and would definitely stay there again.

we stayed in a private room and were very pleased with the room and facilities. the room was spacious, and the kitchen and bathroom were good. the room was fitted with a safe. i can't fault the cleanliness of the room, and the staff that we spoke to were friendly and helpful. the location is good, but it is about a 30 minute walk along hollywood boulevard from the hostel to the main part of the strip where the dolby theatre etc are located. i would be keen to stay here again if i'm in la again.

loved my stay so much that i extended it for few more days so i can hang some more! great location, the rooms are big with a privet bathroom and shower and a full kitchen! the parking is awesome, free and right downstairs! great activities almost every night and the staff is amazing!!! highly recommend!

banana bungalow is at what seems to be the slightly dodgy end of hollywood boulevard however once you get into the complex its a lovely place and the rooms are equipped with everything you need for your stay as well as offering free breakfast, great events almost every day and loads of activities like ping pong and basketball. there is also parking which is very helpful given la is so hard to get around without a car. if you want to explore hollywood then banana bungalow is a great location.

homeless men in our room. one whom had paid for a night but the other was obviously a mate who kept "forgetting" his key card multiple times. felt uncomfortable and unsafe. staff were not approachable, vacant! did not feel we could speak to them about this issue in confidence. man smoking weed in the dorm during the night, stinking the place out. extremely noisy until early hours of the morning. location quite far from main hollywood attractions and did not feel safe walking back in the evening!

nice atmosphere and great location but they don't give you any blankets, only sheets, so i was freezing every night!! room was very dirt and smelt awful and common kitch was also extremely unhygenic and had a bad smell. nice courtyard area
best hostel i've ever stayed in. loads going on, loads of amazing people and staff. centrally located and free or cheap events, food and drink.
part hostel

-security was pretty good, didn't have anything stolen except for sunglasses but i'm pretty sure it was a guest in the room who is responsible.  -location was pretty good since it was close to the main hollywood area which has lots of places to eat, thoug

good location and very good atmosphere if you want to socialise and have fun (but if you want somewhere quiet this isn't ideal. breakfast is fairly good and our 6 bed room had a kitchen and bathroom so was really practical. not there for too long but seemed like they organised a fair few activities and is fairly close to public transport, 7eleven and liquor stores. only problem was the staff were a bit inconsistent - some were really nice, helpful and friendly but others weren't at all.

my girlfriend and i went there for the memorial weekend and slept in 8 bunk beds with two rooms and one bathroom and a shower for all. no issues at all and no complaints. can see the the hollywood sign view from the room. the parking is fine. they will ask you to drop off your key in the front office to keep it safe.
realty great hostel. everyone was so friendly and the nightly events were great for getting to know each other.
brilliant!! they do events every night inside and outside the hostel. they also link events with their sister hostel so always new people

the hostel is located on the outskirts of the main hollywood area. the hostel is probably ready for some renovations. with the wear and tear from years of travelers staying. its a good option for 1 or 2 nights if you are on a budget.
i had an amazing time in this nice hostel. they offer parties and free food. employees are veryfriendly and the rooms are very comfortable!!! you will definitely love staying here.
staff were very impatient and rude all the time!

the staff are really friendly and helpful. the atmosphere is good with a lot of activities going on every day. however, if you want to get some good sleep, remember to bring your earplugs because they host singing events with loud music during some evenings!

the banana bungalow hollywood is in a great location. it's close to many restaurants and hollywood attractions. the hostel held daily, free events which i recommend taking advantage of. the hostel is all ages, there were families there. if you're looking for that party environment, my friends and i enjoyed the bar crawls that were hosted by the hostel and it's location in west hollywood. overall, great stay at the banana bungalow hollywood!
great location, great staff, definitely will stop over there again next time

had a great stay at banana bungalow - mainly due to the incredible friends that i made there on my 2 week stay. the hostel was great because it has a really social area on the ground level where they have a table tennis table, pool table, lots of chairs and tables and had music playing. one of the staff ladies' at reception never semed to have a smile on her face and always seemed angry. also noticed one male staff member that had inappropriate relations with guests. great hostel though!

the location was neither here nor there, it was in between the griffith observatory and hollywood walk so depending on what is the aim of your stay the location works! you would still need to walk out to get to anywhere including the public transportation. there are good options of food not too far. secondly, bring your own locks if you would like to use the lockers provided!
staff and place was great. they hosted epic free dinners and parties for both hostels and it is value for money staying at this hostel.

the worst bed i e ever slept in after 4 months of staying in hostels, uncomfortable and very squeaky, couldn't make a simple move without it being noisy.  the place is very run down, needs a quote of paint and the breakfast. at area needs a good power wash...  the night time receptionist had a bit of an attitude too... i hated it.
i liked this hostel, it was clean and stuff was very friendly:)
had a good time here - good open style accomodation

this hostel was pretty well worth the price. i did not see staff too often but they were helpful when i needed them. free parking and free breakfast (although if you want a filling breakfast you'll have to pay). bathrooms are inside each room, which means one bathroom for six people... proximity does not equal convenience. but it was clean. very international and met lots of great people. i would stay here again

great atmosphere, nice staff, the tiki lounge is a great place to relax in the sun and get chatting to other people, and i met some really lovely friends during my stay. the karyokie and night out on a wednesday is great fun, with free mexican food! everything is clean, showers work well, wifi is good and always reached my room. beds aren't that comfy but manageable, no individual lights by bed which can be difficult if some are trying to sleep and u are awake or vise versa. lockers in room.

this is a good hostel in la. good atmosphere and provide breakfast like coffee, milk and bread. i lived in a 6 mixed dorm, we shared a kitchen and a bathroom.  there were about three wall sockets in a room. the hostel has different activities every night like movie night, bbq or party...etc. it takes extra money of course. the parking lot can park around 15 cars. first come first park, you have to park outside when it is full. overall it is a good hostel, i'd like to stay here again.
staff were amazing & there were a ton of free activities/food/etc. location was great and they offer shuttles to major attractions.

the staff was so welcoming and friendly and helpful, especially mary in the reception. the place was cozy and the food (you can buy different breakfast meals with eggs and stuff) was excellent. we were very pleased with our visit.
i loved it! one night they gave us free drinks and food! and the breakfast is awesome.
very good vibe hostel. nice people and the fact each room has a small kitchen and a bathroom is really convenient.

absolutely loved my stay here!!! the staff were friendly, everyone was so nice, and the room was great. i ended up having wonderful roommates the entire time i was there, which was lucky!! the courtyard and tiki garden were above my expectations, it was amazing. i would definitely stay here again, overall just a perfect hotel experience in my opinion.

very noisy stay. i used to stay there in my early twenties but not sure i would do it again now... the room was great and very clean but the karaoke night lasted well past midnight and made me feel very uncomfortable with an early day awaiting me the morning after.
other than a v friendly host - dishing out wine and serving breakfast - everything else was pretty average
nice place to stay in hollywood. good facilities. would stay here again.

we had to change room 3 times because somehow someone checked in with my name few hours before. we also had to wait 45 minutes before leaving since an hostel van was blocking our car and the couldn't find the keys

i met such cool people here, when i was traveling for work. everyone was super friendly and welcoming and that is something you need if you travel alone constantly. i made instant friends and i could have stayed there for weeks. i will definitely be back!!

this hostel is great if you are looking for somewhere right in the centre of hollywood.  there is a great atmosphere and the majority of staff are absolutely lovely and willing to help.  points for improvement could be the cleanliness (fairly standard for a hostel of this nature).  last note one of the receptionists is essentially useless in explaining anything that you may need to know about the hostel but there are usually others around who have a bit of an idea so just look out for them :)
i was not able to go to the hostel but i got a refund by the people that work there and they were very kind

overall staying at the banana bungalow was great. good value for the $. you're right on hollywood blvd so you are not to far away in terms of walking to the walk of fame and nokia and chinese theatre. the only problem i faced was the check in. we confirmed a check-in for 12pm but were only allowed to check in at 2pm. so instead of getting are stuff settled after coming from the airport we have to keep our bags in a holding area with other guests and kill 2hrs.

worst hostel i've ever stayed !  i've stayed in about 30 hostels across as many countries and this one is just not good. staff is rude, rooms and lockers are small, beds are not comfortable at all, its super noisy. there was a problem with my booking and they woke me up at 11pm to make me change room because mine was overbooked. yes you're closed to hollywood blvr but that's it. you're an hour away from anything else. go to banana bungalows west hollywood instead, i've stayed in both.
stayed here for 2 nights really love the all games ppl is nice and friendly. location is good. second day nothing to do just play sport games with hostel new friends. nice one hostel to stay.

this hostel is a great place for a sightseeing trip to l.a. a 20 minute walk down hollywood boulevard are lots of attractions and entertainment. the staff is also very nice and helpful.   a negative aspect about our stay was, that the heating didn't work. with outside temperatures at about 15 degrees celsius, our room got very cold over the night, since the room is hardly insulated.   apart from that i would absolutely recommend this hostel.
party hostel. do not come here to sleep.
the best hostel in hollywood by far, everyone on the staff was amazing and polite. great vibes at the vibe hotel forsure. i'll be back!!

it's a pretty decent hostel and is definitely in the best location. griffith observatory is 1 hr hike, walk of fame is 5 minutes. they include free parking + breakfast which is amazing.    cons: in hostels, most people are concerned about their belongings. although this hostel provides lockers, you have to bring your own lock or buy one for $2. this is the only thing that bothered me. otherwise it's. a pretty decent place for $33.

good place close enough to hollywood and vine station though a bit of a walk from all the action but not that far....  not as much of a party hostel as usa hostels down the road but about 10/15 dollars cheaper, though it does have stuff with its sister hostel.overall a very good choice you won't be disappointed with.
da best of da best
that's a really nice place to stay in la.

well located near to the hollywood walk of fame and not far from amazing views of the hollywood sign. the organised transport and trips are really helpful to avoid public transport getting around la and to meet others in the hostel. the room wasn't the cleanest but this was more likely the other occupants than the hostel itself. overall a good stay!
had a private room, was clean and close to everything
loved it! totally recommended

i booked a 6-bed room, but was given a 8-bed room. very chaotic. some drunk people were walking inside the wrong room in the midnight and trying to find out their beds.  the shower and toilets are limited.  worst hostel i had.   only good thing is that it is close to walk of fame.
excellent place to stay. value for money. friendly staff and welcoming people. secure and safe.   recomend it to everyone

my sister and i only stayed at this hostel for one night but we enjoyed our stay regardless. we had a rental car and it was nice to be able to park it for free in a gated area so we didn't feel unsafe at all. checking in and out was easy and the staff were friendly and helpful.

the staffs are soooo nice! everything is so good here, i stayed in a dorm which has our own bedroom and little kitchen with microwave and tablewares. the tiki garden is very nice for enjoying the sunshine! other facilities are good too, just having fun with friends. the activities are very good and enjoyable for everyone!  i have to say it's really hard to describe how great the hostel is! i really had a great time here and will go back as soon as possible!
the private kitchen in dorm room was handy. the wifi was very poor

this place is good fun! staff are all friendly and helpful! good breakfast! chilled out atmosphere! bathrooms could be slightly cleaner but i think that may have been down to the people we were sharing a room with and not the cleaning staff! would definitely stay again :)

great spot, great people, great vibes.  only place to go in the small us hostel scene but they have done it well. only stayed 3 nights but 1 of them included free drinks and karaoke, for which everyone got up and about for.  breakfast was good and facilities were great.

the hostel have some very nice things, like pool, table tennis, basketball hoop and a complete breakfast. nevertheless the beds are awful, horrible mattres and bed sheets. also the towel had some strange dirt stains. also the atmosphere wasnt so good. maybe if you want to stay a long time in la this hostel is good for you because you will have time to use all the infraestructure, but if you want a place to sleep good this is not your place.

the marketing team for this hostel deserves a promotion. the video portrayed this hostel  as a 10 out of 10 but it was definitely the most disappointing one we stayed in while in california. it did all the basics right and definitely has the potential to be a 10 but we found the rooms a bit dirty and the staff relatively unwelcoming. breakfast was pretty average, and if i were to stay in la again i would probably stay closer to the beach.

my first hosts experience in the usa.   rooms are big, with ensuite bathroom and little kitchen.   daily drop offs are to universal studios and other attractions. cheap dinner nights a couple times a week at the hostel. nice free breakfast.   staff is very nice and helpful. however, not all of them are very knowledgeable about activities in the area or travel hacks in the us.   common area is mainly outside. amazing when the temperature is nice. unfortunately i had cold days.   great hostel !
food rooms with kitchen inside, breakfast is sweet and the hostel is a raid layout. old motel.

best hotel i've ever stayed at. and this is coming back traveling europe. we were greeted right away and had free alcohol with karaoke! (thursday nights) we met people from all over the world and roommates were respectful. hollywood is in my backyard but i would love to stay here once a month!

easy walk down to the centre of hollywood. about a 5-10 minute walk to buses and metro. have your wits about you when walking alone in the early morning/late nights - lots of homeless people living on hollywood blvd and sunset blvd. staff are very friendly and helpful. activities run by the hostel are great - when they say "free drinks" they mean it! free dinners provide plenty of food and breakfast is decent! room was well cleaned daily. heater kept the room nice and warm.

this hostel is so much fun, staff is great, super friendly, walking distance to all the fun hollywood attractions, dorms have full kitchens, so many choices at breakfast, karaoke night is so much fun, best hostel i stayed at do far

great location if you want to see hollywood.  otherwise a pretty average hostel with limited facilities.  having cars drive around in the common area seemed weird.  considering the price, i expected more.  i would recommend the other banana bungalow in west hollywood, as i felt it was a better deal.

probably the best and most relaxed/laid back hostel i've ever stayed in. couldn't recommend it high enough, from the various events and services to the atmosphere and staff. everything was great for the price!
very solid choice for a budget stay in l.a. i would come here again.

for los angeles, it's great value for money and i was pleasantly surprised! the staff was fun and super friendly, there are tons of free stuffs (free shuttle, drinks, food etc.), there is a great social atmosphere and the location is really close to hollywood bars and sights. we felt safe although it was a bit dark at night and not super lively in the immediate neighborhood. there were many storage space in our dorm. only complain, 1 bathroom for 8 people does not seem much!
good location, great staff. facilities are a bit old but all good. free breakfast of cereal and toast, plenty of nightly activities and tours/shuttles.
excellent

this is the worst hostel i have stayed in on the entire west coast (vancouver bc included). the bathroom looks like it hadn't been cleaned in about 2 weeks. the rooms were filthy as well. there was no security for your stored bags, nothing gets tagged and people can just walk in and out of the room. wifi is basically non-existent. if you're looking to plan your time in la when you're here, forget it. i had to go to a starbucks down the street to even book my train.

this is a good hostel, some things i liked here:  1. the hostel rooms have their own shower and kitchen, which is rare in hostel dorms  2. you can see the hollywood sign from the hostel  would recommend

i stayed in the jungle room - fun for a night but for more than, pay the extra and get a proper room. this is a tree house, without windows or proper walls. every time someone walks on the stairs the whole room shakes. and just outside the room is where everyone spends the night singing, drinking and talking. earplugs are a must. there is no breakfast included.

the staff was friendly, some people around the neighborhood were kind of sketchy but i felt very safe while in the hostel. you can find sketchy people anywhere.  close to the metro, a bunch of places to get food nearby. i enjoyed the rooms, they weren't bad. it was nice having a bathroom in the room. however the beds made a lot of noise so everyone in my room was worried about waking each other up haha. however, i would definitely stay here again!
a great place for fun. very big rooms for what we paid for and definitely better than a lot of hostels we've stayed in so far in the united states.

no light or plugs for bed. noise from party inconsiderate to non-partying guests. cigarette smoke filtered into room. pillow not a real pillow, more like small bag of fluff. staff unable to advise on basic transport issues (told to just look at google maps when i asked how to get to moca which is just a train trip away). staff do not listen to what guests say (key stopped working and i asked for it to be fixed - they acted like i was checking out). uncomfortable. high rating a mystery.
loved it - perfect location and has a good la feel.

extremely friendly and down-to-earth staff, who have huge knowledge about hollywood and l.a. during the three nights i stayed, there was a free dinner/drinks, and a party on the first night; free shuttle to universal studios hollywood on the second day; and free breakfast all the way through. the hotel provides a very cosy environment which encourages guests to meet and greet a variety of other guests from around the u.s. and the world, especially in the hostel rooms. extremely sociable!
good staff, good location.

i've stayed here several times and it's always good value for money in la. location is good: away from the craziest part of hollywood blvd but close to restaurants, bars, shops, metro etc. dorms are basic but good, showers and wifi great. if you have a car, the free parking (when available) is an amazing perk in la and can save you a lot of money. at this hostel you can definitely party and be sociable or just do your own thing and get some rest.
friendly staff, good breakfast (even soy milk) good activities, bit of a walk to places, use uber. clean and comfortable.
wifi was terrible to use internet.

perfect place to stay, hollywood area in general is a bit run down , but all in all it was nice. really cool set up. you get a bathroom and kitchen which is great especially for the hostel. staff were great, always making sure all felt included in group excursions, would have done a lot more but couldn't afford much after already being in the u.s for 6 weeks prior. highly recommend! :)  wifi not great but hey, there's so much to do in town :)
people smoking weed everywhere, homeless people outside the front door, save your money and stay else where, i couldn't wait to leave this hostel

i was told there were no blankets left when i arrived and the staff were not very friendly. however the shower and kitchen in the room were nice and the free breakfast was chilled. good for a short stay.

i recommend this hostel! i spent 2 days in hollywood and was very good!  the location is very close of the all turist places!  have many options to eat, shopping and other stores!   my friend and me really enjoyed!   luana

a fairly solid hostel all round. price is good for the location and has good facilities, clean rooms and friendly staff. more effort could be put into getting everybody together for nights out and socialising. also, having to make your own bed and sleep on a noisy waterproof mattress cover is a joke and should be changed. enjoyed our stay altogether.

stayed here for my brothers 21st for 5 nights. good vibe, oddly enough during the week rather than weekends. make sure you're there on wednesday night (free beers & karaoke!!) staff were really cool, especially chris "brown" who does the night shift - you know who you are haha! cheers guys! nik & armaani
amazing location, party central so expect loud noise late into the night. everthing you need provided!!

it's a basic establishment in a seedy area of los angeles.  the staff are moderately helpful, but the rooms lack not only character but cleanliness and character.  the breakfast, however, is decent, and there's plenty to go around.  the environment is conducive to socialising, though, and meeting other travellers.  during the day, the surrounds are okay (although they befit only a certain variant of travel limit to a minute shoestring budget).  it was okay for a one-night stay.
very nice room, it has private bathroom and kitchen, good for the price. not all the staff were as friendly as we expected. atmosphere was great.

the hostel is overall nice but it has a weird set-up. it's a converted motel so all the rooms circle a central courtyard/driveway. they installed a basketball net in there, which seems like a good idea but the sound of balls banging is very loud and they don't have rules about when people can play. so basically, nice hostel but not for the light sleeper.

i did not feel safe here. my first night staying here (i had a private room), someone walked up to my window and tried to peer in through the curtain for several minutes, and jiggled the window. it was terrifying. i went to talk to the front desk management and described what happened, and she thought i had been saying on the first floor. she said it must have been a homeless person, that they often tried to break in and steal things (!!!) do not stay here if you are a woman traveling alone.

we reserved a private double room, where they say that you pay for room and not for bed, but they asked us to pay for the extra people without telling us before. the worst thing is that the weather was cold and they didn't have enough blankets so we spend the night freezing, i also saw a cockroach in the bathroom. i definitely won't spend another night in that hostel.
frendly staff and clean rooms. my single complaint is the noise levels late   at night. through the ventilation ducts i could hear the loud laughs of other guests.

the only nice part of this hostel was oscar, the receptionist that greeted us. everything was okay, but there was one night where the "maintenance" guy came into our room, which we assumed he changed the paintings on the wall (even though they seemed perfectly fine) and to paint a door. there was no prior notice of maintenance and no one gave us notice afterwards either. we only found out when we came back and our room lights were on and left blue masking tape on a nightstand.
great place to stay - close to attractions in hollywood, clean rooms and friendly atmosphere. good value for money.

the location was really good, though the staff were travellers rather than locals, so their answers to questions were often to look it up online which is not excellent.  the kitchen facilities are not great if that was what you were after.

good place for the money. it is very well located, the rooms are very clean and spacious, and the people there are really nice. there were just a few things that i hoped would have been different. the breakfast was very basic, which is understandable for the price that we were paying for the rooms. one staff member was pretty rude with me, because i didn't understand his question. there were a few sketchy people there, even a homeless guy that was asking for me and my friends personal info.

stayed here as a first stop on my backpacking trip. arrived at about 8am from lax and they let me store my bag and have free breakfast, which was appreciated. the rooms were a good size and clean. i loved that our room had a mini kitchenette and dining table - i've never seen this before. walking distance to the metro and is on the same street the walk of fame, chinese theater etc is on so is in a great location. great social atmosphere if that's your thing. i'd stay again.
overall very good place to stay. great room and bar. fantastic location, all staff super friendly and helpful. only downside was that the wifi was terrible.
pros: friendly staff, events, location, atmosphere  cons: there is an ongoing high-pitch sound all around (and in) the hostel that may or may not bother you

the location is great and the rooms are big enough. but when we arrive, they were over booked so we had to get another room, then change again the day after. they say the manager will give us a discount for that inconvenience, but it never happened: the manager was never there. the bathroom wasn't that clean. the rooms have heating, which is great during winter.
fantastic place for international students to stay at when in la! great atmosphere and chill crowd. friendly staff and good amenities!

my travel buddy and i enjoyed our stay at banana bungalow. we stayed in a private room, and found that it suited our needs perfectly. i was larger than i expected, clean, and comfortable. it seemed as though the management understands their clientele fairly well and does their best to provide a decent experience for everyone. from the laid-back staff to the readily available amenities i felt like banana bungalow is a great find for any young person hoping to explore l.a.
would be a rad place to stay minus the cockroaches in the bathroom. staff very friendly and accommodating. location is just touching out the outskirts of dodgy but building very secure.

great location but extremely noisy if the hostel has an event on which is annoying when you have early morning commitments. lots of free transport although we had to wait over 45mins for a shuttle bus to the griffiths observatory we ended up getting an uber instead - so don't fully rely on them to be on time but can't really complain for a free service. the common area is a car park which is a bit pointless in the winter.
value for money!  good location  friendly staff.

all staffs are very kind and location is pretty good as well. but this hostel has a party at night, so it is a little noisy. it is a good hostel for sure as long as you dont mind noisy outside at night

i didn’t stay here for long & i was jet lagged so i didn’t get involved in the group activities. the staff seemed friendly, the breakfast was good & it was clean. as a female solo traveller, i didn’t feel safe going out on my own in the dark. the location is ok but there’s a lot of homeless people around at night & people with mental health issues (not that i’m judging - just for personal safety & the stories i heard). overall, it was good.
very good, parking and breakfast included. though a bit expensive and sometimes a bit too noisy

overall a decent stay. right on hollywood boulevard, staff were friendly and they had cheap dinner nights and yummy included breakfast. overall atmosphere was a bit off for me, and i probably wouldn't stay again.

its a bit shady but that's part of the whole vibe, i guess. its on hollywood boulevard at the center of all the action. hostel activities are good and covers things to do in hollywood and la. i had fun there so i would recommend it.

we had a pretty good stay at banana bungalow, it was in a brilliant location. you could walk five minutes down the road and be at the metro station, making it easy to get to different locations in the los angeles area. the evening activities were fantastic. for example the first night we were there we paid $15 each for all you could eat lasagne, unlimited drinks and free club entry! however on the other hand if you want a quiet night these activities can be quite annoying, they're very loud.

this is a party hostel - don't stay here if you want quiet evenings. nobody showed me around and i was sent to a full room of people upon arrival because the records were wrong. i had no blanket  for the first night and the staff did not seem concerned. i was told to hurry back the next day at 2pm because the blankets go quickly. when went to the computer room someone was sleeping in it. better security organization and "caring" from the staff would help. a communal backup washroom would be nice

excellent staff! everyone was very friendly. each room has it's own bathroom but the bathrooms kind've suck. it takes forever to get hot water (although it was the same at another hostel so i'm not sure if it's an la thing.) decent breakfast. the pillows and bedding are the worst of any hostel i've ever visited....they're that bad! they have great deals on meals/drinks/club.    location is right off the walk of fame (or whatever that sidewalk is called).

i had an amazing time staying the hostel! i met some of the interesting and cool people i've ever met anywhere! the hostel also offers all kinds of cool free stuff like comedy nights, parties and trips. the location was great as it was close to a lot of touristic sites. the staff were very chill and friendly and everything was perfectly clean. it was simply an amazingly chill place to stay!

it is not too far from hollywood/vine station. just bit cold at night. ask for more blanket. i saw a cockroach in the kitchen.. the breakfast wasn't good. overall was ok if u wanted to save some money

this hostel was fantastic.  it is on hollywood blvd (from the street, you can see the hollywood sign) about a 10-minute walk from the museums and theaters.  i had stayed at the lax hostel (adventurer/backpackpackers paradise) and santa monica hostels and banana bungalow was in the middle price-wise.  it was clean and secure but maintained a laid-back party vibe.  the staff were kind and helpful with my changing itinerary.  best hostel in hollywood

vegan friendly breakfast!  positive: en suite kitchen w fridge, stove, plates, and table area. en suite bathroom. hostel provides many fun & free/cheap activities. i felt like i was at a resort with all of the activities, and the friendly staff. fire in outside communal area.  if you don't want to party there are many of quiet spaces to relax, play pool, internet rooms.  location is accessible to buses, subway, lax shuttle (flyaway)  negative: metal bunk beds. bath in room 219 drained slowly.

great place to stay. very clean. each room has its own kitchen complete with fridge and microwave. only problem i had was surly staff member on the sunday morning. wouldn't smile. didn't want to help. all of the others were fantastic. free tea and coffee all day. wifi good

the hostel is close to the hollywood blvd, which is really nice. also the staff was ok but when we arrived around 5am in the morning, the man didn't really help us to get a room or anything. this was so annoying because it was cold and too early to do anything. after we got a room around 10am after asking another guy we shared one bed for two hours to take a nap. but unfortunately it was freezing in the room even if there is a heater.

very nice staff. great atmosphere and great location. the rooms are great with a kitchen and a bathroom and they have a pool table, basketball hoop and more. they really encourage socialisation. good breakfast.

a good atmosphere at this place ,  lots of things organised by the staff, and is a good location for the hollywood area. the only thing i didn't like was the darkness of the place , poor lighting in the outside common areas and the wifi didn't stretch to the rooms
i had a great time here! made some friends and had an awesome night in la. the staff are great and friendly, the atmosphere is great and i would definitely recommend it!
banana bungalow was a great time. they have activities planned every day and night, with great shuttle options and tons of free food and open bars. highly recommended!
above all, every staff was amazing!!!!
great place to stay in hollywood area.

good hostel.  location was a bit far away, but most backpackers usually are.   good for what it was.  free rides to universal / disney much appreciated, and free breakfast in the morning was a delight!
really cool place in decent spot along the boulevard. great facilities with nightly activities.. really easy to meet ppl as a single travellor. will def  stay again when in la

recently stayed here for 5 days. it was in a low season area and there weren't a lot of people until the last night i was there. but the staff are terrific, tom cooks gordon ramsey-esque tasting dinners every couple of nights. there is nothing bad to say about this place.
vanja on reception was perfect. tell him my "spasibo"  next year we shall come again.

we stayed here during thanksgiving and probably that was the reason why it was relatively expensive but still much more affordable than any hotel around. the private room was spacious, the bathroom clean, only the (private) kitchen could need some "update". the hostel was busy, many young people around and there were loud activities in the evening (bar, karaoke, etc.) but that's what i expected from a hostel, ha ha. staff was very friendly and helpful, the location perfect.

i had a great time at the banana bungalow hollywood. it was nice and i could go there another time. the only problem i had was the parking because it was full all the time. the parking lots at hollywood seems to run only till 2am... to overnight i could not find any. great location, nice staff. the breakfast was good but i prefer to use the  kitchen in the room that i stayed.
terrific!
great with fun and breakfast included in the morning!

my girlfriend and i stayed in a private room with a little kitchen that was nice. the water pressure in the shower was super low so we ended up using the bowl a bath method. other than that the hostel was accommodating. no a/c so thankfully we were in la when it was cool out. very open courtyard conducive for meeting people. close to everything.

when i first arrived the lady at the counter was rude and insisted to  charge us extra and told us we would have to speak to a manager at a later time.   which we did, and she was lovely as were all the other staff.   i was with two other girls and we stayed in a private dorm. awesome, large room.   ara, boogie and nial were awesome at getting everyone's vibes up! 100% recommend this hostel.

there was a great atmosphere in this hostel, everyone was really friendly including staff. it was a great place to meet other travellers. the only thing i would say is that the place is a bit tired looking. it could do with a bit of a makeover. also it would have been nice to get a proper duvet at night instead of just a sheet.

it is a good hostel, staff friendly and the rooms are ok. the lockers on the rooms can be improved because some are bigger than other and this causes guests to leave the clothes on the floor.    the tours and transportation facilities are great as los angeles is quite big.
love this place, second time staying here, love the basketball hoop

really cool set up with heaps of places to chill.  i was only there during the week and it's a pretty quiet location not really too close to the nightlife but if you want a good night be there wednesday.  i'd definitely stay here again
fantastic location. free breakfast, vending machines, tour options.  dorm rooms are quite small.  not the most comfortable bed. no amex cards accepted.

such an awesome place to stay! has a really nice vibe during the day and in the evenings. all the staff are super friendly and are always organising events in the evenings which is great for meeting new people! the rooms are clean and tidy and even have their own little kitchen! highly recommended!!

friendly stuff, rooms were ok - clean but older, breakfast was really simple (too simple, even for a hostel), free use of the storage room and facilities (shower etc.) before and after check in and check out.

i am giving this a straight 10 of 10. this was one of the best times of my life!  i came to this hostel, right after staying at a nice hotel in las vegas. the banana bungalow hollywood blows any "fancy hotel" in vegas out of the water! the staff is friendly, the atmosphere is great, my god: the night program is unbeatable! stretch limousine to a downtown club, with a stopover at another banana hostel - including drinks and snacks! best breakfast ever (including nutella!). great people! love you!
great atmosphere here, met a ton of great people at the events the hostel out on! i’d stay here again.
i would stay again.

stayed in a 6 bed mixed, breakfast was nice, lots going on in the hostel. lots of free activities, karaoke night with free drinks was good. if your looking for a hostel that includes a good atmosphere, friendly staff and a lot to do it's great. fab view of the hollywood sign from our room. kitchen with fridge and microwave which was good. secure parking was ideal as we were driving. would stay again.

great location, office is 24 hours, staff is friendly. there are activities daily with free rides to the beach, lunches, comedy events etc. location is right on hollywood blvd. 5 mins to the walk of fame, chinese theater etc. hollywood & vine subway stop to downtown is just a few minutes walk. right next to the 101. i wouldnt stay anywhere else when i go to hollywood.     most importantly, ive made lasting friendships, and had memorable times. thanks for everything, i will definatley be back.

great location! super friendly staff. we only stayed one night but loved that they had so many organised activities everyday & cheap $5 meals on offer. cool little chill out area/garden. rooms have ensuite & small kitchen with dining room, fridge, microwave, stove top etc. awesome!  only complaint was it's a bit noisy with road traffic & beds are very squeaky but you just need good ear plugs. would definitely stay again.
one of the best hostels i've stayed at, great atmosphere, fun staff, always something happening. the rooms were nice, free breakfast was good, highly recommended.
nice hostel, great location, friendly, helpful staff.

banana bungalow was a nice hostel. my friend and i had a private room and were very impressed with the cleanliness of the room and the shower. free tea/coffee, cereal and toast for breakfast. the $5 spaghetti on monday night is awesome! only a 5min walk from the train, and a 15-20 min stroll to the walk of fame, dalby theatre etc.. 2 stations away from universal studios. overall very happy with banana bungalow. would stay again
nice vibe. lovely breakfast. clean bathroom, only the bath was not emptying quickly, which was kind of disgusting... they use plastic cutlery and cups, not good for the environment!
