perfect location for santa monica and venice beach and shopping/restaurants etc. easy access to hollywood also. really spacious rooms and great facilities. friendly staff and other people staying at the hostel. the only thing i thought was odd was the individually wrapped slices of bread at breakfast, coming from an environmental view! just a thought, otherwise loved it!
one of the best socially prone hostels around. and alot of activities in a top location

this is an excellent hostel. great location and feels very safe and secure. the staff were fantastic and really good at providing public transport directions! beds are comfortable, rooms are clean and the bathrooms are decent. highly recommend!

a great, clean hostel, comfortable beds, and friendly staff. only down side is no drinking or no bar in the hostel, which made it a little harder to meet people and kick off epic nights however the location of the hostel is next to some excellent bars and clubs so it was pretty easy.     would definitely reccomend and would stay here again.

the hostel was clean, affordable and located in a central part of santa monica. it was exactly what you expect, not overly nice but definitely acceptable as a place to crash and hang out between activities.

this was one of my favourite hostels throughout my usa trip. awesome facilities, clean, good rooms and perfect location. the staff really let this place down - they're reluctant to be helpful and seemed so uninterested in their jobs. i felt like everything was a huge effort for them. apart from that, i would recommend staying here.

nice hostel in a good location. the staff could be friendlier and perhaps explain things about the hostel rather than just hand you a sheet and say your room number is on there. leaving you to figure out what floor and where it is.  the breakfast in the morning is a bit lacking. each slice of bread is individually sealed in plastic which is just wasteful, the apples are prepackaged slices rather than just having apples left out which again is very wasteful. otherwise no complaints.
great stay and lovely staff. it was almost like a hotel, everything was brand new! definitely get what you pay for!
solid hostel right in the heart of santa monica, not much of a social hostel if you're looking to party this isn't for you.
great hostel a little bit expensive but has everything you could need, staff friendly and helpful.

great place to spend a night...met some brazilian fellows who were traveling california & had lots of interesting stories to share..i felt very comfortable with them & slept very well...the location is perfect...close to everything. ..pareked at the civic center & was at the getty villa in 15 minutes. .even with traffic. ..was in downtown la in 20...the great location of the hostel really made my visit very easy, hassle free, & enjoyable....recommend highly..
24hr desk, central, good facilities. only complaint is the bathrooms are a bit basic but they are spotless.
lovely staff, had everything you need, felt safe and comfortable beds :)
great atmosphere, convenient location and i felt very safe staying here!

best location, easy to meet people, kitchen set up is amazing! don't worry about the no alcohol rule, if you're subtle about it you're sweet.  don't bother with club tour it's very average. go to bungalow bar!
excellent hostel!! right by the beach and the shops. very big, lots of space and many rooms so great atmosphere. had a lovely stay!

a hostel in a fantastic location to access santa monica as well as venice beach. the travel store next door made booking activities so easy and there is a cheap shuttle to the airport at the end of the street. the bathrooms were the only thing i would say were average as they weren&#39;t always that clean. otherwise this place is great!
very expensive but good location and its very clean and organised which is nice!

had a great stay at this hostel, the only problem was the showers: the one in our room was boiling hot (no way to change the temperature), and the one from the restrooms in the hallway was not great either. i could take a shower but the water was still really hot. i hope they will fix this issue, aside from that, i'm really glad i stayed here!

great location, but that&#39;s where the positives end. our group of australian guys in our 20s have hostel hopped around the world and know what makes a good hostel experience. the atmosphere is the key. there was a complete alcohol ban which should be clearly disclosed prior to booking! lastly, someone needs to tell the staff to smile once in a while and the maids to stop barging into our rooms without our permission. not to mention stealing our belongings.

as a single female traveler i was mostly concerned about my safety. it&#39;s a safe place just 2 blocks from the beach.   pluses - it&#39;s clean safe there is a wifi and a complimentary breakfast.    minuses - they could organize more attractions in the evening. pub  crawl is good one  the stuff is ok but not super welcoming.  plus depends who do u have in the room my roommate has been snoring too much so you need to have earplugs  overall very good experience plus i recommend it
loved my stay here.  the pub crawl was a nice free extra.  i don&#39;t give out many perfect 10&#39;s, but this place earned it.  i&#39;ll be back!

this hostel is located in the perfect spot. it is a block from the beach/peir and a block from the train station that can take you any where from disneyland to hollywood to universal studios. the staff is so friendly and helpful. the kind of people that stay there that i came across were so friendly, nice and all so culturally different! definitely would stay again!

clean place with lockers and bathrooms in the dorm rooms. also had extra showers on each floor. nice free breakfast that includes milk and juice with food. great location, but they don&#39;t allow alcohol inside (got to keep it discreet or drink out front). easy walk to pier, beach, and bars/restaurants. the hostel also organizes activities. the new rail station to downtown is only a few blocks and a bikeshare station is in front of the hostel.

the best hostel location in la!    it&#39;s five minutes from the beach in beautiful downtown santa monica. they have an amazing friday night club crawl and the facility was top notch. far from hollywood, so be prepared for a long car ride if you&#39;re trying to go party. my friend and i had to agree, this was the best hostel we&#39;ve ever been to.
great location!

my stay at the santa monica hostel was very nice and the facility was clean and comfortable. the location is great only few blocks from the beach and only a block off the prominade. there is a bike rental stand directly across the street from the hostel which is very convenient. the staff was professional and courteous. best of all i met some friends from other coutries that are simply wonderful.    thank you,  bob

hugely docking marks for having individually wrapped slices of bread (??) at breakfast with no recycling for the packaging. direct to l.a landfill. awful and outdated. sort it out.     this hostel is in the idyllic part of santa monica. l.a can be a bit dodgy, but this hostel is in a nice secure location about three minutes from the beautiful beach and santa monica pier. attentive staff, perfectly pleasant and professional. showers were not worth the money spent.  cold. no temperature control.

the hostsl is clean and in a good location. the only thing we dindn&#39;t liked was that the showers were not really adjustable and were sometimes cold and hot even you haven&#39;t done something! and all of these, we tried the showers on differenz flors! and the hostel staff told us the wrong bus number to the airport!!! but the rest was really good!
the facility there is really really good!
really goid pkaces, stuff could be more willing to support sightseeing geeks andmost of all these uncleand showers and restrooms. also my roommates were not friendly and didn&#39;t want to chat.

it&#39;s a fine place to stay, especially for the area. i thought the rooms were kind of bad, because the beds were small. i&#39;ve had hostels in asia with longer beds (i&#39;m only 6 feet tall). i also don&#39;t like the atmosphere, boring.

superb hostel! beds are really comfortable, the beach is one block away, one block away from third st. organised a great pub crawl.   only bad thing is that the water temperature in some of the showers fluctuates slightly.
good but pricey. like everything in la also no drinking in the hostel results in no atmosphere. but you can just drink in your room if you get good roommates.

i stayed an entire week in hi santa monica.the hostel is in perfect location,one street away from 3rd st promenade and one street away from the beach.the hostel itself provides everything you need-rooms are ok,clean every day,lockers are pretty big,regular carry-on fits in,you just need to get your lock.thumbs up for the light and power socket above every bed.bathrooms and showers are clean,good lightning in there too.everyday breakfast,24/7 kitchen access,outdoor patio and couches to chill.
awesome experience for santa monica! my friends that live there were blown away

a huge building - reminds me of a hospital with long hallways with an endless number of rooms. staff is only available at the reception, they don't hang out elsewhere. common rooms to hang out in, tv didn't work. location is excellent right in downtown santa monica close to all shops and restaurants. as an area very nice and safe.
this is a very nice hostel in a perfect location, right near the beach in santa monica.
place is chill.  beverly hills adjacent and all that goes with it near the ocean.  it&#39;s why everyone wants to live in california.    dp
fairly comfortable. so close to everything i wanted to do in california. the breakfast left much to be desired, but other than that i can&#39;t think of much i would change.
the hostel is very good. the only problem is that it has so many common areas that there is less socialising than in other hostels with one common area.

for me the best part of a hostel experience is meeting other travellers.  this hostel (while clean and conveniently located) does not really facilitate the kind of interaction that i was hoping for with other travellers.  i had just come from banana bungalow on hollywood boulevard where i meet loads of people and had a really great time and i actually regret not staying there and visiting santa monica for a day.  santa monica generally lacks character and doesn&#39;t need more than a day trip...

brilliant location on 2nd street. friendly, helpful staff and lots of great facilities including a decent free breakfast. four bed dorms have a double wardrobe each for a locker! spotless kitchen and we'll organised (and clean) fridges. very clean bathrooms - my only gripe was that the showers were cold and that appeared to be normal.

solid hostel, good location in santa monica, convenient to shopping and the pier and near bus routes to airport or downtown. had fun on the pub crawl and there were some other activities that looked fun as well.
great area!

the hostel is in a perfect location and is incredibly cheap for what you get. the facilities are great, breakfast is nice and we were even lucky enough to stay on a night of the pub crawl which was great fun. i would definitely go back to stay here in the future.

showers on 4th floor were scorching hot. actual skin burn type temperature. everyone else in my room experienced same thing. i went just after peak bathroom time once and it was still ridiculously hot. when i spoke to front desk, i got a pretty sassy response of &#39;go to level 3&#39;. i&#39;m not really keen on running around a hostel trying to find a good shower... not good enough for how much we pay!

santa monica is a really lovely part of la - much nicer than downtown so this was a great choice for accomodation. breadfast was good and the dorm rooms weren&#39;t too crampt. communal showers weren&#39;t too private but otherwise great hostel.
staff were helpful. in a prime location. good if you want a quiet break
they gave me an early check-in, which was a god send after flying from australia! super chilled atmosphere and unbeatable location!
i would definitely stay here again or recommend to a friend.

i cannot think of anything bad about this place. maybe the rooms are a bit too large? maybe the kitchen a bit too nice? the only real downside was its distance from the closest supermarket so you&#39;re kind of forced to go all in or not at all.

loved my stay here. rooms were spacious and i love that every bunk has a personal lamp and outlet. lockers are big. breakfast is continental but generous. the hostel is always organising tours/outings too which is great to meet the other travellers
really nice place, well located right next to the beach. good facilities.

really friendly staff. free breakfast of cornflakes, coffee, bread/toast with butter/jam, apple and an unopened bottle of orange juice. i&#39;d take my oj away and drink it later continuously topping it up from the water fountains all other the place. free orange juice all day, admittedly getting weaker!  marked down for: facilities - iron but no ironing board! security - homeless people would come into lobby & outside areas and try to mix with guests, however security cameras are everywhere.
it was really worth the cost, the only thing that was annoying was the construction noise, but it was very min.
great location. right near places to shop and very close to the pier. easy to find from lax. would stay again if i were to return to santa monica.

i loved the location and the hostel, for the price there should be more variety at breakfast. a huge bummer for my friend an i was when we got to our room on the second night, someone was in my friends bed and had broken the lock on her locker. we were lucky nothing was stolen but i found that to be unacceptable. staff members did reassign to another room for the night, we were thankful for that.
amazing place! gracious staff & the planned events are awesome!
i loved my stay here! from the comedy show, to the discounted bike rental, there was plenty to do at a great deal, and the location couldn&#39;t be any better!

the location is awesome! everything was fine.   except that we booked 2 beds in a 10bed female dorm and we had the choices to get separated or sleep in a men&#39;s dorm (but then together). since one of us was underage we couldn&#39;t be seperated. we had to take the men&#39;s dorm. next time i would prefer to get what i booked. but we were to tired to argue when we arrived.

perfect location, only two blocks from the beach and in the centre of shops and restaurants.     room was good, if not a little hot. there is a fan but it didn&#39;t really cool the room down much.     i found that it wasn&#39;t a very social hostel but has a nice seating area downstairs.     shared bathrooms are adequate and have hair dryers but the water is either too hot or too cold depending on how many other people are showering, and you can&#39;t change this.

never stayed at a hostel until this trip to the usa and this was my second and was extremly good. very clean, great location in the city and seemed very secure, i would highly recommend it for anyone of any age to stay in.
great location-right in the heart of santa monica and just in between 3rd street promenade and the beach. lovely and clean all round, however a slim choice for breakfast was a bit of a let down.

overall, i enjoyed my stay.  the facilities themselves were impressive. loved the location and its proximity to shopping and the beach.  the only drawback was the front desk staff. they were cold for the most part and absolutely expressionless.  i even greeted them with a smile and tried to initiate a friendly interaction but they really didn&#39;t reciprocate (the graveyard lady seemed nice though. being warm with guests can greatly impact there impression of a place. that was my only negative.
i made so many friends, such a cool atmosphere in an amazing location. loved it

good hostel, easily accessible from airport on public transport. on santa monica beach which isn't the nicest beach in la and a good 40 min drive, 1-5hr bus from hollywood or staples centre. great security with key cards and good basic breakfast in the morning.
i had a great stay and the staff is great!... right in the middle of the action in santa monica. easy to get to beverly hills or hollywood.

hi los angeles in santa monica was superb! travelers there ranged in ages and were all very friendly. as far as accommodations, the beds were comfy enough - especially for a hostel. the in-room lockers for your belongings were very large and i was able to fit a carryon suitcase as well as a purse and laptop bag. don&#39;t forget your locks, but if you do they sell them at the counter for $5 usd. the location is amazing. tons of bars and restaurants nearby. i would definitely stay there again!!

besides majority of the hostel being renovated or closed, i had a good stay at this hostel. great location but price could&#39;ve been better. i&#39;m also glad they offered breakfast. simple, yet just what one needs to start their day,
great location, gutted i had awful weather cos it was perfect for the beach and 3rd street promenade!

great location, clean enough, blisteringly hot showers, wifi drops in and out, not particularly social, staff don&#39;t know the bus routes. good overall but just extortionately expensive for what you get in my opinion.
construction was going on at the time so all of the facilities were closed. the bathrooms were mostly out of order as well.

a ton of people staying here including, what appeared to be, a kids soccer team. there were many children here which i found strange for a hostel. other than that, they had some organized events which were ok. staff was very nice and helpful

very well positioned near the beach and in a lovely area. didn't seem very easy to meet people as the common areas were quite quiet and there was not much encouragement to participate in activities. but all round great place to stay to enjoy santa monica with clean comfy and safe facilities. would recommend
no booze allowed  broken pool table no privacy in rooms   liked the separate shower, toilet sink area  liked the outside court yard loved the location  loved the pub crawl  huge kitchen

hmm, this was the second time around i stayed here. the first time- i loved it, great location, great atmosphere, good facilities. unfortunately this time somehow i woke up with a tick on my leg. it wasn&#39;t the greatest surprise to have:/

amazing hostel. i met some awesome people here in the social area and they organized some awesome activities and events for us. the hostel itself was beautiful and very clean. there was construction happening but it didn't affect my stay at all. also exactly central to all things touristy in santa monica and an easy walk or bike ride to venice

great place to stay. the location is ideal for santa monica beach and also easy to rent a bike if u want to cycle on down to venice beach. also the hostel is right beside the shopping area. great place, would stay again.
great location, only 1 block to the beach. they have activities on if your travelling alone so it&#39;s easy to meet people and just an overall good place to stay :)
the hostel in nice and clean.  not a typical party hostel, not much socializing, but they have pub crawls, etc.
relatively clean and well placed hostel. complete lack of atmosphere and no alcohol allowed at all.

this place is huge and pretty basic - so it&#39;s a bit on the pricey side for what you get - there are nicer, cheaper hostels in la tbh. it&#39;s kind of a barn, a bit impersonal, and the bathrooms, though cleaned regularly, were a little yucky - mostly because a lot of the clientele seemed to be very young and not all that adept at cleaning up after themselves. still, it&#39;s in a good location, very safe, warm, convenient etc.

didn&#39;t get to stay long, but staff were friendly and helpful. the bathrooms were a little dirty, but i did arrive at 11pm. the location was ideal for exploring the area.  easy, cheap shuttle from lax to get you to the hostel. and a direct bus 2mins walk away straight down to union station.
great hostel in great location. good facilities. not a party place.

overall i was very happy with hi santa monica! the location was great, the room was huge, the showers were clean and hot and the beds were quite comfortable. what more do you need! the wifi was a little on the slow and unreliable side and for some reason the hostel was very quiet when i was there so the vibe wasn&#39;t as social as i was expecting but otherwise it was great and i&#39;d recommend it to anyone travelling to santa monica.

a typical hi hostel. amazing location, very basic rooms with lockers, simple breakfast (bread, jam, cereals, tea/coffee, orange juice), bathrooms are a bit older but mostly clean, washing machines were defect. free wifi worked well most of the times, but from time to time got pretty slow. all in all it was a good stay. if you're more interested in a great location rather than fancy rooms, than this is the place to stay.  fyi, wait for shuttle bus from lax is about 30 to 40 minutes.
great hostel 2 blocks from the beach, very clean with key code access for security. girls at the front desk were great and printed our boarding passes for us.

loved staying here! will definitely be back, the location is perfect, close to the beach and the promenade. the staff at the front desk are very helpful and will go out of their way to make sure you&#39;re happy.   i just wish the washing machines were in use (also there was no noise from the renovations)    one of the only negative things i have to say is that the common room could use a little tidy up, but other than that everything is kept pretty clean   thank you hi los angeles - santa monica!!
great location, friendly and helpful staff, good breakfast. the perfect spot to stay in santa monica!

this hostel is great and they try really hard to improve the atmosphere of the hostel by running all sorts of events each night of the week. dispite this i still found this was some what lacking due to the other travelers. rooms were good and clean as too were the showers. i've read some reviews about the showers being cold; i didn't find this to be the case at all.

staff was amazing! location is by everything! also had great events.. really recommend if you&#39;re there friday night to do the limo party downtown hollywood. would go back in a heart beat i loved it so much!!

hostel is in a great location, safe neighborhood, within walking distance of everything you could need (including the beach and pier). could of been a little bit cleaner but it wasn&#39;t disgusting. would definitely stay there again! :)
can&#39;t reccomend it enough. perfect location, clean, safe, lovely staff. very enjoyable stay overall.
great hostel but it&#39;s the reception staff and there above standard efforts that will make me come back!!

great location but still can&#39;t get over the price  - stayed here because theres no better option for the price but come on - i guess can&#39;t win em all .. people didn&#39;t really seem like talking in my room of 6 but i never made it to any of the common areas, maybe its different there
weird no alcohol rule but other than that the hostel was amazing! go to the parking lot across the street for a great view of the city for free!
same breakfast everyday -_- but its free so yeah....

this was the first time that i stayed in a hostel of any kind. i purchased a membership and getting ready to book my next trip today.....two blocks from the ocean in santa monica, who knew.  it was great.
didn't spend much time there but location was excellent and hostel seemed really cool

no complaints, i mean you guys have a fireplace. i once saw one of those when i was kid peeking through rich peoples homes and the showers were kinda cold but with the drought i bet your saving a lot of water. i see what you did there.

i was initially only planning on staying 3 nights here but ended up staying 11 because i loved it here so much! great atmosphere, great for meeting people, spacious rooms and prime location, thank you so much guys !!

this hostel is awesome! maybe the best hostel i ever stayed in. staff is super friendly and helpful. big kitchen,  pool billard,  fireplace and lots of chilled areas to hang out. the is close during the day and pub crawl is fun at night.

i stayed just one day at this hostel. nice one. but it does not have that atmosphere i´ve seen in other. maybe because it´s too big, seens like a hotel. i just didn´t like the shower (you can´t control the temperature, and it was quite cold, so i wish the shower were warmer). considering there isn´t hostels in that region, i recommend this hostel for those who wants to be near the pier and the beach in santa monica.

santa monica is really beautiful! there's also an amusement park there, just beside the sea!!! the sunshine is amazing, and it's just 3minutes' walk from the hostel! the 10-bed dorm is quiet and the breakfast is quite nutritious hhh the big blue bus is convenient to connect santa monica with downtown la, but remember: never go to downtown when it gets dark.

location is fantastic for this place and staff is very helpful with questions. beds are very uncomfortable and rooms were unbearably hot at night, but you get what you pay for. overall definitely worth the money to stay here. i recommend!
wifi worked perfectly all through the hostel, the staff were super helpful when asked questions, the place was super clean and in general just an awesome place to stay! thank you!

perfect location for santa monica. all the standard facilities for your hi hostels. activities daily. laundry unavailable at the moment due to refurbishment is the only thing i can fault. good base for la
need to finish the tv room and roof. good luck with the construction works!
great. shame that some facilities were not available due to refurbishments but i don't think it's fair to hold that against an enxcellent hostel.  hi's are some of the best hostels around!

localization is great. just be aware of taxes in santa monica: 14%. employees at the front desk were confused. it seemed they didn't know how reservations using hostelworld worked, so they wanted to charge us more, despite of the money we had already paid online. but the hostel has good vibe.

to be fair, the hostel was going through some renovations when i was there, they didn't disturb me but i was very bummed there was no laundry facilities available. this is the only hostel i have ever stayed in where they give you 2 pillows, which was nice. the hostel was good and i would stay again. the shuttle back to the airport is dumb. i booked it, it never showed up, and the hostel did not return my $2 booking fee and called me a taxi. i was not impressed by that.
the room was stuffy & stinky. the heat was way too high. good breakfast but the same everyday so by day 4 it's not appealing.

i loved this place. they were really kind to let me do an early check in for no charge, i'm very thankful about that 'cause i was exhausted.  the place is shiny and clean, spacious, well lighted, breakfast was good, the kitchen is excellent, the common areas are comfortable. great location, just a quick walk from the beach and the santa monica pier, and many bus stops. it's a very safe neighborhood and full of life. i'm coming back!!
everything is great and i enjoyed my stay very much:)
i'll just state the cons, wifi is very very slow,there is no hot water , sometimes the toilet is dirty.

everything you need. two minute walk to the pier and the beach and ten minutes to really great shops and restaurants and also a big supermarket. staff lovely. lots of construction going on when i was there so didn't experience outdoor area/tv room or laundry so can't rate! nice free breakfast and fast free wifi. really like the lounge area with the open fire too. small dorms are just right and beds really comfy. kitchen also really good. travel place next door good for booking trips.
amazing location and everything!!!
excellent location. absolutely perfect for what you want, 2 minute walk from the beach and the shops!
found a bunch of local residents dancing salsa in the streets just a couple blocks north of the hostel - great atmosphere and experience!
it's a great hostel but their wifi is really bad. it don't work!!!

the location is very good and the staff are helpful too. the room is clean and the kitchen is big. the only problem is that they don't provide a friendly talking area so most time i stay there alone. that's kind of boring to me.
have a savory option for breakfast

great location! friendly staff and excellent security.  wonderful to meet people from around the world! too bad the renovations were still ongoing during my stay.  maybe, next time i can use the tv and washer facility.  thank you!  ed from kansas city, mo
in comparison to other hostels its quite anonymous

we stayed at the hi hostel in santa monica for three nights. the room was cleaned every morning. the reception was located right where one entered to go to the common area and the rooms, which felt very safe. good breakfast. the staff did their best to help us with our questions. the hostel was being renovated during our stay, so many doors were open and there was a cold constant draft. the wifi was not very reliable but the staff helped us with one of our bookings.
met my expectations. everything was perfect except the outlet up on my bunk bed that will not charge due to socket was too loose but i will come back again. excellent free breakfast compliment.
great location and friendly staff.

great hostel, great location only two issues was that the wifi connection was not stable and in the evenings it was non-existent, water was not hot and as such one had to contend with tepid showers on a daily basis.

wow, this hostel sets a new standard in hostels.  the place felt like i was in a luxury hotel, with the fireplace lounge etc.  i'll definitely be back to use the clubtour and other services offered.  great time.  dp
nice hostel and nice people
great place. i've been in many others hostels but this one lkeit most. very friendly girls on a front desk create great atmosphere

pretty bad that no one told us that the hostel was under construction and that we would be woken up early by hammering. also no alcohol is let inside and most common rooms are closed so the atmosphere in the hostel sucked. it's relatively inexpensive but as a hostel it felt more like a hotel i was sharing with a bunch of random people. pretty lame and would not recommend as a lone traveller.
good place, brilliant location, but half the facilities closed including tv room and laundry!

there was renovations happening while i was staying, meaning no washing services at all (the best they could do was tell me to walk 25mins to a laundromat) and many common rooms were closed. also wish that i knew that the hostel was a dry hostel without a bar or even allowed to drink at all on premises. due to the renovations forget about sleeping past 9am after a big night, lots of loud banging and work being done. location is brilliant but some forewarning about the above would have been nice.
i had one of the best stays ever at a hostel. the only downer was the wifi was bog-slow.
wish i was warned about all the renovation going on during my stay.  also the daytime staff were not too friendly overall, but the night staff were great and helpful!
best hostel i've ever been
breakfast was not great  water in showers is not really warm
you are supposed to provide the washing machine

best hostel i have stayed in. friendly staff, loads organised to help you explore and meet new people. decent rooms with a personal light plus socket for each. breakfast was also decent.    location is perfect too - minutes from both the shops and beach!
this place is vast and like a super hostel. wouldn't say it's the best spot for solo travellers as can feel like you're rattling around the hallways. location is great and staff were always helpful.
great location but the hosts is huge so there isn't any hostel vibe to it. the breakfast is super boring but it's at least included.
overall this was a great stay. i had no issues and everything was really easy. location is especially excellent.

i was flying into long beach and i emailed the desk asking if they had any suggestions for getting there without a car. their reply was very abrasively suggesting that i google it myself. rude.     their wifi was spotty and their free breakfast was probably the worst i've seen from all the free breakfasts at hostels. their drains in showers didn't really work.     location is great though. and that's all that really matters.
awesome hostel! breakfast was cereal, apples,coffee, milk and juice. love my stay
great location!!! great staff!!! i will stay there any chance i get!!! i feel so fortunate to have discovered it!!!
we would definitely stay here again!

i would like to comment on the staff!  all the staff were absolutely amazing   they never hesitated to help with any enquires we had  the went above and beyond there call of duty to accommodate any needs or enquires we put past them! very friendly and understanding of my son who has autism! what can i say! well done to all involved! thanks for making our holiday a memorable time   kindest regards   rosie & josh

we had a great time at this hostel! loved the location - close to the beach and shopping. the breakfast was also great. the rooms were a little small though and not enough showers. would stay here again!

there were no wash cloths in the room; it would have been nice to have some in the shower room.  the people at the desk were very nice!  i especially appreciated the man who answered me very honestly about  safety walking late at night in relation to the homeless people.

the hostel is in a great location, the staff was very helpful to get our room and even put our party in a  4 dorm room that was very nice to inform us that there was still rooms ave label ;  and the staff was very nice and helpful  we came up to celebrate a b day and we had a very nice time and made great memories   thank you for all the hard work the hostel staff puts in every day  i do enjoy my stays with the hostels very much  thank you cemile
fantastic front of house staff, very welcoming and helpful when i had a question. location is amazing! just 2 blocks from santa monica beach!!
great location  wifi completely unusable, too slow, websites hardly load  bathrooms quite dirty and old.

over all, i enjoyed my stay.   but wifi was very poor!   and non of the computers were working, which made me nervous because you have to slide your credit card  to use the computer, which i btw find weird that you have to pay to use them.
this hostel is absolutely amazing, location is 100% i definitely recommend
staff were very approachable especially bevin. the wifi however was terrible

the place is great, excellent location and service, the stuff is really nice and helpful. you can go anywhere in santa monica by foot, or take a bus to any of the interesting places of la just around the corner. great value for money.
it was cool!
great location, nice rooms! overall good stay but by that hostel like, more hotel atmosphere!

good location very near to the beach and the pier. lots of places to eat and drink nearby. clean and tidy.    sadly, the wifi was slow to the point of utter uselessness and the 'free breakfast' was a tiny box of cereal, with optional slices of apple.    h.i. say they aim to help young people travel. which travelling young person can afford $50 per night for 10-person dorm? it costs a couple $100 per night ($600 per week) to stay in separate rooms. wouldn't recommend it to anybody. use airbnb.

the hostel needs to add a social event every night and throughout the days, i found the hostel was large but very antisocial.   and ive stayed at multiple hi hostels and out of about 10 of them this is the only one that dosnt have air conditioning! you desperately need it!!!!!
lack off ac makes the rooms hot and unbearable .. and the in the rooms are to skinny. you could just sleep without a madras
great hostel, only complaint would be no air con, was soooo humid which made it hard to sleep at night. loved the atmosphere and facilities were great and clean.
no a.c way to hot. only stayed 1 out of the 5 i was supposed to because there was no a.c. other than that good hostel.
they should install air condition

right next to the santa monica pier and wonderful, modern hostel. staff were super helpful as well; needed a taxi to lax at 5 in the morning and we told him at 4:50am as uber surged. the lounges were fantastic to chill in and the outside indoor piece was great.

staff weren't the best. although they were helpful when you asked for something they weren't particularly friendly compared to the other hi hostels i've been to on my trip. but nice facilities. they need aircon in the rooms though - it gets unbearably hot at night!
in general it is perfect to stay....a lot of possibilities to do! the only problem is the heat in the rooms- no ac which makes it hard to breath- but you will survive your stay thou!✌️😄
no a/c, can't sleep very well at night because of extreme heat.

great location and hostel was good. i feel as though there could be more activity nights and there should be drinking allowed in the room. would also prefer to have mixed dorms. all round good hostel but for 3x couples and the price we would stay elsewhere next time.
i only stayed for one night but i'm really glad that i did as this was one of the best hostals i stayed in through my trip to la.

a bit run down hostel in samta monica, only a couple of blocks from the beach and the pier. many dorms and floors, not easy to meet people if you're a solo traveller. santa monica is a great area with lots of stores, restaurants and entertainment at night. stay here!
best hostel ever!
best hostel ever!!!

excellent location between the beach and the boulevard for a reasonable price, and i would stay here again just for that fact (especially since i had no desire to head into downtown la), but i find hi hostels are much too sterile and lack atmosphere, and also usually too big which makes it hard to meet people. apart from that, no real issues and would still recommend people stay here.
awesome hostel thanks

the hostel is in the perfect location and  staff are very friendly and able to help with any questions. however the lack of air cinditoning leads to some very uncomfortable nights in warm weather. the fans  don't do much to cool the room down. it is only value for money if staying on your ownown and becase it is the only hostel in the city. unless the air conditoning is fixed or prices dropped this place is going to lose most its business to airbnb
perfect location with easy access to the city and beach. beds were comfortable and outdoor area was perfect for socializing or spending time alone. definitely recommend.

great time here, fantastic location, especially if you have a rental car - there is a parking lot across the road that does 24h parking for $14. inside the hostel, staff are friendly and helpful, the beds are good and clean - if not a bit small! linen provided is clean and plentiful. facilities are great throughout, lots of space to relax and enjoy yourself. really good free breakfast available, take advantage of this. the rooms need air conditioning though, it's unbearably hot    in the summer!

love the hostel, and have stayed there in previous travels as it has a fantastic atmosphere, good security and nice atmosphere.  the only things that i was disappointed with was:  1. temperature of room. uncomfortably hot 24hrs. there was a fan however it was fixated on one person and couldn't be changed. i estimate it was 38-40 degrees. much hotter than outside in the evenings!!!  2. breakfast 3 item limit.

it's a really nice place with a beautiful patio and good security! but the room is really hot because there was only one fan in the 8 bed room. would be nice if we had individual small fans in our personal bed area though! the location is excellent, no doubt about it.
was like staying in an oven ! no air con in the rooms !!!!!
couldn't have asked for more, thanks again! special kudos for the ability to print.

the location is unbeatable! it's not far to get to places and even venice seems to be pretty close. it's just a walk along the beach to get there. but i would rather recommend to stay in a hostel in venice than here if you're planning to connect with people. i was traveling on my own and it was way easier to connect in other hostels (venice included!). this hostel is more lika a large hotel where everyone stays anonymous.

pro's: friendly staff, clean kitchen facility, lounge facility, rooms to stays...     con's: water temperature for shower was slightly hot, second floor men's bathroom was humid, hot, steamy, no air ventilation..

i read all the reviews about the heat issue but decided to stay anyway, hi hostels are awesome (i've stayed in 3) but this location doesn't have ac in the rooms, and the wifi is slow, so these are the two things that let it down. huge hostel, free breakfast, location is fantastic (close to santa monica pier, shopping, restaurants, buses) they have multiple common areas, computers to use (small fee), the beds are comfy, so honestly guys, fix the heat problem & you will have a 5/5!

great location to the beach and the central area of santa monica including shops and night life. however we were there in september, which certainly isn't the hottest time in california, and the rooms were like a sauna. it was impossible to be in there for any more time than absolutely necessary and getting to sleep at night was a nightmare. we stayed there for 3 nights and if it were any longer i would have changed hostels. it was far too hot and ruined sleep for the next day.
great facilities not so great atmosphere. i'd say if you're travelling alone pick a different hostel if you're travelling with a group this is a great place.
only stayed one night. it was nice place to stay. i would come back, definitely. close to bars and entertainment. the area is extremely nice. clean, good breakfast, nice staff... ideal!
it was very hot in the rooms making it impossible to sleep

this is the third time i've stayed at this property, usually i love it, but ths time the heat in the room was just unbearable. one fan for a small room with 10 people and a shower in isn't good enough. such a shame because everything else was great! fab location!

i absolutely love this hostel.  have been in it a few times and is always great. is very big and spacious, the rooms and bathrooms are always clean and nice. the common area is super nice specially in a hot day, and the breakfast is good.  the location is perfect, 2 minutes walk to the 3rd promenade where the main restaurants and stores are, and less than 10 minutes to the santa monica pier and beach.  staff is always helpful and nice, and have met some great people.  would always come back!
great location. everything you need.
nice place to relax your sunburnt body
the location is very good as well as the breakfast.

i enjoyed my stay however sleeping at night became unbearable in the heady and the one fan did nothing. i would have liked more fans to make sleeping at night comfortable. in the women's bathroom on the 4th floor it would have been convenient to have cubicals or an area to get changed in private after taking a shower. the breakfast was great!
i really loved it here. close to the beach and nice staff . love the lockers to store all of my stuff in- they are huge and 5 bucks a day

pro's: clean dormitory, friendly and upbeat front desk staff, clean share communal kitchen, computer room, clean lounge area, clean bathroom within dormitory area, presentable linen arrangement on bedding area., decent breakfast, supermarkets/restaurants/cafés within walking distance and nearby, retail stores within nearby walking distance...     con's: my bag of groceries and along w/medication that had to refrigerated was stolen within 24 hours of my stay even though it was labeled w/my name

cold showers, no ac in the room, slow wifi, toilets that had overflown and stayed like that for longer then they should, also a cockaroach crawled across the couch one night while in the tv room while i was just trying to relax. it surprisingly wasn't the worsts hostel i have stayed at, but for the amount of money you end up spending you might as well split a hotel with some of your friends. at the very least i would find another hostel.
general ambiance: imagine a detox center.
good location. many activities. friendly staff.
very good facilities and great location but zero atmosphere.

everything was very clean, which is a top priority with me.  breakfast was very modest, so don't expect much.  but they didn't seem to limit the coffee.  nice places to relax with your electronic devices.

my room was pretty basic and there was no air con so the room was boiling however a friend was staying in another room which was huge and much cooler so not all the same. i've stayed here twice now as the location is just perfect. i would return again. good common areas, big kitchen all in all a good stay and would recommend
great location and cool chill out spaces. maybe make breakfast a little but more known

stayed in room 403 and overall nights get really hot up there. would recommend to stay on second level, but already the 3rd floor  is quite heated up. even with 2(!) fans on it was almost too hot to sleep.

i enjoyed my stay at the hi however... air conditioning should be added to each room. without this is was unbearable in my dorm with 7 other people. the fans should also be updated as our fan did not work correctly.
room was too hot, no cold showers
looks like a plush hotel from the outside. nice rooms and beds with good breakfast. staff competent in booking things for you but also seemed they wanted to be elsewhere half the time.
very convenient if you want to stay in the santa monica area, the rooms aren't too crowded, and awesome breakfast!
staff were very helpful. not the cheapest of places but the location made it an excellent overall choice for a few days stay in santa monica

i've stayed here before and had an excellent time. this time tho the room was unbearably hot. window open fan going. unbearable. i also think i was in an older section, not renovated. i've been in the newer, smaller dorm rooms. those are much better.
the showers aren't hot enough. the breakfast in perfect! also, there are not enough washing machine between 3pm to 11pm  since they are reserved for the staff.
great location, facilities and staff.  a little on the expensive side though for a hostel.

good location for going to the santa monica beach. good prize for a bed. this is an option esspecially if travelling alone, as in a regular hotel or for an ensuite room, you need to pay for the whole room, i.e. two beds etc.. the room and the bathroom/toilet were not clean (also because of poor useage by the residents). breakfast was included, but as it is often the case if you need something more than a coffee and a toast with grape jelly you need to eat out anyway.
amazing location, very safe environment. lots of public spaces and beautiful courtyard, nice breakfast. overall great experience, would recommend :)
staff were very friendly and helpful. public muliti story car park on the opposite side of the road so if your driving, this is the place to stay. it's 14 dollars for 24hr parking
this hostel was good, clean, well managed and fresh. it wasn't that great for meeting people but in all other respects nice.
perfect location, excellent staff and very clean!
the room and the restroom were very warm so it was hard to take a rest and put on an makeup. the light of the room was not that bright. the breakfast was not satisfying.
great location, rooms can get hot in peak of summer but the fans really helped.
this was my first hosteo experience ever. staying at this hostel has forever changed my opinion on hostels. loved it!! amazing, amazing, amazing!!!

pros   location excellent, very clean, staff approachable and friendly (with a smile) and the breakfast was good. i would of liked to have had access to boiling water for tea etc through the day and evening.     cons  the room was a too hot, atmosphere a little boring and the internet was way to slow for me to read my emails etc i was relying on the internet to be working to let my family know i arrived safe to los angeles. the prices are too expensive for a hostel.    regards,  leon

a nice hostel and probably the cheapest place to crash in gaslamp.  the atmosphere was pretty chill and i found it easier to mesh with other residents.    the front staff were super friendly and offered great advice and suggestions.

by the beach. definitely worth staying here for at least a night if you are on an adventure around la. definitely overpriced. they charge you extra when you arrive. it's in the small print so they aren't doing anything wrong legally but travellers are usually on a tight budget so it would be nice to be upfront about costs. the wifi doesn't work. the staff will tell you it's your device. go to the coffee bean on the street corner if you do need wifi. great walking tour provided.
a bit expensive but very well placed.

excelent location, 1 block from the beach and near to the 3rd street promenade, where you can find all types of shops. if you stay there, you don't need a car to enjoy santa monica beach and venice beach. sometimes, especially in the morning, the toillets were not that clean...

i stayed for 2 nights. one in 10 females dorm and the other night in 6 females dorm. the both rooms didn't feel small and in fact it was comfortable enough. after 10 pm,they have a policy that you have to try to be quiet for other guests. the place at night was quieter than any other hostels i have stayed before.  the staff members at the front desk were always nice and kind.  bathroom cleanliness could be improved,but you get what you paid for.  the location is awesome.
wifi is really bad

hi hostels are a good. the staff were helpful and kind. the location was perfect for me as i wanted to stay in a more beach like environment. venice beach and the most popular santa monica pier are right next to the hostel and if you want to travel further the blue bus line stops a block away. the only problems were the one of the landry dryers didn't work properly and i wasted two loads($2.00) and the sheets had stains that looked like blood spots but stain on sheets are expected at hostel
the ladies bathroom on 3rd floor had blocked toilets for 24 hours. the stench was so bad couldn't use it. beds are comfortable. large lockers provided.
wifi didn't work in the rooms or the building
breakfast milk was disgusting, sorry!
coming from australia new zealand this hostel feels more like a hotel, especially enjoyed the wifi and towel!
nicest hostel i've stated in and perfect location. only a five minute walk to everything. only downside is the rooms have no air conditioning and is brutally hot.
i had a great stay here. fantastic location and really good free breakfast! the room i stayed in had plenty of room and the bed was comfortable. would definitely recommend staying here.
great hostel!!!!

i really enjoyed my stay.  the location is perfect!  breakfast was good - nothing fancy but was perfectly fine.  the facilities were really great and i had everything i needed.  it was a good mix of ages staying here too which was nice. definitely recommend.
the 6 men dorm was small and really hot. there were two fans in the room but no ac.
very well kept in a location and promenade . wifi slowakei and unreliable
bad wifi; no air conditioner; always the same breakfast(but it is good( milk;cereal;fruit;yogurth;bread;cake)  people too cold.  the location is very good; although at la you will need a car.
great location and a great atmosphere. only downside was the rooms were quite hot as there was no air con.   definitely will be staying again :)

the hostel is really well located. next to the pier and 3rd street. as almost all hi hostels, it is not a party hostel.  the bathroom is big enough and always clean. the breakfast is good with toast, fruits and cereals.
it was a really nice hostel thank you so much
fantastic hostel in great location
i love this hostel, the location is great!
im only rating very poor for facilities due to the lack of air conditioning. rooms were like a sauna making it very uncomfortable to sleep.
really good hostel, but so expensive for what you get

the facilities and location were perfect for anyone touring la and the coast,  however there is no alcohol allowed in the hostel which really kills the atmosphere and makes it a far less social hostel than most.
great location, excellent activities, could use ac
very clean, but huge!  modern building, but unfortunately there's no atmosphere.  still had a good time. quite comfortable beds!
friendly staff, clean rooms/bathroom, great location. travel shop right next door, easy to book day tours.   great for 5 days or so.  cheers

great clean hostel, a bit more expensive than some but amazing breakfast and communal areas. not a great atmosphere as the hostel is so big, but if you want somewhere more chilled then this place is great

it's very close to the beach. i liked that. it's a bit pricy though like any other hostels in la. the thing that bothered me most was that i am not allowed to drink alcohol inside the hostel. i should have known that hi (hosteling international) hostels have no alcohol drinking allowed policy.
it should be advertised on the website that the hostel is alcohol free.   breakfast is excellent!

as a solo female traveller, this place was perfect. very clean and safe. the location is unreal! i think santa monica is the best place to stay is los angeles and i enjoyed my time here. i am returning on my next trip but with my boyfriend and would love to stay at this hostel but there's no private rooms or mixed rooms. thank you :)

great location close to the beach!  i was on the 4th floor and it was miserable hot up there. they had multiple fans in the room but it didn't help very much. it was difficult to sleep because it was so hot in the room.  other than that, great hostel. would definitely recommend it.
great location, a short walk to the pier and a few streets down from the main shopping area.
bathrooms need a serious update!
will be staying once a week on business, and i could't be happier with choosing hi.
in my opinion really good. good location and all that but still really expensive for a hostel.

staff was nice and helpful.  pretty good selection of events and entertainment.  location is very good - a few blocks to the beach, and in the middle of santa monica shops and restos.  downside to the central location is the noise. may depend on which side of the building you're on.  nice facilities, but not a ton of character -- a little sterile.  dorms were good, clean, nice lockers, bedside light and plugs.  bathroom facilities good and not crowded at all.  bike room was a nice bonus!
homeless people around, the room had bad smell (due to people staying in the same room). hostels in la in general are somehow expensive.
really nice. friendly staff

this is one of my favourite hostels i've ever stayed at. the staff go above and beyond to make you feel welcome and comfortable. really impressed me! it's very clean and spacious. tours and activities organised everyday. a number of common areas. really easy to meet fellow travellers. only down side is it's uptown, which isn't a particularly interesting part of town. however, all the pro's make it worth the train ride downtown.
ver nice hostal, awesome location
room and bathroom very clean. a little expensive, but the hostel is a corner away from santa monica beach and pier. staff very nice and helpful. good spot if you want to shop too!
good location,  and plenty of space in common areas.  only there for one night but the wednesday night pub crawl was a definite highlight in later.

very poor value for money. on arrival the staff were not very helpful.  for the money i would have expected a better breakfast where we were not limited to 2 food items and i would also expect that the majority of the poor selection of breakfast items would not run out prior to breakfast ending (this happened on 2 of the 3 days we stayed).  the showers whilst relatively clean practical. water went everywhere outside of the cubical and there was no private dry space to dress other than the toilet
amazing location and friendly staff. easy to get to the other locations in la because of easy public transportation. i definitely recommend this accommodation though the price is not cheap.

awesome place to stay! people are friendly, activity's are good, the receptionists are super friendly and helpful!    perfect location as well, only 5 mins from the pier and beach.    i will definitely stay here again!

a fantastic hostel. the location is literally perfect! la is so big that is almost impossible to stay in just one area of the city and still get to experience the city life/hills and tourism/the beaches and piers etc. so this hostel is perfect for those wanting to visit the beaches and famous pier. the neighbourhood is safe and secure and much classier than hollywood blvd hostels. great staff, clean rooms, easy access to transit. 5 star! definitely would recommend if visiting santa monica/la!!!
expensive have to pay extra $3 a night if your not a hi member so bear this in mind, noisy if your next to the street.
most of things are good. but what i am disappointed about is washroom. it was so small and kind of dirty. maybe it was just old. anyway i advice you that you renovate the washroom to make it bigger.

i stayed here just for one night since i was doing a roadtrip but i liked it a lt, it was clea and the atmosphere was nice. the wifi worked everywhere and i liked the plugs in the room even for the upper beds! the breakfast was also very nice.
big hostel that was very clean!!
a bit noisy with windows open, great location though, good breakfast.
cool hostel

nice, clean hostel. community restrooms don't allow much privacy, but we're always clean. large lockers for storage are a plus. the only issue i had was the housekeeper coming in to vacuum while i was asleep at 9am. i understand that quiet time is over at 8 but i thought she could have been a bit more tactful.

excellent location and friendly staff. this was my first time in a u.s. hostel so seemed pricey. same price gets me a beachfront hotel in costa rica or thailand :) however, very reasonable for the location. beach is 2 blocks. 3rd street promenade is 1 block away. great staff. great group hike. all ages. had a good time.

quite expensive for these mattress  at the second day they implemented a new breakfast policy which is ridiculous and doesn't reflect the price - you feel like a prisoner  building is nice and most of the equipment  room service should have separate laundry machine - had discussions about how many machines are currently in use by other guests
hidden charges incurred due to a backpackers is not a member of there associations, if you stay in this hotel will charge you additional cost.
was want to get a orange juice but the machine go to take the energy drink, i don't know what's going on. and shower is not so hot.    but cleanliness is really good.

found a lot of the electrical power points were very intermittent when trying to use a usb charger. perhaps with so much use, they are worn out and need replacing. apart from that, an excellent place to stay.

the location of this hostel is absolutely amazing. it is right in the middle of everything. there are a lot of great stores and places to eat and the area is very beautiful and exciting. the hostel itself was great. it was clean and the staff were very helpful and friendly. my friend and i had very nice roommates and we met a lot of great people at the hostel that we are still friends with today(a year later). we hope to visit again!
the staff at the front desk were very nice, but not very helpful with info. breakfast was excellent.

perfect location, just 2 blocks drom the beach and third street. the hostel is not à party hostel but there are many nice bars around it. i would advice people to join the free tours. they aren't that great but you will meet people! tip 2; check out 'the bungalow'! real nice bar close to the hostel. à little pricy but worth it!
i really liked the activities planned during the evenings. your location is perfect. thanks!

this is a huge hostel in an busy downtown location. the prices change depending on demand. my first night was $48 in a 6-bed and it changed to as much as $68 per night in the same room. the 6 bed rooms are nice. they have a sink and a mirror. the 8 beds however were too crowded for my preference. i wished there were surge protectors in the lockers so we could charge our devices for a few hours when we're not in the room. the staff were friendly and helpful.

excellent hostel. very modern and clean, massive big dorm rooms with en suite toilet and showerroom. huge kitchen downstairs and lots of lounge space. amazing location, 2 mins walk away from the beach and santa monica pier, and 2 mins walk from the shopping district. hostel offers nightly entertainment which is always good value and a great way to meet people. would def recommend it!

excellent location in santa monica. great free breakfast ( juice, coffee, fruit, cereal, bread, bagels) and free coffee throughout the day. lots of areas to go and sit. dorms are quite spacey with big lockers. beds have individual lights. not much atmosphere in the hostel but friendly enough. definitely not a  party place which was fine for me.  enjoyed my stay. just a bit expensive

the excellent location and facilities definitely live up to what i've come to expect from hi locations. i felt the cost ($45/night) was a bit steep for a dormitory room, but if you're planning on spending most of your time in santa monica, it's probably worth it. if you're more interested in visiting other parts of la, you may want to consider staying nearer, as la's public transit is not great. if you have a car, there is a ton of cheap, 24/7 lots in sm (civic center garage is $5/day nearby).

i had a good time there. it was very clean and even if there were 10 beds in the dorms they were confortable arranged. there is a nice patio in the middle and a big kitchen and dinning room. i really recommend this place.

accommodation in la is expensive. what you are paying for here is an exceptional location. the dorms and bathrooms are adequate, the breakfast is great, the activities are expensive, the common areas are nicely appointed but largely unwelcoming and there is no temperature control in either the rooms or the showers.  this hostel is somewhere between a b and b and a youth hostel, and be aware - there is a no alcohol policy!
i had so much fun
great place and the free breakfast was awesome!

this was my first stay in this hostel and it was by far the best buy in town.  the staff were terrific, everything was immaculate, the facilities were very comfortable and inviting and the location was perfect.  great job to all the staff and thanks for a very nice stay!

they tell you price would be 42$ in fact it appears become 50$. you stay in a room with 8-10 people. water in a shower is warm, but not enough. especially when i arrived it wasnt so hot outside and i wantted to warm up my body in a nice hot shawer and i couldn't do that!

it's a nice location with only one corner from the beach.the stuff was nice and helpfull but unfortunately they don't have maps of la or recommedations for sight seeing.the rooms are clean and include lockers.the breakfast is basic with toast, jam, cereals and coffee.as a whole: a good place to stay
amazing hostel. probably the best hostel i was staying in california. great location and pleasant atmosphere.
everything was perfect, except for the wifi.  there should be more fun!
rate it highly, real clean, staff are sweet. feels real safe

enjoyed my stay at the hostel. was planning to have a quiet night for my one night stopover in la anyway so didn't mind that the hostel was a "non-party" hostel but this might have bothered me if i was looking to meet people and have a fun night out.

what an incredible place, and incredible people who work there, and stay there!  the hostel is very modern, clean, and really quite fancy for a hostel!  it was probably the most luxurious hostel i've ever stayed at, with large lounges to work, and a huge kitchen and eating area.  also, a nice courtyard to work outside! the rooms were immaculate, and they even make the beds and strip the linen for you, unusual for a hostel. they even have towels!  staff is super-friendly, helpful + professional!
pretty nice place to stay a couple of nights, but don't expect to make friends there. most people just keep to themselves, even in the shared rooms, so...
great location
everything was ok
best hostel experience ever!!!!!  amazing breakfast!  nice staff!  clean!  location !  perfect!

excellent location, very close to the beach and the 3rd street promenade! the hostel offers different activities to help guests get to know la and make new friends. there are evenings when you can have dinner at the hostel, the food is good and cheap. i loved the pub crawl, it´s free and they take you to 3 or 4 different pubs and clubs near the hostel. room and bathroom clean and comfortable, hair dryer and bath soap available. breakfast is good too. elevator in the lobby. good value for money.

i had a wonderful stay at the santa monica hostel. i stayed for four nights and wouldn't have chosen anywhere else to stay. it's a short walk (5 minutes) to the beach, and just a block away from the third street promenade! lots of places to eat nearby as well. the helpful and friendly staff, group activities, and free breakfast were wonderful as well. thank you so much for giving me such an amazing experience!

the weirdest hostel i have ever stayed at ! people don't talk to each other  quite atmosphere  feels more like a hospital then hostel  quite hours starts from 10 pm ! what?! really ?! wouldn't recommend it if you travelling alone !

excellent location right near santa monica pier/third street promenade. staying in santa monica is way better then staying in hollywood/downtown as the atmosphere is nicer. staff were very helpful with providing directions and also provided bolt cutters for a padlock incident. hostel organised a hike to temescal canyon on a sunday which was amazing! they had great volunteers and it was all made super easy. rooms were clean but a little hot. just a fan in rooms, not air conditioning.

i had a great experience. location was perfect, it was easy to walk to the beach, and the 3rd street promenade is a minute walk away from the hostel - tons of restaurants and shops! the staff was very helpful when giving advice about the buses in la to get to hollywood. the breakfast was a nice bonus! the lockers were also an excellent size to fit everything i had with me.
generally a good hostel with friendly staff, however would be even better if the staff we're a bit more informed about local activities, events etc.

i only spent one night at this hostel but it was in an excellent spot not too far from anything! and super close to 3rd street promenade and santa monica place. the only complain was that i booked a 6bdrm dorm with ensuite but was put in a 4bdrm dorm with a shared bathroom. but like i said it was only 1 night so i didn't make a fuss. they had a comfy place to sleep at a great location with good wifi :)
great location. dorms very hot with no aircon
was one of the best hostels i've  stayed at. the staff is very nice! is a place i would definitely stay there again!

staff were brilliant, fab location for the shops, bus links and beach. the complimentary breakfast was vey good. they assign beds to each person in the dorm, which people don't stick to which makes it a bit of a pain come bed time, it would probably be better to leave it unreserved. a bit steeply priced in my opinion, but a good hostel overall.
thx for the great time! i´ll definitely be back!

jättebra läge ett stenkast från stranden. väldigt bra säkerhet med kortläsare överallt. superbra tvättmöjligheter. ganska dyrt som de flesta hostel i denna stad men ändå prisvärt. frukosten är väl inte jättespännande och kunde vara lite bättre för det priset men den funkar helt klart.

note: alcohol free hostel!! pretty much says it's all. if your looking for a fun time to social and meet others, don't stay here. if you would like a quiet place to stay then it's perfect. great faculties, breakfast and beds. but if your up for a fun time, look elsewhere, no alcohol and too many common rooms, lack of social activities makes it difficult to interact and meet other travellers.
the atmosphere wasn't the best but the accommodations were very nice and the staff really accommodating! we had so much fun in santa monica we stayed one extra day!!

its right on the beach, walking distance from the pier and endless shopping and restaurants. pub crawl was fun and all the tours stop at the hostel. the rooms with en-suite bathrooms were spacious and clean. i do not suggest the vip limo tour, unless you just want to pay $50 to ride there and back in a limo. but don't expect all the free drinks and club cover charges. the tour guide bought one cheap bottle of vodka for 20+ people and the clubs were all free entry.

mattresses were not comfortable, they should be upgraded  a little too pricey for a hostel in general especially for a private room, $129 and you don't get your own bathroom!  overall nice facility, nice ambiance in the common areas, friendly staff, nice big kitchen
fantastic location, in walking distance of most things. brekky included, nice!
amazing hostel, met some amazing people! central, close to the beach and 3rd sheet prom, venice beach and the pier! def coming back here!!!!
this is a very nice hostel, perfect location, clean and quiet. my only complaint is the price seemed quite high for a hostel. $55 for room of 4-6 beds.

included breakfast is always good, although there wasn't heaps of variety. kitchen facilities and general socialising areas were really nice. bathrooms were okay but not great. my bed was quite uncomfortable but the location is fantastic if you want to see the santa monica area.

it's in a nice place with nice staff but it lacks an atmosphere. i'd say something like a bbq in the courtyard would allow people to mix more freely rather than having people sit on opposite sides of tables at breakfast not speaking
excellent staff, very friendly and know their stuff. good location and perfect spot for a little getaway

we only stayed here for 1 night as we had a stopover in la. the hostel is in a great location. only a 5 minute walk from 3rd street promenade and about 10 minutes from santa monica pier. the staff are really helpful and the hostel is very clean and has great facilities. there are many cosy common areas to hang out and the breakfast which is provided is great. there is toast, bagels, fruit and yoghurt, cereal and juice and coffee.
amazing location and very good premises. atmosphere and breakfast were uninspiring though. us price for dorm bed (excessive).

great location in santa monica - right by third street promenade and the beach and pier. easy walk to everything!   staff were lovely and super helpful.  had to pay for luggage storage of more than 2 hours after checking out which was a bit of a bummer.  but great communal areas - kitchen, lounge rooms and a lovely fire for reading next to!  beds were super comfy and bathrooms were clean.
good location! helpful and friendly stuff! just two blocks away from the beach and there're some good restaurants nearby.
not enough activities for tourists on their own. breakfast was very average and being in a room with 9 others wasn't an enjoyable experience.

best part is the location -- right near beach, pier, 3rd street promenade. cost $1 to get to from lax via bus. great hostel, although too expensive: including all taxes and fees it costs me $50/night as a non-member in a 6-bed dorm. showers don't have heat options, it's just an on/off knob, so they are warm but not hot. dorm rooms are great -- every bed has its own outlets and light. wifi is good. bonus points for charming open areas like a fireplace room and atrium. decent breakfast.
very clean and professional. my favorite place in la so far...
it was an amazing experience. awesome breakfast and awesome location. simply amazing. will come back fossho.
here's breakfast is very very good!!!!!!!!!!!  i love +_+ hahahaha    most of part is good

this is a really nice hostel, however it is a hi-hostel. as a hi-hostel they have figured out how to make everything so efficient and predictable that the hostel has no soul or character. however, the location is decent and the breakfast is ok. the hostel is a little on the pricey side. if you want a hostel that is actually interesting and not out to simply make a profit i wouldn't recommend this hostel. also, the hostel is so huge and cold it is really hard to meet people.

my stay was excellent while i was there. the staff were beyond helpful. the breakfast included (toast, mini bagels, yogurt, cereal and canned peaches) a minor suggestion to take this hostel a step higher assorted menu selections of both hot and cold breakfast. waffle/pancakes, fresh fruit, oatmeal, and or pastry danishes. those would mean the world to travelers.i loved the fact the hostel was literally a block away from the beach. many of food places and store near by that came in handy.

this hostel has great location for the value, right at the center of santa monica and near to everything. you can pretty much walk to most of the points of interest. staff are very helpful and awesome. hostel often organizes fun events at discounted rates such as hiking and sightseeing. they are pretty insightful about what to do in santa monica and the la area. had a great time there interacting with the staff and meeting up with the other guests.
very easy place to find, not far from lax air port, staff are very helpful and friendly.  would be very happy to come back again.
nice and clean with several open common areas. a great location in santa monica. really enjoyed my stay.
breakfast is good and has a lot of activities to join. just 2 blocks from the beach. i will defintely stay here again if come to la
loved it! fantastic staff!
the location of hostel is very good!
really clean and fresh hostel.
its a really nice hostel, close to central santa monica and with big common areas. really nice and helpful staff too!
loved it here- was great, staff were super friendly and location was tops...great kitchen and common areas!
better showers would really help.. and it's too expensive for a hostel..

i really enjoyed my stay here. so much that i stayed for longer than expected... and came back again!! great location, only a 5 min walk to the beach and then a short walk to the shops too. staff are extremely friendly and help in any way they can. would definitely recommend this hostel.
the shower could have been better. i can live without a strong water flow, but the water needed to be hotter than just above warm.
the location is one of my favorite places to visit and the local community is very friendly.   there is convenient shopping for almost anything you may need.
the hostel team is very helpful. location is excellent!  but, at the hostel's bathroom was a huge cockroach.
nice place
nice stay, comfy beds, clean shower and awesome location.  the only negative i found was that there wasn't a good atmosphere.  it was very quiet and people kept themselves to them selves.
hi santa monica  is a model hostel in a terrific area.
i could not sleep well because of someone's or something's making noise.
the place has a friendly, helpful bunch of staff.

very clean, comfortable hostel in the perfect location only a block from the beach. close to restaurants and all santa monica tourist activities. facilities were great. i was hoping to participate in some hostel activities but seemed most were getting canceled, i think because there weren't many people around. a bit of a loud area with construction on the street outside but we were warned of this and i'm sure at a normal time that this isn't a problem. overall it was a great hostel!
such a shame that you can't drink alcohol in the hostel... would be way better if you could!! other than that everything was great and the staff were all so helpful :)
the breakfasts were full of sugar... too much in my opinion, and not enough selection of cereals (i hate cornflakes). otherwise it was a really great experience.
one of the best and cleanest places to stay in the area, and very convenient to the beach.
very helpful staff, great location and perfect alternative to staying in downtown la. the breakfast was great and there are plenty of cool spaces to relax. would highly recommend.
very well located, it's at the heart of san monica and very close to the beach! the facilities are very nice and clean. the rooms are okay.
what a great location. 2 blocks from the beach. can't beat the price of you are ok with staying in a hostile. met all kinds of people from literally around the world.
had a very goos stay here, unfortunally there is no really feeling because the hostel is too big for that
the bathroom smelled like pee. that was the only downside.
the staff was really rude and disrespecful. but the hostel was good, but expensiveeee :s
water in bathroom isn't warm.it's very cold when i took shower!

the charge for computer use is incredulous, as is making your wonderful staff stand all day (it's a hostel they should look comfortable and friendly, standing is stupid, it's not meant to be a formal uptight occasion)
the front desk staff was excellent. i wish you would extend the stay for three weeks. you are the best hostile in town. god bless!!!
great hostel. best kitchen in a hostel ever, they have cheap food nights with bbq, pizza and pasta. loved the chill out area out the back. on the expensive  side but you get what you pay for

no complaints. this hostel has good tourist info and activities that make navigating la more bearable. santa monica pier and beach is a quick walk and you're practically in the third st. promenade for all the shopping. lots of street musicians. 30 min jog to venice beach. i definitely recommend staying here.
air conditioning would be good
specialized for santamonica!

santa monica was a great area to visit and hostelling international in santa monica was a great place to stay in.  i enjoyed the pasta night and the pub crawl they had on offer at the hostel.  i wish i had stayed at this hostel when i visited los angeles in october 2008 but fortunately fulfilled my promise to myself of staying here if i returned to los angeles.  i would definitely stay at this hostel if i returned to los angeles again.
