i thought the hostel atmosphere, facilities, location, cleanliness, how modern it looked were all amazing! they had so many added extras that made the stay so much nicer too.   the only improvement i would make would be to the mattresses, im quite a small person and every time i lay down i could feel the bed frame underneath me it was so thin. i dont think it was every bed though, and it definitely wouldnt put me oglff from staying here again.

great hostel even if it is a little expensive. the location is fantastic, staff very kind and helpful. beds are comfortable and my roommates were great too. very respectful and quiet! we were lucky to be at the end if the corridor so no one walked past our room in the night, so peaceful sleeps for the whole stay! would definitely recommend this hostel!
extremely overpriced and absolutely no atmosphere. wouldn't stay here unless you are in a group before you arrive.

this is an amazing hostel located in the heart of the city, just 1 or two minutes walk from 3rd street shopping and the same from the beach front. the hostel was very friendly with great common areas to meet other travellers, would recommend this place to anyone wanting to stay in santa monica!

no aircon in the rooms so it gets extremely hot at night, and the wifi is pretty poor, but other than that, the location is amazing, you can lock all your valuables away in a locker using your own lock for added security! the staff were friendly but they didn't give me any information on where breakfast was held or about using the key cards, and for my first time in a hostel i was pretty confused until i manged to figure it out myself!

wish hostel had smaller rooms and/or privacy curtains around beds. one girl was sick and was always in bed. she kept closing the windows ( i kept opening them). sick people really should stay in a hotel or private room.

the frozen mini bagels served during breakfast were kind of awkward to cut in half and toast; and they seem almost purposefully made to easily get stuck inside machines. where's the regular bread? also, there was no hot water to take a shower with at all on friday night to saturday morning. come on and step up your game you $50/night hostel!! otherwise, everything else was as good as expected.

this is an okay hostel, i just don't think the value for money is good. i payed over 50 dollars for one night (in an 8-bed-dorm), had to pay extra for storing my bag on the day i checked out, and i couldn't even use a computer for free. also my towel and linen had stains on them and sleeping on that matress felt like lying in a halfpipe.
great hostel. they've thought of everything. big rooms good beds and a top location.

i think this hostel is the best one i have ever stayed. the location is good, safe, and walk around to see seaside is just about a minute. they have enough vending machines for me who is really a lazy person to buy instant noodle and other stuff easily.  compare to the hollywood hostel , i prefer this one because the facility is also better and there is bigger space for people to relax.   i will definitely come back if i visit la again.

it's a good hostel, a good chain (hi). you can have some troubles in the summer, cause is to hot there e dont have air cond., have a lot of people that can enter on the hostel without pay for it, a lot of people sleep on the ground of the dorm. had a good staff, a good atmosphere. the most strange thing was the hostel was hot like hell and when i tried took a shower just had a hot shower.. amazing..

this place is awesome. i've stayed here on several occasions and the staff is super friendly and welcoming. taylor caught me having a meltdown and was just the sweetest helping me calm down and getting me a great room. they work really hard to make this a great hostel and it shows. it's super safe, there's a mutual respect among the travellers. in the la area, there is no question that this is the best place to stay.

all in all a quite good hostel. i was in a 6-bed-dorm which offered quite a lot of space. unfortunarely the beds were quite short (with 1.83m i am not a giant). there was no airconditioning in the rooms, it was really hot (the fan only made a lot of noise but did not really cool down). nights are quite boring at that hostel - people communicate with their ipads and smartphones but not to each other. alcoholic drinks are not allowed, not even beer...
amazing location

great location (10 min from the santa monica pier, and the third street promenade), free breakfast, wi-fi is working really well, but 10 beds in a room is getting really hot at night, not enough activities to meet people and no alcohols is allow in the hostel.
best hostel in santa monica
great hostel in a wonderful location, close by for shopping and beach. staff incredibly helpful and facilities clean and pleasant. would definitely stay again next time i am in la!

loved the hostel with it's nice location in the heart of santa monica! just a few minutes to the beach.:) the only problem i had was the missing air conditioning. santa monica can get really hot at night so i could barely sleep in a room with 9 others and about 90 degrees fahrenheit... other than that i had a wonderful time and espeacially the breakfast and the many free activities like hiking or a la city tour were really nice!

very close to the beach and the shopping streets. very secured outside even at night.   the front entrance and the door to your room requires a card key to get opened. but you must be careful not to get things stolen just in case.  there are several public rooms that has sofas, computers, tvs. free wi-fi is provided throughout the building.  the shared bathrooms with showers were not that clean and comfortable. the dishes for your breakfast weren't either. dishes are all washed without soap!!
nice location, cool and clean hostel only the male showers on the 3rd floor is like going into a oven!
nice hostel

the first room we were in was awful, so tiny and hot with no bathroom. we were moved into a bigger room to be with the rest of our friends and it was the same priced room, but much bigger with its own bathroom. the pricing doesnt seem fair for the huge difference in the two rooms.
would be nice if you could have a few drinks in the court yard otherwise pretty good

room was very very hot.  we had an 8 bed room which was very small for that many people.  washing was quite expensive (cost $1.25 each).  no parking at all for free, it was either an expensive one close by or seven blocks away for $5 a day.  they were always cleaning the bathrooms but they did them all at the same time so there was no where to pee.  it was social but there weren't many meals etc organised so you had to do it all yourself (not like a lot of the other hostels).

this place was nice although not lively at all, i would definitely recommend staying down in venice beach where they have hostels on the beach. santa monica beach itself is nice although you can easily get there if you're in venice. this hostel has potential but i just couldn't see anyone staff or guests getting involved in any activities while i was there.
had a f*$@:-) blast....
well located, nice & clean rooms, good breakfast, good facilities in general.
loved the hostel, such a great area, just thought my room little small, they add one bunk, so we couldnt even have space to open the suitcases, but all the rest, can't complain!
great location for the price and easy toget to from the airport
nice hostel and great location, but social areas are not great for mixing and luggage will only be held until 1pm the next day. great breakfast!
great location, helpful staff, clean and comfortable.
location, staff, beds, and facilities were amazing!
good location. very nice hostel. something on every night.

the showers were cold on two of the three floors. but as california is on a bad drought, i guess it was better for everyone and not really bothering considering how hot it was!    apart from that and the price per night that was maybe a bit high (38 euros) this place is just awesome! such good vibes, super movie room, super reading room, super common room, great kitchen, awesome patio, very friendly staff, so many things organized every day that you couldn't be bored... i recommend this place!

the shower water system was changing when i was there.... so the water was not stable all the time.... and the key card didn't work out couple of times.... i had to go to the counter redo it. i don't know if there has stuff to clean up the fridge. it looks really a mess and packed all the time. the value of this hostel i think is the great location. ten minutes walk to the beach and two mins walk to the downtown area....
we had cockroches in our room!!!!

fantastic location and lots of free or cheap tours offered out of the hostel.  breakfast and dinners i had were good as well. the room was very hot with only a fan and no air conditioning, and the 3rd and 4th floors did not have any hot water in the showers.

terrific central location.close to the beach,  boardwalk, restaurants and shops.parking is only 14 dollars a day across the street.    a bit hot at night, but otherwise a terrific place w knowledgeable staff.
a very good hostel in a great location. great facilities, tidy and clean. verall staff pretty helpful.o
the showers where very hot, but other than that it was a good place to stay.

i was there for 5 days with a friend and we very much enjoyed our stay at h.i santa monica. the staff was always helpful, breakfast was good and the place was clean. the only bad thing i have to say is that showers was sometimes freezing cold or burning hot and there's no way of adjusting it yourself.  it's located 10min from the beach and one block from all the shops on the promenade and many buses run to downtown la so it's a very good hostel if you're here to visit but also relax!
great location, good facilities, and great atmosphere. washing room not the cleanest, and can be quite hot without aircon.

one of the best hostels i've ever stayed at. the people were amazing, lounge areas huge and nice, but showers were either hot or cold, and no a/c on the 4th floor was iiiinteresting. but i would def. come back again if for anything the location!
there was no air conditioning in the room, and with eight people in one room it gets pretty hot. couldn't sleep at all, and that kind of ruind my trip there..
excellent hostel. even in a large dorm i got good sleep. went for a swim first thing in the sea as it's a 5-10 minute walk. really cool hostel
the only small complaint that i have is that the quiet time rule was not followed. we had girls come in at 1 am and turn on lights, talk and pack suit cases.
great breakfast, - room was extremely hot at night and the one working air conditioning only cooled one or two beds.
a nice place close to the beach but as all the hi hostels, it's not the best place for partying and drinking. still, the place was clean and i enjoyed my stay there.
great atmosphere, lots of facilities in a great condition, 5 mins away from the beach and center of santa monica.

the key was not working from the first time i got my dorm room but there's no staff taking care of my situation. they just kept saying "wait". so what happened is that only i was sleeping in the room n i coudln't notice someone's knocking on the door. bcz of that my other roomies (3persons) couldn't get in the room for over 2 hrs....
more protein in the breakfast?
possibly the best hostel in the world!! period.
this hostel was good. great location, big hostel, breakfast provided, and good value for money.

i had a great time in  santa monica and the hostel was definitely responsable for that. the location is noble. the best location i ever had in 20 hostels in all over the world.   but the hostel must to fix the water temperature, that was completely crazy and make better informations about distances to la. i lost my train in union staion because the desk said that it was 1 hour from santa monica. i spent 1 hour and 45 minutes.  in spite of that i intend to come back again to this hostel.

awesome location, the rooms and bathrooms at the hostel are also super clean. free breakfast and whatnot in the morning was also a plus. the only downside would have to be how nobody talks to each other in this hostel! i really think there should be more of a social focus because apart from a few of the people in my room i got to know nobody.
this hostel could be really cool if it wasn't alcohol free.

this hostel is fantastic! great location, everyone is really nice, wifi works well. only downside is that the bathrooms are very stuffy and 1 of the 4 showers was out of order for my entire stay... and that it is so expensive!
i loved the water bottle filler! haven't seen that anywhere but it's so convenient and green :)

way overpriced, especially with the hidden charge if your not a member. excellent location, only hostel around that area.  the bathroom really run down, not the best showers. common area was pretty nice.

staff were absolutely terrible, inattentive rude and aloof. the only atmosphere to speak of was the loud dingles out the front, no fun to be had anywhere else. never paid this much for a dorm bed, never again

great location.  the staff are okay.  not the friendliest or most enthusiastic people ever but that's fine.  the only thing i really disliked was that the key i received to get into my room did not work.  i had to carry all my luggage up and down the stairs 2 or 3 times to keep going down to fix my key so i could get into the room.  the staff gave me attitude which i did not appreciate.  don't they understand the whole reason fokes pay for the hostel is to have access to the room?
i loved the area and the employees were awesome.   super friendly and just cool.   i liked the hostel a lot. i would go there always again.

they where great hosts.  can't ask for more.  jd parked his car in a free parking spot to save it for our car.  my girlfriend and i where only staying one night but they offered us all their facilities, cereal, juice etc.  can't ask for much more.

i was satisfied from this hostel overall, but i think that the hostel's staffs weren't good. they had unconcerned me sometimes when i had check-in from the hostel. that is, when i couldn't the check-in for the hostel before 2 a.m, i wanted to keep my luggage at that time. and then, they seemed to be unconcerned me. anyway location was very great by locating the nearby santa monica beach.
i liked it and would stay there again

felt it was bit on the pricey end, but my friends and i wanted to stay near the beach so went for the little extra money. really nice place. very big hostel and has a more separate feel than other hostels i've been at where it has a more community feel. breakfast/kitchen area was large, but filled up quick. when we checked out we asked to keep our backpacks on hold before we left the city, but they only offered to keep them in lockers which we would've had to pay for.

the best kept secret to see santa monica, california! i'm hoping to fly back for christmas! staff very friendly and knowledgeable. showers, bunks, rooms and interior design spacious and jazzy reflecting the international guests who travel there. there sun and air are so wonderful! i slept like a baby. first time in my life slept so soundly i was snoring. lol. no car necessary walking everywhere and buses run every 15 minutes! paradise, paradise and beaches! you will experience heaven! blessings!

i was frustrated by the shower, which was only on-off with no adjustment for temperature, and it went from freezing cold to burning hot on a whim.  the beds were uncomfortable and i did not sleep well, also partly from noise.  all in all, i would not return to this hostel, but i am not against hostels in general.

i was worried about staying in a hostel for the first time, but this was a really good experience.  i'm a female traveling alone so safety was a big deal to me.  i always felt secure.  the clientel was really good and they usually had multiple people at the front desk in case there was a problem.
i enjoyed staying there! but i have a complain! the shower was too hot!

overall, this hostel was perfect. it was a bit higher price than other hostels i've stayed at but the facilities are very nice. it is modern and clean, with many different activities. the kitchen is huge. if you're a light sleeper i would suggest earplugs. the city is very loud and all the windows are open so it's hard to get a long nights sleep.

amazing location right next to the beach and shopping area. the kitchen is huge! great for cooking for yourself though unfortunately our food got stolen. the staff are alright but a bit miserable. beds are very comfy with a plug socket and night light. i'd stay there again.
no smoking or drinking on the premises. a bit too strict i think
just a good typical american hostel, big but if your not scared to speak to people you will meet people
helpful and friendly staff, ideally located for santa monica, good facilities, would both recommend and use again.
good hostel, atmosphere not the best lot of wierd people but thats la really!
generaly pretty good but toilet and showers very poor

a terrible hostel in a good location. there are lots of hidden fees at this hostel and there is no atmosphere whatsoever. in over 200 hostels i've seen, this is one of the worst. how this place gets a rating above 60% is beyond me. stay elsewhere.

perfect location if you want to be near the beach, otherwise it's a journey into downtown la and hollywood. hostel has everything to offer, lots of lounge space, big kitchen and dining area. rooms are good with individual lighting, plug sockets and lockers. the bathrooms aren't ideal, showers run extremely hot or cold and not much privacy with the toilets, there's only one shared bathroom per floor.
not a great place to meet people

the hostel was in a good location, but if you didn`t have good room mates there would not have been a proper atmosphere. it was more of a hotel type hostel atmosphere (like most hi) rather than a proper backpackers.

i chose the cheapest room, sharing with other 7 ladies and it was great. we had any problem, the room was really nice with a privet shower and toilet, and if they were busy, there was a huge bathroom in the same floor. people from the hi were nice all the time. location: excellent. the kitchen was also huge with everything to cook yourself. everything was very tidy. my experience was great.
i loved everything about it!
awesome location, very good value for money !!

nice kind staff, good position, nice building.     big hostel, lots of people. i did not like they ask u 5 dollars to leave the luggage in the storage.    other thing: there were some crazy people in the hostel, and even if visitors complained about some weirdo, they did not do nothing, just move the visitor from a room to another one.
breakfast was very poor, in fact it was disgusting which was a let down in comparison to the facilities.

great location, great facilities, very clean, has everything you need. not so much a "party" hostel, but the hostel runs pub crawls and there are lots and lots of bars within a short walk if you are looking for a party. if i was to go to santa monica again i would definitely be happy to stay in this hostel again. if i had one issue (which is a tiny one), my access card stopped working a few times. it was always fixed very very quickly, but slightly annoying.
over all not a bad hostel however a little over priced i felt.

this location is superb! practically across the street from the santa monica beach and the staff is great.  the only real downer is no reasonably priced overnight parking available anywhere in downtown santa monica. other than that, this is a fantastic place.

hostel was in a beautiful location, about 5 minutes' walk from santa monica pier, which was great! i wish there were better options for parking if a guest is driving in (across the street at $14/night is too much if one is staying there for multiple nights, and the garage that's about a 10 minutes' walk away at $5/night is better but not the best option for solo females walking alone in the evening). also it'd've been nice if breakfast included some fresh fruit or eggs or something.
bathrooms were gross and needed a real clean not a quick rinse that they got each day. showers were either too cold or too hot
no vibe at all. boring experience.
they need a ventilator in the mens bathroom, 3rd. floor.

stayed in the 10 female dorm with my friend. the room was spacious and clean. large lockers were provided. there were power sockets and night lamp for each bed, which was highly convenient. location was within walking distance to the beach and the main strip. large parking station was across the road with reasonable day rates. simple breakfast of toast, cereal and yoghurt were provided. would stay here again.
great location. the free tours are a nice touch.

close to the beach and a really nice hostel with pool table, library, outdoor garden and more. breakfast good, beds good, kitchen good. staff nice except for a guy which seemed annoyed of me asking questions about transportation to the airport. i was amused by the fact that its a alcohol- free hostel, which is a nice break from some other hostels with a lot of drinking.

overall an excellent hostel, with a location that cannot be beat. all of the staff were friendly and helpful. only negative were the showers which had some temperature issues (too hot!). otherwise a great stay.
very helpful staff. great communal spaces. decent breakfast. clean rooms. two blocks from the beach, perfect.
toilets don't flush correctly. the room was smelly.
without a doubt i think it's a bit expensive and very poor breakfast
strange hostel. great staff and location but very strange vibe.  not sure about security.. we had a strange man knock on our door.

the location of this hostel is amazing, and it has everything you need, almost! it does lack that getting-to-know-people-feel that most hostel have. its a very big hostel (260 beds i think) so i feels a bit more like a hotel, with shared room!  a big downside is that they cant garantee that you share a room with your own group, you could get in a situation where you are in seperate rooms! but its a good location for shopping and beach time!
thank you for an nice stay.
nice hostel very close to many restaurants, stores and beach.  staff is convenient and safety place. however, first time i must pay for computer use in a hostel.

typical hi hostel. might need a little paint here and there but generally very clean. nice size rooms, comfy beds and lockers for everyone. excellent location between beach and shopping area in santa monica.
clean, nice place. bit expensive, you could probably also book a motel for that amount of money if you're traveling with someone else. excellent kitchen and very good location. quiet hostel at night
breakfast could do with some varity. wifi was good across the hostel. lots of things to do.

this hostels best asset is it's location - in the heart of santa monica which is one of l.a's nicest areas. aside from that it's a pretty stock standard h.i hostel. excellent facilities, security etc but lacks atmosphere.
not a place to party..no alcohol allowed in the hostel and people all on their phones ..no hostel interaction
clean, does the job and centraly located.  couldn't ask for better than that.
no one tells you that you have to pay extra fees. that is not fair.
everything was great!
great location, helpful staff, good they have tours and stuff organised, nice breakfast too.

if you are going to santa monica, this is the place to stay! the hostel is close to the beach as well as the city. planned to stay here for 2 nights, but ended up with staying for 8 nights. already miss santa monica and the hostel! met so many cool people at hi. if i should say something negative, it has to be the breakfast, wish it was more variety!

nice hostel, clean with spacious rooms and great location. lacked atmosphere thought due to it's size... not many people seemed to be mingling and didn't seem to attract the crowd who wanted to meet others. i wouldn't stay here if i was traveling alone and hoping to meet others.

a good hostel, breakfast included which is nice. great location really close to the beach and the walking street in santa monica. had a great walking tour in venice beach, thanks ekin for that. lots of things happening, and if you participate to the organized tours it's easy to get to know people. otherwise i only got to know people in my own dorm.

awesome staff. did the best they could to give us suggestions on where to go for a night out. could we get the people in the courtyard to respect those who are sleeping in the am to keep the noise down? in the courtyard the noise bounces off the walls.

really difficult to meet new people at this hostel! it the guests are not social at all.  seems that there a lot of group tours and people using it as a home, because they can't find anywhere else to live.. don't choose the 10 beds room. lived with a group of highschool girls and it was a mess.
solid hostel in classic north america mega hostel sense.
great hostel at a great place
バス停や海から近いし、治安も良いところなので、すごく気持ちよく過ごせました。10人部屋でしたが部屋も清潔で、鍵のつけられるロッカーもあり、wi-fiもきちんと繋がります。朝ごはんもキッチンがあるので、自分で買ったものと合わせれば、美味しく食べられると思います。またサンタモニカに行く機会があれば利用させて貰いたいです！
my bed was dirty and even the room. but very nice in the common rooms
the staff was very accomodating and friendly, even with my late 11pm arrival!  location was great, and facilities were very good.

this poor hostel is worst one ever in my entire life.  what i hate the most about here is that price and fraud.  they required extra fee when we arrived because we don't have the freaking membership. they should've discounted for the members rather than added extra fees for non members.  we stayed 1 night. and it was 42$ per one person even our room was 10people dorm. are you kidding? 42bucks for 10 person dorm?  also they provided a free pub crawl. it was fraud. nothing was for free.

really safe and friendly atmosphere. ideal if you're travelling alone. perfect location if you want to see santa monica and venice but maybe a bit far from some of the main attractions such a griffith park. i would recommend staying in more than one area in la as it's so big and there's so much to see!

thanks for the wonderful and clean environment that is available for us away from home. i sincerely appreciate the opportunity extended. my main concern was the fact that, the room assigned housing 8 women was much too crowded and untidy. i also realized that, there is no screening of guests who are paired together in a room. that was surprising, indeed.  as i told the staff at the front desk, next time i will ask for a room with fewer women or, pay extra for a private room.  thanks for your time.

as a youth hostel you expecto to have certain atmosphere where you can meet other travelers. most of the people where too young (less than 18) or over 50. the staff makes no effort at organizing activities to meet others and they bearly can help you on finding something around the hostel
construction noise was horrible.

i loved my stay at hi. santa monica is a fantastic place with constant public transport into la. the staff were excellent and always friendly. and the lockers in the rooms were big enough to fit my whole bag into.
good place to stay but that little bit too big to have a real atmosphere

really good hostel. i stayed in a 10 bed dorm which is kinda big, but it had its own toilet, shower, sink, and there were more of these on the floor in case you didn't want to wake your roommates up. it has a few nice chill out/lounge areas, one with massive tv and recliners which was cool. location is awesome if you want to be in that part of la, its minutes walk from santa monica pier and shopping area, but don't forget how big and hard to get around la is. close to lax, only $1 by bus.

i absolutely loved this hostel it was by far the best i have stayed in. the location couldnt have been better. it also had lots of free activities which was great for when i ran out of cash. the only bit i would say needs improving is the showers.
highly recommended

excellent facilities, especially water filters and chilled reading room, huge kitchen. and great location for the beach and shopping. staff very happy to help when you need. comfortable beds with personal lamplight. but as with many us hostels, rather a strange mix of people staying there across the age spectrum and including the homeless and incapacitated for example. so not too much atmosphere.

not the hostels fault but... i shared a room for 2 days with someone that had a severe bout of the flu - so she told me as i was leaving! is there a policy about sharing a room when you are unwell?    staff were fantastic. i recommend the guided walks.
very good stay, close to everything.
pity about the shower was our of order and had to used another floor otherwise great stay

a great location, well set up hostel with lots of different spaces & plenty of room. staff were very helpful & information provided for activities was excellent with directions & maps.  breakfast was good with tea & coffee provided all day. big kitchen & eating areas.  an elevator was an added plus especially with luggage.
i had to use restrooms from other floors and there were a lot of locks missing for the locker. other than that the facilities and services were clean and good.

this is the best hostel i ever stayed. i've already stayed there for 3 times. there are just two things i would like to comment that i didn't like much: once there were 5 guys in my room and one was really noisy and i couldn't sleep all night. another thing is that i was driving a car and had to pay for parking overnight. if i stayed in a hotel with parking lot, i would probally pay the same amount, and stay in a private room.
no fan or a/c in the rooms.  automatic vending m/c's we're not working. doors should be provided for bathrooms instead of cloth screens.
great location, facility so great. nice breakfast
if you wanna stay at quiet and clean place, i really recommend this hostel.  location is perfect close to the beach and shopping area.

only stayed for 1 night so didn't get to really experience the hostel. was a great location in santa monica, rooms were exceptionally clean and comfortable. showers were 'too hot' on our floor so had to shower on the floor below. slight inconvenience but not the end of the world. would stay again if i was in la
great location if you like shopping and the beach. very expensive, but very safe area. staff were good but not very helpful.

i really liked this hostel, although i stayed there only one night. if only i had more time! it's in great location. close to the beach and shopping area and so on. the staff was really nice and helpful. they tried to help me with problems, even though it's not related to the hostel. it was really helpful! there are a lot of activities going on all the time. so you can join them and enjoy!
location was awesome! hostel was clean and staff was always available to help. had a blast on the pub crawl and you just can't beat the location. i highly recommend.
i love this place, i would recommend it to anyone. except, breakfast are not included much of the varieties beside bread.

great hostel with awesome people. the location is perfect and you can reach everything within 10minutes walking distance. the hostel just had some serious water problems during my stay, water did not work showers too hot or too cold… but i think thats fixed now =)   all in all my stay was great and i really enjoyed my time
you will love it if you like stay near beach..  had great time staying there..
just perfect
really good.
nice hostel in a good neigbourhood/in the city centre of santa monica. hosts all kind of people/ages. felt very welcome !

fabulous location. the breakfast was extremely poor and there is not much choice however, there are lots of places to eat nearby. clean rooms and bathrooms with towels and hairdryers provided. would definitely stay again.

the staff is extremely friendly, professional and efficient.  breakfast is always ready promptly at 7:30 and the coffee pots always full with fresh brew.  and by staff i surely don't only mean the front desk, but rather even the cleaning and kitchen staff are always smiling and keeping everything in good order.  this is absolutely the finest hostel for miles and/or kilometers around!  oh, and i just love the events such as the pub crawl, comedy shows and more!

this hostel has loads of facilities like laundry room, tv room, big kitchen, dining room. a home away from home. nice breakfast. quiet areas if you need them.  it was almost too big in that it felt more like a hotel.  bad points are the communal showers and toilets had little privacy.  another bad thing is the male only dorms. where's the fun in that?  santa monica is ok, especially if you like yoga, apparently. nice cinema.
best location in santa monica, but they keep cancelling tours from hostel such as tour to getty centre, so that i needed to go there by myelf, but that was still a good experience for me!!!

i used to choose hostel international, but honestly it was the worst hostel ever! i felt really not safe and it was noisy with all big trucks next to the window at 6.30am! they put a boy in our room, i was surprise to find him when i woke up..i was in another hostel in hollywood downtown, was cheaper and really better!
the showers should be improved

it's slower in winter than in summer, but the space is nice and the location is amazing.  wish there were a few more casual in house activities -- fooseball table, soft dart board, a few weights or some such thing -- the library is nice and the lounges well styled, but there was a lack of things to do inside.  the big tv in the 2nd floor hall always seemed set on something pretty silly, and people were sitting in front of it but not actually watching (set a time for an evening movie maybe?)
best experience ever!!

a great hostel, located very close to santa monica beach, and in the heart of the santa monica business district. lots of restaurants close-by and a really good atmosphere going on in the hostel itself. good breakfast. only downfall is having to pay for storage on departure day - not cool when you've paid for a night's accommodation.
had a great time lyn and i met some nice people and great locstion snd friendly staff.

the showers on floor 4 were scalding. there was no way to regulate temperature - they were either on or off. fresh towels daily would also be much more sanitary, since there was no way to properly dry the ones we were given. you could put a towel hamper in the bathroom.      i also think that children should not be allowed to stay. someone was allowing their young child to run -- literally -- shrieking up and down the corridors and common areas, which was an unacceptable nuisance.

this hostel is in a fantastic location but it felt a bit institutional... there wasn't much atmosphere despite it having a great kitchen, dining room etc.  the window in the girls dorm wouldn't shut which made it cold at night and it was a long walk to the bathroom. all in all though, it's good value for santa monica.

my only complaint about the hostel is that you don't see much joy, chat... no stimulation to a social relationship inside there, like places that you can eat and drink for a happy hour etc. it is a very serious mood. if it was a younger weather, would be perfect! that's it! i hope i was helpful... thanks!
awesome modern place with big kitchen area and lounges.
very nice staff. felt safe. everyone pleasant and helpful. thankyou.
great locatiuon with great staff. i have no complaints. if there is something, maybe the showe ficility can be improved as it really lack ot privacy.

did you see the prices of this hostel? it is the most expensive hostel i have never been! in the prices showed in internet is not included taxes, and not included 3 dollars/ per night if you are not a member of hostelling international. if you want to stay the weekend, 2 nights in this hostel you might pay 100 $ for a single bed in a dorm of 8 or  10 people!  can you imagine it?  if paid 50 $ per night and in my room were sleeping 8 people, how  much is the profit of the hostel?
ended up staying for 3 nights, very centrally located, good parkings near, near beach and 3rd str promonade. i would definately stay here again!
no, own parking, i came at night, to find free spot was impossible there.

great experience staying at the hostel, rooms were good size, clean & staff were helpful. the atmosphere was good & i really liked the fact it wasn't a party atmophere but there were still activities you could join in on.    only complaint is thst the mattress was pretty uncomfortable!
it is vety near to the beach
other occupants of room were untidy and had food in room. rooms should be checked daily by staff.

everything was nice: excellent location, the hostal is clean, the only thing that really upset me, was  my roomates, they were really loud. plus, my keys was always uncharging but the staff was very compreheensive about it, so it's ok.
rooms have enough space! top location of the hostel!

large lockers in the room are good!  the washrooms were large and clean, but the shower wasn't really hot.  the breakfast was pretty good, and it was warm and welcoming.  the location was excellent, and it felt really safe.
stayed here 18 years ago, and then again last weekend. first class hostel across the board!

that's a very good  hostel, especially the location that is so close to the santa monica beach. if you are afraid of where is kind of far away from holywood, disneyland~ don't worry, there are some tour agencies providing all kinds of tours. actually santa monica is a wonderful attraction, don't forget to take a sunset tour on the beach if you hit there, that will be fantastic.
kind of expensive for a hostel, however its a nice place.
there could be a few more couches in the hallways or more lounge areas to hang out in.
best hostel coffee ever! well worth $100 for a two-night stay (sarcasm).
great place. it fit my needs perfectly. i highly recommend it!

the location of the hostel is very good, especially for going to the beach, the staff was very friendly and helpful, the atmosphere was nice, the only thing is that it is very expensive for a hostel even though it is a very nice one.
great hostel and great location.
on block away from the beach and a lot of bars and restaurants around, nice place.

this hostel is amazing! located so close to the beach, many bars, pubs and restaurants. the hostel itself is sooo clean, so many areas to relax in such as a cinema, computer lounge and outdoor patio!  bedrooms are small, but so comfortable and functional eg lockers.

after checking out they will only let you leave your luggage in their storage for 2 hours - if it is even over by 15 mins certain members of staff will tell you to put it in the 24hr lockers. some of the front desk staff are not helpful or even friendly when you approach them. if you want to mingle and meet travellers this is not the place to stay - santa monica itself is great though just don't expect much from this place socially.
the kitchen could be better with more staff! there was for example just 2 or 3 kitchen kniffs or no free herbs or salt/pepper. the rest was great! friendly staff,clean and a good location!

great hostel in a great location. i always stay in hollywood when visit la. not anymore. the bathroom is clean, bedroom , it is so great to have that extra pillow. the tv room is great as well as kitchen and dining room. one of the best hostels i've stayed in, and i have stayed in many hostels.
staff there was rude and incompetent. mainly the manager some rude hispanic woman and the overnight guy who was super rude. nasty place! nasty staff!
great clean hostel near the beach, great location and lots to do!
great hostel, comfy sturdy beds, friendly staff, great seating areas, good laundry facility and great location.
excellent value for money.

expensive, but you definitely get what you pay for (and it's an expensive area in general). the beds are so comfortable, personal light and plug points, good lockers in room, lots of floor space for bags. good security with key cards at front door and room doors, in the best part of la - clean, good shopping, one block from the beach/pier. great breakfast provided, cereal, bagels, bread, yoghurt, tea/coffee/juice. the showers were cold both times i had one during my stay! maybe just bad timing?
need some improvements in the common areas to make it better for socializing. maybe the layout of the furniture.

great location, minutes walk from great shopping, the peir & beach. all other places accessiable by bus, train etc. walking distance to pubs, restaurants & bars. hostel offered a lot of activities & for nights people wanted to stay in there was a tv room with a flat screen & couches. had a very homely, comfy feel. rooms large & spacious with a clean, hot shower. staff were friendly as well.
best hostel i have ever been! it is not party/social kind of place but it is nice and younare still able to meet some lovely people. definitely will recommend!
the best location.

a greatly equipped hostel. beach, food and shops all around. good grocery store down the road. though the place lacks atmosphere. not enough travellers to chat to. but i did find some cool people around and the facilities made up for it. though no a/c is annoying considering the price. also no alcohol or smoking anywhere on site was annoying as it forced allot of people away. the patio area was really nice, but since no alcohol or smoking could be done there it wasn't used for socialising.
fantastic place to meet new people and amazing location for the beach:)
very good facilities and hygiene but too big to get new friends.
perfect location and breakfast is one of the best i've ever had in a hostel. great place to stay!

great hostel, location and cleanin good.  only thing i didn't like was the extra cost for bag storage form more than 2 hours when checking out.. also should have an airport shuttle a bit more accommodating
great location by the beach. good facilities and very clean. thanks very much.
this hostel is better than an hotel. great great great place to stay. the best hostel i've ever been.
really dirty, and service is bad.

i would defiantly recommended location was the best some of my friends stayed in other areas in la and they were very jealous of my location. so much yummy food, great shops, live music and the beach is all at your doorstep. the pub crawl was fun and the common areas very cool felt like a hotel. i stayed in a 10bed door female very spacious. defiantly stay again and recommend to friends......
one of the best hostels i´ve stayed in!

this hostel is really close to the mall, pier and good eating spots! had a really nice communal sitting area/courtyard which was nice. breakfast was just your basics but still hit the spot :) the only downfall would be one particular male staff member who wasn't very friendly but overall it was a good stay!

really good hostel. very clean. good breakfast, wi-fi for free available. but no aircon in the room. can get a bit hot at night.  every bed has ist own light and powerplug. thats very good.  nice common areas with different things to do! tv-room, internet-room, reading-room......

the hostel was really well run including being very lean and hospitable. however on the day i arrived i got told i couldnt stay in my room for 2 nights (as requested) and had to check out again the next day and then check in again the next day which was annoying seeing as i ha to pack all of my things etc and then reenter the hotel and put it in the storage facilities when people in the room were staying for longer periods of time. other than that the hostel was amazing and value for money.
i checked in 10pm (22:00) and they had overbooked. they had no more beds left, so they set up 2 make shift beds for another guy

stayed at this hostel for six days during that six days, at no matter what time of the day, i did not once have even a lukewarm shower, the water was so cold that this, i believe, was the reason why i ended up with bad flu. i don't know if this was because i was situated on the fourth floor. despite this i felt the hostel was obviously in a very good location, the staff at the front staff were adequate, activities they provided were excellent and the housekeeping staff were the real stars!
easy people, near the beach!

they added about 6$ per night on top of the hostelworld sum of taxes/fees. some of the staff were terrible and unfriendly. the rooms were not very well cleaned. otherwise, it's an ok place in an ok location. avoid the comedy night!

pros: beautiful building, really easy to get to the beach and decent breakfast spread.     cons: however, the staff acts like you're bothering them if you ask questions, the 'activities' aren't that great and there's not a lot of personality. and it's a dry hostel! definitely did not meet any new people at this hostel -- it's a very quiet, keep to yourself vibe.
you should give a receipt to customers when they check out, like in all other hotels.
had a great time there! metso many nice people!

great location! could have activities for the guests - not having it makes really hard to meet other travelers because the majority of them are traveling in groups.great room & they offer breakfast! i don't like the fact that you can not consume alcoholic beverage at the hostel.but overall is a great place & i love santa monica!
there are some sand in my bed ,,that's only one thing im complaining,,mostly are excellent!
staff were very helpful, printing out directions, keeping the suitcases in the storage room etc
very close to the pier and 3rd street mall. clean and secure. it was a little hard for me to find, but was nice
great hostel best in los angeles by far, clean, tidy, great location, friendly and helpful staff will defiantly be returning its just a shame you cant stay any longer than 2 weeks!!

great hostel but lacked in atmosphere as i am a young single traveller. was too big to try and talk to people and everyone minds their own business. great hostel otherwise, perhaps better for groups. realllyyy expensive for a hostel though.

being the only hostel in santa monica there is not much option but we were happy with the quality of beds, common areas and cleanliness. position is great. felt more like a hotel that other hostels as there is not a fun/energetic/friendly vibe.

the negatives: wi fi dropped out a lot and wasn't available on all floors, the staff were efficient but not very friendly. on the plus side: good location, good breakfast included (coffee, juice, bagels, toast, peanut butter, jam, two cereals), organised tours to the getty centre/comedy nights/pub crawls, individual light and socket at each bed :)
the women's bathroom (4th flloor) was dirty during our stay (3 nights), and some of the showers clogged.

i liked it there, it was close to the beach and downtown! also rooms were very clean and it was good that they had more then just peanutbutter and jelly for breakfast, when we had questions the staff was nice and helped us.

great location, very close to santa monica pier and promenade, bus stops and travel agency. personnel was very nice and helpful. the shower was always a mess, many people and water everywhere.  room key didn't work well.
keep up the good work!

this hostel is located in santa monica not in los angeles. you need 45 minutes to reach hollywood boolevard and 1 hour la downtown in bus. it is well located in santa monica not in la. do not be surprised. but the hostel is great. awesome breakfast included. clean. 2 blocks from the beach and the pear. good and friendly staff. santa monica is nice. i recommend this hostel. but if you want to visit la, there is hostel better located close downtown.
location, location, location

this hostel hasn't a good ambiance, too big it's more an hotel than a hostel! we stole our food, and we were not the only one!! taff a little bit rude... i was disappointed happily the location is great.
this hostel is huge. not much atmosphere, felt very much like a dorm room. location is great though.
a great place to stay, i wish i could had stayed for a longer duration!!!

we loved  this hi so much we revisited for the last few days of our trip! the location is brilliant, just two blocks from the beach which you can walk, cycle or rollerblade etc to venice beach and a 10 sec walk to third street promenade which is a thriving hub of activity. the amenities are also great, good sized communal kitchen and dining. the outdoor area was lovely,great atmosphere and this is where we spent most of our time. breakfast was good, basic but clean rooms, great staff,

really liked my stayed there. the location is unbeatable! you will have a great time there. make sure you have a hostelling card orl else it is quite convenient to get one. it costs around u$d28 and you may get one night free if eve stayng in other hostel and if you dont get it or already have it they charge an etra u$d3 per night...so, it is worth it. only thing that i did not like is that they do not charge what hostelworld states as balance due on arrival..of course they charge more, why?

one of your staff members we complained to didn't not help or fix the situation that was caused by a very aggressive and un stable women being allowed into our dorm! it was a ten person dorm and we complained about this spasific person at 11.00am and all nine of us got turned away and then it took a turn for the worst at 2.00am when the police had to be called! i would like my money back because to be out in that situation when you're scared for your own life and so are nine other!
a nice place to stay in santa monica
although i was in a room with 10 beds, it was very quiet.
there is no ac in the room. i think this is problem. but the other things was awesome. i liked it a lot.

this is the third time i have stayed in the h.i. la/santa monica hostel.  i enjoy the large hotel feel of the hostel, their excellent breakfasts, and their organized events.  the breakfasts are the best i've seen in any hostel with a lot more than just peanut butter, jam, and toast.  i went to the acting class, two comedy nights,  the pub crawl, and the club hop that was sponsored by the hostel.   in all four of these events, i had fun and met new friends from other countries.

the location is great, being close to the beach, the promenade, and public buses. i felt safe going out at night, but despite the security door the homeless do get in. there was a very large and very crazy homeless man running throughout the halls at about 3 in the morning banging on all the doors until security was called. breakfast is "meh" but free, lockers are great but bring a lock, no ac, and common areas need to be reorganized to get people to socialize more. everyone's on their laptop.
this is a really nice and convenient hostel. it needs better air conditioning in the rooms but the cleanliness and good lockers make up for that.

the hostel is in a great safe location in santa monica. the rooms are clean and have a large locker for your suitcase (mine was pretty big and just about fitted) though you do need your own padlock. there is something on every night so it's quite a sociable place and the staff are really helpful about extra activities or if you need directions or recommendations.  there are fans in the room but no air con which is the only downside as it can get pretty warm!

rather expensive, but definitely worth it. great location (very close to the beach, the pier, the restaurants and bars), very helpful and friendly staff, great facilities. pool table, patio, good kitchen. excellent beds with personal lamps and sockets in spacious, clean rooms. highly recommended!

i don't normally go in for expensive chain hostels, but in this case convenience and cleanliness won out for me and i was really happy with my decision, despite the expenses. personality is pretty run of the mill, and it was kind of hard to meet people (not the best if you want a party hostel probably), but it was safe, clean, well-controlled and super close to the beach. there's $5 overnight parking 15 min walk away that wasn't bad at all, either, and made my life much easier.
nice place to sleep, poor for meeting people.
had a great time there. perfect location. close to the pier and beach and shopping.

really nice hostel and great location. atmosphere was not that great and it was hard to meet people even in a 10 bed room. there a no drinking or smoking policy, which reduces the social side of the hostel and meeting new people.

fantastic hostel - clean, feels safe, in a good area, so close to the beach, really easy to find. $5 pasta meals on tuesday and free breakfasts are great. staff were friendly, approachable, helpful and had a sense of humour.

the hostel has a great location, close to the beach, 3rd st promenade and buses to take you further. the rooms were clean and spacious. the kitchen is also really big and well equipped.   it is a big hostel though, and as such doesn't really have that community feel of a small hostel. everyone is there doing their own thing. the no alcohol rule also means that you can't sit around and have a beer and chat with other guests (which is only a personal preference!). overall, a great hostel.

it was a very good stay. very big hostel , good facilities , good security and great location , 1 block from the beach  , almost on the promenade , it's where all happens in santa monica. i was in a 6 people dorm  wich has enough space. only weird things is that it's a dry hostel and doesn't have a  bar so i lacked a bit of atmosphere. the staff was a bit " cold" too compared to other hi staffs ...well i guess it's the la way maybe. i had a very good stay.

really enjoyed our stay here, i normally stay in venice beach so this was my first stay in santa monica, the hostel is huge, everything is new they have fantastic facilities, basically everything you want in a hostel and a great breakfast.
really lovely hostel, great location, clean. all you need from a hostel.
hi santa monica is the best hostel for travellers visiting la. santa monica is the best area to stay and i can't think of a better location or hostel to stay than this.
nice and clean hostel, good location, friendly and helpful staff, tons of different things to do and easy access. would definitely stay here again if i come back.
nice breakfast!
it was  awesome!!!! actually it was my first experience to stay at hostel however i  felt that i ve never booked the hostel like this in my life  kk

entrance to hostel a bit hidden by travel shop besides it. ( the  guy in the shop said it always happens that people booked with hi go into shop first)  besides this the reception was run efficiently as it was busy when i checked in.all the information about the hostel is given in writing ( prepacks) on arrival. the place was kept clean. breakfast was adequate for my needs.  location of hostel is fantastic for the beach ( 2 minut)  .it was quiete overnight and people of all ages mingled well

this hostel was awful for atmosphere. there's nowhere to gather outside like a patio to hang out on. no atmosphere mostly because of the no alcohol rule but also because of the hostel being so unwelcoming, there's nowhere u really get to chill and meet people. the comedy show was incredibly bad and the staff should remember to tell you which bed you've been assigned up one checkin.
there was too many people in a room, maybe thats why room has humid atmosphere.
2 things would help make it all above average.  need more bathrooms.  don't hide the dish washing soap.  people are washing their dishes without using soap at breakfast.

location is perfect for all things santa monica. found the beds very short and narrow and rooms had very little space to put your baggage. one staff member was unhappy to store our bags for 4 hours, saying normally they would charge for anything over 2 hours, i've never encountered that in a hostel before. large school group was annoying but obviously a regular part of hi business. free comedy comedy night was a great initiative.

great stay and will stay the again when i visit la. one worker there, elise, really tried hard to get me a cab so i could go see my friend's play on the other side of town.  great service all around.    as for the environment, my roommates were pretty cool for the most part.

excellent facilities with quiet common rooms, tv room, computer room, etc.  it is a bit of a party hostel, plus they let groups of school children stay there.  the kids were constantly running around unsupervised and shouting at each other and generally being a nuisance, which ruined the feel of the place.

my second time here and have to say the location is fab.  staff are helpful and free breakfast is good.  however i had a dorm room over looking the street and main entrance which was very very noisy.  other than this rooms were clean, bathrooms clean and hostel is comfortable.  i'd stay again for sure when in la.

stayed here for the second time, because it is one of the best options in la/santa monica. beds are quite comfy (compared to other hostels) and the atmosphere is mostly good to excellent.    i didn't like that using the computers is sooo expensive, considering that the stays are already expensive. also the price mentioned in hostelworld is excluding taxes and if you're not a hi member you will have to pay extra too, so the stay is even more expensive than at first look.
make sure the cards work because it kind of frustrating to have to swipe your card repeatedly when you've gone to the bathroom late at night.     the shared showers need better drainage.
the hostel, the staff, facilities and location is great! the only thing i have to mention is te poor wi-fi connection, too many people trying to use it and didn't work!

i had a very pleasant stay at the hostel, i'd say it's above an average hostel. it was mainly clean and is located in a very good area! i'm sure i will be back some time in the future! the beach and shopping area are only one block away each and there is a tourist information center right next door. i never felt helpless or lost! the money was definitely worth it!

if you don't mind paying a lot to sleep in a hostel that feels like an army camp this is the place to stay. the rooms are simple, clean and the bathroom is shared by about 50 others. it has all the required facilities but you must pay for everything additional. computers, lockers etc, all extra.
nice clean hostel, good common areas and great breakfast. location couldn't be much better!
staff was very accommodating to our needs!

it was an awesome hostel in a great location. minutes walk to sm pier and 3rd street promenade! only downfall was the bathroom floors were a bit disgusting so i just wore things in the shower. also some events that they had on were cancelled so that was a little irritating when it came to planning your time. but would definitely recommend it to anyone!

i had to alter my arrangements several times due to meeting up with friends  and the staff were very good at altering my bookings and took it in there stride  as though it was an everyday event  also they put me in a small room where ever possible which was preferable as a  more senior citizen and not into noise or late night partying  very impressed
the staff were extremely helpful, friendly and always saw someone cleaning which made me feel a lot more comfortable staying at h.i!
the hostel was clean, confortable, the staffs were educate and very nice. i really had a great time there. and also the location is great.
everything was better than expected, though the door card lost it's charge twice in the middle of the night i had to have it re charged

awesome location! just 2 blocks to the pier and one block to the main shopping street. lockers in the room were awesome, big enough for suitcases with shelving for belongings. shared bathroom facilities weren't too great, virtually no privacy for showering. some staff were great and some notsomuch. i'd stay there again though for the location.

i spent a very good stay here, it's clean, big locker in the room, several common rooms, patio, very big kitchen. location is just perfect (one block to the beach). there is a real good breakfast (yogurt, fruit juice, cereals, toasts, jam, muffins, tea, coffee...). in the other hand you have to pay 3$ per night if you don't have the membership card and wifi doesn't work in the room.

a good hostel in a great location near the beach! the only thing letting it down was the lack of atmosphere and vibe. if your not in a group and want somewhere with more of a vibe i suggest somewhere else.

i fell in love with hi hostel the first day i stayed there. the facilities are clean and well-maintained. i had to book an extra night and apply for membership. they had a lot of activities to make your stay more special. i'm staying at their san francisco branch the following week - just because of the awesome experience i had.
cheaper 'after checkout' security lockers would be an improvement.

brilliant location! very secure overnight parking facilites close-by. lots of shops in the area. close to the beach and the boardwalk. for a hostel, it was clean enough. the wi-fi could be a little bit better. the breakfast isn't special but on par with other hostels i have stayed at. the staff were friendly and helpful. lockers in the rooms, bring your own lock! not the cheapest hostel but for the location it is good value for money! would come again!
it should be better with more bathrooms.

beautiful youth hostel but poor ambiance... no evening activities or bad shows with poor artists...  i didn't talked to anyone, this is the first time in a youth hostel, and i travelled a lot in youth hostels all over the world for years...
no wlan in rooms! :(
great place. no party and the y allow kids of 14 years to stay.   staff is cool except for fergie.    location is excellent.

i enjoyed my stay at this hostel. the staff were friendly and met some really good guys! look forwarding to visiting again. i highly recommend this hostel to anyone who is seeking accommodation at santa monica, the location is perfect!

things are very good. just 2 things to be pointed out: wifi is only available on the 1st and 2nd floor which is not very convenient. people went to bar crawls organised by the hostel come back later but did not keep noise down which is not very nice to the people already sleeping.

another reviewer mentioned that there was no hot water in the showers - there is hot water, but it takes about 5 minutes to get hot, so turn on the water, then brush your teeth, pee etc and by the time you're done the water will be hot.     also, one of my roommates stole my bag of toiletries, so remember to lock things up even if it's cheap shampoo and toothpaste. i don't blame the hostel for the theft.
the family rooms are great and maybe you should have more of them. they are hard to book online - can that be fixed?

only stayed briefly. good to have 24hr staff and access. had smaller room of 4 which was also nice and quiet.    i travel a lot for business and stay in hotels but as a quick stopover leisure trip this seemed a much better option than a cheap motel/hotel.
wifi really bad
a very well set up hostel in a great location.  would highly recommend it to anyone.
had a great stay here, the location is wonderful!
great clean hostel with friendly organised staff.
good hostel

in a great part of santa monica. it is literally a block from the beach. parking will cost you anywhere from $5 a day for uncovered parking and $14 a day for garage parking. lots of yoga places around the hostel. weekdays not in the summer does not have a great night life (everything closes at midnight) but the location makes up for the lack of night life. i would go back for sure.

the hostel was in a great location with plenty of activities and stuff to do. the rooms were probably the best ive ever stayed in. kitchen area was great. garden was lovely. the only downers were the wifi connection was a bit tempremental, the tv didn't get fixed for 3 days and at one point a homeless guy managed to get into the hostel which was uncomfortable because he wasn't escorted out the whole time i was eating my dinner. overall i would still definately recommend the hostel.

we had a fantastic time at hi santa monica. the staff were all very nice when we came in and the beds were already made up when we got to our room. the whole hostel was very clean and the little lobby with the fireplace was super comfortable! we went on the bar crawl that night with the hostel and didn't know what to expect, but had a ton of fun. we even made a couple of friends visiting from brazil who rode with us the next day to tour hollywood. i would definitely recommend this hostel!
love staying here when i'm in la.  can't beat the price and the staff is always very helpful.
excelente place to stay... i loved it :)
shower water temp was unpredictable.
the hostel is too big - it feels impersonal like a hotel. and you can't drink there so there's not a lot of socializing.

the wifi connection in this hostel is very very bad, almost to the point where you don't have access to internet when staying there. other than that everything was pretty good. showers and toilets pretty clean. character and atmosphere pretty cool, staff pretty friendly.   honestly an average hostel in a good location.
i love the community sense of the hostel, there are free nightly and daily events for hostel guests.

great location - only one street away from the beach as well as being close to shops, grocery stores, buses to the airport and buses into town. exceptionally clean rooms, bathrooms and kitchen. daily breakfast was adequate. helpful staff.
clean well maintained friendly.  needs more electrical hookups. needs wick in rooms.

a great hostel, i'll definitely be back. really reminded me of the spirit of what youth hostels can and should be about. the staff seem really happy there and did everything they could to help. good breakfasts too. thanks guys!

a good, safe, located and clean hostel, the staff are very helpful and friendly, theo helped me with directions even though he was very busy. i myself didn't like this hostel as much as others as because of it's size it's very hard to meet people and doesn't have much character, but if your tavelling in a group this is fine. the tours that they put on in the morning are very good and the breakfast is one of the best that i've seen in hostels.
it was clean and quiet during my stay.
very nice thank you

great location in santa monica - staff gave you loads of info about the area, and they run really good tours. the only things that let it down were that there's no bar and unfortunately the showers were only ever lukewarm, which is a bit unpleasant when it's cold outside! overall though, i'd definitely recommend this hostel.

theo was very helpful! wished there were more toilet stalls in washroom on our floor. the pub crawl was boring. the location is close to everything! the info centre very helpful...needed to get to ontario, ca and they provided me with everything.

lovely place to stay. great free breakfast. the ban on alcohol was a bit strange though, i didn't expect that, however it created a good vibe in the hostel. really clean hostel, lovely staff, great location but if you want to get into hollywood the public transport takes aggges!

brilliant location-sandwiched between shopping promenade and the beach. the hostel was clean and the rooms well set out with the feeling of having enough space. a key card is required to get through reception and also into your room, medium sized locker included. the atmosphere is calm, with many people doing their own thing in the lounge areas. the kitchen could use more equipment. cost was more than expected when non-member fee and occupancy tax added(about $4 per night).

excellent hostel with good breakfast, free walking tours to venice beach and la downtown . entertsinment at night  had all the faqcilities ,security and was so good i have booked to return. i have recommended the hostel to others

considering how much we paid for this hostel, we were a little disappointed. it has a great location and the facilities are  pretty clean. we were booked into a 6 bed dorm and it was so small there was no where to put our stuff ( the dorm was full). we moved to an 8 bed dorm and it was better. the rooms need more powerpoints. overall it was fine, just lacked atmosphere.

i would like to see fruits in the breakfast, enough with apples and bananas, and may be not to canceled the activities because a rain the day before but to change it.    otherwise i loved the spirit of the hostel.
well i hope there will be wifi in the rooms in the future

the hostel itself is clean, and the kitchen and bathroom facilities are great.    meanwhile, i have never encountered such rude and unhelpful staff. no smiles, no please, no thank you. in addition, things weren't explained to use properly and we were dissappointed in how we were treated.    the wifi situation is very poor considering the amount of money being paid at the hostel.   they should have a look at how well st christopher's hostels are run.

enjoyed my time here, great location close to the beach, shops, bars etc! staff were helpful, breakfast was average but was free so no complaints! the wifi is frustrating as there is many to choose from but not all work great! bathrooms were clean and the rooms were spacious!
amazing location, good facilities like the tv room and the laundry room and the dining area...no complaints except that the wifi can be a bit spotty sometimes- that's about it :)

good hostel, but it extremely lacks the atmosphere. the cleaning needs to improve - bathrooms seems to be dirty and are not sweeped/mopped properly. only one hair dryer worked while the rest were broken . overall, the location is great and is not far from the beach and pier and the breakfast was good. there is one particular staff that have made one dinner night and the pub crawl a dissapointment. not going to comment or name, but i feel he wasn't professional with his job.

i am concernd about the high cost of stayng at the sm hostel in dorms during the summer.  $50/night is expensive, contravening the mandate that hostels be affordable to encourage traveling, promoting understanding.  i am concerned about the recent decision to not allow people living in los angles county to stay at the santa monica hostel.  the county is vast, taking 5-6 hours to travel from one end to the other by public transportation.  those living in la county travel in internationally too.

the internet connection works only in the common areas, not in the rooms, and it's very unstable. the whole atmosphere was kind of unwelcoming, the staff seemed to hate their job and i felt uncomfortable hanging around at the hostel. they didn't promote the activities nor had a clue about public transportation when i asked them, so i pretty much had to plan everything on my own.

i enjoyed my stay at the hostel. it provideded more extras than most motels/hotels.  i appreciated there being a separate lounge for the tv, electronic communications, and socializing.  i loved that there was a free iron and board in the laundry room.  the best part was at the end of the day being able to get a hot drink in the kitchen or fix a snack or supper there!

i have stayed several hostels in la, and this is one of better one so far. most other hostels are pretty noisy all night and much more dirty than this hostel. the only problem is that wifi here only works on the first floor near the kitchen area. it often does not work everywhere, and i saw some people went to starbucks near by to connect to the internet.

didn't really enjoy my stay for several reasons:  1. not enough plugs in the room, only two in 6 bed room, had to go down to the reading room and charge my phone at midnight.  2. only given a blanket/towel serve as substitute for comforter, had to put all my coats on top of it to stay warm at night.  3. short breakfast time and very limited choices with limited seats at dining area.  4. a lot of elders and other folks that are not youths staying there. not a good atmosphere for students.
fantastic place to stay.
too expensive, the price was 36$ including tax, but 25$ would have been better.  i paid 20$ at the hostel on hollywood blvd.
probably one of the best hostels in north american annive staying in a lot.

had my computer stolen from bed in the the second it took for me to get to the toilet and back after waking up from a nap. front desk were unhelpful and told me all i could do was fill out an incident report and walk the fifteen minutes to the police station. on arriving there i met another guest from the hostel who had also had something stolen, police then let slip that this happens all the time there and that it should be avoided. didn't even give me a free pass for their internet, shocking!!

i stayed for one night at the h.i. hostel but me and my friends  had a really good time.the hostel is really big therefore there is a big kitchen, dinning- and a living room for everybody,also the  have a movie room.the  breakfast was excellent,bagels,toast,cereals...  our room was small but still okay for 4 people,it was clean and the sheets were good.the bathroom was big,clean and had hairdryers!!!i  the only thing that wasn´t so good,it was loud in the hallway for our room because oft the echo.
this place was the best i've stayed in! great location and every facility you could possibly need. had a great time would definitely recommend!!!
this place is top botch, clean, friendly and the best location!! stay here if you can. will be coming back here next time i'm in town :)
was great  clean  close to 3rd street and the pier good fun would stay again!

great hostel. very handy location. right in downtown, close to the shops and the beach. free breakfast was good, bagels and cereals. biggest hostel kitchen i've been in. dorms were nice and clean with fresh bedsheets and towels. would definitely recommend this hostel. thank you.
the kittchen was laking many kitchen utensiles like a water boiler etc  the schweres were not so good, the water didnt get very hot   the hair dryers wenn out while using it

it was very good , a good place very clean big cook big relax place that's very the only thing was lil beat too bad its the traveler dont very share they only go on their laptop and dont talk its too bad otherwise that was good and i will come back dont know when but i ll do it ;) take care

clean, not noisy, and well located near to beautiful santa monica beach. if you want to visit downtown la, you'd better stay in a hostel which is located there, since it is >1h by bus to downtown la. great if you want a quiet stay at a clean well located hostel. if you are looking for a fun place, i would recommend going to another place.

outstanding location - seconds away from santa monica beach. a bike rental just around the corner (colorado/2nd st.) is a good choice to move around and reach venice, hermosa, ... shuttle to lax ($15) stops just in front. decent cleaning, big kitchen, good comfort and helpful staff.

hostel is in a good part of santa monica, close to the beach and everything else you need. rooms are ridiculously hot, good luck to you if you manage to get a good night's sleep. staff are really nice and professional. wifi is pretty tempermental and breakfast is fairly average
if i had to make one suggestion, it would be to get more ventilation in the bathrooms as they were constantly steamy, however overall great location and great value. no major complaints.
carpet in the dormitory is old and a bit dirty  no lock on female bathroom
wonderful experience :) loved our stay there.

a little on the pricey side of hostels but worth it, only 2 blocks from santa monica beach. perfect location. if you only want to visit s.monica, this hostel is for you, if you want to see other sights in l.a. it might not be - it takes forever to go anywhere else using public transit.nice lounges with wifi, good, clean kitchen and beds were okay. lockers were a bit small, couldn't fit in my backpack. very nice staff members, made me smile every morning even though i'm not a morning person!
great hostel! very well located... security was also found there! would stay there again,
what a lovely, comfortable, clean place, and so i am planning to return to it.
great location, clean and secure. defo a great place to stay if you want to do beaches and be away from hollywood

this hostel feels like life at ucla! all the peanut & jelly sandwiches you can eat, plus healthy cheese on wheat, oj, a bowl of corn flakes, two kinds of yoghurt atop ladles of sliced peaches and hot coffee at the ready.  the two palatial reading rooms are ivy league, the internet facilities are at graduate level and the tv room when i visited featured a tutorial in foreign & domestic policy taught by joe biden. total "tuition" is only $30 and a place to sleep is included!

its like a hotel and this isnt always good. it has a lot of acommodation, a good tv room and a "place to read". but in fact, people never speaks between each others and making friends became a very hard work. i'd rather staying in a smoller hostel.  the staff isnt too helpful and wifi doesnt work at rooms. at the end, guess are always at the share rooms just to be on internet.
the doors slamming are a problem and the construction across the street made sleeping with ear plugs imperative.

the hostel looks pretty new. very clean, good atmosphere and safety. location is close to beach, when it's sunset, that was beautiful. but about an hour far from downtown, if you have lots of plan for downtown, you'd have hard time for trasit (especailly, you don't have a car, l.a. public transit schedules are very unoften.)
the santa monica hi hostel, is the best hostel i have ever stayed in.    loved it, thanx, lisa
felt really safe in this hostel and it was so clean! location is amazing!

it was more expensive than other hostels in us.  i can't use wi-fi in my room(3th floor) and sometimes in whole hostel..  but it is really near from santa monica beach and shopping center.  it was clean.

really good value for money, but overall i didn't think the stay felt that great - big kitchen with fluroecent lights that felt  like a school cafeteria . the cortyard was great but since it closed 11pm there wasn't really any space left to hang out after that that felt relaxed. the location was great though and rooms were ok, just need a bit of athmosphere and personality.
very good in every services and the best location!

free breakfast nice vibes and beautiful outdoor courtyard. has awesome tv area and good wifi... fun acticites with free dinner 3 times a week. and the volenteers are super fun especially the guy who does poker night :)
perfect location, just one minute from the beach and third street promenade. nice and clean. can totally recommend to stay there. no better option in santa monica!!!
great location, close to beach/shops/restaurants. i only stayed one night, but breakfast/kitchen facilities were good. water bottle filler was handy. nice courtyard area.
