this hostel is very big, hundreds of people are staying there. but it never feels too busy. there are very nice activities organised in order to meet ppl, such as the pub crawl. plus, the location is definitly the best, 2 blocks from santa monica beach. i highly recommend it.
wifi was pretty dodgy, and there was only one type of cereal for breakfast. other than that it was a nice hostel and the facilities were really good.
for people who don't travel with high tech equipment like computers, there isn't great value for money re. computers.
it's a nice choice to stay. i hope i can get a chance to visit u.s.  next time i will spend my vocation completing a whole one
really great location, staff always seemed to be clean and very spacious room....negatives - a little expensive, so big and so many people atmosphere lacks a bit, but overall would recommend.
plug socket at the bed would be convenient. better wifi. the room was a little bit smelly with 6 occupants.  the bread was really foamy. these are my only remarks., they are minor.

unfortunately it seems to be a common sense for this hostel, the staff is really not friendly. they are not exactly rude but do not expect much more than a really cold hotel approach.  the place looks more like a hotel than a hostel, people do not interact to each other as a hostel. if you are travelling alone or need to cook it is a good deal as you will save money, otherwise a normal hotel can be more comfort.
great hostel. very secure. can get to the beach within 5 minutes. lovely staff members.

this hostel was great- the location is perfect! plenty to see and do around, plus the trips the hostel put on were good too. everything you need in the hostel, couldn't of asked for more really (although the rooms were incredibly hot at night)
really nice hostel, great location just a little bit more clean. my bed was full with hairs =s

i liked how they let you borrow beach towels, that was really great! i think i was supposed to get a bath towel when i first got there too but they must've forgot or something. the serving ladies and the fresh lemonade are very nice too.

the staff at this hostel were a little hit and miss - the person on desk when i first arrived was unhelpful and couldn't tell me basic travel information about the area. it's worth bearing in mind that it takes about an hour on the bus to get to la, it's in downtown santa monica, which is nice enough, but not la. it's a bit of a shame that there weren't really any activities going on to attempt to get guests to mingle, but in terms of building and facilities, it's a great place to be.

like most hi hostels the wifi at the hi  santa monika is stuck in 1980. you can only connect on the bottom floor and then chances are you won't be able to do much of anything as the bandwidth is appalling. so much of modern backpacking relies on the internet for trip planning - get with the future hi and upgrade your wifi
great place to stay. caters for all.

staff were helpful and friendly, rooms and bathrooms were kept quite clean which was nice but the dorms did get very hot during the day and at night made it difficult to have a restful sleep, especially with 8 people in one room

i found the staff rather unhelpful and unfriendly, they seemed to want to chat to each other more than the people who were staying.  it was also very unsociable, nearly every person was on their laptop or other electronic device.  the room i was in was incredibly noisy, i think they emptied the bins outside it every morning. the other 3 people who were in my room were students and it was horrendous! their stuff was all over the room the would talk on the phone and have the large light on till 2.3o

super friendly staff, great location, and very comfortable place to stay.  the large courtyard is a particularly nice aspect of it. the only (minor) negative is that while the hostel has ac, the rooms themselves do not.

everything was good. but they want to improve services there are ways to do it, e.g. extend wi-fi coverage to the 3rd and 4th floors, because it's not very comfortable to go downstairs every time when you need an internet access. also announcements about tours and local event should be placed more prominently.
wifi can be a lot better.
great place to stay in la!!

i had an incredibly uncomfortable stay because the room and upstairs were so hot. i couldn't sleep at night because i kept on waking up sweating, it was really horrible. when i was in the room all i wanted to do was get out of the room because i couldn't handle the heat. i also found the washroom to be quite dirty, particularly the shower area. i feel there is so much potential in this hostel as the downstairs is nice, but the heat ruined my stay.

the room was facing some air conditioning units on the roof and the noise was impossible, internet only works sometimes on the 1st and 2nd floors and i was on the 4th. apart from that all is good, breakfast is great, it is clean and safe, location is excellent and the staff was good too.
great place to stay! so much fun. the pubcrawl good be improved though..
the staff were so friendly and helpful

i had high expectations as this is a hi hostel. i was disappointed. there was no air con, so the room got stuffy and it was too got to sleep. wifi service was really bad and hardly ever worked. they only store luggage for 2 hours, then you have to pay. no privacy in the showers. it lacked atmosphere that a lot of other hostels have.  on the other hand, the kitchen facilities are excellent, it's a great location, breakfast is good.
staff amazing, great place to stay whatever your age, only drawback no air conditioning in the bedrooms so they became uncomfortably hot, fans are not enough for a santa monica summer.
toilet should be cleaner. pc not working and rooms poor equipped. atmosphere unpersonal
it is ver close to the beautiful beaches of los angeles, a lot of facilities to hang around, huge kitchen but no spices for cooking.
loved my stay at the hostel! they had night time activities which make it really good for single travlers to meet new people in a happy, safe and fun environment.

i really loved to stay in hi los angeles-santa monica, the staff were super kind, and helped us a lot. maybe the breakfast was a little bit poor.. i mean in variety!! value for money is absolutely perfect, and the situation incredible!!!
wifi areas throughtout the building.

typical hostel international - very clean and efficient but totally lacking in atmosphere or character. very dim attempt to create a sociable environment. despite this, free breakfast was fantastic and the facilities were very good and also well connected to other areas of l.a. the internet usage fee is not cool.
nice hostel close to the beach :-)

great hostel in a crappy, soulless city. staff are friendly and unpretentious, facilities are fantastic (lots of communal space indoors and outdoors with places to get away from the crowd if you just want to chill out for a bit), huge fully-equipped stainless-steel industrial kitchen and great location in the only part of l.a. any sane person would want to stay. would not hesitate to recommend this hostel provided being able to drink wherever you stay isn't a priority for you.

the location of the hostel is perfect. staff is ok but not very welcoming. some look tired and dont even look at you when you come up to the reception(not all,one girl was very nice) . hostel is in a very good condition, everything looks new and even stylish. as for the atmosphere its a typical hostel: many people, noisy, loud young people.  the biggest con though is that 10 people in the dorm is too much, doesnt feel comfortable at all.
safe and clean hostel and nice staff ;) doing the laundry wasn´t easy though cause many washing maschines didn´t work.. but all in all it´s a good hostel ;)
very conveniently located and a great deal
excellent hostel, no complaints. parking is terribly expensive - would be good if hostel struck a deal & came up with a solution.
could have done with a few more showers and some more ventilation in the room. it was so stiflingly hot! breakfast was amazing however, as was the location.

the hostel has everything you need!!  clean shower, nice rooms and lobby and it's huge. definetely is in the best location and i'd stay again for sure if i come back to santa monica.    cons: - a/c was not working very well  - i was having breakfast and one of the guys from the staff was starting to move everything to a different desk, i didn't realize they were ending the breakfast time....but what i think was rude was his speech "breakfast is over, i need to close "  - it's all about how you talk

stayed here for a night at the start and end of my trip, as my home flights go through la. had been to santa monica before, so chose it for the relaxing feel - beach, walking and biking around. wished i stayed longer so that i could have taken advantage of the hostel's tour to the getty museum.  met nice people, the staff were friendly, and the facilities adequate. the showers weren't the cleanest the second time around, but think that was only because i beat the cleaners to it.  would stay again
good stuff. pay for the location.
i thought the hostel was well kept and clean and the location was great, but i thought it was a bit overpriced for a hostel.
good location, good hostel. there is a cosy small open yard to relax, nice touch.
fantastic stay would of been good if there was a bar like the one in san francisco. however still had a great stay the staff was very helpful and welcoming.  thank you

loved the hostel, very clean, very organized. its location is beyond amazing so close to restaurants and the famous 3rd st. promenade thats full of flavor, lots of shopping and amc in case you wanted to see a movie. its a block away from the famous santa monica pier & the beach.. just loved it.  the only thing that i didnt like is the fact that the rooms had no a/c, only a fan & it was super hot. also didnt like the idea of a shared bathroom with the entire floor.

pros-location in santa monica, common areas, kitchen and breakfast and paid dinners  cons-the people staying there are young and inconsiderate in the dorms.  quiet policy-whats the point in having this if its not enforced?  please highlight to guests and suggest if you are leaving before 8am to pack bags the night before.  every morning i was woken up as early as 6am with people turning lights on and rustling bags for up to 45 mins. not cool.  internet was very slow.
this hostel was one of the best that i have ever stayed in.  i would recommend this to anyone that was staying in the snata monica area

very nice hostel with perfect location next to the sea side. free towels for the beach, free internet and good/cheap washing machines. living rooms are clean and spacious. perfect to relax. one of the best hostel i've ever been.
good location. clean. great atmosphere. very good value for money. recomended
i got two sets of 6 insect bites each, closely spaced; one on my arm, one on my back, possibly bed bugs, or fleas.  rooms 210, and 204, bed 3 in both rooms.

one of the best hostels i've stayed infraestructure wise. the facilities are top of the notch and the common areas are great for hanging around. if you don't have a car, santa monica is the place to stay!
had a great time there
had a great stay at the hi, excellent facilities and location. breakfast was good value. thought the price was a little high compared to other hi. overall great stay.
great place to stay. didnt have any problems. really good location, staff available the whole time. clean. reallygood

the hostel was just fine, and the location is amazing. it was the only hostel we could find that was so close to the beach. however i felt like the hostel takes advantage of its location by charging a comparatively high price for an average service. the hostel was clean and safe, but not as nice as any of the (much cheaper) hostels we stayed in elsewhere. overall, i have no real complaints about the hostel, just that the value for money is not great.
perfect location. clean, friendly, good vibe. the beach is so close you can practically spit on it.
great hostel, in a fantastic location. wish i had stayed longer in santa monica than in hollywood.

i was in santa monica at the start and end of my trip; i chose the area because it is more laid back - i wanted something easy going and when i feel like going for a walk, prefer the beach rather than downtown. also, close to the airport and to the getty museum.  my four bed dorm was fine, clean, and had a lot of space for bags. as all hi hostels, it is very big so it may have an impersonal feel. will stay again.
great place to stay! will recommend it for sure!
definitely the best address in if you want to stay in santa monica!

i enjoyed my stay at hi santa monica, everything was very clean and the staff was friendly, they helped when i had question about the area or how to get around for sigtseeing :)    it was quiet after the "quiet time" and there is space to relax and just come down after a day of walking around!    the beach is really close, just 5 minutes of walking and on 3rd street as a promenade and a mall with great stores, there is also santa monica pier, a great place to walk around :)
i think the acitivities for the night could be more diverse and made more attractive, for example you could offer parties!
great place met some really cool people, very clean, no bar but the location makes up for that would recomend to anyone
excellent hostel, perfect location near sta monica pier and 3rd street!    if you come to sta monica u must stay in this hostel!

it's a good hostel on a good location, but the staff don't give you a hostel feeling, but more like the feeling that you  get when have to pick something up at the goverment. the people make the difference!

the location in santa monica is great - the staff are really helpful, and if you stay there, definitely do the pub crawl - its a lot of fun. however, the wifi is touchy when you're on the second floor, and also the showers have absolutely no water pressure. they seem pretty unclean also.
it was great , location is cool a block from the beach !

big hostel, clean and friendly staff but a bit anonymous. internet is free but painfully slow. rooms are small compared to the spacious entrance hall and common areas. nice location though - a minute away from santa monica pier and just a 30minute walk along the beach to venice.
i would recommend the workers do a better job on cleaning the room and bathrooms

this was the first hostel that i have stayed at in the united states, and it was an excellent experience. they have a ton of activities for you to do, but i was most impressed with the overall atmosphere and character of the hostel. it was very clean, very pleasing to look at, and everyone was very kind and helpful. i'd definitely come back!
this place was awesome!  great facilities, good free internet, super helpful staff and everything i could have needed in a hostel and a perfect location too.  would definitely recommend!

location wonderful! staff helpful & cheerful.  breakfast great.  concerns: 1. hostel movie being played loudly until 11:30 pm in a room outside and below our (courtyard) window.  why would the hostel break its own quiet hours?!  2. bunk-bed mate talking on cell phone in the middle of the night - recommend some more reminders about cell phone etiquette &/or cell-phone-free room options. 3. the dishwashing system isn't very sanitary; doesn't the law in ca require a bleach dip?  why not institute?

it's a good ho;stel overrall...  but in huge hostels it's easy to not know anyone.  the shower in my room need some regulation cause it was cooling me alive.  breakfast good.  security good.  almost no plugs in the room.  but... ok...

staff are very helpful and friendly except for the gentleman who works the night shift. he's very rude, sharp and seems genuinely uninterested in helping guests. the hostel is very clean, and the location couldn't be better. the guys who were in charge of the bar crawl, were excellent! the only downside of the hostel is that alcohol is prohibited. this means that guests can not socialise together, instead they have to go to bars.
perfect location great for shopping and the beach, made lots of friends, throughly enjoyed my stay
just got my iphone stolen.. dont go there

very big hostel, feels like a hotel. additional to what you have to pay according to hostelworld, you pay about 5 dollars tax per night. use of anything costs money as well (internet 2 dollars per 20 min, washingmachine 3 dollars etc). it feels a bit impersonal and expensive, especially after arriving from south america. the location, security and touristinfo are really good.
the wifi was very poor. for travelers that wish to book flights or hotels/hostels whilst on the wifi... forget it! walk to a cafe to get good wifi. not impressed considering the money we pay!

if you want to party then this is the hostel to come to! organised cheap nights out, 3 meals a day, short walk to the beach, excellent vibe. if you want a quiet stay and to cook your own food, this is not the place to come.
great location, felt very safe at this hostel, will def stay here again if l'm ever in santa monica.
the room was fine and the beds comfortable but the showers were disgusting.
great location but rooms are a bit small

the hostel was great and it's location even better!! santa monica has a lot going on, and it's a really nice part of la. i was traveling alone and felt really safe in that area! the only thing that could be better are the showers-the pressure is pretty bad and they should get darker curtains. other than that-perfect!!
great! super clean and professional. great location and the wednesday night bar crawl was fun!! only negative comment is the price, too expensive for a hostel!

the staff directed me to the wrong bus stop for a bus that i needed to catch to meet a friend. the 'no drink' rule is a joke. i spent the evening in the courtyard. there were some french guys drinking and being obnoxious. they were also smoking marijuana and it was blowing in my face. i went to complain, there was no-one on the front desk. - unacceptable. you need to have a manned desk at all times. you have a 'best staff member' competition? none of them for me, they should all be disqualified.
the internet connection is terrible. surely this can be fixed so that it actualy works alot better than it does.

very expensive!! by the time you add tax and non-membership fees you're looking at about $50 p/n. but if you want to stay in santa monica this is the only hostel around. my advice is that if you are travelling with someone stay in a cheap hotel instead because it will be cheaper. free breakfast was average (cornflakes & small bagels) and they had lots of activities on display which looked good but they cancelled half of them. is very clean but way to expensive for the budget traveller.

5 star hostel! very clean, huge kitchen to cook in, excellent breakfast included, right in the heart of santa monica shopping area.   lots of common seating areas and organised activities. this was my second stay and iwill definitely be back.
bit steep at $40 a night, but that's la. santa monica is a great area to stay and hi is a nice clean hostel. not very social though.
this was my first time ever staying at a hostel and it was fantastic. excellent staff, comfy beds, and very safe. no complaints at all.
the hostel was amazing.  it's a place that u can go there with ur family.  so clean and quite. with friendly stuff just 2 blocks away from the  beach and city centre

great place to stay to avoid the hustle & bustle of downtown la and enjoy the relaxed beach lifestyle that santa monica offers. easy to book discounted tours from the shop next door and the $1 bus fare on the 'big blue bus'#3 from lax is a winner (about 40 min ride to just near the hostel). staff were friendly and helpful and the hostel had different activities on each day/night of the week. there are homeless people that frequent the outside of the hostel, but i would not let this put you off.
only hot shower,too hot water
very good place to stay, just not very cheap. plus the beds were not comfortable at all. apart from that the hostel is amazing.

the location in santa monica is excellent and facilities ok, but the hostel itself lacks character. it is more hotel like and the atmosphere is like that; no so much random chats with other than your room mates and people seem a bit distant. and not allowing to drink any alcohol in hostel premises is just stupid.
my only problem with the hostel was that the room was too bright, the curtains don't block the sun rays.
really awesome hostel!
it felt like a hotel. amazing!

tax is 14% and also there is a $3 charge each night you stay if you're not a ih member.  staff was helpful and it's a nice place.  really not much to do in santa monica though, and public transit to main la sites is about 30-45 min.
one of the best hostels i've stayed at. comfy beds and generous breakfast.

lovely hostel, clean, great location in lovely santa monica, staff very helpful and good fun also, my only problem was with the beds, very thin mattress most hostels have deccent mattress so this was a bit disappointing also the $5 fee for day storage again most hostels this is free...other than these 2 issues everything was great....
among a lot of hostel i've stayed this one was by far the best! it is highly recommended.

this was a really lovely place to stay. it wasn't a party hostel by any means, though people could go on pub crawls and explore the local night-life as they felt like it. i could be alone, but was able to meet people, go on tours, and enjoy the atmosphere of having so many friendly faces around.

i had the best time from check in to check out! the location is unbeatable, and the activities were such a ball. the staff was very friendly and the hostel was a great environment to get to know new people.
this hostel is awesome, if your in socal this is the hostel to stay at. great location 5 minute walk to santa monica beach & pier, the staff and fellow travellers are friendly. cheers.
amazingly good location and reasonable value for money. kind of soulless or bland but utterly functional. staff respond to emails superquick which is great!

the hostel was very nice and clean. a plus was definitely the free internet and the free printing. maybe they should organize the breakfast a bit better because there weren't many places to sit. also sometime the toilet paper was missing from the bathroom, but other than that it was a very pleasant stay!

one of the nicest hostels i've stayed in.  close to the beach, shopping, public transportation.  tours available next door.   internet cafe onsite, tv room, places to hang out and talk.   nice to have breakfast everymorning.  staff was friendly and helpful.
enjoyed my stay, though they were putting in new floors during my stay so couldnt access my room during the day apart from that i wouldnt have a bad word to say about it.  santa monica rocks!!
my only complaint is about internet. it could be fast and more reliable... the rest was excelent! graet people, grat place!
love this place and very  nice, but it  at the time i was staying there people were less social or outgoing.
hello everything was fine.

really liked this hostel, great location and as a lone traveler it was really easy to meet people. lots of organised tours and activities...only down side are the showers and the fact you can only get wifi on the 1st and 2nd floors! along with the $3 extra a night for not being a member! would gladly stay here again

the hostel was nice and in a good location. the problem was the staff, particularly the guy who worked the night shift. it took him 30 minutes to check us in and then put us in separate rooms, even though i had booked 4 months in advance. also we were charged significantly more than was on our hostel world receipt.    i would not stay here again solely because of the staff and their bad attitude.
best hostel i've stayed in. no question.

not pleased, after cancelling my stay it got charged to my credit card.   didn't stay there so can't comment on other aspects obviously but this leaves a fairly bad impression and i'll take my business elsewhere in future.
hostel very nice, lively and people available. rooms and bathrooms cleans, despite a lot of people who come in. breakfast good and various choices.

you have to pay for locker storage when you check out. they don't place the internet passed on the walls everywhere so people always asking eachother and most of the toilets don't flush properly. great location near beach/shopping area, clean, spacious rooms, lots of activities and drinking ban is good.
this was my first time staying in a hostel and it was great! perfect location, not too far from the pier and the promenade. stayed here for my spring break and i would definitely stay here again!!
great location, breakfast a plus.
a great place with perfect location.
perfect location, you couldn't get closer to the beach if you tried!

i really enjoyed my stay at this hostel, probably one of the best on my extended holiday around the world. very clean and good facilities. they also provide cheap dinners throughout the week and organise pub crawls, poker nights etc. i really liked the location - very close to the beach, the pier, heaps of shops and restaurants. you need to get a bus or shuttle to downtown la/hollywood, but they're just day trips anyway, don't want to stay there.

this is a great hostel, very well located, safe and very clean and organized! good breakfast too. my only two complains go to the showers (they were usually cold) and the internet connection, that is very slow! but i would definitely recommend it! although if you are looking for a party hostel, this is not the case... alcohol is not allowed in its premisses and the pub crawl they organized was not very good. besides, it does not provide much opportunity for meeting new people.

staff seem flat and are not overly keen to go out of their way. i approached the desk to ask for some scissors and they claimed they didn't have any. i'm sure their was a pair of scissors somewhere in their office. facilities are good but it lacks atmosphere. it is probably more family friendly then fun for young people. and you pay top dollar for it. i would probably stay in venice beach next time!!
it was a clean and friendly place.  everything was clean and there was plenty of everything needed.  not all hostels are as nice as this one.  and it's right near the beach just like was promised!!

i enjoyed the stay.  the staff and location were excellent.   just a couple of minutes walk to the beach and also to the shopping area on 3rd.  my only complaint was that the shower room was a rather unclean and i cut my finger on one of the hooks in the shower room.  it had a very sharp edge.

my only  complaint was that very little was done to enforce quiet hours. during the time i was there there was extremely loud outrageous conduct on two occassions where i had reason to complain about girls running shreiking along corridors at 3am.this was not an isolated incident as i am aware that another hosteller had to summon staff twice in one night to deal with similiar incidents.staff seem unwilling/ineffectual at dealing with this problem.needs sorting

its a great place with a great location, the breakfast is awesome as well. but the staff has nothing to do with costumer service...    all was set up for trolley holidaymakers witch the hostel was full of  as backpacker you are in a minority and almost feel unwelcome. if you are only a backpacker over day in the area they won't help you. that has nothing incoming with backpackers idea or hosteling international.  it was sad to see how a awesome backpacker.place was turned into a commercial.
great breakfast, just two minutes from the beach, clean toilets and bathrooms i would def come again nxt time i'm in santa monica

i really enjoyed my time at this hostel.  it was my first hostel experience by myself and i felt very comfortable.  the location was by far the best aspect of this place.  a block away from 3rd street promenade in one direction and a block away from the santa monica beach and pier in the other direction.  not to mention all of the public transport spots all around it.    the hostel itself was very nice, pretty clean and comfortable.  some of the staff was very kind, others seemed a bit put out.

friendly staff who was cleaning all the time. computers could be free with a time limit ! (most people have their laptop, but those who don't  would appreciate that service ) free coffee and tea very nice. bread and jam for breakfast little bit dry and jelly-style but free, so won't complain too much :)

i didn't really liked the bed. i was in a 6 bed room and the beds are very small and not very comfortable. and it would be an asset if on every bedside it would be a plug to charge their phones or laptops. also the showers didn't looked very clean.

included breakfast was great!  dorms/bathrooms no worries.  free comedy night was hilarious.   staff were great, but seriously, not enough of them for such a big hostel. i spent so much time waiting in line each time i needed to speak with them.  atmosphere not that friendly. if you're wanting a party hostel, this probably won't do.
very good hostel, despite i had to pay an extra charge cause i wasnt a hi member when i arrived,   if u are looking for a cheap hostel its not the option, but its very good

no character at all. it felt like a hospital. locker room style showers and toilets wasn't too good. no power outlets or lamps on/near the bunks (which were quite sqeaky as well). cleaning crews coming in to vacum sometimes around 8-9am, which i found a bit odd. vey clean hostel, and a great location near the beach, but that's about all it had going for it......
great facilities, clean, comfortable, would recommend to everyone.
great place, although the guy that's sometimes at the door doesn't seem too pleased with you presence.   oh, and don't be fooled, they'll charge taxes and etc, so it'll be $32 for the cheepest bed.
i wish i knew there were lockers in the rooms, i paid $5 for the ones downstairs then went to my room.  this is a great hostel though, loved the common areas, beds and rooms were roomy.  thank you.
best hostel i ever had!
shower room is so dirty that i can not take a shower.

big, airy, clean contemporary, cool hostel. loved being able to walk to the beach in 5 mins, dorms nothing spectacular but nice....and i liked all the different little communal areas dotted around the bottom floors....nailed the hostel experience!

i liked the location but the staff were a little rude when i needed information. the place was well kept and maintained, lots for the guests to do. good wifi and lots of computers to use. the kids running around bugged ma a little. the two guys in my room stank to high heaven, they need to open a window. that really ruined my stay. hair all over my bed. so gross. didn't stay the second night purely due to the stentch. the male bathroom was also pretty terrible. good for a night or two.
i liked too much, the place is wonderful for all types of persons.
very nice staff and service.  i just spent one night there, only one problem bother me: the shampoo is not very good to use.

free luggage storage while i was waiting for my plane would've been nice but overall a very secure and well layed out hostel, giving the illusion that it's not as big as it actually is!  also nice and close to the beach :)

and some comments about my stay there.     what to keep doing: the breakfast is very good.    what to fix: some staff can not understand international guests'english phone calling.     what to add to make the hostel the best: to make the airport shuttle booking 24hours available.    i stayed in your hostel from dec.27th-30th, room 301-02(els).i enjoy the time there.  i left an adaptor(white, small square form, only three holes,on the wall)and a knit woolly hat(dark green). i called the front desk about that

good: 1) clean and safe place. 2)nice staff but not as nice as in duohousing l.a.. 3) nice location, easy access to public transportation. 4） great  breakfast  bad:  the hostel can accommodate more people but i feel there is less communication.   overall it is a nice place to stay.
old but clean, well equipped  location also good

it's a good place you can go to the beach in 10 min by walking. but little bit far away to downtown la and hollywood, you need to take bus like 30 to 45 min. right next to the hostel there is a tourist agency which will offer special discount if you stay here. staff service is good also. the only thing which i don't like is you can't get wifi in your room, only in first and second floors and the speed of internet was so so slow especially in the night....

good location where you can enjoy sunset and sunrise everyday.and there are a lot of interesting activities.the only complaint is about the noise.every night there is a lot of noise outside my room.but overall,it's a good choice to stay there.

if you are not a hi member the price you pay is different from the one you are said when you book. they charge you $3 more for every night. it'squite a boring place. you can't even drink a beer in the hostel. some people live in there and the room i was staying in was totally messed up.
beautiful hostel, very well-located (close to 3rd street promenade, next to the beach). they give lots of info on how to get places, etc.

was a great experience and a wonderful hostel. the only think i think they could improve on is having an age barrier as the old generation that came in on my extended made it awkward and uncomfortable when sitting in common rooms.

nice hostel in nice place but lacking a bit of atmosphere. lack of bar or drinking area means that socialising in the hostel is minimal, when i was there everyone seemed to be isolated and sat on their laptops the whole time, making it difficult to talk to and meet new people.
very well organised, safe and secure and fabulous facilaties

breakfast should have stayed longer until 10:30 not 9:30 i think, and everyone in my room was charged more than originally quoted which we were all abit unhappy about. and i didn't get the gold card that i paid for or the discounts it's meant to get you, so that was a waste of $10.

this is the best hostel i have stayed in. landing from a long flight, it was perfect to relax and then help me set off on my feet when ready.     staff are great, place is comfortable and really clean.     you can stay in santa monica without a car and get a few local buses, hire bikes or just walk.
the hostel is at an ideal location, clean. it organises activities through out the week and a good place to meet other travellers. i certainly enjoyed staying at h.i. los angeles.
excellent hostel, defenately great value for money. we had a great time there and no reason for complaint whatsoever.
i really enjoyed my stay at h.i. it really is a home away from home.

the toilets were a bit dirty , most times had to go to a different one as they were filthy . i think that a makeover of the bathrooms are in order as showers were a bit crappy as well , water was either too hot or not hot enough !! otherwise its a great location , with lots of activities to do , via from the travel agent next door and on site as well ! would def stay there again though !
very clean and tidy hostel.  well set-up and in a great part of la.  i  would highly recommend staying here.

the hostel is huge and everything is clean but the hostel misses massive character, there is no buzz... there is no bar and alcohol is not permitted which sucks seeing everything in la is super expensive!  the staff were horrible. they were rude, arrogant and made it seem like a chore and that they were going out of their way to answer our questions.  there was a mega sleazy guy working there who made us feel very uncomfortable and was super rude to us after my friend denied him a date.
the promised activities were not delivered on.
nice place to stay and close by to the sea. hostel is clean and well run.
fantastic location, really nice rooms, lots of activities to do.

during my stay, a man came in during the middle of the night.  i think he had been sent to the wrong dorm.  my dorm was an all girl dorm... so i was a bit suprised to see him enter our room in the middle of the night.  i spoke to the reception and they thought someone had given him a key card to enter the room... i don't think it was an error made at the reception.
very pleasant and helpful staff.
a great stay in california for sun, sea and hollywood history! a good effort with hostel activities where you meet a lot of individuals.

the location of the hostel is near the santa monica beach which is nice if you're spending most of your time at the beach. if not, it's far from everything - town and tourist attractions. there is no metro serving this area, so i had to take a bus to beverly hills (45mins) or to get to hollywood or universal studio, take the bus to the nearest metro station (about 1hour away) and takes another 30mins by metro, so 1.5hrs! other than that, the staff are friendly and the hostel has good social vibe

couldn't ask for a better location if you're looking for beach-side accommodation.  plenty of buses going to all major tourist areas in la/hollywood if you take the time to look for them - lots of info at the hostel.  rooms are spacious enough with sink, toilet and shower in room.  great cheap place to stay in a pretty expensive city.
good hostel, staff was not overly friendly. hostel runs like a hotel making it hard to meet people.
totally awesome. though it was a really short stay, i really liked it. yes it was kinda pricey for a hostel, but i felt it was worth it.

it's the second time i've stayed here as it's in a great location and is well keep the staff and activities are great but this time i stayed in a bigger dorm with it's own bathroom and it was a bit dirty and could have done with a clean.

the building looks nice, but the dorms are crappy. the en-suite bathroom was disgusting and old, the toilet seat was broken and the walls were not clean. wifi is bad and no alcohol is allowed. there is not much organised and the atmosphere is not great.

the location is very good and the hostel is very clean. but very very poor is the wlan! you are a lucky guy when you have sometimes conncetions in the lobby. better go to bean coffee for wlan close the hostel. poor is also the breakfast. the orange juice was almost just water and yogurth was offered very less . for this is the price of this hostel too expensive. also alcohol is not allowed. i wouldn't go back to this hostel.
very expensive, staff weren't all that interested. but great location and very clean.

great location, friendly and helpful staff and the facilities are the best i've had in a hostel after travelling for 3 months in south america.  would definitely come back and recommend this place to friends on a budget.
lovely looking hostel, fantastic location, safe and clean.a little bit dull and lifeless but a very nice place to relax and enjoy beautiful santa monica.free wifi and free breakfast is great!

the hostel is very big, almost like a hotel. the bad sid of it is you have to try harder to make concact with otrher people. the hostel is in a very safe location, it is clean and cosy. it also offers a lot of events and trips.
good place but bad wifi which they obviously create in order to drive guests to paying for the in house fee paying computers. staff response to a complaint about this was ... a shoulder shrug...

i was a bit miffed as to why you can only stay at the hostel for 14 nights, when they have students staying for 3 months? the meals were good and cheap, because of the student its not easy to mingle as they have their own group, i would stay there again if in the area.....
it was in a good location in santa monica, loved the included breakfast. was easy to book tours e.g la sightseeing and universal studios tours at the place next door.
great location. super friendly staff..  awesome hostel!
brilliant locaction, right near the beach and shops!
such a brilliant place! serving breakfast makes a big difference that you wouldn't realize.  the location was brilliant as everything that was needed was within walking distance.

very clean spacious and modern. only down side is it is harder for someone travelling on their own to socialise within the hostel. but great location, meals offered every night for cheap, and lots of activities that you can sign up for to be more sociable if you wish.
very good youthhostel in motel quality. location is very good and in the cenral of santa monica. i'll come  back again. wifi is slow because of to much access.....

extremely slow wi-fi, which is ridiculous when they advertise themselves as having it available, and it is only available in the common rooms which means nobody interacts or talks to each other. breakfast was pitiful as well.

not happy booking through hostel world. we needed to change our reservation and were easily able to with hi hostel but did not recieve any refund for the three nights that we cancelled with hostel world. word of advice- just phone the hostel and book your stay direct through the helpful and happy staff that work there.

the hostel was in a great location but was extremely expensive and did not include a lot of extras which other hostels usually include; for example free airport transfer and free luggage storage. i thought the $18 airport shuttle fee (one way) was exorbitant and paying $5 for a locker for the day (in $1 bills only) was frustrating. i stayed on the fourth floor in an 8 bed dorm for $50 per night which i think was too much, and it was extremely hot with no fan or air con.
great location in santa monica and ideal for bus tours of la.
this hostel is very nice and close to the beach but it is too big for people to interact with each other. finally, it is a good place to sleep and get information on the city, but that's it.

i liked my stay here really close to the beach and shops and the hostel puts on tours to go to la downtown and hollywood. but there were to many old people staying in the hostel i think one of the guys in my room had to be 80 and slept all day so had to be quite killed the vibe

service was quick and efficient at the desk, and staff was nice.   a dorm mate was questionable, older woman who did not sleep in the dorm but would have her stuff in the room and making a lot of noise in the early morning.
dependable... and the location can't be beat!

kids running around screaming at all hours ruined the aesthetic, cleaners took my personal pillow and after four days of trying to get a manager to talk to me i unsuccessfully gave up. internet was poor. i will never stay at a hi again.
great place to stay.  lots of activities.  i would stay here again.  really great location.
good hostel but nothing special for the price, guess your paying for the location. prefect for a nights stay!

there were a lot of young childern running around,  not expected at a hostel with mostly young adults. the noise and the constant running around was a bit bothersome but other than that, no complaints!
awesome spot. nice and clean with bargain meals on fridays. would stay here again.
the best hostel ever! best location, perfect cleanliness, good breakfast, great structure. everything is perfect!

don't book the airport shuttle from reception, i waited 40 minutes and it never turned up. it would have cost $18. i then went on the public bus that cost $1 was 5 minute walk from the hostel and took less than 1 hour in rush hour.

my stay @ the hostel was much more then i expected. i met people from all over the world. everyone worked & played together in a very impressive fashion. i was happy to see the no drinking/drug ordinances. this really helps. the location could not have been better. the help really made sure all needs were met expediantly!the help works very hard. i think if you had a few partime people to help host, or volunteer, or biz interns; it would be out of this world. thx jp

i stayed here for 2 nights at the begining of my stay in la and have changed hostels to come back here for my last 2 nights as well, because it was just so lovely. not the most lively of hostels, but i'm not 21 yet so that wasn't such a big deal. lovely vibe though, just very chilled, and gorgeous location; so close to the beach! definately recomend staying here, i felt very safe being a lone female 19 year old traveller!
simply outstanding 'super' hostel. you don't really come here for character, it's got the feel of a large hotel in its presentation and the staff are very helpful and professional.

awesome location, central to everything. movies everynight, great way to chill out in the evenings. key card kept failing to work, bit of a pain but would definately stay again, only shifted because they were booked out, should of got in earlier......

i was traveling alone to santa monica and i had searched a few other locations but they seemed over priced and too far away from the pier and 3rd street (which is where it all happens) and then i found the hi hostel right in the centre of everything, i was a little unsure at first as i never stayed in a hostel before but i decided to give it a go, when i arrived the place was as stated perfect, the staff where really nice and friendly and the rooms when perfect, i am going to be going back there
like a big hotel, good all rounder, excellent location near the beach :) i'd stay again.

i really loved this hostel. i loved the location, even though it is an hour by bus to hollywood i thought it was great being near the beach and a street away from a main shopping street. the staff were so helpful in telling you about how to get places and things to do and see. the security was really good with good sized locers in the room and a security door to get into not only your room but the main hostel area. the breakfast was also very good. i would recommend this hostel to anyone!

bad staff and absolutely no fun at all.  my flight got delayed, i've called then and warned then about it, but even so they've cancelled my reservation around 2am and made me "homeless" for the night - and also charged the "no show".    no alcohol is alowed in the hostel, so obviously ppl do not interact. actually ppl don't stay at the common area for fun.    finally, the bathroom are not clean. both man's and girl's.
the hostel is overall really nice and the beach is just a block away.
the hostel is well organized, staff is friendly and helpfull. it is a nice place to stay.

hostel was good, had some good nights out. the rooms were very clean.  downside was there was a staff member that was not helpful or friendly at all, was an older man. they cancelled one of the tours and didnt tell us and when we asked him he said it was still happening and so we waited for about 20 mins and we asked him again and he told us it wasnt running. as if we should of known and got angry at us for asking, he was very rude. everytime i asked him something it was like i was bothering him

i wish the center courtyard was a non-smoking area. my son and i didn't want to use it because of the smoke, plus the smoke blew in through the windows and doors into the dining area. otherwise, the hostel was great and i would recommend it to friends.
really good location with great organised events and loads of free information. good cheap food and clean rooms and the staff were all very friendly and helpful, would definitely recommend it.

really good location. first time in l.a. really happy we stayed in santa monica. the hostel was clean, great location (short walk to 3rd street promenade, santa monica pier), tourist desk next door, cheap dinners at hostel if you're on a budget, secure rooms and additional lockers. area was safe at night. overall, very pleased!
good location, friendly staff and great facilities for a hostel.

the hostel was great and we really enjoyed our stay there. the room was nice and the breakfast was very good. the only thing we did not appreciate was the bad cleanliness of our roommates. we understand this is not the responsibility of the hostel, but if the hostel team could remind all the customers that they are sharing rooms, and therefore need to respect the other roommates, that would be great. (some of them basically consider the room as theirs, and we had the feeling to be their guests).
great hostel. two possible improvements:  1. get better beds.  2. get sound proof windows: trucks cleaning the street outside stopped me from sleeping.

+ good location in st monica   + top security with key card and lockers  + nice atmosphere with court yard, library, tv rooms, ...   + discount for tours in the belonging shop next to      but figured it out by myself, no information at the reception    -
excellent place:    -awesome big and clean kitchen  -friendly staff  -nice, clean rooms  -great location, right next to beach, shops and nightlife activities

my friends and i loved this place. we checked in early and our luggage was placed in a secure area while we checked out santa monica. the staff member who helped us also gave us our own room of 4 instead of the room of 6 we had originally reserved! h.i. held daily activities which allowed us to make friends with everyone like the trip to malibu and a pub crawl (one to remember)! the bathrooms were maintained and the breakfast and dinners were great! definitely recommended!!

we booked a 4 bed private dorm, but when we arrived we were informed by an unapologetic staff member that there had been a mix up and had been 'upgraded' to a room with a private bathroom, however this supposed upgrade was to an 8 bed dorm, and the 4 of us were split over 2 rooms. the staff member was rude and unapologetic about this mix up, and never gave us an opportunity to move back into the room we originally booked

this was a great hostel!    the activities were great - awesome sunday hike, good movie nights fantastic open mic night and a really good pub crawl with impro comedy.    great location near the beach and nice shopping area and easy to get around to places like the getty museum, venice beach and downtown with directions supplied by staff.  good deals on tours too.    the 6bed dorm was comfortable.  the breakfast was good and well organised.    an all round good hostel experience!  top notch!
this is a really good hostel in a fantastic location. i had a really good stay here, good enough to go back to which i will be doing in a few days. i would recommend this hostel.

very good location, right in the heart of santa monica, good alternative if you dont want to stay in l.a. when we made the reservation here on hostelworld we got a confirmation letter telling us the total amount of the stay, but when we arrived we had to pay 3 dollars extra / person / night because we werent members of the yha, therefore the total from hostelworld wasnt right.
good beach location, lots of activities going on. but typical large hi that can seem a bit impersonal if you are traveling alone. well run

this hostel is in the best location, is clean and has lots of information on where to go and how to get there. there are also some free guided walking tours and free breakfast.     what i didn't like were the curtains, they let al the sunlight right through so i woke up each morning before 6am. also our room was facing the courtyard and the noise of the air vents was very annoying.

i was only here very briefly and felt like i had missed out by not staying longer and making the most of the facilities and opportunities.  the hostel has everything a traveller could want, it's clean and comfortable and has some really nice chill out areas as well as putting on tours and activities for guests.
hostel was amaizing. will stay there in the future when i return to la
+ great location, nice staff, average price.  - cleaning staff comes into room while guests are sleeping!

unbelievably bad staff. totally uninterested in you, your questions and your comments. beds are bad, so are the bathrooms. basically the only good thing is the location. it just keeps amazing me how bad hi hostels in the states are, especially if you consider how much they charge.  charging money for basic services like luggage storage (even if the check in leaflet mentioned free storage for a hour). overall big and expensive disappointment.
cool location but you cant bring alcohol into the hostel and there arent heaps of places to go out nearby
minimal hot water.  untidy bathrooms. hair dryers not even working  dorms were really warm....too hot really  the only good thing about this place is its location. seriously!
santa monica is the perfect place to base yourself whilst in la. great hostel, close to the beach and travel / tour centre right next door to help organise anything you want to do!!
great venue close to beach and tour bus bookings

this hostel was great the free breakfast and tours , the door to door tour company the food at night, the size of the place is great and the people were fantastic. i met so many great friends here and i truly recommend this place! best hostel ive ever been!

one of the worst nights i've had in the us. people running in the hallway at 2am? c'mon. it's your responsibility to keep the hostel quiet, not the customer's. just monitor the hallways every 15 minutes and see if there's trouble. also, outlets! usa hostels provides 4 p/ person. wifi? did not work in my room (303) and did not work in the fireplace area.
nice hostel in good location near venice beach.

the hostel was clean-ish. showers were a little slippery. as it was quite a large hostel, it didn't really have much character to it and i found it difficult to talk to people. also, the ceiling in our room leaked quite badly when it rained! the beds were fine. it was just...ok.
excellent location and great commune areas. very close to the beach and the 3rd promenade with shop and restaurants. i will recommend stay at this hostel

hostel in an ideal location for the beach and tours. its 3 buses from the greyound station to the hostel, taking just over 2 hours. or you could splash out and pay $50 for a taxi to the hostel!!  hostel is a typical hi, clean and well run. nice place to stay, apart from the girls on reception not exactly friendly or helpful, which does surprise me for a hi . absolutely no alcohol allowed in the hostel. so save your dollars for the local happy hours.
this hostel is simply excellent: standard and location. amazing! fireplace, breakfast, vending machines. location!
possibly the best hostel iv ever stayed in. very warm, welcoming and cosy, plus in a great location to see la. thannnkks    dan,uk
very close to the beach and the santa monica mall.  free breakfast was a plus, good tv area.  lifts weren't working at the time and hot water was on and off.

the hostel was amazing! the location is perfect.    but the elevator was broken and is going to stay like that until middle of feb. the other problem is the internet connection, that is completly slow.    but i highly recomend.

in 6 months of travel hi santa monica was the worst hostel we stayed in! they should actually take out the s and make it hotel as the place was full of old people and they take every opportunity to make an extra buck. cold showers, unfriendly staff, lame activities run by volunteers, no alcohol allowed in the building, and you pay extra on top of the already excessive price for internet and locker storage. definitely recommend staying elsewhere!

one girl member of staff (blonde chick with beanie) was particularly helpful but most other staff were average to help with things. it would have been better if there were more activities planned so more guests can interact, and if the internet was free for those without computers. beds were uncomfortable! but brekkie included was a bonus.

a fantastic hostel in la/santa monica. santa monica is a great place to stay in la. it might be an hour from downtown la, but try finding somewhere in la that is close to everywhere. buses run all night to downtown and hollywood. shuttle bus from the airport is only $15 (super shuttle). the hostel is spotless, huge kitchen and heaps of rooms to relax and meet fellow travellers. will definitely stay again.
great place, just one block from the ocean and just in downtown santa monica. good busconnection with airport and downtown los angeles.

the staff at the front desk "tried" to be helpful, but did not seem to have many suggestions as to what a tourist should do on a free day... or on christmas for that matter. also there were mixed stories as to why there was never any hot water for showers, and the fact that once you check out, the hostel would only store your bags for 2 hours was kinda lame. but the hostel was nice, very hotelish... the tv room was the most social oriented room in the hostel. 2.5 out of 5 stars

this hostel is for families and travelers of all ages, so no alcohol is allowed. however, they plan great activities, like hikes, pub crawls, all you can eat pasta/hamburgers, etc. the lobby has a fireplace and is a great way to meet people. the only thing that i didn't like was that the showers rarely had hot water, and it took them a really long time to fix it. otherwise, a great location, and a good hostel. really clean.

awesome location so close to the beach and santa monica pier. found it hard than usual to make good friends being that there is no bar and not so much of a social atmosphere. but htey do have some cool activites you can sign up for  where you can get amongst it and meet people
should be allowed alcohol in the hostel.
decent safe ,easy to find i dont approve of no drinking in hostels its a hostel not a boarding school obviously hostels may be recieving people on the run or nutters or something
the hostel is in a fantastic location. the public transport is easy to use so from the hostel you can get everywhere easily. close to the beach and close to the promenade, perfect!

this was a lovely hostel. i was there just before christmas and it was very cosy with a fire and christmas tree up. the rooms were basic but spacey and fine. the bathrooms were clean however 2 out of the 4 showers were not working the whole of my stay. the location is the best, litterally minutes from everythng, beach, pier, shops...overall i would 100% stay here again.
beds could be comfier, location is amazing, and events are run to meet people

best hostel i ever have been to! great staff and hostel arranges nice things to do all of the time. good breakfast, clean rooms, plenty of showers. very nice location in santa monica, close to the city and the beach. can't think of anything bad, it was just an excellent experience to have been to this hostel.
best hostel ever!

could not get a better location!!! the beds were fantastic, showers could be better with only a curtain into the restroom and one tap, so you cant change the cold temp. would return to easy! and something on everyday organised by the hostel so great if travel by yourself
this was the nicest hostel that i have stayed in during my year in north america.. loved the location as well close to the beach and shopping
nice hostel, just one block away from the beach in santa monica. i can really recommend to stay there.
i though the water coming from the sink in room 305 smelled a bit?
best hostel in the whole of la, shame about the yha no drinking policy...this place could have sum wicked parties!!!!
huge hostel, which offers everyting a backpacker need. although, no alochol!!!

good hostel with a great location really close to santa monica beach.  the hostel itself is a bit big and can make it hard to meet people but besides that and the slow wi-fi, a great hostel!  make sure to do the pub crawl with scott and the boys! great way to meet people and have a good night!

i was impressed by this hostel.  it was very clean, the staff was especially helpful, and they served breakfast in the morning.  santa monica pier and the 3rd street promenade are just blocks away and there are multiple metro stations nearby.  i enjoyed my stay, and would definitely stay here again.
by far the best places i've stayed in california, right by the beach and the staff really do help you get around

by far, the best hostel i stayed in over 4 months! there were plenty of activities, location was fantastic - very close to many busses, the beach and the famous 3rd st promenade (shopping!). the attitude of locals in santa monica was very friendly and relaxed. this was the one place i felt comfortable walking alone after dark. the staff were also very helpful (though at times appeared bored?)  bathrooms were clean and plentiful. rooms were also very clean!
this hostel was fine. great location in santa monica and friendly enough staff and travelers.
there was a little problem with some air condition - which was too loud during the night. but they gave us a discount for that night and were really caring.
huge hostel in a really good location on the outskirts of la.  staff were always helpful, breakfast was good.  hostel was clean with plenty of activites to do.  would definitely stay again.

great location, and having a (paid) shuttle bus right to the door was wonderful. the kitchen with free coffee/tea was open 24 hours and they had great free tours & meal deals. only complaint was a mild smell of urine (or something equally cloying) that seemed to be in the room; aside from that - great place to stay
this hostel is in a great location, very close to the santa monica pier. i spent 3 days here, relaxing before flying to bangkok. i'll be back when i return from my trip through asia. :)
great hostel had such a good time there organised events are great and the hostel is really well laid out and social
excellent hostel.  one block from good shopping and great food and one block from the beach. would stay here again.

this hostel is fantastic - fresh, clean, new, minutes from the beach. a really great place. friendly staff happy to go out of their way to help.  if you wanted to chill out you could and if you wanted to meet people and get involved in the activities this was also possible.
it's a very big hostel so everyone just kinda sticks to their own groups. but the breakfast was good and so were the facilities. and the lockers were a really good size :)  overall pretty happy :)
the cleaning lady took my towel (the one i brought from home) & the towel from the hostel & didn't leave any towel for me : o (, but then i talk to her, & she was nice & help me. : o )

very nice and clean hostel. the location very good and quiet, close to all and there is a bus around the corner which brings your for less money to beverlly hills, hollywood and downtown. good and enough breakfast in the morning!

one of my favourite hostels in the usa so far!    not very social as there is no one common area for everyone to go and meet new friends...but it is hands down one of the cleanest, safest and most convenient hostels i have stayed in.    close to shops, a police station, the santa monica pier, and heaps of restaurants. will stay again!

great hostel in a perfect location! the rooms were big and had lockers, ensuite bathroom had a seperate shower and toilet and there were two sinks as well. though there were 10 girls in the room, there was plenty of room for everyone to put their luggage.   the location is also a big plus, very close to the airport with shuttles available and in walking distance of shops and malls.   every night, there was an event taking place which gave the opportunity to meet other travellers.

a very well-run hostel, which, while of course mostly visited by young people, was very suitable for a traveller in her mid-thirties who wants to travel cheap. everything is really clean, in excellent working order and everyone are friendly and helpful. not a party hostel at all, you can't have alcohol in the hostel, but that forces you to mingle with the locals. the area is great to be a tourist in, walkable, bus-able and with great cafes/restaurant/bars/people.

location fantastic, but i find it easier to meet people in smaller hostels. this is big and spread out. also another american non drinking hostel, which is different when you've travelled in europe and they simply don't exist. i'd stay again however

clean and centrally located. a few trips are organised by the hostel but not much that you couldn't do on your own. quite a big hostel so not great to meet people if you travelling alone. staff were helpful when approached.
excellent loacation. very clean and modern. plenty of facilities (large kitchen, free wifi etc) would recommend to anyone.
not flexible if you don't show up, will charge the whole amount plus lots of taxes to your credit card :/

the location is great! one street from the beach and santa monica pier, one street from the main shopping promenades of 3rd and 4th street! a police station is located directly across the street from the hostel but as a female solo traveler i felt very safe walking around during the day and early evening. facilities are very modern and the elevator was a great help when carting luggage up to your dorm! bed was already made, towel provided and huge free breakfast! i will totally stay here again!
cheers 4 the excellent stay people

boring for what you pay for. but it's close to what you need. got kicked out for watching tv and falling asleep, apparently half awake i said that i didn't have a card - a little staff discretion maybe?. it's no fun when you have a right to be there. also, the shower burns you when someone flushes the toilet. forget having skin. a fun time for single travelers/young reveler but only if they don't expect the hostel to provide it. imagine grandma as a hostel. one that hasn't yet tapped the gin.
nice clean hostel in a great location. because it's so huge though it's really hard to meet people. good choice for free breakfast.
awesome / clean hostel! one of the best i've stayed at. beach is so close by and the people are friendly and helpful. must see - getty museum!!

typical hi hostel - good activities, good free pasta and breakfast, good rooms,bathrooms good good tv and videos and stuff. internet a bit steep, but everything else good. location perfect, just near santa monica beach, takes about an hour to two hours from the greyhound stations to get there though. i would advise getting off at the hollywood station and not the main one which is dodgy! if you are, dont go at night! santa monica v safe though!
nice hostel, clean, nice staff , nice lobby and internet room , and good breakfast.
only stayed there for a night, due to a stop over at lax. though not in the mid of la, it is in an awesome trendy location, really close to the beach, would be back!
a ggod place near the beach (venice beach and manhatan beach are not very far from that place) beside that it's close to the 3rd st promenade where you can find a lot of shops and restaurants.

typical hi hostel, clean and value for money. staff helpful and in a good location. the organised activities were a bonus as it would have been boring for me if they were not organised. i liked it, id rather stay here and catch a bus to la than stay in some dodgy joint near the city.
good base from which to explore los angeles.  i have stayed there twice and had good experiences both times.  would stay there again.

first hostel experience at the start of a 5 month trip. good hostel, security, clean. breakfast was good. had to walk a fair way to get to the toilets from the room. great location in santa monica though. social atmosphere ok.
if you want a quiet place, this is it.   no alcohol inside the hostel, not even at the bar! besides that little detail, the hostel is good. great location!
good place clean but not alot of fun as cant drink in the hostel, makes pre drinks and meeting people a little hard.

i would stay here for the location again! for the short time i was there i didn't really get a good vibe from the hostel. the guy at the desk was one of the rudest people i've ever been served by. he would make guests line up until the clock actually struck 3 haha. but apart from that the rooms were clean and big and so were the bathrooms so really and truly santa monica is what you make it but probably spend as much time out of this hostel as possible ps. bus to san fran is great value!
staying in this hostel was so much fun!!
loved it fantastic location helpful staff x
very noisy and hot at night

this hostel was good. the staff are lovely, the tours offered are great, the kitchen was great.  i was there while the lounge room was being renovated, from what i could see it looks like it will be great. bathrooms could do with an update and the rooms desperately need more than one power board. overall, i would stay here again. it was comfortable, great location, and had many great amenities.

clean bathrooms and shower, bed was nice and soft but my bed was the only one in the room that didn't have any jack to charge my electronics.    free breakfast and refill of clean water for your water bottle
‘twas lit fam

they were undergoing renovations when we stayed here, which i think led to an unusual smell in our room and an even more unpleasant odour coming from our sink and tap in our room. other than that very lovely, spacious private room and good facilities

overall the atmosphere, staff, location, all amazing. my only issue was the stairs situation. stairs to get up to front desk, plus stairs if you have a room on the 3rd floor, and so people with lots of luggage or heavy luggage, it can be difficult. also the bathroom situation, a bathroom for both male and female on each floor would be so awesome, especially if one has gone out for some drinks. that was my main issue. otherwise everything was great.

hollywood blvd us a little noisy on a saturday night. and the hallways are a little to loud. foot steps and voices echo pretty far, but overall, very nice stay and super awesome staff. i checked in at 1am, and checked out around 8am (just needed a nap), and caught their free breakfast. everything was super clean. really above my expectations for the price i paid. awesome night!
great location (though hard for uber drivers to locate). bathrooms were always clean and were cleaned multiple times in the day. free breakfast is good too.

i cannot give a rating about this hostel but have only heard good things. i have a uk unrestricted passport with no criminal record and cam to the states under the vwp (visa waiver program) and was deported on the next flight home as i had not yet purchased my return ticket. one officer told me to buy a return ticket and come back in 5 minutes. on the final confirmation page a different officer came an took my ipad away and told me it was too late.. i am completely shocked.

i was really impressed by the hostel. we were warmly welcomed as we arrived, our room was clean and comfortable and the breakfast was good.   the tours the hostel offered was the best in my opinion. you can sign up for free and get a guided tour to several destinations within l.a.  if you sign up and dont arrive - no problems, its very flexible.   i'd highly recommend to stay here, i'll definitely come back!

good location if you’re into the very touristy walk of fame and shopping. the hostel had a musky stale smell in the air. the employees looked very unenthusiastic, i’ve seen hospices with more energy than this hostel. we came the night before nye hopping to stay there and didn’t even stay the full first night before we got on a train and just went to sd. they closed off the common areas after hours. outside the hostel is the walk of fame but very crowded streets. could’ve just been a bad night

location is perfect and it's pretty much clean! the staff is just ok. points of improvement: reduce the volume of the music from the common area (it's far too high untill late at night). having a lady cleaning the male common bathroom all the time, is also very umconfortable...
great location, right in the centre of hollywood. friendly staff and a reasonable breakfast.

i enjoyed my stay, it isn’t the best location if you are looking for good nightlife close by.    the staff were friendly and made the stay better, the free hike to the holywood sign was a laugh with carlos. barry the irish lad on reception was helpful & happy to have a chat with.

the walk of fame hostel is located right in the middle of hollywood boulevard making it super convenient to see the sights of hollywood. however the staff are extremely unfriendly and make it seem like such an inconvenience to help with anything or answer a simple question. the atmosphere around the common areas is depressing and staff couldn’t tell me many details about the daily activities. rooms are nice but stink like b.o.
good clean hostel, can't beat the location on the other side of the hollywood highland metro rail station.

first ever stay in a hostel and i was pleasantly surprised!   such a clean place to stay- toilets and showers were spotless throughout my stay.  staff were super helpful and friendly.  organised trip was great and other travellers were friendly.   would definitely recommend.
great place  staff was very nice lots of tours everyday great breakfest  rooms clean very good hostel  would stay again !

good for location and hostel provided lots of great info on what to do in the area, the staff were very knowledgable and could give recommendations. we were a group of 3 and they upgraded us from an 8 bed dorm to a 6 bed dorm which we had to ourselves the duration of our stay, was quite a nice perk.

this hostel is in a great location of you want to see hollywood without making a social trip. very close to universal studio and in any case it's across from the subway which can take you anywhere you want to go!!    the common room is located very close to some of the rooms and the quiet hours are midnight to 7 am, so if you want to go to sleep early good luck! there is a pool game and loud music usually going on until very late. the breakfast in the morning was great and good quality.

clean and tidy place to stay for the night, small kitchen available to use, shower cubicles were a bit small, room was decent. overall satisfied with my stay, $60 for one night was a bit much. staff were friendly.

for the price and location this hostel cannot be beat! it is about as centrally located as a place can be in a city without a center. you're in the heart of the hollywood action, and it's equidistant from the ocean and downtown. the staff is friendly and helpful. i had fun shooting pool and drinking brews before i went out at night. the bathrooms are clean and spacious. there was always an available shower. i would recommend this hostel to almost anyone.

yes, this is a nice hostel located straight in the opposite of metro exit which is good. you can walk to metro station just by 5 minutes. the room is clean and neat, but there's no ac, only fan. security is good but don't forget to bring your own lock!  overall, this hostel is really value for money.
one of the best hostels i've ever stayed in. perfect location, very clean, great showers, comfy bed, nice staff and really good price. i would surely stay here again.

we found that the hollywood walk of fame hostel met our needs during our 2 night stay in la. we had a private room on the 1st floor which was modern and clean with good facilities. the location was very good. one issue however was that the female toilet facilities were on the second floor which meant a long walk during the night to use toilet facilities. it would have been good to at least have a unisex toilet on each floor to avoid this. the breakfast was decent with a good selection of bagels.
great staff. great place. highly recommend.
great place in a great location but having the male bathroom on one floor and the female on the other is annoying
decent hostel in a good location. can be very noisy on the walk of fame so be careful which rooms you pick.

good location for public transport and attractions such as walk of fame & wax museums. room was way too hot and no air con, only a small fan for 8 people. also the ceiling fan only worked with the light on, not ideal for sleeping. good bathrooms and adequate breakfast.
great location. great hostel

terrible - we changed hostels. luggage storage room didn’t have a working lock. only one female bathroom on a different floor and at the other end of the hostel - 4 showers not enough. room was stifling hot and absolutely stunk of body odour. bags don’t fit under the bottom bunk so there is no space to move. half of the electical outlets didn’t work and couldn’t be reached from the bed. no rule against people staying who are living in la or over a certain age! makes for a creepy environment.

the staff is really nice, and the housekeepers too, always smiling and willing to help you.  there are arranged tours for the guests and a schedule with all the programmed activities which i found great to get to know other people.

great location right in the middle of everything. metro is straight across the road which is very convenient if you need to get anywhere else in the city. front desk staff and housekeeping are amazing at their jobs. breakfast had great options.
great place to stay.  excellent staff and location.  very clean and excellent facilities.  highly recommend to stay here when in la.
great time bed in a quiet room. i'll be back!!!!!
bathrooms were really nice, clean. parking in the back, is $20 a night, but it's in a secure area at least. walking distance from a walgreens in case you need anything.

really nice hostel. had the perfect location. staff were welcoming and very helpful. i left my wallet with my credit card and passport in my uber. the staff helped me contact the uber to get it all back within the hour.
perfect staff!  perfect location!  worth for the price

i would recommend you to stay here!  so close in hollywood st, u just get off from metro and then you will see hostel! u don't need to walk too much! i have lot of stuff and  one small man staff (i din't know his name) help me to carry my suitcase. i'm so appreciated because its so heavy! breakfast is okay but bathroom, toilet is good and big.  so this hostel is good. you should stay  there.
one of the best hostels i've stayed at

walk of fame hostel was right in a great location with plenty to see right near the hostel, including a shopping centre across the road. our room was a decent size but my only issue was that there were no plugs easily accessible from the top bunk meaning i had to use the plug by the bottom bunk which required me to awkwardly try and avoid touching the feet of the person sleeping on bottom bunk. breakfast was okay but not much variety. staff were great tho and they have awesome daily activities.

this hostel is right in the center of town and easily reached by public transport. i joined in the hostel activities each day i was there (hike to the hollywood sign, beverly hills trip, downtown tour) which were free of charge and super fun. i hung out with a really cool and diverse group of people who quickly became friends- from across asia, europe and north america aged 19-mid thirties.the hostel is a little annoying to close down the common area at 12pm so you can't chill in :(
