maybe a little too expensive. but we had an awesome stay
very well located!!
the place is in an amazing spot, in the middle of everything on the walk of fame! was only here for a night but it was a great place, would definitely recommend it!

the staff was awesome. they were very helpful during check in and encouraged us to participate in their activities for the night. everyone seemed friendly. the only downside was that there was no air conditioning and los angeles in september is very warm. other than that it was a great stay.
please a/c in the room!!

great place and atmosphere! right on the hollywood boulevards, which can be a bit shady, but it's mostly fine. second night, they've been filming right in front of the hostel, which was a nice experience.

i'm very sorry but you could think that a part of the staff is dishonest against their guests because one guest lost his cellphone and he didn't get real help. he was  ensured that a guest found his phone and a member of the staff own it and he has to wait on the reception. but although he calls every day he have to call later on. the staff didn't want to say what really happened with his phone.
have sent a message and done a survey to samesun. there are too many issues to write here again.
too hot no aircon and window not open to let free ventilation!

shared shoers were too dirty and the smell was horrible. any kind of privacity  it was really difficult to get a clean towel. they were tuning out of tiwels at any time!!  the room was extremely hot and noisy.  the services and the staff were really cool. even participating in games with costumers.

couldn't ask for a better location. angela puts on a good night starting with beer pong. the hollywood sign tour was amazing. the staff also took us to the observatory to watch the sunset for no extra cost. really comfy mattress and huge bathroom. the rooms are a bit smelly and too hot to sleep. maybe have breakfast end a little later because after those wild nights there's no way i can be up by 9am 😉 had a great time, i recommend staying here!
staff were amazing! great location so long as you like to be amongst everything!

this hostel is great if you&#39;re looking to stay in hollywood for a few days. we stayed 4 nights and were pleasantly surprised with the location! it is quite literally on hollywood boulevard. there are also a lot of activities that are arranged inside the hostel, activities such as free walking tours and comedy nights!  value for money is fantastic, breakfast is ok. if you&#39;re travelling the states then i&#39;m sure you will be bagel-ed-out by the end of it, every hostel had bagels for breakfast.
great location! special thanks to angela; she was very helpful and fun!
you definitely need a/c if you have a hostel in socal.

great location, comfortable enough. there is no a/c however, which would be a great addition since its in the heart of the city. staff has always been helpful, while remaining distant sometimes. lots of people come and go. i would comeback for a 2 night stay to visit hollywood.

great location on hollywood blvd, right opposite the subway station. it has a very small door so not easy to see/find straight away. big, clean bathrooms but open windows so ppl outside could see in - weird. rooms were hot as there was no aircon and only one fan to share which i didn't like. good selection at breakfast and there was a hooters down the road. if there was aircon then i'd recommend but otherwise, too hot.

stayed here for 3 nights in august. pretty decent value for money, most staff were very friendly and helpful. no ac in my 4 person dorm so we ended up sleeping with the door wide open for cross flow of air (still quite hot), but despite being on a fairly dodgy area (hollywood boulevarde) we felt safe to do so as the security is decent. quite a lot of street noise from our window but that is to be expected in the location. communal male bathroom was big, a little messy but staff often cleaning.
excellent location but the place is way too hot and humid.

very good location, can see the hollywood ave right through the window. the and bus stop very close, and metro station is right across the street.  staff are very friendly and helpful, rooms are clean.   free breakfast is very good.  but no elevator, have to carry my suitcase all the way up.

this was a nice place to stay for a few nights. lovely helpful and friendly people. can get a bit noisy as it is on such a busy street but really an amazing location. bring your own lock for using the lockers (if needed). helpful staff.
well done, well run! international travel, and felt very at home.
great hostel but no air conditioning! rooms too warm.
that was the best hostel i stayed in on my us trip! they should just put some rules for cleanliness and they would be awesome!
one of the best hostels i've stayed in the coolest and most friendly staff, amazing location, could not have asked for anything better!

we spent 2 nights in this hostel, not much to do in la so i wouldn't recommend a long visit here. perfect location, car park near by. lockers provided in our 6bed dorm, free breakfast, no que for showers.

this hostel is ok for one or two nights, i wouldn&#39;t recommend staying longer. there are lockers in the rooms, however there is minimal security. one staff member who runs the trip seems to leer over the drunk girls and offers them rides with his&#34;cousin&#34;. he also has a fake british accent, which as a british person is very entertaining. really good location and the girls bathrooms are clean (shower pressure is great).
disgusted with the fact a couple who can easily share a bed are made purchase two bed without ever and intension to sleep separately! breakfast, although free, was a embarrassing
i really loved this hostel, everything was great that it looked like a hotel!
good. friendly staff, free wifi connection, and location is really convenient!

i stayed at samesun hostel last week and i think it was my best stop through out all my vacation it was a great hostel , great location and especially very lovely and helpful staff , big thanks for ibrahim for making things a lot easier and simpler for everyone .
the hostel is good, but it could a more clean, the bahthroom was always dirty and wet. i noticed that the guests in this place have no sense of community. people never cleaned their own mess.

i had an amazing stay. the hostel was my refuge from the craziness of the streets outside and served as a much loved hub for my stay in la. thanks to all the team for the great breakfasts and always being ready to offer advice, which went above and beyond what is expected.

to put it simple do not stay here!!! rooms are messy and smelly. staff are useless is of the absolute minimum. items got stolen. after around the usa for three this is by far the worst hostel iv stayed in.

most awful experience in a hostel in the us. staff: unfriendly and useless, didn't even get shown around they just sat behind the desk and gave us incorrect bus info. rooms: no aircon, stuffy, very very smelly and dirty, thin windows make them very noisey due to location. breakfast: about 10 plates for the whole hostel and big queues. toilets: very dirty and disgusting. common room: small for the amount of people staying. can't stress enough not to stay here. i cancelled my 3rd night do not stay
location is wonderful. enjoy yourself at hollywood!
this hostel has best  mattres, no joke, i've  ever slept on. i mean  for a hostel, my matress was excellent. (not thin)

overall is was a good stay.  the shower was blocked and filled up with water but the bathrooms were fairly well maintained otherwise.  great location in you want to be in the centre of the hollywood craziness and close enough to runyon canyon to get away from it all and go hiking.  i think you should make it clear tax is added to the room rates, not included at the booking stage.
good and fast checking in and out.

its extreemly hot and stuffy at night, the rooms arnt cleaned out properly.you dont have a key for the front door so have to buzz and wait up to 5 minutes just to get into the building. if your unfortunate to be in room 30 you will have to share with the most arrogant obnoxious guy you will ever meet, and to make it worse,, hes the 'activities' guy?? he has a total disregard for others.  stay at the venice beach one instead, there alot more friendly, a better set up, and its a lot cooler at night

it was like been at jail. the room was dirty, noisy, without proper ventilation. the place smells as if cleanliness and hygiene are not priorities. the neighborhood might look good on tv but in real life it shows racism, violence, and feels unsafe all the time. absolutely non existing value for the money paid. never again. not recommended if you are looking for a place to relax and have a good time.
unfortunately this hostel wasn't the best, not very clean. great location though.
nice place, specifically for the location! i recommend host here, absolutely. :)
great location and atmosphere! the general stench of human feces in the room wasn't very enjoyable though.  but hey if you don't have a sense of smell book ahead ;)

the lack of air conditioning in mid-summer was expected from previous reviews  however, the bathroom facilities were well below standard - while renovations were being done on oneside (which i completely understand has to be done for improvement) there was nothing but a sheet between the workers and showers - which would have been fine but there was no shutters or blinds on the bathroom window which openly faced a lane with visible public view - so it seemed either way you were exposed.

comfy beds and clean rooms. the bathrooms, however, were not good. of the four showers, three of the cubicles were missing their curtains (two were added while i was there) and there is nowhere to put your towel or clothes while you're showering so you just had to hang everything over the top, or outside the shower which was wet. the big open window also looks out onto the street so people can see you getting changed. needs a curtain?? could definitely be cleaner too.

when we checked in, the staff seemed a bit annoyed and there may be good reason for this. to enter the hostel, you have to be buzzed in. for the person trying to enter, it can be hard to hear the bell amidst the noise and ramble on the street. as a result, some staff members were observed yelling into the microphone with disdain. in the days following our checkin, the staff was very helpful in suggesting attractions and assisting with travel.
stayed here having lived the venice location.  staff weren't as friendly, all of the fire escape doors were open all night, seemed like it would be easy for someone to break in
the hostel is old, and in general it smells bad. the bathrooms were not clean enough, and i think that the facilities are quite old.
loved staying here, the staff were amazingly helpful, really great vibe and lovely rooms too! defiantly reccomend!
the hostel is great, the people, the environment, the rooms, the unique problem is the noise from by the street, but the rest is cool.
it was ok but to loud and toilets were not that good but wasnt that bad and location was good!

the location of this hostel is its main selling point, if you don&#39;t mind the hussle and bustle of hollywood blvd at night. i felt there was a real lack of atmosphere here. as a solo traveller i wanted to meet people and get involved in group activities, but there didn&#39;t seem to be any effort here to incentivise this. not a terrible place by any means, but there are better places in the vicinity.

i really enjoyed staying at the samesun hollywood. free pool table, free breakfast, great location, staff was lovely. it was under reservation while i was there in the summer (july 2015) but it was still a delight, not really a disturbances. it will be awesome place to stay when the reservations are complete. thanks samesun hollywood
more outlets in each room would have been really nice!
okay rooms and common areas, nothing to complain about but nothing out of the ordinary. perfect location in hollywood. nice and helpful deskpeople.

women's bathroom-curtain was what separated the construction workers and the woman's bathroom?workers could see in-male staff member came into women's bathroom to change paper. did not call out &wait for women who were in shower naked-to call out&say it was ok to come inside. he just said"i'm coming in" &entered.i went down stairs to tell people at front desk-they had excuse that there wasn't a woman to do it &yet there was one at desk when i went to tell them?
it was a nice place and great location, but you guys need to think about changing the breakfast, not same food every morning, thank you
very noisy area and it may be difficult to sleep at times.  clean and secure hostel.
great place, great people, great location...
very well priced, perfect location.
the location is good. however, there is no air conditioner inside the room which makes sleeping extremely difficult in this hot summer.
cool hostel, right in the middle of all the hollywood action. i liked the common room with the free pool table.
this is your typical samesun hostel, maybe even a bit better! they run really good communal things like hikes and taco nights which were good. clean too. great location!!!

it was my nightmare staying there. especially,the shower time!!  no door for the shower room, just some sheets and didn't even have any hanger for hanging my stuff. terrible blanket / dusty bed. won't go back again.
common room was great, rooms weren't great, my 4 person dorm only had one power point in it, it was also very hot in the room as well
this place is so dirty, they never clean up the toilets. very very hostel

i loved the staff who did the tours, however front desk people weren't really fussed about guests. also, the wifi is painfully slow! besides this, the hostel was great! the tours were great and the location is amazing! would 100% visit again.
poor atmosphere. too noisy. staff is not cool.
sick location and loads of fun. two thumbs up
wicked location. everything i wanted to see was in walking distance. all around great experience.

great location right in the heart of hollywood perfect if you want to see the sights and be able to walk everywhere. staff were great although can be noisy at times but this is expected due to location. would definitely stay here again.
amazing location and big rooms. very clean, breakfast very basic, would stay here again.
good location and facilities were good. brittish man running the place was very rude and arrogant.

the staff didn't seem readily willing to help you out, nor did they seem to do a lot. many of them sat around during the day in the living room and weren't too friendly when i did try to approach them. a friend and i went downstairs to have a cigarette and his phone was stolen within 5 minutes.

awesome and nice staffs. great location. very good atmosphere! its hard to find any better hostel in downtown hollywood. the only wtf experience is that there are only one outlet hidden behind the bed on wall with two plugs in my room where four people share. just put aside that, its pretty good experience living there. lastly, it will be better if there is cereal in breakfast as its quite plain to only have toasts

comfy beds and great location. free pool table was a bonus & fun to play our own music in the common areas.  the free breakfast was pretty basic with toast, fruit and tea and coffee. really enjoyed the hike up runyon canyon with aaron :) convenient, clean and safe.
everything was perfect, spacious room convenient location   but i don't know why they arranged a man to live in a female only room on the last night of my stay
great location, super friendly staff.
the location is just amazing right on hollywood blvd ... nothing else to say

the room floor and the shower were dirty. lots of hair clog the shower. not a lot of space in the shower to put your clothes, only one bench to share with other people.   the breakfast were disappointing. there were no paper towel and bread left, i had to ask the staff.

location, location, location! same sun is fantastically situated while it also boasts a very chilled out vibe and laid back staff. a grunge look echoed throughout the property, cleanliness ticked all the boxes, while the room was  simple and pleasing.the common room / hang out space  was really good. a modest  free breakfast was offered (white bread, oranges & coffee) & tea available round the clock.  the  main thing that could be improved on would be staff more recommendations & maps from staff

great hostel, wifi in all th areas would let the common area be more social or doors for th common room so pool can be played longer would be fun! apart from that great hostel. everything very new and clean and perfect location

this is the worst hostel i have ever stayed, i was arranged into a staff' room when i checked in, then later the reception changed the room for me. when they gave me a new room, they gave me the wrong key, they changed, then again the wrong key, the third time, the staff went to try another key with me, but didn't work. up to my checking out, i didn't have a key with me. the breakfast ended up very early, 9:00am, when i arrive in the kitchen on 8:55, nothing left. we wait for one hour, crazy
very bad hostel. very dirty and noisy
excellent location at hollywood. rooms are clean and comfortable. staffs are helpful. this would be a good choice if you're planning to stay in a hostel at hollywood.
nice hostel in a cool location

amazing location. it's situated directly on the hollywood blvd. it's easy to reach the most important places with public transportation. the staff was really friendly and helpful. the atmosphere was amazing because of a busy lounge. had a great time.

very noisy even during quite hours and i am not talking about the noise of the street but some music coming from the lounge. no one came to take our trash for 3 days. bathrooms were not disgusting but very uncomfortable to use because the showers only had curtains.

samesun is the best location for you if you're looking for a place in hollywood. it's close to the metro station and the famous walk of fame is just on your doorstep, so all major hollywood attractions are within walking distance. i was staying in a spacious 6 bed dorm and there wasn't one single time i was queuing neither for a bathroom nor a shower. the staff at reception is helpful, you've got a basic breakfast and it's a good place to meet people - what else do you need?

i think breakfast should be better, it would be nice to have more of a selection. not just bread and butter! there's a lot of people staying there who are hungry and at most time in a budget. the portions provided to residents isn't sufficient.
carlos was super helpful!

overall negative experience. the hostel wasn't clean at all, the rooms were incredibly hot and the beds were falling apart. there is a club nearby so if you can fall asleep with music shaking the floors, you'll be fine. on top of that, there were wet boxers in my bed, so i can imagine the bed wasn't changed. don't stay here!

the hostel personally to me was great, amazing location right in the middle of hollywood, i could see the hollywood stars from my room. also it had a real hostel vibe to it, but my friends would've preferred it a tad more modern but i liked it. it's kinda of a younger crowd hostel
great hostel located in the center of hollywood area. always clean, not much noise, i really enjoyed my stay

has potential to be a great hostel soon, give it a month whilst they transition ownership, complete renovation/decoration and embed a activity program...sure it will be no. 1 in la. amazing location right opposite chinese cinema/walk of fame/hollywood blvd/ hollywood&highland metro stop
great location fairly clean common areas, very clean bathrooms some staff were friendly although most were in their 'click' no actives  no vibe
beds were a little uncomfortable, but location was great and security was adequate. the communal area was nice and easy to socialise with everyone!

the hostel is located in the centre of the hollywood right across the metro station, the door to the hostel is very small therefore look carefully. the staff was okay, they know their job. i never get an opportunity to eat their breakfast, heard there were a lot of dramas about pancake that day. there are a lot of room in this hostel so probably get a room for your self in a 6 bed room. i will go back there again.

the overall atmosphere was awful but is now much more friendly and social. the new mattresses and breakfast are also a big improvement. however, there is still major room for improvement. there is one guy with a fake british accent; i think his name is louis and he is from nigeria or somewhere who constantly harasses girls and attempts to get investment from people for some app. he creeps everyone out. another guy on reception is nice enough, but has some cousin that is a creep!
bathroom and shower area could be much better! needs deep cleaning or remodel,  otherwise pretty nice stay.
this is in the hollywood! i think this hostel need activity kind staff, however, no parking lots
had an amazing time at samesun hostel hollywood blvd.  the staff is very nice, met a lot of backpackers and the rooms are clean. i'd stay there every time again!

amazing location with awesome staff! everyone was super friendly, met some really cool people there! i wish my stay would've been longer than just one night! i can 100% recommend the samesun hollywood!
great location. like the classic hollywood-themed murals.

amazing location right on hollywood blvd combined with big, clean rooms and bathrooms makes this place a great hostel. staff were always super helpful and nice. loved the free pool and the vibe of the common room. defs will be back.
cool hostel in a great location in the center of hollywood right opposite the metro station. we loved our stay at samesun venice
good deal.
in holland centre!very cool and convinience!

you stay here for the location, that's all. the hostel itself is a little worn out and the staff is a bit confused and slow.    see the rest of the review here: http://www.tripadvisor.com/showuserreviews-g32655-d119471-r286071973-samesun_hollywood-los_angeles_california.html#reviews
a little bit noisy in the night.
expersive, bad location and poor breakfasts

very good hostel. staff were helpful and friendly. wifi was very on and off. other then that brilliant accommodation, great cooking facilities and the living area is a great place to meet people. the hostel holds brilliant events in the week. highly recommend, i would definitely go back.
bed didnt come with a pillow...

-front desk staff were consistently clueless, but nice enough. wifi wasn't working on the computers one morning and there was no coffee for an extended period of time at breakfast. the staff couldn't have been more lackadaisical about addressing the issue

very good hostel with nightly activities.    pros  -nightlyactivities where you can meet others  -clean  -good location  --good common areas    cons  -some daytime activities would be nice to have in addition to the nighttime ones

i lost my id prior to arriving at banana bungalow, the front desk attendant was gracious enough in dealing with dilemma but seemed incapable of offering any help without the manager. i had several options for verifying my identity but was told the best they could do was offer me a bed for night. i sat in their front room for around 4 hours before i was told i could stay for the night and met with many odd looks from staff members who seemed quite aloof and despondent.
overall my stay at banana bungalow west hollywood was nice, clean and good value for money. it seemed quiet at the hostel, but apart from that it was ok.

i found the staff very rude! not very helpful at all. clean enough rooms and communal area, we had a cool room with nice people in it! free parking which is really good for la! a hostel just for a few nights as a stop gap!

very nice hostel, grea tbreakfast. very friendly staff always ready to help. every week they organize activities in the hostel. the very relaxed atmosphere   109/5000  although it is not so close to tourist attractions, it is very easy to move
other banana bungalow location is way better!!!! several people at reception weren't really eager to help....

the staff here weren’t very helpful, they seemed bored every time i asked them a question. the hostel wasn’t really running any events even though they advertised they were, you had to travel to their “sister” hostel in hollywood. which was good, their events were fun (free booze too) but annoying to have to travel elsewhere. it was clean and comfy and other travellers were friendly. i would stay here again if the hollywood hostel was booked out.
the receptionist wrote my credit on a paper and said it was their policy. was kind of sketchy to me.    other than that it was  nice
the only reason for the low rating on facilities is, the bathtub/shower water was always on the cool side

all the staff were friendly and helpful. they have an event each night of the week, with free food and drinks which was great. good location for some things, but a little distant from the “hustle and bustle”.  would definitely recommend it for those on a budget or ok with public transport/uber/taxis to get around.
wasn't too impressed.. the facility was pretty old and warn down.. i have stayed in many other nicer hostels in california for the same price..

plenty of things to do in the evenings, although unfortunately i missed the events i wanted to attend because i came the wrong days lol easy access to get anywhere (lots of things within walking distance), very friendly staff and the people staying were pretty cool too. an awesome experience, even has a huge kitchen accessible to everyone. car park a little hard to spot, but that made me feel safer about leaving my car there. lot of gays :p

perfect location! seems like a sketchy area at first but it's not, some staff members were super nice but one in particular seemed like he hated our guts lol. not a lot to do in the hostel itself and it's kind of junky but if you're just looking for a bed and place to keep your stuff then it's great. vending machines suck though, every time we used one, one of our items would get stuck and we'd have to bother the front desk. other than that i would highly recommend for ppl on a budget!

overall, this is a great place to stay, especially if you’re planning on staying in weho for the majority of your trip. the rooms are cleaned daily, and the public balcony and outside areas are really nice. there are plenty of restrooms as well. i’m not sure about previous reviews, but the staff in my opinion were pretty cool. i didn’t ask many questions, if any, and was able to check in my room at 9am. i would recommend this place to anyone looking to save a few bucks in west hollywood.

the premier hostel in hollywood. private room is the way to go, $100/night in la w/free parking and breakfast. great activities throughout the week! we live in central california and can have an amazing time in la by coming here. best kept secret in la!
friendly staff and good location.

i just stayed in a private for one night, but i was really happy with my choice. the room was huge, and the bed was really comfortable. they had free secured parking, which was very convenient. only downside was checking out was kinda tough because i was trying to leave early and even though it says 24/7 reception, they had the blinds down and the door closed so i felt a bit awkward trying to get their attention. like i said, it was super early though so i understand, everybody needs sleep!

a 15 minutes walk from the hollywood walk of fame, the banana bungalow is a medium sized, cozy hostel. the staff are ok, but they do their job so no complaints there. the decor is nice but the atmosphere was what made this place special. perhaps it was due to the free food and alchohol they provided for thanksgiving, but i had a lot of fun talking, playing ping pong and drinking with everyone there. being moderately clean and having a free breakfast make this hostel an easy choice.

it is really old hostel.  it doesn't have card key system. so they use real 'key' to open the door. thing is that it works in other rooms too.    the facilities are really bad, too.  also, there was no shower soap or shampoo.
very dirty. i good place for party people.

i don't know if we just got a bad room but keep this in mind: they may say they do not allow long term rentals but they do. we were in a room with three other people and they had been there for weeks to months. a good judgement is the amount of shampoo left in their full size bottles, the shelves full of clothing, junk, empty beer cans, etc. we barely had enough space on the floor for our things. it was just a very bad experience and i would be very hesitant to stay here again.
good hostel. i would stay here again. the location is perfect for all the attractions in la.
great staff, slept alright (hard when you're tall). great being in the fairfax village. good lockers that you can put stuff in. only criticism is there wasn't much soap for the shower i was in.

the only thing that prevented a 10 was that they did not have a chair in the room to sit on....if you are sleeping on a top bunk you have no where to sit to put your shoes on or sit....other wise this is one of the best for the money and location.....as arnold would say, "i'll be back."    thanks to the friendly staff alex, laura and vile who made my visit memorable.
completely dead atmosphere, the towels we were given were dirty. the room was smelly and dirty and the location was far from ideal. the other banana bungalow hostel is much much better

great location! room was nice and so were the facilities. only complaints are that the front desk staff always made it feel like it was such a burden if you had a question. also, i received dirty sheets and towels when i first checked in and when i brought them back to ask for clean ones the person at the front made it seem like i was being picky for requesting that instead of apoligizing?

the hostel has a great atmosphere and activities to meet fellow travelers. on the downside my room was dirty and the floor wasn't swiped during my stay and clearly hadn't been swiped in several days. the lady on the reception on friday afternoon completely killed my good mood, she was unpleasant, rude and condescending.   hostel is good, would stay there again
awesome place. got there at 9am and was able to have breakfast and leave my bags securely.

our stay at banana bungalow was very comfortable. our friend got sick and had a bad fewer, they gave us a new room immediately!  the staff was very friendly and the location was good. it is easy to get to hollywood boulevard, walk of fame and santa monica beach.   they had nice activitys, for example free barbecue, stand up comedy or ping pong tournaments. it is easy to get to know other people because they have nice lounges where you can just hang out.   all in one we would recommend the bbh!

we had a clean, private room. streets can be noisy but it's la. the woman who checked us in was really lovely and helpful (sorry no name). the day after we asked other staff some questions about the public transport card and they seemed annoyed and were unhelpful. ''just pay cash'' when we specifically asked about the card isn't the answer.    hostel itself had a standard (but free!) breakfast and lots of fun activities. it's located in a street with lots of shirts-n-sneakers stores and the grove.

nice location in west hollywood. a slight disadvantage is they don't assign you a bed number and it can create a confusion. my bed was taken by some other guy. the breakfast can have a little more options. overall recommended.
amazing deal , good vibe. i highly recommend it.

i loved this hostel it had such a friendly atmosphere, it was very clean, breakfast was good and above all the staff made this a special place. friendly willing to help from giving directions to attractions to organising events to mixing with hostel stayers. there was evening entertainment most nights food drinks and music, by far the best hostel i have stayed in in los angeles!!
total worth for money. staff were great. and everyday they have some kind of activity. i found people to hang with
enjoyed my stay looking forward to the next visit

great hostel with friendly staff and an amazing atmosphere. the rooms and internet were good, but the best thing about this hostel were the activities. monday night we were invited to a free bbq (with burgers and beers) and stand up comedy, which was amazing. the communal area also has table tennis and pool tables, so a good way to meet new people.

the hostel is located at a convenient location near the hollywood blvd. the beds aren't very great. the one i was given made too much noise on the slightest movement. making your own bed, especially if it's the top bunk can be a task. their biggest plus point was the parking space included, makes life so much easier.
pretty chill and nice hostel - apparently they have some decent parties when joining up with the other banana bungalow but wasn't around for that. clean and safe place to stay
not far from main hollywood. beds were difficult - very old and rickety. bathroom dated. staff were bit abrupt
great place to stay for a small amount of $$$. i will recommend to anyone who asks. a+
lots going on most nights and it's for free.   everyone is friendly who stayed at the hostel, great value for money if your stopping in la

excellent stay from start to finish. niall in particular was amazing. he went out of his way to make sure everyone was happy and involved in the activities.  free breakfast was a bonus. we had a late flight and they let us use the facilities during the day even though we had checked out. we really enjoyed the evening activities which were really good value for money. overall a very laid back and well run hostel.
great place to stay in la

the building itself is really run down and seemed to come with a lot of issues - warnings on toilets, vending machines out of order and showers with no hot water and weak pressure.   cleanliness was pretty bad. it looked like the drain in the shower hadn't been cleaned in days and there were items that belonged to previous visitors still in the rooms   at night they didn't have ppl on reception to help when cars were blocked in. the tow company required their authorization but no one available.

we stayed there for three nights and were only given the code to get in the building on the second night. this is despite asking them at check in if there was a code to get in, and they simply told us someone would be at reception till 12. front desk staff seem unenthusiastic and grumpy. no night guard on third night, didn't feel like a secure building. close to sunset strip which is a plus for those wanting to go to the comedy clubs. clean, cheap, nice kitchen staff no, but not a buzzing hostel

banana bungalow is my home away from home when i'm in la. it's located right in west hollywood, close to all the shops and restaurants. the people working here are always so kind and attentive. love that this place has parking spaces underneath. furthermore, the events held every night are always fun and the morning breakfast, while not grandiose, is a nice way to start your day. definitely worth the money. will be staying here again in the near future. love it!
great location and helpful staff. free breakfast was okay. not a lot of space to store bags in dorms but laundry was cheap :)
parking is too small

awesome place! great location, nice clean rooms and great atmosphere. staff has many events and free breakfast and the guests aren't loud or obnoxious. they also have free parking. would definitely recommend!

not a bad stay at all, the other banana bungalow seemed like it had a slightly better atmosphere, but we chose to stay here due to the parking facilities being limited at the other hostel. all in all not a bad place to stay, great people, great vibe, and very affordable!
the staff / hostel itself is awesome. they could cut back on enabling loud drunken kids.

favourite hostel of our trip so far, the hollywood one was a better location but we preferred the vibe of this one!! the nights organised by the hostel were really good fun, free drinks and delicious food plus great atmosphere. niall made our stay, even if he does look more like rafe spall than ryan gosling.... 100% recommend staying here if you're in la, absolutely loved it!!

i really enjoyed staying at the banana bungalows. the bathroom within the dorm room was an added luxury compared to some of the hostels i have stayed in. the dorms were clean and comfortable. the entertainment provided was very good too.

this hostel is more then i excepted it to be - it was clean, the staff was friendly (which i personally would like to give a shout out too, lauren, angie, nile, augstina, gabby, eyvlen, fucando, marina, matt, sorry if i missed your name) but everyone was so nice! the cleaning staff came everyday and cleaned my room. this hostel is not like any other, food is provided literally every night, breakfast is provided every morning.    literally the best neighborhood - walking distance to everything.

really enjoyed our stay at banana bungalow west hollywood. we found the location great as it was just one short bus journey into the chaos of hollywood but far enough away to be out of it when you want to be. the hostel offers 2 free meals a week through the activities - bbq definitely worth it. rooms are a decent size with an ensuite. staff were lovely on check in and keen to get you involved in all activities.
fun place, great way to meet other travelers!
safe location, nightly events, clean

simply put best hostel i've been to in the world (tops any european hostel) great facilities, gym,pool table,ping pong table, pooo table, outdoors hang out area with bar and downstairs area with another pool table and tv for late night/early morning chills. is right on fairfax and a few minute walk from melrose ave which are both shopping hubs!    they even through free dinners and events most nights of the week! shoutout to niall he's a legend and if you stay here go to canters deli 110% must !

we liked this hostel, but unfortunately our car was broken into in the hostel car park, as well as 2 other cars, despite voicing our concerns that the gates should have been closed. the security staff were not helpful.
just good good

this hostel was great! we're returning to la at the end of our two week trip and have made sure to return here! the staff were really friendly and helpful. in the evenings there was always free food and entertainment. niall was amazing as he even waited behind to catch an uber with us so as to make sure we made it to he event that night as we were running late. all in all, 100% recommend this place, best hostel we've stayed in all trip. thanks!
clean and secure place. staff very helpful and inviting.

amazing stay, best place to be. would definitely return. big shout out to staff member niall!! so friendly and helpful. make you feel very welcome and the activities provided are a great way to socialise and make friends!
good location, unprofessional staff. if you planning on sightseeing its not your place, but if you looking for a party it should suit you! also cheap place, so in the end you get what you pay for!

this hostel was nice - each room is ensuite and there was a spare toilet down the corridor which was great. the lack of plug sockets next to the bed was a bit inconvenient but the beds were comfortable and the communal areas seemed nice. it's hard to say if it's a good location because l.a is so spread out but the nearby dog shop which let you walk dogs was great and the free breakfast was always appreciated.
really awesome people there! had a positive experience :)

this is the main hostel i stay in when im in la. great communal area both inside and out, nice staff and they organised some pretty lose shindigs throughout the week to keep everyone entertained! karaoke night gets the most lose imo.

great hostel with great atmosphere ! the people are great, friendly and the italian food is amazing ! every night you have events, some of them are free and some of them are 5$ - 20$ highly recommend and will comeback !
lovely staff, clean, fun things to do there... 😊

a great hostel. quite good location. but no shops nearby about 10 min walk. free breakfast is good. if you're under 21 it's not as good as you can't enjoy the events they put on every night. $5 dinners / free bbq & beer nights. some staff were nice/easy going but some were very rude. keep your personal items in your lockers as some of my things were taken & reception told me it wasn't down to them. apart from that would recommend.

i really enjoyed my stay here. they had a lot of great events going on in the evenings were you could meet people and had an awsome time!   if i ever come back to l.a. i will stay there again!!  recommend it to all!!
it is a very nice place, not expensive and well located.

i had a great stay here after only planning to stay for 1-2 nights i got attached to the area and the vibe and stayed for a week. really close to a lot of street wear shops flooded on fairfax and melrose including supreme if you're into that. the staff were really friendly i got along with most. in particular got to know jacquill pretty well who showed me around and was overall a legend who made my stay feel like home.  overall a great atmosphere. home cooked dinner, optional party most nights.

banana bungalow is probably the best hostel i have ever stayed in. the staff are brilliant, the atmosphere is fantastic and the amount of fun things that the hostel put on are incredible. we had a free bbq and beer night - what is better than that?! the location is good - not the best but a taxi/uber to alot of destinations is relatively cheap. if it's a sunny day though you can walk to hollywood centre in around 45 mins. i cannot recommend this hostel enough.

dirty building, cockroaches, indian lady on reception extremely rude, other staff not much better. poor security, a girl who wasn't even staying here would come in to our room, use our shower etc. be careful using credit card. this was one of two places i used mine and my details were stolen. overall bad experience.
davvero un buon ostello : pulito, colazione abbondante e ambiente davvero accogliente ! certo bisogna avere la macchina per spostarsi ma a la è così ovunque ! lo raccomando !

make sure you don't go to the other banana bungalow hollywood. it took me forever to get to the other one from the airport only to realize that i had gone to the wrong banana bungalow and that there are two hollywood locations. have to say though the west location is better. the other hollywood one was quite sketchy at night and hidden between some restaurants i couldn't even find it

very nice place in the heart of hollywood. i stayed in the all girl's dorm, and all my roommates were really sweet and easy to get along with. i went to bed early and always got a good sleep. i recommend bringing earplugs because the noise from the courtyard is always audible inside the rooms.
wonderful little hostel, right in the heart of la.

great hostel about a 15 min walk from all of the action. staff were extremely polite and helpful. breakfast was good, coin laundry on bottom level and the bathrooms were clean. would definitely staff here again in travelling to la on a budget.
great atmosphere at the hostel, lots of social events organised by staff which allows guest to get to know one another. food provided in exchange for a tip, great value for money.

super far away from everything and a pain to get to from the bus station. shops are pretty far too. general vibe not great in the common area(which is almost non existent for those looking) except the garden area where you're aloud to blast music or yell until 12 am or until someone complains (that is after 12).   breakfast was pretty good although when i asked if i could have it five minutes before hand as i had to catch the bus (cereal was already out there) i was refused.  met some great peoplethough
not bad for the price is u just gonna stay for one night but it far from downtown angeles and beach
actually not the best location and a staff member was pretty dang rude to me for being a paying customer. i don't really reccommend this place. perhaps it is the cheapest option for a reason.

this place was great! something going on everynight. staff were friendly and helpful. good location. felt very safe. the free breakfast is a bonus! very clean. would definately come back and recommend! they offer shuttle services to most tourist attractions so thats handy. value for money. very happy with this hostel!!
facilities are a bit old, location was not ideal but relatively safe. great stay overall

awesome staff!  friendly, hospitable, no attitude.  fair treatment to all guests. centrally located .  you are close to the farmer's market,  west hollywood, and most of l.a.'s attractions by foot or bus.  if visiting santa monica, beverly hills, or the beach area, you may need to rent a car.  i had a pleasant, peaceful, and fun stay. no complaints. thanks to great staff for being nice & patient in a fast-paced nutty city .... a.k.a. "hollywood".     best wishes,  peter c.  u.s.a.  󾓦
i stay here all of the time! it's in an awesome location, not too expensive and i've never had a bad experience in the 5 years i've visited this place. see it up!

i loved stay at banana bungalow   staff was nice   best breakfast that i already had in all the hostels that i stayed!  they have a bunch of actives during the week  the only thing is that the bus don't stop on banana bangalow west hollywood it stops at banana bungalow close to the walk of the fame!!  if you intend to go buy bus, know that it is gonna stop at the walk of fame and you have to get a uber till banana bungalow west hollywood that will cost you between  $4 $7!
excellent hostel!
great stay. location was great but the breakfast included wasn't great. more options would be preferred

hostel has good facilities and clean rooms. beds pretty comfy and kitchen is decent size. they organise some good night activities and staff were really helpful. little pricey but that's la. would recommend
''twas trashy. you get what you pay for.

i'll start by saying that i didn't spend a lot of time at this hostel... my friend and i left during the day & actually stayed with a friend elsewhere for 1 out of the 4 nights we were there. i reserved a 6 bed mixed dorm, but for the duration of our trip it seemed to be exclusively men. our overall experience was great- the beds & bathrooms were good and the free breakfast was very convenient. while not immediately close to shops, its in a very central neighborhood with lots to walk to.
nice place, helpful staff

great value for money. nearly every night of the week the hostel has some type of activity. providing free food and drinks.   half a block from a small supermarket where you can get all basics. or roughly at 15minute walk to the farmers market.
staffs are very friendly, location quite good and near to bus stop, activities provided by hostel are awesome, but the toilet's flush in room has a little problem

staff really helpful and friendly, everything is exactly like the video on their website, pool table, ping pong, loads of activities, rooms cleaned daily and got enough sleep because other guests were respectful. locals restaurants and supermarkets in walking distance. highly recommended - would stay again.
my stay was awesome the staff was very friendly and helpful. the rooms were clean and the staff organised events are very fun. will go again.

this was honestly the best hostel i've come across. ideal for socialising as they offer great events every night of the week and the facilities were great. it's in a really cool part of town and the staff are so friendly and make you feel at home. the rooms and bathrooms are spotless. would 100% recommend.

amazing hostel! only one guy who was working at the bbq was a bit rude. most of the staff were great. the van driver (an indian guy who i forgot the name) was amazing. the manager/owner was also very good. there was an argentinian girl called lucia who was an great person always helping around. loved it.

kind of a sketchy area but the security was good so i felt safe as a female solo traveler. place is kind of dingy and dirty but i only stayed one night so it was fine. bunks aren't very comfortable. i didn't get a chance but seemed like plenty of opportunities to meet people.

good location close to the beverly center and west hollywood area. i drove and they have free underground parking so that was great. they have a bar/party area if you're into partying and a big area to socialize. internet connection was good. the only con is the sheets are cheap quality and too small. every morning i would wake up with the fitted sheet half off the mattress which was kind of annoying having to remake the bed everyday.

very satisfied with this hostel. perfect for youth travelers looking to get in the mix of la. located well enough to reach everything you could need and would want to see. helpful staff and very fun common space make for a good spot to make lifelong travel friends. would stay again.

the staff here were so helpful and the location was near everything. my friend and i were visiting from michigan on spring break so we were very happy with all the suggestions and useful info for all the attractions we wanted to do. although, we did find a couple bugs in our room (in which they immediately upgraded us to a better room), as well as the water being cold in our shower, we were really pleased with our stay. 10/10 recommend.
hey,    it was an amazing hostel, with nice people and the staff was awesome!

it was an incredible experience  staying here. clean facilities and super friendly staff. i made some genuine friends here and connected with people from all across the globe. i would definitely recommend this place 👍🏾  and it's right on hollywood blvd. cannot beat that. 😉

this is a great hostel! fun crowd, great central location, clean, and they offer you tons of resources for helping you make the most out of your la stay. most nights they have fun activities planned in conjunction with the sister location on hollywood boulevard. staff is helpful and informative. the free breakfast is standard but welcome. affordable price and a really good value for your money. i'll stay again!
such a fun hostel! highly recommend staying at this hostel.

kind of old and dingy, but fine for a couple of nights. bunks are old and creaky and have no outlets or lights, not the most comfortable. definitely not on the level of european hostels. felt safe as a solo female traveler. bathrooms were clean. good location near shops and walkable to trader joe's/whole foods. as i said, probably wouldn't stay here for more than 3 or 4 nights.

in the staff the hostel has a man so bad in customer service. the only one who has a great customer experience is the girl that collects the name for the parties. the place is so far of the centre. hostel has good plans but i miss more interest in giving information for the tours. the cleaning is terrible in my room, i arrived and for three days it has a lot of dirtiness. only my last day the room was cleaned.

location was a bit sketchy but not that big a deal. facilities were great - plenty of gathering space and available activities. breakfast offerings were basic. staff seemed detached and somewhat bothered and weren't enthusiastically suggestive of things to do.
they offer free activities every night. they even had free unlimited beer one night.  i'd say you really get your money's worth. nice location even if it is a bit far from most attractions.

this hostel is by far the worst hostel i've stayed in. the location is pretty poor, the washing machines can only be used at night so you have to chose between clean clothes or their 'nightly planned activities', they only had 1 working computer which was used by staff to watch netflix, the tv did not work and when we asked for help the staff member accusingly told us we must've broken it, the hot water didn't work, and staff were far from helpful.

great place to stay, very clean, large kitchen, great wifi.  close to everything with helpful staff.  and awesome social environment, hostel rubs daily events and shuttles   will stay again if ever back in la

my one night stay here was fine. facilities seemed pretty good and breakfast was sufficient. seemed well set up for activities and socialising with a bar and common room. i found people quite unsociable over breakfast but it was a rainy day so perhaps that affected the mood!
great place to stay, only thing is the water is not warm in shower and only one sheet for the bed not good during colder months other than that great place.

this is a pretty solid hostel, good wifi, kitchen, outdoor areas, ping pong, pool, tv in the rooms, lockers, individual showers, good beds and organised activities every night. could be cheaper, but hey it's america and you get what you pay for. you'll be happy here.

i would stay here again. staff was helpful, desktop internet/computer and local calling was also helpful. i wish i had taken advantage of the shuttle parties to the west hollywood bungalow. nightly activities were fun and made it easy to meet others. don't forget to cook up a storm in their more than adequate kitchen. lockers in dorms were a nice touch. used the 780, 217 and 218 buses, plus the bus on melrose for downtown access. great restaurants in the area including canter's, aek ramen, etc.
beyond all expectations.  they underplay how good it is as a hostel option, or even just a general option for staying a while in la.
good hostel just not enough showers and bathrooms. cool staff and nice location
really happy, lots of friendly people, kitchen was a little under maintained but facilities were good. yeah overall we had a pleasant stay.
great location. staff is nice, but a bit unprofessional. the hostel smells bad. the breakfast is plain. over all a good place to spend a couple of nights.

this hostel is a really cool place to be, it's affordable (so long as you go for a dorm room) the staff are decent/fun people and the atmosphere is great, i checked in on the 15th for a 2 night stay but kept extending, mainly because of the amazing people i met at this hostel, in the end i stayed for nearly 2 weeks just partying and chilling with everyone, the lockers are small but big enough for valuables, 217 bus to hollywood takes 10minutes, nice clean place as well, i will be coming back!!!!
great hostel! superb atmosphere, awesome facilities, comfy beds!

when in la it's very important to have your own car because the city is huge. from this hostel driving to santa monica is almost one hour, downtown 30min, hollywood 15min, weho 10min. beverly hills 30min, usually backpackers on a budget don't rent cars but a car (and uber/lyft) in this city is a really must. look at the priceline app for cheap deals. this hostel has underground parking and is close to weho which is the reason why i booked it. nice stay, not so super clean but it's ok.
hostel world apply too much commissions and fee! is better to book direct without hostel world
cool and clean well located place. it was so nice i just stayed way more them planned.
lots of bums around. walking around at night not an option.
verry good
very welcoming....clean...good people...good coffee   ideal location to get anywhere you want to explore

located in a quiet neigbouhood, one 10 minutes ride bus to hollywood blvd where the attractions are. facilities are incredible.staff are nice and funny. like that they have activites for guests in the hostel, easy to socialize with others. but the atmosphere is a bit party-like, still hear the noice of the hostel actibity at mid night in the room, might not be suitable for children or whom want to be quiet.the lower storey of the bunk bed is to small, can't sit on the bed.

good place to stay in terms of having somewhere to sleep. the breakfast is awful and the atmosphere was okay. they took us out one night really far from the hostel and basically told us to find our own way back even though there was no taxis driving around which was very frustrating. staff was incredible when helping us find ways to get around and accommodating when the lock to our room broke. overall good place to sleep but that's about all.
it could have been the best hostel i have ever stayed at compared to about 20 others if i had not seen the huge rat in the kitchen in my last night.
staff was so friendly but the room was kina massy seems like some people live there for long time. it was not bad with cheap pice and good location in west hollywood!

great location.  they had events organised every seconds night which was great. the staff could of been a little more helpful, some were great others just seemed liked they didn't want to be there. had a great time and would happily stay there again.

really nice hostel. it may look a bit dated inside but it really didn't matter. the people were all really nice and able to help in any way possible.  i can definitely recommend this to other travellers.

i love this hostel, this was my second time coming here and i love how close and accessible it is to the happenings of hollywood and west hollywood. it is often very clean and the people who stay can at times be hit or miss but this time all of my roommates were very friendly. the staff tends to be friendly most of the time as well, but this time while checking in i was greeted by the welcoming committee. dont tell people your moving to la otherwise your money isn't green and they wont renew u!!

i stayed here one night and loved that they had a private bathroom attached to the 6 person dorm, as well as fresh sheets/blanket/pillowcase per bed. the staff were very friendly, and there was a free parking garage to keep my rental car.     this location was close to a bunch of stuff in west hollywood, and i was satisfied with my stay.  i recommend this location.

pros: close to a bunch of shops, fun and helpful staff, fun area to hangout in, events thrown are fun   cons: dirty and very outdated, rooms were cramped, right beside a very busy street so sometimes it's hard to sleep    overall the experience was okay, but i expected to get a little more for my money's worth

staff is very friendly, lovely and pro active, the place is cleaned constantly, kitchen is spacious and well equiped, also very clean  the elevator was broken while i was there, but no big deal as they have only one floor up.
cheap stay in l.a. nice atmosphere and many free drinks. not located at the best area of l.a., but close to many nice places like sunset strip or hollywood

out of all the hostels i stayed in america this by far had the best atmosphere.  there was some really good events held each night i was there at either the hostel or their sister one in hollywood which you allowed you to socialise with other travellers quite easily.  this was good as an alone traveller, and i met some really cool people which helped enjoy los angeles as i though the city itself was pretty ordinary.

i really felt comfortable in this hostel. great security, and locker facilities. the staff were amazing, throwing party nights on certain days; it was a lot of fun. the rooms and bathrooms were immaculate, and cleaned daily. facilities were awesome, fuzbol table, table tennis, large kitchen area as well as a really large kitchen with lots of fridges and a couple of vending machines. at midnight when the outdoor area closes, you can take the party in the basement hall.
the best hostel stay i'd ever experienced. will definitely come back.
it was the best place i have ever had.
great place. safe, clean and great atmosphere because they have activities every night to get everyone together.
staff was really friendly. generally a good experience. would also recommend to rather stay here than on hollywood blvd. probably the best hostel i've been in la in terms of value for money.
great! thanks!  especially for staff are so kind.

eventhough we were only there for a couple of nights they made us feel sooo welcome!   complementary beer on arrival with a free bar that evening then off to a pub crawl :).   although it isn't in the main area of where everything is, there are plenty of cheap buses that can take you there! :)   they also have lots of information of how you get to places from the hostel and even offer free lifts to places!! :)   we loved our stay and if we're ever there again will definitely be returning!

excellent location and free parking! i have stayed at various hostels in la and for around 30 dollars a night, you are not going to find a better deal.     some of the hallway lights had dead bugs that needed cleaning out and sometimes the hot water in the shower would not work but i have stayed here multiple times and have had a great experience.    if you are looking for fun group activities, this place is great too!

this is a fairly okay hostel, does okay with the activities but half of them are at the other hostel in hollywood. the tiki bar is only open on event nights but you can drink in the courtyard. i found it quite frustrating that the bag hold was not secure.
good place
great hostel, super close to everything i needed, for a one night stay it was perfect - heaps of social events for those who arent sure what to do or travelling alone.
fantastic hostel! staff were great, there was a lively atmosphere and the facilities were excellent. highly recommend
banana bungalow is a stellar hostel. you would be making a great choice by staying here. could not possibly ask for a better location, better facilities, or a friendlier staff.
the bathroom is clean. however, it is too noisy....

great hostel if you are a solo traveller as they have planned events every night which makes it easier for meeting other travellers. bed sheets didn't fit the bed i had so that was a pain. location is close to walk of fame but miles away from the beach. i'd recommend this hostel!
definitely i&#39;d stay again, the people there are just so awesome and the atmosphere is so cozy!

it wasn&#39;t as bad as the number shows, but not all in all good. more or less you just get what you paid for. since for just $30 or so, it did the job. one thing bothered me a lot is the designated parking lot fills up quick and there aren&#39;t any spot outside the underground to park for carefree. that was one of the biggest factor, so i was very disappointed and made me nervous to get it towed
accidentally booked the wrong banana bungalow and they changed it straight away and put me in the same dorm as my friend. such a good vibe and everyone was so friendly and relaxed. thanks so much

my stay at the banana bungalow, west, on fairfax liin. in west hollywood,was everything i expected and more!  this was my first time staying at a hostel.  i was very pleased.  i stayed in a dorm room with 3 bunk beds and an attached suite with 3more bunk beds.  all of the women were quiet and respectful!!  i was interested to learn that  everyone was from all over the world ... switzerland, germany, france, australia to name a few.  the accommodations were clean.  highly recommended, reasonable.

i really love this hostel!   did not want to be in downtown la, and i believe this was te best choice.   pretty cool athmosphere, great staff, cool looking hostel and the location was pretty convenience.     if i ever go back to la, for sure i&#39;ll stay there.

america isn&#39;t that good at hostels in general, but this place was cool. plenty of activities on in the evening, and a good vibe created to meet other travellers. clean enough and good wi fif also.
staff were very helpful, hostel was clean and the organised events during the evenings were great!
this was a great place to just chill. there are plenty of people around to meet and greet, but the rooms and the roommates are quiet so you can nap to your nap&#39;s content. very chill, indeed.
the hostel was centrally located and very clean. it was easy to find parking and the staff was very helpful!

perfect hostel for the solo traveler. the organized events were a hoot. staff are lovely and provided a cheat sheet for the buses and trains to get around which was super helpful.  comfy bed and hot showers.

banana bungalows west hollywood were excellent, there is always something organised for you to attend and get your drank on or just chill on your own if thats your thing, the location was perfect, it was easy to get around and the area isn&#39;t as crazy as being on, or near the hollywood strip.  also the staff are all pretty damn fine so thats always a plus !
i really enjoyed my stay.  was welcomed with a nice cold beer after a long day.  thanks guys,  i would stay here anytime 👍

great hotel in a great place with a really fun-friendly vibe! everything was clean, and they put on the best comedy show the night i was there. felt safe and in a great location of the budget traveller!

the banana bungalow west hollywood is one of my favorite hostels in los angeles, really good location, friendly staff and cool activities every night. not my first time in this hostel, definitely not the last :)
it was absolutely awesome.
staff were really helpful and the showers were good. events make meeting people really easy. good wifi.
party hostel, not able to get good rest

great location as its not a far walk from the grove or farmers market as well as a lot of shops and restaurants. i&#39;d recommend spending time in the other banana bungalow as well to see the other side of hollywood. breakfast is good and the atmosphere is great as staff are friendly and welcoming. planned tours most days and activities in the evening too. offer free parking too.
good hostel, quite a bit further away from hollywood blvd than their sister hostel at east hollywood though

i travel a lot & have stayed in many hostels, but i think this one has had the most social atmosphere of all of the ones i&#39;ve been in! they arrange visits to the beach, universal, & disneyland, which is awesome. and everything was clean and well organized! had a great time and met some great people in my room and in the common room downstairs!

i stayed here while traveling solo from overseas and it was my first hostel experience. i enjoyed my stay here a lot. the atmosphere was great and it was a great place to meet people as well as new drinking buddies. the staff were helpful, friendly and polite. the rooms weren't amazing but the cost was right for what you got.
great people, the breakfast will keep you going while you stroll around la. a good night&#39;s sleep in a comfortable bed waits for you if you need it!!

stayed here for one night during a long layover via lax. quite social place which is good if your looking to make friends, but was a tad bit annoying when you are looking for a cheap place to rack out for the night. the staff was helpful and the breakfast was decent enough.

much like most of hollywood these days, the hostel looked pretty tired and run down. common areas and kitchen could be a lot more cleaner than they were. some beds had no blankets, some pillows are like resting your head on a bag of potatoes. lots of activities on offer from the hostel though which was great.

the door is always locked so i felt really safe in banana bungalow. the neighborhood felt pretty safe as well, which i value as a female traveling alone. i was fortunate enough to be in a dorm with very easygoing, respectful people. there was an event going on downstairs when i went to sleep, but my sleep was never interrupted. the free breakfast was enough to get me started on my long journey the next day.  if you&#39;re looking for a chill place to stay, i&#39;d recommend banana bungalow in fairfax.
really good, i&#39;ll definitely stay there again
terrific!!  i didn&#39;t participate in any of the activities but they seemed great. pool tables and tvs.  rooms cleaned every morning. and you can&#39;t beat the price.

yeah, great hostel and everything, sure. but the kitchen is loaded with styrofoam cups and bowls and paper plates and plastic cutlery! at a hostel! i stayed here on my first night back to the states in two years of travel in australia and new zealand, where every hostel is super environmentally friendly and having any sort of disposable crockery and cutlery would be out of the question. i was shocked. america is a strange place, my friends.

they serve breakfast which rules, give away free booze on their events which also rules and there are lockers in the dorms! clint was so friendly, informative and hospitable! made me feel very welcome, as well as ara, sam and riley!
location was great!! staff was always happy to help you with something.

great location, excellent value, great staff. have stayed here close to 12 times. definately recommend banana bungalow to anyone looking for budget accomodation while in los angeles. xoxoxo see you soon banana bungalow !!!!
perfect location for the hollywood experience. lots to do within walking distance. met some amazing people too! had a blast!

i have stayed at banana bungalow several times. there is solo much to say but, it feels like home every time i stay there. i call it my "vacation home" the staff is great, always friendly and very helpful. there are plenty of activities and opportunity to socialize or just chill. it is located close to the grove which is great for people watching and farmers market. there is shopping nearby and great facilities to cook in. i recommend this hostel to everyone. see you soon banana bungalow !!!!!
had a nice stay !
so clean! very well kept restrooms! quiet atmosphere and well supplied kitchen.

awesome hostel and great price. $30 w/parking per day is hard to beat. great people from all over the world.    my only suggestion to the staff would be to ensure that the $15 all-you-can-drink plus club event is managed better. my friend and i ended up having to pay a cover charge for lure nightclub when we were promised free cover. they said there were too many guys in the group and cut us off from free cover.so let them know beforehand to expect a various ratio please!

stayed here twice - after the first time i vowed never to stay again due to a terrible atmosphere but i had to due to needing to be in west hollywood.    fortunately things got better the second time atmosphere-wise: there was a great free barbecue on with comedy. very nice atmosphere for this. unfortuantely my room smelled like urine.
i enjoyed staying in banana bungalow. the staff was friedly, beds comfy, breakfast tasty and the party crazy.

great location, excellent price.  the hostel is close to all the important spots of the city. the neighbourhood is safe and pleasent. i went with my wife on honeymoon, we didn&#39;t like the mood of the staff, they were very cold and distant. also, the mood of the overall guests was very weird. i&#39;ve stayed in many hostels and there&#39;s always a feeling of &#34;shareness&#34; and fellowship in the air that we couldn&#39;t find here. if you&#39;re looking for great price+location+don&#39;t talk to me, t
real sweet place to kick back, socialise and pretty central for all the main attractions.
great location

i had a fantastic stay at banana bungalow! the staff there was knowledgeable and helped with everything and they also facilitated a very friendly atmosphere. the rooms were clean, and the other facilities (laundry room, game room, etc.) were great as well. a very happy stay!
first hostel experience and couldn&#39;t have asked for a better one! i want to come back already!! :) homey feel

we had a great time banana bungalow and met some awesome people. the comedy night was super funny and the free burgers and beers exceeded our expectations! delish :)  one of the girls on the front desk was really rude and not very helpful at all... a bit of a shame but apart from that w had a good stay.   thanks again
it&#39;s always a pleasure to stay here! i&#39;ve stayed so many times that i&#39;ve lost count. thanks again! and see you next year! :p
this hostel is amazing! is a super fun hostel that provides with amazing activities and free stuff like bbq, shuttle to the beach and party. if i go back to la i&#39;ll come back here for sure.
the hostel was very clean.  i love the fact that the parking was free.  for the location and the price, you can&#39;t beat it.

good hostel but not the best location, the other bannana bungalow is located better. staff are useless, breakfast average, they advertise loads of free stuff but there not really free. workers need to find a way to promote more of a social atmosphere. very clean though
good location, just a short bus ride to hollywood bvld, close to supermarket. free breakfast of toast and cereal, good wifi, nice communal areas, generally kept very clean.
great hostel for west hollywood kind of area. staff are super nice and helpful regarding activities. during my stay there it was a very age varying crowd there...
good location. basic amenities. i had to kill a few cockroaches and that was the only downside.
nice hostel. i want to be there again.
really great place to meet people and have a good time. the people there is really chill and it&#39;s easy to get to know people.
fantastic hostel, great experience and lovely staff. unfortunately let down by an extremely rude gentleman working the door at night.
we really liked it. great people. good price.
cool and clean hostel  location ok  welcoming staff  good facilities and good activities at night

kind of party hostel, but the room i stayed was noisy free. beds are comfortable, but i missed individual lights and more power sockets. everything was very clean. free breakfast is good. cheap laundry service and other great facilities. it's easy to meet people around. staff is helpful. location is nice, walking distance to farmers market e near to bus stops (easy to get to everywhere).
great location with great staff that&#39;s very helpful!
i was only there for one night as i was passing through but it left a great impression as a fun place. it&#39;s great if your interested in the area but i had to go into la and city traffic is awful.

i am in l.a. for two weeks and am staying in different hostels, just to experience different neighbourhoods.  this hostel has been my favourite by far.  very nice atmosphere.  people actually talk to each other.  nice garden, big kitchen, nice lounge downstairs.  and easy enough to get to by bus for non-drivers as well.  recommended.

i'm 100% coming back the next time i'm in la! i couldn't have asked for a better place, with a nicer bunch of people. the staff were so friendly and accommodating and events we're held most nights for the patrons. you can't go wrong with burgers, tacos, comedy, karaoke etc. wish i could've stay longer!

felt like a hospital - very sterile atmosphere. would not stay here again, but can&#39;t complain about it really. for your money you&#39;re getting the bare necessities which is great but no interaction with other residents (apart from some cool people in my room). one party had only ~3 people sign up so...
great place,nothing to complain.
sometimes people from staff don't have enough information about the city or even de hostel activities. people make some confusion with deliveries too.
cool place with nice people, amazing location and facilities!
very nice. loved the perks- free beer, comedy show, ect.

i have a nut allergy, the breakfast they serve was a nutty cereal and peanut butter and nutella on toast. they did have porridge but it was scared about the contamination with nuts everywhere.  it was hard to sleep, you could here cars and sirens all night, need better noise deduction windows.   the bunk beds beds were so squeaky.   if they say free drinks and dinner you are expected to tip per drink and for food. the service is great once you tip. the pub crawls they offered didn&#39;t go ahead.

if there was a rating beyond excellent for the staff at this place i would use it. i was so impressed by the italian receptionist elena. she went above and beyond her duties to make sure i was happy and having a good time at the hostel...and i really did...thank you for making me so comfortable and for helping me with everything!
it was great. breakfast & socializing in the morning, plus an after hours game & tv room for a night owl like myself. clean rooms & friendly staff, enjoyed my stay will definitely be back
very friendly staff and clean enviroment all the time.
staff were rude/indifferent. net didn't work, no one cared. room was nice, clean and more or less quiet.

the bungalow was a cool place to stay. everyone staying there was super chill as well as the staff who were also happy to help out with any issue whether it was extra blankets or swapping our room for whatever reason. the breakfast options were more than just toast (amazing, right), and in the main room there are pool and ping pong tables, also a cool outdoor area so plenty of things to do when youre not exploring.
i loved the location of the hostel, great area. free parking garage is great, huge common areas, great facilities overall. totally recommend this hostel, had a great stay! thanks

i was most impressed with the industrial kitchen/abundant fridges and the location. most of the staff was friendly. really cool variety of guests. convenient shuttle for $14 to lax. it was exactly what i needed -- thanks!
the cleaning crew were very detail oriented.  i was impressed on how clean the facilities were!

good position, closed to farmer market and 10 min by car / 40 min walk from sunset and hollywood. many thrift shops and vintage clothing shops in the surroundings where make big deals; closed to the famous locations of school of rock highschool spot and grease gym yard spot. very good the holliwood/beverly hills/bel air/melrose tour with the van, do it if u can!
excellent place to stay.

it was my first time at this hostel. overall was great. one thing about this hostel, you make up your own bed. they had a great kitchen and complimentary breakfast. great location as well to all tourist spot.   definitely will comeback. just wished they had a all male dormitory. girls that i was with were cool and respectful so it's all good.
the experience at banana bungalow was ok. i was there in winter, so i guess that the lack of energy was to be expected. the room was nice, the facilities clean and the location central.

the day time staff (until  midnight or so) were so great. everyone was knowledge and extremely friendly. i ended up extending my stay with them and i'm glad i did. the hostel was cleaned and the overall facility was awesome. i really appreciate the time and activities at staff put together. definitely would stay there again and i can't wait to come back!  cheers from canada
