amazing place!!! really nice hostel with a lot of cool activities every day! free beer and activities with the orbit hostel, so you are more people to do the party!!! there is a party room in the basement, so when you come back of the bar, you have a place to go. the free computer to use, it's 3 imac!!!  the dorm are big,  two room connected together of 6 beds, but the people are nice, so it's not a problem.  good location and nice staff. the banana bungalow are always a good place to stay.
really enjoyed the stay, staff were friendly and helpful, good tours and atmosphere. i recommend it to others
awesome place to stay in and great location, staff were very helpful

this place was ideally located and had a great atmosphere with a tv room upstairs and a pool table. a great backpacker nearby to book trips and have barbeque for free if staying at this hostel. you can take a bus to the hollywood walk of fame and train station. met great people all wanting to become actors( great people). will stay again.
it was ok to stay there for the night.

i really enjoyed this hostel concept , ive been to venice before , but i really enjoyed this location , great for walking to everything . i would stay again . things to note there is a quiet time from 10pm -10 am , but there is a tv room you can still talk in , beds are comfy , no large lockers , but there are smaller ones for valuables , bring you own lock . there are communal towels for drying hands after using the restroom so bring hand sanitizer
great people. great location. clean. very fun.
hood location and clean. not so much of an atmosphere, the showers can be fixed and upgraded. little pricey. overall an ok stay

podshare venice is located literally 10mins walking distance from venice beachfront. the whole house is very well-built with a lot of amenities, and the staff is super friendly and 'helpful with loads of recommendations! the house also includes a front yard and a small basketball court, what's more to ask for in co-living space! we really enjoy our stay there

really cool hostel, love the pods with the tv in each one and the living area as well as the relaxing garden with a basketball court and table tennis. the breakfast was poor so i had to buy my own the second day. 5 minute walk to venice beach and lots of restaurants.

this was my first experience with dorm-style lodging so i was a little nervous, but for the price i figured it was worth a shot. i'm so glad i did but it was wonderful! perfect for those who really just need a place to put their stuff down and rest their heads at night. i didn't spend too much time hanging around the the property, only because i was busy exploring the city however it was clean, the people were nice, and the location was fantastic!

the sleeping pods were amazing, that was definitely my favourite thing about the place. the location isn't bad, but it's still a bit of a walk to get anywhere other than venice beach. i was advised against taking buses so had to uber everywhere - not great, an uber to hollywood (for example) is about $22 one way. the fact it's advertised breakfast is included is a bit misleading - it's just "being able to use the shared food" of which there isn't much.

really clean, modern-looking hostel. had a super friendly vibe and the staff were very helpful and welcoming. wish i stayed longer! felt very safe and you could borrow the hostels bikes to go for a ride along venice beach or wherever else. will definitely stay here again next time i'm in venice beach

great overall, super cool place, friendly people. unfortunately there are no locks provided which makes securing your valuables problematic, especially if it turns out on site. so everyone bring a lock!

a so-so hostel experience. the pods are really nice and feel private, the facility was gorgeous and peaceful but not very clean. trash cans overflowing, dirty dishes, no toilet paper sometimes, etc. half the time there was no one at the front desk so when a guest came to check in so they'd just have to wander around trying to find an employee (no name tags or shirts so it's hard to tell who works there and who is a guest). overall i had a decent time but this place needs to be run better.

great hostel - just not much atmosphere. would be good if they have people a reason to hang in the social area (movie night, free cake one night etc). struggled to meet anyone while here but the hostel really is beautiful. bit pricey but they all are in the us!
the staff were really great. it was suitable to the accommodations i needed.

located just a few blocks off of abbot-kinney, this co-living space is not to be missed if you're looking for a quiet, clean and non-party hostel, this is for you.     the facility is clean, comfortable and equipped with a full kitchen. you are about 10 minutes from venice beach and a few steps from the canals.  staff was pleasant, beds were comfy. the hostel was secure, both inside and out. they have lockers to lock up any valuables. super quiet at night, making it great for non-party travel.

pros: big outdoor space. interesting places to walk to.  cons: dirty! wifi was hit or miss. couldn't use tv in bunk because too many other people were signed on to the same account. like the other locations the "breakfast"  that is supposedly provided seems to just be what was left behind by previous guests and moved into the "community" pile. gals working here weren't bad, but also not terribly friendly either.
i love this place but never went i tcancelked my reservation but no one ever contacted me to credit my money back as i got sick and had to fly home back to colorado 267-874-1902

the vibes were chill and the location was amazing! majority of the staff were really friendly and helpful, there were a few times when i had no idea where they were as they weren't at the front desk. the facilities were really cool- computers and basketball court and outdoor furniture available, and a tv in bed. the bathrooms were good, except one toilet door broke- so they were down one. the only thing is there is barely anything for breakfast- i had to buy my own. free bike rental though!
highly recommended!
amazing facilities and very comfortable beds! would definitely book again.

this hostel is awesome! i love how it's set up. it's super close to both the beach and the venice canals. they had a whole bunch of things you can do outside (sport equipment, a grill, rentable bikes). the staff was extremely nice and the overall atmosphere was good. the only down side i had is that the bathroom stalls are tiny and one of the showers doesn't have a changing room attached to it. but, i had a great stay and definitely will be staying at another podshare whenever i'm in the area :)

super recomendable! todo el staff​ super amable.. mi primer noche fue en los cuartos de arriba (que no están muy buenos) e inmediatamente al día siguiente me cambiaron al sector principal!!  el amigo venezolano me dio la bienvenida con 2 margaritas :) el lugar es como se ve en las fotos, cuentan con toallas y la ubicación es excelente!

the staff was awesome! i really loved danny! what a genuinely amazing person. i was a little scared at first, not ever having stayed at a hostel before, but the podshare is a great introduction into space sharing. the property is always clean, calm, and peaceful, even during busy times. i am a very light sleeper, but with the right mind set, i was able to sleep peacefully and soundly in my pod. the personal tvs are an awesome bonus!
looks good, functions poorly. no doors on bathrooms, and 3 showers total. rude unhelpful staff.

i stayed at this podshare for a few days. the staff that work here are very open and welcoming. the place itself is surrounded by a nice garden and well secured with a gate. also, it's only a short walk to the beach. you can rent a bike for free, which is a great way to get around. the pods itself look very nice and are completely open. this might be a remark to someone who is searching for privacy. also, the cleanliness of the facilities was not always great. but would recommend for sure!

staff were great. location is superb. 5 mins to the boardwalk and beach. 2 mins to abott kinney with funky eateries and decent coffee.  bus stop literally at the front door to help get around la. awesome outdoor area, staff organised yoga and meditation in the morning. i even got free smashed avo on toast on my last day. literally my only gripe has been mentioned here before, the showers are pretty much always filthy. would stay again.
the staff here are great - so friendly and helpful! the hostel itself is about 10 minutes walk from venice beach and boardwalk, 5 minutes from venice canals and 2 minutes from abbot kinney boulevard.

totally awesome hostel w great value for money, located just minutes away (by foot!!) from venice beach and abbot kinney blvd.  very clean, calm at night, the parking lot is handy - only a pool is missing ;)

it’s a really lovely clean and modern hostel with big comfy beds and comfortable sofas and good wifi. there is a kitchen so you can make food and there is a cupboard with stuff people have left that you can use - i made a big bowl of porridge with peanut butter for my breakfast with the leftovers. there isn’t much around the hostel but it’s a short walk from the beach. it’s nice and quiet at night and i slept well. having travelled a lot, this was by far the most expensive hostel i’ve stayed in.
this place was great.
excellent place to stay. i would highly recommend it to anyone travelling to venice beach or looking to have a base nearby to visit la (provided you have transport)
great hostel, only improvement would be private mirrors i'm each pos but apart from that it was perfect!

i booked two beds with confirmation emails to prove. they said i was not in their system and that there was a mistake on their end and there were no beds left. i paid the deposit and $30 to get to the place.  in the end they gave me the employee bunk bed section (completely different than what was promised) at full price. no compensation whatsoever and i was left utterly upset . manager insisted that i was promised "beds" and that's technically what i am receiving. highly unorganized system.
i like the place... all made of wood, really cool.... nice place, awesome shower.... but no breakfast at all.... just sugar to ' share'....

very clean and well located. the staff were friendly and helpful. the rokus don't  work. that didn't matter much to us because we weren't in the hostel too long, but it's poor form to sell the hostel as being this cool thing with tvs in every pod if they don't actually work. the outside is super nice with basketball and volleyball courts, ping pong, and soccer.  overall it was a positive experience and i would stay again.

i stayed in a few hostels across america and this was sadly the worst. it could be made a better experience quite easily.     there is no privacy and lockers are tiny. the hostel prides itself on being 'open' but this makes it very unpleasant unless you are with a big group. the bathrooms are small with holes in the door so you can see people in the shower/toilet. there is nowhere to get changed at all so ppl change in the shower causing a queue.     the location with regards to venice is good.
a great place and awesome location. friendly and helpful staff and a peaceful environment.
awesome staff and great facilities. stayed here more than once and will definitely be back again.

this is much bigger than the los feliz location. with so many more people, it's tougher to keep as clean - but they still do a very good job. location is super close to abbot kinney, and about a 10 minute walk to the beach. parking in a huge + as well as the yard, which includes a ping-pong table, basketball court, volleyball etc. easy to meet people and quiet time after 10pm makes it easy to get a good sleep. my standards might be high from my experience at los feliz, but i highly recommend.

super comfy beds not so clean bathrooms! staff didn't seem to know a lot about the area. maps/flyers would have helped a lot. backyard area is nice at all times of the day. although, there was not a lot of furniture so it made it a bit awkward to meet people. the furniture that was there was pretty old. the space would benefit from fixing up the communal areas.
great place, great starff!

great hostel with great sized beds.  it's also in a good location. negatives would be bathroom stalls just had wooden slat folding doors and no big lockers for your bags, but nothing was stolen and i didn't really fear anything would be.

the property would not let me stay here because my flight was delayed and wanted to charge me double for one night.     they refused to get back to me properly about it within 24 hours, knowing this would make my booking invalid for change in anyway.    horrendously disappointing.    not so 'community' based from my experience.

since there's not much information about this place since it's so new i wrote a long review and uploaded it to google drive; https://drive.google.com/file/d/0bx5h5lq1xlagzxu1wnf4zm5hz0e/view?usp=sharing    the short version is that it is a nice place and i'd recommend it. not perfect for light sleepers or party people. no place to hang out with people after 10 pm which was too bad. not much privacy but felt safe. easy to meet people and good location. i had a good night's sleep.

amazing place to go and everyone very friendly, felt the staff could have been more involved and didn't know who were staff and who were hostel users so didn't know who to address. would 100% recommend, no faults at all. pictures didn't do it justice, amazing experience. lovely sporting facilities and great space to hang out. shame they don't have a social area after 10pm but if it's warm, outside is more than substantial. i didn't use the lockers provided because the environment felt so safe.
super cute place. really well kept and modern. nice bathrooms and showers.
awesome accommodation, however the staff weren't too friendly which was surprising for a hostel.
sensation hostel with the best staff.   staff were always available and would detailed any help needed to get to where you wanted to go.

we had a great stay and prolonged one night to four nights because it was such a nice place to be and the staff were very friendly and helpful! breakfast is basic but we took the opportunity to use the kitchen and just made our own "healthy" ;-) breakfast. i can totally recommend this place, be it travelling alone, as a couple and maybe even with children!
very cozy and close to everything!

absolutely wonderful time spent here! extremely polite, friendly and helpful staff. plus, you're bound to meet amazing people here. you'll be charmed by the vintage interior of the hostel which harkens back to the golden age of hollywood. highly recommend it.
me and my boyfriend had a great experience at this hostel. would definitely come back.

a fantastic stay.  really felt more like a hotel- clean, quiet and cozy.  stayed in a private room with 2 twin beds and was completely satisfied.  lots of bathrooms and shower rooms in the halls- all single use that i saw.  every time i went into one it had just been cleaned.  there seemed to be a fair amount of the private rooms.  lots of local info in the lobby- the hostels own handouts were very informative.  i will stay there again- most likely every time i'm in the area.
a different kind of hostel - very cool!   everything was clean, the rooms were good, location is perfect!  to be improved: breakfast only consisted of waffles.   would go again!

this place was very nice and felt very safe. the location was perfect, being that it was walking distance from hollywood blvd. the receptionist was very kind and helpful, even gave me some recommendations for places to go while i was there. plus they even had amenities that you could check out like computer chargers and wall adapters in case you needed it. i will definitely stay here again!

the property was beautiful,, the staff went out of their way to be helpful, it's a block away from the center of the hollywood attractions, and it even has parking. i will definitely stay here again and recommend it to friends who are travelling to los angeles.

the location is really excellent for all things that you might want to do in the area, the staff were really helpful and very accomodating with all requests and really helpful when we asked them about anything. the rooms are basic but comfortable, very secure and safe though.

fabulous location at a reasonable price. lovely rambling old home that once was a boarding house for up and coming, now famous, stars. rooms nice but small. our room was in the basement, small, and alittle noisy at times because it was right next to the common tv/kitchen/lounge; computer space and lockers; and next to staff parking spaces. it tended to be stuffy. staff generally helpful and available.  very clean. breakfast was basic, however, the make-it-yourself waffles were great.

very quiet and well-maintained property. location is probably the best part about the hostel: just a minute away from the walk of fame. although the breakfast is not too great, there is always tea, coffee or hot cocoa available. definitely recommend staying here, if you are looking for a quiet and restful end after a hectic and busy day.
great deal with the bike rental place; $16/day
loved the demographics of being within the vicinity  of everything! staff was wonderful. i enjoyed speaking with other travelers that stayed at the hostel as well. i'll definitely be back!

a pleasant location, clean, loved the old house. it would be nice to have small reading lights next to each bed. one bright overhead light was the only room light. i used my iphone light at night while reading so i wouldn’t disturb my roommate. it was convenient to restaurants & tourist attractions.

nice place, good value and very helpful and friendly staff.  the facilities are good, i enjoyed being able to make a decent breakfast with the food they set out every morning.  it had a nice atmosphere and the location is great - quiet and peaceful while being incredibly convenient.

we had a great stay, lovely garden, close to everything, we were able to walk to our function, breakfast, dinner, but quiet atmosphere.  i would recommend anyone to stay in this historic, lovely hostel.
great location, great value, great vibe, great service. will certainly return the next time i'm in the area to see some music.
great location, confortable private room and very silent, it’s not a party hostel.

location is good but still very quiet which is great. we were in a private room which was very large and clean. the only downside was that we were each asked for a $40 cash deposit for a room key which wasn't mentioned anywhere previously. luckily we all had cash on us but i wasn't very happy to have to give all this over without any prior warning.
great place to stay

beautiful old mansion and great location near metro, shops, restaurants, hollywood sights & runyon canyon. staff was super friendly. the place has private rooms and dorms and the atmosphere is more like a guesthouse than hostel. i found the dorms overpriced. compared to other dorms in la, they're more pricey & you don't get value for your money or any freebies. lockers should be in the rooms and not in the basement. dorms also need individual lights & power plugs. check-out is too early at 10.
excelente ubicación clima muy bueno estilo hogareño me gusto mucho
good place to sleep at night in safe and enjoy the los angeles hollywood! helpful and brilliant staff, available coffee all the time which means a lot to me. location is awesome!

i’ve stayed here three times in total, the first two being when it wasn’t very busy in january. the advantages of the hostel are the location and overall cost. the third time ruined it for me because of the noise as i could hear every other guest in the hostel. we were located by a staircase and were constantly woken by the frequent use of the stairs as well as the rooms adjacent and above; after 4 nights i was exhausted. the room was unfortunately and noticeably less clean this time too.
it is across the street from the magic castle!

great location within walking distance to lots of shops, restaurants and the metro but on a side street away from all the noise and safe to walk at night. front desk staff were amazing (thank you pedro, beatrice & laura). rooms were clean.
all was great! espesially hotel staff were very responsive and nice!
great location, a little oasis of quiet just off hollywood drive mayhem! really friendly and helpful staff, offered advice to help make the most of a whistle stop visit. thank you.
good location
i loved it here! it was soo close to the walk of fame and metro line. the staff were lovely and the rooms were very spacious and clean! i would definitely come back again.

i had a decent stay. it was extremely hot in the basement room that i stayed in. they need ac in all of the rooms. i was a little annoyed when i was told i could not receive my key deposit unless i grabbed the sheets/blankets off my bed at 4:30am, which disturbed my roommates during the middle of the night.

great location only a minutes walk from all the action on hollywood boulevard. the staff were so helpful in giving directions, recommending what to see and do and helping book transportation! he really went out of his way to help out. the breakfast provided was really good. room was a good size and clean however the bed was a little small.

it's perfect. the only thing is that there is not too much atmosphere here, and no outlets in the garden in case you need to use your computer outside but besides that, it's perfect to rest and have a good stay in la :)

very basic, and the lady that served at the front desk was very rude to my group. facilities in the kitchen were not great, and basic things around the building need work (such as taps or locks not working). very small lockers also, so if you plan on having a big suitcase i probably wouldn't recommend here. location is right next to hollywood boulevard which was good, and the only thing giving the staff a somewhat decent review is the guy who served us the next day.

only used this as a stop over, but the location is perfect for hollywood, a bit far from the beaches though. the staff were really welcoming and friendly. overall the hostel was clean and welcoming. i would definitely recommend.

location is really good, off main walk of fame.   car park is available- payment required  the hostel is a large building, several rooms etc we had a private room which was adequate.  staff at reception really friendly and informative.

the host was welcoming as i stepped through the buzz-in front door. clean carpet and nice wood walls in the lobby, it was well kept. parking was available and felt safe. as i stayed in a 4 male room, it could have been a little cooler than it was, but the bed was comfy and clean. sure, the restrooms were tight but they were clean. the backyard was welcoming and the kitchen well stocked with pans, plates and cutlery. i would recommend this hostel.

great location& staff was very helpful. good security and we felt very safe. super helpful that the hostel had print outs of places to go and directions about how to get around town. we booked a private room and we're a little disappointed in the size, it was very small. also there was no air conditioning in our room specifically, there was ac in dorm rooms. in la in august not having ac isn't easy and we had difficultly sleeping we were so hot. overall a decent stay, would stay again if had ac.

i had an amazing stay at this hostel. beautiful renovated mansion a block away from hollywood blvd. clean, peaceful, and parking in the back ($10 / night). staff are really friendly and accommodating. highly recommend :).

this place is amazing. this is review is geared to my fellow americans: don't be afraid to stay in a hostel!!!! the location cannot be beat. you are literally around the corner from hollywood blvd and many other major tourist attractions. you are also very close to public transportation which the hostel is very helpful with finding your way around on it. the price is unbeatable for the location if you book early enough. best hostel you could stay in in la

a fantastic base for visiting la. my husband and i stayed in a private room, which was very comfortable, our daughter stayed in a dorm, which was also good. staff were very friendly and helpful and the make-it-yourself breakfast was a bonus. the only downside was that the kitchen is rather small for a number of people trying to make waffles or pancakes at the same time and no dishwasher makes proper dish-cleaning an issue. however, i would highly recommend this hostel.

beware of the basement rooms and $20 deposit. tiny kitchen and tiny bathrooms. nice atmosphere and location. i had a very negative experience with the front desk receptionist. she was extremely rude, unpleasant, confrontational, and unprofessional.

i stayed for two nights. the man on reception was really helpful and gave me good tips about hiking to the hollywood sign. he was happy to help anyone that asked for advice. the hostel is located around a two minute walk to the main part of the hollywood strip and 10 mins from runyon canyon. so it was good to be in the thick of the action. i stayed in a six bed dorm with en suite, it had air con. the breakfast is pretty decent you get pancakes or waffles. would recommend for a short stay.
great location, lovely old charming home

this place is a win, win! hollywood, the bowl are in walking distance. subway to santa monica is close. i enjoyed the property, during breakfast and beers in the later hours. here is a tip, at entrance of the gate look up the hill. see the pagoda take a walk up the hill and explore the grounds. you may want to visit hollywood's farmers market on sundays, go early. great staff and very secure.

hi,   i stayed there for two night. the hostel location is nice and walkable distance from the nearest metro station. the staff is very co-operative and always ready to help. they have great travel guide handouts and maps to help you navigate and plan your trip.   awesome place to stay with a reasonable amount.
wonderful location. not too noisy at night but a really close walk to hollywood bl. friendly staff and was tidy when we arrived. did have to keep asking for the air conditioning to be turned on.

this was my first ever private room rental and it was fantastic.  the hostel was clean, people were nice, and it was close to the things i wanted to see on my short trip to los angeles.  the hostel was quiet and i slept very well.

i had an amazing time staying at orange drive for my first ever hostel experience. the location was absolutely great, and the amenities were very good, from great wifi, to kitchen access and multiple fridges and freezers, i really felt comfortable throughout my 5 nights. it was so good i stayed an extra night, and wish i had of stayed a few more! staff were also very great and super accommodating, cannot recommend enough. safety seemed to be a strong point for orange drive, great work.

has a nice homie character but lacks a welcoming atmosphere. no real inviting communal area. $10 per night parking adds to the price. free breakfast is make your own waffles/pancakes. would've been nice to have a/c in the lower level rooms. saw a cockroach come out of one of the lower level showers. front desk lady didn't admit to any faults to the hostel, giving a vibe that that's normal or not out of the ordinary. very nonchalant. would've been nice if she had a better attitude about it all.

great place! the staff is very helpful and friendly, and the location is great: right off hollywood boulevard from where plenty of buses can take you to different places. it is expensive for a hostel, but i guess that's anywhere in la.
good breakfast, really small kitchen. really good location
great everything.. excellent price and location :)
the staff asked for a $20 security deposit for the room key, which wasn't mentioned in the description. that was a bit of a hassle but otherwise a very relaxing hostel in a great location!

i had a great stay at orange drive hostel. one of my favourite places i've stayed. i love that the place has a garden and multiple bathrooms! the only downside is that there are not a lot of electrical plugs in each room.

great spot - easy access to major hollywoid attractions and the metro! double rooms as well as dorms are ok-nice. especially the garden/patio is great to relax and have breakfast. overall quite calm for a hostel in that location! would come back again!
great location a short walk to hollywood blvd, facilities were very good with a good well equipped kitchen best of all are the staff who are extremely helpful and courteous.
the room was extremely bright due to white curtains. didn't get good sleep. please fix.
staff awesome, location great
the hostel is situated in a very convenient location, and staff are super friendly with lots of useful information available
in the heart of hollywood. seconds away from the walk of fame and tcl theatre and only a 30 minute walk from the great runyon canyon. modern, clean room and free breakfast, yum!

my stay was wonderful. the staff was very kind and welcoming! the hostel was not only super clean, but super cool! i loved my room, it felt like a luxury hostel. the location is awesome too; right near hollywood boulevard. i also enjoyed walking through some nice neighborhoods nearby.
good location, close to the hollywood walk of fame and chinese theatre. older style place so some of the features are dated but clean and comfy and a nice quiet vibe. staff were helpful and friendly.

great hostel in a very nice house. the location is perfect and even it's located in the tourist zone of hollywood is very quiet for being one block away from the main avenue.  nice beds, and a very nice park for having breakfast, drink something or just relax. the staff is very helpful and friendly.  cheap parking if you rent a car and fair room price.

loved this hostel! great location, the staff were very knowledgeable & extremely friendly, breakfast was good (although a bit limited), and they had very helpful handouts at the front desk with tourist warnings! only downsides were limited parking, the bed was extremely hard, and the bathrooms had very small sinks that led to water on the ground from other guests washing their faces. overall great for our short stay & would stay again! :)

had a great stay! literally the best location to some of the coolest places in hollywood - a quiet street about 100 metres from all the action. staff were lovely, and it's a wonderful old house with loads of character - plus you can't beat free waffles! one recommendation: it would be great if they did laundry with less heavily scented detergent as when we checked in, the scent of the freshly washed linen overwhelmed the room like french perfume and we had to ventilate for a few hours. 9.5/10!

great location very near dolby cinema and chinese theatre and hollywood/highland metro - but next to hollywood tat as well. easy to get to on red metro line from union station. feels safe in a tourist area. quiet hostel.
the orange drive hostel is very good. it's clean, with friendly staff and in a good area. i stayed in a twin room with ensuite.  it is very well located, and offers excellent value for money.
wish i had not left my expensive perishable food in the kitchen (fridge) overnight for my last night there, someone was more hungry than i, but it's ok.  another lesson learned.
absolute top location  staff very helpful
convenient location  helpful staff

we called airport shuttle at front desk.  but we waited 30min over, the staff does't care of us. finally, we could't take airport shuttle  and then we were late at airport.  i was very disappointed of it.  we paid 4 dollars for call shuttle, but we did't refund of it.  it was terrible of day.

good location and pretty good value for money. the breakfast included was actually not a prepared breakfast and instead there's just waffle ingredients (and nothing else) and you have to cook it yourself. other than that this place was quite lovely although a bit pricey (90$ for twin room) for a back packer budget.
i want to say special thanks to staff for being very helpful and really willing to help!
excellent location, beautiful rooms and at such a great price
fantastic right in the middle of the action and yet so calm

amazing location, right by the metro red line so perfect to get around downtown and santa monica if you don't have a car. staff are really great gave us loads of tips and advice for things to see. room was lovely, breakfast is great, make it yourself also has a kitchen if you want to make your own meals. feels more like a b and b than a hostel but perfect for a few days stop in hollywood!

great location, great place, very clean and comfortable.  my only point would have been to add a curfew to the kitchen as it can get too noisy and people tend to use it at all time even during the night.

fantastic location seconds from all the action yet blissfully quiet and comfortable. very helpfull staff. alejandro especially. great facilities all functioning well with a decent breakfast free in the kitchen. plenty of information in the foyer with free mints and pens plus you get a "beware if local scams" type info sheet which is invaluable to those who are new to the hustle of la.  i couldnt recomend this place enough.

i loved this place!!! checking in, the woman was so nice and helpful...but checking out someone else was super short with me and didn't even give me the chance to ask her questions like i was trying to.   the location is perfect! walking distance to the walk of fame, but far enough away that it was quiet for sleeping.   my room was comfy and clean, my bed was phenomenal. it was better than my bed at home!  i wish it was a little cheaper, but other than that i loved it.

the staff are so friendly and helpful! ready to go above and beyond if you need help. the location could not be beat with only just a few minutes walk from the action of the hollywood strip. our private room was basic but comfortable and tidy although the walls are thin. shared bathrooms were clean and plenty of hot water. breakfast was basic but sufficient with oats, pancakes and waffles. this is not a party hostel. all in all this hostel was excellent!

booked a single room. the good stuff.... the location cannot be beat & it is a quiet hostel if you're not a party animal.   the bad.... single room was not clean or well-maintained. poorly furnished, old bed, several things needed fixed in the room. air-con broken, window would not close so noisy and security risk. staff are lethargic (check-in took 20mins!) & not welcoming. breakfast is appalling so best forget it!   chain hotels in suburbs provide much better value for money at the same price.

orange drive hostel is a little piece of paradise! i cannot recommend it any more highly!    a special mention to beatrice (front desk employee) -  she was so helpful and caring. really friendly and sincere.     i stayed in a private room and it was gorgeous; i felt really safe and slept in peace on a comfortable bed.     there was always a toilet or bathroom to use and it's generally very clean and inviting.     there are free waffles and a selection of breakfast items which were great!

hostel is in great location, literally 2 minute walk from hollywood walk of fame and everything that surrounds it. free breakfast is great. only negative was our room which was right above the kitchen area which was very noisy from 6.30am every day and during the night, one night in particular at 3.30am. ask for a room away from the kitchen area. apart from that very nice hostel. we had a private room, bathroom was fine.

very cute hostel located few minutes walk from hollywood blvd. the hostel was well maintained and very quiet for those who are looking for more of a relaxed vibe. i stayed in a private room which ended up being a bit more cramped than i had expected. it is a heritage building which is very cool but also aged in many ways, as well it has a cramped feel to it in some of the common areas (bathrooms, kitchen, tv room) and lack comfortable seating to watch tv or just chill. overall, great place.
just a fantastic place.

this was a first experience for staying in a hostel.  it was a great stay, even though it was only 1 night.  if i am in the area again, i plan to stay at the hostel [if available].  stayed in a private room with private bathroom.  it was just perfect [other than no tv in the room, but understandable as to why none].  the coffee was hot and perfect to wake up to, plus having the free waffles helped to start the day off perfectly.

perfect location for sightseeing in hollywood. close enough to the action, but on a quiet street away from the crowds and noise. not a party hostel. very friendly, kind, helpful staff. convenient atm downstairs. small bathrooms (single stall), but i had no trouble finding an available one down the hall or on a different floor. never got a chance to try the free waffle breakfast, since it was always crowded and i was constantly on the go, but it smelled amazing. would definitely stay here again.

this hostel is really lovely. it is in a quiet spot, just a couple of minutes walk to the hollywood stars walk. the laundry is really handy and the breakfast is great (the kitchen is small). i noticed that this place is super clean and well maintained. they even have covers on the mattresses that protect against bed bugs. i would highly recommend this hostel for all ages and types of travellers as it has a mix of rooms. although it isn't right in the action, everything is easy to get to.

amazing experience from the start. location is great, within 1 block of subway and bus station. staff is extremely helpful and nice. everything is clean and feels more like a house than a hostel. bathrooms are individual and not shared, which means you can have that extra privacy. and to top it all, its cheaper than any other hostel i´ve stayed. definitely would recommend it. the only thing i would improve is the breakfast. i would add a few more options (specially fruits).

my boyfriend came across this hostel while we were trying to plan a trip to la and looking for hotels. we were both a little spectacle about staying in a hostel but decided to take a chance and we were greatly surprised with our experience :) we were discussing our next trip back to stay at this hostel before we even checked out lol.  beautiful old, historic estate with charm and comfort, reasonably priced, plus absolute prime location!
the breakfast is too simple, room is small, hot. and one of the locker on the door is useless. most of all people talk so loud until midnight, couldn't sleep.
this is a very comfortable and pleasant place to stay, with a great price and excellent location.
very nice and affordable place to stay in hollywood. will plan many trips to stay at orange drive hostel.
everything was great. friendly staff who were more than happy to help to offer valuable advice to many travellers. good free breakfast. good shuttle bus transport.

it was a very nice hostel with a kind staff. the location was good, near the hollywood walk of fame, but on a side road so it wasn't loud. the people staying in my room were quiet and respectful. and the free breakfast was good!
the bunk bed was difficult to get on and there was no power outlet near the bunk beds  shower was very small and not very clean

this is my first time to la.orange drive hostel gives me a good memory in la.the greatest thing is location! location! location!  most people are very friendly who lives here.i love the breakfast time.u could make some friends who sits next to you,share your plans with  them.

very close to hollywood, near shopping/restaurant areas. because it`s right off the main road, it`s still near all the attractions but it was quite and calm at night. not the party vibe hostel, but that`s what i wanted. stayed in a private bedroom, very comfortable bed, small but functional bathroom. staff were great, incredibly helpful and polite. there`s a subway close to the hostel, and it was very convenient getting to universal studios. a short cab ride to the grove. overall a great stay.

very average hostel, facilities run down & in need of an update. great location close to hollywood attractions. we stayed in a private room that was very small & cramped for the high price. there was hair on our bed sheets. room was not well sealed with a cold draft coming through the windows. on check out, we asked reception if they could store our bags at but the storage is just in the foyer area & not very secure at all. the response was 'we take no responsibility for your bags'.
perfect location
well located hostel off hollywood boulevard with clean rooms and good kitchen facilities.

location is perfect, other things else is average.  it's a pretty white house in the perfect location in la which is very easy to go everywhere.  others are average and need big improvement on facilities.  - no drinking water tank to refill, only hot water provided  - need to pay for towel rent. from my experience, most hostel provide towel  - too small kitchen/dining: there are only 2 small tables, diy breakfast is ok  - no headlamp, no electricity outlet at each bed
very close to chinese theatre and hollywood walk of fame. my room was comfortable. friendly staff.
charming hostel. in (west?) hollywood, and can be a bit of a walk from some places, but sort of expected in la. charming hostel-mates and staff. clean and friendly. parking in the back!
brilliant on all accounts.

the location is great as it is very close to the hollywood and it will be very convenient especially when you visit universal studios. however, the toilets and the bathrooms are extremely small while the rooms are small as well. btw you have to cook the pancakes and waffles by yourself as they provide the ingredients.

good location.  staff : ok and peter really nice.  poor breakfast,  at commun toilettes and kitchen were cloth towels to dry hands which is not healthy.  it is convenient and great to change towels per paper.
very nice hostel to stay at
great hostal!
very good place !

this place is amazing! best one iprice is worth every penny. all of the staff were so awesome. very clean. a two minute walk & you are right on hollywood blvd. this plus is a must stay for all travlers. coming back really soon.

the hostel is great. the location was difficult due to being less than a block from the busiest part of hollywood boulevard (intense traffic and random people wandering around), but the parking was very nice and there was always stuff to see. the staff is great and flexible. i also really appreciated the wooden bunks because it cut down on the inevitable noise. the house is an old mansion so while the layout is a little confusing, it's got great atmosphere. overall, i'd definitely recommend it.

as a native of los angeles, i still have family and business in the area. the orange street hostel is in a terrific central location in l.a., so i don't have to deal with my sister's dogs that try to sleep with me. the parking lot in the back is an extra bonus! the whole place is clean and friendly. it's also nice to get some good coffee and a fresh waffle in the morning. fellow hostellers, definitely check this one out!
excellent location. cheap parking, clean and reasonably priced. highly recommended.

good hostel in the heart of hollywood. perfect location, located on a quiet street just around the corner from the hollwood/highland metro and the main attractions such as the walk of fame, the chinese theatre, runyon canyon, etc.  very easy to get around using public transit. i was able to get to beverly hills and santa monica using only buses. breakfast was only waffles or pancakes and tea, coffee or hot chocolate but can't complain given how amazing everything else was. would stay here again.

hostel is in a good location, on a surprisingly nice quiet toad considering it is just off hollywood boulevard! it's also very close to attractions such as the griffith observatory and universal studios (short uber drive away) our room was nice, we did have a slight any problem though! i also think the room numbers need to be clearer as we had people trying to get into our bedroom on several occasions in the middle of the night i assume confusing it with the bathroom! staff nice, good value.

i was impressed by how well located this hostel is. i loved how you can have breakfast in the courtyard, lovely in sunny days! the only thing i would have enjoyed better was having a lamp for each bed so i could change without waking up others or read before sleep. pedro, was always very calm and helpfull all times. i will come back and recomend the hostel to my friends for sure!
great location, supportive staff, comfortable bed with a view of the magic castle from the window in my room. win-win!!!
quiet hostel, all round good, perfect for a nights rest but would put nearby usa hostel first for partying and meeting people.

i booked this hostel because it was just a few blocks from a function i was attending.  not only was the location good, but the staff was friendly, the room comfortable, and the breakfast yummy.  i definitely will consider orange drive hostel for future trips to the los angeles area.
accommodating staff with comfy rooms.. not far from the hollywood sights. would stay again.
double room isn't really a double; bed is super small. not much of an atmosphere. ok for a couple of nights.

nice quiet little hostel.  nothing special really.  was bummed that they don't really have lockers for your luggage (just small ones for valuables).  beds are made of wood, wood is quiet unlike the squeaky metal ones you find in many other hostels.  i would stay here again without hesitation.

the place is so quiet and at the same time really well located on hollywood area. its very cozy and home style. you also get very good information about whatever you feel like doing in la. the dorms are huge and not crowded with tons of beds. i loved it, it felt like being at home. thank you so much for everything!

i loved my stay at orange drive hostel. the gentleman behind the desk was lovely and helpful. everything was clean and nicely presented. a lot of thought has gone into the place. it was also very reasonably priced and only about 100 m away from hollywood blvd. i will definitely stay here again if in hollywood.

perfect location for hollywood. also very accessible to bus lines and rail (red line). we easily got from the hostel to lacma / la brea tar pits and then to santa monica by bus and rail. pedro? at the front desk was friendly and helpful. we didn't spend much time at the hostel, but we used the laundry ($6/load incl. detergent) and made free waffles and tea in the kitchen. the latter was a little chaotic, because there were so many guests trying to use the small kitchen at the same time.
wow, this place is great!! it's got everything you need, and in a crazy neighborhood like hollywood i was shocked that parking was so easy! and secure... super convenient!
this was the 1st hostel i took my sister to. we loved the location. we were right next to hollywood blvd. it was in the middle of everything.
fantastic location if you want to be based in hollywood! staff are super friendly and helpful. w

surprisingly quiet considering only 1 block from chinese theater on hollywood avenue, near starbucks!  bathrooms were clean.  bedspread/pillow case, room furnishing need updating, mattress cover edge had dust/lint as if it hadn't been cleaned for a while.  liked the on-sight parking and 5-7 min walk to highland station a plus!  sunglasses were never found after leaving them in room 10 minutes after check-out.

the hostel was nice, rooms are secure. i was woken very early every morning by staff sleeping in the room. showers are great, lots of bathrooms. wifi works well. great location. breakfast is fine if you like pancakes or waffles, make your own.

nice place overall. i consider it as a quiet place for this area. but,they are going through renovation now so i woke up because of  the hammer and saw sounds. good breakfast.  better hostel than hollywood and highland for sure, worths the additional money.
decent gaff
the better place to say in la.

by far the best hostel i stayed in during my 3 weeks in america. felt like i was in a hotel. checking in very professional and  with help to carry luggage. was upgraded on my second visit to a beautiful large room with nice views. location excellent, facilities clean with a great outdoor courtyard. the building has a great charm to it.

my stay was pleasant, the room was clean.  there wasn't a great communal area for people to hang out in so only really met the people in my room. there was no ac just plug in fans so the room was really warm
there's only one word to describe this place - location, friendly staff, value for money. oops.... you won't find a better vfm deal in la.
lovely place, like a cross between a hostel and boutique hotel. brilliant location, lovely beds, good wifi. needs to get toilet brushes, plenty of skid marks. would def stay again.

the space was really tight. small doors to the rooms, small restroom but for one person it should be really nice actually. i&#39;m a little dude so i fit good. i would have been upset if i was a really big dude. there was some construction going on that i wasn&#39;t told about and if it had rained, the room would have gotten completely flooded because of a door in the room. i&#39;m sure they will have that fixed very soon. the dining room was really small.

honestly blown away by how great this place was. i arrived from scotland with a ton of luggage to stay in california for a year and was surprised at how great the location was of the hostel - 30 seconds from madame tausauds! when you&#39;re on the walk of fame you can get some dodgy streets that surround it but this one was safe and friendly. room lacked having a bedside lamp but apart from that it had everything you could ask for. definitely staying here again when i next go to la!
great location, wonderful stay, kind staff.

fantastic and friendly staff. easy location and a relaxed atmosphere. perhaps a bit pricy. but the staff are generous with there time and help and always had a smile. breakfast was make your own pancakes and waffles, the kitchen was very small so hard to have a lot going on in there at once.

my husband and i stayed for 3 nights. we are mature travellers and we&#39;re made to feel very welcome. the included breakfast was great and the desk staff were very helpful with information regarding tours and fights. 2 minute walk to hollywood blvd, so location, location!

in a quiet street off the main section of hollywood boulevard. can catch the beginning of the hop on hop off tour close by (best sightseeing/transport option), or walk runyon canyon. beautiful home. comfortable beds with power points by bed. plenty bathrooms. areas to hang out inside and outside. excellent value.
great location very helpful staff would stay here again

we stayed there for two nights in august 2016. booked it because of location, cheap price and good reviews.  double room with shower and breakfast cost very cheap compared to other ho(s)tels in hollywood. the reception staff were amazingly helpful and welcoming. they answered all my questions about the area, hollywood bowl, grocery shops etc. bravo. parking is very very cheap (7$), but not guarranteed.  the atmosphere was not hostel-like - very quiet. breakfast could have been better.

the hostel was just what i expected and i found the staff more than excellent. i really enjoyed my stay. the facilities are fine and the breakfast sufficient. the small kitchen is ok and makes people talk more in the morning. the atmosphere is excellent. there are nice green grass lawn outside to sit on and relax and have a beer or whatever.

the service was good, free breakfast was awesome and the location was great. the hostel had so much information & things to help you out with your stay. the bathrooms were cleaned often and security was very good.
great location. nice staff. includes waffles for breakfast.

good location for visiting hollywood - near shops, restaurants, movie theatres.  lots of local information available.    facilities very good though kitchen rather small. good place for meeting people though. seats and tables outside in the garden where you could sit in the shade.  we liked the diy waffles for breakfast.

this hostel is very well located if you are planning visiting universal studios, walk of fame or hollywood bowl among others in hollywood. is incredible the contrast you find being so close to the crowded boulevard! you can go out for a walk and arrive back to a pacific hostel with well cared open spaces and quiet rooms to relax before going out again (: breakfast is quite good, rooms tend to be way too hot (no ac) and if you are planning on spending several days on the beach it is very far.

fantastic location within 2mins walking to walk of fame/chinese theatre. the staff were really friendly and helpful. rooms & hostel were clean and nice. very homely hostal (looks like a hour). this is a little gem in the perfect location. highly recommend staying here.
this place is the best ever, believe me !
one of the best hostels i&#39;ve stayed in. so close to everything and really friendly staff. rooms stylish and clean. would definitely recommend!
really enjoyed my stay. great location and i felt very safe. i was able to check in early and staff were very helpful.

we had pre-booked a parking spot but when we arrived we where told that it was under construction and that we had to use a public one which cost $15 instead of $7. there was no apology or anything. also the check-in process took almost 15 minutes per guest which was way too long.  the room itself was good enough and the waffles for breakfast were nice. the location is definitely unbeatable.
one of the best hostels i have ever stayed in. staff were very helpful and the facilities were in great condition.

this place is a great hostel. the kitchen is small but this didn&#39;t affect the access to breakfast, which was great.  if you are interested in seeing hollywood and heading to places like universal studios then it is a great location.  it is a fair trek from the beach but was easy access by bus.  there was lots of information on hand for different stuff to do in the area.

this little hostel was a great find, quiet and tranquil, and right off crazy, bustling hollywood boulevard!  i liked the old fashioned feel of the place.  this is not a party hostel, there are several of those in town.  i met families with young children, older travelers (like myself) and young adults, this is a place for everyone.       they say they are putting in air conditioning after the roof is replaced which will make this a perfect place to stay.  i would stay here again!

great staff!  great location, right on hollywood boulevard and not noisy!  just a thing, if you can, ask for a room upstairs. we had one downstairs near the kitchen and lockers, there was a lot of noise coming from the kitchen/tv area all the time.
nice and clean laid back hostel close to all the action in hollywood.

overall stay was six nights and honestly i barely have a bad word to say about the place. extremely polite and helpful staff, always clean facilitys, full kitchen with free breakfast (mmm waffles), smoking area. the location really is a minute from hollywood blvd. the only warning i can give is there is no air-conditioning, so can be a bit warm at night but there is a fan in every room. but for the price its fantastic, everywhere else around is $100+ a night. highly recommended

this hostel is in the most amazing location. you are 30 seconds from hollywood boulevard and the walk of fame. the free breakfast of waffles and pancakes is delicious and the rooms are very cosy. i loved it here!!!

the hostel is very clean – among the cleanest hostel i&#39;ve stayed in. pedro at the front desk was very informative on local attractions. the location was great. though just a few minute walk from the hollywood attractions, it was very quiet. on the downside there is no ac, so the sleep is quite uncomfortable. the kitchen could use a fan as it is very hot down there with the cooking. there is not much of a social environment as people pretty much keep to themselves. great hostel overall.
i&#39;ve stayed here 3 times now and its always a pleasure! highly recommended :)

very friendly staff right off of hollywood blvd. my room was on the top floor and was very hot. no ac. the wifi worked half the time.  room seemed clean, but we did find a dead cockroach in the bathroom. breakfast is free but nothing special. i would not stay here again.

loved my stay here, quiet and safe. bit far from some places such as approx 1 hr on the train to santa monica and 2 hrs public transport to disneyland, but very close to hollywood bvd and universal studios. staff were super helpful and everything was clean. kitchen is very small but easy enough to work around. something other than waffles or pancakes in the free breakfast would have been nice but hey its free so can&#39;t complain much! would stay again for sure.

nice house, clean and great location right next to the walk of fame in hollywood. but being a hostel owner myself i will suggest investing some money and setting ac in the rooms. i stayed in the female shared dorm and it was extremely uncomfortable to sleep because it was too hot at night!  no hostel vibe, hard to meet other travelers and no organized events so i just stayed for one night and left.

i had such a nice  5-night stay at the hostel that i would definitely stay there again. i stayed by myself in the private ensuite room: a lovely space at the top floor. everything was clean and in good condition (however, room was not cleaned during my stay - perhaps it was the hostel policy). stay included free breakfast with coffee and do-them-yourself pancakes. hostel also had a free wi-fi. the staff was very friendly, and always happy to answer all the questions that the travellers had.
we had a fantastic time

hostel on orange drive is a nice p;ace to stay. well situated to hollwood blvd.,   i enjoyed the peaceful atmosphere of this hostel , especially for the end of my trip.  all the staff were helpful, polite.   whole building was clean and beautiful and sound did not carry from room to room.
great place for the price, but nothing special. the bathroom didn&#39;t seem particularly clean and the bed and pillow were not exactly comfortable, but were great for a one night stay.
the best hostel i&#39;ve ever used! an amazing location, warm staffs, neat and clean rooms. can&#39;t ask more for the price!!!
great stay and awesome location!

i stayed at this hostel for 7 days. it was amazing. they have a wonderful and friendly staff that are willing to help you out in away and they make you feel totally comfortable. the room was nice and it was quiet. i met some amazing people from all over the world. starline tours is close by if you have tours booked with them. hollywood blvd is right down the street. breakfast was great. i would recommend this to anyone thats touring la. i would stay there again for sure.

i loved orange drive hostel. it was conveniently located only less that 5-minute walk to the center of hollywood boulevard. when my boyfriend and i arrived, we were pleased to find a charmingly restored historic house with faultless facilities for anyone on a restricted budget not wanting to compromise on quality and comfort. i would gladly stay here again on my next visit to hollywood!

awesome location, you yarn every morning inside the hottest block of hollywood. pedro at the front desk is extremely courteous, helpful and can give you very good hints about the attractions all over southern california.    dorms are big, clean and beds are confortable. lockers are the standard for hostel, which means it&#39;s not large enough for a travel suitcase but very safe for your personal valuables.    definitively a good place to rest after l.a. thrills, but not to hostel parties.

i had a one-bed private room, and was very pleasantly surprised with this hostel. location, facility, lodging, staff, the whole thing.    clean rooms, clean bathrooms, fantastic hollywood location, shout-out to pedro who checked me in, he was an awesome dude and walked me right to my room.     highly recommended!!!!!
fantastic place to  stay.  if you are looking for something a bit quieter than the average hostel then the orange drive hostel is definitely recommended.  great location too.

quite liked this hostel which has a bit of history to it. location was brilliant being a 2 min walk to dolby theatre and kodak theatre. rooms were spacious and not jam packed with people. staff were friendly and approachable and facilities were decent
a great place to stay. the location is brilliant, just off hollywood boulevard. the place was was clean and felt very safe. the atmosphere was more like a hotel or b & b than a hostel. very nice
great hostel, very clean and good location. kitchen a little small and could do with another table as there are only two.

orange drive hostel was great! such a cool building, and a great location. i was there to see the ellen show and do a wb studio tour, which was all in burbank, not west hollywood, but it was super easy to catch a bus where i needed to go, it was about a 1/2 hour bus drive away. and it was great walking around and looking at the chinese theatre in my down-time!

good location in terms of connectivity to hollywood and surrounding area (30 seconds from walk of fame). however, we arrived heavily jet lagged after long days of travelling and - when we discovered our room was adjacent to the breakfast room - asked whether there were any other rooms available (as we were keen to get some sleep and were worried the noise from the breakfast room might disrupt this).  the member of staff on the desk told us &#34;you paid for budget room, what did you expect?&#34;...

if you are looking for a very quiet hostel and primarily to eat out for every meal then this would be ok, the location is perfect for hollywood blvd and the metro and is on a quiet street. extremely small kitchen and not really any atmosphere which was disappointing, it seemed to be a much older crowd. poor wifi which nowadays is frustrating.

loved this hostel. it was amazingly quiet at night; i even had the windows open to let in a breeze and slept peacefully considering that we were right on hollywood. i could walk to the theater, shopping, universal studios was only 8 minutes away...etc, even santa monica was a nice drive. would definitely stay here again.
a little dated but great location, rooms need a ceiling fan, strip outlet, no lockers
very cosy hostel right next to the hollywood blvd. definitely worth a recommendation!

everything was great at the hostel, check in was easy, the room was great and clean (my boyfriend and i got the private ensuite) it was very private when you want it to be, pretty quite and right near hollywood blvd and a close drive to most of the attractions. plus they offer parking which is great!

this place was great! it has an amazing location. just a 3 minute walk and you&#39;re right on hollywood and highland. staff were super friendly. the place was very clean and they provided free breakfast every morning! the only downside is the parking lot is very small and there was no air conditioning.

facilities were dated but that added the the charm of the place. the only thing i didn&#39;t love was the smell-- it wasn&#39;t a bad smell, just strongly smelled of patchouli or something similar. met many friendly travelers from other countries. wish i could&#39;ve stayed longer just to hang out with the people i met! stayed in the female bunk with the en suite bathroom... would definitely recommend the en suite if it&#39;s available as it was nice not to have to walk down the hall. staff was very caring.
i simply loved this place, awesome atmosphere, super clean and cozy, and well... waffles for breakfast! i didn&#39;t want to leave... will come back for sure!

stayed here twice, would stay again. v good location - 2 min walk to walk of fame, 1 subway stop to universal studios/wb studios, 5 min walk to runyon canyon. street very quiet despite being so close to tourist part of hollywood. hostel very clean, staff friendly. not much of an atmosphere, common areas very small, but if you are just using it for somewhere to sleep etc then very good. if looking for somewhere a little more lively and sociable, maybe go elsewhere.

i have stayed there before and i will stay there again. the staff is always friendliy and helpful and it feels more like an home, than like  an hostel. the location is really good (close to the train, walk of fame & a cvs) and quiet. it&#39;s close to the freeway and they have parking. it&#39;s always clean. couldn&#39;t ask for more.  thank you.

housekeeping is great, they cleaned the room each day including vacuuming and dusting the room. sheets are clean and given to you upon arrival. the hostel seems to attract a more laid-back group of people as it was very quiet. the hallway had two bathrooms and showers, both easily accessible. walking to hollywood and sunset blvd is a breeze but else where can be pricey and a lot of traffic.
orange drive was more like a home stay,  the staff were extremely helpful and very friendly!  they location was central hollywood, and there was lots of information on tours and tourist destinations
wonderful place
loved it and will be back soon!

orange hostel in hollywood is so great that i don&#39;t want you to know about it! the location is just perfect -- less than a block from hollywood blvd., the red line metro station at hollywood and highland, and very close to the h&#39;wood bowl and hiking in runyon canyon. the staff were so super chill cool professional. the parking is only $5 and they let us stay parked after we checked out, for no extra fee! free no nonsense wifi. clean ample bathrooms and toilets. delicious breakfast! 5 stars!
perfect! and the lady at the reception is the best👊

1) crazily poor facilities. the shower room is too tiny to turn your body around and face cleaning desk is so micro that filthy water gets everywhere. even the bed is too short for me as 1.85m length.   2) wonderful location and staff services.

we were in the 6-bed female dorm for 5 nights, and we really enjoyed it! the room didn't feel crowded with 6 people and baggages. there was even a large closet, which was useful! the beds were comfortable. the room was cleaned throughout our stay. there was a bathroom conveniently next to our room, but there were more located on that floor that were easily accessible; we never had to wait long to use one. bathrooms and sinks can be a little small, but nothing we couldn't get used to.
best location for hollywood sightseeing.

this hostel is quite charming. rooms are small but cozy and functional. the bed was comfy and i slept well - not noisy at night. the kitchen is small so don't plan on doing any heavy cooking, but it's clean and has everything you need for basic meals. instant coffee is a little disappointing so you may want to bring your own provisions if you are a real coffee lover.. location is very central and parking iconvenient. i had a great stay and would definitely come back again! great price too!

bathroom was dirty. hair around the shower unit. we couldn't take shower because of this. kitchen is too small. not enough tables to sit down comfortably. coffee is instant. there is no point of free breakfast.   i feel the price is too high for this service.
great location, and loved the waffle iron. private bathroom was a bit small and  very basic but otherwise good :)
the best hostel i've been to. i definitely recommend!
location is great. price was bearable. cleanliness was better than most. great that parking was available.

very tidy hostel. we had a private double room with ensuite. felt like more of a hotel! tastefully decorated with everything you need. location is perfect, just a few minutes walk to hollywood blvd, so made exploring the area very easy.

a very nice accomodation with freshly renovated rooms. for the atmosphere: i would rather describe it as a `hotel atmopsphere`. everybody is doing everything for him/herself. lacking the typically warm hostel atmosphere.

one makes this place special is its location and its staff. in addition, it is located in the heart of hollywood, near all the attractions and business centers. the fact that many movie stars have stayed there as a training for their acting careers before they made it big, its fascinating. we stayed in the marilyn monroe room, spotless and cool. i recommend this place to the next visitor.
to have a better additional 1/2 more choice of breakfast.
very poor breakfast!
helpful staff , great location
nice hostel.

awesome hostel to stay in hollywood which is just a mere 2min walk to dolby theater, chinese theather and the walk of fame. walk slighly further down to 5mins and you reach the hollywood/highland metro station. location is excellent!    the hostel itself is a quaint slightly colonialish style, a bungalow of its own. very quiet, amazing staff pedro who is very helpful and friendly. i super loved my stay there for 5 days. will definitely stay here again if i come back to hollywood/la
breakfast needs to be taken care of. maybe charge a few quids more but have some bread and cheese please.

the canadian guy on reception is awesome. the bathroom facilities were a bit on the small size, considering the overall size of the rest of the facilities. great comfy beds. awareness of $40 key deposit should be advised on booking. free breakfast is great, but would suggest offering toast as an addition - pancakes and waffles every morning gets a bit much! overall great stay - central location is fabulousness - some history on the house and previous guests would be a bonus too (as a thought)

the staff is not helpful at all, when we arrived we had to wait for half an hour so that they could make our check in. we had a lot of luggage and the woman who received us was not able to help with anything.   we had to leave a 40 dollar deposit, which i find completely ridiculous.  the breakfast is really poor, not real coffee, no napkins, and very little number of dishes.  the towels need to be rented, and the wifi is horrible, really slow and not even working at times.  don´t recommend it.
wonderful atmosphere, great location- one of my favourite hostels ever. the house is simply beautiful, makes you feel really at home. solid beds, large rooms, strong matrasses.
highly recommended, clean quiet and safe place to stay in thr heart of hollywood. pedro is great and was so helpful during our stay. beds comfortable and warm.

very well-prepared staff. we really appreciated the tips and used the transit how-to guide lots of times during our stay. it was pretty odd that the ensuite room had a toilet without a door, definitely wouldn't have paid the extra for that if we had known. the bed was quite uncomfortable and the pillows should be replaced. the location was close walking distance and very easy to get around. the waffles are a nice idea for breakfast, and there are cooking facilities.
an amazing hostel in the heart of hollywood, clean and quiet, with good security. we will definitely be back. pedro was so helpful and friendly, as were all the staff.
marvelous. as nice as a hostel can get! very clean, great location, safe and good environment.

this place is a calm oasis just off of full on action hollywood blvd. the contrast was remarkable for just one block back.  the location was great for buses, metro, shows, food and fun. the staff were generous with helping me find bus connections. i really enjoyed myself and met interesting people there from around the world of all age ranges.  thank you !

the staff were very very good. they were pleasant, courteous, friendly, kind, and professional. they really made me feel at home.    the hostel itself is very clean and very well maintained.    plus you can't beat its location. it's literally half a block away from major tourist attraction.    will definitely recommend this place and will stay again in the future!
normal city hostel. incredible location. very cheap private parking. friendly staff.

lovely place to stay, amazing location right off hollywood boulevard.  also friendly staff.  not a party hostel, but good if you're an older traveller like me, as the hostel has no age restriction.  would stay again.
great location super close to hollywood blvd. staff were super helpful and friendly.
great location!

location location location. very close to the subway and the hollywood sights. staff were friendly and atmosphere was generally good. the free morning waffles where definitely a bonus. wifi wasn't the best and cut in an out sometimes but apart from that a great stay.

great for a couple of days in la if it's your first time, right in the heart of everything & only a short walk to the runyon canyon entrance if you want to hike up to see the hollywood sign. very touristy area around the corner but the actual street is very nice & quiet. we had a private room with ensuite which was everything we could have asked for.
everything is great
this hostel is ideally located!! the only minus is the free breakfast that only consists of sweet belgian waffles!! i was expecting more. bute everything else was great!!
a breakfast with bagels would be more efficient than offering the waffle dough.

the staff were quite cold, but the room was fantastic,  lots of character. agree with previous reviews that there needs to be fans in the rooms, we were there in fall and it was still a bit muggy. the free breakfast is fun, but there are only two waffle irons so when it's busy and you have people making three servings in a row be prepared to wait around in the tiny kitchen.

really,  you can't go wrong with this hostel. it is excellent in all categories. a beautiful building, so close to the main hollywood strip, perfect in all the categories we marked it for. summer would be a bit hot if the room has no cooling i suspect. parking is easy too btw, we just pulled right into the back and went to check in.
great location, cute house, wonderful staff - melissa went above and beyond to help me both days of my stay. thank you!

good value for money hostel in a fantastic location, right by hollywood boulevard. staff on the front desk were extremely helpful, we originally had to make 2 seperate bookings for 2 seperate rooms but once we arrived, the lady on the front desk sorted it out so we wouldn't have to switch rooms, the gentleman on the front desk gave us some great camping recommendations when we were checking out too! all in all a great experience

as far as staff, location and price go it's a big thumbs up, the rooms are hot though and need some fans installed,,, also it quite close to the action so expect a bit of noise,,,, there was a lot of complaints about the internet service but seriously don't travel if your going to hang out and stare at your pc, there's to much to see and do and cool people to meet,,,, sitting on the net is for losers not travellers
all you can eat self-service waffle breakfast is included! no ac in room, very very hot, otherwise nice and safe hostel in excellent location.
very clean, comfortable, would stay there again only complaint was that it was extra hot in la that weekend and no ac in our room.
only stayed a night but happy with the experience.

i love this place!  the staff are friendly, efficient and extremely helpful.   they make life easy when your brain is suffering from travel fatigue :)  i've had several stays there and hope to do so again.
loved the free waffles for breakfast!
i was very surprised this hostel did not have a good breakfast. it does not offer water either. what they do is that they put out a waffle batter and once this runs out you are out of luck.

this place is a gem! it's cozy, well kept, clean and in a great location for our travel plans. the only thing that was frustrating was the spotty wifi on the third floor but it wasn't a big issue, we just moved downstairs if we really needed the internet.  10/10! if we're ever back in the area we know where we're staying!
that's a very nice place to live in this area! soooo convince!

this is a very cool hostel in a great location (hollywood). it has a very &#34;old hollywood&#34; feel. i stayed here as a solo female traveller, and i felt very safe. the room locks, but there aren&#39;t any lockers besides that, so i brought my valuables with me.  they have free breakfast, which is also nice. the only complaint i have is the noise at night. i wish i would have brought earplugs! otherwise great.

i found the staff to be friendly and attentive. the room was relatively clean as were the bathroom facilities. there was no air conditioning or fan in our room so it was very hot once the sun came up. there were also ants in the room as i was leaving the window open. the shared area was small and tucked away downstairs at the back of the hostel. a bit of apity as it meant that there was no real communal feel to the place and not a lot of opportunities to meet other guests.
very clean and friendly in great location.

the staff people each make you feel like you are at your home with your family. the beds a very comfortable and the bathrooms are kept very clean. the front yard and side yard are great places to relax outside or do your paperwork in a warm, sunny, peaceful setting

perfect location. friendly staff especially pedro.   no airconditioning, an electric fan would be useful.   poor breakfast (only waffles, should have fruits as well at least bananas).  wifi - very bad esp. in upper floor
nice hostel with excellent location. staff there are friendly and helpful

wifi was poor in our room (though fine everywhere else). room itself was fine, as was the ensuite bathroom. hostel could really have benefitted from a water fountain/dispenser and more breakfast options. i thought 10am is early for check-out. didn't understand the merit in having to hand over your id in order to use a hairdryer, when a deposit was sufficient for everything else.
relaxing, well cared for, and perfect quiet location off busy hollywood strip. and free waffles in the morning! very happy with my stay.

the room had no air-conditioning or fan which meant the windows had to stay open but it didn't cool the room at all.  also by having the windows open, there was too much noise from traffic and general outdoor noise from the central location. the bed was really hard and uncomfortable and after driving 5 1/2 hours i really needed a good night's sleep which i didn't get here. my partner actually ended up sleeping on the floor as he said it was slightly cooler being lower down as it was just too hot
nice hostel in a good place. no ac. was really hot in the room. showers and room where clean. nice staff
