wonderful hostel with wonderful staff who go above and beyond to help you out! so clean and homely! very quiet so when you go out to party you have somewhere nice and quiet to come back to. prime location of you wanna be in hollywood. i loved his hostel and i'm seriously considering checking in again during my trip! i highly recommend this place!!!!
the rooms were really hot and the windows weren't very secure
loved this hostel, close to hollywood blv, as in really close but also has a quite feel about it. met some great people here. so good i'm going back next week!

i loved that the hostel was super clean. the rooms were very cozy and clean. there was not much interaction betweem guests at the common area and i stayed with my friends in a private room so i guess it is not a surprise too. the location is unbeatable, less than 5 minutes walk to the metro subway and only 2 mins to hollywood. there were plenty of eateries and supermarket nearby. the paper they give you at check in is also very helpful, don't be deterred by the amount of words! thanks :)
place was good, although no air conditioning so can get quite hot. great location in the heart of hollywood!
great location in the center of hollywood, but at the same time very quiet. very very nice and clean rooms!   the staff was a bit slow! unfortunately we did not have air conditioning in our room.

a good location just off hollywood boulevard. lovely old house in a garden setting. book with caution in hot weather as air conditioning is not available and the rooms are stifling. you will not get any sleep. some staff are intransigent and the kitchen area is very limited.
this was probably the best hostel location ever and it is very clean! the staff were super cool and helpful! the only thing missing is the ac! but the parking makes up for everything

everything was absolutely perfect while i was there. all the staff members were really friendly and helpful when we asked for advices. the hostel is really clean and the beds are comfortable. thanks for the lady at the front desk we didn't get ourselves in a really dangerous situation because she warned us about that certain area we were planning to go. we are really thankful for that. if i ever gonna have the chance to come back i definitely want to stay in this hostel again. thank you again!
$45 per night is way too expensive for packing 6 guys in a tiny room with bare minimum amenities and also sharing 1 super tiny kitchen with all the hostel.
i have never stayed in such a beautiful, clean hostel in my whole life and i've been travelling for two years.
no air conditioning
plugs by the bed and in the lockers, good showers, and great location.

i had a good experience, although it was summer and no air conditioning and in hollywood the temperature can reach up to a 105f/40c. our room was a private one but the bathroom was tiny and not comfortable at all. pedro, the receptionist was amazingly nice, although the woman a blond one that was at nights was extremely rude and treated me in weird ways while i parked my car. the ways she used to tell things was very rude and didn't like it at all. it's not a way to treat guests.

this is a beautiful place. nice staff and all the things you expect in a good hostel - good location, clean sheets, a kitchen to cook, free wifi. only down sides for me as a solo traveller were 1) no atmosphere, super quiet (which is nice) but just nobody to mingle with. and 2) the rooms were really stuffy since they didn't have aircon and there's no cool breeze in la.

one of the best hostels i've ever stayed in. perfect location including ultra cheap parking, literally right behind the chinese theatre.    this is an old lodge that used to be used by stars in the 1940s so lots of original retro waitress the phone box being one of them.  lots of space in the female dorms and excellent pancakes and waffles for breakfast.    loved this place didn't want to leave!!!
loved staying here! you cannot beat the location, the building is lovely, the staff is great. being able to pop down to the kitchen in the morning to make some pancakes is a huge plus too. :)

pros: awesome location between the chinese theater and the magic castle (what more could you ask for?);  good private bathrooms; coffee/tea/hot water all day.  cons: no air conditioning on a hot day; wifi is weird, sometimes real slow other times fast; top bunks have no ladders so painful to climb up there.  but overall the location takes it -- i would definitely stay here again.

i loved to stay in the hostel as it is clean, the beds are very comfortable, during night it is calm and a it's located at a perfect spot in hollywood to go out and discover the nightlife in l.a.   if i come back to l.a. i will definitely stay again in this hostel!
excellent location
i loved the character of this hostel.  plus, it was a 2 minute walk from hollywood blvd and the tcl.

fantastic location just around the corner from chinese theatre on hollywood bve and almost next door to the tour buses.no aircon was a minus and it was noisy with traffic but earplugs fixed that. all in all great place to stay.

this hostel is great. nice homely feel and awesome location right near hollywood blvd. breakfast of pancakes was great too. not a party hostel so harder to meet people but other than that, a good nights sleep!

excellent location, couldn't of asked for better.  atmosphere was very lacking, we imagined it to be a hub of livelyness being this close to hollywood with lots of young people, but we were disappointed to find that it was the opposite of this, with many older guests.  none of the provided dvds worked in the dvd player.  breakfast was the most poor out of all of the places we have stayed in the 7 weeks we have been in the states, the waffle irons were very slow and left the waffles undercooked.
it was noce. i slept well and enjoy a lot!
kitchen is small, but adequate.  waffles, pancakes and oatmeal for breakfast are included--also coffee, tea, and  hot chocolate all day.  right around the corner from grauman's chinese theater.
a very friendly and convenient place to stay, if you don't mind the noise at night from the street when sleeping, and the small ,crowded kitchen. this place could be perfect.
great location and chilled out atmosphere!

very well located, unfortunately we had a room between a public restromm and a public shower next to a noisy kitchen with people hanging around late and speaking loud. the beds were confortable though.
everything is perfect!

excellent position to metro with a high level of cleanliness and  charm.  our room on the top level was practically new but could do with more block out curtains with windows on 3 sides that invite the lovely california sun in a little too easily. the kitchen area is somewhat small and awkward as others have mentioned but there is a lovely seating area to eat at outside in the well kept garden. the place is a credit to all the staff.

orange drive was so close to hollywood boulevard and local shops so that was easy. the staff were friendly and helpful, the room which was apparently marilyn monroe's was comfortable and clean and i appreciated that towels were provided. the morning waffles were good too.
nice staff, bunch of suggestions what to do in l.a.  includes breakfast but limited choice (oatmeal, pancake/waffle mix)  pratically on the walk of fame !

i had arrived a day earlier than planned knowing that orange drive had no rooms available. as the bus has drpped me at chinese theatre, i walked up to the hostel and asked to leave my excess baggage at the hostel for next day. pedro l on duty was more than helpful in accommodating me. he is also well travelled and seemed emphatetic with traveller's needs. it is such a convenient location with buses and train to all corners of la.

the absolute worst 2 nights of my life! we found a half dead cockroach in our room, and when asked to switch rooms we were told they were all booked. the rooms are cramped and stuffy, no a/c, and the bathrooms were so small we could barley use this sink and the shower faucet was broken! it wouldn't shut off! the beds were so hard, i woke up the next morning very sore. the only good thing about this hostel is the location, it's steps away from the walk of fame. i will never stay here again!

we stayed 3 nights in the private room. the second night after 11:00 p.m, we heard loudly music and people talking from the patio. it sounded like they had a party. the location is good and the room is clean.
thank you for a great stay!
it's nice there. i enjoyed my stay there.
stayed in the private room and it was more like a hotel room. good free breakfast too - make your own waffles. perfect location right by hollywood blvd.
there is no air conditioning in the rooms.  we stayed there in july and it was very hot all day long.
the staff are lovely and the hostel is clean and quiet. thoroughly enjoyed my stay.

the hostel is an extremely clean, well-maintained old hollywood mansion. the location is absolutely central and convenient, but almost no street noise. i stayed in a 6-bed female dorm with bathroom, and it was very comfortable, safe and quiet. we could also access any of the numerous bathrooms in the building if our bathroom was occupied, which was very convenient. pancake/waffle batter and syrup was provided for a cook-it-yourself free breakfast. the staff was extremely courteous and helpful.
need stronger wifi.

location is great, just a 3 minute walk from union station.  staff is really friendly and helpful, and it is very clean. wifi works well most of the time and even though the hostel is right around the corner of lively hollywood boulevard, it is very quiet and safe. it's like being in another world.   the kitchen is very small, but we didn't use it for cooking, just for breakfast, it was ok for that. the house is a bit old, furniture outdated but who cares. it's a fine place to stay, we enjoyed it

great location, very clean, and very kind and helpful staff. it's amazing because literally less than a block away, you have the super noisy and crowded hollywood boulevard and hollywood walk of fame, but orange drive hostel is very nicely sheltered from that. bathrooms were very clean and the staff treated me well. one very tiny complaint i have is that breakfast options are very limited. it's pretty much just waffles and pancakes. would have appreciated maybe some fruits and toast.
great location, great service, great price!

very good localization (you can't be closer to the very center of hollywood)  lockers are outside of the room which is a bit inconveniencing  friendly staff  small kitchen and terrible breakfast  it wasn't all bad and i would probably stay there again

orange drive hostel was such a lovely place to stay . the location is the best location in hollywood , it's like a two minute walk too the hollywood boulevard so you could be out and about within an instance  , but away from the noise of the hustle and bustle so you could get a good nights sleep . breakfast faculties were good . wifi worked really well , stretched to the back of the hostel and we had the best connection out of all the hostel we stayed at . shower facilities were kept clean.
excellent location!
the common area is a bit stale and could use a makeover. the staff is great and the facilities are spot on. finally, the location is really great!
location right next to hollywood blvd. but the street is quiet. nice building.

location is excellent if you want to see hollywood and go on the tours.  also very close to runyon canyon which gives a great view of the city. staff were happy to give tips and information,  although the hostel itself was a little quiet.
location is in the very heart of hollywood. location was perfect. i stayed individual room so i can not comment  on the dorm rooms. there was no hanger in my room to hang your clothes.
would have loved to have some milk at breakfast, otherwise a fantastic place, i will definitely stay again!
customer service was great. very helpful with all enquiries. location wise it is probebly the best spot you could ask for. more onsite showers would have been great
the staff was super friendly and came outside to help find parking :)

before i arrived in los angeles i wasn't sure what to expect when staying at a hostel, but i didn't have to worry, it was a fantastic experience. it was in a great location just of the hollywood blvd, the staff were excellent and very helpful, and i met some really lovely people who i was sharing the room with.  this had been my first visit to los angeles and california, and the whole experience was something that will stay with me forever. thank you orange drive hostel    p.s wifi a bit slow.

for a larger hostel in a super-touristy area, this hostel had a nice, relaxed vibe. the cute house makes it feel homey. bunks were wooden and not noisy. facilities were clean and modernized.  i'm really not a fan of hollywood boulevard and all its tackiness (i was staying here because i went to a concert at the hollywood bowl), but this hostel provides a good base to explore cooler areas nearby -- los feliz, east hollywood, the hills, silver lake, west hollywood, etc.
wicked place with great staff and coll rooms, really clean. that part of town is full of crazy people but this joint is awesome. wifi was a little sketchy but that's my only gripe.

i have been in many hostels all around the world and i have got to say that i liked this one very much. pretty clean, nice atmosphere and the thing about the pancakes it's true! it is so nice to make your home pancakes in the morning and also the dough was sooo good! the only negative thing was the wifi, it didn't work in the rooms and i often had to stay in the kitchen or the stairs (but that was not good either and many people were passing while i was skyping!). also, very good location!

clean and secure hostel set in a property with history and character. great location and helpful staff as well as good value for money. recommend staying here and we will be booking again if we are back in la

great location, so close to metro, buses and hollywood. good info on what public transport needed to visit different attractions, fun breakfast (make your own waffles) nice kitchen, helpful staff. matresses and pillows a little firm, and the tiny en-suite had a wobbley toilet that needs repair--but hey, we had an en-suite!
perfect location.  comfort bed.  clean room. but my room was at the basement near a stair, it's quite noisy when people going up and down.

the location was very good, just 2 minutes to the walk of fame and the dolby theater.  the poor thing was the kitchen and the breakfast. there were only 2 cooking places, 2 waffle irons and just one sink, which is definitely not enough for a hostel in this size.
excellent hostel, very clean, great location with helpful friendly  staff.
cool hostel. the building itself was awesome seemed like a historical building.
love the place, classic american house, well kept, 2 mins walk to hollywood boulevard, free breakfast
great place, great location. :)

the location is great! two minutes from the walk of fame by walking. the staff is friendly and really helpful. there is a free breakfast (waffles). the wi-fi didn't work in my room. there is a park for 5 dollars. i stayed in a double income room and it looks like a regular hotel. my only complain is that there is no entertainment schedule, i mean, you don't meet the other travellers.

i was really impressed by the friendliness of the staff. pretty basic place, big old mansion with lots of halls and rooms. i really enjoyed sitting out on the nice outdoor patio because all the flowers were in bloom. i was able to walk to dinner, which was nice and convenient.

very nice room with very clean bathrooms "which were shared in our case", location is very near to universal studios and walking distance to the hollywood walk of fame...also very close to a lot of restaurants and shops.  the breakfast is as mentioned and it is good that they are providing it but i would suggest to add more varieties since waffles only isn't enough to be considered as a nice breakfast meal but thanks again.

awesomene location, super friendly and informative staff that are happy to answer questions. i had a private room but shared bathroom and both were clean, comfortable and well maintained. couldn't beleive how good this place is for a hostel, great value for money, highly recommend!
warm welcome and delightful room in  a charming period house. informative and accommodating staff. comfortable and well appointed.
amazing location and great value, loved our private room :)

since my boyfriend and i arrived here we could tell that we had made the right choice. the staff at the front desk was very nice, always willing to help. the place is very big and rooms are the right size depending on what your need are. we stayed in two different rooms and they were both cleand spacious. the kitchen is very well equipped and there was always parking available for a small fee.

this place is better than what you think of a typical "hostel". the service level and cleanliness is beyond expectation. also, the location is just a minute away from hollywood blvd. which i didn't know beforehand. absolutely recommended!
great hostel, highly recommended
very friendly,  helpful staff.  nice peaceful hostel just around the corner from the madness of hollywood boulevard and the chinese theatre.
best hostel ever. i will return.

stayed here on two separate occasions on my recent trip to the usa and would definitely recommend it! its a well maintained old weatherboard mansion that is directly around the corner from hollywood blvd and the chinese theatre.  its pretty cool walking around the corner from all the chaos of hollywood to this house and feeling like youre in a completed secluded area. the staff are very helpful and knowledgeable. the facilities are fine and the place is kept very clean.
excellent location, big clean rooms
excellent location for visiting hollywood!  but one of the staff is a bit wired...
wifi was down a few days which was inconvenient. but sraff provided options so that was cool of them. great staff.

pros:  close to hollywood boulevard and tcl  front door always locked  very nice and helpful staff  room was very nice  parking space around back    cons:  locks to room old and not very sturdy  small kitchen, with few places to eat    summary:  excellent place, would definitely stay there again :)

perfect location 2 minute walk to hollywood boulevard but far enough away that you're not right on the strip. bus and metro stops really close too. staff were really friendly and helpful organising trips and transport for us as well. would definitely stay here again!

the floor creeks like an old house does and with the long hallways and several floors, it kind of makes it creepy in a cool way. granted, i have an active imagination, but that's what made it exciting–imagining that i was in some sort of scary movie at night lol. anyway, it's a nice little place to stay. loved that they arranged an airport shuttle for me and were up and available at 6 a.m. to check me out. no complaints.
really great place to stay. the staff were really friendly, loads of helpful information has been put together for guests, and the building itself and location are great. would definitely stay again.

i was very impressed with this hostel. the location is awesome and within walking distance of the major attractions. the metro is a few minutes walk. the facilities were good and the host was very chatty and helpful. i would definitely stay here again if i was visiting la.

the hostel is a beautiful building just a stone's throw from all the action on hollywood boulevard. the room itself was very nice and spacious, my only issue being the limited number of plug sockets (although i was unfortunate with my roommates charging multiple things continuously.) the outside areas are really pleasant and there were no issues with the bathrooms. i didn't feel that there was a huge amount of atmosphere, however this again may be more to do with the mix of people i my room.

we had the pleasure to stay in orange drive hostel where we found an excellent group of people (from the management to everyone on this). clear, clean with a great atmosphere of hapiness and service.  totally recomended !!!

the staff was very friendly and helpful, and the location couldn't be better! (a very short walking distance to the walk of fame, the dolby theatre, and the red metro line, that takes you downtown). although you have to cook your own breakfast and clean the dishes after, it's a small hostel, so we never had to wait long, and you're given the batter (for pancakes/waffles).  we booked a twin private ensuite (private bathroom) and everything looked very clean and taken care of. i'll come back!

really great location.  hollywood and all its attractions are right outside or for further trips, it's a five minute walk to the metro (shorter to bus stops).  travelers were friendly and respectful, staff was helpful, and rooms were clean.  wi-fi ranged from atrociously slow to moderately acceptable.  breakfast in the morning was the only neutral point (only instant coffee and waffle batter that didn't seem to cook right) -- but a small negative and lots of restaurants in walking distance.
good facilities and great staff. helped us with good local knowledge and getting the most out of our time. thanks guys!!
they were really helpful in accommodating our needs for a double bed.... the room and location was great!

i really enjoyed my time at orange drive hostel. the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, and the hostel itself was beautiful. lots of charm! if i return to la, i would absolutely stay there again.
great location and helpful people! bathrooms can be a bit of a squeeze. not so much a hostel to meet new people with events but overall, a great place to stay!
great hostel right on hollywood. staff were very helpful and informative on places to go and things to see. car parking is a real bonus at only $5 per day. would definitely return!
first of all, very very nice staffs :) room and bathrooms were clean, good location, and it was quiet that i could sleep well

this hostel was great. it was in a fantastic location, right off hollywood boulevard (literally a 30 second walk!). there was also two grocery stores close by too. reception had a whole heap of print outs on what to do in la, transport options, tours and were very friendly and helpful to assist with these. shower had great pressure and was nice and hot (and clean!). wifi was very slow in the bedroom. hostel had lovely atmosphere. free pancakes and waffles for breakfast too.
very nice place and very nice staff - everything was enjoyable. thank you all !!
fantastic location, close to everything! kitchen facilities were great, rooms were clean and staff friendly and happy to help.
excellent hostel, pretty good located,  friendly and helpful staff!! our room was cozy and was upgraded from a shared bathroom to a ensuite one without notice! ;)

great 1 night stay on my way to central america. desk staff were genuinely friendly and helpful. relatively easy to get to from lax. i took the flyaway to union station and metro red line to hollywood/highland for $10 total. great location and surprisingly quiet given how close it is to hollywood blvd.
the staff was really friendly & went out of her way to help us. location was excellent & the hostel created a feeling of comfort. i would definately recommend this hostel for all ages.
a hostel in hollywood at which a long list of actors and actresses once stayed -- what could be better than that?
great location to check out hollywood. very helpful and friendly staff. wouldn't hesitate in staying here again if visiting la.
great location with parking.

this hostel is in an excellent location in hollywood. but there is something that really needs to get better: the kitchen. the hostel says they offer breakfast, but besides not having nobody at least to organize the things for the customers, the kitchen is horribly tiny. so if four people are already sit having breakfast, no space is available anymore. i believe they should organize that or not to say they offer breakfast. the atmosphere of the hostel is more like a hotel, no partying at all.
pretty good. but lack of entertainment and the kitchen is so small.
room is basic, location is great, overall recommend it
nice hostel, few steps away from hollywood blvd.

i stayed for 4 days at this hostel and it was a wonderful experience. the location is perfect. very easy to get around. the staff was very friendly and has all the information you need to go around the city. the kitchen was a bit small with small seating area but it wasn't a big deal. thank you for such an enjoyable stay!
great hostel, clean and tidy in a great location with friendly staff
this place was great, easy to get to, great environment.. if you wanna chill you can chill if you wanna drink you can drink. has it's own bar but not too loud. showers were clean and warm.

this hostel was one of the best i have stayed at. everything was clean, the front desk receptionist was very nice, the breakfast is good. the twin room was perfect! wifi was excellent although phone sometimes turned into roaming because the room was on the lower floor.
thank you.
the location is the best.  quite

i dont know why it is rated so lowly, it is a great hostel, the rooms are comfy and location is everything, right around the corner from hollywood walk of fame, walk distance from public transportation and the breakfast is not much but it's enough, loved the waffles!
felt like i was at home. really!
very clean and friendly.

we had a fantastic experience at orange drive. great location near public transport so it's easy to get to other places like santa monica and west hollywood. the rooms were really clean. as other reviewers have mentioned, there is more of a hotel/motel vibe here which as a couple we were fine with but if you're traveling solo, it's not really a party hostel. the front desk staff were incredibly helpful and made the experience even better.

we treated ourselves to a private room here when we got off the planeand the end of our trip - both times we were super tired and it was lovely to arrive here.  it is a little more expensive than a regular hostel but very nice and i felt, worth it.  keep in mind - this is not a party hostel!  but the location is awesome.

the location of the hostel was excellent just a few steps and you are on hollywood boulevard. there is a supermarket and a chemist close by too. the staff were welcoming and friendly.  the shared bathroom was cleaned regularly and thoroughly.  the price was good for the location and the city.  the building was big and accommodated lots of people. only thing we didn't like it smelt a bit funny but we got used to it.  good facilities, free tea and coffee and breakfast. wifi good not great.
great place. no complaints. we had a great time and would strongly recommend the place. staff is great and pedro was particularly helpful when we arrived.
i wish there was a better comment than excellent...absolutely brilliant stay. staff so accommodating and so close to hollywood boulevard. fantastic option!!!
great place to stay! and lovely straff!
very friendly place and helpful staff.

so quiet, yet a couple of minutes away from hollywood boulevard. perfect to go and explore la and around (i did it by public transportation). the rooms are clean, and the spanish/canadian receptionist is super-friendly ! it was just a peace-ful stay !

great location in hollywood, 5 minute walk to walk of fame. day staff were nice but night staff were rude and condescending. kitchen in the morning was always too busy so we skipped the free bfast, personally i think a continental bfast wld work better. also you can hear your neighbors a lot in your room so it can be a bit noisy at night. laundry system is strange, you have to pay reception and then they show you where the washer is but there is only 1 so we had to wait to use it.

this is a great and very centrally located hostel. the hollywood walk of fame is less than 5 walking minutes away. the beds are comfy and the stuff super helpful. the only thing i was not happy with was there was no hot water when you turned on the kitchen sink.
excellent choice, i would definitely stay here again. very clean and perfect location!!!

bed was small for a private double room. their parking costed 5 dollars per day. there was noise during the day (some carpentary), but it was ok. lovelly old woman talked to us when we were leaving. it is on the same block of walk of fame, dolby theatre, el captain and others: so it is good, will save you some time. they give waffle for breakfast, but it is diy scheme. it was taking too long for people to make theirs, so we went to a starbucks nearby. no deal-breakers. no air-con or fans.

quiet location close to bustling hollywood boulevard.  staff are pleasant and helpfu, rooms clean but kitchen and dining space is small and cramped. but i guess everyone dines out when visiting hollywood and the nearby diners and hamburoger places are worth a visit.

great for exploring hollywood and nearby areas. we had a car so the location was not that important to us. the hostel itself is set in a beautiful house with a lovely, very clean kitchen with free tea and coffee. we had a private room at the top of the house, with plenty of space and a view of the front yard. as far as i could see there was no airconditioner so it might get a bit hot in summer. i'd definitely come back when in la next.
loved staying here. all the staff were so helpful and friendly. would definitely recommend to anyone staying in hollywood.

great hostel! we got a two person private room that was very charming. the bathrooms were impressively clean. the staff was always available. the hostel location is within walking distance of hollywood blvd while the street itself being pretty quiet.

perfect location for travelers who don't wish to drive!  you really don't need a car to explore l/a, the metro is only 10 mins walk from the hostel door. the bonus is the hollywood blvd, all the major attractions are only 2 blocks away, the suvinior stores open till 12am! you can take the hollywood sign picture on the upper level of the mall near by. i will def return to this hostel.
lovely hostel with amazing staff, beautiful and clean and great location but unfortunately lacking in atmosphere!

location is good in regards to the metro, chinese theatre and going to see jimmy kimmel live etc however at night it can feel a little unsafe and intimidating. staff also informed us we could get a bus to the airport for $8 at the corner of hollywood and vine however failed to mention it only ran every hour so we missed it and had to get a $70 taxi to the airport which was very stressful. however staff were very friendly and helpful!

great place to stay. so close to all the action but felt so far away. very quiet, clean and safe. staff were very nice and helpful. definitely recommend staying here if you are a busy traveller that spends most time out and about.

we stayed two nights in this beautiful hostel. the building was erected in the 1920th and so everything is a little bit old fashioned but charming and clean. we loved to sit outside at the patio for breakfast (pancakes/waffles are included, also coffee/tee and cereals but no milk :/) and dinner. when you leave the hostel and turn left you already can see the hollywood blvd and the chinese theatre. the staff was always friendly and tried to help us with all our questions. we definitely recommend
the location is great, but others are so so.

perfect location if you're going to a show at the hollywood bowl, hiking to the griffith observatory, or hanging out on the hollywood walk of fame! we had a rental car, so the $5 daily parking behind the hostel was extremely helpful. facilities were clean and the free waffle breakfast was delicious! highly recommended.

stayed here for 6 days had a great time. people were friendly and had a nice vibe to the hostel. in a great spot so easy to wander around hollywood blvd etc. it did get really hot @ night but thats the only bad thing. and kitchens really small so didnt try and cook. but fresh and easy is close and loads of places to eat. staff where very friendly. i would stay again.  really good hostel with good tradition. thanks guys enjoyed la much more this time around.
the room is too stuffy!! install fans of something!!

excellent place and staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. always go out of their way to give you more info. only complaints would be the heat as there are no aircon or even fans in the rooms which makes sleeping quite difficult. location is excellent though and everything else makes up for the lack of aircon!

such a lovely hostel!! location was awesome and staffs are friendly :) they have free breakfast service in the morning. you can make waffles or pancakes there..it depends but you might better go eat earlier (like 6 or 7) if you don't want to eat in a crowded kitchen. landry costs $5 everytime which might be a little bit expensive but others are awesome for me!! i would definitely love to stay here again!!

the room was tiny but we managed - the hostel has a nice old hollywood vibe to it - around the corner from hollywood blvd but feels more like you are in a nice quiet neighbourhood. ideal for a quick stay in la if you are there to see the main sights!

a lovely place to stay. nice and peaceful in the madness of hollywood and really lovely staff. nothing fancy, so don´t come with really high expectations but it is definitely a nice place to stay in la.
i had a very enjoyable stay
i made so many friends during my stay here, it was in a perfect location and the staff were very helpful. my stay here was well worth the price i paid, and hopefully i will be back here next year.

a great place to stay with the best location! so easy to get around with buses and the metro right on your doorstep. staff were very friendly and willing to help you in any way they could. only negative thing i have to say about our stay was that it was so hot in our room we could barely sleep at night, even if we had the option of renting a small fan for our stay that would have been a great help! other than that, would go back in a heart beat!

i really loved to stay at orange drive hostel. it was my first time being a hostel and i found the environment very friendly. loved the staff (especially laura) and all the tips that they gave to me about places to go. i've made a lot of friends there!  not to mention the free waffles in the breakfast and chocolate all day! the location is really good (1 block from hollywood blvd). my only complaint it was not having a fan in the dorms. at night was very very hot and a trouble to sleep :(
very nice hostel, friendly efficient staff.  good location in hollywood and good facilities.

the hostel is located a stone throw away from hollywood boulevard! it's clean, tidy, spacious, everything we could ever need from a hostel! there were posters and information up on the noticeboards by reception about local events and activities going on in the area and the staff were very helpful. they also give you space in the kitchen to purchase foods and drinks for yourself which is a bonus!
my stay was great - awesome location.
i had an absolutely great stay at this hostel! the employees are so lovely and you feel comfortable and safe the whole time!
very gooed location  nice hotel, friendly staff  breakfast is very poor

whilst being close to hollywood boulevard (which is less of a positive than it sounds), there is little else to recommend this accommodation.  the staff, barring one girl who looks like tina mcqueen from hollyoaks, were quite rude.  the whole place looks like it could do with a lick of paint and security leaves a lot to be desired as there is no safe room to leave luggage whilst awaiting check in.  the temperature in the room is also very difficult to regulate, leaving you sweltering.

the place was really good to stay during our trip, close to hollywood blvd it's perfect to feel the atmosphere of the walk of fame.  however one of the receptionist was not welcoming and we felt as we were disturbing her. we payed to be here, just remember that ! the other ones were nice.  i particularly enjoyed the front and the private garden to spend time with people.
was in an excellent location
beautiful girl checking in，they help us buy the ticket to universal studio ，and book taxi。feel very good！exceeding explanation！
it would be much better if the kitchen had more space.

perfect location if you want to do hollywood´s tourist parts.  good rooms but thin walls so if you are sensitive to sounds this can be a problem.  nice and service minded staff. would definitely recommend this hotell.

brilliant hostel!! the location is amazing-can't believe how close you are to the walk of fame!! check in was very easy and the room we stayed in (private twin with shared bathroom) had everything you needed and was very good for the price. rooms were clean, staff were very friendly and beds were comfy and there wasn't a lot of noise.it was easy to arrange a shuttle to the airport  and it was only about $17 so a lot cheaper than a taxi. i would definitely come here again!!

orange drive hostel was amazing! the staff were very nice and informative about the hostel and things to do in the area. this was my first hostel in america and i can't imagine having a better experience. hostel is completely safe and in a great location!
i don't know how to use the air condition .（＾_＾）
i wasn't in this hotel this year, but last year.
i am ok without milk for breakfast, but if there were some instruction of pancake maker, that would be great
very very impressed! nice rooms, good and helpfull staff!!

i had a private room with no bathroom, but was allowed to use any bathroom in the building, and there were plenty.  the room was hot because there was no air conditioning.  the place was clean and the location can't be beat - from the front door we could hear the screaming fans when the rock showed up at the chinese theatre for a premiere.
a/c would have been nice during the summer
no complaints. clean, neat, close to everything. will definitely come back again.

this place is great to stay close by the hollywood blvd (just around the corner). you are in the middle of all the action but great to go back and rest in a quiet, peacefull place. breakfast is great, all you can eat waffles, tea, and coffee. the staff is super nice and helpfull, they hook you up with great tours, give you tips and directions to move around the city, and have a great shuttle service to lax. overall not your tipical hostal experience because this one just went overboard.

the location is awesome. close to the metro, la fitness, cvs, and other stores/restaurants. big beds, but no a/c or fans.  i just didn't like that i had to give them $20.00 as collateral for the key just because it forces you to use the atm there. everything else was good.

excellent location, particularly if you don't have a car. lots of attractions within walking distance. the 6-bed dorm i stayed in was comfortable enough, but very hot (no air con) and there were only 3 power outlets in the room. bathrooms were generally very clean and there were plenty of them. staff seemed friendly. wifi was a bit temperamental, particularly in the lobby. breakfast is basic and the kitchen is way too small. other guests were quiet - no parties here, thank god. good overall.
friendly attention, great location -less than a block away from the chinese theatre-, very cozy facilities. definitively the place to stay in hollywood!

great stay - the location is perfect, literally minutes from hollywood boulevard, it doesn't feel like a standard hostel the house is so beautiful it feels part of history.  the only downside is there is no air con, but with the windows open it was fine and everything else made up for that!

we stayed at orange hostel for 2 nights earlier this month. the property was lovely, however because of the age of the property, there was no air-conditioning so rooms got quite stuffy at night. the dorm was rather expensive for what it was. however, we loved the staff. they were extremely lovely and accommodating. our stand out favourites were laura, tattooed guy, and particularly pedro.

good points: - amazing location for the walk of fame and chinese theatre  - lots of bathrooms - free breakfast  bad points: - no tv in the room which we did have in other hostels (in a private room) - no pool - tiny bedroom  - not overly sociable environment  - kitchen is small for the size of the hostel - no air con , the rooms get ridiculously hot and there isn't even a fan  -room wasn't cleaned all week so bin overflowed - couple of the staff really strange and pretty rude

we only stayed here for one night when we arrived in the us but this hostel is perfect. it's in a small little old house which you wouldn't expect so close to hollywood boulevard and it was brilliant for what we were after. nice facilitiesn and rooms, good wi-fi, and a great location.

best thing about the hostel was the location, located right in the centre of hollywood and a few minutes walk from the station. staff was friendly and welcoming - only down side was the atmosphere. not sure if it was just the people that were in my room at the time, but no one made an effort to socailise and as a solo traveller i'd have been better off elsewhere.
breakfast was poor. only waffles and instant coffee.  rooms little bit smelly...
amazing location!!!

one thing i wish was on the webpage was that there is a $20 refundable security deposit, payable in cash upon arrival.  that information would be helpful to travelers who want to make sure they have enough cash on them for other activities.  having said that, the location was excellent, the facilities were great (though one wishes for air conditioning in summertime, especially when sleeping on a top bunk), and the staff were very helpful.  plus, you can't beat free breakfast!
great hostel, clean, perfect location, nice staff
a little noisy. may be the window can be doubled to keep quiet.

loved the location and how easy it was to get in and out at night. they provided information about local happenings and transportation. kind of surprised they left out uber and lyft. i felt very safe there and the room was clean. it felt really awkward talking to the person at the from desk, who didn't make much eye contact or smile. they were by no means rude, but i didn't receive the level of hospitality i was expecting.

awesome hostel! we were in a private double, next to one of many shower/bathrooms so appreciated the quieter atmosphere (more hotel than party hostel). considering location, which is spot on for hollywood, and solid wifi, the included waffle breakfasts are super good value for la (and us in general) although the kitchen  is small and queues can form on busy mornings. considering the price of accommodation in americas larger cities i would say this was excellent value overall and great staff.

myself and my girlfriend staye here for a week. staff were extremely friendly, the location is fantastic - right next to the hollywood walk of fame and near the metro. room was lovely made and very value for money. if you are going to la you have to stay here, it really was great!

this hostel is located in a lovely, rambling old hollywood-style house and has a nice lawn with outdoor seating and a patio for breakfast.  the upper floors with private rooms were very quiet - not the place to stay if you want to make some noise, come in late, stay up visiting, etc.  definitely not a party atmosphere.  free pancake breakfast was offered (did not try it).  nice perk was the parking for 5$ extra; you'll need it in this neighborhood.   great location.
i thought the location was perfect as it was so close to the tours i booked and easy to get to all the places i wanted to go.

good - staff were helpful,  useful location for my needs, clean spacious room.  not so great - 3 out of 4 nights i was woken up around 1pm by people sitting outside in the smoking area being unnecessarily noisy.    i thought the bathroom on the top floor somewhat inadequate for a shared facility.

the kitchen is very small and there was someone who was helping people make breakfast but it wasn't clear if she worked there or was simply being helpful. the hostel was in a great location. the manager interrupted us checking in to talk to the employee simply so she could leave. if would have been nice if she could have waited until we were checked in.

good, helpful staff, fairly clean, good amenities. a bit expensive, but it's hollywood, and the location is great. we had a private room, but it was very noisy, as the walls/floors are paper thin (it's an old building), and right next to common washroom.

location is incredible and staff are so helpful - will go out of their way for you.    highly recommend this hostel. after a big day of being a tourist in hollywood its a perfect hostel to come home to!
everything is perfect!!! wonderful place!!!! thank you!!!!
the location is perfect to discover la and hollywood. it is a quite and clean hostel, very close to the hollywood boulevard and the walk of fame. staff is friendly and helpful.

very convenient location right behind the hollywood and highland center. great for tourists. the rooms are big and clean and facilities are good. the only -ve was that it gets a bit noisy in the night especially at weekends. i would still recommend this hostel to anyone who visits la and wants to stay at hollywood

most of the bathrooms didn't worked when i stayed there  (after doing booking now with hostelworld  over 150 times this is the first time the price chance while i was booking around 32 dollars  be over 40 dollars a night.) definite not wort the extra price, fore that price i could get a privet single room some where else.  or 23 dollars for just a good hostel.  perfect for people whose not there to party or meet people (other guests), quiet there,  good standard on rooms, and really good location.

good location in hollywood close to hollywood boulevard, making it possible to travel e.g. downtown on metro, but also to get buses to west hollywood.  all good except for 'breakfast', which was actually just waffles - not even any fresh milk.

beds are comfortable and the house has several bathrooms, but there is no common area inside (apart from the reception room), which is very bad if the weather is too hot and dry like when we were there. breakfast is almost nonexistent. the hostel resembles a guesthouse and lacks atmosphere a bit. it also has some strict rules like a $50 cash-only security deposit and an inflexible 10 am check out. location is around the corner from hollywood bl., thus well-served by public transportation.

nice hostel. great location, limited parking however but you should manage to get a park , especially if you have a smaller vehicle. friendly staff. dorms fairly private. overall a nice place in a good location.
thank you for a great stay! meeting the owner was a joy!

the hostel is located right next to the walk of fame in hollywood. the staff was very friendly and helpful. all facilities were in good, clean order. free breakfast waffles were great as well. all in all it was a very good hostel to stay at.
the hostel is great in terms of price/quality, very well located and the staff is very nice and helpful.  i definitely recommend

really good location, nice looking hostel. lots of bathrooms, small kitchen and washing machines available.   our room was bright and clean, all the windows had fly nets so you could leave the windows open.   the only downside was that the room got so hot because there was no air con or fans.
friendly atmosphere, nice rooms and comfy beds. staff were helpful and nice. neat and well presented, great location.
really liked the old building and network of stairs - relaxed, nice courtyard area, comfy bed etc
great location & great staff!

there is nothing more i can add or suggest. orange grove really is an excellent place to stay , ( my second visit now ) . all the way from australia, i wouldnt consider anywhere else. my 15yr old grandaughter, i traveled with on this visit, wants to return to orange drive hostel. she felt safe and welcome. a home away from home. thankyou
the staff were very helpful, having only just arrived in la from australia, this was the first place we went to.  only one blocks walk from walk of fame and catching buses around la.  impressed.

the location is perfect for hollywood literally a stones throw from the main street in hollywood but you can't hear any noise at night so you can get a good nights sleep!super clean and nice big airy rooms with comfy beds. nice outside area and tv room. free breakfast of pancake or waffles in the morning is appreciated and the staff are very friendly. free, fast wifi. i would say it is slightly overpriced though.

great location, clean rooms with lovely decor, free wifi that worked well. not enough bathrooms it would appear, breakfast was a bit naff plus the kitchen was a little small. doors slamming in the night but otherwise quiet.

we are a young couple who stayed here in the beginning of april. we liked the hostel and the staff, some of them more and less. the location was really good, two minutes walk to hollywood boulevard and the walk of fame. there are a lots of restaurangs close by. it was also just a short drive to both universal studios and six flags.

the location is excellent, the staff was very friendly (thanks for the great restaurant suggestion!!), the waffles for breakfast were nice, the atmosphere is really relaxing. i would totally recommend this place!
breakfast says it includes creamer. we stayed for 2 nights and we never saw the creamer.  kitchen is to small and always a mess.
great hostel we have changed our accommodation so we can stay here again when we're back in la tomorrow night

the location of this hostel is absolutely perfect! hollywood blvd really is just around the corner and there's an excellent access to public transportation so it's easy get around and go wherever you like to: metro station and bus stops are just a few-minute walk from the hostel what really made my trip. thanks for all the maps and additional information/tips about la. they were very helpful! staff was awesome and very helpful!

i love the old hollywood feel to the place so much, and how there are the old phones and furniture still in the place.  excellent location for visiting hollywood, a couple blocks from the train (which you can take all the way from the airport), very clean inside, and felt so homey.  loved it.  it's a lot of money for a hostel, but apparently not for one in hollywood, and i'm so glad we chose it.
a wonderful place to stay we will happily come back.
the only diadvantage is the wifi connection a bit on the slow side. but overral the hostel was nice and quiet!
free breakfast, free internet, great location and staff are friendly and have lots of information about transport and activities. bathrooms are private and clean and room was very spacious!
generally speaking,it's ok.
very friendly staff, perfect location, nice room
the facility is in desparate need of cleaning. a little paint and elbow grease would drastically improve its overall appearances.

i have a huge pet peeve with the lack of outlets in the room!  one outlet on each side of the room.  the outlet on my side was below the bottom bunk bed, which i could not get access to.  the other outlet was occupied by the women on the other side of the room.  that left me going downstairs to the basement, even late in the evening in my pajamas, to charge my phone.  quite a ridiculous measure to have to take.

have no negative comments about this hostel but just a word with those who get to use the shuttle service ensure you have a firm agreement with them as i got told by hostel and lady at shuttle point the$$$  amount, but driver charged more when he dropped me off even though i argued the point--going back to la airport no hassle thank you to staff for all your help and yummy free breakfast--best wishes

excellent location if you want to be close to walk of fame, dolby teather, chinese teather in fact beside hollywood boulevard were all the cool stuff and bars are.   in reception has a lot of documents that will help you with directions and number of buses that need to take to go to santa monica beach or venice beach and other beautiful places.    nice staff very helpful - perfect hostal to relax not to party or drink - clean - wifi - do not have lockers for backpacks or any suitcase.

free parking, one block from the tlc chinese theater on hollywood boulevard, and a variety of public transportation options - it is the ideal location to stay. it's located in a side street off of hollywood boulevard that's actually very quiet and nice. i would definitely stay here again.

i liked the neighborhood feeling i got even though you are right by hollywood blvd. you might get a little turned around while walking thru the house, but it just added to the charm. there's parking behind the hostel for $5 (not sure if this was per night). i really liked the place

we absolutely loved staying at the orange drive hostel! so close to hollywood boulevard, but still nice and quiet. bed was a bit shaky, some rough edges here and there but hey, it's a hostel! at an amazing location! atmosphere was great. nice and relaxed. were also very grateful for the parking permit option. the house is amazing. would definitely recommend it and would definitely stay there again!
locationa great!! helpfull staff members. had to pay for internet and towels. breakfast ok.
great place, conveniently located. stayed for 3 nights. central to both west hollywood and downtown la. clean and friendly staff a bonus. would definitely book again.
i always stay at orange drive hostel because they are simply the best in hollywood. best staff, best folks, best location, best service.
i really enjoyed my stay at this cool old house. i would love to stay again. it has a great location!

great location!! 1 block from the main street (hollywood boulevard). very clean, safe to walk around by yourself at night (23yo female). staff were very accommodating and friendly. not a party hostel, more like a massive bnb. nice & quiet & very safe. hot water, clean bedding, hand soap, towels, great wifi, great kitchen & has own atm inside. hostel has lots of printed information about what to do & how to get places in la. kept my luggage during the day while i shopped & caught my transfer.

enjoyed my stay here. lovely old building, very spacious rooms, shared with five other girls who were lovely and very friendly. very close to hollywood where there is loads to do. hostel provided free coffee and pancakes each morning, lockers and laundry facilities. recommended.

location couldn't be better. the hostel is clean, decent, friendly and helpful. at times, the wifi wouldn't go all the way to the rooms, so we would need to awkwardly sit at the reception to look at emails, so there wasn't any privacy really when going online.
really great value for money place to stay close to hollywood boulevard, clean and comfy. if you're looking to check out the hollywood strip, this place comes highly recommended.
excellent location right near broadway. rooms were a good size & very clean. hostel had a really cosy feel & the staff were extremely helpful. no complaints at all. thanks for the stay!

the staff arguing with you about not refunding your money even though you have given her 24hr advance notice. the excuse was she could not find someone else to take my place on time, so that became my problem. that was the stupidest thing ever anyone has said to me.
the location is great, and the staffs are very nice!

very nice old house converted to a hostel. just 5 minutes walk to hollywood blvd and a fresh n easy super market great location. front desk staff are very helpful and hostel is very clean. only draw back seemed to be a bit limited in atmosphere and socially a bit quiet otherwise highly recommended!
i think this hostel is pretty good. it just needs to add some activities like small parties. otherwise, i loved my stay there.

the location was good but you still have to take subways and buses just because la is a big city. the hostel is right in the middle of hollywood, so it is quite safe and lively. you have access to good restaurants and shops. the hostel itself was good, too. there are many restrooms so you don't have to wait at all. rooms are kept tidy and clean. however, if you are looking for some kind of "friendly" atmosphere, orange manor might not be a good option cause it is more of a hotel than hostel.
the location is perfect. it is close to hollywood. but wifi there is sloww.....

lovely hostel in a great location. if you want to see everything hollywood, this is the place for you. they offer $5 car parking too if you want to see more of la which was good. staff were keen to help and all facilities were very clean and good. free breakfasts were offered and rooms were of a decent size. only criticism was that it felt a bit more like a b&b than a hostel, but that isn't all bad when you're tired and just want to sleep.

nice, clean place to stay with comfy beds and lots of room. the free breakfast was great and was useful to have a kitchen but cooking options are limited. the staff were very friendly and helpful and it's super close to prime locations in west hollywood. only downside was the wifi being hit

just a perfect hostel! i was traveling by myself i felt really safe and i had a rental car i just paid 5$ for 24h parking, just behind the hostel. you walk 3min and you are on the first star on the walk of fame so perfect location, i woke up one morning and walk 5min and just saw ben stiller, amazing! staff are really nice they helped me to book a show. you have lot of space in the room and the hostel is in fact a big house with lots of history.

great hostel in an excellent location. we stayed in a private room which was very comfortable and in close proximity to the shared bathrooms, which were always very clean. wifi was free and fast. the best thing about the hostel was the location. it was only a few minutes walk to the walk of fame, and close to bus stops and the hollywood highland metro stop. would definitely recommend this hostel.

loved our stay! fantastic location so close to hollywood blv. free breakfast (oatmeal & pancakes) lovely facilities! would 100% recommend. they also stored our luggage for the day after check out & organised our airport shuttle!
enjoyed our stay! definitely coming back if we ever travel to the hollywood area again.
perfect location and excellent housing.
great hostel, amazing location. if you need to stay in la for a good price, this place is perfect
i was very impressed with this hostel, it had a great location, great price and very helpful, informative staff.  i would definitely stay here again.
a very well run hostel and obliging staff, location was excellent and would stay there again.
very clean, great to have 3 fridges, and burners.  just lacking a but in community and atmosphere, but i would totally stay there again
the hostel is very near hollywood boulevard and all the main attractions in this area, bus stop and metro station as well. breakfast is only pancake (not so good though)
there are no enough bathrooms
great hostel, i left my watch in one od the communal bathrooms and it was handed into reception!  great location!!
beautiful house,perfectly located! dorms are spacious with wooden floors,and the garden is lovely and quiet! i didn't like hollywood that much,but i would stay here again!
great location and really clean hostel. room was clean and big. only down side there is no kettle so you have to boil water for tea or coffee!
nice, clean and close to everthing.. frindly staff, the only complaint was the breakfast.
a coll place, with paking in holiwood

the kitchen/ lounge area is very small but as there were very few people staying at the time it was not a problem for us.  very close to metro and has parking on site at he hostel so great for all travels!   we also got given a 6 bed airy room for just the two of us as they were so empty she said she would give us that one on check in rather than in the basement :)
thank you guys for making my start in l.a. so easy and wonderful!

this place was in the perfet location. hike at runyon canon is within walking distance and a must see (especially after dark). it felt like we had a home to come back to staying here. super market close by was perfect to be able to walk to and get food and snacks. the only thing that would make this better is having a fridge in the room , but there were fridges downstairs in the hangout area that everyone can share..didn't really want to keep my stuff in there. i will stay here again for sure!
amazing location. literally around the corner from dolby theatre and chinese theatre courtyard.

nice place too stay. good dining place and good kitchen. its locate near to a grocery shop name 'fresh and easy' that you can buy ready to cook food for your dinner, it's much more cheaper than dining outside. waiting for the staff who is probably on the phone with her boss for 25 minutes to call my super shuttle to airport which is already late, didn't feel that they put customer first. overall it's still a great place.
the kitchen is too small & the common area is not big enough for meal (just one table for the whole hostel)
great location. very friendly staff. the check out is to early, but that's it.. i highly recommend it.

this hostel was perfect for a short stay in la. perfect location, clean rooms, helpful staff. i have very few complaints about this place, although ac in the room would have been good as it was very hot. also, i did not appreciate the australian guy who went around knocking on everyone's door trying to pressure people into joining the guided pub crawl one evening.

good hostel. nice patio areas and everything was clean. on hollywood's doorstep, but quite place still. not much socialising but there's often one or two people around to chat to. staff were either great or terrible, just depends who's on the shift. lockers weren't in the rooms and kinda small, big enough for a 13" laptop. toilets/ showers were too few, but they were very clean. breakfast was poor, but grocery store 2 minutes walk away. they do a $20 refundable deposit for the key, so take cash.

the wifi was a bit shakey and the breakfast was a bit unclear was were included and what was private. small kitchen. the location great, parking, great patios, clean bathrooms and toilets. overall great

location is great. it's a beautiful old manor house just around the corner from hollywood blvd. only downsides are there is no air conditioning in the rooms and it is in la so it gets pretty hot! also the reception staff were unapproachable sometimes. as they seem to live there too and at times had their friends hanging out in the reception area for hours and made it feel like you were disturbing them if you came to ask a question. they were nice otherwise. would stay again.

great location in hollywood, very close to the walk of fame, m. tussauds, chinese theatre, etc in a lovely house.    staff was friendly and nice, jacques who checked us in was lovely and we managed to sort out an issue right away (we overpaid for parking but got the money back). oh yes, there is a $5 dollar a day fee for parking and laundry for $5.the bedroom could've been cleaner, there were doritos pieces on the floor next to the bed (private room). don't count on their wi-fi, it does't work.

the main issue was the lack of air conditioning in the room, which seemed to be one of the hottest rooms in the building. having a washing machine that worked well was an advantage.  the other problem we experienced was that someone stole a large bag with several packets of candies/sweets from the communal fridge, which we had been intending to take home as presents. we were a bit disappointed about that due to the cost and no time to replace them.
awesome location, friendly staff, super cheap! perfect if you are looking for a cheap place to crash.
underrated hostel. excellent location and friendly staff!
i gotten eaten to bits by bed bugs. clean sheets were provided but i still got eaten. other than that good place to stay

excellent little hostel. amazing location - so close to where it's all happening in hollywood and yet so quiet. the rooms were beautiful for hostel rooms with 2 beds rather than bunks in the private rooms. was not a very social hostel, at least not while i was there, but lovely nonetheless and perfect for our purposes.
liked the location and the hostel, wifi dropped out constantly though
the location is perfect! however they don't provide towels for free and there was a piece of trash under my bed when i checked in. staff is really nice and the free wifi is fast
rooms were spacious and comfy  staff was very friendly,  welcoming and helpful  location is superb

really enjoyed my stay here. right in the heart of hollywood! met some great people and the place was really good overall. a very old house but well looked after and had good facilities and layout. will definitely stay here again. thanks team!
jacques was very helpful. thank you. great location and an interesting house in which the hostel is.
excellent location, helpful staff, highly recommended!
the location is perfect, they have parking lot for customers, which is good. the room is very clean, staff are nice, totally worth of money, definitely gonna stay with them next time!
great experience, easy to find, really good location. worth while - staff we're pretty chill. not many people about but that's probably due to the day i was there
awesome location, just behind chinese theatre. staff friendly, comfortable rooms and facilities and car park was a bonus.
perfect location and friendly stuff!

this hostel is pretty clean. the location is great for people who needs the public transport. staff are nice. oatmeal is provided for breakfast, you can cook for yourself. however, there seemed no air conditioner in my room. so it would be a little hot in the room at daytime.
clean hostel. staffs were friendly. adequate number of showers and toilets were available. most importantly, location was excellent!

the location was perfect,straight up from hollywood boulevard.i did not get any notise in advance that the price had got up,so i had to pay ekstra on arrival.this did not give a god first impression.for that price you should be able to rent a towel for free,instead of having to pay 2 dollars,like now,and maybe get some milk for the cereal offered for breakfast.but i did love the atmosphere of the house.staff was friendly to.i would come again.miss la allready!
you must stay here. best value.
very close to hollywood blvd. nice place to stay. poor breakfast.

best location ever! ants in the kitchen, bad attitude by the staff, and 5$ for washer drier?!? and there's only one machine so prepare to wait if laundering is needed. aside from that the rooms are big, clean and the location seriously can't be beat!

the hostel was nice. the location is right on the hollywood blvd corner, in the center of action. the place has $5 all day parking in the back yard. the staff was really nice. we had a private two bed room, however it was noisy due to the managers dog barking and people talking in the back yard, the front desk staff gladly switched us to the more quiter room on the second floor. the hostel over all is great, and highly recommend it!
this was a great hostel, the location was fantastic and close to the sights without feeling like you were in them.  i was impressed with how clean and friendly everyone was.
awesome! can't beat the location. lots of character. my second time here and i'd go back again!
the room above ours had water leaking into our room. was quickly attended by the staff on duty at the time.

stayed at the orange drive for 7 nights with my friend. we were looking for someplace cheap to spend our nights and this hostel was an excellent choice! great, friendly, helpful staff. clean rooms, however small and without any closet space..i would definitely consider staying here again. worth every penny. as we didn't have a car, this location was perfect with the metro near and everything!. bottom line, you get what you pay for. if you don't have too high expectations, you will be pleased!!

i really loved our stay here you could not get closer to everything you would want to see in this area. we had a room on the 3 rd floor which was really good. i would stay here again & again if i return to l.a. anytime..

no free breakfast!!! only oatmeal, but nothing else. two bottles of cornflakes, no milk, no orange drink, nothing but hot water.  the staff wasn't helpfull, they were rude.  the room has terrible bathroom, old and dirty!  no any signs on the streetfront, very hard to find this place.  the location is good if you interested the hollywood area.  i was a lot of places around the world [hong kong, singapore, new york, san francisco, mallorca, tokyo, etc.] but this hostel was the worst ever!
this hostel is right in heart of everything you want to do in hollywood and nearby. quiet, which we liked.
we had a very big room, hostel was clean but bathroom facilities are rare. we often had to wait for using the showers. staff was friendly but we wished to get more information about the area.
the restroom near my room is under construction during my stay.  i need to find other restrooms.  there should be an available potable water to drink.

normally in other hostels, they clean the sheets everyday, here, you have to change your own sheets and can't do that every day! no lockers nearby, there were some in the basement and was not useful. location in hollywood & orange is pretty sketchy and gets worse as you go east. felt very uncomfortable to leave my stuff there. staff at this hostel were very nice tho, no complains there.
a beautiful old building, with lots of bathrooms everywhere   rooms are clean and big enough

most of the staff were rude.  the shower didn't drain and filled the shower floor with nasty soapy water before i had even rinsed my hair out.  some reviews have said there is free parking.  not the case, it is $5/day with a tiny parking lot.  best i can say- the sheets were comfy (but the beds were old, creaky and hard).  no ac-very hot!

i was not pleased that i was charged an extra $20 upfront which was not mentioned on the website.  overall, i cannot complain as the total cost of staying there for the weekend was pretty decent.  the other reservation was that i was charged for sunday night, when i was not planning to stay until sunday afternoon.  otherwise, i was fortunate to find decent roommates who were respectful of my belongings.  it took a bit long to wait for the men's shower so i had to use the one upstairs.

nice small hostel set in a big old house just off of hollywood boulevard. tiny little bathrooms that were generally kept clean and tidy, though the showers were a bit dim and cramped. old furniture and rugs generally added positively to the character, though could have been cleaner. free wifi worked in most parts of the building. staff generally helpful.
awesome place. the staff were very kind helpful ladies and the room was clean. not a single problem! right next to hollywood! i enjoyed my stay there plus free parking
good, convenient hotel that's a bit different. no problems at all.
the location is great, very clean hostel, the best staff!
we stayed there for 3 nights ... very close to public transport and excellant value for money ... though theensuit rooms were very small ....
keep up the good work, thanks!

the hostel has a very nice atmosphere, it´s like staying at your grandma´s. the rooms are nice, but the shared bathroom is very small. anyway the location right next to the dolby theatre and hollywood boulevard is great. i would totally recommend this hostel to my friends.
great location, lovely building - we enjoyed our stay!
perfect location, very clean and staff friendly and helpful.  would recommend spending  a little extra to have private bathroom.
very friendly staff, great location, nicely decorated and presented. i was very happy here and will be heading back for sure.
fab location. charming house. helpful staff. quiet at night.

very nice hostel close to the hollywood boulevard. we stayed here twice and enjoyed both our stays. even though it's really close to the main tourist area, it's relatively quiet. the rooms were spacious and clean. staff was very friendly and the free internet worked great. only thing we found a bit weird was that you had to pay 2$ to rent a towel.
great little place, clean, comfortable and great value for its hollywood location. staff were very pleasant and helpful, and happily accommodated our early check in when we were badly jetlagged.

i really liked the hostel it had a calm but good atmosphere, things felt not to loud but company was never far away, with some great people staying as well as the staff who were all really good and i liked them all.     some of the facilities like lack of laundry was not so good, and the internet was also not good even though there in a pay in machine. my email accounts didn' work properly on it. however these things were not every thing and the location was good and over all would give it 9/10

excellent location! just a block from kodak theater, walk of fame! friendly staff ! the nice lady in the front desk lead us up and down stairs to let us choose the room and introduce the history of this lovely inn. i just found out this lovely hostel has once provided as a lovely home to some famous actors and actress like marilyn monroe! and the room is quite clean and comfortable. the only problem is the heater. it is quite old that it seems it couldn't change temperature and had a bit smell.
no power point in the bathroom, and 4 beds, yet only 1 towel hook.
excellent location and helpful staff - they were very accommodating with my requests for dropping off my key for check-out early.  parking is also available onsite for only $5!
great location and great staff!

great location, 2 minutes walk from hollywood boulevard but set back enough to avoid the noise. very good kitchen facilities, but tended to get our own breakfast from the supermarket that was less than 5 minutes walk away. everybody was very friendly, good hostel for meeting people and getting advice about the area. our room had no plugs but there were plenty in the common room and other rooms had them. overall, a good hostel, in fact we are returning on our way back through l.a!
amazing location (less than a block away from the walk of fame, 2 blocks from a metro station), really quiet hostel, very nice and helpful staff. i would stay there again

orange drive manor hostel is in an excellent location in hollywood ,just off hollywood blvd,close by santa monica and sunset strip and universal studios and all hollywood sights,plus subway close by!....very friendly and helpful staff.....bathrooms,showers.and rooms very clean ,excellent!good value for money...enjoyed my stay there...i will come again when in hollywood,la!

very friendly staff and top location. however the hostel lacks a convenient space for socialising and hence i found it difficult to meet people. though my fee was waived by kevin, a great gesture, charging for towel and internet use puts the hostel on the backfoot immediately. including the fee for all would appear better in my opinion. similarly, in not making the bed for visitors the hostel is a step behind the competition - minor but noticeable. despite this, had a top time.
the staff was really nice and gentle. the location was excellent, 1 minute walk from the chinese theater.

it's more of a hotel than a hostel but not necessarily in a good way. there was no real common area. kitchen was tiny and breakfast was oats and hot water. there was no luggage storage, we had to leave our bags at the reception. the general feeling seemed unwelcoming mainly because of the rules posted everywhere on the walls like no using facilities after the check out and charging extra for late check out (even 5 minutes). on the upside staff were very friendly and helpful.
nice enough, little old and could do with a face lift.
great location, helpful staff and clean bathrooms.
great location and staff was very helpful
had a very comfortable time. very relaxing considering that it is so close to so much action.
superb location, friendly and helpfull staff. great rooms. very few opportunities to socialise with other people staying.

this hostel was only 1 block from hollywood blvd. and only 2 blocks from the metro station. i found getting around hollywood, as well as greater los angeles and the beach very convenient. the staff was fantastic and helped me plan my daily adventures. all i had to do was ask. i felt welcome and safe, and the rooms and bathrooms were nice and clean for the price. the location is a little off the beaten path, so don't expect a ton of people, but i had no troubl running in to people.
pleasant stay, very quiet, amazing location.
front desk staff very helpful.

great place with character , very helpfull staff and fantastic location! only downside to the stay; very small bathrooms/toilets! but that's nothing they can really change i think, it's an old building. alltogether, great place!

regarding what one expects from a hostel in la, this is one where you can definitely stay, given its location, the seriousness of the staff, etc....  the one less good point i felt is the non existence of breakfast in the morning and may be the lack of activities inside the manor itself.
it's a bit of a mix between an hotel and a hostel. it has more character than your average hostel, but it was not that much fun when i was there. but the location is excellent!

location is alright if you want to do hollywood boulevard. didn't strike me as a place where it promoted meeting other people, although i may have been there during a quiet period. no laundry facilities. i thought it was a bit pricey considering what the place was like. staff were friendly and helpful.
great location. did not feel secure, dirty and linen was dodgy.

location is fabulous. just within walking distance from the chinese theater. very quiet at night. away from the vibrant hollywood. good if u need a good rest. the staffs were friendly & hospitable esp one of the ladies, sorry i didn't get her name. she helped me a lot, e.g. where to go, and more importantly how to go by the cheapest way. really very thankful to her.   please take good care of your own belongings & valuables. you only have your own self to blame if u lose anything esp in dorms.
great location, comfortable, great staff
our room was so hot! other than that, we love staying here. corey is so funny, and keith is super nice!
excellent location, just a few minutes walk to hollywood blvd.  character room, spacious, clean, enough parking spaces.
