loved the location and the beautiful old building (especially the telephone booth). however, the hostel needs better options for securely storing stuff, please. there are only a few working lockers & they are tiny.  they also require money every time you open & close them, instead of having a daily rate. not at all helpful. also, the area in which luggage is stored pre & post checkout is not secure. staff is frequently out of the room for very long periods of time & all guests have access.
very very good especially the location
helpful staff and great location!  however very noisy room and no air con in room which is ridculous given its so warm at night-worst nights sleep in a hostel!
nice place in a great area. really close to go walk on to the hollywood hills! free oatmeal for breakfest, lots of room. no ac but it will save the earth so thats ok.

a really nice hostel. it is in a great location, just a very short walk to hollywood boulevard.   the staff were really lovely, and helpful with tips on places to eat, and how to get around la.  we stayed in a private room, that was huge, with lots of wardrobe space and drawers. the bathrooms were tiny, but the showers worked fine.  only downside was that it was really hot in la, and there was very little air in the bedrooms (no ac / fans).

i stayed in a 4 bed female dorm and although there wasnt that much space, it was was clean and tidy and i would def stay there again. i liked the location - 2 seconds to the train station and near lots of buses.  staff were very friendly and helpful.

fantastic hostel with friendly, attentive, caring staff and a location that can't be beat! i'm so glad i stayed here, and next time i'm in l.a. i will definitely be back. the only reason i only marked "good" on the facilities column is that the air conditioning was broken in our room, and in the middle of summer it made the room quite hot. the bathrooms were clean, the beds were comfortable, and they have a nice kitchen and tv room if you find yourself needing an evening in. highly recommended!

the hostel in itself was good. one woman of the staff was welcoming, not the other.  luggages left on the common room at arrival.   the ammount due on my booking was different of the ammount due on arrival.  there was a piano. the room was big for not that much people.  no outlets in the rooms, wifi???

perfect budget hostel in hollywood. management was very helpful and very nice. rooms were fairly clean and cozy. hostel cleanliness was overall fair.   the only concern is i wish they had better breakfast and not a self-service kitchen
hostel is grand for one or two night, very central, no locker room for luggage but staff seem to be there most times during the day.
could have done with air con (or at least a fan in the room) but otherwise an excellent hostel - very close to hollywood, very nice and helpful staff.
amazing location!

it was my second stay in this hostel. ive been in some hostels in los angeles and so far this hostel is my favorite. its very quiet - doest fell like a hostel at all more like living in a big house.  needless to say that the location is perfect.

the only good thing about this hostel was location. great location right behind the kodak theatre. staff were rude, hostel had no character or atmosphere. never saw anyone around and when you did it was older people who never talked. hostel is a money grabber too. $5 per person just for a piece of paper with the wi fi code on, $2 per towel.  showers were a small hole in the wall which if you're tall you'd be lucky to fit in and there was only one shower per floor for around 20 people on a floor.

my friend and i had a fantastic experience with the hostel.  it was perfectly located to where we wanted to go & the staff was exceedingly friendly. we loved our room & the facilities were perfect. we'd definitely stay there again & would have no problem recommending our friends to stay there.

the location can't be beat, and our host was very hospitable. we stayed in a private double, and although it was a bit warm at night because there was no air conditioner, we felt we had chosen exactly the right place to stay!
very nice hostel and helpful staff. great location close to hollywood blvd.

great location. it is the quiet street behind all of the hustle and bustle of hollywood blvd. it is right under magic castle, a famous private club on a hill that is dedicated to magicians from all over.  i was told that marilyn monroe lived there when she was still norma jean. they have an old fashion telephone (not in service) and wooden telephone booth.  literally walk around the corner and you are in the midst of the action. parking $5 per night which is a nice. i would stay there again.
the staff really did excellent service! they worked for more than one hour to provide us transport, which they normally do not do!
friendly & helpful staff. perfect location right behind hollywood strip. close to public transport. nice safe area.  had all the needs & essentials for a backpacker. would definitely stay here again.

exellent location, but amennities poor. no towels for shower, bed was uncomfortable, also pillows very thin, no television and had to use a shared bathroom. value for money poor. if all you want is a place to crash for the night then this is ok since location is exellent, otherwise very average.

the hostel is located in an excellent position in hollywood. safe area about 50 meters to the walk of fame on hollywood boulevard. just far enough away from the action so you can get a good nights sleep if you wish. the hostel is an old mansion nothing special but not to bad either. great value for money i have stayed here on 2 occasions now. they staff are friendly and helpfull.

i loved the location and the staff even though they gave us the wrong room and we were forced to have a shared bathroom instead of private ensuite. the price was excellent and the house is beautiful. the shared bathrooms however are uncomfortably small and that is far from an exaggeration. i could barely manage to shave my legs without sticking them out the shower. the common room is a great space, wish there would be gaming consoles for rent at the desk or something fun!

super great location, you can walk less than a minute and your already on hollywood blvd, grauman's chinese, dolby theatre , el capitan etc. the staff was really friendly. the breakfast is oatmeal without any flavors, so if you want something more constistant, you will have to go buy yourself food at the market (which is really close though). great hostel in general, i would recommend it more for the location and staff than anything else. there wasn't any room service proposed.

i cannot tell you how happy i was to check into this hostel from the nightmare one before this.    this hostel is seconds away from hollywood blvd, but on a quiet side-street so you don’t get the noise of the madness while trying to sleep.  i booked into a solo room on the top floor and it was one of, if not the, best hostel room i have ever stayed in; it was light, i could open windows and let air in, the sheets, while worn, were clean and i could take my shoes off without fear of what was ingrain

the location of this hostel is perfect, the coupon which was offered by reception -- sherry's cafe or sth like that, the breakfast they offered was really really sucks. anyway, in general , this place is awesome !!
very close to the main parts of hollywood. is very quiet and relaxing - the perfect place to stay when you've had a long haul from australia.

a nice place.  the location was great - a quiet place to sleep but close to the action. the place had character, containing lots of random vintage/antique items.  it was clean and quiet, but had a large indoor area if you wanted to just lounge around.  the breakfast was nothing special, but it's already a cheap stay and at least you get free tea/coffee all day.  not a party hostel, if that's what you're looking for, but a place to rest your head after a long day/night of exploring or partying.

this hostel was located in the heart of hollywood, a great location and an amazing old house with so much character. the communial bathrooms are a bit dingy but nothing unbareable. there were no lockers or any safe spots to store valuables like passports and laptops and the 4 bunk dorm didnt allow much if any room for movement. the staff member named keith was great, happy to help and really accommodating but all the other staff were quite rude.

thew staff was very nice , but the cleaning could be better. in the hostel it was very quiet, so  the hostel is perfekt if you want to be close to walk of fame and the entertainments there. we decided after the  first morning to have breakfast somewhere else. there are plenty of coffieshops in the aria.

was very impressed by our stay at orange drive manor, compared to an awful motor inn down the road. very clean and safe area despite being just off the main strip. staff were very helpful and always made themselves as helpful as they could with any questions or issues. parking off street was great and room was great. i will not hesitate in rebooking this hostel next time i'm back in la. you guys are doing a great job!

it was good located in hollywood, only about 3 blocks from the dolby theatre and chinese theatre theatre. the only bad thing about the hostel was the curtains. they were too thin and white and had to open our eyes at about 7 o'clock because of the sunlight.

staff were unfriendly and the room was very basic (2 beds and an open bathroom/toilet combo). the hostel didn't have a party vibe, but was still incredibly noisy thanks to the thin walls loud floors. located just around the corner from hollywood blvd, it's in a good spot if you're there for the chinese theatre and star boardwalk, etc. i've stayed in a lot of places and this was close to the noisiest hostel i've been in.

was very impressed with the location and the facilities in the kitchen! the wifi access was however a bit tempremental - it would have been nice to have definitive access in our bedroom as this is what we paid for.   we thought that the oven in the kitchen was a little unsafe as it became burning hot and difficult to touch.   overall though we throughly enjoyed out stay
nice place,great and safe location,metro is just araund the corner....could be a little bit cleaner!
great hostel and great location, very nice house, if you go to hollywood ,  and you need place to stay, choose this hostel!

the only issue was that the bath mats needed to be washed more often consider the amount of people who use the showers.  other that that i absolutely loved the place, the location was excellent, the staff were amazing and helpful and the hotel was clean and safe.    next time we stay in hollywood we are definately staying there again.

a really cool hostel in a great location. we had a double with shared facilities: there are a lot so no hustle if house is full. we had a lovely room and staff was friendly and welcome. i would definetly stay there again!!!
staff was too unkind and they looked they cared only money not customer's convenience.
kitchen was far too small.  location was great though.

the hostel was in a great position so close to hollywood blvd.  the staff were very helpful when we had questions or needed information.  the only problem we had during our stay was the noise during the early hours of the morning when some of the other occupants were partying.
very charming hostel in a great location.                                  loved the runyon canyon right down the street. best views of la. this hostel is very quiet and was just what i needed.

having not stayed in hostels before i didnt know what to expect.  i was travelling with 4 other guys and were only staying 2 nights,  we found the hostel adequate for what we wanted as we were just passing through la.  it appeared a bit tired and run down but is in a fantastic location for touring la and the price was good as we just wanted a place to get our heads down.
beautiful, 'vintage style' house, really is only a 2 minute walk from the buzz of hollywood boulevard, cheap to egt to from the airport as well.  helpful staff, i loved this place!

the best thing about this hostel is its position literally just a couple of minutes walk to hollywood bvd.  staff very pleasant and helpful.  a little pricey though but it was worth it for the convenience.
really handy location for visiting the hollywood sights and it was much cheaper than hotels nearby. the staff were very friendly and helpful.
great location!

no free wi-fi!!! you had to pay $5 for the duration of your stay (expensive)! the free breakfast is poor - just oatmeal, and not even the microwave-able kind! the staff was not there at the counter to let us in when we arrived. when they are there, they are usually friendly. they charge security deposit of $50 in cash for the keys. when you enter the room, there's a long list of rules on the back of the door. check-out seems too early at 10am (5$ for later check-outs). showers spray weirdly.

the whole place was not very bright, a little gloomy, kitchen too small, tv room too small. no lockers in the room, no free internet. the beds were very noisy, kept me awake. close to hollywood blvd, good location, close to metro (good), felt pretty safe and it was pretty clean.

the orange manor drive hostel is in a great location for you to visit the main part of hollywood blvd. its moments away from the kodak theatre. its also easy to get to universal city and universal studios via the metro which is about 5 mins walk away. there is a supermarket and post office near by. staff were friendly and i think most of the staff lived at the hostel themselves. showers and bathrooms were clean. we stayed in a private double which was spacious and had a heater which was great.

great place to stay right  in hollywood. parking lot in the back if you have a car. we had a private room. cannot get a cheaper room in this area for sure! nice helpful staff. in a quiet street with trees. really liked it!
great old building in a superb location. just round the corner from the heart of hollywood, yet surprisingly quiet. pleasant staff, recommended.

the place is very well located (close to hollywood blvd and kodak theater) and has a lot of character. the guy that help me during check in was very nice, so was the polish girl working there. but first they put me in a wrong room, with unclean bathroom. after complaining i was transfered me to the room i booked, but that had very unclean bathroom (hair/nose bugs) and the room was very noisy. i could hear the other rooms, the bathroom outside my room, people upstairs. i left next morning.
everything is very well, but the bed is too soft
all was good except that the room smelled old and moldy, and didn't feel very clean.

very convenient location, 3-5mins walk to hollywood walk of fame and chinese theater - free wireless even in rooms not just in common areas - good value for money - only issue is very small bathroom/ toilets in private rooms, but if its for few days you'll survive -  if you're staying in la stay in hollywood because all tours starts in this area and all attractions are nearby as well, there's absolutely nothing to do in main los angles city and its just so boring in that part of la.
perfect location. friendly staff, easy parking. some noise from other rooms but no big issue. definitely recommend.
this hostel has no atmosphere whatsoever. everyone keeps to themself and the staff encourages that by being mostly invisible
change the oatmeal brand and/or add more free breakfast options. the oatmeal really didn't have any flavor. other than that, i was pleased with mainly everything.
great location, 2 min walk to chinese theatre on walk of fame. our private room (shard b/room) was spacious.

great location - a stone's throw from walk of fame and kodak theatre. great in most ways, but not so well suited to meeting people and need to have more events, i.e. bar crawls, etc. otherwise very happy with all.

why did they charged a customer who  did not stay in there hostel  and cancelled 24 hours before arrival,  i don't get it !!!!    i want my money back and want them to realize it is so wrong!     i also cancelled another hostel called duohousing in l.a. they charged me 2 bucks.
the room got really hot at night and there was no airconditioning or fan. this was in november, i wouldn't dare rent a room in the summer.
not a very special place, but the location can't be beaten, it is right behind the chinese theatre!

this hostel is all about the location - right around the corner from the kodak theatre, chinese theatre, hollywood walk of fame and the highland metro stop providing easy access to universal studios. the staff were great - very welcoming and friendly. definitely, the best value for money if you want to see hollywood in a couple of days.
stayed one night, will stay again. great friendly service and facilities.
excellent location. there too few showers, only rwo or three for the entire hostel.
i can recomend it if your not that fuzzy about clenliness.

it may be not the cheapest hostel and for sure not the newest one.  the 'breakfast' might not be existend, the walls are pretty thin and the bathrooms are as old as the house.   but for this location it's def the best deal you can get.  you get to all the hotspots in about 1 to 25min by car, there are lots of restaurants in the neighbourhood, two movie theaters, a bowling place, shisha bars,..  if you don't expect a lot and the only thing you want to do in the hostel is sleeping it's good enough.
excellent! great location, private parking and helpful  staff..

we stayed in private room, private bathroom so this may make things a bit better, but still this is one of the best hostels in my experience. it gives everythig i need - perfect location, quiet, clean, parking place (add $10).   our room had cloakroom which was very nice.  they only thing can be better - breakfast is not complimentary. for $5 i didn't give it a try.
great location,friendly and helpful staff. would recommend it to anyone staying in hollywood on a budget!

this place has a fantastic location, it's just off hollywood blvd!! if u wanna go downtown or to the beaches, just take the metro or the bus which stops are just a min's walking away. be aware tho, their breakfast is cereals (bring your own milk!), u have to pay for wi-fi, and they have no air-con so it can get quite hot in your room. also u'll need your time to get used to their beds since the matresses are kinda wrapped in a plastic coating. the walls are paper thin.
excellent hostel, really close to everything in hollywood for a really cheap deal
they might  change the mattress!!!!

the staff was helpfull. it was a little bit noisy because i could hear the noise outside,  but the best thing about this hostel is the location, it's very close to the best place to see the walk of fame. the room was ok but i couldn't turn the air conditioning on so it was very hot. i would recommand this hostel.

no aircon or fans for summer but the staff try not to place you in the hot rooms. really lovely old house & facilities are good. the shower cubicles are tiny though. for someone who has only stayed in 4-5 star hotels this was not too much of a shock as an introduction to hostels.

the hostel didnt have a tv in the rooms and smelt fusty. the rooms are dated and very expensive with what you got. when we turned up they tried to charge us more money for paying by card when the fee we agreed to pay on hostelworld was printed on our booking. they also tried to charge for internet which wasnt clear on the booking.  we were very disappointed with this place and left after 1 night when we were supposed to stay 4. went and paid another $20 a night and stayed in the best western whic

nice quiet hostel in a very convenient location, two out of 3 of the staff is very nice, 20 key deposit is a bit much especially if you are leaving the states the next day. and i would not call instant coffee and oatmeal without milk free breakfast.

staff unwelcoming and not particularly knowledgeable about surrounding areas. we stayed in a private room which was cosy but had no sink and only one tiny shower room on the corridor.   kitchen facilities and storage space for food is also very small and gets busy quickly.   no services to help out with travel.. wish we'd stayed in usa hostel where they offer free shuttles to the beach.

super awesome location. its right behind the kodak theatre (known from the oscar awards) and its right next to the walk of fame! the rooms are nice and there is internet access, a tv room and a nice kitchen where you can warm up your leftovers!
loved this hostel. def not a party hostel but really enjoyed the chilled back atmosphere and the location was excellent - right on hollywood boulevard

this hostel seem to be after your money at every stage. credit card payments were at a surcharge per night, wi-fi was at a charge, lockers were only available at a cost, even the free breakfast of cereal and a hot drink required you to provide your own milk!!! the rooms were unbearably hot and one of us encountered bites during sleeping there.  the kitchen was tiny and didn't offer much in the way of utensils. also there were no towels in the toilets for drying your hands.
great location (for those who want a lodging in hollywood). cheap parking ($5/day) !!! but very small and not-always-very-clean bathrooms

great location, no doubt, but...  it really feels more like an alders house then a hostel. no music, no character, no activities. nothing.   good for bed & breakfast maybe.  hostel is an affordable place for students or just young people who come to a foreign place to have fun, the fun starts at the place you stay.
it is right in the heart of hollywood so if you are a movie lover that's the place to be! close to transportation, restaurants and it has parking space. nice stay.

very nice hostel in a great location right next to hollywood boulevard. there are some strange people at the hostel that seem to live there.   the guest kitchen is really really small and the common room has not enough tables.   they charge you $5 per night for parking  and the internet is also not free: $5 for wireless access or pay per minute on their computers!  however we enjoyed our stay.

the location of this hostel is great as it is in the center of hollywood especially for the price but the house is really old and pretty run down. there is no ac so every morning it felt like we were waking up in a tent especially since the morning sun shined straight into the windows when it came up at like 6am and the really isn't enough showers for the amount of people in the hostel. the kitchen down stairs is good plus but the $50 key deposit is a bit steep.
everything is just perfect but shower^^
staff were great! location outstanding!! only wish i known more about the non hollywood aspects of la before i left... ie fairfax ave :)

this is a great hostel and in the best location you could ask for. the staff were fantastic and the room very clean. the hostel also had great security. this is more a hotel than hostel, so if you are looking to party, don't stay here because its quiet and relaxing, just the way we liked it.
very good location, friendly and helpful staff.

the staff where extremely helpful at all times and the location was outstanding, although the bathrooms in particular were unclean. hairs stuck everywhere and old dirty soaps and things similar left there for days.   all in all though, it was a value for money, great stay.
terrific staff,helpful,friendly,perfect position,great character.

i adore this place, and will always stay here when in la. if you want a part hostel then please stay away! this is not for you. but if you want a friendly place to stay which has character and the best location, this place is great. i love how it is so unique and that is it not just a "chain" hostel. i also stayed in 2004 and enjoyed it then too.
very quiet, clean hostel with perfect location (heart of hollywood, near major transport links).

room was nice and big. but discovered lots of random objects lying around from past visitors (speakers, toothbrush, fortune cookie paper??) which led us to believe that it was really not cleaned often. bathroom felt a bit gross, wore flip flops in the room. pillows very uncomfortable.  no breakfast in the morning, just make-your-own instant coffee. however, the staff was extremely helpful. ps!! i highly recommend heading over to runyon canyon nearby, beautiful hikes, celebrities go there!

nice helpful staff like laura, b & leslie sure made our stay happy!!!  love the bedroom that we had though the morning sun shining thru!!!  love the front porch of the hostel!!! sure doesnt look like a hostel when i was searching for it in the night!!! so peaceful!!!

i didn´t like this hostel at all. at first we couldn´t find the place because there was no sign saying orange drive manor hostel, just a locked house, kind of creepy really. when we were inside the staff was not that friendly though there were a man who was very nice. we stayed in a female dorm and it was clean and all but the whole place was impersonal. it was close to hollywood boulevard and if you like typically tourist stuff you will love it but i thought it was dull.

i would stay here again if i'm in la. the location was fantastic, the hostel clean and secure. i saved a lot of money by being able to walk and use the subway system to get to the places i wanted to see. highly recommended.

good location, just off hollywood blvd. multiple bathrooms is always good. quiet hostel if you want to go sightseeing and then get some rest at night. not to sure about some of the people staying there though. a few long term "guests" more like transients.

location....location....location if you want the hostel in la with best location, this is it just steps away from hollywood blvd. great to have secure off street parking in la too even if it is $5 extra per night
good location - very close to hollywood boulevard and metro station. lots of people seem to live there and it´s not very social.
the hostel was very nice, staff were great friendly and fun, it is clean but very noisy, and the showers are really bad. i would definatly recommend it, but there are some things that may annoy you.

all in all it was a good stay. bed was a little stiff and the fact one has to pay for internet that was spotty at best was a minus. staff was great, place was clean and secure, and location to downtown hollywood was also great.    close to subway travel and local supermarket for food.     the only negative was the fact that i paid about $3 more per night than if i had booked directly through the hostel.
very good hostel. the staff were very helpful and it was very clean, i will be staying there again

this is a wonderful hostel in the center of hollywood. it's just off the walk of fame but still far away enough to let you sleep at night. parking is only $10 and securely in the back!  the house is big and beautiful. it's safe and the staff is very helpful. there isn't much room to hang out in, but you have entire l.a. to do so in!  this hostel is highly recommended by me and my friends! i'd stay there next time i visit l.a.

the location of the hostel was perfect and security was good. however, there was no guest laundry which wasn't stated on the description of the hostel when we were booking, although using the local laundry service turned out to be cheaper than in most hostels. the polish lady on reception was extremely helpful and friendly, however, the man who was on duty when we arrived was new and could have done with a lot more taining, as we were left feeling very confused with misinformation.
this is my favorite place to stay in hollywood. quiet! parking! fabulous location. not for the party hearty crew, but perfect for a taste of old hollywood.

just 5 minutes walking from a subway station, it is a good location in hollywood. there is a excellent supermarket near. the kitchen is small, but good. the place is a nice house and the room was very confortable. it is really a good option in this region.

i booked orange drive manor hostel for a recent stay in los angeles on a holiday that was a mixture of hostel and nice hotels.  on the internet it looked charming, the reality was different! aside from the naked man who lived on the third floor and didnt throw anything out the cleanliness was awful! couldnt wait to get out of the shower quick enough! it could have been lovely, they have tried to add character with old furniture but instead just looked decrepid. location, while central was onlyok
good hostel, right off the hollywood walk of fame.   it was not the most fun place, but it was all that you need
very nice hostel, right by the hollywood boulevard, with a private parking ! staff is also friendly. hostel looks a bit old, but very quiet and yet a common room. great !

there was nothing really wrong with the place, just not outstanding. the location is great, if you're going to spend time in hollywood (which we were bored of in 10mins), but otherwise its just a place to crash and if thats all you need then no problems here
perfect location!! the best square in hollywood!    this is not a party hostel.

omg it isn’t a hostel:it is a family!!!even i am living in la and i am traveling around instead of a hotel or staying with friends  i always come back here.i made so many friendships all over the world.everyone who is here in la should make this awesome experience.no matter if u r coming alone,with your friends or even with your family. u only see smiling faces here.😊👍🏻
very quaint and cozy. friendly staff, free breakfast, and not over crowded. would recommend to a friend!

the place is very nice with many facilities, and a great breakfast. little detail is that you're asked to pay more than the original price in hostelworld, but apparently it's a tax in every hostel in ca.
everything is great! you wouldn't feel regret staying here !

the beds are comfortable. people in the common area are too noisy for those who want to sleep after 10.  the breakfast is fabulous!  proximity to buses and metro is excellent  no kitchen...food prep. is only a microwave, toaster oven, frig and sink.

fantastic place to stay - great location, it is a very small hostel but with great facilities. the staff are lovely and helpful. the beds were comfortable and the rooms nice and big. unfortunately there was no locker space in the bedrooms and no where to place your bags.   the only downside is that the common area where everyone eats breakfast is on the same floor, and adjacent to the bedrooms, this means it is very noisy in the morning from 7am.

this was my experience, first the directions were wrong and i found myself in a very dangerous neighbourhood at night where i was supposed to transfer from the metro to a bus that simply didn't run on weekends. quite scary. once i checked in, i left to get food in the area and  2 bad experiences in 15 minutes that were extremely dangerous (i was chased by two dealers and by a man on a car). so, the area made me feel truly unsafe and uneasy. keep that in mind, especially if you're a solo female.
nice place, with friendly stuff and people. i recommend it :)
great place! definitely recommended!
great place!! the staff makes you like home. really nice people. the roof is amazing.
good hostel and people were great, but when i booked it the rating was a 9.3 which i think is a little overrated. it was def an 8 though. good price n p homie. breakfast is sweet.

we had a bit of an issue with a girl in the room who brought back a random guy at 4am which is fine as long as you come in quietly as there are 8 other people sleeping but no they decide its the perfect time for some sexy time, not being subtle about it either. i mentioned it to reception and he said no one else was in her booking meaning he wasnt even meant to of been staying there. the staff were really good and dealt with it straight away. only issue is security as ovbs anyone can walk in
good hostel! clean and organized. however, this is not a party hostel, where you can find a cool atmosphere. this a good place to sleep at night.
clean. close to hollywood, near a bus stop. breakfast is available. recommended.  locks are not free.
cleanest hostel i’ve ever stayed in
i loved the staff, the only two low points i see is one the internet don't work everywhere! and two the check in time is too late but was cool they let me storage the bags and wait ;)

atmosphere is top priority as a solo traveller hoping to meet people and this hostel really didn't meet expectations. room was decent considering the amount of people in there but could be noisy from the streets and the bathrooms always seemed to be covered in hair. the shuttle they offered didn't have enough people signed up so never seemed to run. location wasn't great, seems you need to catch an uber everywhere (seems to be the case everywhere in la).wouldnt recommend to other solo travellers

this is not a very social hostel but it's a very nice hostel. you have to try to meet people which is possible, but the vibe is not very social. other than that the facilities are very clean and staff are very friendly.  i stayed in freehand hostel la previously and i prefer this one.
awesome stay !  good breakfast !  only issue - didn't stay to the deal regarding allotted bed.  otherwise good people. nice environment.

great staff. ok area. plenty around to eat. there's a bit of a wait for toilets and showers but it's a small place so they have done the best they can with the room they have.  the roof top is pretty cool.  i'd stay again

melrose is a wonderful and safe place! the staff are so friendly and the breakfast and facilities are nice. there are more than one bathroom so you can always find one available. it's near the bus station so best for backpacker travelling by bus. i would definitely come again if visiting la!

this place was clean and organized and had a good breakfast. they have a cute little rooftop, too. there isn't much to do in the immediate surroundings but if you are willing to walk a mile you can find some cool stuff. they also have a bus stop across the street.
very good thanks a lot
quiet and clean place with all you need  except for a washingmaschine. really nice breakfast
hostel a bit out of the way but think that's due to la being such a big city. staff were amazing, the hostel always had something going on and the vibe was fun :)

for the past 20 years i've stayed in many hostels travelling and this one reminds more of a university/youth crash pad 'money maker' than an actual backpacker's hostel. the lack of an actual kitchen it's a huge disadvantage as you have no choice but to either eat a take out or a pre-packaged food in throw away plates and cutlery. and when i asked one of the staff if they had any real bowls so i could make myself some ramen noodles in the microwave the answer was 'no, cos they kept breaking'!!!

i loved the breakfast. there were lockers to put valuables into. the staff were amazing. they were always willing to help. there were around 50 people staying there when i was there. this meant it was probably hard for staff to keep things clean. i liked watching movies in the common area. wifi was great when not using at the peak time when everyone was around. i'd go back for sure. it was also easy to get to and make your way around la

the staff at the melrose hostel are very nice and kind. the hostel has an unusual layout for the restrooms and showers. you have to walk through the commons area to reach the bathrooms and/or showers. the female dorm was comfortable. it's a huge room and has lockers. the breakfast was very good. overall, the hostel was clean. i only stayed one night because i had reservations at another hostel.
great stay. lovely friendly staff. comfortable beds with clean and spacious dorms. one negative - led to believe there'd be self catering facilities, which was only a microwave.
the hostel is new but the interior made it look old and not so fresh (but it is a clean place). staff is realy friendly and helpfull and they have a very good breakfast!
the staff there is very helpful and the breakfast is really delicious!

the beds in this hostel are great! super comfy and the room was really clean... the staff were really friendly and helpful. there's a big tv and sofas and people generally just lounge around and chill. i didn't realise how big la was, somewhere closer to the city centre maybe would have been better, expect to be übering around a lot!
it's a great hostel. it's located in koreatown. very nice staff and close to the hollywood walk of fame!
this was the cleanest hostel i've stayed in in a while. also had a much better breakfast that most hostels. otherwise a fairly typical hostel, nice people, good experience.

amazing place, reliable wi-fi, delicious breakfast, clean rooms and common areas, bathrooms could be a little cleaner. location is good, almost hollywood but you still need to take public transportation, there are bus stops nearby taking you to a lot of places of interest. atmosphere was really good, but there were a lot of groups when i was there so as a single backpacker it was harder to socialize, but they have several social events. one of the best places i've stayed.
really chill hostel, great breakfast. relatively close to hollywood, especially if you're using public transport or uber. not super social or loud but that's what i liked about it. very clean.

this hostel was exceedingly pleasant in every way and exceeded my expectations in a number of categories. terrific breakfast, access to the city and food, but by far the most exceptional aspect of my stay was the staff. they were always incredibly helpful and when a payment issue arose they went above and beyond to rectify the situation.

amazing staff that really made me feel welcome and at home. the place is clean, the breakfast is generous and the beds were comfortable! good spacious area to relax after a long day and i just can't fault the hostel. the family are lovely people! always smiling and helpful.
just perfect. amazing breakfast, cleaned more than my home, the staff so kind and helpful.
possibly the best hostel i've been to so far (in any country). all was perfect, cleanliness, security, friendliness ... also quite reasonable in price (i paid approx 38$ per night on average)
great place to stay! staff are lovely, the place is very clean. they do a really great free breakfast. there's buses pretty much right outside your door to take you where you need to go! :)

great hostel. only just opened but great atmosphere to chill watching tv with lovely staff. central door and room door is coded and get small locker in room, no room for big bags though. beds have electricity sockets so can charge. breakfast was awesome pastries, toast, cereal, fruit, yoghurt!!! bathrooms nice and clean. 20 min walk to a metro line

one of my favorite hostels already. what sets them apart from most hostels in la, is that they truly care- incl. management+employees, & truly embrace you like old friends. they're also v professional, accommodating, plenty of reources/equipments, even discount cards for restaurants around! also one of the cleanest hostels i've been to no joke! smells fresh&clean, surprising as a hostel! they also have a rooftop! cozy colorful layout, plenty of bathrooms; s/o to doris&andrew :)

great hostel as a base in la, you can jump on public transport easy but la is much better to explore if you have a car! would recommend taking uber as it works out cheaper than metro/bus! hostel was clean and secure with great breakfast in the morning! only downside is the lack of showers, only 3 for the whole hostel witch meant you intern had to wait a while
very friendly staff, very clean, great breakfast. unfortunately no real kitchen for cooking. rooms are a very good size, beds are comfortable.
this hostel is quite a walk from the main attractions of hollywood but it's well connected by metro for both hollywood and downtown. the vibe here is really nice and the breakfast was good!
this was my first time traveling alone and this was the perfect hostel to stay! the staff were all really helpful and super accommodating and all the people were friendly too.
stiff mattresses, poor ventilation, etc. do not believe the average high rating.
a nice hostel for a few days. very good breakfast with a lot of variety. expect a lot of people in your room. staff is very nice and helpful.
not a good place overall   not at all the feeling of an youth hostel ...  sad place ...  please avoid!
very kind staff and good breakfast!

one of the best hostels i've stayed at! staff were friendly and helpful, and the hostel itself was excellent - especially the rooftop terrace. amazing free breakfast every morning, large communal lounge, and comfortable and quiet rooms. they have some pretty cool plans for the rooftop terrace so the place will get even better in future.
nice hostel, friendly staff, good place to stay for a few nights.
the staff was flexible and tender.

large room with a lot of beds, it is a small place though. you walk upstairs and there are the rooms the kitchen the common area and the bathrooms all in one spot. it's not so much of a let's all get in a group and hang out, it is more so of a place where you just need a place to stay that's clean and comfortable. i would stay again on nights i need to just lay my head. if i was looking to have fun, this isn't the spot for it.

no word is good enough to describe it! just a perfect place to stay. amazing staff that make you feel welcome. the breakfast is fantastic i could go on and on... for sure the best best place to stay in la. looking forward to come back!!
great hostel! i've stayed there twice and would stay again!
great atmosphere, better people and an overall terrific time.

this hostel is cool hidden gem. the vibe is very flexible in all aspects, whether if your down for socialize/partying their roof top is perfect,  or want to have a chill rest day their lounge area is full of comfy couches.   the staff are really cool and amazing people. will definitely rebook again when i revisit la.

this is the best hostel i've ever been to. it is also the cleanest hostel i've ever been to. the staff went above and beyond for each guest, like when one volunteered to take some of us to in'nout. great roof, great breakfast, amazing staff. they have daily events, such as free transportation to the griffith observatory, going to a play, and other great ways to make friends with other travelers. the beds and dorms are nice, and the people are nicer. if i come back to la, this is where i'd stay.
such a fun, clean, and welcoming place!!
absolutely loved it :) i would come back any time.

really nice hostel, kind staff, really clean and new facilities. great views from the rooftop. really really comfortable beds. unfortunately no kitchen but free breakfast was a definite plus!! location was fine but not amazing. overall really great stay!

one of the best hostels i've ever been to!  it was a great atmosphere! i met some nice people and the breakfast is great as well. the activity offers are a worth trying as well, we went to the observatory and had a great time. the staff is very helpful as well. also the rooftop was really nice.  the only downside was the fact that i had a bed next to the window so the traffic was quite noisy.   i would still definitely recommend the hostel and will stay here next time i come to la.

the breakfast, i am sorry but this is the best thing about this place, been travelling for a while now and this beats even some hotels that i've stayed in!! the hostel is really secure with locker and keypads on dorms/front door, it is also very clean! the location is okay, we relied on public transport (which is not great in la- but manageable) and you have to get a bus to the nearest metro, or you can get uber/lyft and the hostel have some deals with them! defo would stay here again!

i was very happy to find out that the hostel was kept clean including washrooms. this was great. i liked breakfast. everyday there was fresh fruit, cereal, yogurt, coffee bread and various spreads. beds were comfortable  and rooms were clean. i liked that each bed had its own socket to plug so there was no need to fight over sockets. the only encounter i had that displeased me was that we were refused to replace our used towels after three days of use even thought it us written in signed contract

melrose hostel is very nice.  it is clean, staff is friendly and delicious breakfast.  there is a lot more space in the kitchen and common areas than some other hostels.  only reason i didn't give a perfect score is the neighborhood isn't my favorite and opens to a main road.  i prefer being on a side road with trees on my block.    thanks melrose hostel.

well pried and well located. electric locks on the front door and room door plus lockers in the dorms. friendly staff.     room and facilities were very clean, bed was comfy and i appreciated it being already made as i turned up rather late. was often a wait for a bathroom though. towel provided which was great!    my major dislike was that disposable bowls plates and cutlery were provided for breakfast. this is disgustingly wasteful and i would be reluctant to stay here again for this reason.
no kitchen facilities. other than that an awesome hostel and great atmosphere, especially on the roof at night time.

friendly owners and great value. lots of travelers from around the work and a nice social atmosphere. i really enjoyed the roof deck and breakfast buffet! some of the staff could be friendlier but overall a great place that i’d recommend to anyone.
awesome staff, in midst of k-town, great rooftop and convenience stores around location!
it was a relly nice hostel to stay in - everyone was friendly, the stuff was super helpful and we enjoyed very frehs fruits at the breakfasts (cherries, strawberries, ...)

one of the best hostels i've ever been to. beds are comfy, staff was super nice and accommodated me way above what was expected of them because they want their guests to have the best trip possible. location is ok but in la you need a car or uber anyway. i was a bit sad when i left because there i made friendships that i know will last a lifetime. the atmosphere there is perfect for making new friends, but if you want to just chill alone you can do that too. unpretentious and heartwarming place.
great friendly atmosphere

i absolutely loved my time spent at melrose hostel. the staff were incredibly friendly and fun to talk to -- as were the other guests. the spaces were clean, comfortable, and well-appointed. their rooftop was a delightful place to hang out after the day's adventures. it also provided a great space for the delicious (free!) july 4th bbq -- not to mention a great vantage point for viewing fireworks. and the price was glorious! by far the best bargain i've encountered in the u.s.
great place in pretty central location. the place is pretty new so everything is clean and nice :) they also have a great breakfast provided.

i told them i was going to be late for check in (ends at 11pm) and they still accommodated me.     the location is okay depending on where you want to go.     the beds were actually pretty comfy.     the area around to the east of the hotel is pretty sketchy and the closest subway station is to the east so i would recommend going a slightly longer route to the hollywood/western station. i still felt safe in the hostel, there is a lock on the door and cameras.     overall, pretty good stay

they were very nice and made me feel at home. some idiot in the room woke me because i was snoring but he apologized the next day. they do sell ear plugs for people who cant sleep through snoring. all in all it was a great time.
literally the best hostel i've ever stayed at. the staff are so nice and they are constantly doing things for the guests like a bbq on the 4th of july and movie night.
good hostel. breakfast exceeded expectations.

i really enjoyed my stay at this hostel. the best part about it for me was meeting several travellers and making new friends. the staff was friendly and the rooftop patio is a great place to socialize. my only suggestion would be to have larger lockers to fit a larger backpack for travellers.
nice and friendly hostel. staff was great, excellent customer service. it was a little hard to find parking, but welcome to la. location was good. very comfortable place to hang out and chill.
it was nice facility and the staff were very accommodating;)
i would have liked a chair in the showers

this place is very new and just opened in may. overall my stay was good. it is quite clean and probably has to do with it being so new. you kind of feel like you're staying in someone's home; very warm atmosphere. it is very conveniently located being not too far from most sights/tourist spots. my complaints would be the dogs running around from the owners were annoying and barked a lot especially when guests came through the front door. the street in front is very noisey; keep earplugs handy!

if you are staying for 3-5 days in budget to explore la, and don't wanna switch places frequently, this is the ideal place to stay. plus, as a sole female traveler, i felt safe here. the female bathroom is clean and spacious, and the ambient here is nice. if i come back to la, would definitely stay here again!
great place to stay and made some cool people. nice rooftop
awesome place in a great location considering how big la is. met some great people, drinks on the rooftop bar, and not a bad breakfast!
great staff, and a fun environment! i had a lot of fun here, and i would stay here again on future trips.

the hostel was really clean and the staff were lovely. the beds were also very nice. the location wasn't that easy to get around and was a good 20-30 to downtown by car, longer to beverly hills and venice.
staff is really nice, they help as much as possible, breakfast is amazing. the only thing i miss is a kitchen where i could make some food for myself.

i spent a few nights here and it was great, while i was there it was being run by a family who owns the building and they were super accomadating , i met the owners sun who was super helpful and the owner was also super nice   great atmosphere   great location   the only thing i could complain about is that people would leave the doors open for long periods of time , but nothing got stolen because i had good people in my room

family owned and run hostel, the staff are so nice and help with anything you need.  good breakfast included - cereal, bagels, toast, yoghurt and fruit, tea, coffee & juice! good atmosphere, it was easy to meet/ speak to other people! big couch to watch netflix on also rooftop with tables and chairs! there is also a female only bathroom which i liked. plenty of room. you can also get 10% discount at some close by restaurants if you say you're staying here! would definitely stay here again :)

we loved the atmosphere at the meltose hostel - the layout of the place was awesome as it meant we could easily interact with other people. the staff were super lovely and the bagels for breakfast were such a treat! the only downside would be the lack of kitchen facilities, making it difficult for us to cook dinners.

very nice hostel, close to hollywood, very close to many bus stops to go downtown or any place in la.  if they organized activities for their guests would be  the perfect place to stay in. the staff were very gentle.

great hostel in a great location. a $5 uber away from sunset and hollywood blvd and only a 20-30 minute journey from lax and other tourist spots. the hostel was really clean and the staff were lovely. also it didn't feel like we were in an 18 bed dorm as the room is so large. would definitely recommend 👍🏼
the staff were so welcoming and around all the time. i ha good convasarions with a few of the staff. everything was really clean. there is a lot of space to chill.

i was expecting my stay in la would be filled with frustration over traffic and difficulties getting around places. well it definitely lived to my expectation! however my stay and view of la has changed through my stay at melrose hostel. i've been travelling to over 50 countries and stayed in many hostels, melrose would be in my top 5 hostel. the hostel has a lovely homey feel about it. the staffs were super friendly and helpful, especially jae! if you stay there, make sure you meet him!

this place is fantastic. it's only a month or so old but it has everything you need, plus an awesome rooftop hangout that they say will be renovated soon. the place is clean and cozy, the complimentary morning breakfast has everything you need, there's a tv and computer, and it's kept cool/cold. the street parking outside is metered 8-6, but always available, and the morning i left one of the employees went to pay my meter without me even asking. they're great people with a great place.
we had a great time there! people there was suuupee friendly and nicee and the hostel,is very clean!!  and a good breakfast btw haha

i'm pleased with my stay.  the staff, adali (i'm so sorry if i misspelled your name or mispronounced!!!) but he was outstanding and i want to thank him for the lyft discount.  i'm happy and i can see myself return. i hope to see you guys again!!!

great place to stay when traveling and wanting to meet new and interesting people. made the stay very welcoming and family oriented. love the fact you can cook and everyday there was an event planned. great job usa hostel.

absolutely loved this hostel! the staff were super helpful and friendly, and was always there when you needed. the hostel itself is great, open space and super clean and easy to get around via transport. i met so many great people here too, so worth your money! thanks melrose ave, i'll be staying again for sure 😄

there were a lot of beds in the room but i didn't have too much trouble. the common areas were good but there is not a real kitchen so you can't cook. the location is easy to get to by bus or walking to the metro.

easy access to public transport subway/bus makes this hostel easy to get to from the greyhound terminal & to travel around visiting the sites of la. the hostel is very clean & supplies a great healthy breakfast. you have the ability to cook in a microwave & store a small amount of food. they do offer  some free tours which i didn't go on. a good selection of netflix, movies & wifi is moderately ok. the girls bathroom actually has hair dryer & straightener a nice touch for the long term traveller

omg... melrose hostel by far is the best place to spend your vay k at. from the people who host to the atmosphere in general is very welcoming. your money is well spent here since the hostel is located near bus and subway transportation and nearby tasty restaurants. purchase a tap card and pay $7 for an all day pass on the metro. very home like feel huge flat screen with netflix. breakfast and coffee  offered every morning :) very clean bathrooms, rooms and a rooftop you can wind down. 10⭐️stars

melrose hostel is a new and inviting little hostel. they make so much effort to make the hostel feel like home with events such as movie nights! they offer guests discounts to surrounding restaurants and include breakfast! i'm excited to see what they will do to the rooftop area as that could be a real asset to their business. this hostel is small, but comfortable and inviting. 😁✌🏽
they are so nice and friendly
good place to stay. i would come back
staff was very friendly and welcoming! great value for money in terms of being pretty central in la only a short drive/lyft from tourist areas and west hollywood!
super nice hostel, definitely a recommendation! everything is new and modern. service is great, food is awesome and price is low. and you can take a picture for the wall of former guests:)
nice hostel but taking time to get bus to metro staion.

the owner and staff were exeptionaly helpful and kind! the location is not fantastic, but definitely safe, and only a few blocks down from hollywood, sunset, and santa monica boulevard. the free breakfast is great, and the dorms,showers and common area are well kept and comfortable. i will look to them the next time i'm in la.

definitely recommend!!! the staff are all really nice and super helpful with any and all questions you have about things to do, how to get around, places to eat, etc. it's brand new (only a few weeks old) so everything is nice and new, and they are adding new stuff all the time! facilities are awesome, very secure and safe, and an extremely friendly atmosphere. was there for less than a day and made friends with like 10 friends from countries all over the world! definitely a travelers dream!

it's a new hostel in a nice area, really close to hollywood. the hostel is clean, with nice dorms, a big leaving room and a rooftop. the breakfast is amazing with bagel, toast, cereals, chees, jam, fresh fruits and much more. the staff are all friendly and helps you if you need something. i definitely will come back to this hostel the next time.
cheapest hostel in la. nice breakfast. nice staff always ready to help. only a 40 minute walk from hollywood boulevard. bus stops nearby to get to other locations.
great breakfast and nice staff, location is ok, near a bus stop, very clean and quiet badroom
the stuff is awesome extremely kind and helpful. they made every moment enjoyable and helped with everything we needed.

excellent place! they have just opened - which explains the lack of reviews - but it was overall a great experience.  the staff was the friendliest i have come across and it was definitely the best value-for-money deal i have experienced. many of my fellow travelers (including ourselves) extended our stay simply because of the experience. would recommend to everyone.

this was very good value, provided that you are ok with either taking public transit/cab/shuttle to arrive and leave, or if you are willing to park up to 3/4 mile away and backpack/walk to the location.  breakfast was provided, although my schedule did not allow me to take part.  other guests seemed to provide interesting conversation, although i only spoke with a few people.  on this rather warm day/night, it was a bit warm inside, i believe because they chose to use the ac sparingly in bedroom

i would rate the hostel is just okay for me. i personally do not like the atmosphere at the hostel especially during the day when the staffs are so busy walking around cleaning the hostel and the room seem a bit stuffy as there are many people in one room and the air conditional does not seem to be working well. but their toilets are well clean. the location of this hostel does not seem to be very convenient.
best hostel i've stayed at so far, the atmosphere and location are so good, would recommend to anyone staying in la !
very happy with my stay at this hostel...so friendly and helpful hosts would not hesitate to recommend this place.

fantastic hostel, probably the best. when i arrived the family that owns the place gave me a very warm welcome which i really enjoyed. they made me feel at home and i'm happy to say that i had one of my best times there, endlessly recommended. thank you andrew, adalhi and his family. sorry for the late review, see you soon
the staffs were extremely helpful and friendly. the hotel was clean and the breakfast was very nice. me and my two friends love the place and will come back again.

i only stayed one night at melrose hostel, but the stay was awesome! it's a new hostel that just opened in may 2017 so everything is new and clean. andrew was super helpful and gave me a hiking route up griffth park to the observatory. he also gave me very accurate description of the various parts of la. i can see he goes out of his way to help all guests who stay there! wish i can stay longer. maybe next time. highly recommended!!  ps. i was their first canadian visitor! =)
brand new place in korea town. facilities are pristine. very friendly and very helpful staff. awesome deal for the price. definitely would come back here.
really enjoyed our stay at the newely opened hostel, good location, amazing staff and good breakfast! would come again anytime

this is absolutely the best hostel i've ever stayed at. no seriously my absolute favorite hostel guys lol. incredibly clean & the staff was amazing. i've stayed at quite a few hostels that are ok, but in some way or another miss the mark. not at melrose. the wifi is incredibly fast, and the free breakfast is not just toast & juice, there's an actual variety. very quiet, chill area with some awesome people. if you are traveling to la, short or long term this is the hostel. trust me.
really really a nice hostel... the staff are friendly.. the breakfast was amazing..
very nice and new hostel! it's in a good area close to hollywood with restaurants and shops nearby. staff are very friendly. i totally recommend staying here!

i stayed at the melrose hostel for backpackers for one night only, but the place was super clean and nice. the location was good, not sure about the public transportation because we had a car. the host was great, super kind. i highly recommend this place!
best hostel i've been in, can be recommended!
i love this hostal, the staff its very nice, i recommend it especially for young people. breakfast perfect. and they have a very nice dog. really i dont understand the bad reviews.

i had a good stay at the hostel. i met many friendly people and everybody was happy to be there, including the staff.  it has a centric location and is great if you don’t mind a 1 hour commute in transit to get to major destinations.   my one issue during my stay was that i was hit with a wooden board from the top bed that fell on my head.

amazing people, location and food that they serve there daily. although i wasn’t informed about a bed bug situation that had been brought to their attention about my exact same bed one week prior to my visit. i woke up the next day with extreme bites all over my body. if you don’t want to be bitten, book another hostel. btw, if you even set your things down on the floor, they’re prone to carrying bugs.
very nice place. in a quiet neighborhood

thank you all! 2nd time at your location and i really y enjoyed both stays. i look forward to next year. always an adventure.   oh, and tyler, you rock!!! please send me any dates or info on carlos. i hope he does well in his upcoming pursuits!  sincerely, dan c

unfortunately my stay at the anderson estates was a lot worse than i had expected. i read previous reviews and had an idea of what i was getting myself into but i didn't expect to be treated as poorly as i was by the staff. they had assigned my bed to somebody else without informing me or assigning me to a new bed. i had nowhere to sleep my first night and the office was closed. when i went to resolve the issue the staff blamed it on me and did not apologize or feel bad at all.

pretty chill atmosphere, definitely a place for young people. we stayed in a private room and i thought they were joking at first but they gave us this ancient skeleton key for the door that was difficult to use. not a great location, the neighborhood isn't very sketchy its just far away from things if you don't have a car. we got tap cards but the metro wasn't great either. would have taken us over an hour to get to the beach or other places we wanted to go.

you don't even get what you pay for. the communal kitchen was always dirty. the entire house smelled like urine and weed.  male workers came into female dorms without even knocking (it happen to all of us staying in the dorm, they came in when my roommate was getting dressed).  there are  no lockers, rooms don't have locks (everything is open, no keys), no curtains (not even in the restroom).  i've been to hostels around the world, i never thought the usa one would be so disappointing.

sit by the pool or deep in it; the staff is friendly, and unlike in many other places i stayed they actually want to be here doing what they do.    some guests are possible transplants to la others are just travelers, so you have the right balance. there is also an unwritten code of respect for personal space and privacy, so if you have to work or write that important email, there is the silence and space to do that.    metro is walking distance, and you can go directly to st monica or downtown! :)

it's definitely a hostel worth checking out. friendly and helpful staff and the facilities are just something else. quite a fancy hostel i'd say. better than average breakfast and you even get served. nice pool area with a real possibility to sunbathe so if you're lazy enough or too tired you don't even have to hit the beach necessarily.  price is fair and it feels good to pay for the stay with these guys. the metro station is close by which really makes moving around very easy and convenient .
clean hostel , near the subway, economical place and friendly staff
won't stay here again
perfect place to be located, very easy to get everywhere & such friendly staff. incredible value for money!! 10/10

well, i guess you get what you pay for. unfortunately we were late due to my plane being delayed, so my friend and i were both charged with a  late check-in fee (although we had called before). this fee was stupid- all staff members actually live on the hostel ground and are up, partying all night anyway. the rooms were fine, the beds very comfortable. there were ants everywhere though. you can not lock your belongings. bathrooms were meeh, ok. my friend was put in the wrong room, too.
good place to stay, great atmosphere and only a short walk from metro transport

this place has a great vibe and is very close to la! walking distance to metro. overall a great experience!  i just want to give some tips just about minor things. the outside bathrooms were a bit dirty and not always stocked (toilet paper, no shelf in 1 bathroom). the sink is outside of the 2 bathrooms, and it was very small with no shelf to put your stuff, except for a brick ledge. the shared room we had didn't have a lock, which was a bit concerning. the kitchen was small and unorganized.

the place was disgusting. there were ants all over my bed and next to my bed. no security what so ever. no locks on the doors or lockers to put belongings in. there weren't even blinds on all the windows so any one could look into my room which was severely cramped. toilets were dirty and hard to access. didn't end up staying a single night there, left as soon as i could. couldn't get a refund, staff were rude. book the hostel in santa monica instead and you'll have a lot more value for money.
there are a lot of ants, which irritated me. and few restrooms compared to the number of guests.
great hostel- don't really get the bad reviews. staff are really nice and its great value for money. good breakfast with a lot of choice. great hostel.

bad things:  filthy  in a dodgy neighborhood  no locks on doors or secure places for passport  2.5km from nearest grocery store  literally four inches between beds and no side tables or benches for laying stuff out which meant people left stuff all over the floor  someone stole my scarf and all my food  one room had no privacy at all and was ground floor with no curtains on french window style doors        good things:  solid wifi  good breakfast  tv with some games consoles  pool
great place! free amenities! friendly staff and guests, perfect for traveling artists, musicians, and actors.

staff are very nice and helpful. they clean quite a bit, but the facilities themselves are old and falling apart. showers were disgusting. one leaked constantly and flooded the bath. great location; 15 min walk from the train. no air conditioning can make sleeping difficult in the summer (it looked like some rooms had window units, but not mine). breakfast is pretty good. lots of mosquitoes by the pool. i got bit every night. overall weird vibe. no close stores/alcohol.
i had a amazing time /stay
great atmosphere, having the pool as the social area, only 10 mins walk from the expo metro line. great value, the neighbourhood has many shops in walking distance.

normally staying at an hostel your expectations for cleanliness aren't that high but if you have to pay a $15 dollar fee per person for it you would hope that you would see where that money goes.to begin with their was lice in my bed, yes.every morning i would wake up with bites around my whole body, it wasn' until the my last day that i saw one moving around my sheets, the bathrooms are decent but the showers are disgusting, you can tell that no one has clean those showers with bleach in weeks.

if you're staying in la and want to meet all kinds of beautiful people from around the world then this is the only place to stay. location was great and the mansion itself blew my mind. the pool is amazing and the staff are great. loved it!

saw the reviews on this and was pleasantly surprised when i saw it. swimming pool, cool people, super cheap, breakfast was decent, area was a little dodgy but i walked around at night and lived to tell the tail so it's all good. i left my laptop in my room and didn't get stolen so nothing but good things to say about the place

i was worried i had brought bedbugs back with me for about a month.. saw some beg bug spray left out in room and some people in my room were bit by something.. place was a mess nice staff.. wasn't horrible.. wasn't amazing.. had to walk a few blocks to get a free breakfast..

if you are looking for the nastiest, most ghetto hostel in la, look no further, from sheets with blood, this 3rd world hostel will not disappoint you, come and stay at la's greatest show. from living rooms and other amenities rooms changed to bunk beds, to bathrooms barely accesible. prepare yourself for a thrilling experience of getting into a lottery of who's staying at the 'mansion' and who will be staying at some random unfinished house from a nearby area.

loved the security guard at the front of the street. very kind individual, everyone gave off great vibes.    get some locks!   was totally blown away that not only did the dorms not have locks, but there was no locker option. very unnerving to go to outl all day and have to cross fingers your belongings would be there/untampered with when returning at night.      luckily everyone was great and there were no issues,  with the amount of traffic coming through it only takes 1 bad seed to spoil it all.

it seems lots has been said both positive and negative about this place.  let's start with positive- some staff were very helpful and assisted when an issue arose. pool was inviting. cool old house other guests are good to hang with. breakfast is free and fills a hole. washing is free. the area while appears dodgy locals were really friendly, its safe and close to metro. security on main road too.  neg- some staff not friendly. too few  bathrooms, no locks on rooms.
amazing place! loved staying here. everyone was extremely friendly and the vibe is rad.

the hostel was pictured and marketed far beyond its actual standards. the security was almost next to nothing, with no lockers and no way to lock our rooms. the fact that the toilets were only in some rooms and were 'shared' meant that people kept entering the rooms with toilets. the floor was so dirty, the towels were not washed properly.
felt like home. exactly what needed after 12h flight. staff is very friendly and helpful.
hadi was really nice..
great place with awesome staff and guests, lovely (clean) pool. had a really great time here. not very close to downtown la or the beaches, but it is close to a metro train station though!

my favourite place, honestly is a home away from home. the staff are incredibly friendly (special shout out to hadi who helped us order pizza) lovely atmosphere and great location, near to train station and and bus stops and local food supermarket close by. definitely will stay again
there was no lock in rooms and even in the house.  we smelled a gas from the stove area.  we didn't feel safe.  it smelled like damp and the furnishing wasn't working properly (ie. windows, shower).

door to room was unlocked all of the time.  had a problem with ants in the room and the member of staff we brought the issue up to told us it was our fault for having food in the room (there was no food in the room) anf got somebody to just sweep the ants out. other than that single issue, the hostel was amazing

poor management at this hostel, got placed in another property away from the main house and it's facilities. they didn't mention anything about numerical locks on the front door to the property i was placed in so i'm glad i didn't stay out too late and get locked out. just all around an unpleasant but liveable experience. very unorganized process and little to no explanation of things. would not recommend or stay here again.
the staff were nice enough i guess, but they moved us to another property riddled with problems. friend of mine even for a bad skin infection from the bed. would not recommend to anyone.

a very pleasant place. with a very laidback staff and an welcoming atmosphere. definitely  good for the backpacker and a younger crowd. access to a nice swimming pool and a relative close distance to the metro that can take you in to downtown was a big plus.

you do get you money's worth here. $35 a night for decent sleeping quarters, walk in showers, they serve breakfast for you, they have a pool, and 10 minutes from train. the downsides were the atmosphere (guests and staff were somewhat reserved and doing their own thing; no events here) and the hostel is open door as in they don't lock the doors. even though it is in a college town, in a family neighborhood, and is claimed to be safe i would have felt more comfortable with it being more secure.
fun, fond memories of the old days of radio, an eclectic site, with parking the biggest difficulty.  for the money, it was fantastically good, at $ 22 a night
staff members are kind and the laundry is for free.

between hosteworld and anderson estates my booking was completely messed up   i got a email from anderson to let me know that even though i had a booking confirmation i was charged a shared room rate for a private room which is what i booked.. a private room. after many emails i was still not guaranteed the private room even though i was aled to pay a higher price which i was prepared to do. i also called them ten times with no answer. when i arrived there on the day there was no private room ac

clean, friendly staff, awesome pool.. if any extra, staff shares their staff meals with you too..thats a bonus! besides that, its evident they try to accomodate you to the best of their resources and capabilities.. to all visiting backpackers, wash your used dishes immediately please. it's counterproductive for the staff who cleans, when you leave dishes in the sink and you complain about roaches etc..  otherwise, all's fine and dandy...

this hostel is perfect for  people who want to meet other travellers and hang out together, very communal atmosphere, everyone is very friendly.  if your are after more luxury / private accomodation this might not be for you, but if you want meet people have some drinks this is your place.  wifi is good in certain spots, very close to train station which takes you straight downtown. and the breakfast is amazing too.  had a great time here 😊.

definitely a solid place to stay. walk to the train wasn’t too long. pool wasn’t very clean (leaves and stuff), but it was also april so 🤷🏼‍♀️.  the dog in the lobby was the best part. she was perfect.  the kitchen was really small in the place i stayed. there was only 1 bathroom for like 15 people.  overall, i probably wouldn’t stay here again but i enjoyed it fine while there.

the best: free breakfast and laundry service, you can swim in the pool, the staff is friendly.    the worst: security, someone stole my personal towel. i know: it's just a towel but could had been a jewel or anything else...
i had a nice peaceful stay would definitely go back
the hostel's in a lovely area very close to the metro line. breakfast every morning was yum! and it has a savage pool ... and lots of great staff (hadi

they claim about a gap between their system and hostelworld. i booked a 4 bed room, the first night i get a bed at a 10 bed room, and the remaining nights at a 6 bed room. it is not critical, but if you booked something you expect that in return.    the neighborhood it is not the best, but it is okay.     pros:   -breakfast  -pool  -employees really friendly

they don't have any key for the entrance of the property (any person can get into and nobody will ask anything).no lockers anywhere. to get in/out  the common areas you have to cross the room of 6 people (poor them, no privacy at all!). my 1st day they took all my luggage while i wasn't in the building for "maintenance" and left in the office. and they charged me $15 more for "maintenance"  although everything was included in the price. although hostelworld don't mention it, they took it anyways

i prefer not to have bulldogs roaming the premises.  i also found one guest to be particularly invasive of my sense of well-being.  (a little too much like the bulldogs.)  the poolhouse based manager was consistently considerate and softspoken in a way that very much served the interest of a customer-facing organization.  i had my own set of planned (and unplanned) events, so i did not network with guests.  good, but be discerning, have a backup plan to avoid 'reality show' nightmare.
i was asked to wake up while sleeping and get out of my bed while the room was searched. then i was asked to empty my pockets.   how humiliating

this hostel is great. the rooms are nice, the people are nice, the complimentary breakfast is great.  there is a big swim pool. you just can't ask for more than that.      very clean too.     i put 5/5 for security, despite the regretable lack of lockers ( i never understood why some dorm doesn't have lockers. aren't they quite easy and cheap to build from square bookcase + adding little doors and lock ? ) , because it feels extremely safe here.       highly recommand.

the bathrooms and showers specifically need a good bleaching to get rid of moldy residues. that was pretty gross. was a bit intrusive with people walking through rooms at all hours of the night  when people are trying to sleep. there should be hours when these doors are locked to prevent this from occurring. from 2300-0600 would be good times to enforce this.

in all honesty, i met some truly unworthy people here. while the hostel was okay, i still felt uncomfortable at many moments. the staff weren't but really tentative to the needs of the guests and many times new guests would come to me seeking help with things that the staff should've been taking care of. i would like to say thanks to george, beatrice, mr. tony, barbara, abel and jesus for their great service and friendship during kyng stay! they took the time to actually speak and acknowledge us
the anderson estates provides value for money. for $25 per night i was able to get a free breakfast, free lunch, and access to an outdoor pool. the staff are friendly and nice and the place is tidy.
