our ensweet was the only one working for around 20 ppl. they were walking through our room at all hours. some didn't even knock. the breakfast was yummy and staff were nice.
breakfast was absolutely amazing!! more of a halfway house rather than for travellers. other than that, truly enjoyed it!

the images shown here were't even close to reality. we were made to stay in a cottage outside the main mansion. we were assigned an 8 bed room although we had booked a 4 bed room. the reason given to us was that the hostel was overbooked since they do not have any way to limit the number of bookings.place is old, not well maintained, and shady. hostel staff was inefficient and breakfast never started on time. someone was sleeping on the couch in our lounge on one night. no lockers. roms dnt lock

great place to stay, made a lot of new friends from all over the world. free breakfast and wifi, and water too whenever you want. also you get to live in a piece of history, and they have really friendly dogs.

we booked to stay for two weeks, however ended up leaving after three hours. we arrived and were taken to an office where no one seemed to be working, and they didn't seem too interested in checking us in. once we had paid we were told we wouldn't be staying in the mansion in a four bed room, but were taken to the 'overflow' house in an eight bed room. it felt dirty and the atmosphere was very uncomfortable. they said we will get a refund, i have chased them up after two weeks and nothing.

this hostel has the potential to be beautiful, but our experience was definitely far from this. the room smelt unpleasant and was not clean. there was mould on the bathroom floor and it was never cleaned during the day. the rooms smelt of weed and had no security, lockers or anything of the sort. the security was the worst part and we felt uncomfortable leaving our possessions there during the day. the inside of the manor is quite nice. the staff were not very professional or helpful.

the pictures from this place are very deceiving. when we pulled up to the location, the mansion looked very sketchy and torn-down. the facility was not kept in maintenance. we had to go through the mansion (when i say mansion, just picture a huge house with paint chipping off and creepy people staring at your from their window), to get to the office space. the staff in the office also seemed very sketchy & super weird. we had to go through another room to get to our room which seemed really off.

felt my belongings were safe, but there are no lockers in the rooms.  metro stop is close-by. staff is cool and keen to help.  bad points:   - difference between hostelworld booking system and on site room allocation (never happened before)  - one of the rooms is kind of a preferred passage by guests of other rooms, and some of the guests used to leave the room door open while smoking next to it    likely to come back - a few improvements (see above) would make this place a "must go".
great atmosphere, i like the location and i have extended my stay.
great place to stay,good facilities and lovely people! although still not sure about broccoli for breakfast!!!  but great time had and would definitely stay again!! 😊

the anderson estates was great! it made my first hostel experience the best!! i made so many new friends in my house complex. and they serve breakfast in the morning if you get up early enough to get some;)
very accommodating during a busy weekend in the area. polite staff, youthful atmosphere, always something going on. wouldn't recommend staying extended periods longer than 2 weeks.
good place to stay for cheap when visiting or even moving to la. free breakfast, good wifi and close to metro line. would reccomend.

my only night at the hostel was just traumatizing. my dorm was outside the main property and, unlike it (where the normal backpackers like me were), it was populated by over 50years-old men who actually lived there permanently.  toilets and kitchen were dirty, messy and insalubrious. the whole hostel constantly smelled like weed.  i  left after the first night, mainly because i felt totally unsafe, and asked for a refund which fortunately was done.   breakfast is good and the staff is very kind.

this hostel is more than just a building. the vibe is chilled and super friendly. amazing (free) hot breakfast and coffee every morning. people want to be there and hang out. i loved having breakfast in the garden, sat chatting with people from all over the world, sharing stories and making plans. the staff are all down-to-earth, great people who are up for a laugh too! this will definitely be my accommodation on my next visit to la, for sure! my only problem was a lack of corkscrew! ha!

the attendant took me on a car chase trying to find an under-aged girl who was supposed to stay there but rose his "suspicious teen runawa" flag. its late, its dark, im in his vehicle. he said he needed to drive me over a half a mile to the house id be staying in away from my friend and our car. no house keys. nowhere to lock up my belongings. unsafe doesnt even begin to describe it. i chose not to stay, got a partial refund. that night, 3 blocks away there was a gun fight and people were shot.
it is a great place. i loved every moment of it. will definately go there again.
amazing value for money - the staff were gr8 espec hattie and barney. the piano was gr8 addition too and the breakfast was possibly the best ive ever had.

interesting place, most of the staff was great very helpful and easy going, some were a little selfish when it came to making noise... also a lot of the guests were very inconsiderate of other guest being rude or loud in the bedrooms or blow drying hair in commen areas etc. staff could of done more to help make guests be more considerate, breakfast was lovely just sometimes started late, ants problems, lots of non travelers just hanging out which is cool i guess overall ok experience good value
pro: location was ideal, right by the metro line which can take you pretty much anywhere. clean enough and breakfast was okay.  con: no house lock or lockers.

i really liked staying there; especially, i spent time with jazzey (the nice pitbull)... staff are really nice and friendly... you can meet people almost from allover the world... i did not like that there is no lockers although everything is safe. i had my laptop, and it was in my room most of the time, but if you have the option, do not bring it.    the breakfast was pretty nice, and they offer coffee and tea most of the day. there is a pool and you can use it anytime before 11pm.

positives  - lovely staff  - pool  - free breakfast  - very flexible if you want a longer stay  negatives   - one morning i got up at 8 just to go to the bathroom and came back to find my bed had been stripped. i was staying another night so couldn't understand the reason for this. the sheets weren't replaced for another couple of hours. also they took my pillowcase which i take on my travels.  - the room is cramped with beds, there were 11 beds in my room and 4 plug sockets.   - wifi not great

the property is unable to be locked, has no security and no lockers for valuables. there are people who live at the "hostel" who leave everything a mess. from having their belongings all over the dorm room, to not washing dishes after they cook or eat and leaving the shared bathrooms messy.  we were driven 3 blocks from the main house to our "hostel", you have to walk back and forth for breakfast or use of computers or pool. people who live there have 0 regard for guests sleeping or anything els

when you arrive you first have to change the location to another a few streets away. but the breakfast is in the first one. so you have to move. the hostel is dirty and the kitchen/living room is combined to the bedroom> might get loud in the middle of the night, whether the others want to cook (as they did when we've been there).
it was great. i thin one of the best place at la. the staffs and boss was very friendly. i like a lot

couldn't recommend this place more! it's cheap, awesome free breaky, so close to the metro and the staff are incredible. they accommodated us moving locations just so we could be closer to the pool and had so much info on everything la. if we are ever back in la this is where we will be!
awesome place to stay

special stay at this hostel. it's a mansion turned hostel managed by a group of cool people. mr anderson and the staffs are very helpful and friendly. location is not exactly town-centered but not far from the town (esp with car) about 10 mins walk to the nearest metro station, which are about 4-5 stations from the downtown. not very secured as compared to other hostel because there's no lock for the main gate / door. neighbourhood is residential area so it's quite safe.

i enjoyed my stay here and loved the breakfast.  i would of gave it a higher rating if the bathroom in my room were cleaner.  also my bed got infected with ants on my last day there.  if you could please clean the room and spray bug spray on the edges of the wall.

people in the hostel tend to do a lot of noise at nights, they don&#39;t really keep it quite at 11pm as they say. the rooms are not that clean, the floor was pretty dusty.  it&#39;s not in a center location, but you have a metro station within 10 minutes walk. it&#39;s not close to restaurants or places to go out at night. but it&#39;s a good area, lots of big houses, no people on the streets.  brakefast was nice, crew was nice too.  i guess it&#39;s a good value for your money.

this is false advertisement. there are no private rooms for 4 people available and the staff stated that this was hostel worlds fault not theirs (doubt it). the place was filthy. the staff were not helpful unless you spoke to mr.anderson.  there was no locks! it was close to the public transport but not worth it! i would not recommend this place at all!!
provides awesome breakfast! staff is awesome and so friendly!! my group got upgraded for free to a private room for the entire weekend! very fun and comfortable environment. totally recommend!
unlike the reviews on the web, security was not an issue. the environment is friendly and the staff is nice

at first, our first impressions of the hostel were positive. our welcome to the hostel was very warm - the staff were very professional and relaxed, and the process of checking in was very simple. location is okay.    as our weekend continued, our experience worsened. security is atrocious (no lockers at all). miscommunication with the staff led to one of the guys in our group to lose his bed in the middle of the night.     we wouldn't recommend this hostel to any traveler.

this is a very unique hostel. the location is very conveniently located close to a metro station. guests and staff were cool and the breakfast is free, but if you plan to stay longer, you will soon be bored by the same breakfast every day. but the value for money is unbeatable for the dorm beds. my only concern would be that theoretically everybody could walk in anytime, since the doors are open all the time and there is no possibility to lock up your stuff.
awesome hostel, great atmosphere and helpful staff, the only thing thats kinda strange is they dont have lockers. but overall, i reccomend it.
awful. no lockers no security. far away from anything interesting in a horrible area. in a run down old home.

very poor security, our doors didn't lock. some sleeping areas are in the open and there's nowhere to lock your things. the place was not the cleanest. for people who are not familiar with la the area may be a bit concerning.

on a budget it is a great place to stay, however the security is lacking a lot, do not leave any valuables as during our 4 day stay there were two cases of stealing, the breakfast is great value for money and the pool is a bonus.

i was in california to drop my daughter off at college.  i stayed here.  slept well after my 22-hr drive, and loved the place! other guests were quite civil, and the boss - mr anderson was a courteous, level-headed, and excellent host. yes, i would love to visit again, soon!

felt unsafe with no security. anyone could walk into the hostel and the rooms. the top bunks had no ladder to get on top. the room wasn&#39;t clean. the mattresses had holes in them and wasn&#39;t clean
really nice place,never had any problems with the room and breakfast was really nice too
it was great hostel after my nightmare in camelot inn. sam, the owner is a great guy.
it&#39;s ok for the price you pay there. i only recommend it if you don&#39;t have any other option.

there was a communication problem since we had booked a private room and were expecting privacy since we thought we paid more than we would have for a shared room. in the end we got a room for two nights which we were able to lock but it took a while. then we had to move into another room. the bathroom that came with that room had not been cleaned and there were used toiletries and towels in there. please check with the owner which rooms are available and whether the they match the offer on hw.c

location is okay given how big la is, staff were helpful and friendly enough and there was breakfast every morning (which was not the best and exactly the same every day). hoewever, security was atrocious. no locks on outside doors or room doors, and people who did have a private room with a lock on the door were forbidden from locking it! no lockers that i saw either, so you&#39;re constantly considering that any random stranger could walk into your room and steal your stuff.
not at all like the pictures on display. terrible beds, poor management (alloted one bed to multiple people) only decent part was breakfast. avoid at all cost.

the location, although is a quite and residential area, is pretty far from the main places of interest in la (hollywood, beverly hills and santa monica). you can arrive by public transport (10 min walking form expo/western station), but it is not a hostel i might recommend for doing tourism in la area for a few days, unless you have a car (but, i remind you, la traffic can be horrible).  the ambient was chill. cool and youth staff. the pool is probably the best of the hostel.

the breakfast is awesome and it&#39;s around 10 mins walk to metro ( a bit scary to walk at night ) . some of the staffs are very nice and fun to talk too. the room i stayed though was pretty dirty but all the other rooms were so clean and i stayed on the 2nd floor with only one bathroom in the other room so sometimes i couldn&#39;t use it so i have to walk to the pool just to use the bathroom but i enjoyed the stay. it&#39;s really affordable and worth it. + main gate was never locked but it&#39;s safe.
i have had my best time there and my vacation in cali was fab  the place is nice and the people too , i hope come back.soon

good facilities and great breakfast but little security with doors being open onto the main street and no lockers and keys for rooms. everyone was friendly and helpful and me and my friends enjoyed our stay here. metro was close enough to hostel to get around la easily and parking on the road was fine as well. films in the evening with snacks were offered as well. good for price but don't have high expectations. although free breakfast was amazing!

the people who run and work in the hostel are so nice and everyone who stays there is so friendly. the free breakfast you get every morning is amazing especially the waffles i need that recipe!! you can easily get to the tram which takes you into downtown and it&#39;s a couple of stops from lots of museums. i would defiantly stay here again
good for price but lacking in security for personal belongings. other guests had things stolen from.bags whilst here.
pretty good place. close to the metro. nice swimming pool. great breakfast. free towels. free bottle water. free washing machine. amazing !!! i will stay here again when i come back to los angeles.

the cottage is the main property with the pool, free breakfast, big screen, and dj. the ensuite is three blocks away, consisting of four buildings, but was unfortunately under construction during my stay, which started at 8am. there was also an ant infestation, mainly in the kitchen, and only 1/4 stove tops worked. and parking was competitive/limited.    everything else was great! two miles from shopping strips, grocery, and clothing stores. can see the hollywood sign from the ensuite!
best accommodation i&#39;ve visited lately :) great staff, wicked pad, pretty much unreal. i will recommend to friends. thanks !!

a wonderful, old, historic, very nice place to stay.  mr eddie anderson is a wonderful man.  just one small thing bothered me ...... rooms cannot lock.  although it is very safe. otherwise, i will sure stay there again.  and i give them 100%.

there is no security at this hostel at all! neither the house, nor the room, nor the bath room could be locked and there were no lockers available to rent. that the hostel is in fact a mansion with a pool does not compensate this. location is ok for la with a metro stop nearby but staying in that neighbourhood with no security was uncomfortable. everything usually looked clean, but it would be great if shelves and cupboards were dusted regularly, so that they could actually be used for storage.

anderson estates is not a hostel in the typical sense. there is the main mansion where the pool/yard is located. as well, mr. anderson owns several houses in the area where bunk beds have been set up. some of the beds are set up in bedrooms, but bunk beds are also set up in open areas with zero privacy.    there is absolutely zero security! the house and bedroom could not be locked, and there were no storage lockers for your items. considering the sketchy neighborhood, this is very worrying.

the free breakfast was great always left full. location is a good as you&#39;re going to get in la, close to the metro line and close to a big supermarket. the staff didn&#39;t really help or hinder it seemed like it was run by a group of mates rather than a actual staff. best price you&#39;re going to get in la

everyone is so friendly! great place to meet other travellers. nicely prepared free breakfast! the location is convenient for tourist attractions in different directions. i would definitely recommend this place.
it was good :)

+extremly nice spot with swimming pool!  +best place to meet amazing people from all horizons  +breakfast is amazing  +mr. anderson and his team are really nice, and offer a lot of extras (cutting gopro movies service!)    -secondary houses very poorly is

one of the strangest hostels i've ever stayed at. part hostel - part construction site where the mansion owner provides free accomodation for those working on his house. these individuals drink most nights and can be very loud and abusive. wouldn't reccomend staying here, but it is fairly close to the expo/western metro station.
it was good overall but the first day they put me to sleep at the living room on a horrible air mattress and the wi-fi doesn&#39;t work very well.
i have chosen it because it was quite cheap, but when i came i felt like a king :)  you have pool, great breakfast, kitchen, wifi, showers, nice staff and 2 cute dogs. what do you need more?

we booked two gender specific dorm rooms so were pleasantly surprised when we ended up in a private dorm.  we were in one of the secondary houses (not the main mansion). beds were comfy and had a shared ensuite, although other people accessed it via our room. there was next to no security! door to house was never locked and normally open, couldn&#39;t lock our bedroom door from the outside and there were no lockers. breakfast at the mansion house was nice and there was a pool use. near metro stop
nice place with a pool, great staff, good price, great breakfast!

they are still under construction.   so thay made noisy sound every morning.   there is no 24hrs front desk service.   the first day, we got the temperory room that there is no privacy as well as many people passed by our room to get their room and bathroom.  second day, there is no ladder on our bed going up. even if i asked staff already, thay didnt fix.  there are some aunts in my bed and i saw a cockroach bathroom.   i felt scary near hostel. the price was cheap but not wealthy.

i have stayed in hostels all over the world . i can truthfully say this is one of the best places i have stayed and certainly one of the best values . a clean room, clean bathroom, excellent wi-fi, a good breakfast, a customer useable computer and general atmosphere makes this one of the best deals you will find in los angeles ever . i highly recommend this hostel and certainly plan to stay there again when i am passing through los angeles again.l.p.

probably the cheapest place to stay in la. free laundry and breakfast in the morning! definitely a college party-type atmosphere, so prepare for that, especially if staying in a dorm room. staff (and other guests) could be more considerate (what's with continually leaving the door to the living room wide open and blasting the tv at all hours, especially when people are trying to sleep???). mr. anderson himself is a great guy. location isn't so good—near usc—but that's the nature of la.

free breakfast, swimming pool and a large garden area are all bonuses on top of a comfortable hostel close to a metro station. the beds are comfortable and the bathroom areas are clean. however the kitchen area is gross towards the end of the day and there are no lockers or even locks on the bedroom doors. also the front door is left open 24/7 so theoretically anyone could walk in. luckily i had no problems with my things while i was there though.

i made a good choice to stay here.  to think i paid $20 to stay in a mansion, where hollywood stars used to visit, including bob hope and marilyn monroe according to mr anderson.  great breakfast, much better than all the other hostels i have stayed in the us.  the staff was excellent.   facilities include a large pool which i hope to use next time if the weather is warmer.

the stay here was awesome, although i think people, especially other females, need to know to be a little careful in the area. i had quite a few people around la tell me to be careful in the area and not keep my phone out while walking around because people have been known to swipe them.   other than that i had no problems. laid back with a pool, 10 min walk from the train and buses, takes about an hour to get to most places which is common when taking transportation anywhere in la.

worst hostel ever. i was coming from out of town for work and knew id have a late check in. called 2 numbers more than 4 times with no answer or voicemail to leave message. emailed to ask about the late check in and they said it was fine. i got there and no one was there to check me in. i stayed for three days without checking in. there are no locks on any doors. communication is absolutely terrible & none of the staff know whats going on and are unable to help even when they try. complete mess

i stayed in the private room so security wasn&#39;t a problem. but the stay was very nice. wifi runs decently, the walk to the metro is about 15 minutes though so get ready for that. overall it was a good stay, i didn&#39;t have the free breakfast, but i know they have it so thats also a plus.

very strange place. didn&#39;t feel comfortable at all. booked for 3 nights but only stayed 2 because i felt unsafe. no locks on the front door. no lockers in the rooms. the second night a really creepy man came into our room around 10.30pm. the staff said it was too late to check him in and just let him into our room without knowing who he was. i didn&#39;t want to stay in the same room as he, and luckily the staff did understand and asked him to leave. breakfast is ok.wifi ok.close to public transport

the anderson estates is definitely one of the stranger hostels i&#39;ve stayed at however it certainly has a lot of positives, the staff are really helpful, i met great people there, free breakfast and laundry and you even have a swimming pool and gym equipment. negatives are i didn&#39;t feel security was very tight, it was like anyone could come and go whenever plus the location isn&#39;t central at all although near a metro stop. would still recommend as it is the cheapest place in l.a

not bad for the price. has a pool & the people are friendly. but people need to learn to knock on your door not just bust in on you. not the best location for site seeing. most of the time you&#39;ll need to call a cab or use uber/lyft. but overall it was a good experience. i&#39;d stay again.  bostonbyrd
i was doing laundry when i went to check on it someone was in the process of taking it out.
10 plus if you or anyone you know needs a reliable place for what ever reason i highly recommend staying there very trust worthy.

don't let the number decide your trip - the value of this place far outweighed the issues i did have with this place. if i was ever staying in la again i would hands down stay here every time. but: security is lacking. no keys, no lockers. bring a cable/bag lock! the staff are actually great but management is a bit weird... it feels like there's no permanent workers so no one really knows some things  overall its the best hostel for your money in la, but definitely needs a bit more work!

nice place, but is not a mansion, the rooms are in a little house near to the swimming pool. the staff was volunteers from france very bad face, the breakfast is bad food, the only good is wafles but only 1 for person.   the please doesnt have lockers, and everybody pass for your room.  the doors doesnt have lock.  also the staff put the tv in the night too high.    the neighbourhood is nice and you have the metro close.
beautiful  structure but not very clean.dust below beds.  reception staff not   very  friendly

this is my first experience with a hostel. i&#39;ve met some nice and interesting people at anderson estates. i believe there should be more involvement on a managerial level. the breakfast is always great. there is prompt service if any needs arise. i have found it humbling and appreciated the home.

it&#39;s a great place to stay: free breakfast, friendly staff, a pool and very clean rooms. i travel a lot even though i am los angeles based here. it&#39;s comforting to know that i have a &#34;home&#34; to stay at that is not only affordable, it&#39;s a great to be in. i enjoy the place and appreciate the location where i can drive to work within a reasonable distance.  if i have any concerns, joanne will take care of it. i know that i am listened to and valued as a guest. i stay here often. thank you!
this is a nice hostel, with great friendly staff. the only downside is that as a solo traveller it is harder to meet people there.

the property in itself is extraordinary, and the amenities are very good and free. however the staff could be a bit unorganized, and they do not have lockers in the rooms.   also the location isn&#39;t exactly central, but it is however close to a metro station.   parking is nice as well.   i enjoyed my stay there, and would recommend.

the people were awesome and so was the breakfast! it&#39;s hard to tell who&#39;s on the staff and who isn&#39;t but if you ask around you can always get help from a friendly staff member. if you get drunk with the french people you&#39;ll probably end up getting thrown into the pool... all in good fun! this place was great!

bit of a strange vibe, and it's very much in the suburbs. close to train line though and the neighbourhood is alright. facilities made available to dorm customers are pretty average - i kind of felt like i was intruding tbh, though people were all nice, it's less travellers and more people in between houses or moving to la that seem to stay in the dorms. nice looking pool, comfy beds and everything cleaned daily, can't comment on the breakfast because i'm vegan but people seemed to enjoy it.

the place looked dark and uninviting.  as we walked the facility we felt unsafe and concerned about how easy it was for people to come in and out of the property.      we expected to see travelers like ourselfs but instead we saw a lot of young people just hanging around and it looked like they had been living there for a while.  the place looked like a college dorm after a house party.      we want our deposit back because what was been advertised is not what we witnessed.

the anderson estates hostel is a beautiful place to visit.     when i arrived i wasnt enable to check in, but some employees (there are volunteers from workaway) did help me to get a bed. everybody was telling me that the breakfast is good, but im used to do a dutch breakfast.. so it wasnt good for me. it is very sweet and i didnt like the way they serve breakfast. the location is good, like everything in the us... you have to travel a long distance. after all its a good and &#34;cheap&#34; hostel.
it was confusing trying to utilize this hostel - bathrooms were not clearly marked, one of the pool showers was lacking a shower curtain.
i was really happy with my stay at the anderson estates, you have everything what you need. nice room, quiet and great breakfast. i would definitely recommend this place to anyone.

wow! one of the best hostels in the world! it's five times larger than most hostels, with many living rooms and houses and hangout places, gym equipments, free self-laundry, two kitchens for guests, tvs, and a playstation. our 8 bunk-beds room and private bathroom is cleaned daily. i had a free delicious breakfast buffet every morning while watching tv in a big dining room in front of a beautiful swimming pool. the staff is very nice and friendly. highest luxury for lowest cost! need i say more?

when i got there every one was really nice. i stayed in the 9-bed mixed dorm for two weeks, and even had the room to myself a few nights. there's two huge houses, lots of couches, very comfortable. right next to the metro train, which was very convenient. the place was so big that it had 3 different wifi passwords, but they all had strong signals, and i was  streaming all the european soccer games to my phone no problem. they leave the coffee and tea out all day, and the free breakfast was great
all in all a nice hostel.. only thing is that its a bit fare away from everything..
very good
i enjoyed my stay at the anderson estates. the staff is friendly, excellent breakfast, and the other guests we&#39;re great to live with. i will definitely stay here again!

when you think of a hostel, you think of a happy, welcoming, relaxing, affordable experience. well this place did that for me, i have been to so many hostels in my life and never one like this. i've seen the reviews on here, and some have said the neighborhood is bad and others have said the staff is mean. since i hwvhwve been here i have been given the upmost respect by every single individual on the facilities from the staff to the guests.

amazing loved my stay the dog is funny , staff are great and friendly i stayed in the 9 bed mix dorm and at some points it was all to myself, you have to stay here there's a pool and the breakfast well hot bacon sausage and egg with waffles covered in chocolate cream and strawberries .... it's very much a hidden gem ... oh did i not mention the price yet !  i payed $20/£14 and stayed for 9 nights cheap supermarket 10 min stroll ... why are you still reading this ... book up don't be a fool! ☺️
great hostess!
had a wonderful the place is clean , the staff are great and the breakfast is awesome ! won't find anyplace offering the same in la
stayed here on multiple different occasions. located close to metro line. great backyard with pool. friendly staff.
a bit unprofessional staff, but sweet!! they make you really nice breakfast every morning and it's near the metro
we booked it for 9 dollars a night and it was doubled price we had to pay!!!!

this is not a hostel. no lockers and doors are open all day and night. near the most dangerous district of la. unprepared staff. many guests/residents trying to get jobs in la. room with dirty carpet. worsened my allergy. good breakfast.
they told me the site was faked and stole my money , they kicked out me and insulted me , very impolite

the internet didn't match with the booking they made on their own. we booked for 10 night but couldn't get more than 2. they kicked people out same day as us because a big groupe were the day after. we waited for one and a half hour on the receive they promised me the day before.   we haven't no stairs to our bed and than have to climb up every night.   the lock on the restroom didn't work and the shower was grose.     the breakfast in the morning was excellent - so good!!

it was more of a home for people wanting to move to la. staff weren't very helpful with tourist attractions or pu lic transport knowledge. had to figure it out on my own. breakfast was good, though self service would've been quicker

t is more upscale than most of the motels in the los angeles area, close to shopping and practically everything required for a comfortable life style. for the price i am paying for 4 bed/room this place is preferable to anywhere else i would rather be. the room mates are polite, considerate and happy when we gather around mrs. anderson. i will stay here as long as i want.  there is also a big beautiful swimming pool where anyone is allowed, a full staff to serve breakfast and drinks and 24 hour r

very great place! near from the city center, you sleep inside a big american house : big rooms, kitchen, laundry (also for free!), a rest room (sofa, tv), swimming pool in the garden, two clean bathrooms for dormitory. the mattress in dormitory are comfortable. the breakfast is included (egg, bacon, pankake, strawberry, coffe, orange juice,...). great for backpackers. the owner can offer you a job inside the guesthouse so that you can stay longer witthout paying your room!
cheap and cheerful but in a very dodgy area. easy access to the metro though
lovely place, great breakfast included and really nice staff. would definetely recommend it to others. and the price is soooo good!

make no mistake... this is not a hostel! 1) the west adams district of l.a. is a crime-ridden, drug-infested ghetto, where every house has bars on the windows and the nearest bus stop is 2km away. 2) there are no lockers, and the bunk beds are crammed less than a meter between each other. 3) god knows what property you'll be placed in. the tiny house i stayed at had 22 beds and only one bathroom. 4) forget about meeting tourists. most everyone are actor wanna-be's or indigent locals.

i missed my flight from berlin to lax, so sadly, i'm unable to leave a cogent review. but i would like to think they are good people. this is why i'm forced to leave an "average" report, having no other idea of what to suggest.

the room that i was have just 2 beds with a bathroom, and all of my floor could use the bathroom. however, i didn't like the idea of all the floor use the bathroom, because i was with my friend in the room, and i thought that this bathroom it was just for us. i suggest to do a bathroom for the others rooms or make the bathroom of this room just for the room. also, i didn't like the cleanliness of the bathroom, because we stayed for 5 days, and the bathroom wasn't cleaned any time.

i never received a key that worked for the front door while at the hostel. several nights i was locked out of the building, and had to ask to be let in.     the younger staff from other countries were great -- very nice, and accommodating. some of the older staff seemed a bit curt with guests.
fantastic staff, friendly and helpful

nice mansion,relaxed,feels like at home,tv,pool,kitchen,close to metro/train station,great to stay in groups,atmosphere a bit boring for one traveler,of course it depends of currently residing guests.staff not so attentive,also managing system with beds for guests disorderly,feels like you're part of the staff and they can move you to another room suddenly when they want to,there is no any cattle to prepare tea/coffee,which is strange..
it was great! thanks guys for everything! hope to go again soon.
extremly dissapointing. staff ignored me totaly. this is not a backpacker hostel at all, more like a long term housing. would really not recomend to travellers.

this was an odd sort of hostel, in that it was segregated into a few different houses. the "office" was a house across the road from the main building, and often there wasn't anyone there to ask questions. they also don't provide any maps or visitor guids or tourist info.   i had to ask about 3 times to have clean sheets put on the bed, the management doesn't seem very well structured.  otherwise it was a very nice place to stay.

i have been staying at two different locations, the rochester house is under going some upgrades and i look forward to seeing the place when their finished. the second house is very nice and the other people staying here are friendly and considerate of the other guests. i am moving to another one of the many other properties that they own and if its as nice as the other two i've been in then i look forward to staying there.  its nice to know that they have so many different locations.

the hostel is nice, we stayed in a 6 beds room, the room was really big but the bathroom was in another room (occupied, so it was awkward). but people were nice.   and the location was awful too far from everything, 30 minutes by taxi and more than 1 hour by public transportation.
very good hostel and very kind staff!!!  see and you won't be disappoint.
it's a really nice place. it's a little bit caotic, but there are just on the beginning. if there are done the place is probably really nice. the breakfast is the best! just awesome!
there is no brackfast in correct time, i booked a room with 4 beds but when i arrived there the room had 8 beds, local reform. gates open 24 hours and there is no security.

they lied about their facilities. first of all there wasn't 3 meals a day. they place is still under going it's refurbishment so there is no pool nor is the rooms as they looked in the pictures (now they have been updated) the kitchen was a mess, nothing was there for you to use.     management was rarely home. was fed up answering the door to strangers wanting to speak to the  . the front door wasn't locked at night. extremely unsafe especially in jefferson, a rough area.

this hostel was nothing like advertised on the website, the actual hotel was being refurbished so we were directed to a grubby little house nearby which didn't have pillows or breakfast and was generally very run down. we were then told there was aistake in the booking process and we actually had to pay four times the advertised price! needless to say we left quickly and found somewhere else. do not stay here.

i booked this hostel for the price, but when we check-in they told us they was a mistake with the price and it sould be double price , so we stayed 1 night and then moved downtown where it was same price .
bed bugs! the hostel is nice enough but when you pay $40 bloody dollars for 1 night (the most i’ve ever spent on a hostel and i’ve travelled the world over) . but...... no..... great
lovely place to stay indeed. definitely would return.
i had a great time the staff was amazing and super kind ill definitely go back sometime thank you so much guys
i would avoid this hostel.

podshare is interesting. the bed is super comfy and i like the pod space you have to yourself. the working space is a bit annoying. it is quiet time 10pm-10am - which isn't good if you have time difference to your work country and the coffee was not easy to make so i found myself out in coffee shops a lot. the showers were good quality, clean and warm. the toilets were tiny. there are lockers and you can get a lock. you will meet very interesting people and have a great time and an amazing sleep

the hostel is completely different to what i've experienced so far. that's not to say it isn't a great place, because it can get really cool. the location is fine, relatively close to union station, but it can be far away from attractions like west hollywood. do not expect the typical bagel-with-something kind of breakfast, but there are cereals, milk, and other stuff in the kitchen. elvina, the owner, was super cool and took the guests to fun halloween activities, she puts a lot of love in it.

location is good and close to union station but it's very noise cuz it's close to road, you can hear people screaming, police car warning sound (very loud), car horn, busy traffic noise.  the lady owner a little rude sometime, she doesn't provide enough information how to unlock the door at night, you have to ask and she didn't seem happy to let you know the password. free breakfast but it's only the cornflake or stuff like that. toilet stall is very small, knee hit the stall door.
ちょっと変わった感じで、最初は戸惑いましたが、居心地よかったです。夜はとても静かでゆっくり休めました。交通機関へのアクセスが少し遠く、周辺の人通りがないため、少し警戒していましたが、特に危ないことはありませんでした。
a bit weird on first. but really great place! recommending :)))
simply sublime. staff were unrivalled along my travels for the most kind people i met. would stay again and again

this is one of the better prices in town it's a place to sleep well. it's not all that bad just the toilet and shower spaces were a tight fit. also the refrigerator fresh water dispenser was very inefficient trickling slowly.  other than those little inconveniences it was a nice stay.
no security at night n alley u walk thru not that well lit parking is poor on street n bums walking around
lovely layout and very clean.

my encounters have been brief, needed a consistent solution for work a few days a week. have travelled overseas often and decided to give this a shot. i usually arrive later in the evening so consider this a night shift review. overall this location is always amazing, clean, quite, and has overall a great vibe to it. everyone has always been friendly no matter their background, ect. people are respectful of your pod and belongings; at night it is quite, definitely recommended. fantastic job!

didnt really love this place too much - it was chosen only for convenience. it isn't in a happening area, there wasn't much atmosphere and the pods are literally all open. i get the idea and think it's great however a small half curtain just to hide the light of others in the night would be really useful.

podshare for sure was the best hostel i have been. different from others hostel, you have your own pod which has a t.v., a lamp, a thing where you can hold your tower a d place your stuffs. i felt very comfortable inside the pot.

great place, great location. i loved having so much space and not being cramped into a normal bunk bed. free tea and coffe which was nice. only downside i thought was the bathrooms could of been a bit bigger and the doors less see through!
brilliant and lovely staff
really wonderful staff and location, but lack of atmosphere and the loos and showers are too small and dingy.  great area, don't be afraid to explore.
pleasant and clean, but not super social and in a bit of a removed location.

everything i hoped it would be an more. podshare has a great vibe and its layout really gets people mingling. facilities are great for what you're paying. i'm a neat freak so i was most worried about it being dirty, it's clean! for people who need their sleep lights out and noise kept to a minimum is enforced around 10-11pm each night. overall a really fun but respectable environment. made some lifelong friends. it won't be my last time at podshare!
loved being walking distance from litle tokyo! veronica is super awesome and friendly!

it's a nice hostel with pleasant smell of pine wood. the reception mr matel is awesome and very polite and helpful. place is clean and well kept. the showers and toilets are super snug though and ear plugs will help sleep better as the traffic can be noisy at night. beds are super comfortable and the pod concept provides more personality to the experience. overall a unique and pleasant experience. loved it!!

overall had a decent stay, when i arrived it took forever to find the hostel. had the tiniest podshare sign i walkedaround for about an hour. the staff when i first arrived was super quiet but did his job, he left then there was a young girl that i didn't even know was the staff. she was out partying with everyone so much that i assumed she was staying in the hostel herself. she barely even talked to me and was very unprofessional. the hostel itself was very nice. wouldn't stay again.
couldn't put a foot wrong. great place and love the fact that it's located in the arts district. slowly becoming part of a mini berlin.

so before going i read the reviews and there was a negative one that was quite concerning. after visiting pod share i have to say there were no negatives. the place was awesome, clean and there are no beds close to the bathroom. everything smelled great. excellent location and a fun environment.

it's ok. beats being homeless. pros: seriously the most comfortable beds i've slept on in my travels. plenty of room in the pod, tv, light, and outlet. although one of the pods is without them...makes me wonder why they haven't fixed it. overall a clean comfortable place, reasonable kitchen, rooms to lounge in.  con: no privacy. the pods are nice but could use a curtain. bathroom is a joke. cramped..absurdly cramped, no privacy, no door to living area. thought i would get tetanus in shower.

podshare has high-quality facilities for the most part, but there were a number of uncomfortable factors. the bathroom facilities are extremely cramped. my pod was virtually in the middle of the room with zero privacy (the check-in "desk" is about three feet away), it had no convenient outlets, and there was no personal locker for valuables. while staff was very friendly, they often weren't around, so the hostel did not feel well run.

it was a great place to stay, it was a very convenient location, and i appreciated the security measures with the door keypads. it wasn't that hard to find free parking, and the beds and common areas were clean and neat. the only minor complaint i had was that the bathroom stalls were quite tiny, so if you sit on the toilet, your legs are pressed against the door. other than that, it was a very minor thing that didn't detract from my overall stay. really, it can't be beat for its price.

i had the only bed without shelf, light, plug, tv but paid full price. no breakfast although stated otherwise and paid for. staff shrugged it off and said only management can do sth. management supposedly had no time. reception, kitchen, bath, lounge and beds all in one room. toilets had no real doors, could hear and smell people pooping from our beds. nasty showers, loud street. been to many hostels, but this place has the worst concept by far. false advertising. be warned, avoid this place!
great place to stay. i loved the fridge with the ice dispenser! i was in la to work and found great cafes to set up my laptop nearby. organic supermarket 5 minutes away.

it was exactly what i wanted.  private bed space, but shared.  very clean, really comfortable, really good feel, helpful staff.  i really loved getting off the plane and coming straight to a place like this to rest and restore.

the place was clean and the pods were very comfy. each pod comes with its own tv, outlet, shelf, and the whole place has a strong wi-fi signal. the main thing i didn't like about it was the facilities. the bathroom/shower area is very small and tight, shared between all the males/females in the whole place. 3 toilets and 2 showers in one very small room for everybody to use. on top of that, when i tried to take a shower there was no hot water. i waited an hour and it still was cold.
the place was clean , comfortable and welcoming . the staff and the other clients were all great ! i will definitely stay here again !

podshare is an interesting idea.   the pods themselves are private from one another, but they are all within the same great room space. it's sort of like having your own treehouse in a giant backyard.   the toilets and showers are cramped, but passable. the kitchen is simple. the upper bunks run warmer than the lowers; grab a fan up in the common area.   the location is absolutely perfect for downtown, and the train station.   i'll stay again, the next time i visit.
interesting concept. a kinda work/sleep space. comfy bunks with individual tv and power points. good food in nearby little tokyo. can walk to downtown.

remarkably clean and well-equipped; great location in the arts district & near downtown; elvina was friendly and helpful and had bangin' food recommendations; not much community (& even a little conflict while i was there) but generally very nice people.

the staff were nice but it wasn't that much of an inviting vibe. the concept is really cool and looks really cool. although my bed was really comfy and the position of the hostel was great the facilities that i needed like wifi and the tv i was auspost to have didn't work 80% of the time.       positive tho best showers ever
very friendly staff, a great experience for my first time staying at a hostel
great place for solo travelers. everyone is respectful.  the facility is clean and quite. the neighborhood is also very quite and safe.
right in the uber hip arts district. very close to little tokyo and dtla. comfortable beds, very clean, very nice hostel-mates and employees. one of the best hostels i've stayed in.

this is a perfect spot to meet new people from various places. the hostel was clean and the smell of wood makes you feel at home. the booking process was simple and easy, i recommend purchasing the $1.00 security fee, i had to change reservation dates and it was a very simple process. i really enjoyed the setup! i highly recommend, i would definitely keep podshare in mind next time i visit again.
seldom private space

overall place was good, just couldnt find the staff and didnt know who they were. desecent location in a a good part of town so it was pretty safe. the other thing i missed was the email from podshare since it came 40min after the hostelworld confirmation emails. i took off right after i got the confirmation email and wasnt really sure where to go or how to get in when i got there. the podshare email had all the information on where to find the door, key pad number, and wifi.

bathrooms are tiny - sitting on the toilet my knees were hitting the door which was made of wooden slats so people can hear your farts easily.  but great location in the arts district next to little tokyo and union station
world tiniest bathroom and toilet. u have no where to get dressed since there is no privacy.

hi, this place is amazing. you have full access to the kitchen, and the staff there is super friendly and helpful. the bed, the restroom and the whole area is very clean. it is also very quiet. i slept three nights and it was a great experience. definitely recommended!

i arrived at 10pm and they gave me one of the last beds they had, which didn't have tv or somewhere to charge my phone. all beds should have those facilities because i paid for them, there shouldn't be "lasts and worst beds". the restrooms were very small and not private. the location was quite bad, i didn't feel secure outside the hostel. notice that check in is until 11pm, and for them that also means light turned on and music everywhere. staff were really nice.

this is an 18 bed hostel with a kitchen and bathrooms that are well provided with toiletries. it is located just a short cab ride from union station (you could walk to if you up for it). the gentleman who checked us in was really helpful. the hostel was really quiet and everyone friendly and well behaved. its a good option for a solo traveller or even a group.
very clean, safe, spacious, comfortable and instagrammable. staff was extremely helpful and responsive. a little pricier than other hostels but i&#39;d say it&#39;s rather worth it!
great place in la downtown!

i loved staying here! the staff are so friendly, the space is open and very clean, yet you still feel like you have a certain amount of privacy due to the way the beds are constructed. the only thing i could wish to be better would be a little more space in the bathroom stalls (for those of us who are tall and gangly :). great place to stay for a long or short term visit, i highly recommend it.

an amazing place to stay! the staff make you feel right at home and have great knowledge of the local area that they&#39;re happy to share. the communal areas are great if you&#39;re looking to meet new people from around the globe or if you&#39;re tired each individual pod is quite private. 10/10

we were very jet lagged when we were at podshare, it was a cool place to explore downtown la from, but as a couple, our three nights were definitely enough time to be spent there as the lack of privacy started to get to us and the trains were very noisy at night! staff were pleasant and happy to help with questions and directions :)

interesting set up for a hostel, but was really happy. only picked it because it was the closest hostel to the hotel that my tour was starting from. beds are really comfy!! wifi bit sketchy on phone but ok on laptop. little difficult to find. staff pretty helpful. facilities are good and clean, but the toilet and shower are really small.

definitely will come back and stay at this place again! very unique and inspiring experience. the co-living space concept definitely works and it allows for people to create new friendships and make you feel really at home. comfortable, safe and pleasant environment. it feels like you belong to a bigger family unit. amazing experience! love it!!! 👍👍👍

the bed was comfy and clean, the staff were lovely and there was communal food so i didn&#39;t need to worry about finding breakfast. the &#39;pods&#39; are very open and there is nowhere to securely store large pieces of luggage. it felt safe so i didn&#39;t mind but it may bother some people. netflix on our own personal tv was cool but mine had a very very slow connection.

absolutely amazing place to stay! what elvina has done to the building is nothing short of brilliant. the pods are fantastic, they&#39;re clean, extremely comfortable, have tv for when you just want to chill out and they don&#39;t make a noise like the conventional bunk beds! i really enjoyed staying here and would recommend it to all! emma and gillian were great upon greeting us and showing us round and really made us feel at home! if you&#39;re ever in downtown la there&#39;s only one place to stay- podsh

this might be the best hostel i every stayed.    don&#39;t be intimidated by sharing a big room with 14 others, in fact, you have a big bed space and you feel you have all the private space you need!     a trendy approach to hostel environment, forget about those traditional en-suite room with metal bunkbeds, podshare is a completely different experience...    located right next to the art district and little tokyo, otherwise uber is easy.    only small problem is the wc space is a bit small...

loved podshare!     i&#39;m a freelancer so i work in la a week at a time. i only stayed here on a wednesday and spent less than 24 hours there but loved it.    it&#39;s so clean! super clean! so if you need clean here you go.    the beds are so comfortable!!!!     the sheets are perfect      but:  the internet sucks when everyone is on it.    it was a little difficult to find. the address isn&#39;t visible and they use their logo as a sign.    street parking only.
definitely would come here again! everyone is super nice and welcoming 😁 there's netflix on the tvs, food for the community, they provide you with a towel, and even some shower/morning essentials!

superb stay. we were able to find parking easily, gain access into the building on our own quite easily at 5am as well with the access code provided, & the pod was comfortable along with very accommodating.
beds were really comfortable. we are community breakfast, which rocked. audrey very helpful. be bikes were just ok, the locks wee horrible. loved it overall!

podshare is an experience every hostel-traveler should go through, you might feel a bit discomfortable at first to stay at an all-open room for 18 people, but then it feels more private and friendly at the same time than staying in a small room of some bunk beds. podshare arts district was especially comfortable and clean, and the staff was very friendly- we almost preferred to stay inside rather than going out and exploring la!

it would be great for young people traveling but it does not make a good workspace. the owners were having a heated conversation while i was doing a bit of last minute trip planning.  i never ended up getting work done there, i went to a cafe near by. the area is great and the food is outstanding.

i had a great time staying here. it has a great atmosphere and everyone interacts pleasantly with each other, while respecting your space. the whole unit kept in immaculate condition and it&#39;s great to relax in your own pod with the roku. the only downside is the late night noise from osso dtla across the street and the small bathrooms. i would definitely stay here again though.
they totally jacked me around they are walking turds i am very  angry about their unprofessionalism
i really enjoyed my stay here. i love the fact that everyone has their own tv with almost any show or movie you want to watch. super friendly and helpful staff.
a usefull and awesome place for short timers.

this was a fantastic place to stay, lots of younger visitors that are easy to get along with. it is in a great location 20 minute walk from venice beach and has lots of food and bar options surrounding.   the staff are great, helpful and friendly ready and willing to help out with any questions you have about the place or the surrounding area. the place itself is really interesting and can accomodate people who need their own space or who are happy to socialise. i would recommend this to anyone.
my stay was very great. met sone really cool people
way better than staying in downtown. the fact hostel provides everything i need and people were really helpful. the house is old but very beautiful and located in a quite area close to the beach.
could do with more lockers, possibly in the rooms, but this isn't really an issue. it's a really relaxed place in a really nice area. the staff are all great; really welcoming and friendly.
absolutely amazing place;) staff very helpful and friendly! finding a better place for this price is not possible. thanks a lot to the venice beach hostel to be a part of my trip. xoxoxo

i've stayed in a lot of hostels all over the u.s, so i feel confident ensuring you that this is the absolute worst one.  ever.  and for a number of reasons! but first, and most importantly: the guy who checked us in at around 11:00pm was wearing a red donald trump "make america great again" hat.  and it wasn't a joke.  i asked him.  my girlfriend, who is of color, was so scared to stay there after i told her.  this is also not the location they advertise! it's so much farther away.  liars.
staff was really helpful and friendly...everything clean and nice...great value for money...
i had a great experience in l.a. and the venice beach hostel has been a big part of this experience.  for sure i will be back.

this place is an absolutely run down dirty old house - not even half of the beds are proper beds, most of them pretty much camp beds. we hadn't even booked for that place but got rebooked by the owner from the original address to this place (more than twice as far to the beach btw) without even asking. the so called "private" rooms entrance is through a dorm and basically nothing more than two camp beds put in a huge bathroom. if you want to relive a filthy 70s porn you might be right...

this was the worst stay at a hostel i've ever experienced. my third night in, the window next to the door was shattered by what i'm assuming was one of the many nearby homeless men. instead of fixing the window (a huge safety and security risk) the manager had the audacity to blame us for breaking it and now (3 days later) the window is still broken. on top of this issue, the electricity went out for a day, the kitchen sink was clogged and unusable, and frankly most of the employees were rude.

ian the manager is very friendly and professional, remembers everybody's name even though he sees 20 new people per day. breakfast included is very good with fruits, cereals, toasts and all kinds of jams. the place is kept very clean and great atmosphere ! the price is good compare to most other hostels, but dormitory rooms for more than 20$ don't seem fair, i guess this is la... :)

they have 2 locations. i was at the one closer to the beach. it had free all day parking. this is their secondary location so it was almost empty. on first night there was another person in 6-bed dorm room and on second night i was the only one. all in all great value for money.

great spot eric was so helpful. literally helped me out with everything i needed. hooked me up with the best bars with live music in venice and his recommendation got a 10/10 from me. will definitely stay again. steve ireland 🇮🇪

the hostel was ok but if i knew there were two locations and that i would have been 25 mins walking from the beach, then i would have liked to know beforehand. there were two showers for all the hosts and you pay $2 for a towel. the stuff is professional and luckily i got my bed early.

super cozy hostel with great owner and workaway staff. we had really really cool encounters with fellow travelers. well equiped kitchen, free (basic) breakfast, so close to the venice beach - hotspot for surf, skate and incredible sunsets. seems like there's no better place to stay in la and chill at the same time. the hostel also looks super cool, makes you feel at home in an instant. we loved our stay. thank you!

address they give us the wrong one... they need to make that clear when booking or just change the address online. there is nothing outside to say that it is the hostel, some signage would be good. other than that, check in was great. lots of information provided.  basic but good breakfast. good location! i’d recommend

the hostel’s address on the web is wrong....... the right one is 2915 yale ave. i wish i would know it before i came. the whole environment is fine and the landlord is very kind, however the locker is too old and small.

the place is very well located; close to the airport and obviously, venice beach. just a block away is great food at sunny spot and walking distance is the cheesecake factory, yum! there are nearby bus stops and a very friendly and tolerable owner. i’m sorry for the mess!

i’ve stayed at many hostels and this was by far my favorite. everyone is so nice, friendly, and helpful. iain the owner does a great job keeping it safe and quite. i felt at home and would definitely come back. it’s close to the beach and conveniently located to everything i wanted to see. i definitely recommend staying
rude rude rude staff. guests where fantastic. be weary of hidden charges and costs they don’t list!

i really enjoyed my stay at the venice beach hostel. very friendly host and guests. very clean rooms. close to the beach and many restaurants. very conveniently located to many bus routes. felt safe walking around at night in this neighborhood. i’ll definitely come back again!

sweet location, really hippie vibe, smells like urine and dust. literally an inch of dust on the carpet. the "private room" is an old dressing room inside an 8 bedded room with a random bath in the room. positives: the water was hot and amazing!
wrong address on hostelworld, only two bathrooms shared by everyone, horrible matress, o.k. location, friendly staff, easy to get to from airport.

this place felt like home. great staff, good location, and a friendly atmosphere. i think this place attracts good people and good energy, i felt very comfortable. free breakfast was a bonus and the kitchen facilities were pretty good.    if i return to venice i would stay again for sure.

old unloved grubby poorly maintained property, broken electrical sockets, door handles missing. over crowded dorms 4 people sleeping on the floor. beds are wobbly camp beds, old saggy mattresses old bobbly sheets with a smelly furry blanket, yuk! just 2 showers and toilets in the whole building. no privacy just a shower curtain between you & everyone else using the unisex bathroom, no door locks. kitchen, filthy oven that didn't work, tap fitting taped together. $10 card charge. not near beach!
owner was very nice and gave us information about the area.   we also rented bikes from them. bikes could use some maintenance.

if you're looking for the cheapest place in la and close to the beach, this is the place. this is not the best hostel i've been but you get what you pay. i was just looking for a place to sleep so for me it was more than enough. the rooms are maybe overcrowded, they even have beds in the middle of the room. and the bed where i've slept in is far from being comfortable. the check in was slow (it was with sam and everything is made on paper lol) but the staff is nice and helpful.

our stay at venice beach hostel was just perfect. staff was so helpful, especially this one girl anna who gave us the best tips. its walking distance to the beach and with bikes even better. there's only two bathrooms and the privacy with those was a bit nah, but worked out. very cute, felt like home.
great people and great vibe, proper backpacker stay but the beds are the very worst that i've seen in any country and the bathrooms are a joke, fully open and shared, no privacy whatsoever.
stay away
very friendly and great for international travel. close to venice beach and easy with a bike rental

i really enjoyed my stay here, the staff was friendly and there were a lot of cool people there making the stay even more fun! the bar scene is really good and walking distance, the beach is walking distance, and santa monica pier is about a 15 minute drive or 30 minutes by bike. the breakfast is small but that is fine as there are lots of places to eat nearby.
crowded rooms, uncomfortable, old beds, just 2 bathrooms for 25+ without lock on the door, no privacy. but still, it was a pleasant stay.

i've been in many hostels around the world, but i never saw such a disgusting hostel. i did not want to use their blanket and used my own towel.   another bad point is that they have two locations, you check in in the nice one and then you i had to go 1km or so down the street to the other location. also breakfast was only served on the top location and the whole divide makes it no nice atmosphere in the hostel (at least if you stay in the lower location)

fantastic hostel, super helpful and friendly staff. insanely easy to get to from the airport.  i've stayed here twice and will stay here again next time i pass through la. thanks again guys look forward to seeing you next time :)

overall, i had a positive stay at this hostel. staff was extremely friendly and helpful upon check-in. the only downside and recommendation i'd have for management is to upgrade some of the dorm beds. i slept in the large dorm room (14 beds) and had a very, very poor mattress (top bunk un the back right by the closet).
good breakfast, friendly staff, old matresses

there was only one bathroom for at least 10 people and things did not seem clean.  also the included breakfast is a 15 minute walk away at the other property.  not really as stated and not really worth the money.
cheap place. the double room is very small
this is "aerospace" chris.  very nice staff very friendly and accommodating for my last minute travels.    will do it again.

i really enjoyed my short stay in this hostel. the place was very close to the beach and staff was nice, helpful and friendly.  definitely cool place to stay, explore and meet people. would recommend and would stay here again.
great place just needs better wifi
auberge sympathique, propre et convivial mais peu de place dans les chambres.
great place for a great price with one of the friendliest people i ever met

i had a great time here at the venice beach hostel thanks to the owner who provided a continental breakfast for us every morning, and was the most courteous. as for the rest of the staff, most were very welcoming and helpful except for one russian lady employee who was completely dismissive towards me during my entire stay, made racist jokes around me, really made sure i noticed their trump patriotism, and treated everyone i spent time with poorly too. hopefully that gets sorted out, thank you.

this hostel is the worst i have stayed in in the us.   it is dark and dingy, and looks like it hasn't been redecorated in 20 years. the doors are constantly wide open with easy access to all of the rooms from anyone outside.  inside the rooms, they have crammed as many beds in as possible. the mattress was the most uncomfortable mattress i have ever slept in and kept sliding off the bed.   i left with 30 mosquito bites.   there are 2 unisex showers for everyone, with no where private to change.

creaking double decker beds, there is no decent ladder up the beds, 1 bathroom to 12 people at least, no lockers to secure your stuff, very hot rooms in summer with no fan and lack of power outlets. it looks like one of those workers quarters. (note i stayed not at the 'main hostel' but at another building)    good location and the people running the hostel were friendly, but the place is one of the most run down hostels i have lived in.

everyone is nice and friendly at the hostel. the staff are great and are very fun and welcoming. the people who stay there are always happy and are very nice. it is a very clean hostel with great facilities. i will definately be staying there again when i go back to la.
a place i would definitely recommend. i booked last minute very late at night and the staff were flexible and very friendly upon my late arrival. great atmosphere in the house!

atmosphere was friendly and welcoming, but the hostel was a disappointment for la, venice, writing on the walls and ceiling was quirky but when paired with the old, dirty, no linen beds made it feel like a homeless shelter. i've stayed at a lot of hostels, and military barracks and the bed furniture here was the worst i've ever experienced. lockers were too small to handle larger bags, which was recommended that we leave them in the garage, this was not secure at all. shame as staff were great!

we couldn't sleep directly in the hostel as they told us it was full. so they brought us to a partner house which was the dirtiest hostel i've been sleeping. there was only one bathroom for the whole house and the kitchen was super old and dirty. also there was a disgusting smell in our room.     also it was strange that they only take cash payments. the guy told us that the device is broken... "so we only take cash".  i would not go there again!

stayed in a private room and really enjoyed my stay.  location was great, staff was awesome - anna was super helpful and told us about bars nearby, food spots, and showed us all around the hostels 2 locations.    i read a few reviews before booking and some have inaccurate info about this place.  one said it's not near the beach, it's

the place is just a big house. got put in a bedroom with 13 beds squeezed in which were uncomfortable and the bottom bunk had a tiny amount if room.     2 toilets and 2 showers for the whole hostel isn't great. when you do take a shower theres no where to get changed as there is no locks on the bathroom so people just walk in.     staff were alright. some were really nice some just stared at you.    wouldn't stay there again.
the atmosphere created by the staff is great. all were extremely helpful and one staff member anna helped us immensely as well as baked everybody cheesecake! worth the stay.
nice people and very nice location.

i wouldn't recommend this hostel, although some positive charachteristics partially compensate for the poor accomodation.  facilities' quality is extremely low: bunk beds with old, broken and uncomfortable mattresses. some guest had to share beds. not very clean, with no bed sheets, 2$ for towels and cash only payments (10$ extra for using a card). only 2 restrooms.  what's good: location cant be better in la, the owner is a funny englishman, staff girls are cool and pretty, easy going atmosphere.

keep in mind most of the price you pay for the location. i actually didn't like my stay. i expected way more for the money. the bed was horrible, the dormroom looks like a orphan house. bedsheets seemed not clean and smelled as if someone pied in it. couldn't close the bathroom and bedroom door. didn't feel unsafe though.

this hostel was really lovely. very chilled out, friendly environment. ian has done a really good job creating a safe space for travellers like myself to come home to after the chaos that can unfold in venice beach. i'm terrible with names, but that russian guy and his girlfriend who work there are so so kind, genuinely would not have had as great a time in venice without them!

everything was perfect! the value was solid and it wasn't too far from the beach. there was also an in-n-out burger close by as well. the staff was extremely nice! maciej, was by far the funniest and most entertaining staff memeber. he laughed at my stories and made me feel welcomed. in the morning he even offered to share some of his breakfast with me. i couldn't have chosen to stay at a better hostel in los angeles. if you want to feel welcomed and have a good time, stay here.

we we're put in the second location of the hostel. we didn't know this until we were there. i got an email witch sad that we were to go there to check in. not that we had to stay there. the beds were horrible. old, squeaky and the matras  was sacked. it didn't feel clean. there are only two bathrooms and you can't lock it if you take a shower. the staff was really nice. the one thing i did like was when you brush your teeth you look out of a window instead of a mirror.
banana was an excellent place to stay! realy in the heart of a great part of la. very walkable. great staff, great atmosphere, and clean hip vibes :)

i've been traveling the world for many years. this trip i invited my best friend who does not travel much & booked the misleading "venice beach hostel". property is not near the beach at all. (not in venice?). main issue was energy & attitude of the manager. he made us feel very un-welcomed. my friend is 10 years older but he is a kid at heart. he embarrassed us in front of other guests, way overcharged us for a lost bike lock ($40!). completely ignored me during checkout. we also saw a bed bug.

no key to the property so in theory anyone could enter, but there are small lockers to store your valuables.  can feel the springs in the bed and no sheet, just a blanket which isn't washed between guests.  only two showers and toilets for property, and no where to change in privacy.  other facilities all good.  decent location and transport links. decent breakfast including fruit.

great place with a good location, pretty hard to find if you haven't read the instructions properly though. staff is great although the polish guy is a bit wierd.  location is as said good, only a 20 min walk to venice beach amd they have bikes for rent at the hostel!
big social area, feels like a big friendly house. positive vibes. about 25mins from the beach. only downside is that there were only two showers/toilets for the whole hostel

good value for money and location, easy to rent bikes and staff are helpful (if a little serious). breakfast is decent. however not a great atmosphere and you have to be quiet in the evenings as it's a residential area. there is very little privacy in the bathrooms and the rooms didn't feel very clean with no sheets provided, just blankets at the end of the bed that didn't seem that they had been washed for each new guest.
could not fault ian and the staff at the venice beach hostel. great location accompanied by the traditional hostel experience. thanks for having me!
is it really that hard to get door locks or even door handles on the bathroom doors? jesus christ. every time i had a shower or went to the toilet i had at least 2 people walk in on me.
u have to pay for towels; pay for leaving luggages 1 hour after check out; staff is not friendly except the older man.
absolutely amazing hostel in an amazing location. literally the best hostel i have ever stayed in, the staff were helpful and always up for a good laugh :d

the hostel is located around 25mins from the venice beach pier! the owner ian is a lovely, very helpful person. he even took my friend to the hospital after spider bite! staff is so nice and friendly ( two russian anna's- hi girls :),)apart from jaida who thinks she is at least a celebrity and looks down her nose at people which wasn't pleasant especially when checking in!     facility has got only two bathrooms but suprisingly it was never crowded.     place was always clean and fresh :)

great place , great staff , great location..  super great prices with aaa+ staff ,   close to the beach , bus , food ..  you will be happy you was here ...  i stood for 3 night and very happy over all

ive actually stayed at both locations (the main big hostel has a smaller sister apt for overflow.) the main hostel is this huge beautiful and airy old craftsman  house. very comfortable and feels like a home. the dorm rooms have huge vaulted ceilings. its kind of a nice respite from the boring norm. bags of character.  . the smaller apt is a little bit closer to the beach, which is a good 20 minute walk. rent a bike like i did! best decision ever.

we stayed in the hostel for 3 nights and it was brilliant. the atmosphere was so comfortable, everyone was open and friendly and willing to integrate with everyone. the host was great, friendly and helpful. the rooms were very clean and spacious! location was about 20 minute walk away from venice beach, so pretty good too.  would highly recommend this hostel!
confusion with payment, however amaing location! only thing that could improve is comfort of the beds.

i had a really nice stay at the hostel.  the staff who work there is very friendly and helpful. thanks to the common area there a good opportunity to meet new people which makes the stay even more enjoyable. the place is very clean and the location is vary goo too, its within a walking distance from the beach.

great staff! very friendly and helpful.   the beds are really not that great and compfy and it's pretty important to me as it's what you pay for at the end of the day. that could improved for sure and it would make the experience great.

it's relatively cheap for the location, i guess, but other than that, i suggest looking elsewhere. staff are nice enough but there isn't really any atmosphere, the wifi was always super slow or not working.. the room that i was staying in was way too over crowded and they just moved my stuff without asking & added another bed in there when there was already very little space. beds were super uncomfortable. i would not recommend.
