i have booked to stay at venice beach hostel but was put into some other house remade into hostel.   there were no locks on the door into the hostel and also no lock for the dorm rooms, the doors were open most of the time.  the facilities weren't as good as in the main venice beach hostel. there were only two bathrooms for the entire place which had 20dorm room and several 8 dorm rooms i suppose. this means only two toilets and two showers for everyone. also the toilet was within the bathroom.

a decent place to stay but a little weird.  none of the dorms have locks on the doors and they do have lockers but you need your own pad lock.  there's also no great places to change, the bathrooms also do not lock.  while i'm sure the sheets have been washed, they were probably purchased 15 years ago and are pretty dirty, ours had dried blood on it.  staff was nice and it's a 30 walk to the beach.  hostel is not marked with signs so make sure you know the house number.

i've never written a review in my life but this hostel is that good that i wrote one. such a cozy, homey space, and immaculately clean. perfect location, with easy access to the beach, venice, santa monica, and all of la's west side. the owner (ian) and the girl who is working over this summer (anna) are such kind and accommodating people, that made me feel right at home. i completely believe that if you want a cozy yet cheap stay in la, there is no better option than the venice beach hostel!
super chill and nice place to stay - huge common area and nice staff.
great hostel and amazing staff! enjoyed my stay in there.

hostel was nice, it's a converted large house so it still has a homey vibe. we stayed for 1 night in a twin room and there were board games and a tv in the living room as well as leaflets for activities in the area. anna, who checked us in, was very helpful and gave us a list ofthings to do in the area. the hostel has good restaurants near by (c&a cucina is amazing) and easy access to the beach and lax. the negative was paying $5 each to store luggage at the hostel after we checked out after 12.
such a wonderful place to stay! staff were amazing. they stayed up late because we got stuck getting into la. great vibe, nice rooms, great location for the beach!
great hostel. staff are great location is perfect ten minutes away from the beach. would stay again
a pleasant place to stay

really enjoyed the hostel . had a great vibe. walking distance to venice beach . beds are basic but fine. no air con but wasn't an issue as windows open though out .  highly recommend and would stay again!
this place is great.   and venice is a great place to be.

pros: the house is in a nice neighborhood, the house has an interesting allure and charm.  cons: not enough showers and toilets for the capacity of people, very uncomfortable, old mattress, weird smell all around, generally unclean (toilets, shower with mold on the curtain), you can find  places closer to the beach with better facilities and for only a few bucks extra. i tried to make my stay there as short as possible, and it was definitely not worth the amount i paid.
great staff.
rude staff

the location is far from the beach and the center of town, but there is a good bus system and it's pretty easy to bike to (and along) the beach. make sure you check out the canal. the common areas were nice but there were too many beds in the room, and most of the beds are very old and uncomfortable.
has 2 locations, i stayed at the less fancier one. it was very basic barebones type feel. there were no staff or main desk where i stayed. tv room just a couch with old tv. big kitchen tho.

open house with spacious dorms and common area. however, just two bathrooms without proper separated showers/toilets and possibilities to change. plus, everyone was basically able to walk in and out of the house.

really nice hostel and good location to the beach. you can rent bikes for cheap and bike down santa monica/venice beach.  staff are super friendly and helpful. the only thing was that the room i was in had slate windows,  so it was quite a noisy sleep due to traffic outside.  other than that one thing everyone was great!
loved this one place!

this is a great hostel, beautiful beach style with verandas and billowing nets. its clean, cool, near the beach, comfortable and with a great breakfast. i had a short stay but during my time the staff were really helpful especially marco who went way beyond the call of duty to help me with travel arrangements to an event i was going too. i had an short but exceptional time.... noel
loved this hostel - the staff, house, location, other guests were all great. i had a lovely time in this chilled out beach vibe. everyone was really lovely. would totally recommend and return.

loved the place! the vibe, staff, location, i went back a number of times, really liked the friendly  welcoming people- the travellers and the staff. definitely will recommend to others. no pick-up from lax but the bus is easy. can be difficult how get a park at times.
really nice stay at the hostel!!! staff was great and good location!!!!

the best part about this hostel is the location! it's walkable distance away from the venice beach. other than that, this hostel is not good. check in place is different from my stay, and while walkable it's a bit far. i say that because in the morning breakfast is only available in the check in place, and from 9-10. there's only 1 bathroom shared by everyone there. the place also looks old and dirty, and the room kinda smells too. having said that i only stayed 1 night so it was ok to crash.

facilities were not at all as described 20 minute walk to venice beach. owner marco was very nice and accommodating. hostel was basically a one floor apartment two of the privates were beds literally jammed into closets so the only thing in the room was a bed. windows had to be open constantly as there was no ac making it impossible to sleep from highway noise, the top bunk i slept on was ready to fall/collapse at any moment and having only 1 bathroom between 7-10 guests extremely frustrating
place was not at all a hostel. more like a converted house with no privacy in bathrooms, terrible lounge/kitchen and rooms, aggressive staff and a weird vibe. 1/10 would not recommend

it was difficult to find the hostel, apparently there are two locations (second building is on yale av) and we didn't know about the second location's address. the address was not mentioned on our confirmation e-mail nor on the website.
really loved my stay here, just what you want from a hostel: good atmosphere, friendly people, good location and good facilities. loved it so much i stayed longer! thank you guys for having me :)
great place. great staff. great location. made a new friend and had a great time. will definitely come back again.

not the best hostel i've stayed it. owner or manager wants to keep a "holiday" environment, so he moved me to another unit with no one in it. i ended up partying harder than anyone there, i just handle my business during the day. anyway i love hostels and go to them a lot, but would never stay at this one again. thanks !

great stay!!! l it's pretty much what all of us adventurers are looking for. just want to note that this hostel doesn't have ac - just propped open windows/doors, which would be fine if there was a massive breeze but frankly i was hot and sweating when i was not directly in front of a window/door. this also let a lot of mosquitos in so bring bug repellant. (2) there's a lingering odor assuming bec the entire house, except for downstairs area, is all carpet (even in the bathroom).

very uncomfortable beds, no privacy in the shower, the location is different that the one posted, weird thing going on with the final price, i asked to 2 people they both told me a different thing, smell weird in some places of the hostel.
my friend and i enjoyed our stay very much. safe + clean + great location. the staff was professional and friendly- they know how to do what they do well. thank you so much for having us!

super stay at venice beach hostel. marco the owner is super cool and gives good tips on venice and la ! ! great location, cheap bike rents for the day, great atmosphere in the hostel. i highly recommend

great staff, very good hostel it's nice and relaxed and very close to everything. the beach is only 30 mins walk. breakfast was good and they had english football channel so very good if your a british lad. overall great hostel would stay again.
we were 15 people in our room, other people had four or six people in their room with a private bathroom and they paid the same money. only two bathrooms in the whole hostel with little privacy.

i don't recommend staying at this hostel. it smelled (even with windows open), bathrooms were dirty, main light in my room didn't work, and i could feel the springs in my back when lying on the bed. the lockers are small and in a different location from the bedrooms.  you would think with the money they make off the guests they could fix a few things or clean up a bit.   pay $10/20 more and find an airbnb in the area, you'll be happy you did.
good value for money, amazing atmosphere. i have really enjoyed my time in this place. thanks #thevenicebeachhostel ;)

staff here were very friendly and helpful. good location and very easy to get to from the airport. mixup with the hostel location, it was not the same as what was on the website. bed was uncomfortable, and being on the top bunk i sometimes felt like was going to fall out. would recommend for a short stay like i did (1 night).
great place, ~1 mile from the beach. i only stayed the night but everything was super clean and the people working there were very nice.

the place was not as described. the address was a different one that was stated when purchased. they didn't even allow to leave bags by the end of the day, and demanded additional payment of $35 as if i was going to stay for a night. the breakfast is awful. very disappointed!    notice for a british guy who is suposed to be the host: ukraine cannot use with the article 'the' according to the english grammar rules.
not very clean and location not superb. very friendly people though!

i appreciate very much the friendliness and helping me with directions.  thankful for the fresh fruit offered with breakfast.   i liked the large shower with plenty of room for also getting dressed with privacy after taking one, also that the bathroom was clean and sanitized.  i will recommend on having softer mattress specially for women is uncomfortable laying facing down and feeling the  the metal coils. great home with much character. i had a sweet time staying at this hostel.

attentive alert friendly staff.  the hostels i stayed in in uk and ireland 11 years ago had lockers large enough to put my luggage in, and they rented out padlocks for the lockers.  the "lockers" listed here were about 0.9 cubic feet or 25500 cc, enough for wallet, purse, keys, etc.  if i hadn't had a car to lock things in i would have had to carry around my luggage. the neighborhood was nice for parking the car.  cracks  on outside of shower will allow framing decay eventually.

me and my friend loved this hostel. the people there make all the difference as it is quite small and you are in close proximity. the staff sam and marco were great and happy to help, it had a real family home feeling. it's close to venice beach and has allot around. will definitely be going back.
that bed was rough

the beds are very uncomfortable, in fact they gave us no beds, the first night they gave us a couple of mattress in a loft, and the next day they gave my friend an old mattress where she could not  sleep. some of the staff are very nice but not all of them. we made a mistake in the reservation but the owner did very little to help us. the location is ok.

no one was there to greet us when we first arrived for a few minutes, which wouldn't have been a big deal if other guests hadn't made uncomfortable comments to the friends traveling with me. good location and very friendly owner, but wasn't fully comfortable staying long in the hostel itself.
as the guy said.  those condos down the street cost 2 mil a pop a piece or you can stay at vbc for ~50 a night.  great place, great ppl.
this was a great place to stay and everyone we met, staff and other patrons, were great to be around. will definitely try and stay again when visiting.
great hosts! they will make you feel welcome right away! the atmosphere is very relaxed and the rooms and bathrooms are basic, but clean. overall, i had a great stay.
there is no parking, you park on the street.
terrible beds.   2 showers only  2 toilets only.  not clean
this spot was in the perfect location, felt clean, & welcoming.  the staff was friendly and all visitors were kind and outgoing.
its a bit cold on the 3 weeks a year it rains.

not really worth the money. if you like drunk people or drinking too much that's the place for you. it´s not a big deal if someone is completely drunk and spreads his stink there. couldn´t breathe when i had breakfast. staff is cleaning everyday, but there´s still smutch from the past years on the surfaces. you don´t even get a duvet cover for your blanket, not very hygienic. you cannot lock the showers and the toilets. there´s just 2 bathrooms for many rooms. the breakfast was simple and okay.
nothing worse than being sick on vacation. the staff was so helpful about everything. i was lucky i stayed there. a+++

there were two locations of the hostel, one where we checked in and one where we stayed. both of them difficult to find, no signs. we had a private room, which was very small and cold. the breakfast was at the other location, so we would have had to walk outside and walk a few minutes, what´s not very convenient when it´s raining really hard.  the stuff was nice but all in all it was way too expensive for this accommodation.  i was disappointed from the hostel.

old house turned hostel. the place smells. 2 bathrooms and 2 showers for 30+ people. privacy whilst showering: only a flimsy curtain, and the shower is in the main bathroom (which cannot be locked). beds are very squeeky and you can feel the springs through the mattress: bad back guaranteed in the morning. can't say if the sheets were clean or not. towels are 2$ extra. floor has very old dusty carpet. kitchen makes you want to clean everything twice before using it.

it's as grungy as any hostel. all the facitilities function well, but there's just a bit of that odd charm, like why is there a van in the storage space? it doesn't really matter though. it's pretty to get to venice beach if you want on the bus line. it's not really close to any metro, so it's a bit of a trek to get anywhere else in the city if you don't have a car. if you do have a car, there's a lot of amazing drives really close by.

we stayed two nights at the hostel. the staff we friendly but it's a very basic hostel. it's about a 15 minute walk to venice beach, about an hour walk to santa monica pier. the rooms were relatively clean but could be improved. a few new things in this hostel would help a huge amount.

nice hostel in a prime location. just rent a bike for $15 the whole da from the hostel and ride the bike route to the beach,  follow beach bike route north stooping at the shops in venice, the pier in santa monica. i you are in good shape go up to the bel-air bay club where the beach bike route ends. the bikes at the hostel is really cheap when compared with the the rent bikes shops.

very nice hostel, just a few minutes from the beach. different concept really, looks and feels very cosy and friendly. met some really cool people there. the manager ian is a really nice guy, he helped me out a lot and i suppose is pretty nice for an englishman. highly recommend this place.
terrific staff, great atmosphere and a great place to stay if you like hostels, the only thing that put me off was that the beds were not the most comfortable, the springs were quite hard.

i was greeted with, "you can only stay for a few days because americans steal." bread for breakfast. windows open all night so some guests were literally catching cold. people they liked less were sent to another location. lack of privacy with windows that won't shut. just... weird.

the worst staff i have ever met. they told us they were making a huge exception for us since were american.tati and the manager were rude,condescending& judgmental. when they got there they kept questioning why we wanted to stay there& treated us like criminals&made us feel extremely unwelcome just because were american.we asked 4 a refund&said we werent going to stay there regardless&they said no&once again were condescending,telling us they were doing us a favor because we were dressed nicely.
really nice hostel.  friendly staff. nice quiet and homey feel with a great interior and comfy beds.  near lots of places to eat/drink/chill.  i'd definitely stay here again and recommend to anyone.
thumbs up
great staff. good location and nice hostel. close to the beach and away from the dirt of downtown la

very cosy hostal with a nice athmosphere.. venice is a super nice area to recomand for a stay in la.  only real negative point of the hostel is the lack or restrooms and showers. only two for the whole building,that really is toi few.

weird hostel, sort of worked though. the staff were really great all round. breakfast for one hour and early checkout coupled with having to vacate the hostel and pay for luggage storage is a bit rubbish. but looking at prices in venice maybe fair enough, just new to us for a hostel. felt like you were staying at a friends house at uni but again seemed to work in its own way. would stay again if we stayed in venice.
it was perfect. the staff was great and i met some awesome people.   i hope i can go back there soon.

hostel is fine, nothing really special. bathroom kinda weird, tho. there is only two full bathrooms in the house and a thin curtain splits the one showering and the rest of the users, creepy. i should mention that is not the most comfortable bed, neither the worst. the bed have only springs, no bases, so when you lay down, you kinda sink on the mattress and when your roomie of the higher bed arrives, you might think if the springs will reach you or not (it doesn't).

great hostel, management and staff warm, friendly and very helpful, guests equally so. beautiful location handy for day trips. highly recommended. oh, they watch a game on tv where nothing seems to happen, i think they call it baseball. xx

cheap and 20min walk from venice beach! nothing beats that. everything is walking distance. really old bunk beds ( i still manage to get a good night sleep) it would be nice if they even painted them to make them look nicer. better if you pay cash. charge you $5 to swipe cc. thanks guys.

great location with jut one road to walk down to get to venice beach- takes about 20-30 mins. large kitchen, but only two bathrooms.  hostel had no signage so take note of the number of the house to find it easily! it is pretty much a house; the conversion to a hostel means that its large rooms with camp beds laid out. we were the last in to stay at this house and given a double bed-people who arrived after us were sent across the road to another house. wifi not that strong due to high demand.

when we went to check in the woman made off and we were left waiting about a half an hour. when we eventually did get to check in the woman informed us we were in fact in another building down the street. upon arrival the place was wide open so anyone could walk in or out. the room was very small and hot with 7 people crammed in together.  the wifi was not working and the place was not very clean at all. would not recommend at all.
really enjoyed our stay - friendly, knowledgeable staff, clean facilities, close to venice beach and other funky places. highly recommend!

this hostel is the worst i 've ever stayed in. the beds are really old, stinky and the room seems like a match up with mattresses one just found on the street. moreover they charge you basically for everything! if you wanted to stay till 5 pm after check out you had to pay five dollars. till 10 it was 10 dollars. seriously? a girl who stayed there the night before couldn't hang at the hostel for an hour without paying 5 $. the employees are so unfriendly and rude! stay somewhere else!!

i wasn't impressed with the fact that the bathrooms didn't have locks on them and people come come in while i was showering, although there was a shower screen i still didn't feel comfortable  it was a very quite hostel and they never liked any fun

i stayed at the "other building", which is not the one where they have the reception or breakfast. there is only one toilet and one shower and the both are behind the same door, so locking the door while using the one blocks access to the other as well. but hanging out in the lounge area with the other guys was great fun.

i&#39;ve stayed in many hostels over the years and have to say this one is up there. excellent location with only 20 min walk to venice beach. tons of restaurants and bars and very nice area! felt like a home away from home, staff where really friendly, ian the guy who owns the hostel was very helpful. defiantly got my money&#39;s worth and would recommend anyone to stay!

easy walk to the beach or connections into town, bed was just as you&#39;d expect and the staff were super helpful and friendly. the general atmosphere of the place is also really chilled, not too loud and just generally a great place to hang out in. would definitely recommend.

overpriced, won't not recommend or stay here again. no where near venice beach, about 20 min walk. no locks on the bathrooms, and only two in the whole hostel, so you always had to wait, they were also very dirty. no ladder for top bunk, all the mattress were disgusting and very old. there was even a mattress on the ground, under the stairs that someone was sleeping on. no where to put my backpack as they was someone living in the room who had there belongings everywhere.
excellent choice, very happy l.:  recommend to anyone. cheers
good vibes, laid back and easy

i loved my stay at the venice beach hostel! the staff working there were extremely friendly! i stayed there for my birthday and they made sure to treat me very well! the people staying there were also super chill and the whole place just seemed to have a really good vibe to it. you can rent bikes there and then bike down to the beach in under 10 minutes, which is super convenient. 10/10 would recommend.
we were quite disappointed not to be in the hostel located next to the beach. of course, it was just 25 min of walking to reach the beach but it wasn&#39;t what we expected.

10 people squeezed into a tiny room (nowhere to charge my phone) with shaky bunk beds, no air condition on a noisy street with one bathroom to share with many more people from the other rooms. wifi wasn&#39;t working, no locks for lockers provided. you can leave your luggage after checking out and hang out, but it&#39;ll cost you 5 $.  staff is nice though.

friendly staff and ok location. but, we overpayed! there are cheaper and nicer places through airbnb nearby. the other guests were up all hours of the night and we heard everything, keeping us awake. the bathroom was always occupied. wifi was terrible. won&#39;t be returning.
staff really helpful and friendly with good atmosphere. the property wasn&#39;t as close to venice beach as expected, about a 15 min walk.

staff were incredible! i used a surfboard that the hostel had for free and the hoestel itself was in a great location and very clean, only issue was that it wasn&#39;t as well signposted as it could have been, from the outside it looked like a normal house, there was no sign i could see that said &#34;the venice beach hostel&#34; but other than this everything was amazing!

we stayed in a private ensuite room for one night. booked a double bed room only to get twin beds that could hardly be put together. there was no shower or even a shower handle in the bath tub and the toilet had no divider? the entire room was one open space with no room for privacy whilst in the toilet. the room entrance is through the doom which meant coming in and out was difficult and you had to be volume conscious. stayed in many ensuite hostels across the world this was quite bad.
had a great time staying here. the staff were sound and the location is great as the beach is only a short walk away.

the hostel is split in two locations, both are a short walk to the beach. beds weren't the best, cleanliness could be improved and lockers didn't seem very secure. good free breakfast and friendly staff. overall a good hostel and would stay again.

i had a great time staying at the venice beach hostel. the hostel is a very nice california style two-story house equipped with everything. the staff is fantastic and the facilities are clean. i made a lot of cool friends too    do note that it is a 15 minute walk to the beach from the hostel and make sure to check in at 2915 yale avenue. there is a bus stop a few blocks away at the intersection of lincoln blvd and washington that will get you to and from lax for $1.25 each way
beautiful oldie worldie hostel! very homely and cosy environment, very nice staff!

the hostel was split into two locations, the main house seemed like it would've been nice to stay in however we were in the other part of the hostel a short walk away! the location was great to get about venice, the showers were clean and the kitchen was good however the bed i stayed on had seen better days and the dorm was very cramped. a little like what i imagine a crack den to be like! i'd stay here again but would want to stay in the main hostel!
for how expensive property is at venice it&#39;s good value for money

very very expensive for what it offers.  there are  much closer hostel/hotels to venice beach   it takes 20 min by foot to get to central part of the venice beach from the hostel&#39;s closest location ( 716 wash blvd )  the key does not work at the outside door for the washington blvd location.   one bathroom/toilet for 10+people we woke up at 6 am and i could only take a shower at 8:15.
cool place, great vibe, free breakfast was good but for the price they could at least make the bike rental free or fix the wifi. this is expensive for what you get but not a bad choice.

45 dollar per night to sleep in a thin matress (less than 5cm thick) on the ground, everything quite dirty, no locks in the room... it was an interesting place to see, very alternative, but definetely not worth the price!
my stay was as good as i was  hoping. the staff was polite and informative. i felt welcomed back and certainly will book a stay at there location in the future.

great hostel, great vibe, great staff.     be prepared to walk about 15-20 minutes to venice beach but for what you pay, particularly compared to other hostels/hotels in the same area, this hostel is a bargain. staff are extremely helpful and friendly.     i would recommend hiring a bike to enhance your stay. bathrooms and shower are up their with the best for hostels i&#39;ve stayed in.

this hostel is gross. no air conditioning, and windows are open but without screens. the guy made us pay the first night even after we were unhappy with the location cleanliness and atmosphere. it looked like a crack house and is nowhere near venice beach! it&#39;s in marina del rey not venice beach. i do not reccomend this hostel to anyone, it was a disaster.

security - incessantly lacking     location - absurdly distant from the beach from which it steals it&#39;s name     staff - consescending and unhelpful. preposterously annoying habit of shining flashlights and kicking beds whilst we slept ( not a joke they kick your bed to wake you up on the day you&#39;re checking out)    atmosphere - exceedingly boring people, the toilet queues were a literal sh*tfight     value - we were placed in a bigger room then we ordered     facilities - 1 cm foam mattress
great hostel,really friendly atmosphere and welcoming staff, as well as good location!

sec: front door open wide, locked from midnight-morning. bedroom balcony door open at night due to no a/c. loc: 20 min walk from beach, restaurants/shops nearby. staff: mixed, some rude, some friendly, one threw away something of mine. atmos: quite boring compared to other hostels. clean: overall pretty clean. vfm: paid less/the same for much better places. facilities: nice downstairs living room w/ couches and tv and cooking facilities, but only 2 showers and toilets for the entire hostel. wnr.

really good, nice people. the door to the hostel is quite hard to lock so sometimes you come back and the flats been left open with no one in it and double check where your staying as i got put into a spill over flat down the road which wasn&#39;t that bigger deal, but if your booking to be in the big social main hostel this might be a bit of a bummer. would totally recommend this hostel though great for the money and very friendly staff and tenants, great location!
bad experience ever  very bad owner  the first ever bad experience in a hostel  i don t advice this hostel
an amazing experience:) had a wonderful stay!

no signage to help find the hostel. when we did find it, we were directed to go somewhere else rather than be able to check in where our location was- would have been good to have been told this before and would have saved exhausted, confused people walking up and down the street for far too long.

really enjoyed staying here. i&#39;m from london and this was my first time visiting the venice area. i met some great people in the 2 days i was there, and all the people that worked their were extremely kind. getting to venice beach itself was super straightforward. would definitely stay at this hostel again, a super chilled environment perfect for the beautiful location in which the hostel is located.

i booked the s hostel because it was cheap but honestly the staff is one of the worst. the hostel itself is terrible as well. the entire hostel is sharing two toilets and showers. man ,woman and you can&#39;t even lock doors so privacy is not included. no air-conditioning either and so door remain unlocked and no reception so i didn&#39;t feel safe at all.   do yourself a favor. spend that extra money and go somewhere else. you are welcome.

very interesting hostel... basically it&#39;s a giant house with 3 bedrooms... each bedroom has bunk beds cramped into it leaving just enough space to walk between beds/bags... there are two bathrooms for say 30 people.... no locks on either of them... just a shower curtain to stop people having a peep show... with that said..  it had character, i was actually enjoying my time there, it&#39;s super chill and the staff work/live there and are really nice. it&#39;s pretty over priced for what it is...meh
beer in the vending machine was awesome but there was a lot of drama/noise at night time.
it was so awesome! my first time in a hostel, but i will definitely be using them more often. it was so much fun!

the location was pretty good. close to airport and venice beach. they say they offer a free airport pickup, but it was not driving that day for some reason. the atmosphere was relaxed and welcoming. the staff was very friendly and helpful. although both buildings were in a pretty safe area, people would often leave the door to the dorm open to the street and the door locks did not work consistently (they were hard to open even with a key).

this hostel is on the outskirts of la. describing it as &#39;in los angeles,&#39; would be a bit of a stretch. the place is a bit strange, but clean and safe enough. the location is terrible though. the shuttle from lax cost $37 including tip.

venice beach hostel is actually a house in marina del rey. run down, grungy yet full of character and very friendly staff and guests who all hang out in the lounge area. a bit over priced for what it is but i guess yre paying to be in a good location near the beach. decent free breakfast. the negatives are they need more security lockers as most guests have no where to put there valuables. bathrooms are unisex with no locks or privacy, which i found to be very annoying and the bunks need ladders

wouldn&#39;t really call it a hostel. it is more someones house with too many bunk beds/ hospital beds in one room. 12 or 10 person dorm could hardly fit 8 people. terrible value for money. location is ok, 10/15min walk from venice beach.

honestly, this is one of the best hostels i have ever been in. the staff was amazing, iyan anna and were so kind and funny. the location is good and safe and you got food all over the place. great atmosphere and overall great hostel!
they sent us to a different location far away from the beach with very bad facilities. will never book that again. there are many hostels in the l.a. area which are a lot better.

great value for money considering the facilities, location and the general atmosphere. the staff are friendly and super helpful. the hostel has great flow with people coming and going all the time but still a chill, relaxed place. it was about 15-20 mins walk away from the beach which considering the price is really convenient. we loved staying here and would again if we were back in venice.
overall this place has the basics, but the set up is cramped. very relaxed protocol as well.
staff were amazing, very friendly, and helpful. clean house and great location!
this hostel is a fair price considering its location, cleanliness, and incredible staff. if you can afford it, i definitely recommend it.
i loved the venice beach hostel! the staff and the owner create a beautiful environment! nice place and great area! cheers!
everything at this hostel was great! the staff is very friendly and the owner, ian, is a very cool guy. it&#39;s also in a good location. i definitely recommend this place.
really excellent hostel with great atmosphere and people, would recommend it to anyone.

i wouldn&#39;t trust booking here.  i booked my four night stay at the venice beach hostel on hostel world a week in advanced.  i was told that i had a reservation.  when i arrived after a long day on a train they didn&#39;t have any beds for me.  someone didn&#39;t write my name in the schedule.  since it was memorial day weekend it venice beach was popping.  what if i hadn&#39;t been able to find another place to stay.  i wouldn&#39;t book here again unless they changed their system.
friendliest staff ever.

excellent place to stay. friendly staff and guests was like a home away from home. i would definitely recommend to anyone who loves a chilled vibe and good conversation with some real down to earth people.
it is a nice hostel.  the staff is very friendly and helpful.  i will come back.  very good.

great location and great facilities. breakfast was solid. front desk staff are so lovely and always helpful which made it hard to mark them down but did so only due to the volunteer staff who organise everything else. mostly kept to themselves i felt and weren't incredibly sociable amongst the guests

the hostel is fine. it&#39;s a big house that was turned into a hostel. it&#39;s like staying in a frat house. maybe this was legit, but i feel like it was not. i paid 12% of the price through hostel world as per usual. however, when i got there, the guy said &#34;no you have to pay for the whole thing&#34; and gave this spiel about taxes. i am pretty sure he ripped me off. if that is normal than disregard. if that is not how it&#39;s supposed to be handled then shady business tactic for a few extra dollars

they didn&#39;t have airport pick up.  we mailed them information about our flight number and time. got an email back that we just have to call them after we pick up our bags from the baggage claims at the airport.   so after 10 hours nightmare fligt we did and the girl sad we should have called 24 hours before arriving 😯 take the local bus.our room had a toilet and bathtube but no walls it was just an old chair to hide the toilet.   dirty carpet whit some glas so we had to wear shoes all the time.

i only stayed one night so i can&#39;t comment on the environment (tho it seemed nice in a homely sort of way) but for the price i would have liked to have been handed fresh bedding as my cover didn&#39;t seem fresh, i would also expect large lockers to store suitcases and to have proper door on the toilets rather than slotted doors. also $5 to pay by card and $5 to store your bags after checkout is kinda cheeky. i personally wouldn&#39;t advise the place unless it&#39;s your cheapest option.

very homely, nice and ideally located hostel with a great atmosphere. they currently have two different locations in a residential area near the beach and have everything you can wish for. their staff member anna even got up at 5 a.m. to order an uber to the airport for me since i&#39;m travelling without a smartphone: she&#39;s the best.

i didn&#39;t know about the no sleeping bag rule and while i was out one of the staff took it and put in a locked cupboard which was quite annoying coz i had to leave in the mornin and was quite stressed trying to figure out how to get it. maybe tell people no sleeping bags! everything else was great tho, really nice place and atmosphere
possibly the nicest staff my whole trip. equally happy to help or hang out with you. about a 20 min walk to the beach but worth it for price and atmosphere compared to the other venice hostels
good hostel for travellers passing through. great staff (ian the hostel owner is a legend) very helpful and insightful on the local scene.

everyone is so friendly here and make you feel at home. there weren&#39;t any locks on the room doors though but it did have the vibe you could trust everyone. the toilet and showers were a little awkward and not very private. great breakfast too.

the staff is nice, the location is good (nearby venice beach and marina del rey), the neighborhood is calm and so it looks safe. however, there were a couple of things that were disappointing for me, at least for the price ($30.00/night):  - no sheets were provided for the bed - for me, not very hygienic;  - restrooms with doors with no lock, which reduced the privacy by a lot;  - breakfast provided was very very simple (bananas, toast, coffee, milk, butter,...);  - general cleanliness

my vote seems a little low because i believe it wasn't a really good location, the staff is people actually hired when traveling and at first, when i got in, i felt like i was in an old cottage. but!!! it took 20 minutes to get over my first experience and i actually loved the experience. there are only 3 rooms so everyone gets to know each other more than in the big hostels. i would not suggest to stay there for more than 2-3 days because it's really far from everything in la.

i arrived @ the venice beach hostel in the evening and was directed and by the time i woke up the next morning i was told by the owner that i was not welcome there because the hostel is only for international travelers.  i am a traveler from new york and the money i spent for the 3 night stay was returned to me by the owner of the hostel for that reason.  i felt the decision  was unjust but i was left with no choice but to move on.  i would not recommend the venice beach hostel to anyone else.

the room was a good way from the main hostel, where breakfast was from 9am, not good if you&#39;re traveling on early. also, it was right by the front door, so very noisy at night, people were sitting on the stairs right outside talking loudly, they did move when i asked them to be quiet. no bedside light or table. it&#39;s a young person&#39;s place.
nice building ....  bad administration   rude staff   un favorable breakfast timing .....  good location ......  only one shower    i stayed here because my friend had aiready booked
great staff and very nice people all around. great time met some people who i will definitely try and stay in touch with. didn&#39;t have to worry about my stuff disappearing. which is always nice.
very relaxed and peaceful. most of all safe. i would recommend this one to my closest friends. thanks.

the venice beach hostel is more than that, is like a shared house with a whole bunch of amazing and interesting people living all together in a tranquil community in the beautiful venice.   if you're easy going i absolutely recommend it. although it is not for everyone, if you decide to go, you will have a good time there.
good location and big breakfast. 1 bathroom for about 20 people.

the hostel itself is pretty cool. it&#39;s a large converted house in a residential area. the main problem we found was that there is no signs whatsoever on the property and as we arrived late (10-11pm) there was nothing to say that the hostel was not someone&#39;s home - another issue is that googlemaps takes you to a building further down the road (looks pretty empty and covered in advertisements). otherwise, staff were cool and rooms ok.

this was my first hostel that i stayed in, and i had a good experience. the location is great since it only takes about 20 minutes to get to venice beach. i only got to interact with the morning staff and they were really helpful and understanding. there was a handful of solo travelers just like me, and it wasn't difficult to strike up a conversation with them. my only complaint would be the mattress in the 13 mixed dorm, i literally felt the box spring of the mattress poking my back.
best hostel i&#39;ve ever stayed
wasn&#39;t expecting a house airbnb setup  was a different location to which we booked  staff were very helpful

i loved venice beach hostel! i found that even though i was in la, the hostel was great value for money and being on a travellers budget that was well helpful. every member of staff are awesome, real friendly and make you feel right at home. fab communal areas, great for meeting other backpackers.  and its in a rad location, 10mins or so walk to venice beach. top hostel x

the main building on yale st, was very nice good atmosphere. bed was a bit bounsy but i was very tired of my trip so sleeping was no problem. a lot of the stuff is old and outdated bad.  the shower was great. e breakfast was super, got more than the hotels were i stayed  the second place were i stayed was on wasington blv, was nice but also a bit "under construction" not bad but for the breakfast you needed tpo go to the main building.
love the place  . will stay again .

make sure to ask the hostel about airport pick-up before booking (if that's important for you), because sometimes they're not able to pick you up - even within the announced time period. otherwise friendly staff. not much privacy in the 13-people dorm - but who could expect that.

alright hostel. a nice place to hang out. it was a big house with a lot off beds. only two toilets in the house to share with around 30 people. very soft beds, and i didn't like that they didn't wash the blankets in the beds between stays. but overall a nice place to hang out at.
nice hostel, well situated, 20 min to venice beach on foot, markets in neighborhood. great stuff. big rooms, clean toilets, breakfast included.

our room was remodeled and nice. one of the window blinds was getting hard to operate. i forgot to tell the staff that. the entrance where the office is  could be remodeled. it doesn't look that good when you first go in. they could consider getting better couches for the day room also. but overall we really  enjoyed our time.   the atmosphere was great and the staff was friendly!

on the checkout day while i was having breakfast i was told-" u need to vacate the room at 10 as we need to change sheets.you know how it works,right"   i was never informed of this rule during checkin and i felt it was really rude to say so and do so without prior information.and yes i do not know how it works unless u tell me in advance.

pretty hard and confusing to find, but got there in the end. way too expensive for what you get but i guess one of the only options. they only have one parking spot which is annoying too. nice kitchen  and staff. fair bike ride down to the boardwalk and any shops. okay for a night

best place i&#39;ve been in playa del rey area and i cannot ask for more, close to in&out, costco, awesome chinese restaurant, walgreen, liquor store, lots of smart people to learn from such as spacex and google. i recommend, i felt at home
i really liked this hostel. it was so welcoming and totally friendly. i would highly recommend going here, and i would definitely go again.
this is a house so more like a air b n b feel than a hostel . couldn't fault it . perfect for 2 nights

pretty chill hostel close to venice beach. felt kind of more like a airbnb place because it is just like a house in which everybody is living together. however i really enjoyed my stay and i would recommend this hostel to anybody who wants to spend some days in la and doesn't mind sleeping in a bigger dorm together with other travellers.

really lovely hostel with lovely staff and charming character to the hostel itself, definitely from the old school of hostels and a welcoming homely feel with books and games which personally i prefer to flashier more clinical modern hostels. ian welcomed me and helped me with directions and it had everything i needed, and a cup of tea :)
best hostel ever! the staff was super friendly and accommodating.
my friend and i stayed here nye and had a great time chatting with the staff and other travelers. we really enjoyed he lounge area and it's laid back vibe.  i would definitely stay here again.
its was the worst hostel i've ever been! and it was different from what we saw in the website and the room was so dirty and there was bugs in the bathroom!     im not satisfied at all.

when i first walked into this hostel, i was ecstatic - it looked like a warm, family-like crowd, the hostel was basically like a giant house, and everything was extremely laid back and alternative. however, security is practically non-existent (you charge us $5 to keep our bag on a pool table in plain view? seriously?), dorm room is incredible mess, no a/c or heating,  staff is kinda random, and it's a solid 30-min walk to venice beach. thank god was only there for 1 night.
had a wonderful stay thank you for being such lovely welcoming people and making me feel right at home!!!

the hostel on the whole was decent but we were relocated to their other location which was a remarkable disappointment as it was dingy and had an overall unpleasant atmosphere. the bedroom had a bad smell with old creaky bunk beds, the kitchen was unequipped with basic utensils. if you decide to stay here please request that you not get booked at their other location which looks like they got it right after some untidy person abandoned it all of a sudden.

the ensuite room had a toilet literally inside the room, without a door. the showers were shared only and are not in the room for private use. there was a jacuzzi tub in the room which was practically unusable because of the lack of heating in room. also, the hostel is actually a few blocks farther from the beach as compared to the address shown on website and in online booking. that made it very difficult to walk to the beach. also, there is no mention that they charge for payment by card.

didnt stay in main place but a house converted off washington.blvd. its very homey but its an old hous so dont expect modern comforts but more country lodge type deccor.and atmosphere. cannot fault staff they were.   lovely. day fee and luggage storage on top of already expencive room fee is charged. not sure how routine this is for usa. beds not too comfortable. not sure i would stay again for the same money. but then again it is la?!

close to venice beach (15min walk) and one block away from bus stops. it's a house converted into a hostel so expect facilities according.  nice and confortable, very friendly people, breakfast it's good and very complete, toasted bread and cereal, some fruit, milk and orange juice.

i admit that i booked this stay in a hurry after a stressful change of plans. excited to find private room with shared bath for $45/night. didn't realize it was per bed & i would be charged for unoccupied bed as well, nor that the $35 "deposit" was really an additional fee would not be deducted from my total. i would never have paid $100+/night for a dirty room (i vacuumed the toenail clippings & other detritus), above the smoking hangout, w/hairy shower, & empty tp. staff nice but inflexible.

the staff are fantastic and the location is great but the room had no curtains and the bathroom had no locks so you would be in the shower whilst someone was in the toilet. i would stay again but this is not a hostel for anyone afraid of a commune style vibe.

nice place, staff super friendly and helpful. it is a 20-25min walk to the beach but that doesn't bother me my diet goes out the window when on holiday so the extra walking is a good thing or you can hire a bike and no issue. highly recommend you cycle between santa monica and venice beach during your stay.

thank you anna for the great effort of explaining the things to do, place to visit and food to eat. it was really a good place to stay where the staffs were very friendly and they do introduce good places to visits and invite guest to great place to hang out together. good job!!
it was awesome staying at the venice beach hostel! the staff was honestly amazing, very nice people at the hostel. the facility had a very familiar atmosphere and i felt welcome immediately.

if you want a friendly environment with an abundance of cultural and welcoming people, then this is the place for you. i felt welcomed the second i walked in and i've made memories with them that i'll remember for the rest of my life.
ayou will find a very nice crew there. nicest hostel staff i ever met. felt like family after just a few hours.
great, relaxed atmosphere.

this was my first hostel experience and i would definitely go back! my main concerns were bed bugs but i saw nothing like that or anything else that grossed me out. of course the bedding/towels weren't brand new, but everything was very well maintained. ian knew my name from the first phone call i made to the hostel, and other staff members were just as attentive. the people i met there really added to my experience. i now have friends all over the world. :)

i can not speak higher of this hostel. i have stayed in hostels all over the continental us and this one has become one of my favorite stays. the owner could not be any nicer or any more hands with his buildings. i will be staying here in the future and would recommend it to anybody staying in in venice beach area.
great stay, friendly people.    just don't confuse with similarly named hostel near the beach and could use a sign out the front.
felt temporary

the place is a good deal for a a few days with a low budget. the atmosphere was ok, the staff (the russian girl) was very helpfull. the place is a little bit to far from the beach, maybe 20 min walking or more, it could be closer, but had a nice stay.
it was really nice, the breakfast area is great.

the staff were very friendly and respectful. i arrived after 11:30 pm and they were accepting and friendly. they helped me with my bags and helped me with information about what to see in la. the hostel vibe is awesome and the people were amazing.

we turned up and there was a man laying on the couch who told us he worked there but it was his day off so couldn't check us in. we had to awkwardly wait with this man for 30 mins until a woman who was working arrived. we were shown to our cramped room with mattresses on the floor (not beds) with a small fan in the corner of a very hot room. there was one mixed bathroom with no locks on doors with two showers for over 30 people on the top floor.  games room was a dingy garage with no games.

atmosphere was really good. everything was perfectly working such as lockerz, wifi, etc. location is also good. it only takes 10-15 min to go to beach on foot. there are bus stops close to the place. i recommend this place. it worths.
the address in the website is wrong and they don´t provide any fans for the hottest nights, much noise and the say they have parking but the parking is on the street.

great location, 15 minute walk from the beach (can also hire bicycles)cheapest hostel in venice! the staff were really friendly and approachable, the facilities are clean. the best hostel we found in la! would highly recommend.

no locks on bathroom doors so it's free for all to come in. 2 showers and 2 toilets between 18 people. no safe space to lock up your bags. bunk bed felt like the were going to fall to bits, so people were moving mattress on to space on the floors. felt like a bit of make shift attempt of a hostel.

fantastic! this hostel rocked my socks. their location was in a central area, easy to access buses, transport to the airport, close to the beach and the famous venice beach boardwalk. there are loads of hole in the wall and swanky bars around for whatever your tastes are for a good night out also! of course, i have to mention, their staff was on par. absolutely friendly and so so helpful with everything! you will not regret your stay here one bit!

this hostel is awesome. such a great, chilled out vibe. it doesn't feel like a hostel at all. everyone is social and more often than not you'll find yourself hanging out with people you met earlier that day! i've stayed here twice and if i ever return to la i will staying again! there are lockers (bring a padlock), the kitchen is available for use, breakfast in the mornings. it's a $1 bus ride away from the airport and the beach is a 15min walk away. thoroughly recommend to social people!

we got to the address that was on the website which isn't where the hostel actually is so we ended up walking a mile after looking online for the hostel and see there are 2, when we get there it's not the right one, he gives us the real address of the place we are suppose to be staying and we get a bus back. after an hour and a half we get there and it turns out it's a house. the beds are uncomfortable the bathroom is a family bathroom with one shower and one toilet with no real privacy.

excellent location. my partner and i stayed in the twin bed private on washington blvd, facilities were sufficient and clean. staff are accodating enough but i was told i could park on oxford avenue (next to washington blvd) and i ended up getting a $63 due to road sweeping the day after i arrived in the country.
the place is not at all good to live. they stuff the crappy rooms with about 10 people. the rooms are somehow crappy. toilets are not good at all.

helpfuo staff, but it it's nit a real hostel it's just some kind of appartment for up to 14 people with just 1 bathroom, it's a bit far too far to the beach to be named "beach hostel" 20 min walk to the beach, very old bunk beds, it's ok if you don't expect nothing but otherwise it's not worth the money+ they charge you 15$ for buying by credit card!!
for the price it really wasn't very good. beds need new matresses.
warm & welcoming staff with respectful guests. positive energy in a casual social setting.

we checked in to a 6 bed dorm, with no air conditioner, no fans, so hot we had to have windows open, with cars/trucks driving down the main road at all hours of the night, resulting in next to no sleep, it was extremely hot and uncomfortable without anything to keep us cool, the bunk beds felt like they were going to break considering how unstable they were, a pull out bed blocked the the entrance to the room, meaning we had to squeeze in and out of the dorm, the toilet didnt flush.

excellent location for the beach and felt very safe. the facilities are however a bit unclean and it would be nice to shower with some more privacy but as a young female it never felt unsafe. very relaxed environment, it may have been the timing but after socialising loads in previous hostels people kept themselves to themselves here.
the bunks are not the best, but the house is charming, and the place safety and full of live. love it!

good breakfast, location was alright, but  it's actually not really close to the beach. the beds were totally worn out and almost all the facilities were moldy and dirty. our room was very small. we had a window directly to a busy street, but there was no possibility to completely close it, which made the room very noisy. no air conditioning was available. staff varied between friendly and creepy. we did not feel comfortable at any moment and felt quite insecure in addition. stay somewhere else!
this place was pretty grimy and quite far away from venice beach. it was overpriced and mediocre.
dirty and uncomfortable. definitely not a nice experience.

this hostel is ok if you're staying for one or two nights, but i wouldn't recommend a longer stay. the atmosphere was nice but compared to other hostels this didn't offer clean towels or bedding,  there was no ac, the madrasses felt dirty and  completely worn out.
i think the main hostel (yale) is pretty much cooler
iain was super helpful.

i am an american student backpacking around my own country and i have been staying in hostels always, i booked this hostel when the l was in los angeles and when i got there they refused to let me stay, they said they don't allow americans and they never returned my deposit money.

the lovely staff failed to make up for the extensive flaws. whilst the communal kitchen and living areas were fine, the bed was the worst i've stayed in - no barrier for the top bunk combined with a very low quality mattress and bed frame meant it never felt like a safe sleep.     this is a review for the overflow property on yale avenue, which is further from the beach than the one advertised, though it is still walkable.

a good hostel especially for younger travelers. many students from all around the world. always something going on.  even if the location is announced as 716 washington blvd, i had no problem to find the correct location (yale ave) for check-in (got an email right after the booking). venice beach is a almost 20 min walk and lax 30 min by bus.
clean place,  strange location with a hobo hang out outside. heard them shouting all night. staff is super cool and friendly. big confusion with the "other" location.

the hostel was passable, but not ideal. i wouldn't have liked to stay there for more than one night. the address given on the hostel was not where we were actually supposed to go - please change it to the yale avenue address! the 13-bed dorm was very crowded, and became smelly through the night, and people were not that considerate about coming in late and making noise.  however, the service was very friendly and helpful, and the breakfast was nice.
helpful staff, clean hostel and nice location

this hostel has 2 locations (one close to the beach, the other a 20min walk from the beach). the 2 locations makes it more difficult to create a good environment with great ambiance. the beds were old and are due to renew. but every person gets new sheets which was good. the bathroom needed a good clean(water and sand all over the floor). i think that if this hostel was located in only one place, it would have made my stay a lot better. it felt more as renting an apartment for a few nights.
the staff were all amazing and so friendly.
all good! ian is a great guy. thanks for having me ;)
excellent staff, very friendly and helpful.

no lockers in or near the dorms. i was in the second location which is closer to 30 than 15 minutes walk from the beach. the place is a bit scruffy. and it costs $5 to leave your bag in the unlocked garage for a day after you check out.

"the venice beach hostel" (this hostel) and "venice beach hostel" are two completely different hostels. the venice beach hostel isn't even located to venice beach, it's in marina del rey. why the pictures of venice beach? it's  a good 25 minute walk to the beach. also, they moved us to "the other hostel". my rating is of the "other hostel". it's a old unit which has been coverted into a one bedroom (6 beds) and a single private. this wasn't even a hostel!

great location for getting busses and trains into hollywood and la.  also not too far from disney.   stayed at the 2nd location on yale avenue which was a 15min walk or more to venice and muscle beach.  chilled out relaxed atmosphere safe area  great stay

so the staff was really nice and helpful all the time and they gave good advices for trips all around los angeles. nevertheless in my opinion towels would be needed in the bathroom for drying hands, the toilets smelled bad and the blankets seemed not to be washed for every new traveler (either they should be washed every time or they should use sheets/covers).
nice and quiet but a bit far from the main activities. great staff and clean rooms.
everything was good ! the hostel us nice ans zen and 20 min to walk for the beach   thank you so much !!   xxx
friendly and helpful staff regarding the area and things to do. pleasant stay. bathrooms a bit lacking in privacy for the female travelers.

while there are things that are rustic in nature i love the atmosphere of this place. people are laid back and there is a hominess to the facility. after staying in a few other hostels this one remains my best pick out of all of them.

we booked a private room with bathroom and it was not disclosed that it was without a shower. also the location of hostel is not clear we thought we booked closer to the ocean but when we arrived they said the only private wasd at the other hostel further away.
you can not even lock the shower as it just has a curtain. there were not ladders to the top bunk.
good breakfast, nice staff

great location - 10 min walk to venice beach. double room was extremely simple and located in the other building on washington (main bld is on yale). this location is less crowded so probably cleaner and quieter, but the main house feels more "homey", also the majority of the guests stay there so more people to hang out with. breakfast is great and the bike rental is very cheap. ian the owner is super cool and kind. overall great atmosphere but expensive for what you get with the double room.

had a wonderful stay. got picked up straight from the airport! it's in a great location, there are 2 venice beach hostels which can be a bit confusing- that's my only criticism. the people are so friendly and helpful. thanks ian for answering all our questions! there are lockers (bring your own lock) and in terms of security i felt safe in the hostel. kitchen is all you expect and the free breakfast is very nice. big shared bathroom, good price, would stay again. sarah and loretta
nice, but basic hostel. not that close to the sea.

great stay, 10 minute walk to the venice beach awesome bars and shops close by, great kitchen for cooking for your self. ian the owner is very helpful and great chat. definitely recomend to anyone looking to fully enjoy their time in la

attention: this hostel is not at the venice beach!! when i booked and checked on google maps it showed it would be right next to the beach. in addition to that they just transfered me to another hostel (first they said it would only be for check in) which turned out to be in a calm neighbourhood, about 30 minutes walk to the beach (the hostel staff kept saying 15 minutes which is absolutely not true, i talked to other people in the hostel). i wouldn't recommend this hostel honestly.

the hostel was one of the worst we've ever been. the address mentioned on the website of hostelword.com was not possible to find. we drove around more than 2 hours. after we had the right address they did not have all our reservations. they gave us additional mattresses but no blankets. it was a joke. in the morning, we found the most terrible bathroom. the shower was for men and women but no key to close the door. and the shower curtain was grey from dirt. just terrible! dont go there!!!!

it took me four hours to find this hostel - inc. 2 buses &2 taxis - 1 taxi gave up trying to find the hostel. the address on website doesn't exist. when i checked in although it was 2am the hostel employee was drunk. he didn't have my booking despite me showing my hostelworld reservation. he told me the hostel was full and "made me a spot" which was a very thin foam mattress with a sheet over it on the bare floor under a staircase and charged me $30.the lady working in morning was very rude.

despite airport pick up advertised this was not available on our stay which was disappointing. we booked a private double with ensuite which turned out to be 2 camp beds with a bathtub and toilet in the same room - not what we were expecting! staff not particularly friendly or helpful - unable to provide recommendations. also location wise, at least a 25 min walk to venice beach and not too much around the hostel itself. wouldn't recommend.
friendly staff . hosel in a convenient and safe location
a great place! very welcoming, nice staff, feels like home (:
lovely staff and other people there. this place is cozy and has a nice setup to encourage folks to chat with each other.

ian, the host, is a great guy.  the location is all right, not right on the beach, but close enough.    on the other hand, if you're a us citizen (not "international"), they're not sure if they want you.   it does explain that on their site, but it's fine print.    also, as others have mentioned,  the address is confusing.   in the gps, the place is marina del rey, not venice beach.       but regardless, it's a great place and as i say, ian is first rate.

welcome was the worst of stay,with reservation i got message to check-in at another site,later we also had to sleep there!no keys for rooms!hard to find sites-no signs that make you recognize that these are "hostels".also in afternoon there was nobody to welcome us.breakfast is ok,but all sites are not of common standard-price-performance ratio=really bad! also charged us more than said in hostelworld email!!  sorry but do not understand who made the other comments here on hostelworld!

the staff of this hostel is one of the best i've ever seen. they are helpful, really kind and they make you feel at home. this hostel is more like an old house, so that gives something special to the atmosphere, it's nice. the furniture is quite old, especially the beds/mattresses. they should really think about new matesses, because it's not good for your back.   the breakfast is nice and the neighbourhood is nice, it's safe to go outside (also at night).
it is not a real hostel, it is a old house with a place to sleep. the private room is inside tha bathroom. to be very honest, it is expensive for what it is. just for sleep is ok.
nice, relaxing hostel in a great area! the staff are great, very helpful.

the hostel is pretty nice. it's a big house that now is a hostel. the location is very good to. the staff were friendly. i had a great stay there. the mattress could be a little more comfortable, but it was ok.

15-20 min from the beach, clean, but crowded room and only two showers and toilets  breakfast alright, kitchen and living room nice  too expensive for what you get, old beds and uncomfortable mattresses, little weird that the staff sleeps in same room  deposit actually a fee (so you still have to pay the whole amount when you arrive, unless you already have paid a deposit to hostelworld...)
great hostel, lovely, helpful people. perfect stay. many thanks

the bathrooms have no lock, there were only locks for the toylet part.  i was not wake for the rush hours of the bathroom, but i think that it would not be enough. we even got the private room with bathroom, with consists of one big room with one toylet and one tub, no doors separating anything, no shower.
i liked this place so much the first time around, that when i had to go back to la, i decided to stay here again. that pretty much says everything about the hostel.

the hostel doesn't have a reception area, no towels for free, no paper or towel to dry hands in the bathrooms, no heater in the dorms and hostel (which is bad during the winter), no living room to play games. the hostel is far from the beach. no cool and cheap places to go near the hostel. the staff is weird. they don't like to do the things with technology and they have non sense rules.

only one bathroom with one toilet for an apartment for 10 guests can be pretty difficult. its been also damn cold in the rooms, because you cant really close all windows. ok, maybe california in december isnt such a good idea, but anyway, freezing at night with a paid roof over the head is sad. but to be fair: the furniture and location is pretty good :)

it's a really good hostel, it's like family house. the location is perfect for that people that want to visit venice beach and santa monica. the staff is nice, the help you in all you need and the treat you in a really friendly way. i had a good experience in this hostel so i recommend it to every traveler

staff were lovely and it's a real cosy place to stay. it's 15 minutes away from the beach (there's another one nearer to the beach but we were put up here instead because the other one was full) and close to a grocery store and bars.
fantastic atmosphere, nice personel. had a great time!

this place has two addresses most likely you will not be able to check in with the listed address. make sure to check your emails!! staff were helpful and the area is good and it's easy to get to the airport!

we had our problems even in finding the hostel reception because the room was in a different building, half a mile away. they provide free parking, but it's the 2-hour-parking next to the street (we had a ticket after). the price is much too high for this shabby room (very small and unheatened). the bathroom was dirty with a carpet soaked up with water. when we talked to the employees there, they were not at all reasonable. a very bad deal (we are long term travellers and saw a lot of hostels).

the kitchen is terribly dirty, microwave has 3 years worth of food in it. i had to change arrival dates and this angered the hostel owner, i could understand that if the hostel was at capacity, but it was empty. not a pleasant experience.
when i stayed here, hot shower was broken!! so i could use only cold shower;(. but the staff is kind:). this is a nice hostel.

some people might not like it but i think that the fact that the hostel is set in what it looks like a big house makes it really cozy and welcoming. staff is very helpful and kind and i didn't have any issues with dirt or anything like that. my stay was very pleasant and i made some really nice traveling memories there. the breakfast is good and the laundry machines have a fair price. i recommend it to anyone!
hostel has a very great and relaxed atmosphere, and it's wonderfully located just a 10 minute walk away from venice beach.

the staff is outstanding and very welcoming! the way they have greeted me and went out of their way to show me the highlights of the surrounding, can definitely make a difference when staying in a new city! thanks for that...
the hostel was great everything you need and more with breakfast and friendly staff. iain the boss was great very funny english man, i had a great stay !!! see you guys soon

i bought one privete room with privete bath, and the room has no shower and the sanitare vase in the midle of the room. totaly digusting!!!!  i had to transpass into the other room to reach my room!!! is this private????? very bad!!!!

very cosy place. like a small house where good people meet and hang out:-) slept both in the private room in the main house and in the dorm. decided to have a few days extra there since the place was so good. really friendly staff as well. recommended:)

location was not as expected. the room was very tiny and not value that price. the kitchen was well equiped but in total the place was pretty used. it was far away from the beach. they also run two facilities, so you have to run from one to another to get breakfast or to get access to the laundry. before booking try to make sure the room is in yale ave because regarding the facilities it's the more convenient one, but it's more far to the beach. you have pay an extra charge for credit card.

the hostel is in a good location, close to a grocery store, several restaurants and car rentals.  the bathroom and kitchen were okay and kept clean. the laundry room was also functional. to use the washing machine it cost $2 and the dryer $1.5 which is not too bad.   the only negative thing to say, is that the owner is phishy. he seems friendly, but he rips off travelers and blames hostelworld. after paying the deposit online, he demands full payment though you have paid a sum already.

everything was great besides these 3 things.    1. wifi would not always work  2. bed feels like they are going to fall to pieces   3. not alot of privacy in the bathrooms.     but you get what you pay for. i enjoyed my stay.

hostel world confirmation didn't include sufficient information for us to find the hostel. there are two locations and neither is marked or signposted in anyway, and you are required to check in at only one site so if your room is at the other it is another 4 block walk back.we were told that a follow up email is usually sent with more detailed instructions but we received no such email. and booking at short notice there may not be time to receive it before you are on your way. very frustrating!

this place was ok... a bed to sleep in and a hot shower, but the woman on shift when i went to shower didn't know where the key was for the towel closet and i had to dry off using other clothes i bought. the bed above me was also extremely loud when another girl in the room could not sleep at night. the woman than checked me in was very knowledgeable and pleasant and the location felt safe which was important.

the worst place i ever statyed at, the adress were wrong so got to a "house" first and then we had to walk to another house. in there it was so dirty and small. it couldnt been cleaned there for weeks. the window had no glass and it everything was so bad. we couldnt stay for an hour. never book this place!!!   it worst than hell!
it was a nice hostel. it was really hard to find as it just looks like a house no sign outside. they had a really great breakfast.
very nice place.  little bit dirty and huge fees if you décide to pay by credit card
very good place in santa monica. it's full with young people. fully recomend :)
this hostel is very comfortable for students. it's really not expensive, nice atmosphere and clean place, also near the beach and excellent view of the pacific ocean. thanks a lot for everything.

just brilliant!    i don't really understand, why other people haven't enjoyed their stay at venice beach hostel.  my friend and i, who stayed there, found it just brilliant.  staff was nice and in general, people there just were.    so all in all i have nothing to say but to go there if you need a place to stay in venice. and it doesn't really matter, what so ever, that they put 9 beds in the 8 bed room. you only need the place to sleep.
nice relaxing household environment

we arrived and had booked for three nights after arriving i told the staff we would only stay one night we asked for our money back for the third night following their 48hr return policy, she said to speak to the manager in am. the manager in the am told us it was not possible as it was now  past the 48 hrs. the hostel room wreaked of b.o .there was no visible front counter, the internet was slow to non existent. we stayed out as late as possible to avoid sleeping there upon return at 4am no loc
excellent atmosphere .. met very cool people ..

the prices being charged to stay here are absurd. they had two locations, mine had one bathroom for almost 15 people. no hand towels or paper towels in the kitchen or bathroom. one of the guys came to clean and he literally just wiped things to make it look clean. they don't mention that they want you to pay in cash and if you don't they will charge like $10 to use your visa. both locations are run down. the beds were so unstable that one guy had to put his mattress on the floor to sleep.

the place was very neglected. the kitchen had ants crawling all over the surfaces and in the cupboards. the beds were really outdated, i ended up falling out of mine during the night twice and was forced to sleep on the floor, i told a member of staff and he said choose another bed, but that was also very unstable. the hostel doesn't state that there is another location where you must first check in, half a mile down the road!
nice place to chill out. close to the beach and all of the venice beach area. also quite close to funky cafés and bars. staff are super friendly and helpful.
ian was amazing, really knowledgable about bus routes and things to do in the area, however the facilities and location are not good enough to justify the price.
ian was awesome, super helpful and knowledgeable, however the rooms were crowded and lacked security.

great hostel, has a great atmosphere met lots of other nice travellers. never review hostels but because the staff were so friendly felt i owe them to return the favour. ian one of the staff is a legend.
good location, nice staff, had a great time there!

my first time visiting a hostel my mind had taken a different picture. when i arrived i was greeted by a friendly crowd of hostel goers and then to a staff member, ian. probably the only reason i had stayed in america as long as i did. great walk to the beach, local amenities with 7/11 being 5 minutes away. as well as fast food chains. cheap laundry services and 1 dollar coca colas. bonus. would recommend this location to anyone!
staff were friendly, especially ian and gave us directions. always had time for our questions.   lovely breakfast.

location was great, less than a mile from the beach. staff were always very friendly and extremely helpful. bedroom, living-room, kitchen, and bathroom were also very nice and comfortable. absolutely no complaints whatsoever, could not ask for a nicer hostel.
my stay at the beach hostel in venice was awesome. even though it was only a couple of days we definitely made the most of it. staff were very welcoming. cheers, james
you get what you pay for. cheap, great location, polite and easy going staff.

all in all, a decent place.  it is decently located for la standards, pretty close to venice beach (everything else is at least an hour away), staff were friendly and willing to help when needed, there were lots of young guests from all over the globe which gave it a nice atmosphere.  on the downside. there were only 2 unisex toilets and showers for the entire hostel. there was not a lot of privacy if you wanted to shower or go #2. also, the doors were wide open all day which felt kind if unsafe
i read very bad reviews about this hostel the first time before to book it but now i can tell that it was a great place to stay with a staff always ready to help you. moreover it was clean.
