had an amazing stay and the venice beach hostel, great staff and awesome travellers were staying here which made it lots of fun. only down fall was that someone had stolen some clothes that we had left to dry on the balcony of one of the dorm rooms. not the hostels fault but really was a downer of the trip

i loved my stay at venice beach hostel (even came back after a short trip to catalina island). the atmosphere is friendly, the staff is very helpful and nice, everything is very clean and cozy. it´s not a party hostel it´s more of a feeling of coming home while traveling.  the location is pretty good as well: 20 min walk to the beach and a lot of buses around the corner which take you almost everywhere.  would definitely stay there again!

only one is positive : the location !   the security:any one can gets in and one without being disturbed / staff (shift night): a way behind expected. the guy didn't know that i paid a deposit and have me paying the full price for two nights, and charged me 5$ for using a visa card/ the motel is dirty, and the kitchen is disgusting, the walls are creepy. the rooms were stuffed with people and stuff all over the floor, i had truble getting to my bed. no plugs in the rooms  not recommended!!

the staff were great, very helpful and kind. the hostel had a home vib to it which i enjoyed. the other guests were really nice. the location is good, close to grocery shopping and convenience. it's not the cleanest hostel i've been to but i still really enjoyed me self! thank y'all :)

as of summer 2014 this address is not correct. took a taxi to the address listed here and there was nothing there. this was at 3am in la. tried calling them and they gave me poor directions to another address! never even got there and had to sleep rough on my first night in los angeles!

the staff was super specelly ian :) helpt you out wothe whatever u needed. he also knew everyboodys name staying at the hostel if just for one night.   liked that it wasnt screaming here we have a hostel.   /swedes staying    all and all absolutley worth the moeney. specilly thanks to ian! the downside was the kitchen, lots of flys.
we felt unsafe the whole time. the beds were falling apart and there was little to no security
very good hostel
we chose to stay at friends place instead and left venice beach hostel after just a few hours. my mistake not to read the   reviews before booking this place - they all seem to be true.
the dorm is extremely crowded and the beds are old and filthy. limited bathrooms and shower facilities. friendly staff. cheap place to stay but nothing else redeeming.
do not stay here!!! there simply isn't enough space in this comment box to express how disgusted we were with the place! it's an absolute disgrace!
miss one thing in this youth hotel, one phone who working..
the staff were extremely friendly, very nice atmosphere, feels like a home more then a hostel.
cool place, nice people and a great place to stay
wrong location. the new address had a nice neighborhood with a local pub that i liked. had turtle race in the backyard of the pub. haven't seen that before.

i loved this hostel!! it has a great atmosphere and everyone is so lovely. the staff are like your friends and it really feels like a big home. whilst the facilities are nothing flashy, they are clean and comfortable.  i stayed at the house that was further away from the beach. it was about a 15 minute walk so we rented bikes from them. recommend renting bikes anyway so you can go up to santa monica. was very sad to leave and can't wait to go back sometime. would eagerly recommend this hostel.

staff were all really friendly and helpful and kitchen had great facilities with really good breakfast. bathrooms were clean with good showers and we didn't have any issues in waiting for them but i can see how that could be a problem. there were quite a few mattresses on the floor where people had to sleep on which i wouldn't be happy about!! location isn't bad but the address on hostel world is wrong which meant we spent an hour walking around trying to find it! not signposted at all...
it's really not a good place to stay in la
can't complain here, great location, great people, great cheap eats in the area to
this hostel is vert nice it looks like a house but everything is open and they have only 2 mixed bathrooms it's not convenient and annoying ..the location is very good !
this is the worst hostel i have ever been in. the staff is unfriendly, all the doors open and the rooms very dirty. i caught bedbuks there!

stayed during a busy period so were told that we were staying at the 'overflow' location. it was the one advertised but, it was basically just a flat with 2 long term stayers so really it just felt like we were encroaching on their space. only 1 toilet/ shower room so getting access to it was hard work with 6 people staying here. free breakfast and all other advertised facilities are at the other location. no atmosphere. some staff were nice, mostly we just felt in the way. not worth the price.
the staff were very friendly and helpful. my friend and me slept together in one bed it was small and very uncomfortable. there were only two bathrooms for approx. 26 persons.

this is a party hostel. if you want to have a good nights sleep to get up at a decent time the next morning this is not the place for you. the outside common area is directly below the rooms so it can be very loud throughout the night. the beds are very uncomfortable.
great host ian, very professionel , spend the time to make sure we knew the area, facilitet, what to se. very helpfull and a great place to stay :)  sincerly tina and kenneth
breakfast too late 9-10am

staff..one member very unenthusiastic, didn't have much to say..i was only notified on the day that i would be staying in the 'extra building' that the hostel has.. which is a tatty house, really not worth the $35 i paid a night..you couldn't call it a hostel, it was a house with beds thrown in, a couple of dodgy camper beds too, bad wifi connection and a good 20 minute walk to the beach, not great when i was expecting a 5 or less, overall left me with a disappointing 2 days to end my trip.
is was old and crappy
average stay for a hefty price! i guess los angeles can be quite pricey, however i still don't think this is good value for money.

i took a risk to stay in venice after reading bad reviews.  but it's completely opposite,  dont believe review and relax. around the world hostels are suppose to budget with friendly atmosphere.  thanks venice beach hostel and ian. my experience, book 2 days and get free ride from airport.  its in very good location and mr. ian made my los angeles easy by providing city tips. everything is available from cable tv to bike rental.  breakfast include and free wifi. i got full day tour in luxury van

great staff :) make you very welcome....need to sort out the toilet situation and reception thing out . if they had a reception and female male toilets n showers, or at least locks , would b best hostel in venice!!!
one gripe was the size of the security lockers, couldn't fit my work laptop in to lock it up. if there was a few extra large lockers available would be great!

- address on the website doesn´t match the actual address and there isn´t any indication that it 's a hostel;  - they said it was 15min walk to the beach, when actually it´s at least 30min;  - hygiene is not good and my friend woke up scratching;  - i

had an awesome time here, the staff and travellers are friendly. easy to get to from airport by public bus, then it's easy to get around la with public buses/metro. beach is a short walk away. rooms, kitchen and bathrooms are clean. free breakfast is an added bonus and the hostel is close to restaurants for lunch/dinner.

- first issue, the address registered in this page is not the same, i think this is a scam , i mean i all the time was thinking that we will be in the other address a few blocks from the beach.  - bad service.  - bad attitude of a few people of the front
the staff at the hostel is very friendly and helpful. also the common areas are really nice. the rooms are large and leave enough space for everyone.

my girlfriend and i booked the double room at the venice beach hostel for one night.  immediately after booking i received an email stating that the owner had two locations one on venice beach (as advertised) and another which was pretty far from the beach and not mentioned in the ad. this was disappointing as there wasn't much nearby and was misleading.  the 'double room' didn't have a double bed but 2 folding single beds pushed together and the toilet was in the same room as the beds.
we rented a private room and it was a glorified walk in closet/bathroom with two cots jammed inside.  not exactly what we expected.  i would never stay here again.
the best hostel i ever stayed. friendly, clean and safe. feels like home atmosphere.  definitely will stay again.
the hostel doesn't have the best location, 20 min walk to beach.. but the staff is super friendly, it feels kinda like hanging out with the family in the evening. it's clean and nice.
would definitely come back
m ost enjoyable. excellent atmosphere.staff and guests friendly and helpful. convenient to all services.a memorable stay for all the right reason
chilled as hostel, great place for newcomers to la
i came from barcelona and i had an excellent time, good location, it's a kind of familiar hostel and amazing staff, always stay tuned to help you.  totally recommend.
there are just much better hostels in the area, if you dont mind people walking in on you in the shower or rampant fleas in your bed, then this is definitely the hostel for you.

every staff such a good person but it's not everything. first of all, bedbugs ruin everything. we're staying in hostels to have fun but if you are itching everytime, sorry that is not acceptable. and they are doing nothing about it. second of all, you cannot lock the door when you're in bathroom. what is that ? the other thing is, i dont understand what kind of hostel is it because is no hostel sign aroud the building. if you dont have phone, it's imposible to find it.
i paid for the private bedroom and findout it was only a big bathroom. no privacy to use the toilet or the bathtub (there was no shower). what a joke.
i loved it! the gratest people...

the staff were awesome, the hostel facilities were pretty standard, the whole place could of done with a proper clean. the hostel itself is actually about a 20 minute walk from venice beach, so if you're expecting beachfront you will be a little disappointed. also they have a problem with bed bugs.

when i stayed here there were bed bugs found and instead of getting the fumigator in, the owner merely changed the sheets.......not acceptable, the guest concerned was not even reimbursed for his night. a toilet without a lock whilst not bothering me clearly affected other guests.
chilled out! free quick wifi! bit of a walk to the beach but buses only $1. you have to walk if your taking surfboards. great place though definetly stay again!!!

from the very moment you see the place, while being greeted by friendly staff you feel welcome and at home! the 13 person room is definitely the best choice... variety of people, yet respectful space. the mornings were inspiring. bring a friend, or go alone! safe, clean, and just perfect.
really friendly owner. met cool people here.
brilliant ! well run ! great staff. kitchens perhaps a little small. but that would be my only gripe.
ian was an amazing host but ughhh..those bed bugs is a killer to the mood. couldn't get sleep.

very basic hostel in an average location. not much going on but felt homey which is what we needed at the time. nice staff, but crazy serbian guy living there when we stayed, bit rude and over powering personality also obsessed with face off. other than that, good stay.

i have traveled all over the world and stayed in a number of hostels that were both good and bad, and i have to say that venice beach hostel is hands down my favorite one. from the moment i walked in the door the staff was warm and welcoming, and actually took the time to hang out and talk with the guests. the hostel feels more like a home for wayward travelers than just a place to crash. the atmosphere there really bred an easygoing friendly environment to talk and hang out. awesome place.

worst hostel ever. there is better ones and chipper also with free shuttle bus to airport. worst experience ever. i was not expecting anything fancy, because i knew that it was a hostel, but that was too much.
very good team, and very good relax atmosphere.  i stayed just one night but will come back there without hesitation :)
absolutely loved this place, the staff were absolutely lovely and made my stay in la awesome!

really nice hostel. little further from the beach but nice  and safer area. staff was friendly. i stayed on washington avenue,which is little bit away from the main building, but nice own tv room. good way to meet people. i dont understand the negative reviews, the other hostels are worse and more expensive. i can tell because i stayed there too.

this hostel is not in the location listed. check your email. this needs to be changed asap and is unacceptable. the staff were cool and friendly. there is no privacy in this hostel. there are no locks on the bathroom or bedroom doors. it is far away from anything, you'll need to catch a bus everywhere which was fine with me as they are pretty cheap. getting to the airport is really easy from here. i think it was 1 dollar on the bus :)

had incredible time here and i highly recommend it!! short on showers but that is easily over shadowed by the staff and atmosphere. you are probably travelling after all. only a 15 minute walk to venice beach and super close to buses that take you anywhere. you should totally stay here!

this is the worst hostel that i've ever stayed in (out of 25+) staff are ok but: the two sites are a short distance apart and the security is absolutely non-existent. anyone could walk in and out of either hostel -the second site does not have a self locking door and i walked into and around the main hostel without being challenged. as for the conditions in the main hostel: i have genuinely seen better homeless shelters: simply awful. i was actually shocked.  read other reviews before booking.

awesome hostel. staff for the most part were great. made some really cool friends, the vibe there is unreal. venice beach in general is just a really cool place to check out. free breakfast was just cereal

all the beds had bed bugs! i didn't even had a real bed, the bed was foldable. you had to share the 2 bathrooms with girls and boys - no locks, so there was absolutely no privacy!!! no lockers in the room and no keys for the front door and dorm doors, so everyone can walk into your room.
bed bugs, terrible bathrooms and unfriendly staff.
good location, only 15-20 min walk to the beach. safe area. nice atmosphere and staff!

although advertised as venice beach hostel, it wasn't located by the beach or even in venice. (marina del ray). don't be fooled by the address on the website, or on hostel world.  upon arrival we were immediately charged an extra 10% for "tax" which wasn't at all suggested by the confirmation email. some staff were good and friendly; others were creepy and offensive. only 2 showers (no locks) and 2 toilets between thirty guests. the beds are also riddled with bed bugs. enjoy your stay ;)

the place is not clean at all, and there are bedbugs. and there is a person he's really annoying and strange. so shortly, the place is not nice at all and avoid it. they also got some fake photos on hostel world. and the hostel is far away from the beach.

although we enjoyed our time in vencie beach the hostel was a fair walk from the beach we also found the (shared) bathroom floor had blood all over it when we arrived and also that we were booked at another site/ location that we were not made aware of until arrival and where we had to drag our bags over gravel to the other site ( just not ideal after getting off a 15 hr flight) kinda wish they would have just given the address of the other place for the bus to drop our bags there
it was my first time at a hostel and i really enjoyed it. met some awesome people who i hanged with most of my stay

i thought that this was a great hostel in terms of value for my money and close proximities to lax airport and the beach in san monica. i would recommend others to stay there if you like to stay close to a beach and shopping.
cool friendly people and hostel staff

property is not in the location listed on hostel world, instead you receive an email after booking saying "hey we've temporarily relocated, here's our new address." not acceptable. no locks on the rooms or in general, anyone could walk into the "hostel" and into the rooms if they pleased. 2 showers between how ever many beds also not acceptable. guy who runs it very nice and helpful but whole set up just feels deceitful.

i did my reservation for 7 days, paid for reservation and received document stating that the remainder would pay on the date of entry, for total consideration less the value for booking. to my surprise, the day of entry was charged at 100%. even presenting the document, i received a bizarre explanation of fees i had to pay 2 x the amount of the booking and not got receipt.even for the long period of seven days, was not granted discount provided on the site.  there was no airport shuttle.

not to bad. it's about a mile walk to the pier and beach or a bus is right there. a super market is close too. the bed was kinda like something from 50 years back but i got over it. i never woke up for it but i'd assume the breakfast was good. because it was free. free food= good food. the staff was fine i guess. i pretty much just stayed on venice beach the whole time. price was a little high. that was the only thing i though "meeh" on. otherwise it's not bad.
very kind staff !! the place was big and the internet worked well which is not the case in all the hostels... i am overally happy with my stay there !

very disappointed, we had booked two nights but left after one. the hostel was about 2 miles from the beach which is not what we expected. our room was in a separate   building to the actual hostel, about a 10 min walk. the room was next to a busy road which made sleeping near impossible.  beds were uncomfortable and very basic. of the two members of staff the lady was pleasant and helpful, the only positive. overall we were not happy and surprised with an overall rating of c 70% on your site,
too noisy in the night, i woke up 2 times during 2 nights because of the loud noise
good social setting good staff

really nice atmosphere, as its a house made to a hostel. the bathrooms, where everybody can be in the room while you are on toilet or in the shower is a bit strange but really funny!  very nice staff. very close to venice beach (15 mins walk).  great location to hang around and meet people!

it was a 30 minutes walk from venice beach, they had bed bugs, and when i told them they only put me in another bed and the same night there was somebody else in that bed!! michael and inga were nice, but the place is not well managed, worst hostel i have stayed in so far for sure!! the beds are really uncomfortable too!!   bed bugs is a serious matter, when you find one you have to exterminate the whole place, no matter the cost, don't go there they need to exterminate the place! and they won't

all in all, the hostel was nice. information, however, is not very good. there are two locations, hostelworld.com has the wrong adress, check-in is in another place. the second place, where i slept, is like a real house with big bathroom, kitchen and living room (+ tv). but for breakfast you have to walk down to the other house. you can walk to the beach in 20min. tax is not included in the prices! for the prices i ended up paying i expected a little more comfort. the bed was really unstable.

everything's fine except one thing - changing of the rules. when i arrived i was informed that the day of departure if i leave my luggage after 2pm i would pay extra 5$ (quite surprising, but ok). the next day in the morning, the day of my departure, i was informed by another person from the staff that i would pay extra 10$. the situation was really unpleasant. finally i paid 5$ (and i wouldn't have paid more because i hate if someone plays like that). this situation left a bad impression.

i had paid $4.33  on the internet, the site said the difference i was going to pay at the hostel was $23.67 misleading)the owner made me pay at $28 saying the rate didnt include tax, i felt cheated, i slept on a torn duvet and not clean, bed.was squeaky.all night worse with the person on top, the owner pretends  to be nice but i didn't think so, he is all.about money and from a business point of view, he is going to lose. customers,improvement can be.done if constructive criticism is

very friendly salutation with a quick and informative overview for everything in and arround the hostel. the privat room was big, but you had to pass the dorm to get in! inventary was rustic but nice. toast and cornflakes as breakfast (expected more!) and a vendor for beer and softies :) good food arround.just 20min. walk to venice beach - bus also availible. good connection to the airport 30min. with big blue bus by 1$. finally i was very happy to have a nice place for my stopover. thanks a lot
inga is the best :d had a great stay. friendly and helpfull staff. good location in la. venice beach is great!

it takes 30 min to the beach by foot. in return it is a calm and safe surrounding. the stop of the blue line bus from and to the airport is 2 min away by foot. the atmosphere in the hostel is very pleasant.

loved this place (despite hating la in general) the staff were really cool people and encouraged social through chat and not loud music and free beer.  my only issue was the television, but i ignored it so that was fine. it's close to places to buy supplies and about a 20 min walk to the beach.
it was just fine... nothing else. the bed and the mattress was very old and uncomfortable.

the main property on yale seemed nice but since we had booked a private room we were further down the street. when we arrived they had just installed a carpet and the whole room was in disarray. the staff did her best to get things ready as quickly as possible. she was really nice but overly apologetic about hosteling in general. we've stayed in a lot of hostels so it seemed unnecessary that she was trying to soothe us as if we didn't get the concept and were secretly appalled. good location.

an older home converted into a hostel. good location for buses but a 20minute walk to venice beach. beds need to be repaired (i was on the top bunk which was wobbly and very creaky). linen was old/not very clean looking. rooms and bathrooms couldn't be locked (which is only ok if there are bathrooms designated female or male) so no privacy whatsoever having a shower/getting changed. staff members were friendly + helpful.

the location was a bit far from the beach.  the hostel was nearly impossible to find because hostelworld had given me a wrong address and i was never emailed the correct address.  the staff was great and friendly.  it was a plus that there was a shuttle from the airport.

staff was great! we stayed four nights, only problem that happened was in the middle of night, when (there were no staff) smoke detector started to beep in the ceiling and we couldn't turn that off..  the neighborhood was peaceful and hostel was 20 min walk from the ocean..

the staff was excellent, i only stayed one night and had to wake up before dawn the next day, so they put me in a room with less people so i wouldn't wake everyone up, and so i could get to bed earlier, very accommodating. wish i could have stayed longer the hostel seemed pretty cool with decent facilities, nice kitchen, ect.

i love this staff!!!!! they're friendly and kind;)  it's a little bit far from dm, but no problem! you can take a bus near the hostel. also, you can walk from the hostel to venice beach and santa monica! they were awesome;0 i wish i could stay more..... thank you so much!! enjoy, la!!!!!!
the beds need a bit of oil, i didn't mind that they dipped low but the creaking drove me insane :) other than that had such a lovely experience.

the staff is really nice and helpful. however the place is so cold due to bad insulation and it's not clean especially the bedrooms, they smell really bad i could not sleep in my bed cuz of the very low hygienic level of the beddings.
most of the rooms are very cold during the winter session. walking distance to venice beach about 30 minutes.
it was realy cold in the hostel in the winter
i had bedbugs!!!

hostel staff members were very helpful and friendly, and willing to share information about los angeles and venice/santa monica environment. i will give average for facilities since private room did not have showers. hostel building was very comfortable and on a positive note i want to emphasise that there is free parking on the street where the hostel is located.
we had a good time in venice beach. marco was very funny. i recommend it!
don't book here, you will pay double!!! the hostel gets nothing from the money you paid in advances. and ist more expensive... they also have weird guests including us
lovely staff, felt homely too, a pleasant stay!

the free airport pick up was a big bonus, and i was able to have good, much needed sleeps in the bedrooms - a big relief after too much time spent in noisy party hostels. the tips about the area provided on check in were also helpful.
this hostel was amazing!!!! the staff were amazing, the beer vending machine was unreal and we had the time of our lives!!!!

stayed there 7 nights. stuff was nice (actually changed for 3 times in a week!) but the owner was a bit over excited about the way we were partying, he was always complaining about his neighbors will be mad about him coz of us! they even didnt  let us to use the bbq in the backyard. 20mins walk to the beach!
good hostel, can work on a few things but overall happy with my stay.

this hostel was sold on the internet as the venice beach hostel on venice beach. the pictures on the internet were pictures overlooking the beach suggesting that the hostel was located on the beach. in fact the hostel is a twenty five minute walk from the beach! the hostel is dated and the beds are very uncomfortable, i could feel the springs from the mattress in my back. the staff were friendly but the hostel appeared to be run in a very disorganized. i would have preferred to stay elsewhere!
very nice place, you really think beeing in a hostel at 70s!
the hostel really has potential but there is just no good vibe. people here were not really up for anything and then it really ends up being just a lot of beds crammed into some space.

the hostel had fantastic character and a great atmosphere for young people and travellers.  the staff were all really helpful and friendly and made you feel safe in the area.  great value for money. always clean. lots of quirky character and decoration. location about a 20 minute walk to beach but it is located close to shops and food places. typical shared hostel rooms and front door is usually open without security we chose a private locking room for this reason but  wasn't really necessary.

we were disappointed with the hostel. having read the comments here, we knew it wasn't going to be perfect. however, it was far worse than expected. there is no security at all, the door to the hostel is always wide open. we paid for an 8-bed dorm, but got put in a 13-bed one!!! there was absolutely no space to walk in the room because the beds occupied it all. the facilities are all very old and not too clean. the owner of the hostel is greedy and rather irritating.

the hostel was a good place to stay, good location in relation to the beach and airport.  the hostel could be better if there was a little bit more information about things to do in la, maps, brochures, etc.
no security at all, only two ( dirty ) showers for everyone, the "beach"hostel is 20 min away from the beach, you pay too much for what you get.

i have to say that i loved this place! it was not spotless but one of the friendliest, most relaxed hostel i have ever stayed at. ian who runs the place is so helpful and social that it makes the whole place fun and it felt like home. security is there if you need it(lockers available) but it was such an open friendly place that i did not use one in the end. the whole place to me felt like a big old share house. awesome.
it's to expensive for what you get. to many beds in the rooms and bathrooms you can't close. i don't want people to walk into the bathroom when i shower .

the mattresses were definitely the oldest i have slept on in my hole 3 month trip. they were very uncomfortable and i also used my sleeping bag because i did not want to use the provided blankets and i´m definitely not so picky if it comes to things like this...  besides a little trouble with the owner i had a very nice stay and met a lot of nice guys. the chill out area is nice but make sure to bring a laptop or so since the provided computers to use the internet are very expensive!
a very friendly relaxed hostel. welcoming staff and within walking distance to venice beach.

this hostel was great nice little hostel with a beachy house kinda thing!!easy walk to the beach!the staff were so friendly and always there to help and give good advice!clean all the time mabe one more bath room would have been better!!nice cool rooms close by shops!

very cool hostel, in a great and safe location near bars and a beach! i was impressed that tour information was made available to me when i arrived. only improvements would be a fan in the rooms as i found it very humid in the rooms as i was travelling in the summer
friendly and welcoming staff. very cosy and comfortable. brilliant location 10 minutes walk from the beach. will definately stay here again if i'm in the area.

this is more like a huge family house. but the spirit is awesome! :) the ppl are great. you can easily make tons of frineds in no time and have interesting discussion! :) i really loved that place. but it's totally not the classic backpacker. so if you want your sardin bunk bed and standart hostel - this is not it!  this one is really special !! great spirit and pretty close to venice.  make sure to check out the channels in venice as well (not only the beach) i find the channels much much nicer

filthy rooms. sheets / blankets never changed. dust mites / fleas / bed bugs in the carpets - got eaten alive . showers have no privacy at all. it's a half hour walk to the beach. a big plus - close to lax.

hostel in nice location, although it takes about 20 minutes walking to get to venice beach. rather not a party hostel, good for people wanting to chill. hostel is in a normal house converted into a hostel. nice and helpful staff.

the owner of the hostel was extremely unprofessional, he didn't even know how to use the credit card machine. the rooms were extremely unclean, they didn't even provide proper bedding. the house was continuously left unlocked, no keys or codes were given. i am an avid traveler and this by far is the worst hostel i have stayed in.
awsome crew!

booked an 8-9 bed dorm, however on arrival we were reshuffled to the annex location of the hostel about 5 blocks down the road closer to the beach. was only a 5 bed dorm, so we will call it a win. downside was breakfast was at the primary hostel, which we needed to drive to. carparks available on street was good. good vibe. cheap vending machine onsite with beverages. one thing to note, this place is hard to find as it looks just like a residential house in nice surburban street. stay again.
best hostel i have ever stayed at!
#NAME?

super friendly and helpful staff, they know the area and are happy to give you some advice if you ask! the other guests were really nice too. however, the security was not very good, no locks on room doors, no lockers and a front door open to anyone. also, one bathroom for three dorms is not sufficient. t  for the price its a good hostelhe rooms were not very clean, but i've seen worse
spot on, no qualms at all. good, friendly place near enough to the beach.

ian, just wanted to let u know michael was rude as hell day i returned to fetch somethin i had forgotten in room (after i moved out) n he should learn how to talk to guests 'decently' if not nicely. joe was great n so is aisha. do provide soap n try make the toilet/shower area bit more cleaner..fix d downstairs shower door etc. all d best.
beer for one buck :)
when i booked it i thought it was where i stayed a few years ago. both hostels have the same name. i was not very happy to stay. at least it was only one night.

venice marina hostel was a nice stay for the pay. it was a bit confusing to arrive at the hostel and find hat we were in a neighborhood in marina del rey rather than venice beach and a block from the water as the name and address stated " venice beach hostel". apparently there are two different locations and this one is on yale avenue! it was a 20-30 minute walk to venice beach although it's not too. the transit system is very good in the area to get down to abbot kinney, the airport, venice or santa monica  and it's only 1$ each time you ride. we booked for 3 nights and stayed 3 nights. an airport pick-up was provided by ian who was very accommodating and kind. we rented the private room which was a great amount of space for two people- we had our own jacuzzi tub, two sinks at the vanity and cable! i get a bit squeamish with smells  and cleanliness so be aware in the communal bathroom area as there is some mold and the pool table room smells slightly of urine- it is an older home that could be maintained a bit better. i would recommend this hostel as it was a nice stay for the cost- it wasn't loud, everyone is nice and there is a vending machine with $1 beers and free breakfast!

my mates wallet was stollen. nothing exciting happened there. the hostel isn't actually in venice beach it was the next suburb and was easily a 25 minute walk to the beach. overall pretty average place for the price they charge
awesome place. very laidback.

weird configuration of bathrooms. the toilets should be made seperately or at least be more private. showers didn't have hangers to put your clothes or stuff on. the shower in the 2nd floor didn't allow to take your clothes off easily without getting wet. some matrassen didn't have cover sheets. blankets might have been clean but they looked liked they were from my grandma. weird pass-though door to private room in bedroom on second floor.

i very good hostel......it doesn't look like a hostel, looks like your home. people are nice and they have 1 dollar beer.........nice place stay........close to venice beach. you will not regret being there.
awesome hostel, super nice and helpful staff, good atmosphere....
the beds very uncomfortable and the linen was ragged and not very nice. the mattress springs could be felt through the mattress

this place is great if you're looking for a fun, easygoing place where you can hang out and meet cool people from all over the world.  it's more as if it's someone house - very chill.  ian, the guy who works there, was really friendly and helpful.  about a 20 minute walk to the beach.  plus it's right next to an in n out burger!  super rad place, didn't want to leave. not the most private or secure, but had a funky, cool, energetic vibe that i loved.

brilliant place to stay, staff were very helpful and extremely friendly i felt right at home straight away. we stayed in the two bed private dorm and the room was better than any hostel room i'd stayed in before!  highly recomend.

wasn't a big fan of this place and quite disappointed the reviews sounded good, it's run by all men and this gives it a slovenly old feeling to be honest. breakfast is pretty good but apart from that, the place is falling apart. holes in the floor, a shower door that fell on top of a girl getting into the shower, graffiti all over the toilet doors and not even a sign out the front to easily find it. clean enough bed clothes though.

when we arrived to this hostel there was no sign to whether it was a real hostel or not, there was no one working there and it looked really bad. we called the hostel and the man working there was out for coffee, when he came back to the hostel he was so rude and said "well its okay to leave the place unattended and i needed a coffee" we were hessitent to stay there and the man snapped at ous and told us i dont care if u live here but im charging you anyway and just walked in to the hostel.
there is 2 verice beach hostels in that area, which is very confusing.
the owner is the coolest most helpful guy we met on our travels and if you are looking for a classic venice beach experience this place cannot be missed. great place, great people, perfect hostel.
laid back hostel. quite a distance from the actual beach though
very welcoming and helpful, brought a feeling of ease and relaxation. lots of fellow aussies there when i was there. thanks
great place for the cost... very relaxed and informal environment.  friendly and fun!!

get hostel! loved the people and staff here... did have to stay down the street in a different hostel that was owned by the same owner but it was definitely not as nice but still a great stay and still allowed at the main hostel as much as we wanted. i will be here again

the venice beach is like one big share house. the staff are helpful with directions and things to do around the area. i was not concern about the security but be aware that there are no locks on the doors so use your common sense with any valuables. hollywood is a bus trip away.
great hostel! breakfast was okay, location is pretty good and the staff is very nice and helpfull! it doesn't feel like a regular hostel, but more like a normal house with living room etc.
felt very welcome.  great staff, great banter, good times!
well located for my course,they even picked me up at the airport,staff very helpful and friendly
joe scott was a wonderful host and ian was an excellent manager. i enjoyed meeting frank, kevin, and the other guests from france, the netherlands, and finland during my short stay.

this hostel is more like a large shared house than a hostel really - if you like a little privacy you may not like this. when we arrived we asked if it was okay for us to share a double bed and assured that the hostel was safe and secure. when we woke up in the morning there were two guys asleep in the front room and the front door was unlocked! the staff were friendly and refunded us some money after they over-charged us. overall: a little unorganised.

a really friendly place in a sometimes unfriendly city. in a good neighbourhood and 15 minutes walk to venice beach. the owner and staff are really friendly and you will always find one of them hanging around to talk about getting places and any other advice. the hostel is exceptionally clean, a real rarity. the only issue i had was the privacy is somewhat limited - the bathrooms do not lock so you only have the toilet cubicle and the shower door to separate you from other people in the bathroom
nice hostel with the flair of a family's house. i stayed here for two weeks and had a great time!

this hostel looks like a big house. it has a good kitchen and a good common room. there are only 2 bathrooms. the rooms are filled with beds, think we had 12 in ours in a room that is not that big. it was about an half hour walk to venice beach which was a bit of a hike.
extremely friendly staff, excellent location. good value for the money.

none of the doors have locks and the front door to the house is always open.  there are only 2 bathrooms in the entire house which had at least 10 people at all times while we were there.  overall ok stay, was extremely uncomfortable when one of the staff asked a guest if she was a "bad girl" and to come find him if she was.  ian the owner was extremely nice and hospitable.
good experience on my part, but i did overhear an older male worker making inappropriate comments to one of the female guests in the room next to me
near the venice beach,but the privacy room is a little too old

the staff is one of the friendliest staff i've encountered.  this hostel has a unique setting of being in an actual house-turned-hostel.  the facilities were clean and kept up very well.  i would recommend this hostel to anyone and will hopefully have a chance to visit it again in the future.
venice beach hostel, has all the basic necessities, it's got a good location and great staff.  best of all, you can relax and feel at home there.

overall was good. but if you are going to travel mainly to downtown, this location is a little bit too far to downtown, but very close to the beach. this hostel is pretty much cheap and what you pay what you get. i'm quite satisfied.

we had a terrible experience with this hostel.   the address is wrong. it is not in venice beach but the suburb next door, meaning no taxi driver, gps or street directory could not find the hostel.  tax was not included in the price so we ended up paying an extra $10 on arrival.  we were also treated extremely rudely and intimidated by a staff member when we asked for our money back because we were put in a 14 bed dorm instead of the 8 bed dorm we booked. he also refused to give us the manager's #.
old hostel, horrible bathrooms, worst beds, not going back...
stayed here a few times nice spot friendly staff  will stay here every time im in la.
we had a really good time! great hostel! 30 min to venice beach.

this is a great hostel located a 20 min walk from venice boulevard. the hostel was great, free breakfast, $1 beers, free internet, free detergent for a washer and dryer that costs only $2.50 and actually cleans your clothes! we paid the little extra to stay in the only private double twin but it was sooo worth it! the dorm rooms looked quite crowded but but we were in a similar sized room for 2 with a bath, 2 sinks, a tv and a toilet! bit cold in the night tho only downside.

good hostel, staff  friendly and helpful. good location, close to the airport, bus straight there in 20 min, walking distance to venice beach, bars, shopping etc. i stayed here once then came back a second time. you can easily get a bus to santa monica, hollywood etc. good value for money and better than staying in hollywood. it's like a big house,great if you want to chill but can drink as well if you want. deff recommend it, also has good parking if you have a car.
nice place to be, especially the two bedroom with own toilet and bath. 20 minutes to walk to venice beach!

the free airport pickup (with minimum 2 nights stay) was very nice and i really liked that the staff was so friendly and helpful.  the dorms were okay, too.  maybe some people would have a problem with the bathroom because you cannot lock the shower and the shower is in one (big!) room with the toilet (which you can lock!), but there is at least a curtain and actually nobody comes in when you're having a shower.  all in all a very nice place with a lot of nice people and located in a good area.
amazing vibe at this place and the staff are the best. was mislead in terms of how close the place is to venice beach but the price and character of the place easily made up for that.

after intending to stay only 3 days, i stayed 15 nights! one of the best hostels i've stayed at in 13 years: a great area, better than touristic santa monica, with everything close-by; staff are awesome, so friendly, down-to-earth, helpful, just real chill people; clean, facilitated kitchen (cleaned each day); homely, unlike standard soulless/expensive hostels, thus it doesn't need huge signs outside - a house number & street name is all you need if you're smart :p thanks for a great 2 weeks! :)
thers is so cold and they dó not put warm ón

i was anxious after reading reviews online, but decided i should try anyway.  it was awesome.    the other people in the house were great.  a fifteen minute walk to the beach.    the closest comparison would be to staying at a party house, without the party.

a big old house with a great salon and a big kitchen. very easy-going staff, if you need help, hey will help you!  it is a bit humid and some heating more can be necessary in winter, but apart from that, the hostel is cool.  of course it is a hostel, we are not talking of average hotel services!    anyway a cheap, sufficiently clean and relaxed place to stay in l.a.    thank you vbh!    mattia
i had a great experience here. the staff are lovely, and the people here are great. i met such interesting and fun people here, and you really feel at home. i will 100% stay here again.
nice hostel, great helpful staff. good value for money. quite a long walk from the main part of venice beach though.

we are a young couple, and we have booked a private room with a "private barthroom": the beds were awful, our room and the common kitchen  were dirty, and the worst thing was that the so called "private barthroom" was simply a wc and a bath tub in the bedroom, it was not another room, so there were not separating walls between the bedroom and the "bathroom"!!
the hostel was great, i met a lot of good people. i will definitely stay there again the next time i return to venice beach.
although i stayed only for a night, i really liked my stay. the staff was very helpful and courteous. i'll certainly stay at venice beach hostel when i come back to venice.
i enjoyed to stay at your hostel, as it had a cozy and nice atmosphere.   moreover, i liked to have the breakfast included and i loved the christmas dinner.  thanks a lot for all your help!

very peaceful and family sized venice's hostel  located around 15 minutes walk from the beach.  great free wifi access everywhere in the house.  that really looks like a usual home instead of a true hostel.  max around 25/30 beds i believe.  near los angeles lax main airport and marina del rey.  no curfew and kitchen very available because of so few people.  managers are here just to keep an eye and hardly ever bother you.  cheap price, good value, one of my best experience so far.  i do will come back.

weird place! no one said hardly anything and the staff did not accept the hostelworld price until a few hours later. there was not a sign for the hostel so i was confused at first. no lockers and no keys, not even for the front door. i would not stay here again. i recommend surf city hostel instead!

this hostel isn't your average check in, use the facilities and check out  affair. it's more like a house share with rooms, lounge, kitchen etc and everyone getting into the spirit of the occasion. i stayed longer than planned because i simply had no desire to leave! ian the owner is a really decent bloke as are all the staff.  i was here during thanksgiving what a meal they laid on! if you're looking for good value hostel in a great location with a fantastic atmosphere then you've found it.

this is the friendliest hostel i have ever stayed at. i felt very welcome when i walked in the front door the first night because of the incredibly helpful staff, the staff is always there to help out with any problems you might have.   you make a lot of friends because of this friendly atmosphere and i have been to a lot of activities with my new friends.  the location is also really good, just a 15-20 minute walk to the lovely venice beach!     i highly recommend the venice beach hostel!

it looks more like a grandma house than a hostel. no security: no locker, nobody checking after midnight.   we cant even lock the bathroom for the shower which only has a curtain!   i wouldnt recommend that place although it was alright

we really enjoyed the stay here. the double room is quite huge and has its own bathroom with a big bathtube. venice beach is a 20 minutes walk but buses are driving there as well. to get from or to lax, one can take the big blue bus 3 for only 1 dollar!!
need to get rid of the tv! turns everyone into zombies

the worst hostel i have ever been in. room was disgusting - bugs, stained carpet, stained toilet. staff made me really uncomfortable with their comments and they gave us totally inaccurate information about travel times. also they said the beach was 15 mins walk away. it is more than double that.
great staff, great hostel, nothing more to say
great place to be. lovely people. these laundry and bikes for rent, breakfast and tv.just fun to be at. i would definitely come here again!

i loved my stay at this hostel, it had character and a good vibe. the staff were very pleasant and helpful, the only downfall was that there was only one hot shower  and a cold shower down stairs for the entire hostel, i also had a problem with the bed bugs, apart from that i had a wonderful time in la and would return again.

unique place, they picked us up from the airport for free, check internet, $1 beers free breakfast, friendly staff so all in all a nice place to stay as long as you get the private room. the dorms looked overcrowed and uncomfortable.
the hostel was hard to find in the dark, no signs or anything but the staff was kind to guide us.

when i arrived to the hostel, it was not clear that was a hostel since there is no sign at all. you do not get any receipt after paying, and in my case i was charged more than expected, since i had deposited something through the web but i was charged the whole amount. i did not complain at that point since i honestly did not remember what i had pending to pay, but i expected the hostel to have the accounts clear. besides that feeling of not being in a regular and legal hostel, the rest was fine
great hostel, highly recommended, great location and great price
typical guesthouse ! i just love it. if one day i'm back in l.a, definitely i'll try to stay there once again. nice staff, clean house, close to the beach (10 min walk), good atmosphere.

had a great stay at the hostel, friendly staff, helpful to sort out any queries you may have, community atmosphere, just like a big house really, nice to have the big kitchen and lounge area :) would recommend a stay here, small walk to the beach which is fantastic :)

the hostel was awesome! i stayed just for 2 days but i had a really good time. the hostel team is really nice and helpful. i definitely recommend you this hostel. you will not be disappointed.    ludovic

we were taken to a separate part of the hostel because the main part was fully booked apparently but this not very convenient as there were no facilities in this part such as breakfast so we had to walk all the way back to the main part each morning in order to get some breakfast which wasn't what we had planned for.  the room we were staying in was nice but there was no lock on the door which i didn't like.  also the main guy was extremely rude!!! arrogant, condescending and very unhelpful.

i liked the hostel a lot because of the great feeling you have being there. i stayed there by myself and the warm, almost family-like atmosphere made it easy to find people to hang out with. also the cleaning service was outstanding as they cleaned every day. what i didn't like was the untended condition of the hostel itself. it had so much potential and there were only small things like the shower-curtain (which really needs to be changed) to make the place a lot nicer. the staff was helpful.

i would reccomend this hostel to anyone. it has a lot of character and an awesome vibe. the staff were really helpful and went the extra mile to suggest things to do in la. the hostel is also close to venice beach.

great hostel, loads of fun and good layout. ian and mike are great. only downside was there were only 2 bathrooms for the whole of the hostle but this didn't really affect my overall enjoyment of the place.
do not go there - awfull - far from the centre, foam matresses are on the floor, sheets didn't seem clean and just no atmosphere - weird.

stay away!!!! this should not be called the venice beach hostel, it is located at least 30 minutes walk from the beach near an intersection which is popular with the local bums. also if you are looking to have some fun whilst in venice don't stay here, we had some drinks one night and ended up getting kicked out the next day! the breakfast is a joke and there are no locks on any of the doors or even the main door to the hostel! no activities or available staff to help out with anything.

a lovely welcoming hostel. felt more like at home stay than being in a hostel. a great place for meeting people & having fun. ian (the owner) & mick (i think) couldn't do more for you. free breakfast, tea & coffee. i had booked into a 6 bed but ended up in a huge 13 bed dorm for the first night... they soon corrected that though. just one downside.. ian, invest in some new bedsheets. they may be clean but they look sooo old :-(  other than that a great stay & i would recommend. lockers downstairs
really good hostel for the price! close to the beach and the owner is really helpful with how to get around and so on.

convenient location for public transport, eating out and grocery shopping. had the private twin room - one suggestion is to put a shower head over the bathtub in this room, so guests wouldn't have to use the shared bathroom. one thing i didn't like about the shared bathroom was having carpet on the floor instead of tiles - felt a bit gross walking on carpet with wet feet. also, there were no rails or racks to hang towels and clothes while in the shower. put some rails up pronto!

i though my experience at the hostel was quite fun and interesting considering that most of the time the hostel doors aren't locked and ppl seem to love and respect one another, so i'm giving it a good reference.
we were recommended the 'venice beach hostel'... we quickly realized we had booked the wrong one.
i have been in many hostel, but unfortunately this one it was the first everybory can smoke inside it...

great place to stay near venice beach, only a 20min walk to the beach and close to a supermarket and bottle store. really relaxed atmosphere and the staff are really great and friendly and know lots about the area so they can always point you in the right direction.

it was rude that i got taken to another place down the road because they were full because i ended up staying in a room that was unlike the one i had booked. it was also quite dirty and not very nice, as well as being smaller and not having many people as did the main part of the hostel. it also didn't have any internet which i was meant to have as it was part of the reason why i had booked that hostel. the staff were also a bit weird and not very professional. one of the worst hostels so far.
don' t go !!!
i loved this place and we had a very nice stay during the days in los angeles!! i recommend it without a doubt and i could come back here.

the staff here were so amazing, the friendliest we have met in 5 months of travel and the most helpful! happy to answer any of your questions. facilities were also great, rooms nice, cheap laundry service and good breakfast. about a 20 min walk from venice beach itself but close to lots of good resturants and services.
always given a warm welcome whenever i return. very cozy setting. love the wood beam ceilings upstairs.
great homely feel, mike and ian super helpful guys.. will definately be back!
like a home from home. saw my first english football games in 6 months! cheers mike and ian for a hassle free enjoyable stay.

the hostel is an old house; it is quirky and has character. however, in our eyes the hostel needed a lot of work to get it up to scratch. we stayed in the private room with ensuite: there is no contained bathroom, the toilet is in the corner of the room and there is a bath in the middle of the room. camp-beds and bed linen is very old. not our cup of tea! kitchen is fine. 25 minute walk to venice beach.   iain the owner is very helpful and knowledgeable and the airport pick up is excellent.
too cold inside... :( best time to stay in this hostel would be in summer.

enjoyed staying in this amazing tirol style "hostel" filled with a lot of character! viewed many hostels around and would definitely recommend this one to all travelers. it's a spacious and cosy house, with a very good kitchen area and living space. the dorms are clean and there's enough room to stash your stuff. the over friendly staff can answer all your questions about the area and more. close to the beach, safe area and oh yeah the vending machine + free breakfast = amazing :) enjoy ur stay
the hostel is a very nice house and in a good location!! it's closed to santa monica and to the beach!!  the staff is very friendly and helpful!!

i really like this place  it's a big old house : the owner is a "tall guy" from uk very friendly  he knows very well what's happened around l.a.  the other one who work there is also cool : more chill .    there are no locks : it's a free house   don't worries : it's a safe place because all the time someone is looking at.    the kitchen is great : you have all to make a good recipe  it's like home    free breakfast : that's very important to begin a new day    very chill & cheap hostel    nico from toulous
place was great. people were so nice and was relaxing in a great location. loved the $1 beer vending machine. shower was big an warm. ian made us feel very welcome would stay again
cool hostel.  a bit far from the beach and the main parts of venice but fun anyways.  dollar beers in the vending machine and friendly staff

great with airport pickup, quick and easy wifi, great staff who could give you any information about places and activities. 20 - 30 min walk to venice beach, and very close to the bus-stop who would take you anywhere around. close to shops, cafe's and supermarkets.     i would deffenetly stay there agian!
well situated, 30 minutes walking from the beach. nice place if you want to rest

dont stay here !! they dont have roomkeys and you might have to go in trough the window to get inside the frontdoor  a man checked us in who didnt really know who we were or what we were going to pay.   when you see this place you wouldn't want to stay there for more than 1 night tops.   the room was extremly cold! they didn't have any heating ( in januray..) and except from one man there wasn't anyone who really knew anything and they sat in the commonroom just drinking beer and smoked inside. not

old house turned into a hostel. staff incredibly friendly. 20/30 minute walk from venice beach. nice restaurants and cafes around (i strongly recommend the italian restaurant -- and i'm european! - ask the reception about it).
i'm a regular there and its a good place to stay with cozy rooms upstairs. they just did new landscaping out front and it looks real nice.

they were doing work on the outside footpaths etc, but needs work on some of the simple things inside like locks on bathrooms. not for those who can't handle things being less than perfect but has potential.

the location is fantastic. it is a short walk to the beach and the pier and i very much enjoyed the ocean.    ian was on staff during my stay and he was very helpful in pointing out places where i could find some fun.     the wifi worked well so be sure to take your laptop.    be sure to visit the venice whaler it has an outdoor patio on the roof and the view of the ocean is great.    all the guests seemed like decent folks and it was quiet on the nights i was there.    i would definitely stay there again

a very nice little hostel in venice! a bit oldish but ian the landlort was very helpful and great to chat to! we loved it! we even had a jacuzzi in our room for 2!!! how lush is that?! breakfast facilities in a good size kitchen very good! a bus from the airport just drop you by it nearly!very recommended!

this hostel is in an ideal location - the staff are excellent - so friendly and helpful. as the area is so safe, you are able to really enjoy the nightlife in a great environment. the kitchen is well equiped and the rooms are comfortable. there are several bathrooms, and overall the experience is much more personal than the usual hostel experience. thank you so much for a lovely time in a fantastic area!   regards!

this hostel is a really good, fun place to stay. i had a great time here. the staff are friendly and give good advice about the local area and attractions etc. it is 'old school' kind of hippy vibe to it and is really laid back. there are no locks on the doors (inc bathrooms)and it could do with a bit of updating (paint, new sheets etc) but for $27/night you really cant beat it. :d

wonderful staff and stay! this is my first time using podshare and it's way better than staying in a traditional hostel. this location is small but has everything you need and is situated perfectly between los feliz, silver lake, koreatown, and hollywood for all types of adventures. i'll definitely be staying here the next time i'm in la!
i love amy and roger they was so friendly and nice 👍 and great they made me feel right at home 🏡 i will be back

pros: clean space, good location, one of the gals working there was sweet and helpful!  cons: no privacy curtain for bunks and not allowed to hang anything up (except on designated rack).  "breakfast" that is provided is clearly just stuff left behind by previous guests that are moved to the "community" pile.   the other gal who worked there had her boyfriend over the entire time and seemed annoyed when you asked her questions or interrupted their time together. did not make me feel welcomed.

the hostel is nice, close to the metro station in quiet neighborhood. the girls working there are nice. all the people who visited during my stay were quiet and nobody bothers the rest of us. living in the same place with 9 more people sounds weird at first but then everything is okay? everyone respects the others. the only concern i have is the cleanliness of the place and also bedsheets didn't smell good.

i loved this place, the moment i walked in i felt like i was at home. staff and atmosphere make it feel like you're with housemates- very open and social, i honestly made friends for life in just 1 night.   the only issue i have is that i was bitten by bed bugs so i would highly recommend shelving your beds but they are fixing this and i honestly think it shouldn't damper your experience because besides that this place is like no other hostel. you could always try their other locations too!
awesome design. death place. no atmosphere at all. a place to literally just rest. they are super strict about the rules, like beyond jail.
cool, clean, quiet place. not directly in the center of the city but it's only about a 15 minute ride to most places like downtown la. staff was awesome and helpful. would definitely stay here again.

beautiful and well designed one-room schoolhouse of a hostel. it has a rustic deep in the woods feeling which nicely contrasts with the urban environment outside. the pods are not true pods in the japanese way, but still very comfortable. however for a hostel it is a bit overpriced compared with other major cities in the world. it’s also not easily apparent who the staff are as there’s no real front desk so that can be a little awkward. if price isn’t a concern i say go for it.

i stayed one night because i had to be at the hospital around the corner early in the morning. it was a perfect location. it was quiet during the day. in the evening things picked up a little bit. this hostel is an open concept space. the kitchen is within the same room as the "pods". bathroom & shower room are off the kitchen. it was great for my needs. i do wish the pods truly were pods with enclosed walls and door.

good mix of the typical hostel atmosphere, with a more clean and comfortable set up. the ac keeps the place a great temperature, and the facilities in general feel very clean and new.  location is only a 15 minute drive to the griffith observatory, a short walk to the church of scientology, and a short drive to sunset. perfect for those who want to meet new people, but still get a good sleep every night (quiet time from 10pm onward).
the staff and detractors not honest and clear
you could not cancel, it was overbooked and the guy at the door could not operate a computer. nor could the guys spell your last name. i found him uninformative and i ended up going to a hotel...

i loved staying here! we were only in la for 2 days and felt very comfortable leaving our things at the hostel while we toured. i loved how simple and small this hostel was. it felt much more intimate and safe since there were fewer people staying in the building. the bedding left a little to be desired. the sheets were jersey and the blanket was a little scratchy and not very warm. and the pillows were not very supportive at all. i would advise you bring a blanket and a pillow.
nice and small place to stay, i liked the silver lake neighbourhood very much.

this is my home away from home. the best hostel ever! the beds are amazing, so comfy and different from anything i have seen in a hostel. don't worry about the stuff they write about being social and the tattoos people get. it's not that that crazy. people are pretty regular and you can spend time with them or not. when i was there, it wasn't super social.
can i live here forever? best hostel ever! :)

i was very pleased with all aspects of this hostel. it was clean, secure and had friendly competent staff. great for those looking for a quieter hostel, interesting layout and nicely decorated. would certainly stay there again.
very nice place, cosy and essential, good atmosphere
had a great stay😀 would definitely stay here next time in coming to l.a! this is a gem!!!   highly recommended!

thank you! i've already booked to stay again! this is a beautifully hidden gem with wonderful staff! just on the corner nearby you can also get a philly cheesestake that's amazing! the pods each have netflix, there are only 10beds in the whole place so you don't need to worry about too many people and everyone is friendly and welcoming. it's the best bed in a hostel i've ever had! so comfortable and everything is clean. there is communal food as well as room for your own things in the fridge.

this might be one of the the best hostel experiences i've had so far!  cosy beds and a beautifull room for about 10 people, well equipped kitchen and very good cleanliness overall.  everything is basically in one room, so you have to respect the nighttime.  you also have your own tv that's offering netflix and other similar providers.  the staff was friendly and helpful and always around for a nice talk.  the location is quite good near a metro station and placed between hollywood and downtown.
i only slept there....nice shoer, bathroom bunk.....i'd stay again gladly.
very clean and unique place. my first night was very quiet, but on my second night there were a few noisy people. very interesting set up and great value!

it would be great for guests to call and confirm the booking more than once - even i was confirmed that i would have a twin bed, only a single bed was given to me that day. the staff was not very helpful in resolving the problem and was not well-tempered - one of the staff there even threatened to evict me rather than having the problem dealt with.     but other than the mishap the beds were comfortable and the amenities provided were adequate, but shower gel ran out and no one replaced it.

no bells and whistles here, just a nice to place to rest after a long day in l.a. the amenities are nice and conveniently close to the metro and buses. the only problem is leaving the door open at night where passerbys can see inside and it also gets rather cold at night.

this was a great place to stay. the pod idea is really cool! it's nice to have you own space! it's a very quiet place which is nice, the only draw back is there is only one toilet, one shower, and one bathroom sink shared between 10 people. the people are great and the area is safe (i ran early in the morning and walked after dark) and lots really conviently located! great coffee shops, bars, food in the area as well as old movie theaters and easily get to hollywood, downtown, and up to the hill

it says there is parking on hostel world... there is no parking. fyi.   you cannot drive there. you can get close, but you can't park close (about 0.5 mile)   otherwise, cool location and nice people. bunks are very old and provided pillows could be better (just roll up a sweatshirt).  the beach is right there. there are also a series of good smelling restaurants nearby and a great ambiance.

the location is perfect, the staff is super sweet and the breakfast is also great (for a hostel breakfast) we didn't have an ac in our room but since we stayed there in winter it wasn't that bad, but in summer i probably wouldn't have booked this hostel without an ac. the mattresses were very old and uncomfortable but i guess they were currently working on that.
great place to relax and chill, very close to the beach and easy to get around. staff are friendly and facilities are good. overall atmosphere seemed quiet but otherwise it is safe and comfortable.

the staff at the hostel was really nice and i could leave my luggage there because i arrived before check-in time. the location is great, super close to the beach. there are nice houses next to the beaches and i had the feeling that this area is great for families as well. the rooms were okay but the bathroom was shared and on the hallway. also i did not like the breakfast. there was only toast and peanutbutter, i would appreciate anything else to eat. but in general, i enjoyed my stay there :)

a great location by the beach in an area with lots of restaurants and bars to choose from. the hostel was a bit run down and the noise from the bar below was unbearable. i figured a monday night in december would be quiet but it wasn't. carla was friendly and changed our room to the top floor where we were able to sleep with the help of earplugs and were greeted by a stunning beach scenery in the morning. it's a nice hostel but keep in mind the noise and that there is no free parking on-site.

just stay here for the location. this hostel probably has the best view ever. waking up you can see the ocean and the activity of the pier. since it is right on the pier it is at the heart all the action. also hermosa beach is one of the most beautiful beaches ever. staff was super friendly too.
excellent lodging experience  with a location that can't be beat

the location was good. i stayed for 5 nights while visiting friends nearby. my hostel roommate was absolutely incorrigible; immediately started insulting me right when i got there.  i really liked the older guy that cleaned was great. i wasn't impressed by the nighttime staff, particularly when i had to check out at 1am on my final night there. the other clientele there were alright . the place isn't so clean, but for the money i would probably stay there again.
lovely staff, well located and the thanksgiving dinner they put on was excellent

thank you christian. thank you chris and thanks to the lady (i should've asked her for her name at least ... silly me).  i only stayed for one night, but the least i can say, is that it was great.  i was supposed to check-in at 9pm but my flight got delayed so i checked in at like 11pm thanks to christian.  i had no cash at all. you are supposed to make a 10$ deposit for the key and you'll get it back at the checkout.  i had no internet, so the girl and chris printed and helped me with the map.
only stayed on night. location is great if you don’t mind the possible niose from the nightlife. not the newest place but nothing to complain about.
no staff at office when we arrived for check in. another individual slept in a booked bed which left my friend high and dry.    have overnight staff for security and help late at night.
was a very nice stay for just one night

rather dirty, and its pretty worn down. they don't have many kitchen facilities, there is probably a lot of food waste because they don't have a 'free' shelf, but other than that it's a very social place to stay!

the good:  - location. literally in the hermosa beach pier!  - price. facilities show wear and tear, but can't complain about it for the price!  - cool clientele. mostly surfers and hippies.    the bad:  - wifi is not reachable except the rooms close to the common area. i had to move.  - loud noise from the street. earplugs are a must.  - not so clean, especially in the bathrooms.

it's a backpacker's hostel right on beautiful hermosa beach. staff are friendly and laid back. accomodations are basic but mostly clean. the beach is close (though you may have to walk through a film set to get there). what more do you need?
great location, nice safe neighborhood :)

awesome location if u wanted to stay nearby the beach town.. partying noise goes all night thru early hours as expected from tuesday night onwards so take headphones, place could do with revamp but you get what you pay for n owners r very welcoming

second time i have stayed at surf city and i can't wait to come back again. it's in a perfect location (right on the beach) surrounded by great restaurants and an exciting night life. common areas always had people popping in and was a great place to make new friends. for a solo traveler this was ideal. made some great friends from around the globe and we had some great memories. kitchen was well kept and facilities were all working. really sad to see odile leave though! will miss her!

no atmosphere or common areas, no airconditioning or fans in the rooms. the shower has no head so it comes out in one straight beam which genuinely hurts.    everything else was fine; bed was comfortable enough, staff were nice although not particularly accommodating. great location.
loud music at night.breakfast erm.... ;^)  but overall good ;)

my stay at the hostile was a great experience. the staff was friendly and helpful. i met alot of nice people staying here.  it was in a great location that you could walk anywhere and get whatever you needed. the beach is just out your door. i would stay here again !

location was great under a minute walk to the beach. very helpful and accommodating. rooms were very hot and music played late but can't really complain since it was a holiday weekend and in the middle of a heat wave. overall would definitely stay here again and great value for money
great location near hermosa beach pier. i mean about 50 yards. bathrooms should be cleaned better.     really nice and interesting clientele.     my second time here.

great location right on the beach and amongst the lively bars and nightlife of hermosa. there is a small communal area but not a massive place to chill out, but then again the beach is right on your door step.  staff weren't always around and we did have to wait a long-time to check in.

if you're looking to be 1)close to the beach 2)in a relaxed environment 3)away from the hustle and bustle of the posh side of la -> this place is for you.  location is an easy 10/10. everything one might need is close-by ( sunday markets, bank, supermarket, bottle shop, bars cafes pubs restaurants).   do buy ear plugs if noise is an issue as the hostel overlooks the main street in hermosa beach aka where the weekend nightlife happens.
i've travelled the us and this is my favourite hostel. the atmosphere, staff and location were brilliant! great value for money.
the area where the hostel is located is a big night spot so if you want to get to be early on a weekend earplugs are highly suggested!!!!
this was my second time staying here, and i can't wait to go back for a third. i had a view of the beach, and love the vibes here. totally worth it.

good for a crash pad, not much else. it was hard to find, and parking was harder. i had to ask someone where it was and as a solo traveler, that's not my favorite thing to do at night. (it's between two restaurants, the waterman is on the right). parking was either really close and expensive or really far and free.  the dorm rooms were small and un- air conditioned and the mattress was very uncomfortable. but the people who ran it were sweet and the location was ideal. you get what you pay for.
just one night. can't say much
it's a nice place. location is convenient,closed to the beach. people are very friendly. rooms are clean and breakfasts are good. i would stay at there again.

honestly one of the nicest hostels i've been to ever. everyone was so genuinely kind and easy going. the area itself is wicked and to be surrounded by a fair amount of locals as you walk through the town centre gives you a fair idea of what it'd be like to live in california, and i hope the idea you form is of a positive one, because i know it was for me.     thanks again guys, i'll definitely be back before i head off to my next destination in a year's time.     lockie

biggest pain point: only 3 lockers in 6 bed dorm! lockers are cheap and certainly important (passport, credit cards, ...). should be a no-brainer to provide as many as beds are in dorms.  furthermore: wifi only in kitchen area. not as many power outlets as in other hostels. no lamps at beds. bathrooms/kitchen only semi-clean.    i still slept well and had a pleasant time in la. there are certainly better hostels though.
great location

i stayed at surf city for 6 days and thought the the staff and the hostel were exactly what you want from a basic chilled out surf hostel. everyone is incredibly friendly and willing to help you at every opportunity, i felt very much at home for my week that i spent there. i will definitely return to surf city!
room wasn't as cleaned/nice as i would have thought it would be.   bin not empty and top bunk had no sheets on it which revealed an ugly brown stain.   staff were friendly and helpful.

fantastic overall! the only things i would change would be to add enough lockers so each bed has one available (in my room, there were six beds but only three lockers). also, from a security perspective, suggest making the door to the hostel is not left propped open. other than that, had an exceptional stay!

i stayed a friday night. the location with so many food & drink places, near to the water, was fantastic. however, rather than hearing the ocean at night, i heard the crash of workers dumping empty bottles into recycling bins until 2-3am. *crash* i had an early morning surf competition and didn't sleep so well. if i were into staying up and partying, this place can't be beat. for a nights sleep, i think i'd be better at motel 6 or something.

i loved this place. it's clean and it just has everything you never knew you needed. hammocks, surfboard rentals, orange juice and bagels for breakfast and lots more. whatever you are looking for- you gonna find it here for sure :)
awesome spot just out of the city. loud bars down stairs on the weekend, right on the beach loved the area. close to airport
perfect location
