i enjoyed my stay at the surf city hostel.  i was in 6 bed women's dorm on the 2nd floor with a private bathroom.  my bed had a view of the ocean and the other ladies were considerate and friendly.  the location is great - steps from the beach and near restaurants and bars.  my suggestion is to bring your own small padlock for the lockers.  this allows you the peace of mind to lock your valuables and relax.  i rented a hostel bike during my stay and loved biking to the surrounding beaches.

very chilled hostel, you get what you pay for. great location and helpful staff. mattress on my bed definitely needed replacing though. kind of an awkward location to get to but it's definitely worth it, hermosa beach is beautiful
top place with top people. more the real la and not to touristy
they are really friendlly. i want to stay there again.

it was a very nice hostel with very nice people. the staff with the red cap was really funny and taked  care that we get safe to the greyhound station. (btw, u can catch the bus 60 (i think it was)  from the end of ur train way, it takes u 1 block further the greyhound station)
seriously helpful and friendly staff! pretty happy with the included breakfast as well.

this was my second time staying at this hostel. its location is amazing, beach views from some windows. right in amongst the bars and resturants that line this lively strip. the owner is fabulous and is really welcoming. facilities are adiquate. if your looking for a place a few steps from the beach, and being in amongst cool bars and resturants, this place cant be beat. if you want to grab an early night you will need noise cancelling headphones as the bars and clubs obviously radiate noise.
i could find no better points than average, but it was expensive than expected.  i will try to find any other hostel next time.

this place is a bit shabby.     good points: nice staff. nice breakfast. good location for beach volleyball. rent bikes for cheap. very close to beach. big tv. wifi.    bad points: small tv room, kitchen and internet room. shower rooms not too good and mixed gender with inadequate stalls so high opportunity for perving behaviours(!) plastic sheeting on beds. hermosa is a bit boring. long term residents, some stoned a lot. blinds let in sun in early morning. no wifi in my room.

this hostel is located near the beach, which is a plus!. parking is difficult here. i'm not one for clubs, bars, and loud music. there were too many drunk guest in this hostel. that's not my cup of tea. won't stay here again.

i loved the atmosphere at the hostel and the staff were just super kind.  the rooms and the sheets could be cleaner. the location is just perfect. despite the facts that many other hostels have nicer rooms and bathrooms i would come back to this one because of the staff and the general atmosphere in the hostel. i really enjoyed the stay.
very welcoming, friendly owner! helpful staff! perfect location! i hope to visit again soon

a good friendly place to stay., if you're into surfing or other beach sports. located on the  pier area a few hundred feet from the ocean. the location is in over a bar that stays open late on the weekends so getting to sleep early is difficult.   parking is a 15 minute walk away
the staff is super nice, the area is top! would be nicer i the hostel would have hostel events! but the rest is really good!

very nice area. it's possible to rent bicycles at the hostel and if starting early it is a very nice day trip to cycle on the beach from hermosa to santa monica. there are some shops and restaurants in the area.  hermosa beach is a very nice place in la, but it takes 2-3 hours with the bus from hermosa beach to hollywood and 2 hours to downtown, so if you are in la to see all the tourist attractions, you should rent a car if you live there.  the busses stops running around 11pm.

first i was a little irritated that my roommates stay there for so long and that there things were kind of everywhere. but finally i realy enjoyed it there. it could be a little cleaner and i don´t know from witch kategorie i should take points for plastic matress covers.

fun, clean, cheery.  what more can you ask for in a hostel on the beach?  nevertheless, the common "living" room had a bit of a moldy smell that they should probably have checked.  also note that this hostel is in a great location due to being on the beach, but it isn't a great location if you're planning on spending most of your time in downtown la as it's very far from downtown.
no parking at all
great hostel, fun nightlife
thank you odile and the others for a very nice stay.

the hostel itself was very basic and there is a bar underneath so be aware of that due to the noise!  however the area in which the hostel is located is really nice,  close to the beach and great bars and places to eat.  we were meant to be visiting down town la for the evening but after speaking to some friendly locals decided to stay in hermosa beach and i am glad we did!
amazing location; wonderful friendly and helpful staff, and great accommodations.
o d of the best hotels i have been, so nice and clean.....big big breakfast, clem toilets...perfect
second home, awesome crew and guests!

i had such a fun time here, made new friends, and it's in a beautiful location! but if you are taking transit (like i was), it is pretty far from all the other beaches and downtown. other than that, great place!

great place.   little bit misrepresented on the web site, though. pics were taken when newly redecorated. well worn common space now... but they seem to be continually working on the place. new meaning for the word 'cozy' .  beds were excellent. pillow thin.  little noisy at night  for an old guy. (from the club entertainment down stairs).

absolutely loved this place!! really wish we'd stayed longer than 2 nights :(  prime location, hermosa beach is incredible and the staff were so welcoming and friendly plus you're always bound to find a party in the common room on a night :d:d
surf city hostel is a happy place at the center of the hermosa beach. staff is nice. thanks!
best location ever. right in front of the beach. the staff is friendly, kind and super helpful!

amazing amazing amazing location!! basic hostel but just what we needed. communal showers and bathrooms which isn't ideal but location outweighs everything. also great free breakfast but get there about 10am if you want any of the toast or bagels, we went in at 11am one day and there was just cereal. nice stay overall
the location is unparalled. the staff is great. breakfast was a nice surpirse. i would go back anytime. stay away if you really don get what hostels are all about :-)
great location and staff, loud at night

excellent location, staff are wonderful, hostel is very social and everyone is so friendly! good connections by bus into la city centre- slightly confusing but the staff were excellent help explaining it all and even printed off a map for us with directions.  couldn't be closer to the beach or any of the bars and restaurants in hermosa beach, which is great but this means the hostel is very loud at night as its right above a bar! im a heavy sleeper so it didnt bother me! i loved it here!

all in all i had a good first impression. simple rooms but fitting for the surfer style atmosphere.   hostel is located very close to the beach which is great... but it is also located above several bars with loud music playing until late night (2am and later). hostel is very lax about noise control.   great place to meet people, not so great if you need to sleep ;)
this was the experience of a lifetime.  no regrets at all.  thank you all for the fun!  i will be back!
very nice location, very nice people, vide choice of facilities, excellent atmosphere! only a bit shabby and also not that cheap.
this place is hectic.

i always stay here. i love it, i love it!!! staff is very nice & the atmosphere is great, plus it's probably the best location on hermosa beach. it even beats those $200 per night hotels close by.   the lady that works there (forgot her name) is so nice and courteous. she’s always smiling & trying her best to accommodate your needs.  i always recommend this place to my friends. we are coming back next year!  natali (from argentina)
great place to stay were coming back

very good hostel, price was more expensive than most hostels we have stayed in (our limit for a shared dorm was usually $25), however the location, staff and rooms were lovely. rented a bike for $10 for a day and cycled all along the coast to venice beach which was awesome (hence the perfect location).  only negative is that the kitchen closes at 9:30pm, which we felt was too early.
i had a lot of fun in the hostel. the location is great. there are a lot of cool places nearby. the only problem is that there's a bar very close and sometimes is hard to sleep early at night.
the best part of the hostel is the location, very close to the beach and great fun places, but the room are very small and for a room of 6 beds is little unconfortable!    still great place!

a nice place very close to the beach! it's a bit tricky getting anywhere apart from the beach (roughly a 1 to 2 hour bus ride into la downtown not serviced by the train system). the staff were friendly and up for a laugh and helpful.   all the bedding was clean, bathrooms were cleaned regularly and kitchen kept very clean too.   the mattresses were a little thin but not bad. very loud and constant noise coming from outside (a generator i think). overall a good place to stay if you like the beach!
the beds are rubbish! and lots of noise from the bar downstairs. other than that it's an alright hostel as it's right on the beach and there is lots of things to do around.

hostelworld.com didn't mention anything about shared rooms, it said shared or single rooms, i was only offered a shared room. the hotel was literally placed on top of a nightclub, so the floor was bouncing and the music was so loud. the room was full of smoke. hostelworld.com didn't say anything about the bathroom facilities, but there was only 1 shared bathroom to every guest on the hotel. i couldn't stay there for only 1 day, i had to find another place to sleep. i would like to get a refund!
overall, it was pleasant!
the hostel is over a bar and thats why it's pretty loud at night til 3am.
it's a good value if you are traveling in a group of one or two. best day to use the laundry facilities is saturday night from 8-11pm.
fun place to stay and perfect location. i would go back! it's hard to beat $40 a night for an ocean view. love hermosa!

i really enjoyed my stay here. the place is much bigger than i expected ao there were so many people to meet. it made for a really great stay. in addition, the staff was always helpful and even provided an amazing lunch on 4th of july. inly downside is the wifi strength is not super strong but that was not a big deal for me i just would go to the common rooms and use wifi in there. loved it here. will definitely be back.

i really enjoyed my 2 night stay at the hostel. it was 4th of july week.  the staff was very friendly and helpful. the place was clean. i stayed in a 4-bed room and only had one roommate from london.great guy. there is one shower on the floor i was on and 3 more modern showers upstairs. only bad thing this area of hermosa is where people go to have fun and it will keep you from getting to sleep, particularly since the hostel is above a bar and grill with live reggae bands
this hostel was the best thing i saw in la.  staff were friendly, guests were good fun, nice place to be.

great hostel would highly recommend!  has a quality atmosphere with things always happening. the french lady who runs it is lovely aswell and the breakfast is pretty decent. only downside is that it could maybe do with another shower.
everything was great. a little dissapointed with what was provided for breakfast... nothing fresh or healthy. otherwise, we have no other complaints. had a great weekend.
this is by far my favorite hostel in california, for one your right across the bike path from the ocean! everytime i stay at this hostel i alway meet some new friends.

the women working here are fabulous! however, came back to a crazy person in my room and some of my food from the fridge was stolen by a transient that got in. i would stay here again tho...loved the location!
good for the beach, less ideal for exloring the rest of la (apart from long beach)

this hostel is dirty, above a noisy bar, parking is street parking a half mile away. staff friendly but when i wanted to ask a question i waited for 15 minutes while she continued a personal conversation.  better choice is hi hostel in santa monica.

its not to far away from the airport! it feels like everything is far away from eachother here in la.   the hostel it self is good, i had a fun time. breakfast was yummy.   at the weekend its a little louder beacuse there are bars downstairs. which i didn't mind.

actually i am unable to comment on this hostel, as although we made our reservation about 4 or 5 months ago, when i emailed them about 5 days before we were due to arrive to confirm, i received an email saying they had a problem with their booking system and now didn't have a room for us! which basically means they put priority over the people who made their reservation after us and kicked us out. i have stayed at this hostel in the past and was very disappointed with this service. horrible.
best experience of my life. coming back for sure.

i was put in a room with people that had clearly been living there for a while and it was a total mess and so dirty. all their clothes,  accessories, makeup, hair products, shoes were scattered all over the room. the bed was really uncomfortable and the window was thin so all the noise from the bars underneath and across the street keep you up until around 3am. i met cool people here so i had a good time but if you want a good night sleep or somewhere a little more comfortable i wouldn't go here

nice small hostel, right by the airport and well connected to the rest of the city by bus and train. good little kitchen and a cosy, homely atmosphere to the place. nowhere to store valuables though (lockers). apart from that a good place to stay on a visit to seattle.
great staff and location - will definitely stay here again!
great hostel! near the beach, cheap, great facilities and next to loooots of bars.

nice hostel, friendly and helpfull staff. we wanted to rent a car amd whem something went wrong the girl at reception helped us very good! she gave good information and tips about what to visit in la and what not.  the rooms are a bit small but nice amd we had a view on the ocean.  the only thing was that the toilet in our room was not working the last two days.  overall we had a really nice stay.    kitchen was a bit small but th
one of the people who went to sleep late actually worked there, but he would still turn on the light every time (he came in  and out several times throughout the night).

cool location right on the beach but be warned.. the public bus takes over an hour to get from the bus depot near lax to the hostel. keep in mind for if you're in a hurry/don't have much time. otherwise the hotel is a bit dilapidated but ok.

great location for checking out venice and is only a short bus ride away from santa monica. staff are friendly and the rooms do the trick. kitchen facilities are fine. only hangup was the lack of atmosphere in the actual hostel, although they did offer pub crawls and other activities. may be because of a relatively small communal space. showers on the reception level had trouble with hot water while i was there, not sure if the problem has been rectified.
just fit! was all good except the name wasn't really describing about the surf, which was a total flat when i was there.
very excellent hostel. very helpful staff. great place to relax for a few days.

i got here straight from lax. the location is great, right next to the beach. the hostel attracts a lot of surfer dudes, friendly and chilled-out types. i think it's more suited to solo travellers (like me) than big groups.
i felt safe at this hostel and the staff were very friendly and helpful.   they had bikes for rent (cheap) and the cost of our stay was very affordable! we ended up staying an extra night
everything was ok.
wifi very weak

if possible invest in nice ear plugs for hire...so that if people are worried about the noise they can just purchase some good noise cancelling ear plugs. great hostel overall, keep up the customer service and friendly staff. :)
great place to relax and enjoy the beach. free breakfast was great would fill up and last till dinner! overall great place to stay.
good location in front of the beach and a lot of bar with dance floor closed to the hostel. only problem: the drinks are so expensive on the bars, you can drink on the hostel before going out.
the staff were really friendly and super helpful!
great place to stay. right in the middle of prime night life and right next to the strand. had a great time here!

francis was really helpful, also george who saved me a lot of time by giving me a cheap lift to the airport! only downside really is that its difficult to get anywhere with public transport from hermosa beach.
excellent place and good situated... i had much much fun.. in hermosa u can find everything u want :)

awesome location for the beach, and fronts right onto a pedestrian-only mall with bars, coffee shops, etc.    all of la requires a car if you are going to see the sights, and this location is no exception.

hostel didn't really organize common activities, maybe it was low-season. however, we got a 6 bed room even though we had booked private room just for 4 us, and 1 was supposed to stay in dorms, thanks for that! :) hostel surroundings were nice, right next to hermosa beach. good place to stay, but not one of the best hostels i've stayed. ask about the transportation to/from the airport, they can help you with that!

nice enough hostel, if you like to surf or like the beach its ideal, 2min walk and your at the beach. however everything else is quite far away, 1 half - 2 hours to hollywood for example... otherwise clean enough and staff are friendly and helpful
the place was cool but a visable sign/entry and some computers for client use wouldn't go astray.....
great place to stay on the beach!!! coming back

this place is a hidden gem and i really enjoyed meeting the other travelers staying here. the staff was very chill and friendly. overall i don't have a single bad thing to say and i'd definitely stay here again.

hostel was great, as well as the staff. they try really hard to help you with whatever you need. the location was excellent, 5 meters away the sea, so it's the perfect hostel to spend relaxing holidays there. i was very satisfied with everything, i had such a great time there!
beutiful setting, loads of things to do nearby. little bit noisy late at night if your not up for that kind of thing. really friendly staff and amazing breakfast selection.
great place, have stayed many times and will stay many more.

we got to the room close bars kitchen, so the evening was a terrible smell of burnt oil.  location good, very close to the ocean, but far from downtown la, but communication very good :)  little loud.

over all i thought surf city hostel was pretty good. i only stayed two nights and both of them were fine, the only problems were: it's on top of a bar so if your jet laged like i was not the best place for your first nights rest. staff member candy was rude and probably shouldn't be working in a hospitality work environment. most of the other staf member were helpful and polite. location is wicked! i had a really good night on my second night with all the bars under the hostel.
the wost hostel i've stayed in.

the surf city hostel has an amazing atmosphere, the frenche woman working in the office treats you like she's your good godmother. amazing location, right on the beach and hermosa is a chilled, relaxed and cool place to meet happy and lively people. you can rent a bike at the hostel and go for a ride up the great beach path that leads you all the way to venice and santa monica. up the street from the hostel there is a few cool shops, i recommend the store; "wicked" they have loads of cool stuff!

this hostel has the perfect location! right by the pier and all the bars (its actually located right on top of one) and close to la and hollywood and of course its right on the beach. could not ask for more from a hostel in so-cal. the staff is very friendly and accommodating. i will definitely be going back any time i need to stay in south bay.

they could not honor my booking.  i got a $48.00 parking ticket for lodging near the hawthorne airport lax.  i spent $60.00 on a parking pass to lodge in hermosa beach.  my credit card was charged and i never spent even one night.  i am asking for a refund.  they say that this booking company gets the money from the booking on my card not them.  they were unable to check me in when i arrived.  i love them.  i am not a man.  i am also american.  they have been good to me in the past.this time$$$$

i stayed in surf city hostel for three nights. the location was great, however living space was virtually non existent compared to other hostels i have occupied. if location is everything to you and you aren't wanting to hang out in the hostel during the day, this is a good option. great bars downstairs and along pier st. located smack bang on the beach, among the beach volley ballers!!

great location, would highly reccomend to anyone planning to stay in a hostel in l.a. great location, 30 seconds walk and your on the beach.cool area lots of pubs and resturaunts. very surf/skate relaxed vibe to area.  the hostel has two lounges to relax in, just the rooms upstairs need fans or aircon as got very stuffy and hot at night. staff very friendly and helpful. but i think price could be lowered 5 or ten dollars.also plastic sheets a bit uncomfortable, and need more lockers in each room!

i truly recommend this hostel. the cheapest and the best hostel i stayed in during my summer trip! if you are looking for a place close to beach for surfing and a good location full of bars at night, it is definitely a place for you! if you wanna have fun at the bars, just be careful and start soon because the bars close around 2am which kinda scared me, haha. staff is amazing, rooms are pretty clean, laundry available, tons of international guys, bike rent available! have fun :)

there were some issues with the plumbing and the toilets and showers were closed for a period of time but this affected the entier building and not just the hostel units.  the staff worked dillegiently to call in help to resolve the problem.  i was only there for a night so it wasn't a terrible inconvience and there are public bathrooms near the pier which is located very close to the hostel.  this issue didn't affect my stay.
it was a nice place to stay, you step out of the hostel and you are right at the beach. the rooms are nice and clean and the stuff is really nice.

the hostel served its purpose as an inexpensice place to spend the night in la. the location is great as it's on the beach and the staff were helpful enough. the only problem with the location is that the hostel is located above a bar and so it is noisy and difficult to fall asleep (even with earplugs). but if partying is your thing and you don't mind the noise, then this is the perfect place for you. recommendation: rent a car for la - very difficult to ger around without one!
staff couldnt care less. i booked a 4 bed dorm and got a 6 bed dorm above the loudest bar ever! no sleep arghhh!!
i love this hostel!  i certainly suggest!    davide esposito
staff were very helpful and understanding
amazing staff, amazing location, just a great place to stay and meet people. really good party atmosphere and close to all the bars.

i had an awesome experience staying at surf city hostel. the staff very fantastic and personable, the hostel was clean and well maintained, and best of all- the location was to die for. i went down for a week with a friend and we had the best time hanging out in hermosa beach. we met tons of people at the hostel and the streets are busy and full of life at night. hermosa has great restaurants, shopping, nightlife, and stunning beaches. it's definitely worth a visit!
the hostel was perfect!  nice and helpful staff, the facilities were clean and the location directly on the beach! nothing to complain  :)

ok, it is a good hostel, near to the beach, restaurants and pubs. the breakfast is pretty good and the beds are comfortable.   cons: few restrooms and they are always busy. the common areas are not comfortable and there are few chances to meet people.
small room, very bad smells, noise in the night...it is worth to spend a little more money and stay in a hotel

it wasn't made clear enough that this hostel is above a club. if i had known this in the first place, i wouldn't have booked at all. i was extremely disappointed when i arrived and found this as, after a long days travelling, i couldn't even get a decent nights sleep due to the loud music, and the fact that it felt as though a house party was going on. i don't think there were enough bathrooms for the number of people that were being put up and the place could generally do with a refurbishment.
one of the best hostels iv been in. so many great people and lots of memorys have been made there. a must go place to stay.
depends what you're looking for; it's in the middle of a party-area and right at the beach... perfect, unless you're looking for a quiet place!

we spend three nights in the hostel and had a fantastic time! the location in ideal, right in the street of pubs and bars and next to the beach, which looks much better than the overcrowded venice beach. only minus, the mixed dorm is right up on one of the pubs, so it's quite loud at night...if you are noise-sensitive, bring good earplugs.

surf city was totally fantastic. amazing location, every morning i walked out of the door and strait onto the beach for a swim. the staff a really friendly and the place has a great atmosphere. i needed to be in santa monica on my last night in la and the hostel was more expensive and no where near as nice. surf city is simple, friendly and very welcoming and the location is absolutely perfect!
great staff. friendly environment, good security. great location
special thanks to odeil (spelling??) the french woman, did nothing but help when i had passport problems..thank you.  place is noisy as reviews but hey, you are amongst it...
great place to visit. great craic around the place.   meet some cool people there. and i will defo go back.
loved my stay. most of the employees treated us excellently. two young female employees however, were rude to us
the old french lady that runs the place is the sweetest woman alive, her employees are quite rude and unhelpful. stick to dealing with the french woman and you will have the time of your life.

absolute blast and the location can't be beat if you are looking to be in the heart of all the activity.  the only downside is that a few of the rooms are directly over a bar.  if you end up in one of these, good luck trying to get some sleep before the bar closes.  the solution is to stay in the bar until it closes....

i stayed there last year already and i don't regret chosing this hosstel again. located directly at the beach, connected to the public transportation and safe neighborhood to many bars and clubs. the parking situation is difficult, i wouldn't recommend getting a rental car. if necessary, park your car in the side streets of the pch, 16th or 14th street.

i had such a great time here. i was here for five nights and i was sad to leave. people who work here are very helpful and provide good tips if you ask. the breakfast is nice, the common room are a good way to meet people. the hostel is on pier avenue, where a lot of pubs play music in the evening. it might be hard to sleep but you'll have good time if you like going out! i truely recommand this hostel to everybody who wants to enjoy the beach and easy going life for hollidays!

it's above a bar, there's no free parking nearby, the rooms are tiny and in the room we stayed the other two guests seem to live there. also at some point  could hear two people arguing loudly and i think one of them was a staff member. also at night someone in another room had loud music.  the only good thing is that it's literally across the street from the beach, and there are several bars/restaurants nearby.

nice hostel, near the beach and right into a little surf-village. if you're lucky you have a room with sea-view. if you stay here to sleep a lot: don't go!! the pubs and bars are playing loud music until 2 am. you'll hear it very well on both of the floors. nice rooms, very little kitchen for the many guests. breakfast very simple. party place: yes! quiet place: no!
very cool hostel. 30 seconds to the beach and right next to all the bars/restuarants bike hire/bus etc etc. awesome stay. very helpful and friendly staff. free breakfast and met plenty of new people.

had an enjoyable 2 nights stay here. it's in a great location right in the hermosa beach mall. some great nightlife nearby and that endless l.a. beach can be seen from some of the rooms. the staff were very friendly and helpful. it's a long way from downtown l.a. so if you wanna see all that hollywood stuff probably best to stay elsewhere. but if you want to avoid the plastic paradise and see a more relaxed l.a. this is the place for you.
this is my second stay at surf city. i love the location, the staff, and the atmosphere the most. :) it is run very well, an th price is right. i close bats down, so it's right up my alley. :)
fantastic location, simple setup.
fantastic la beach front experience. i recommend this hostel.
the location is excellent, but another problem is too noise during the during, because many bars under the hostel. so far it is the best hostel i visited.

mixed dorms, lots for breakfast, right on the beach in a safe neighbourhood, french/american owners.    cons, small at times for space, but whatta heck it's not the hilton. i woke up every morning to waves.

the accommodation made my girlfriend very upset to the point we checked in and within an hour had checked out, no offer of a small sum back on what we had just paid. very deceiving description of the property! avoid at all costs

loved the location by the beach and the opportunity to rent bikes. very friendly staff. didn't like the plastic covers for the mattress and pillow. all in all a very neat place to stay for good money.

stayed for four nights, the location in hermosa beach was great with lots of bars and restaurants close by. the room was nice and clean and had an an suite which was good, the other bathrooms was very nice as well. you could ent a towel for free and the second one was 1 dollar so that was very good if you dont have much space in your bags for towels. overall i haad a very good stay!
great location, except that it was quite loud.  the mattresses could definitely use some upgrading as they were tough to sleep on since you could feel every spring.
at night it was really loud because there were bars just under the hostel.

surf city was a great place to stay, namely because of the location. you can see hermosa beach from your window, and it's also right on pier avenue where there are restaurants and shops and bars. great place to be. it's also not too noisy if you did prefer a more chilled night. the only issue with the location is that it is far away from downtown la and the public transport is a nightmare. but we just booked a tour that picked us up from a nearby hotel. simple! clean, nice rooms and bathroom.
great hostel with really helpful staff.. absolutely no complains!! thanks..

staff were extremely helpful - went out of their way to make sure you were happy and help you find places to go etc. even gave us coupons to save on food shopping! free breakfast was best we've had in 4 months of travelling. only downside to this hostel is the location. whilst its set right next to a beautiful beach, its next to a lot of bars so is noisy at night and it is also quite far from downtown la/hollywood etc so takes a fair amount of your day up just travelling there and back.
awesome time !!!

one of the top hostels i have stayed in. everything was amazing, from the location (can't beat it) to the staff, to the people staying there. we had more fun there than any stay on our trip! thanks surf city, i will be back fro sure!

i had booked here for a week and decided to cancel after a night (wanted my own room and thier "privates" were more then at a hotel), but they wouldn't refund my all my money- kept an extra night's stay even though it was 9am! so charged for 2 nights and only stayed for one, even a hotel doesn't treat you like this, otherwise great location with ocean views, but after a few nights there isn't much new to see or do.

i've been in hostels in europe and south america. in terms of cleanliness and safety this one is one is really poor, for instance, anyone could bring other people to the rooms. the place is perfect anyway (given that you're faaaar from hollywood).

great hostel. staff is very friendly and accommodating. loved the location and wasn't too loud at night where you couldn't sleep even though there are a lot of bars around. loved everything about it!!
hermosa is beautiful and your hostel got everything you need!
i loved it so much that i stayed one more night :-)  i will come back next time i am in la!
not a fair price to what is offered.
my second stay at surf city, would definately stay there again. its not the 'nicest' hostel i've ever stayed in but you can't fault that location, i could see the beach from my window
only there for one night but was great fun, really lovely people, great location next to the beach.. wish i didn't have to leave so soon!

one of the best places we stayed at in 3 weeks in the usa. the staff were all very friendly and helpful, we wanted a place near the beach and i don't think we could have been any closed. less than 100m from front door to sand. the surrounding area was full of excellent bars and restaurants and the hostel itself was really nice.
really fun place! i'll be come back here:d

great location right on the beach at hermosa and near some of the best bars i have ever been in most notable hennessys,the staff were very nice and the girl from montana drove me to the airport for free a nice tip is encouraged.met some really interesting people in the hostel but the facilities are quite basic so i did not spend any time in the place
great place to stay and socialize with many others. i would recommend it.
thumbs up!  great place to stay
a very funky hostel a few steps away from hermosa beach and right in the middle of some good bars and restaurants.

overall a good hostel! very close to the beach! staff were very friendly! there were quite a few long term people who had formed a clique which made it uncomfortable!   the common area was tiny! too many rooms! knock a couple of walls out to make some space!

3rd time staying there and it's delivered everytime, it's   no 5 star but what it is is a friendly warm hostel that seems  to attract good people, the guys you meet there are   always friendly and obliging. i recommend it but girls   it ain't the ritz so if you plan on staying a few weeks be prepared

this was an awesome hostel to stay at. unfortunately, due to the size of l.a. it is pretty much impossible to get around the city without a hire car. this hostel is great, in a really nice part of l.a. on a really nice beach. the staff are great and always helpful and nice.
if you want to go to beach and have fun then location is not a matter, but it takes a long time to go to downtown especially you don't rent a car and have to take bus.
awesome place! surfed everyday, steps from the beach and tons of rental shops on the block. fun and friendly staff.

overall people were wonderful felt like a big part of a family  the accommodations were good.  the only thing i can suggest is to fix showers and make sure windows r repaired for safety. i will definitely come back to stay miss everyone already so sweet  oh and bar under neath wow hard to get sum slep :)
the staff are lovely, helpful. hostel is clean and in a great location right next to hermose beach.
good for surfers!

great great hostel!!! i would definitely recommend it to anyone! the staff is ready to help you for anything (even for a cheap ride to the airport or rent a car). the location is just perfect!!! the only so so thing to me was the bathroom... shared and really no intimacy at all...

it was really nice to stay in this hostel,the staff is really friendly and they give you all the information you need. my room has a beautiful ocean view. the kitchen is not so big but for that reason is like stay at home!

here's the deal, this hostel is in a great location with exception of the bar it's sits on top of. the staff are friendly and helpful no doubt. however, if you have a room on the second floor you will not be able to go to sleep till 2 am due to the music from the bar downstairs. so if you can't beat em, join em right? well if your in the mood for joinin em it's cool,  but if you've got better things to do, your sleep schedule being dictated by the bar downstairs sucks.

nice hostel with very friendly staff and clean rooms and bathrooms, also the beds were really comfy. a lot of bars and restaurants close by which is good but you also hear the loud music to your room. there was a little breakfast included, mainly toast with peanut butter and jam. we had a car and had to park it quite far to get free parking which was a little bit annoying but close to where we had to park there was a good supermarket in where you got a discount when you stayed at surf city.
everyone was really helpful
the hostel and the people i have met there were great! :) i was feeling very cozy and worm! :) and the location was perfect! :)

best hostel ever!  i stayed in a 6-bed female dorm and it was awesome. i had the most amazing sea view. ;) the people i met were really cool. the staff is very friendly, fun and helpful. the place is perfect: hermosa beach is gorgeous! and if you stay there during low season, there isn't as much noise from the bars. but if you're sensitive, you should bring ear plugs. ;)  all in all, i really enjoyed it and i will definitely recommend this hostel!
friendly people, fun place, very close to the beach ( i could see it from the shower) taxis are close. just the internet was a bit slow. in total i would recommend it!

i was only there for a night but made friends straight away with people hanging out there.  the place is kept pretty clean and it's bang on the beach.  if you can handle a laid back surf culture hostel then this is great.  it's an old building but that just gives it some character.  there's free parking up the street or you can park behind the hostel but you have to pay. you can ride bikes up to santa monica along the beach.
lovely friendly staff, felt like a home away from home.  bike rental was so much fun, thank you!
great place to beach party

superbly located hostel, right on a fantastic beach and surrounded by vibrant bars and restaurants, in what feels like a very safe area. staff very helpful, providing guests with beach towels and body/boogie boards free of charge. bedrooms quite small however, and with few showers/toilets per floor. extremely noisy at night (in my 1st floor, street-facing room) until 1am though, as the bars' bass comes directly through the floor and the windows - although if you're out partying, no problem!
good location, with beach, pub, restaurants, shops,and so on. not far from airport.
i loved it there! right at the beach and a lot lf fun!
really great! location could not be better! really fun atmosphere

we had a great time there, spent a whole week in a super hostel! nice staff, clean rooms, awesome location. international audience, i heard english, german, french, spanish etc. :)  especially if you're travelling alone, this is the perfect place to stay. you meet a lot of people in the kitchen (real kitchen, everything's there to cook), the tv room or the "living room"

great place to stay, but very pokey.  not a great deal of room.  however the staff were superb and helped me out of a jam on a very. very frustrating day.  gets noisy at night in the plaza below, but you are guaranteed the partying will stop at 2am, no later, as the local by-laws are very strict.  if i went to la i'd stay there again for sure.

very nice location on the beach, but far away from downtown and the greyhoundbus station. so if you plan to go to downtown check another hostel, but for a beach vacation it´s perfect. very safe area, many bars and restaurants. the rooms are okay, bathroom was clean.

perfect hostel! location is very good - exclusively nice houses, cool bars, good beach!  the hostel is very (!) clean, the bathroom is unisex .. :) ..., the rooms are not the biggest, but it's perfect for travelers who search hostels and who don't really need luxury big rooms and for that price you won't get such nice rooms and such a good location at hermosa beach. definitely worth a stay!!!
i had a blast staying here.  it's a small place so you have a great chance to meet people.  i would definitely stay here again.  right on the beach!!!
cute location. loud neighbors. beautiful beach. friendly people.
we were given a room with two live in residents so we had no space whatsoever and felt as though we were living in someone else's bedroom, this was quite uncomfortable and unwelcoming
l ostello nn e male discreta pulizia disponibili per tutto  dove situato ci sono diverrsi pub dover ci si diverte   sopprattutto nei weekend senza usare l auto

hey together!! it was a relaxing and funny stay at the surf city hostel.   my problem was that i didn't like it that much in hermosa. i drove every day to santa monica because there was way more going on. hermosa is really quiet. little shopping and nightlife possibilities (my opinion). further there was no computer and no lockers in the hostel.   but, it was direct to the beach and the people there are very nice and helpfull :)   greez

i loved my stay with surf city hostel. i ended up working in exchange for my room and stayed for over a month. the hostel is right on the beach and next to several bars and restaurants from high end to very affordable. there is some loud music from said bars and clubs at night, but i slept without any issues. the rooms and entire facilities are cleaned every day and the staff are all very friendly and helpful. a lot of the tenants come back year after year to this same hostel!

the location is awesome because it's not near the beach, it's in the beach, but it's like 50 minutes by car from l.a. this is in hermosa beach, so if you don't have a car, you're screwed if you want to see things from l.a.    but if you have a car, this is great.
ok, no park lot
awesome... so much fun... party every night... and really great people :)
very good location for partying and going to the beach! wifi doesn't reach all rooms though, and there are no personal lockers. really good for chillin'
had an awesome time. this hostel is one of a kind. i loved the staff and the location. highly recommend this place!!!!

character - old building, old photos from place, the description from hostel world should be updated.    security - i saw some people from others places sleeping there, even tourists that register for 2 and stay 3.     staff - they are doing what's possible, on that conditions.    cleanliness - i stayed in one bedroom with some guys that used to live there, so... it's their home inside the bedroom.
great hostel, great staff, a lot of fun. the only annoying thing is that it's pretty complicated to reach the "more interesting" parts of la from the hostel.

this place is great - if you're coming to the area to get drunk and party your ass off n a surfer.  other than that purpose this isn't close to actual la life/fun - it's a 20 minute drive from la and that could longer depending on traffic.and bonus it's on the beach.
this is a great location and the atmosphere at the hostel is great, staff were very friendly and the night life is close and fun, the area is a little expensive though

the place is awesome... sweet location but the only slight down falls i found that other hostels have is the lack of lock up facilities for valuables, a few of the staff werent so friendly and since the place wasnt brand spanker new it wasnt the cleanest, all in all i would definately stay there again and recoment it to friends and travellers... thanks guys for my first experience to la.
this hostel is in an amazing location.  right on the beautiful beach and around plenty of resturants and stores.  the staff was super helpful and very friendly.  i would deffinately stay here again!
best hostel ever.

far away from the citycenter but hermosa is fun and safe and pretty.   we got dorms with ocean-view! located right between a nice strip of bars... (be prepared for loud music at night). the bathrooms are without any options to withdraw but clean... a homelike atmo with 2 cute commonrooms and very nice staff ...
great place if you are looking for a beach hang out, don't stay here if you will be spending a lot of time downtown.

as my first stop in america, i would highly recommend. this hostel doesn't feel cold or uninviting, but more like a welcoming little community, which helps you adjust quickly, especially as a solo traveller.  the resident hostel dwellers will welcome you in with warm greetings, and you'll find it difficult to move on once you arrive......excellent location, excellent hostel.....would recommend to all international travellers.....x

great location-right above shops, bars,so nice to chill in bar at evening, though you may hear music from pubs at weekends-bring ear plugs and you will be fine...  common kitchen and areas need updating-tiny kitchen with everyone fighting for space at dinner times-not good!  seems like the majority of lodgers are more long term rather than people travelling and moving on which we didnt really like..this made us feel like we were intruding.  annette on front desk lovely and helpful!!

be warned: it is very loud. there's a bar downstairs and heaps of other bars nearby. the location is excellent; right by the beach which we could see from our window. it's clean, staff are friendly and it's handy to lax. we would stay again.

first of all: the hostel is not located in la. it's at hermosa beach a way to far from the city. if you want a stay on the beach with young people having fun, thats fine, but don't go there thinking about la. i felt cheated. i should had stayed for 4 nights and spent only two until find out a new hostel to move in.  the mattresses are old and the cleanliness is poor.  the place is on the top of a bar so is too noise at night.  the staff are really nice, though.

i  really enjoyed my experience staying in this hostel.  there was a great, friendly vibe amongst everyone, including the staff.  it was big enough to house a lot of backpackers, but small enough to maintain a tight culture.  right next to the beach, which was cool!  a long way from hollywood, and loud music until 2 pm may deter some guests.

super lage, 30 meter vom strand entfernt, direkt an der promenade, fahrrã¤der ausleibar fã¼r $10/tag. tolle fahrradtour nach santa monica mã¶glich.   sehr freundliches und gut gelauntes personal. wertsachen kann man im bã¼ro abgeben wenn man wo hingeht.  frã¼hstã¼ck ist ok.  die bars unter und neben dem hostel schlieãen um 2uhr morgens(law)- das ist blã¶d fã¼r die die lange feiern wollen aber gut fã¼r die die gerne ruhig schlafen und gut fã¼r den geldbeutel :)
this was my first experience of a hostel and it exceeded my expectations. thank you for a wonderful first time, all other hostels now have your standards to live up to.

this place is fairly good. clean enough, good enough breakfast, wifi, security, nice staff... but overall it rates average. and it's quite far from anywhere in los angeles but, well, that's los angeles, right?
amazing times there!!

surf city hostel was my favourtie of all the hostels i stayed at while in la. it had the best location. i was a 21 year old girl travelling by myself and i felt so safe - the staff are always present and the intimate, community feel of this hostel meant i made so many friends.  loved it!!!
had to wait 2 hrs to get into room even though i had booked. location is bad. takes 3 hrs to get to hollywood. manager is french and cant understand a word she says. would not stay again
hostel was ok, but there were no lockers in the room and it had not been cleaned for at least some days.

this hostel is certainly rough around the edges but if you're looking for somewhere away from the touristy spots where you'll meet other travellers then surf city is okay. the rooms and bathrooms are very bare, if not too basic (a mirror in the bedrooms would be helpful for women travellers!) so don't expect much, and there is a lot of noise from the bars downstairs so pack ear plugs!!!
had an amazing time staying at the surf city so close to the parties hermosa has to offer and the beach bike path is right out side with $10 bike hire well worth it!  will go back and visit again.

a wonderful hostel where you are bound to meet new people. not a place for people that do not like noise nor party. if you want to sleep early, make sure you bring earplugs, but much better, join the fun and sleep late.    the security of the hostel is virtually non-existent, however, no security is needed as i've never felt as safe as in this hostel. people were using notebooks on the free wifi, and i felt comfortable with leaving it unguarded on my dorm-room. so did my room-mates.
great place at a great beach!!! staff was great!! so was the atmosphere!!! be back!!!

location is pretty good, right on the beach and loads of bars and places to eat right on the doorstep. showers are a little rank and the dorms are tatty but pretty cheap in comparison to other places in la. would deffo give it another go if i'm in la again.
good hostel. you can rent bikes there. 50meters from the seaside! some members of the personnel were a bit rude.

this hostel is in an excellent location; in the heart of westwood/ucla with a huge supermarket, target, cvs pharmacy, trader joe's and buses within 2 to 3 blocks that can take you anywhere in los angeles county. it is a new hostel, recently built. it is a large spacious place, quiet with a large modern kitchen well equipped. there is parking on site feb 2018 10 usd overnight. it is at the corner of hillgard and leconte. beds are comfortable, individually built. staff helpful on whatever u need.

podshare westwood is the cleanest american hostel i've stayed in. ample kitchen and bathroom spaces, both well organized and meticulously cleaned. pods come with built-in storage, lamps, and outlets. 10/10 amenities everywhere: double outlets in each bunk, double microwaves in the kitchen, easy to find fridge space and i've never had to wait for a bathroom stall or shower because there are so many to choose from. staff is friendly and accommodating, as well. would definitely recommend!

hi.  this property was under construction when i arrived.  there was glass doors leaning against the walls in the hallways.  people still painting.  men with drills in the showers.  no private toilets.  exposed plug in/  no security locks on my locker.  no access to front door.  people were staying there for free in lieu of work. (illegal).  i had to call the police and i contacted the city and filed a complaint.  they are investigating.
free coffee

when i first read previous reviews i was disappointed in the many low scores, particularly as i'd just come from a fabulous, cheaper hostel in san diego. on arrival i thought i'd also be fairly negative. however! i was very pleasantly surprised to discover that the place suffers only from age! the staff are extremely helpful,keep it as clean as possible and create a sense of community. yes, i made an effort to involve myself but why go to a hostel if you're not interested in like-minded people?

i stayed in many hostels but this has a very strange vibe. this guy walked into our room with his gf without any problems, he wasn’t even a guest there and it was an all female room. the hostel smelled very bad and was quite dodgy. but it is the perfect location and the staff was very sweet. also nice breakfast and well equipped kitchen.

i cancelled this reservation after going to front desk and learning about all the rules that must have been listed in super fine print or weren’t listed at all like not being allowed to have guests or food in my private room; locked doors at 4am where i can’t get into the building after that, zero air conditioning in room i’m sleeping in etc etc. hostelworld should do better at making these type of rules very obvious as i would have looked for a different location.
great location. good facilities. needs a leader-all staff seem to be volunteers and arguing amongst each other.  but great spot. o would stay there again
the staff was really accommodating. will definitely stay here again in the future.

i never actually stayed here. tried to call, email and left a message to cancel to avoid booking fees but still got charged. i'm sure it's a nice spot it has good ratings but my experience only involved purchasing a service i never used.
the bedrooms and common areas were very dirty and uninviting - didn't feel too secure and staff weren't all that accomodating or warming

the breakfast was great! but it would have been nice to hear more about the free dinner..  this hostel have really good potential too become really really nice. unfortunately the energi level is not that high.
i felt like i was in jail when going to bed. literally 80° in the room and no a/c. everything is dirty. the beds are ok. saw a cockroach in the room. overall a 2/10 experience. staff was nice.
seen a rat in that back room and the locations good but not suitable for all due to the homeless people who gather on the beach, which is right next to the hostel

the hostel had a good atmosphere, everyone was very friendly & welcoming. lisa at the front desk was lovely. we booked the "deluxe 7 bed dorm" not realising that meant there would be 6 bunk beds in the room plus one single bed off to the side. it was very cramped & smelled bad, wasn't very clean. the room had no air conditioning so was extremely warm. kitchen/common area unclean. it's in a good location in that it's right next to venice beach although we found we preferred santa monica.
really old and unclean place with no atmosphere. the best part was that it motivated you to leave the hostel and go exploring.

the only decent thing about this hostel is the location. the facilities are dirty & run down. there were dirty blankets left in our room and visible piles of dust & dirt on the windows and ceiling fan. there was broken glass on our floor that one of us stepped on. they allow guests to smoke inside in common areas & people blast music until 6am, we didn't sleep at all. there was one female receptionist who was very nice & helpful when we had such a horrible stay. we would never stay here again

i was worried about all bad reviews here. but i  haven't any problem there. staff was very friendly and wifi worked.    the only thing i didn't like was that you need to return before 4am or will be locked out till 8am

no one was at reception when we arrived at 6:30 so we had to wait outside until 8am! very unwelcoming after a long flight! the communal area was very unclean, we were sat on the wifi and a rat came out from under the sofa!

we emailed to delay arrival time and called to confirm prior to arrival. we arrived they skimmed my credit card then told us that there were no beds. 9pm at night. we ended up having to go to the airport and sleeping on a chair as no other rooms were available. very slow and unhelpful. took an hour for them to prove the refund then realised they only partially refunded the amount and said it was because we were late even though they sold out beds to someone else. crooks.
extremely rude staff and dirty hostel. they made us wait for over an hour to check in.

this hostel is right by venice beach, great location. that the only good thing i have to say about it though. some unhelpful staff, slow check in process, charged extra fees we weren't aware of, charged us $4 per night to pay by credit card, extreme dirty hostel (from dishes to walls, floor and furniture), rooms are super hot and loud with not even a working fan. it was a nightmare to sleep in. insanely expensive for what you get. worst hostel i've stayed in - and i've stayed in many.

great location! the room was clean, not too hot and with lockers inside the rooms and locks on the door. the only issues i had was hostility and one word/no eye-contact responses from some staff and although they advertise laundry, i was instructed to only use them after 10pm when staff had finished doing the sheets (then there was a sign on the closed doors saying no guest laundry after 10pm so no clue what that was about). the hostility brought down the vibe and it didn't feel very social
great location, staff member checking us in was quite rude and the facilities are quite run down.

extremely rude man at reception, haven't met someone so rude and i have been staying in hostels for 5 months, had to wait until 5 pm to check in when he earlier said 2 pm and when i approached him to ask for wi-fi he ignored me for  nearly a minute and then said in a horrible tone 'question' i asked if whilst i waited i could use wifi he rudely told me i have to wait until i check in to get the code. my room was way to hot to sleep, other staff where great, good waffles for breakfast. overpriced

i've stayed in hostels from bangkok to paris and this is the dirtiest. i was looking forward to my first hostel in the us, but this did not meet my expectations. very dirty common rooms and kitchen, and my shared room had windows that opened to the porch, so loud conversations were happening late into the night when myself and others were trying to get a little sleep.    location is awesome, right by the beach in the heart of venice.:)

i booked a private room on the third floor (room 302). the room was practically a suite: very spacious.   sure the bed was wonky, no air con or tv, but the room had character. strangely enough the room had an old windows xp computer - no sure what for other than providing usb ports to charge devices (& there's a disk drive too!).  the lobby, lounge and check-in are all very backpacker like - so don't be surprised.   this hostel fits well with the venice beach experience

this hostel was pretty disgusting, not really any security, on the more expensive side and so hot i couldn't sleep. i think people came and did a quick wipe down of the bathroom everyday but the place is a real dump. i don't think they have ac or windows in any of the rooms.

let me start with location: fantastic! if it's your intention to stay in the venice/santa monica area i don't think there's anywhere better. you could throw a stone from this hostels balcony and hit venice beach.   the facilities were fine, on par with many hostels i've stayed in over the years. nothing special though.   only little qualm i had was with one of the members of staff. the other two i dealt with were great but one was just a bit brash and didn't appear to want to be there.

i booked a 7 female dorm, we were 10 women in there with a tiny bathroom. facilities are quite old.  staff is super friendly.  breakfast is coffee, one kind of cereal and waffles, not really a big choice!
was absolutely horrible. nothing about it was good. i've travelled all over the world and this is by far the worst place. yes it's close to the beach but not worth it. don't stay here.

it is great hostel to socialise someone.   location is the best thing in this hostel, it is near the main enterance to venice beach walk.   nice staff and great barbecue and socialization.   it might be noisy, but it is okay.

this hostel is all about the location, as close the the boardwalk as you can get. the building itself is rather old and has seen better days. everything needs a small repair of some sort as nothing is 100%. staff were friendly and competent and i had no dramas checking in, extending my stay or checking out. wi-fi was average at best. consider a short stay for this location and move to another location closer to other sights. this one is only really close to venice and sm ~30 to uber to hw for eg

location is fantastic, however, i felt the hostel staff rely on this for their business. i cou0le of the staff were great but that was offered by some being very rude, unhelpful & obviously thought guests were an intrusion.

my stay was very nice, i meet many nice people from different places and was able to foster a good experience.  breakfast was great, i got good sleep.  very close location to all the happenings.  staff was friendly and accommodating.
fantastic location, great staff and very reasonable price couldn't have been happier
room was great for 3 people to go private. not sure why they didn't oprnnkitchen until 8am. all common areas closed until 8am? weird, never saw anything like that before.

room 201 the single bed is horrible and the street light shines in all night. might i suggest a better curtain. i had to tie my sarong over the blind there. and the cot bottom on the single makes the matress slide off.. but i like your staff and common area alot

absolutely disgusting place.. everything was dirty, everyone is smoking indoors, the owner does not speak english, beds were not clean, wifi not working, kitchen horrifying, area is extremely sketchy. on our first morning a homeless man snuck in to the building and started yelling and they couldn't get him out. they charge a 25$ fee if you pay by card.... not impressed.

just like everyone else says, this hostel is great for location...and nothing more beyond that. it looks pretty janky if you ask me. a lot of the furniture is worn out, dusty main area with the chairs all tore up. the bedrooms have this old dust odor to them, the bed sheets don't seem very clean (they don't have that nice clean smell either) but i will say the bathroom was not so bad. check in took too long. i had to wait for almost 30 min. no bueno.just see it more as a place to stay and gtfo.

great location but that is where the great stops. was pretty put off by some of the staff, they were not friendly nor could they offer any helpful advice about what to go and see. the dinner deals they adverse were non existent when i was there and the wifi only worked very infrequently. if you just want to be on the beach, it is a good spot though.

it's an awesome place to be at, very chill. when there is fear of low security you kinda have to feel the atmosphere and know you'll be alright. everything went great in my stay. staff is very friendly and helpful. even the guests were very kind. this place is 2 min away from the shore. i loved it.

this was the dirties hostel i have ever been to. it was filthy and i would never stay there again. we used 2 packets of disinfectant wipes to get the room in reasonable shape. there was a hole in the wall, dead cockroaches and other insects, the shower had no pressure with very little water flowing, the bedsheets were full of holes and stains, one of the windows had no blinds or curtains, and plenty of dust on all surfaces. save your money and stay somewhere else - this was not worth it at all.

very average. pretty dated now and a lot of the doors are broken and need replacing. it's pricy for what it is but a lot of hostels with a good location like this are these days. staff were nice and welcoming. i've stayed at the same sun more or less next door and i think i prefer that, but that's not that great either.
had so much fun staying here  met some great people  staff were friendly   30 second walk from the beach  bars, convenience stores, restaurants all within a block  would deffo go back

don't stay here. all the bad reviews are correct!!! not in a safe location, anyone can walk in and out. the staff working there were awfully rude and scruffy - the man working there told us when we checked in 'i can see you, i'm on my lunch brake you'll have to wait'. it was all downhill from there. only good this about the hostel was lisa she was lovely. the wifi was also awful. we wanted to move hostel straight away. constantly smelt of weed. bad vibe.
great location, nice breakfast... rooms smelt weird and wifi didn't work. it is expensive but same as everywhere in la. does the job if your there for a few days and want to be by the beach.
amazing location!   helpful friendly staff.   would stay here again.

horrible stay!  i read the negative reviews and decided i would still give this place a go.  terrible idea!  the only reason i have rated this place slightly alright is because of the location.  location feels very unsafe, although close to beach.  staff were terrible.  people doing drugs regularly in room.  place is filthy and run down.  anyone can walk into the hostel which makes it very unsafe.  i would never stay at this place again.
the staff were nice, la is expensive and this hostel is no exception. pretty good location right by venice beach.
the location is the best thing.  the breakfast is okay  two major problems : staff is a little bit too rude and should be honest about the fact that there's no wifi

worst hostel ive stayed in over my 6 month trip. no wi-fi, people smoking in the common area next to the kitchen, guests coming in and out of rooms at 3am, over priced dorms etc... only good thing was the breakfast. garbage !
总体地段很好，但是房间不够干净，沙发和公共地区都有味道，不推荐
feels a lot more shady than it is. fantastic location near the beach.
it was a place to stay and chill out for a bit.
its a good location,good people.is just that the room smells bad, and the sheets didnt seem clean.

great proximity to venice beach. generally good vibes. lovely common areas. awesome waffle breakfasts included. very clean.    one staff member can be quite unreasonable and rude with guests. i almost cancelled my stay upon arrival, as he was the first staff member i interacted with, and i witnessed him horribly harassing another guest right before my departure. this needs to be seriously addressed by mgmt.
excellent

i understand it's a private room in la but man, it's expensive for what you get. either stay in a dorm to save money or find a hotel for a bit more. the room was awful, the bed was on an angle and the kitchen had nothing but a sink. no cups, no fridge, no nothing! it was so depressing!

i had a fantastic time when i was here with my dad! we met so many lovely people and ate delicious waffles every morning. i really don't like that people can smoke inside it just makes it really uncomfortable. the beds needed a bigger blanket as i was cold in the night. apart from that the vibe is great and it's right on the beach which is nice and chill.
i had a pleasant stay.the staff were very helpful.clean place .i love the fact that i only shared a bathroom with my roommates only and not the whole floor etc.  worth every dollar.
this place is very dirty i would never stay there again

conveniently located hostel right in the heart of venice. very pricey for what you get though - an average bunk and rooms that could do with a good clean. breakfast is basic and disappointing. good common areas. met some great travelers too

this hostel is massively overpriced and really basic. we booked a private room and was greeted with a cockroach in the bathroom, my light didn't work and neither did the toilet. i complained the next day and they did fix the problems but offered me no compensation. these problems don't usually bother me but then we're  usually paying $25 a night and not $125.  location is great but that's it
superb location, feel at home, great breakfast.   become a new generation hippie.  엘에이 단골 숙소. 베니스비치를 만끽하면서 대중교통으로 다른 곳 가기도 편리함. 특히 혼자 여행사 여성전용 도미토리와 큰 공용키친은 큰 플러스.

location is perfect (was a bit hard to find at first, make sure you read directions given, wouldn't hurt to have a sign outside though..)   bathroom in 4 person dorm was so nice and newly renovated.   free breakfast is just a waffle but still good   would come back/ do recommend

i loved it! awesome!  mir hat das hostel gut gefallen. ich war in einem 7-bett-zimmer mit blick auf das venice sign. fand ich total geil. frühstück war ok. das beste: der strand ist gleich um die ecke. ich würde das hostel auf jeden fall weiterempfehlen.

i&#39;ve stayed probably over 30 hostels in my life, and i&#39;ve never had such a bad experience as this one.    the staff was very unfriendly. the room, bed, and shower were in a disgusting situation. at the room, there were only two lockers, when there are seven beds. and the wifi? don&#39;t try to count on it, too slow and disconnect every few minutes.    whenever i tried to work things out and adjust the situation with the hostel stuff, i got a simple &#34;that&#39;s against our policy&#34; answer, whi

great location 50m from venice beach. they let me check in at 9am and have the free breakfast upon arrival which was really nice. free diner style coffee all day was also really nice too. one evening they had free hotdogs with pickles and onion and condiments supplied too. free dinner in an expensive ish country was pretty amazing really! $50us a night seems very expensive for a dorm bed but i don&#39;t think you&#39;d get much cheaper in la anywhere and the location was great so can&#39;t really complain!

fantastic location, clean rooms and it was great that breakfast was included. my only complaint was the noise at night - both nights i was there people were running up and down the halls, yelling and slamming doors until very late. also be aware that if you pay your deposit on card, it take 5 business days to get your money back, which was problematic for me as i was leaving the u.s. in the next few days. the girl who checked me in also seemed very disinterested and wasn't very friendly.

i stayed in a four person female only room on the second floor. the room was not clean at all and it had a distinct smell of urine. i remember reading another review about the smell, but didn&#39;t take it very serious. however, room 201 smells a lot!! when i booked the hostel it was written that all costs were included. however when i showed up taxes, resort fees, booking charge, holliday additiona cost was added to the price and what seemed like a good deal ended up really expensive.

this hostel served us a purpose, we wanted to stay near venice beach for a night. we decided my to stay any longer as we could get a really nice room on airbnb for less in a nice friendly neighbourhood. can't really comment on the social aspect and the staff were friendly and helpful however the hostel itself seemed run down and over priced for what it was

is a good cheap hostel with a close location to venice beach boardwalk. rooms are ok, common room and kitchen could do with some new furniture or updating. breakfast was limited -waffles were good though. hostel allows people to smoke inside which some guests didn&#39;t like.
amazing location! walking distance to everything 😊😊 very casual atmosphere!

when i arrived the room hadn&#39;t been cleaned. i informed the staff at reception i was simply given new sheets so i had to strip and make my own bed. the sink in the room didn&#39;t drain and the toilet later stopped working. we had a whole night with no bathroom and was moved to a different room the next day. breakfasts are very unappealing and wifi is very dodgy which didn&#39;t even work for half our stay. many of the staff are very rude and don&#39;t seem to care however the location is incredible.

i mean, that's the only few places available at the beach area, so can't complain much.  great location, nice staff.    bathroom pipe was broken, every night the room is basically flooding...  the place is really sketchy, you got pot heads- which is normal lol  and drug abusing ladies who just jump into your conversation and laugh along for some reason. that creeps us out tbh.    but like i said, can't complain much cause you got no choice if you're on a budget travel like me :o
great location, staff was nice, hostel was clean but communial areas are in poor condition, most couches are severely ripped. coed dorm was 14 beds with 1 bathroom.

my one and only complaint is that our ceiling fan squeaked pretty bad and it was really hot in the room other then that perfect! great staff, great rooms, great location. needless to say everything was great!

hostel is in a great location right by the beach and has very helpful and friendly staff. the area is really interesting with a lot to see along the boardwalk. rooms are clean and good kitchen facilities and chill out areas.

arrived at hostel and was told my name wasn&#39;t on the books so after panicking and asking over and over again if she could double check, the staff member finally looked again and it turns out i was! the photos definitely do this hostel justice, don&#39;t expect it to be very nice. it was my first hostel and i&#39;ve just come back from another stay in a hostel in san diego which was like a luxury hotel compared to this hostel. only good thing was the location, but i&#39;d recommend staying in santa monic

we had a private room. it was clean, tidy, nice, spacious! we had our own key, and our stuff was safe! they actually had room service here which i was surprised about, and they provided towels.  the location was pretty nice being right next to the beach, although there were a lot of homeless people around at night. this is definitely a hostel for you to stay at with someone else or a group of people.  the staff was kind of helpful, but some were unclear and sarcastic which is not good.
the staff took forever to check me in and out and needed a lot of reminding, the room wasn't clean and nothing seemed well-run or organized. definitely not worth the rates they charged.

the venice beach hostel is greatly located right next to the beach. the price is great for a us hostel. it is very clean and well maintained. the breakfast (which is included) could have been a bit better and more diverse. otherwise it was an enjoyable stay.
the area didn&#39;t feel very safe in the evening and the room where we stayed had a strong smell to urine. in my next trip to la i will not repeat at this hostel.

a lot of the residents are staff living there. they are pretty friendly. breakfast is waffles and potatoes. as a location venice beach is okay during day time buy very scary after dark. lots of surfers and skaters and also weed smokers.
for two nights dormitory the booked 135,- from my visa instead of 2x48,00- --- i call that a classic tried-fraud!!!! i will take the legal way on them now...

amazing location! right on the main road within venice beach area.   however, this also meant a very noisy room for us, and i wasn't completely impressed with the security of the hostel, as the front door was left open with anyone free to come and go as they please.   room had a strange smell, and felt very old and in need of some revamping, but was all in all clean.   breakfast was nice, but as far as the hostel goes for what it was, the room was pricey, and i probably wouldn't stay here again.
omg, had an amazing time.  everyone was so helpful ana friendly.  much thanks to the staff and those who were passing through.  peace
awesome stay,  fabulous location,  really helpful staff :)
i really enjoyed my stay there. it was great! the staff was friendly and helpful and i even made some friends there. i will definitely go back there if i had another chance.
the rooms were very cold!

the staff could be friendlier, not the best hostel i've stayed in by a long shot but the beds were comfy and the location is ideal. warning: if you're planning on being/ going out between 5-8am you will be locked out! not 24 hour currently and dinner was also not included as advertised.

very nice staff 99 %, nice chilled out areas to cook and hang out, feels like being in someones living room..very relaxed. a bit funny though to have to be out of the room between 11am and 3pm for cleaning....its a long time not being able to be in your space if you wanted to. i would definately come back if i was in la again!

i loved location close to the action on the beach. great room mates from ireland made it interesting. there is a large common room that had most kitchen needs, and couches with places to charge your tech. the front desk wasn't always covered, you may have to wait for answers to questions. great hostel to stay at for fun outside...not so much for a good night sleep. street sounds definitely come in the room! parking is tough, watch out for tickets! many homeless..and we saw a car window busted.
the hostel have a excellent localization, good acomodation, but the staff is not that good, watting for check in, rude people.

check in was slow and unless we put up a fight, we would have been charged a higher price for the room than initially agreed (excluding tax). the first time we used the toilet, there was leakage - however, it did not happen afterwards. the furniture is very old and run down, the shower is inconvenient and water was barely dropping.  the place is too run down to even be hippie. location is very good, but i wouldn't go back there - not enough value for the money it's charging.

anyone could walk in and out of this hostel, it seemed people lived there, luckily we were in a private room for security but i wouldn't have liked to have leave my stuff in a locker which was in the hallway. breakfast was awful with just a waffle maker, and potatoes? we moved around the corner to samesun venice beach and had a great time.
the staff (lovely greetings to sarah and simon) is so nice, it's very clean and the location is perfect.

i have traveled all around the world and have been in many different hostels as well as worked in them. i instantly got bad vibes from this hostel when me and my girlfriend walked in. the staff was very rude, unhelpful, messed other people's reservations up, and were drunk. the facility's, common areas, and kitchen were filthy. people were allowed to smoke inside and the outside patio are is right next to rooms so you get smoke and noise from that. on top of all this it was extremely over priced

location was amazing, the atmosphere was nice, it was clean enough, expensive for what you get (but location is something you're also paying for in the total). i'm easygoing and my expectations were medium-low, so i was extremely happy with what i found and the overall stay. the staff was amazing. the boys and girls that work there were -altogether- a sort of dysfunctional family, which was kind of  funny. sarah rules above all.
good spot. but very boring hostel not much going on
very spacious provate double room and bathroom. i fecommend this place

the location is the only good thing about this hostel. it wasn't very clean, and the staff members are weird...  i stayed there for 2 days in a room with 10 other people for a 7 bed shared-room and it was okay...
