warning: do not stay at this hostel. the positive reviews on this website here are questionable. the management treat guests like dirt. they charge an exorbitant security deposit and make you jump through hoops to get it back the next day. i would never stay here again. this hostel and its management totally ruined the atmosphere of what is a nice town on the beach.
cordial and helpful staff. our room was clean and cozy - with modern bathroom fixtures. the best part was the easy five minute walk to the beach and great eateries.
wonderful staff and beautiful room! it was huuuge and the beds were soo comfortable!! i loved staying here and i'll be back soon!!

venice beach hostel was a charming, wonderfully situated hostel. the two staff members that i met we knowledgeable and helpful, the rooms were clean and comfortable. overall it was a very enjoyable stay that i would recommend to anyone looking to visit the area.

the organization is very poor. i changed room twice in three days. the first room in wich i stayed was literally a box without window and three people in there. and i was actually paying the same that people in pretty nice rooms. the breakfast is really bad too. i wouldn't come back to venice beach hostel and i wouldn't recommend it either. however once i complained there were a person of the staff that helped me after arguing with me for a while.

simon was extremely accommodating when we checked in 27/7. when we checked out on 28/7 the new man was extremely rude. he acted as if we were the most inconvenient thing about his morning. we just stood there in such an awkward situation as he bustled about getting our security deposit back and being very rude when we needed to put our bags in storage. he spoke in single words! for example 'sign'. 'no'. he actually ruined the whole experience and we were so off-put by his absolute hostility.

pros: couldn't ask for a better location in venice 2 min walk to the beach front. room/beds comfortable. clean bathrooms/showers. free wifi that works well. lots of evening activities, breakfast included. most staff friendly.  cons: $100 deposit required when you check in plus sneaky $25 surcharge if you book only one night on a weekend, hidden in the small print. check in process is a shambles when busy, then one staff member was pretty rude. maybe upset he had to get his arse off the couch.
i loved the feel and location of the hostel! it seems very venice beach and i would recommend to friends
great hostel. excellent location. private room with enquire was huge and very comfortable and quiet.

the hostel was probably one of the worst we stayed at. we enjoyed our stay but the facilities are awful and the room very basic and stuffy. the location is amazing though!! right along the beach and a nice walk into santa monica. there are heaps of awesome restaurants and cafes at your doorstep. we really enjoyed our 10 days there. we didn't spend much time at the hostel, because it was so much fun being outside so it didn't really matter that the accommodation wasn't the greatest

pretty standard hostel but an amazing location, less than 5 minutes to venice beach, with a nice pub and coffee shop nearby. the twin room was quite comfortable and spacious, and they let us check in early which was very much appreciated after a 14 hour flight.
everyone on staff is nice except the european white guy who seems to be in charge... he is miserable with his life apparently and is a real debbie downer. stay away from him
awesome staff and great atmosphere there is always someone to talk to and things todo. 300m from muscle beach, just go and hit the outdoor gym!
to dirty, and personal was very cold. they didint control what happen inside the rooms even if there where a party!! its ok for young travelers but thats it, just ok.

the staff we very helpful and extremely friendly. the location is great for the beach and santa monica but be prepared for long bus trips to hollywood, downtown, or universal city. (we found that catching the bus to the closest metro stop cut down travel time).
good hostel !!right next to the beach :)
lockers in horrible condition, staff not very polite, beds were not clean when we arrived, and the price is ridiculous for that kind of service.

people are friendly and nice, however, i didn't like the hidden extra fees at checkout. right near the beach and cafe's. also you get a discount at the bike rentals for staying at the hostel which helps with funds.

when i came from australia i was shocked how expensive this hostel is.  but obviously this is quite normal in la.  i really liked the atmosphere in the hostel and the stuff is awesome! the location is top and even if your don't have car you can do a lot of things.  so would definitely recommend it and next time i'll stay here again   and they got free breakfast with waffles and eggs in the morning which is great!
had a private room with a double bed. ...super fast internet! the bed was average but good enough.  an electronic safe for belongings in the room.  i would definitely stay here again.

superb location- right to the beach and center of venice activities. hostel itself is a little bit pricy but economical : nice bathroom in the room and spacious room and common areas, free wifi and computers, free breakfast including tasty waffle, oatmeal, eggs and bread, potato dish and coffee, free rental body board etc. full kitchen and self cook/clean rule. the staff were friendly. main door was locked over night and good security. i will definitely stay again if i visit la

run down hostel needs a major revamp  no young staff members   no activities expect a morning run  witnessesed a cleaning member drinking budweiser at breakfast    cleaning staff signed the sheet to say they had emptied the bin when they hadn't, the sheet says to check for bulbs out well they didn't as there was one missing our whole stay    good location and that's about it   we liked venice so much we checked into ssun and it was a much better vibe and atmosphere down the road

if you're seeking for the ocean, this is the best place. still, combined bus and subway, you can reach downtown in 90 minutes. safe area and safe hostel, not as dangerous as people say. the promenade is o street away with people having fun. good breakfast and cleans rooms.
this hostel is located very close to the beach and all the crazy characters on the boardwalk.

dirty facilities, very poor service. we booked this hostel & were afterwards contacted with the message that we would have to pay for an extra night. after sending 3 mails asking for an explanation, no-one answered.   when we got there, it was even more expensive than mentioned + the separate room we had booked, was not available. staff tried to help, but was unable to, seemingly because of intoxication.  breakfast was nice, however; make-it-yourself waffles were tasty, but that's it.

one particularly aggressive staff member confronted me after he assumed that i used some of his special milk. he refused to listen to the fact that the milk was already out on the side, and maintained that i opened the forbidden fridge to use his milk. there was no other milk available to hostel guests, which was unsatisfactory.    when checking out in the morning, no-one was present at the "24 hour" reception to return our deposit, so we had to wait for our deposit to be returned.    overpriced.

could not stay the first night even though was booked previously as told there was no room! manager didn't seem to care and offered no help in finding alternative accommodation (other staff were friendly and helpful which is why i marked them more). breakfast was poor and dinner was non-existent even though advertised on several sites! key didn't work on bedroom and no activities arranged/offered day or night.

absolutely awesome location - right near the beach. little bit of street noise, but that's to be expected. had no probs sleeping though. stayed in a private room & it was much cheaper than getting a hotel in the area. the place is a little shabby but has good character. excellent breakfast included.
staff weren't very friendly/helpful. room was pretty dirty - lots of rubbish under the bed. very noisy at night due to traffic and bars outside. good location, very close to the beach.
good location (just next to the venice beach; relatively short taxi ride to la international airport). facilities seem old but work.

my friend and i had an overall good stay. there a were a few problems. first of all we were put into a staff room and not a dorm as i had booked from a few weeks in advance. when i enquired, one of the female staff more or less said that they don't want guests in their room either, which is fair enough. the manager was rude and told me it wasn't his fault i can't read the fine print which says they can put guests in any type of share room. also slow with check-in, we waited 2 hours.

the man working the front desk was horrifically rude after firstly emailing me that they can no longer accommodate me.  i then called to figure out what was going on and then the rude guy wouldn't answer any questions. later then found out that my bed wasn't cancelled and had not had my money refunded. stayed at hermosa beach and definitely will be going back to that hostel again and not giving money to rude individuals.
the location of venice beach hostel is not safe and appeared to be frightening of a night time and sometimes of a day time which i think is important for people to know before booking the hostel.
we had a great stay at the venice beach hostel. the room was clean and well equipped. the staff was always kind and helpfull and the location of the hostel is wonderful. everything was perfect!!

most staff were very rude but one or two were actually helpful.  looks like it's falling apart and there's an additional charge for most things within the hostel. but it's i a great location and i met some nice people here.  enjoyed the stay but wouldn't recommend or return there.

do not stay at this hostel! staff were rude and didn't want to know you at all. dorms were crammed full of beds with nowhere to put your bag. my bed was in the hallway of 1 of the rooms where the light stayed on all night and was a thoroughfare for other guests. very overpriced. i've stayed in hostels all through europe and south america and this was by far the worst!!!!!
try not to stay here!

mostly fine but there is one abrupt and quite rude staff member who made me feel like i was an inconvenience by being there at all. made me feel the atmosphere was not as great as it could be because of his abrupt manner.

staff doesn't understand your needs and doesn't accept any comment. they try everything to steal your money if you want to cancel a reservation. the don't answer you when you write to cancel a reservation so that they can have your money
pretty boring and very expensive for a hostel ... but great location
very unhelpful staff , takes over an hour to check you in ! also the tax they add is ridiculously high ! not value for money as it's a very basic hostel with bad staff !
great rooms, great atmosphere, and a great breakfast.

we arrived back at the hostel after a night out and found our stuff in the middle of the room! we have been told by the staff to immediately change our room (in the middle of the night, without prior notice!)

the hostel location at venice beach is great. so very close to the beach in the heart of this fancy location.  having the possibility to cook ourselves especially at breakfast is a real plus.  however the cleanliness is not sufficient. the bathrooms would need to be entirely refurbished.the floor carpetting is doubtfull. too bad that this lack of care of the place reduces the plaisure of a cool and friendly laid back atmosphere that fits well with the surf/skate/beach genes of this vacation town.
excellent staff! the brazilian guys and matt are amazing people! i can't wait to come back!

although venice beach hostel is in a great location, it is by far one of the worst hostels i've stayed at and there are 2 reasons for this. poor staff and poor facilities. everything is very run down.. you get the vibe that the owners don't care about the property at all. i booked a 7 bed dorm but got put into a 13 bed dorm. most staff have a negative attitude towards people. if you want to be in a more welcoming hostel that is a lot better value for money, choose samesun.
staff were very friendly lots of advice for food, taxis etc. relaxed and friendly vibe not roust which was good for us. quite a large room was nice. location was excellent!
keep it up! a little work for guests to keep the rooms cleaner.
hostel is well located and clean, but the lady at the reception was absolutely impolite.

such a nice hostel for a short period of time. the room was pretty nice, except for the bathroom. it was quite dirty, although that depends on the other girls you're staying with. also, a bou it dissappointed with breakfast. although you can eat as much as you want, there's very little to choose from, so i would recommend go get some cereal or milk at the closest market.  all in all, everything was good, you get to meet a lot of people from everywhere and it's right in venice beach!

hostel is in a great location and is kept clean with good cooking facilities. at the time of booking it was advertised that evening meals were offered for $1 a night however when we arrived we were told that they weren't offering these meals without an apology! there was also a huge tax added to the price which wasn't made clear when booking of about 25%! definitely not worth the money unfortunately.
overall the hostel was in a really good location, right on the beach. it had a chilled out atmosphere and the staff were nice

a nice hostel, only 2 minute walk from the beach. rooms were basic but clean, wifi was good, staff were very friendly and helpful. pool table, tv with netflix, computers with internet, sport balls, kitchen, lounge all available for use  .plenty of pubs nearby and supermarket a 1 minute walk. would definitely recommend this hostel.
thus is a nice hostel!

the location of this hostel is amazing and super convenient, close to the beach, bike rental places, a few pubs, plus an excellent cafe across the street and mexican joint right downstairs. the staff was friendly and made good suggestions, plus breakfast and dinner included was a bonus, and yummy too. despite these things, i would say the hostel was average - not quite worth the price, but i would consider staying there again, for location and dinner being included.
had a great stay here! would definitely come back! awesome time, great people.
we really enjoyed our stay. my second visit now. location is excellent. but ...arghhh...those stairs..difficult for me but very greatful to the kind staff that helped

this was without a doubt the best hostel i´ve stayed at! the staff, the atmosphere, the location, the room (private room, ensuite!!)...everything was just great! if you´re looking for a hotel, don´t go to vbh. but if you´re looking for nice people to talk to, helpful staff, value for your money, well, stay here. i am definately coming back!

this hostel is well located in the heart of venice beach. but that it all it has to offer. at a price that could get you a cheap hotel, this hostel is falling appart. everything seems dirty and old, the kitchen and common rooms are terrible. the private bed we stayed was just ok, at least it had a bathroom ensuite.  would not recomend this one.

not a great hostel, but in a good location for venice beach.  rooms are a bit average, nothing worth talking about. breakfast was good, with waffles.  wifi a bit dodgy too.    prob wouldn't stay here again, but an okay place.
los angeles is large!!! so if u want to stay close to the beach, this might be a perfect choise. otherwise, quiet far away from hollywood for example...
nice hostel, good location. but 42 dollars is way too much for a normal 14 bed dorm.
very unclean was in a good location

traveling can often be expensive, so budgeting was key for the group i went with.  we were pleased to stay at a below average place for the right price, however we attempted to stay an additional night based on the prime location but ended up checking out early due to the incredible disrespect the owner showed when we confronted him regarding a price that was quote by his staff and then over charged. i would not recomment staying here but at the same sun with a beach front view and great vibe.

nice location. i was able to see the ocean from my double-bed room and it's very important for me coz i live too far away from it) free breakfast is also the good thing. i think that's the best hostel at that hood for this price. i've been back to la in a week since i left this place and i had to found a place to stay again but there was no vacation in here. however i've found the hostel with the same price and it was much worse in spite of it was really closer to the ocean on the same street..
staff very helpful. overpriced. free food once you know about it.  smokers abound unfortunately. as a backpacker ok.
staff, atmosphere and location were awesome! strongly recommended. joaquín. argentina

this hostel definetly needs to be renovated. the common rooms and the kitchen are fine, but our room was just an assortment of furnitures which deserves to go to the garbage. also the cleanliness was good, we didn't felt comfy in our room, as everything in there was worn out and setted up without concept. the room would be ok for max. half of the price we paided. everything else (breakfast, location (if you like venice), staff,...) is good, but please work on the look of your rooms and hallways.
nice place close to the beach and good to get some free food included. it attracts some weird people but i guess that's not the hostels fault.
very pleasant stay, super location next to venice beach. enjoyed the stay a lot. value-for-price is fantastic! recommend a stay, for sure!

i loved the location, but it could have done with being cleaner! i have contacted the hostel twice now, because i paid $100 deposit on arrival (which i was not told i would have to do) and i have still not been reimbursed. as you can imagine, this is really frustrating. they are not replying to my emails and i am going to have to make an expensive call to the usa about it.

i really enjoyed the stay in venice. i stayed there 3 nights and had no problem booking or cancelling extra night.  staff was super friendly and i know that it's hard to find in a hostel. was also clean. well wasn't luxurious and prob was too expensive for the quality but i guess it's the location you pay for. i would definitely come back!
the building could do with being refurbished but apart from that was a very good hostel.
very close to venice beach, however the area felt a bit dodgy at night. rooms smelt funny, but were clean. free breakfast was limited.

i wad in usa for business and for the first time i decided to book a hostel instead of a hotel. i really enjoyed my time, met a lot of new people, very nice atmosphere and perfect location because you don't need to move in other places, neither for nightlife!

i didn't stay here too long but what i saw seemed really good. the bed was comfy and the staff were nice. it's definitely the place to go for atmosphere, maybe less so if you are looking for shiny and clean.
it was a nice hostel. they ha free dinner every night and we ate some bean mix which was very good.

like all the best hostels, a bit shabby and cosy.you can smoke in the common rooms which i thought was going to be disgusting but was actually fine. lots of plants and books. two private bathrooms in my 16bed dorm. kitchen is a little run down but has everything you need. free dinner is great, saved money but the breakfast is just waffles you make yourself, would be nice to have some bread at least! only old computers i didnt try but didnt look up to much, and bad wifi connection. right on beach
i really enjoyed my stay at the vbh! staff was friendly and helpfull, the rooms where all right and lots of cool other travellers to do some tours or just walk 3 min to hang at the beautifull beach.

this hostel is in a great location if you are wanting to be in the heart of venice beach. not so good if you are wanting to see other attractions such as hollywood, universal studios, magic mountain etc as it can take 1 n a half to 2 n a half hours via public transport.  venice beach is a great spot to chill out though, and explore the boardwalk up to santa monica. our private couple room was perfect, clean, lots of space. the staff are okay. the smoking in the common room is disgusting.
miserable staff. expensive dorm rooms which are not particularly clean. the only plus is that venice beach is just one block away.
defiantly returning great hostel, great location, friendly staff, great atmosphere overall great stay  thank you
i appreciated the free dinner. not a bad place to stay
great hostel, really enjoyed my stay, i'm going to try to come back!
you cant get a better location for venice beach than this hostel... rooms and cleanliness left a little to be desired... but its very fitting for the chabby chic feel that venice is all about.

third time staying here, this place has so much character and venice beach is such a unique part of l.a. i would not stay anywhere else. the staff is really helpful and the hostel does a descent enough breakfast and an okay dinner which is better than nothing.

we have booked twin beds private room, but the room was four beds dorm. though other guests were not there, the facilities in the room was lower than expected. in the bathroom drain was broken and dirty water was running up.  second day we asked to change the room and once they said yes, but some miscommunication between morning staff and night staff, we were made to stay same room again. was terrible.  staffs were really friendly and helpful, but owner seems not able to manage the things.

do not expect too much from dinner (which was only spaghetti with sauce and the next day rice with beans). breakfast was good, with waffles/pancake and bread with egg.  perfect location if you like the beach, and sports. a lot of different nationalities where in the hostel, so you never lonely when you come by yourself.   you could also work at the hostel as part time for part of the stay. so the staff here where very kind and friendly (except the owner himself).

stay at this hostel if you don't mind paying $40 a night to be a block away from the beach and for free breakfast and supper. do not expect anything else. wifi only worked in the kitchen and common rooms. our computer in our room wouldn't turn on and the staff didn't seem to care. the shower head sucked, took my whole shower to warm up, and by that time the floor of the shower was flooded as the drain was clogged. they're super strict on their rules. good coffee, i'll give them that.
its a bit run down but so is the rest of venice. i liked the effort with the dinner they prepare for you. best thing: its about a 3 min walk to the beach.

great hostel, very good location. you can save money on food, since breakfast and dinner is included. however it is the same everyday so you might get bored  if you stay for a long time. breakfast is waffles and pancakes.   great place to meet people! nice common room and a terrace on the roof.   shower and toilet in our room as well. i would definitely stay there again.

regular hostel, fair prices based on the truly awesome location. 5min walk to the beach. friendlyness of the staff couldn't more variate. from mean useless a§§ motherfu*ers to really beatiful helpful great people, depends who you get. balcony is awesome, chill in the shade, watch the venice wierdos down the street and the pacific at the same time. liquor store is just one block away and endless restaurants, weed doctors and bars within 2 min walkin distance. we'd come again in a heartbeat..
loved the hostel, but i don't think smoking should be permitted inside. did not like that at all.

the building needs some repairs and rooms are simply dirty (or at least mine was dirty).  there was a safe in the room, but it was blocked when i arrived, so the manager opened it by screwdriver (btw, i did not feel secure, storing my valuables in a safe that can be opened like that). the only really strong point of the property is its location - few steps from the beach and there is a bus stop nearby, so one can easily reach the downtown (although it is a long ride).

all though, the location is great, the place is really old, would rather pay a little more and stay in the hostels next door. stayed in the private two bed room, the rooms are big, but bathroom is old, and rooms are old. the people staying there were nice. the staff was helpful, a bit unorganized though.

the wifi connection is horrendous and only sometimes works outside in the corridor. the place needs a massive refurbishment, it is very old and dull, it is an absolute dive. the bed was the most uncomfortable bed in the world, it was so bad that you could feel the springs. although it says dinner and breakfast included  you only get waffles or rice and pasta not a proper meal. the staff barely new the area and were very sarcastic and unhelpful. the only plus is it is right next to the beach. wnr
very old building. they don't give you dinner, but pasta for you to cook. expensive
the breakfast, private room size, and location were all fantastic!
venice beach is one for the hippies

it was great to be greeted by carl, he was super nice. nice staff. hard to find the actual hostel, no easily visible sign. june gloom set in for our stay there so it was never very nice looking outside. great little cafe across the street and bars around the place. very close to venice beach and santa monica pier is 45min walk away. very far away from hollywood and usual touristy activities. traffic is always gross. hire a car.

great location.. 1 minute to the beach.. though it is a fairly expensive cab ride to hollywood.. staff were great except for 1 guy that i found a bit rude.. good common area and they provide everything to make breakfast and dinner which was good!
really liked that you could make your own breakfast & that dinner was included too!

owner treats you like a piece of money, an shouldn't work in a hostel. the fact his miserable face is there daily made an average stay. i don't normaly make reviews but the effort here was necessary...... stay around the corner!

excellent staff at the reception. very friendly and helpful. however, when we made our booking we received unprofessional and rude emails from mark about advanced payments.  wifi was up and down. great breakfast and dinners. even if the room was cleaned every days, there was a strong smell. excellent location, right by the beach.

if you want the cheapest stress free experience at the beach this is the right place. the price is good and their is free food for dinner and breakfast ( i should say that it is included).all meals were vegetarian. there is free parking within walking distance.  the hostel is in a slightly run down section of venice beach but there is still places to go for a drink or some lunch and it is super close to very nice places if you want to walk around or splurge on some good food.
nice place, nice crew =)
the bed in my room was very uncomfy but my room was beautiful. i had a view of the ocean and afternoon sunshine. i would have been happy to live there! free food was an awesome addition.
good place room was clean nice and friendly staff good location if you want to see venice too faraway for la centre

i always like to stay in venice beach when i am in la, and this hostel the best location for that. the staff are good they do a nice breakfast and the dorm rooms even have there own bathrooms. they had a karaoke night on while i was there which was good fun. this hostel has great character.

where do i start... upon arrival they tried to charge us for a night we had cancelled weeks before, staff were rude and unfriendly and it became apparent that their hostile attitudes were due to poor management who seemed to want to take advantage of young travellers.  we were treated like scum, told very rudely that you could only have 1 egg or waffles, not both. in the common area, no one spoke, it was as if the staff/ managements attitudes had rubbed off. worst hostel i have ever stayed in.

great localization- only 3 min from venice beach, nice resto near (mao’s resto recommended), surf and bike rentals just in the corner, small shops also.  we stayed in privet room- it was big, we actually had 4 rooms :)small closet; small room with sink, table, window; bathroom and  bedroom. it was clean and had everything we needed.  nice personnel, nice common areas –though we did not actually use it. one remark – be early at the breakfast:). i recommend this hostel and would return there.

i really liked it here. friendly staff and great location. i booked a single room and got a huge private room with 2 double beds and private bathroom. wifi was free and generally worked ok, although i couldn`t get a signal in my room. i was disappointed that all of the common areas closed between 3am and 8am (i was jet-lagged and awake most of the night) but the receptionist gave me an extra 30 mins to finish my skype call which was good. will definitely stay again on my way back through la.

the hostel itself is pretty average, nothing special at all. the location is good though, literally steps from the beach and just a few blocks to the bars and restaurants. i didn't like the guys on reception, carl, in particular was quite rude and seemd annoyed at having to make extra waffle mix at 10.15am  even though breaky is served until 10.30am. terrible luggage storage system, anyone could take your stuff.
we had a great time! felt like a classy hotel for real cheap!!

not the best - i'm not precious but it's be nice if you get what you paid for which i didn't feel we did. the "computers in rooms" thing is not entirely accurate (when i mentioned this to a fellow guest she laughed and basically said that they put that there to get bookings!).    on returning from a night out, the common area looked like a wake was taking place. do yourself a favour and pay an extra few bucks a night, get a hotel in santa monica or similar and give this place a miss.

i loved this place! it is in an awesome location, very close to the beach. the rooms are nice, the staff are helpful and the facilities, wifi etc are good. free breakfast and dinner is good. will be back for sure :) thank you.

although it was a memorable experience, i would prefer a more mature crowd. many people were talking about getting high and drinking....lame. i liked being able to walk downstairs right to the beach, and the kitchen was big too. if you like to smoke, this is the place for you, because they allow that indoors.

the guy at reception was very rude. and i shared a room with 9 other girls so showering was an issues. i wasn't told if there was other shared bathrooms. i actually only ended up staying 1 night and going to a different hostel. price wasn't even that reasonable considering.

i took a private room which was still a very good deal. not flash but all mod-coms available and a good size. a basic dinner and breakfast is included or you can cook your own. you could be very social here or just do your own thing. 1 hour by very cheap bus to all main attractions is ok with me.
the atmosphere of the hostel is very nice, but the building needs to be renew and get better
smoking near the eating area is allowed in vbh - which is not a good idea.
perfect location! amazing staff! huge rooms! free breakfast! 2 extra large gathering areas, big kitchen.. how can you go wrong? i can't recommend this place highly enough, absolutely loved it!

we were a little concerned about cleanliness in the hostel when we arrived, and also about safety in the area.  the hostel is quite old and run-down, and needs some general building maintenance. however, the price was very good, and the location excellent, only a few hundred yards from the beach. we had a beach view out of one window.  our room was clean and well prepared for us.  the staff were excellent, very friendly and helpful, and reassured us about safety.  we would happily stay again.

good hostel, great location, breakfast and dinners great idea and very helpful but the smoking inside the common rooms is disgusting and not fair on non smokers, it forced us to stay in our room instead of being able to kick back and relax on the couches
great place to stay, helpful staff and a lot of character!

i stay 2 nights pay for the expensive suite and simon the recepcionist didn't let my exgirlfriend go in, this was really not polite when i am booking a private suite !! a part warm water missing and security lock in my room didn't work but still simon didn't care anymore..

was nice, clean and the people were pretty friendly. the area was a bit rough, but really close to the beach which is what we wanted. it was difficult to get to and from main la/hollywood without a car. one annoying thing was that we had to give them $100 key deposit - as i was leaving the usa after this so i had to get it refunded onto my card (and was charged to convert it to and from dollars). the food was pretty basic, but it was fine to live off for a week - cheap and cheerful :d

this is a great place to stay! the hostel is nice, with big rooms. the staff here were all so nice and helpful! they provide both breakfast and dinner free! which was amazing!! the location is fantastic! you can see the beach from the balcony! we had a really great stay!

great location   value for money considering the price of other hostels in the area and breakfast and dinner is included.  friendly staff. but hidden policies inregards to deposits for rooms which are not shown on hostel world reflect upon the staff negativley. i wasn't able to check into the room without paying a $100 deposit which was not stated on hostel world or the hostels own website. given that i was at the end of a 12 month trip i did not have the money for this.
it was good. staff were great, room was everything we needed and it appeared secure. only comment would be that the common area was unpleasent for a non-smoker due to smoking inside.

the hostel is very old, all of the chairs are in tatters the bathroom had several cracks and nearly everything could have done with an update. having said that i had a fantastic stay. the amenities were good, the location to venice beach is excellent and the staff were really helpful and fun. the only really awful thing was the shuttle company were incredibly useless, and it took on average 40 minutes to book a shuttle. venice itself is not the safest of places, full of homeless people and weed!
loved the location and the atmosphere. they had a few problems with the bookings of me and others, so double check  that your payment has gone through.

the fact that some people gave horrible reviews (i.e. 60% and below) is absolutely crazy.  this place is really cool and the location is excellent.  there is plenty of food in the morning and at night.   no one should be complaining about this place.

the hostel was amazing!! the staff were all really helpful and kind and i loved it there! the location was real good right n the beach and about a 15 min walk to santa monica pier and transport was really easy to get to places.  i highly recommend this hostel for anyone looking for a place by the beach, you also get free breakfast and dinner.

it was a great stay @ venice beach hostel! amazingly located just few steps towards the boardwalk and the ocean! the staff is really nice and helpful and free breakfast and dinner is definitely a plus! i am coming back for sure, hopefully for a longer stay!
we only slept in the hostel and did nothing else, even breakfast and dinner was missed by to much sleep
the staff are amazing people, i had the best time ever, met lots of people. i look forward to returning
need for reform!  i didn't like!
very friendly and helpfull staff. the rooms are simple but clean. in the habitable rooms its easy to find other travelers. piano, tv, kitchen --> i liked it a lot!

fantastic location!!! room had a strong funny smell but luckily there are stalls on the boardwalk selling incense so that fixed that problem up. the cleaners took our towels on day 2 and failed to replace them for the remainder of the stay which was a little annoying. also sharing a room with a friend and only having 1 key between us for the room made things a bit difficult when we wanted to do separate things.

most of the staff are not professionals but guests who want to stay for free. that's why they are lazy, rooms are filthy. i left my surfboard for 3 days there. i asked one of the members of staff if i can put it in storage room. he said it was ok and he would put it himself. and when i returned i realized it was wet and sandy and was used hour ago. someone surfed on it. so don't trust them. wi-fi signal is very poor in rooms. the worst hostel on venice in my opinion

free dinner means rice with half boiled potato, poor black beans and vegetables as a condiment... i wasn't expecting the best dinner of my life but this was really really poor, felt kind like a homeless.   breakfast with pancakes was ok.  suggestions: a little bit of milk, eggs, fruit...

only good thing about this hostel is the location. hostel & staff suck. when we arrived we had to pay a deposit of $25 each, also we had to pay $10,50 taxes per person per night! on top of everything they wanted us to pay $3 each for paying with one credit card. i went to the boa nearby & paid $3 once for getting cash. towels weren't included, $0.50 each for washing them. we had to share our bathroom with at least 6 girls because there was another room in our room, but we booked a 6 bed dorm!

been all over the work in hostels and this i up there with the best of them. staff were incredible and fun, quests were awesome, location was perfect! right on the beach! sad to have had to leave but already planning my next trip there!

the hostel structure is old and there was a terrible smell. the lobby seemed a basement and it was old too. absolutely not beautiful to see. the first time i saw the lobby i thought it was a joke. anyway the position was great and a part from the bad smells, room were big.

fun staff, some are a bit serious but always willing to help out. rooms are sometimes loud if you have view on rooftopterrace. in general clean rooms, clean bathrooms. good laundry facilities! in 5 minutes on the beach. breakfast is fun cause you make your own waffles, or pancakes. and they have eggs, and bread, with jam and butter! simple but good. when theres karaokenight, they tend to smoke in common area, leaving the hostel blue and smelly... a pity. i had a good/safe time there! thanx!

well, it is a bit difficult.  short: dorms totally sucks, privates are  good!  smoking in the common rooms and floors. that is totally a no go!   and online was never a word about this.    extra charges everywhere!  extra charge for paying with credit card? per person per night 3 dollars?   seriously?   so bring your money cash!!!    1 dollar for one printed sheet? seriously?  that's ridiculous! mire than 10 cents is a rip off!      so think about it people!!!
it is a good hotel near the ocean
old shakey beds. steps for the top bunk would be handy, lockers in romms would be helpful

the hotel is very dirty. smells bad. some of my clothes still have the smell of the room. there was a heavy/smelly atmosphere inside the room and i got a cold because of it. it's a dirty environment and i got some sort of virus. the neighbourhood is full of drugged people. don't recommend at all. the staff were nice in general but on my arrival one of the guys asked me to wait for over half an hour while he was "getting some work done". i only have not gone ballistic because i had just arrived.
very friendly and helpful staff. i'd definitely recommend staying here.

nothing special. place always smelt like buds and come night time the streets around the hostel fill up with crackheads but hey i guess thats just hell-a in general. great place to stay if you like drugs i'm sure it wouldn't be hard to score around venice beach.
this hostel was great, right by the beach. our room was nice and spacious and the free dinners were great. only negative was the rude woman who checked us in.
had a great time, staff were excellent!
nice hostel in a very good location (right next to the beach). cool and very helpful staff!

the hostel is in the best location and the staff were very helpful. however, the main issue for us was the cleanliness and the decor.it is extremely dated and is in desperate need of a facelift that would bring into the 21st century. the rooms would need new furniture and new carpet as well as the sheets need to be replaced as they were stained and borderline disgusting. finally, the luggage room needs to be in a more secure place! the hostel would be brilliant if they would invest money into it
the place was quite dirty and people staying there relatively weird. would rather stay somewhere else if i go back to l.a.

i was meaning to have a week in hollywood and a week in venice on the beach. venice was my second week and i felt very uncomfortable. the staff on reception were unfriendly, their 'suitcase storage' was a space on the landing with no door, let alone a lock. i paid my cancellation fee and left - i couldn't face staying there.
great room with our own pc, located right around the corner from venice beach boardwalk which is a great start for a half day mosey up to the venice beach wharf. really cool staff as well :d

a decent place to stay, private rooms were cleaned daily and tidy. free internet was a little on the slow side but great for looking up bus timetables and maps etc.    it's close to venice beach, the boardwalk and all the shops, about a 40min walk from santa monica pier. a little far from la proper (hollywood etc), bus took an hour to get there or a $25-30 cab. perfect place to stay if you're wanting to beach-it-up but not ideal if you're wanting to see the city.
thanks for a wonderful stay, everyone was very helpful and nice.  will stay again

bad experience at venice beach hostel.we booked for a 6 dorms and they put us in a 15 dorms!!!!  the atmosphere is really strange inside and everythings is really old and dirty; specially in the kitchen.  just a bad place to sleep in a really cool venice beach!  venice beach is ok just during the day; if u wanna have fun by the night you have to book one hostel near hollywood.
cool place very close to the beach friendly staff and would highly recomend

wow, this was such a cool hostel. easy buses to everywhere from the hostel.. the free breakfast and dinner was a plus. and you get free wi-fi and there's a computer in the room. the staff was very helpful and friendly. they also had karaoke and if you sing you get a free shot or beer. and the beach is a 1 minute walk. i will definitely be back and i do recommend  this place

personnel really helped us out with a  lot of stuff, and were superfriendly all the time.hostel's locatcloseion is definitely a plus, cuz is ello connected to bus stations ,groceries stores and restaurants.
it's definitely great hostel. great place, staff, breakfast and dinner for free, internet for free, tee and coffee all day.
it was very nice to stay there. thx for everything!
very close to the venice boardwalk and close to numerous bus routes. staff were extremely friendly and helpful with anything and everything, would stay again if staying in venice
fun place, couldn't ask for much more
staff was great. so is location. cleanliness and condition of furnishings left something to be desired.

i found the location of the hostel amazing...you cant ask to be much closer to the beach,  however we booked a room that was advertised for  6 people. travelling as a group of 5 we found this to be a cheap ideal way to stay in venice beach!    they put us in a room with 13 beds and an ajoining room with more beds, well we only had 4 beds and had to share the first night!  also had $200 stolen and a bottle of vodka!! lock your things...
really great value for money and we enjoyed our stay here.
wrote my trip on, http://www.travelcheapwithpete.com/
great place. 1 block from beach and skatepark. excellent staff.
nice clean hostel. the free dinner is very nice and also that they have free spices was sweet. ah hostel as it should be.
lovely will have to come back!!!

the hostel was filthy, especially the bathrooms with their walls covered with mold. t the building is nice ad old and they should definitely invest some money in refurbishing it, as there were some breakdowns (electricity and water) and also lots of rust! it was also extremely noisy at night and there were more people in the room than expected! i payed to stay in a room for 6 ppl, but there was an additional bed there! i think it's unfair. for the conditions offered, it's far too expensive.

this place is everything you need in venice beach. location is perfect, free internet and computers, theres free parking near by, breakfast is awesome waffles and the staff are super cool, really friendly. our 8 bed dorm had two bath rooms and was really big. loved the time i had there!
great place to stay, staff were extremely friendly and helpful.  other guests were also friendly and a lot of fun. i will  dedinately stay there again on my next visit to venice.
no dramas in a good location.  a little tired and could do with a makeover but staff made up for this.
great experience. friendly and helpful staff. free breakfast and dinner and wifi. awesome location.
really close to the main area of venice beach! good locality and easy to get there from the airport
we enjoyed the stay here, was definitely value for money. we had waffles for breakfast which was awesome. free tea and coffee. there was also a pool table and tv area. . .

this was my first visit to us. i arrived at the hostel at night. took a walk along the beach. there was nothing going on and populated with homeless. it was not the image i had of venice beach, from all the good reviews on it. there was not many restaurants located next to the hostel. not many options on public transportation. the overall room & toilet was not exactly clean and well kept.    this is an ideal location if you would like to experience the morning & day of venice beach.
fantastic location - a minute from the beautiful beach!  really friendly, organised and well run hostel - great, helpful staff
very good. had an awesome time. very clean. and dinner was ok for free.

this hostel was ok, and pretty close to the venice beach boardwalk. the venice area is a little dodgy but i never really had any problems there. brekkie and dinner included which was good however no activities are organized by the hostel which was disappointing. all in all, if you are going to stay at venice - this place is pretty good.
wasn't that clean but ok for the price. i stayes there for 2 nights with two friends of mine.

outstanding! the receptionist is hot...you can hold an impromptu party there...my room was clean. it's a friggin hostel people. the hostel that's hella close to one of the coolest beaches in ca. only complaint..."deposits". i had to give a $100 deposit for my room. got it back as soon as i checked out....but...eh. otherwise...it's tops! -keith

location is good if you want to stay close to the beach, but it´s possible to get there by bus. the building from outside is horrible, it is old, not nice.. i didn´t have warm water in shower. i was glad to stay there just for one night. but the staff was nice, i had breakfast - included - pancakes. that was great.
great location. we enjoyed our private room.

venice beach is a fantastic place to stay in la if you want to have some fun and go to some decent bars with good music! not for bars with cheesy top 40 tunes but actual live gigs with good atmosphere.  the hostel is in a fantastic location 5 minutes walk from the beach and i found the room spacious and clean and the staff fine to deal with.

the hostel is located right on venice beach which was perfect for the 3 lazy days we were after. we did have a day in hollywood but be advised the bus trip took nearly 2 hours. the free breakfast and dinner is a big bonus, not a massive variety but free food so cant complain.  staff were helpful & always willing to answer your questions. venice beach was the most expensive hostel we stayed at whilst in america and be aware that you have to pay a $100 dollar deposit on arrival.
the location is perfect...just one block from famous and gorgeous venice beach...totally worth it

fantastic location - amazing for the price we paid to be so close to the beach & right in the center of the action on the boardwalk. the hostel provided good breakfast & dinner every day. the disadvantages - there was no laundry room & the staff were quite rude & wern't always helpful. i came in our room 1 day to find all my clothes & belongings moved off my bed & onto the dirty shelves & kept there. we enjoyed our stay there & it was very good value for money.

im still waiting to get the deposit back. they were supposed to refund it to us at the check out. however there was nobody at the reception. we left a note asking them to contact us urgently but 36 hours after, i'm still waiting.   we are now thinking what to do but regardless of the end, what an unpleasant experience.

worths the price...it's like a hippy place :) ....i recommend for young people. the breakfast, dinner was simple, but at least food to eat, the kitchen with equipment. very close to the sea, in the area lots of homeless. downtown s far, but if you want to rest on the beach its perfect.
great place for young travelers! but be carefull with the neighborhoud  at night.

the rooms were ok and had a prvate bathroom that was rather clean. the staff was friendly however there were not willing to call an airport shuttle which usually hostels do, from my experience, and it is also not possible to wash laundry in the hostel because there is only one machine which is occupied by the staff 24h and if you are lucky and ask the hostel manager you can wash at 6 am but that never worked out. dinner and breakfast is very basic.
didn't like they closed the door at 4 am. maybe they should freshn' up the commonarea looks like when they build it. and get some wi-fi that works properly.

venice beach is the worst place you can choose to be on the beach near la!simply not the place you will expect. there is nothing around except for homeless, rubbish and old buildings. the hostel is very poor maintained, quite dirty, internet is choppy, there is no breakfast unless you want to cook your own waffles in a dirty kitchen and you also have to wash the dishes! advice: spend 30-40 dollars more and stay in santa monica which is 5 minutes by car from venice beach but is fantastic!
great location, no character, pretty average.

i booked a private room for 2 nights.  the decor was dated but the room was clean, spacious and met all my requirements.  there was some noise from the cars outside, but this did not bother me.  the rooms appear to be old apartments that have been converted into a hostel.  my room had a bathroom, a utility room another room with a sink (used to be the kitchen) then a large main room with two double beds.    overall very happy.  great location, decent value for the money.

i stayed there twice in a month because i had a lot of fun there. the common area is a place where you can meet other travellers and most of them know how to party. if you're young and like to have fun this hostel is the best you can choose, located in the perfect spot in venice beach.

when you arrive the place looks a bit run down but the room are clean and the staff is helpful. there's a very large space to socialize with other travellers and a lot of table games and movies. the area is completely desert at night. good place to stay would come back again.

nice rooms , just a few second to the beach , nice people and clean enough . good price, not too far from l.a. downtown . maybe the only defect is that it's got no parking , but there's somewhere close to it free
had a 12 person dorm even though i booked a 6 person dorm. area unsafe when it is getting dark. would not recommed this hostel.
breakfast s great

nice hostel right on the beach/boardwalk.  a bit dated in the common areas.  also, they cancelled our first nights reservation and did not tell us about it in advance.  my girlfriend and i had to share the bottom bunk in an 8 person, rather than our private suite...the staff was somewhat understanding.

pros: beside beach, free dinner/breakfast, staff helpful, large common room, computer with internet in private room, large room.     cons: room smelled, smoking allowed in common room, bit sketchy, far from downton la, finding parking may take some time.
very noisy all night because the rooms are right next to street and without any sound-proof. room are old and dirty. one of the staff is not friendly.
dinner? that wasn't so great. not necessary to promote that part of the service. paying an additional fee if you pay by credit card is quite ridiculous and i have never ever seen this somewhere else.

the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful and the location is almost impossible to beat.  the room was clean and spacious and even had a computer inside the room!  unfortunately, i didn't realize that the room didn't have ac. it wasn't a problem for me, but i was traveling with a girl and she wasn't about to have that. i wish we could've stayed here. just take note that they don't have ac or elevators. next time i won't travel with a girl and this place will be perfect, lol.

not much of a vibe to this hostel, however it is literally right around the corner from the beach, our room had it's own private computer with unlimited internet access and rooms were kept clean. the free dinner was cook your own spaghetti and the free breakfast, waffles, was good but there could be a large queue in the mornings to use the waffle makers. but nice rooms and good value.
$100.00/night is pretty expensive for a hostel

mate this is rob &oskar  from australia , king karl ,jumping jeff  vic,yana,joe the a team,i had no probs ,its almost a free for all  i travelled with my 13 year old son ,they welcomed o in like one of the team  all the chicks looked after him, at night if i wasent around abloke   would always help him when he wanted to shoot pool or go outside for an ice cream , we rode skate boards  at midnight ,played the piano  i even learnt how to shuffle(dance keep on shufflin)   10 outa 10  i rippped big time!!

the place is a bit dated and could do with a bit of a revamp. do your research if booking a tour of la, the one we booked through the hostel was not good and way overpriced.  excellent location right near venice beach.
i was good free breakfast coool staff

at other hostels there have been planned activities, the staff get involved with people staying there, it's like they are part of the fun.     this hostel had little character and the staff, although friendly enough, were not what i look for in a hostel when on vacation. usa hostels staff members were better as they were generally on holidays themselves so they knew how to have fun.    at this hostel it seemed like it was a job.
eveything was excellent, only thing i could say would be maybe ditch the computers in exchange for t.vs in the rooms....and maybe just keep 2 or 3 computers for the common room...
50% more expensive for a private room than all the motels we stayed at but compared to everything else we could find in the venice/santa monica area, it was a bargain.

unfortunately we were directed to the wrong bus to the airport. the hostel was very quiet (may have had to do with the fact that we were travelling over the xmas period), so you had to create your own fun, however the large lounge areas and pool table helps. the free dinner is great for the budget-conscious!

i would not recommend this hostel. la is huge, and venice beach, while nice, is simply too far away from many things in la. a more central location, such as near hollywood, is much better for really exploring la. staying at venice beach, we spent a lot of time on public transport (seriously consider renting a car) and didn't even make it downtown.   i thought that the hostel itself was not clean, the rooms were devoid of any charm, and the staff was not particularly helpful.

we had to change our reservation a bit and the stuff react very flexible. because we split our stay we stayed in two diffrent rooms both were okay, but for this price we aspected something different. there were foreign hairs on the linen and the towells. everything was a kind of old, you know how old carpets are....they had nice paintings allover and the wifi and the computer with internet in den room was free and great.

the staff is great, except for what i believe is to be the manager who although i had a private room with kitchen, he did not let me take food in the room, in a not so nice tone.    location is great! i hope you guys enjoy it!

the room was dirty and had an overwhelming smell of urine, the bed and sofa covers had what looked like urine stains on them. some of the staff were friendly but generally they were quite curt and did not offer any additional helpful advice or information than necessary. there were no information leaflets or local advice pamphlets available, just an old, used map that sat on the reception desk.the general atmosphere was not a friendly one and i would not recommend this hostel to others.

great location and venice beach is definately the place to stay in l.a.free breakfast and a kind of free dinner which was good. the location is fantastic but if you are a light sleeper then it is very loud outside at night. however i would reccomend it
we did not like that people were allowed to smoke inside the hostel! breakfast was supposed to be at 8 am, they opend it at 8.40 am :(

the best time in california! nice staff, great guests and in the middle of venice beach! what else do you want? breakfast and dinner included, not fancy but great for value! the place to be in venice beach!
great location, price is ok, but the rooms could have been cleaner (especially the bathrooms!). pro: computer in the room, a lot of space, furniture....

i stayed in many hostels across the states & this was my favourite by far. prime location & awesome culture. also the staff are excellent & nice & friendly. i met the coolest people here! was there 3 days & it wasn't enough!
it is very close to the bus stop of metro (to downtown la, union station or with transfer to hollywood) and the big blue bus (to santa monica or with transfer to airport/lax)

hostel was pleasant. wi-fi was a little tempermental at times. they give you food and ingredients to make your own dinner every night. there was some stupid women guest trying to touch my food on the stove though. that was the only negative. parking not on a street side where supposed street cleaning is supposed to take place is a bit of a hassle. don't think they clean the streets very often, the whole place kind of smelled like urine. but that's not a knock on the hostel. overall nice place.
one word: amazing.

really a great hostel, nice rooms and clean. even better than some hotels or motels, the room was even cleaned during the stay and the beds made up.  easy to find parking. great and nice place to stay, very affordable!

my stay here was ruined by some rude fellow hostellers. i stayed in a 6 bunk dorm & my european roommates were loud, drunk, & kept going in and out of the room between 11pm and 5am slamming doors and turning on lights.    i wouldn't normally mind, but this was a tuesday night and the live music venue straight across the street was ultra loud till around 12pm/1am.    the common room was ok...just a big bunch of big old couches and music. the staff were friendly and inviting.

this is by far the worst hostel i have ever stayed at. the owner is extremely disrespectful with guests, he even cursed at a guest one day. the good thing he is not there all the time and hires students to do most of the work. really far from anything good, and not very secure. i highly do not recommend.

staying at san vincente place was everything you could want in a hostel. it was clean and airy and light when you first walk in, with comfy couches and colorful chairs. the main manager, neema, was very helpful and friendly. later on conor helped me with my arrival as the evening staff. plus, they have a pool!    most importantly,  i got a really good night’s sleep there! breakfast was excellent - eggs, toast, cereals, coffee, lunch meats. almost european style. will definitely stay again!

easy to find, clean, spacious, welcoming staff.  has a very nice pool and multiple recreation areas with plenty of seating, which you will find comforting and relaxing to spend your time while staying here.    the rooms have very good quality, and sturdy wooden  bunk beds with a much larger scale twin size mattress that is super comfortable to sleep on.    the entire facility is professionally cleaned every single day. breakfast is available every single morning as well. plus lockers as well.
good place friendly staff, i'd come back again
the staff was very helpful and nice. great place to stay.
the stuff is very friendly but the rooms and facilities are really dirty. there was bubblegum in my bed
very good overall....price e people are gentle....caring and saw my delay and did not charged me for the cancelation......just a good place to satay.i like it.
nice u had me there   thanks for the breakfast   liv bis
i strongly disencourage you to come here. the recepcionist ride and violent with guests, he insulted me on the phone as i wanted to cancel the booking.
kids bunk beds in the room, no atmosphere with other guests, if there was any, no group activities going on, couldn’t tell who was staying and who was staff, cheap but wouldn’t recommend
it was ok to get your head down but very scruffy and i personally wouldn't stay there again.. staff were nice and friendly
just be there to sleep and make a shower, in rest,  go in the city!!!
very nice manager and staff! would like to come back again.
easy to find. staff very helpful. a ”no frills experience”  but for the bargain price it’s worth it. recommend it highly and will stay there again if back in la.

this hostel is reminiscent of a homeless shelter. actually, there are homeless shelters in better condition than this hostel. not only was there no air/ventilation. the pictures on the site are not accurate, up-to-date & misleading. im surprised hostelworld allows this facility to list on the site. false advertisement. a guy (who's supposedly the manager) caught an attitude with me when i mentioned the air. i immediately left & booked another hostel as i refused to pay for negativity.

one of the staff members was reall nice and tried to help us while the other one was pretty rude and didn't even care about us and our problems at all. the beds were horrible, loud and it felt like they're going to break any second.

worst hostel i've ever stayed in- dirty, seedy, shabby, smelly and zero security; staff who haven't a clue what they're doing and very bad air conditioning. also dangerous seeing junkies can easily (and do) get in off the street and steal guests' belongings and cause fights. total rip-off; i checked out after just one night to find a better place. stay away from this place at all costs; it's little more than a criminal establishment and needs to be closed down!
there is no ac! avoid this place unless you like sleeping in a  sauna .

great location. rooms were tiny and the hostel was very old and kinda gross for the price that you are paying. the staff were lifeless and less than helpful. the whole area of hollywood was pretty safe so i would stay somewhere else for this price

bloody hot! it needs ac! if it had ac then i would rate it better value for money. the beds and sheets were clean. all was remotely comfy also. breakfast choice is limited. but is amazing if toast, sugary cereals (such as fruit loops) or doughnuts are your thing, then you are in your element. not that i was expecting an extravagant breakfast anyway. there is also a good amount. one member of staff wasn't so helpful or kind. it wasn't clear that she wasn't a morning person. location good also.
room was very hot and there was no glas in the window. old blanket was covering window. hostel was very dirty. i stayed in different hostel and pay so much less and it was way better.

this hostel is literally the worst hostel ever, just a nightmare. the rooms and the bathrooms are so dirty (we found cockroaches in the bathroom). there was just one small fan for eight people in the same room. we were just sweating so badly as we couldn't sleep, so we just decided to stay outside as much as we could. i can't even have the how horrible it was. regarding the personnel, they were so rude and disrespectful with us. i don't understand how a hostel like this one can still be open.

this place just needs to bo closed and renovated. rooms were in a pretty horrible condition, shower handle fell off many times, the kitchen was really dirty. the staff were cleaning but there's no hope for a place that's been left to get that bad. they left the front door open till midnight so anyone could walk in, didn't make me feel very safe. most of the staff were really nice minus one who seemed extremely unhappy. they did serve breakfast but the kitchen was dirty which puts you off eating.

the hostel was great: good location, nice staff and clean. bathroom in your room which is great! lockers kinda small but since you can lock your room and people don't tend to steal is secure af. a lot of you guys talk about the manager and his attitude, i think he's not bad but a great guy, you only need to understand him since he has a strong personality. they helped us with a complicated situation regarding the booking and were nice to us. shoutout to the black captain morgan! barcelona guys.
friendly atmosphere, manager so welcoming during our stay. nice breakfast , good location. ideal for students on a holiday break to meet new people.

location is good. but the other is not ok for me.  this place has smell all the way. no air condition and elevator. but the price is ok for this place. if you can deal with dirtiness and hot temperatures. this place is for you

defiantly not worth the money, the rooms are basic and very small, hard to cramp 6 people in one room! the beds aren't secure, i felt very unsafe climbing on and off the top bunk as the whole frame would shake! the front door was open all the time which was unsafe as we were right on hollywood blvd. the only positive is the location.
all bad, dirty, sheet unclean (looked like they came from the rubbish), no elevator, for the price there is better  the only reason to came here is the location
the staff were not the most accommodating, but  the location is good. there was no air con, which wouldn't have been an issue if the fans had worked in the room.
it was okay for price. the guest was very friendly. they have friendly staff here but the manager isn't nice at all.

perfect location for hollywood and close to the metro station. staff very quiet and not often that helpful. the facilities such as kitchen and bathrooms were worn and mostly dirty. locks on rooms good. only 2 plug sockets in a room for 4 people and these were not near the beds. bunk beds tiny and you can't sit up in them. sheets smelled and had marks on them. overpriced for what it was, have stayed in a lot nicer places in la for cheaper.

the hotel is ugly and uncomfortable. it has no ac or ventilation in the rooms and smells funny. the upside is that they serve a decent breakfast. it is located next to a 24hs liquor store so lots of people gather around there all night long.

bad facilities    the price of this hostel is way above the average price for a hostel bed, but i guess it's because of its location right on hollywood's walk of fame. aside from location, everything else was lacking. the biggest down side being that there is no air-condition or any sort of ventilation in the rooms, which with l.a.'s weather, makes it very uncomfortable. very tiny lockers located outside of the room, and main door was left wide open on the streets, questioning its security.

do nor stay here! awful stay, the rooms were unbearably hot, staff all seemed to work slave-like hours and were terrified of the boss, bathrooms were filthy and didn't get $10 key deposit back even though no one told me the check out time was 10 not 11.. location is fantastic but another hostel has opened doesn the road recently and i have heard amazing things about it so search for this other hostel and stay there!
pretty neat. cool people.

you wanna be miserable? stay here! you wanna sweat the whole day/night? stay here! you want a room with nasty carpets and horrible smell? please do stay here. no vibe to socialize here. and the cherry on top of the cream is the manager's attitude. he told me on my face that he's the manager in a really bad tone only because i chose to ask the reception instead of him. when i asked him if he was angry he said "a little". what am i his employee now? location is good but i would never stay again!

it's alright just don't expect the ritz, i read the reviews before i went and they said the same however i wanted to see for myself. bring cash. the owner is a bit stressed, wouldn't accept punch in payments which is all i could do at the time, i get the risk of cancelled payments but you fix that by getting a signature.  some of the rooms are hotter than the sun
manager was extremely friendly and had an interest in the tenants staying at the hostel. the location was easy to access central hollywood and was in walking distance to most landmarks

no air conditioning and only one minuscule fan for 8 persons (and i never thought i could complain about that in any hostel), not enough clean restrooms, the breakfast is ok for an hostel, but for the rest is too expensive. the employees are nice, but the manager is too rude.

the host was rude.  the place is absolutely filthy do not stay there.  i left after one day and they refused to refund my money that i prepaid for all the other days.  they prey on foreigners who do not know what a good hospital is like.  stay over at backpackers or any other hostel.  avoid this place at all costs.

i actively discourage to go to this hostel. the owner/manager clearly does not care at all for his guests. in short :  - overall lack of space, everyone is packed together like in a prison cell.   - no wifi in the rooms, nor in the tv room.   - not enough wall sockets, nowhere in the hostel.   - no locks for security lockers, you have to pay/bring your own.    2 other girls had to sleep in the hallway because there was no one to receive them, even though they had sent notice of their arrival hour.

i stayed here for 14 days, - location was great (near to metro station) - added value for free breakfast - friendly staff, especially christine! thx for your hospitality  things to improve: - the double decker bed is very unstable and noisy - the whole floor and room is very hot during summer, pls add more fan. - the wifi is super weak, only works nearby the reception area - its hard to find the electric plug in the room, pls provide more so the guest can charge phone beside their bed

the staff was not very friendly.  didn't enjoy being on hollywood blvd.  too many tourists everywhere.  would like to have a yard and trees on the property and some nature in the back.  would like to have more space.  the kitchen and patio were tiny.  creepy weirdos living there.  good prices and i met a few fun people.  but definitely one of the worst hostels i've stayed at.
just need betters bunk beds to squeaky at night & a window that closes

*definitely* needs to be cleaned better, and provide better places for people to put their luggage (i woke up on the top bunk to discover that a pile of suitcases was completely blocking the ladder down). convenient to get to by transit, though! and if the walk of fame is your thing, you're in the right place!

this hostel wa the worst i ever stayed in. it is so dirty they didn'teven clean/vacuumed our rooms once or touched the shower.  the bedsheets smelled like they haven't been washed in months. the staff was kinda friendly and the location too but everything else just creepy and disgusting. so if u go better bring ur own bedsheets.

worst hostel i ever stayed. let's start with the rooms. u have no air condition whatsoever. instead u got old fashioned vantilator with the cables all around the floor. electric plugs are really bad . rooms have no space for anything. sheets mattress pillow covers... very dirty with heavy stains. dont get towel from them they are dirty. manager doesn't know how to talk with ppl. very rude. thai and taiwan girl were best. don't stay here. location was good but save ur money for other hostel.
creakiest beds in the world, cramped hot rooms, not that bad overall though

hostel could've been better, but the location was great, right at hollywood blvd. the owner was a little bit grumpy, not really a social hostel, but for the price it was allright. for 2 nights it was doable
2 important point   perfect location perfect wifi

metro and bus station are really close and you can go from there to everywhere.    the rooms are too tiny there is barley space to walk when everyone is in the room. it's really loud from the streets and also really hot in the rooms. it's not clean and the stuff isn't really helpful because it seems like they don't understand everything or everything you ask seems like to be a wrong question and you get not a very nice answer.   wouldn't recommend it!

great staff & facilities are ok- impressed by the shower's power and temperature! breakfast is definitely first come first served but overall a great hostel. favourite part is the back patio. rooms quite cramped so pack light
great location. right on the hollywood walk of fame. old and dirty though. also noisy as it on the main strip. good for one night but probably wouldn't stay there again. staff seem unhappy..

even though we booked 3months in advance, the staff was at first not sure if they had beds for us (2 girls). manager was very unfriendly and was condescending towards his employees in front of guests and told us about some kind of stomach flue he had just gotten over - very unprofessional and tmi. the room smelled really bad (no ventilation?), no lockers in the room (only in hallway, but no 24-hour reception), the shower was disgusting (hair). the place was really run down in general. very loud
very good location, but no vibe at all... very small kitchen with not much gear to cook... very inconvenient !

this hostel is good if you are looking for a cheap room to sleep in, nothing else. for an 8-bed mixed gender dormitory, there is one bathroom for about 16 people. and by bathroom, i mean one toilet & one shower that is pretty gross. definitely bring shower shoes if you must shower. the place is pretty rundown with very small lockers to lock your belongings in. it is right on hollywood blvd in the center of all the action. that being said, it can be pretty noisy at night.

probably the worst hostel i've ever stayed on. very dirty and old. the beds are very noisy and the carpet is bad, but the bathroom in the room is a nice thing though.  the staff is not helpful at all and they don't care about their clients.  the only good thing is the location which is very good in the main avenue of hollywood, but this point makes it very noisy.  i choosed this one because was the only one available in hollywood, but if i had to come back to la i won't stay in here again for sure.

stayed in mixed dorm. rooms were very dirty and grungy. mattress was ballooning up and it was difficult to keep from falling off the rickety top bunk. sheets supplied would not stay on bed; ended sleeping half on the mattress. towels were extra fee. front door was left open all day; seemed like anyone could walk in from the street. staff did not recommend things to do or see. okay location if you want to be in the center of hollywood.

this hostel is great. i read a lot of reviews & went anyways. yes, it's small and a bit cramped but the location is amazing. there is no curfew, and other travels are always hanging out on the patio. there is one worker there that is extremely rude, but christine makes up for it. she is amazing.

the beds are so noisy...the shower isn't good, small bathroom.  there aren't nice areas to hang out...the kitchen has only 4 chairs and the breakfast is poor: only bread, jelly and cereal.  the girl from reception was nice but the guys were rude! the only good thing about it is the location.
felt uncomfortable leaving stuff at hostel, administration lacking and forgetting to return change on every item i paid for.  it is what you paid for, cheap.

worst hostel experience i've ever had. the rooms are extremely dirty, no bed bug barrier on the mattress, blankets are visibly filthy, "patio" was tiny & run down. housekeeping was a joke: 1 kid w/ a broom. only 1 outlet per room, kitchen was gross/no utilities, door to hostel is wide open all day & into the night--not safe on hollywood blvd. only redeeming quality were two of the managers not including the owner, who was passive aggressive & made us uncomfortable. don't ever stay here.

pros:  1. the staff is friendly  2.  location is amazing. the metro station is quite close by as well.   3. the information is provided well for tourism purposes.    cons:  1. there are no keys/locks they provide for lockers  2. the beds are extremely shakey and seem unstable.  3. the bathrooms don't have sprinklers

it was very worn and not particularly clean, especially for the price. the only good thing was the location. the atmosphere wasn't great and the staff were all quite odd and made us feel a little awkward. we got a couple of loud knocks on the door at midnight which woke us all up, and then a staff member unlocked the door and let in another guest. this was a lengthy and loud process where it didn't need to be.

the location is great. it's right on the walk of fame and a 2 minutes walk to the next train station. unfortunately this is the only advantage of this hostel. the staff as well as the facilities and the overall cleanliness of the hostel needs improvement. next time i will definitely choose a different hostel.

great location, but not what i expected. the pictures that are on the website are definitely dated. the bedrooms were tiny & crammed & the bunkbeds were old & wobbly. the beds made so much noise at night & moved around so it was a hard to get some good rest. i forget the woman's name who checked me in (might've been christine), but she was so nice, welcoming, & informative. the manager however made me feel uncomfortable my second night staying.
