i spent 5 nights here with a friend. we were upgraded from an 8 to a 4 bed dorm. staff who greeted us were friendly and all other staff seemed fine. the room was fine, and while it had a slight musk it was easily forgettable after a night there. the beds do creek but using ear plugs i never had a problem. however, the top person moving does shake the bed.  everything was clean throughout. the breakfast was basic but enough to get you through a few hours in the morning and omlets were made once.

it's pretty dirty. it's where you stay if you have no money. and that's really the only reason. the staff asked like they don't want to be there. both the black guys who work the front desk were rude. the asian lady was really nice and so was the southern guy. not a place to hang out really. they have more rules than amenities. the staff works downstairs at the convenient store and also in the hospital so half the time they weren't even there. i will say the location is great for hollywood.

the manager tried extorting me for cash.  despite my having given my credit card online. said he couldnt find my reservation despite my name being on the paper right on his desk.  i was unable to stay and was without login during my trip. i would like a full refund of all charges.
the location was great and i still had a good time
the rooms smelled, everyone could basically walk into the hostel and there were hardly any/no plugs in the rooms to charge your phone. perfect location, but i wouldn't stay longer than one night.

if you can, avoid it.  the staff is not too friendly. at least, the owner is some friendly.   the beds are really noisy! the restroom was a bit dirty.  towels are not included, they cost 2 dollars.  though, there was good company, i made good friends there. the breakfast is good, and you can see netflix in the tv room at any time.
good location and breakfast. old bed and rooms.

decent, clean hostel in a perfect location to explore hollywood for the price. the interior decor and facilities could use some serious updating. gotta spend money to make money. thanks for letting me stay.

the staff makes the stay worth it. that and the money you save. plus, i loved the proximity to key places and things in hollywood. and the lady from taiwan (i wish i remembered her name), is an angel. what ever you need, she's on it. if she's there when you are, you're lucky. my complaints are the need for updated furniture and better (quieter bunk beds).   i couldn't put this place in the number one spot because it isn't paradise, but when you're on a budget and need no frills, it's perfect.
considering the price, it can be worth it. location is good, basically in the middle of the walk of fame.  for what concerns facilities, structure, etc it is useful just for sleep.

some parts were a little sketchy but the hostel did the job without a doubt - not the nicest one but considering the cost it definently works. had some great roommates so it made the experience better! thank you for having me!
the hostel was good, clean, good locación close to the metro station. no locker in forma. great  atmosphere, breakfast was really good.

pros:  very friendly and helpful staff.  breakfast available from 8-10am.   rooms were spacious and hot showers available.   easy access to metro busses & subway, restaurants and in the heart of hollywood to start of your adventure.  cons:  shower was clogged but there's another shower available.
the room that i stayed in was extremely cramped.

i have been to a lot of hostels in my life, but this one was by far the worst! it was clean, and in a great location, but our room was tiny and smelly, they should update their air conditioning system! the window was closed but it was still loud. the bed was horrible, mine was shaking every time i moved, as if about to collapse, plus no barriers on the top bed, you could just fall off!  the whole hostel is completely outdated and needs renovation desperately! we didnt feel welcome at all!
in general, really good. just be aware that they don't give towels, but you can buy them for $3.

the place is so convenient and just in the middle of the walk of fame. it is a walk distance from bus stops and metro station so you can visit downtown la and beaches so easily. it is not a fancy place but suitable and safe for just sleep since we spent most of the day hanging out. the staff are very friendly and helpful. moreover,  the price is so reasonable which is important for international students like me whose budget is limited. i enjoyed it and i would recommend it

the hostel is in a good location. we stayed one night at the banana and bungalo hostel and this one was better(hollywood and highlands)  but we had an issue with one of the managers because he was really rude to us when we checked out. started yelling and being dissrispectfull because we couldn't understand what he was saying since he had rap music on so loud we couldn't hear him . we just wanted our key deposit back and he even asked my friend to leave for no reason at all.

honestly, this place was grimy and uncomfortable compared to the other hostels i stayed at in the area. i really didn't feel comfortable at all here. the amount of money spent on a night here could easily go to a hostel that's much nicer and cleaner...
the girl with the greeny blue hair was very mysterious, what is she hiding behind those sunglasses? wish i asked for her name and number.

honestly this hostel felt a bit uncomfortable.  not the worst hostel i have stayed but certainly not the best.  walk of fame on the same street was a better experience.  my friend and i both felt a little uneasy when we were reminded a half hour before to turn in our keys and check out.  to be fair we did get good advise by the staff when we arrived at the hostel.  i recommend this hostel mostly if you plan on just going in and out since the location is great.

we wish we had stayed in the walk of fame hostel down the road!   this was so unclean, you get old blankets instead of actual bedsheets, the bunkbeds are woeful they are just tiny and dainty, designed for young kids not 20+ year olds, some members of staff are nice but some are really unnecessarily rude & unhelpful, just really weird vibes there, no security and really dodgy lock on front door which means people struggle to get in & have to ring the doorbell waking everyone up in the meantime.

nice hostel, very good and central location. decent breakfast. not overall social. has more long term people living there. staff are very friendly and helpful. would be good for groups or friends traveling together.

i wouldn't recommend this hostel, especially for women traveling alone. the atmosphere is really weird and even a bit scary. besides me and my friend, all the other guests were men (or so it seemed), and they were watching tv drunk in a dark common room. the bedsheets had stains on them and the bathroom wasn't very clean either. about the location: even if it may seem good, it's not!

excellent location right on hollywood boulevard. some of the staff were lovely, most evidently pretty unhappy to be there. which makes sense because i've never known a manager to be so verbally abusive to staff in my life. swearing and yelling over tiny little things, right in earshot of the guests. the beds were really squeaky and shaky and the breakfast wasn't great. some of the sheets seemed newer, the ones i got were pretty gross. rooms were spacious enough. lockers outside the rooms.
amazing time and fantastic staff

good hostel in a great location. i've been in many hostels and i understand living conditions tend to be less than any hotel but i found the room had a musky smell that me and my friends found quite strong. staff were nice enough however. it was very quiet whilst we were there and we only stayed a night but if you are looking for a place to stay on hollywood blvd for a short trip then this place is fine.

awful tacky decor. wonderful hollywood location, good for getting around.    the owner i often heard being quite abusive of staff. serious like shouting matches. an employee was on the phone to what was clearly a customer who was disputing a fee  however i walk in to ask a question and just after i walk in i hear through and intercom, in a full shot, "get off the phone it's not for personal use you have been on it for 15 minutes". the man tried to explain, but the boss would have none of it. poor
the beds were making awful sounds. (prison-like, of steel) the rooms were really tiny.
it was great and comfortable for me. if you choose this hostel, you will be disappointed about facilities of this hotel. but, i can ensure that the location give you super satisfaction.
heart location and staff r good. especially the lady from taiwan. she is extremely passion always. breakfast is simply but enough. everything is awesome!
perfect location. rooms a bit small but no problem. other people was having trouble with the staff but that didn't concern me.

great location at hollywood walk of fame. hostel was clean. it was winter, and there wasn't any heaters in the room. even with multiple layers of blankets, it still gets pretty cold. also, once i got back to the room and saw a stranger lurking around in the room. he removed my friend's (who was sleeping at that time) shoes. weird. also, there wasn't any parking available, so we had to spend a good amount of time every night looking for a parking spot blocks away from the hostel.

australian female traveller staying alone, this hostel was exactly what i needed for a cheap night close to all the sites of hollywood boulevard. male manager and lady employee were lovely and always happy to help, i arrived home late one night and there was still someone to ask questions which was helpful. male cleaning staff member was very rude, needs to work on social skills as he brings down the rapor built up by other staff members. breakfast was great, thank you very much :)

once we were finally showed into our rooms, i was shocked! the yellow walls were not only hideous, there was a plethora of unknown stains everywhere. right, next to my bed i had a hole/stain and other brown spots throughout the wall next to me. the beds were not even made and i was handed sheets and one blanket for the remainder of my stay. they left the front door open to the hostel until midnight which did not make me feel safe at all and i felt like anyone could get in. the kitchen was dirty.
really nice people in the hostel, especially my man david, he showed me all around hollywood from a director's point of view. highly recommend

the hostel is amziliant! !! great staff,great bed,beautiful shower. just as remember that if yr over 35 don't book the place. which is understandable, those under 35 need a place to go. wish i had this when i was young. glad it is here now.
i stayed few days and i had a great time, i will stay again another time, thank you ricardo!!!

i loved to stay there! it's a amazing hostel in the walk of the fame, well located, the staff are very cool, it's clean and i stayed in a room with a private bathroom: the best thing hahaha! the beds are comfortble but they make noise when you need to change your position but i think this isn't a huge problem. i loved and i think it's a good place to stay and very near of everything!!

location is the only good thing that i can say about this hostel.  people staying there  are very strange, lots of them have been staying there on kind of  permanent basis. kitchen is ok,  but everything is very used and dirty. there is smell of old furniture and inside of the hostel. room is very noisy due to opened widows to the busy boulevard.

this is the best hostel i've stayed at in the us! they have free breakfast, free shuttles to major places in town, and when i stayed there, they had a free comedy night with free drinks. it was incredible! i loved it here! i would absolutely stay here again. the place is super clean and like a 4 star hotel.

perfect location and good breakfast! just a little run down and in need of an air freshener.    our only problem was that the bathroom was located outside of our dorm and it was constantly busy with people using it from other dorms (when they had their own bathrooms in their own dorms) but other than that this is a good hostel  for travelers who want to see the sights of la and don't want to spend much time in the hostel.

location is amazing - be sure to bring earplugs. rooms are facing the hollywood boulevard. no aircon, was okay for october, but i would not want to stay there in hot summer. everything was a bit rundown but okay clean. facilities could be better, kitchen was small. hostel had everything you need, just not very modern and nice. white pricey for what they offer. staff was friendly.

good staff and location. the place is somewhat small but has all you need; tv room, balcony, kitchen, maps and info. internet is very slow.  the room is fine with it's own toilet however they have the worst bunk beds i have "slept" on. if you are on the top of the bunk bed you are pretty much screwed; light and fan on your face, no rail or near enough a wall to lean your back on or avoid your stuff from falling off, moves a lot, no outlet, pathetic pillow and not exactly easy access on and off.

pretty grim hostel. didn't look massively clean in the bath room and kitchen. we've stay at other hostel for the same money and they had more atmosphere and better facilities. i don't like being negative but compared to other hostels it's bad.
best thing about it is the location, easy subway access, right on the walk of fame.
hostel was good!

please note this hostel has no air conditioning. it's southern california, ridiculous. when i asked for an extra fan for the room because there was no air con the manager swore at me and told me i was lucky to get a fan. we left and got a hotel. the hostel is right on the main street so the bedrooms are incredibly noisy. do not stay here.

hostel was not so beautiful, but the localization was perfect and we had breakfast included. this is what i could expect for this price, but still i enjoyed. also the place makes a lot of opportunities to talk with other people from hostel.
so old hostel
awful awful place. mould everywhere, rooms incredibly hot.   rude and aggressive staff members.     would never ever stay there again.   awful place.

there was no plug in the room so i couldnt charge my phone, the beds were extremely uncomfortable and dirty, nobody told me anything about the checkout time so tomorrow when i asked the receptionist yelled at me.

i really appreciate for everything during the time i stay in this place. staffs were really friendly and helped us about everything we asked. they serve also breakfast every morning which is a wonderful thing to have when you r looking for a cheaper travel plan. breakfast was not so rich but it was enough. different cereals every morning toast and waffles on the weekends. rooms were large enough. bathroom was also good. location is great! we never spend any money for metro or anything. great!!!

you are literally paying for the location. right on the hollywood walk of fame, 24hr subway across the street and the chinese teatre as well as marshalls just a minute away.  there were some homeless people constantly at the entrance of the hostel and it was the only place to go for a cigarette. i didn't like having to deal with them constantly. the beds were extremely wobbly and shaky and the pillow was ridiculously lumpy. don't expect much.
stuff are nice.but only one bathroom for crowded hostel was very very uncomfortable.

you are literally paying for the location. don't expect anything more. i booked an all female dorm and a man was suddenly put in our room. the beds swayed and squeaked a lot. the pillow was super lumpy. there were homeless people right outside the stairs and made it difficult to have a smoke. breakfast was decent however with a subway right across the street.

i recently enjoyed two weeks in hollywood and highland hostel.  the location is great, the staff are friendly and there is even an irish bar within walking distance!  i could also walk to such television shows as dr phil and the price is right.  however if you want to visit the nearest beach or have a night out at a gay bar public transportation is needed.  although there were many beggars in hollywood i found the building reasonably clean and safe.  you can prepare your own food in the kitchen.

an interesting experience.. when i arrived the guy in the office was agitated. not only was he demanding, but kept referring to a "f*cking stupid b*tch" under his breath. fair enough, and when he gave me a tour he brightened up a bit (except for randomly and angrily telling someone off for sitting in a dark room). he also wore his cap so low that when he looked at you, only his nose and mouth was visible, not his eyes. maybe it's because i'm tall? long story short, great location, weird staff
you get what you pay for, great location. i&#39;m not high maintenance so suited me really well

if you are just needing a place to crash while in hollywood, this is a solid bang for your buck. the staff were friendly and accommodating. the rooms/washrooms weren't anything to marvel, but the price was the best i could find for simply needing a place to lay my head on a friday night.

the location is good.  but the hostel owner just wanted to charge money.  that was so worst travel experience in la.  i already deposited the 10 bucks the when i checked out later about 10 minutes then hostel said you later 10 minutes &#39;now is 10:10. check out time is 10am. that was ridiculous to take the 10 bucks for change.  one night that it&#39;s!

everything was pretty good, breakfast in the morning was awesome!!   only down fall was the staff very openly arguing in the hall way outside of the tv room. the asian lady there was really rude when she would come in and clean.   other than that it was good 👍🏽👍🏽

its right on hollywood blvd (walk of fame) and theres a ton of shopping right outside the door. the staff is extremely nice and accommodating. the rooms are in desperate need for some tlc, the bunk beds are one of the worst ones ive slept in and theyre not too big on cleanliness. getting time in the bathroom is nearly impossible and the rooms are hottt. the kitchen is pretty gross and i feel like the price pretty steep. ok for one night, wouldnt stay there for longer though.
very disappointed with staff members - incredibly rude and unprofessional.

the doors were never locked, people could just waltz into your rooms. the receptionist was going to put us in a smelly cramped staff room because they didn&#39;t have any female dorms left which i booked on the website so we had to go to a co ed one. the location is great but the hostel and staff are odd and it was an uncomfortable experience.

best location for hostels on hollywood boulervard. it&#39;s a basic hostel located on the strip. the breakfast is good, safe place, staff are friendly and very helpful. bunk beds are basic and cleanliness is average. but your paying for the location which is fantastic and would purely recommend purely on that basis.
had a fantastic stay here. great atmosphere, location, staff. right by the beach. you can rent bikes and surfboards from the hostel.
great place to stay. friendly,helpful staff, comfortable, and great location on the hollywood walk of fame. no complaints

personale super disponibile e gentile. sempre pronto a dare informazioni, consigli e a risolvere problemi. sono stati carinissimi e hanno lavorato oltre l&#39;orario previsto per aiutarci per un incidente che ci è capitato sulla walk of fame. insuperabili.  la location è perfetta, giusto sopra la walk of fame. consigliato.

great location, right in the middle of hollywood blvd (don&#39;t expect a quiet night!). good breakfast and small but nice terrace area available. friendly staff who managed to let us have breakfast before the advertised time as we had to go early :)
great location but it felt a little weird having a little girl (possibly a relative of the staff). there was also one 2 working plugs in a room of 4 right next to someone&#39;s bed

all in all the stay was ok and the location is good to visit hollywood.but the kitchen isn&#39;t really equipped, the wifi isn&#39;t working and some things like passport, charger,... got &#34;lost&#34;. the baddest thing was, that there was only one accessible public bathroom with one shower, which was blocked almost the whole day. at the day of checkout i stored my luggage there and because i wasn&#39;t able to take a shower in the morning, i asked to take one in the evening, they wanted to charge me 7$ f

the hostel is in a good location, right on the hollywood walk of fame and really close to the metro station. we stayed for 4 nights and found the room clean, however, there was no air conditioning in the room, meaning we had to have the windows open (which didn&#39;t actually shut). this also meant the noise from street made you feel like you were right on the street. ear plugs were a must. there was only 1 working fan in the room, which didn&#39;t go far between 6 people in a small space.
location was superb. other facilities were normal.

what an awesome hostel right on the hollywood boulevard next to everything. very close to hollywood and highland red line station. had an amazing time. only problem was that manager was super rude came telling me that i had chosen the wrong room when it hadn't been my fault, then he took on reception girl right in front telling her how incompetent she was. what an a*hole. other than that, place is great.
best location, friendly staff , you get breakfast  , but the beds are bad and rooms are like sunna's
good location, condition is to be expected for the price.

this was the worst hostel experience i have had. the location is great for nightlife, and the woman that checked me out in the morning was helpful when i lost my phone. however, they were out of towels, the sheets did not seem clean, there was no ac (and it was extremely hot), so in order to have any air in the room, we had to keep the window open allowing the nightlife noises of hollywood boulevard into the room, making for a restless night. there are also no ladders to climb to the top bunks.

i am not one to rate accommodation poorly, but i had a poor hostel experience here. the staff were particularly rude and strange. there was 1 staff member who behaved so strangely i felt so uncomfortable. when he spoke to me, he had his hat brim low enough so we couldn&#39;t make eye contact which was very off putting. moreover, i later saw him in the corridor, where he had a semi-erection and would shake his hips/junk around whilst on the phone. it was so bizarre - from a staff member! wtf!

great location on hollywood boulevard. has a bit of a run down feeling to it. not sure if it&#39;s just old or just not that clean. not a very social hostel - don&#39;t stay here if your looking for friends/people to do stuff with. the beds were hard and squeaky. it was very loud at night but that&#39;s to be expected. no air conditioning.
nice staff, good location, include breakfast. the only downside is there is no parking around.
nice enough. building and rooms were open to almost anyone, lock your bags. free breakfast was basic, location is why you stay here. you get what you pay for.

a serviceable hostel option for the price. basic continental breakfast to get you started in the morning. bunk beds were very, very noisy and mattress was very old and not the most comfortable. location is great for several tourist activities. staff were kind and helpful. we were neither impressed nor disappointed with our stay. location probably adds $5 on what the hostel is actually worth a night.
my stay was alright. all i can say is, location was great and the front desk that day i checked in. i probably would not stay again.
the best location in town, great value and aceptable facilities.

staff were rude and would not look me in the eye. wifi was so poor that a single web page wouldn&#39;t even load, no matter where i was in the hostel. the room had a poor lock so could easily be entered by anyone, and the front of the hostel was only locked at night time, meaning anyone could come in whenever. there wasn&#39;t any hot water for the first two days of my visit.
goood condition, recommend for staying

the place is okay for one night stand but i wouldn&#39;t recommend for more than that. the shower in our room wasn&#39;t working and they couldn&#39;t fix it during our stay  and although they spend the whole day trying the situation wasn&#39;t properly because our door stayed open all the time and we&#39;re weren&#39;t even there. the breakfast is simple but pretty good. the room smelled like cheap soap.

i always enjoy my stay at the hollywood and highland hostel when i come to los angeles.  the staff are always helpful and richard wants to make sure that you enjoyed your stay.  i highly recommend this hostel.
there is no parking except street parking. if you have a lot of valuables in your car i would not advise staying at this hostel with a car. probably not an issue for most people.

hostel is okay, but just a bit strange. everything looks messy (rooms, bedsheets, bathrooms). the staff was friendly, but the guy who checked me in was wearing his cap so low that i never saw his eyes when he spoke to me :| location is great: on hollywood blvd. there is nothing going on at the hostel (no planned events or activities ).

firstly, the bathroom shower in my room was leaking and the staff wasn&#39;t bothered to fix it. the room carpets weren&#39;t clean. there weren&#39;t enough kitchen utensils to cook, and the breakfast is not great either. they keep 2 or 3 cereals with milk. the breakfast buffet needs to improve immensely. the only good thing about this hostel is the location, right at hollywood boulevard(centre of tourist spots).   the staff is friendly, christine, reevaluate and richard in particular.   dissatisfied stay.

unfortunately my stay here was not as well as i anticipated. to my dismay i discovered that there is no air conditioning, when i checked in at the office it was making me feel uncomfortable, because it was so hot in there. there was wifi, but there was terrible reception. i could not even get a signal in my room on occasion. multiple extension cords lay out on the floor which make it easy for someone to trip. perhaps a possible fire hazard with too many extension cords. security was ok.

people who work at the office are the worst ever. they make any excuse to steal your deposit. last time, i left the hostel early morning and i gave the key and sheet. the guy told me to come back later to have my deposit. i came back after 1 week and i stayed their for 2 day, but when i asked them about my deposit they said because you left when the office was closed so no deposit!i spoke with the manager and he give it to me, but when i checked out at 10:40am they said you are late no deposit!!

the hostel is very dirty and it smells horrible inside. security is awful! doors are not locked automatically and anyone can get into your room. besides that i paid for a room with 6 people in it. but the hostel was overbooked and the staff put an additional mattress in our room. so, there were 7 people. and it was a challenge for me to get my bed through the mattress and people&#39;s suitcases. one plus here is the location

the doorknob wasn&#39;t reliable. there was no warm water. but the staff was very nice and the coffee tasted great. it&#39;s the best coffee i&#39;ve ever had, actually. and i&#39;m grateful christine put me in 4-person room even though i paid for 6-person room.
very nice staff and guests.   will return soon!

you get what you pay for, it's a seedy hostel in a seedy part of hollywood blvd... but for that price, it's hard to get better stuff. staff was friendly, but facilities were very basic. security is ok.

hostel/room were dusty, tired & noisey. neither window in room locked & would slide open (next to shared balcony so security risk). one had a blanket pinned up as a curtain, other nothing at all. door lock to the room was loose. bunk beds were incredibly squeaky & unsteady. mattresses were stained & pillows were flat. marks on linen. staff were abrupt & strange. questioned us & tried to belittle our answers. plastic cutlery/cups & paper plates not eco friendly. would never return or recommend.
staff didn&#39;t seem amazingly helpful or knowledgeable. facilities were not particularly clean either. the upside was the convenient central hollywood location.
i like it!!  cheaper than any other places on the same street.  people a re pretty funny and breakfast is good!!

ok for a couple of nights but wouldn&#39;t do a long stay here, not good enough for the price. staff are friendly but dorms are a bit iffy and smell weird, but great location right on hollywood boulevard across from the chinese theatre.
i enjoyed my stay and will plan to stay their again.  great value in hollywood.

fantastic location on hollywood blvd, although there is a fair bit of shouting outside at night and only one window was double glazed, meaning we often got a nice narrative to sleep to! opposite a cvs pharmacy which has a decent selection of groceries and not too far from ralph&#39;s on sunset blvd which is a good supermarket.    the staff were friendly, the room was an alright size with an en suite bathroom. the free breakfast selection was really good. would recommend!

we just stayed here for one night, the location is good, you can take the metro and also bus easily, here if you need towel you need to pay $2. we have no schedule for next day, the staff there gave us good advises , and also told us the route in detail, she is nice, and my roommates are polite and nice.

the place is great ,cousy like home with very  kind  staff that gives you a good feeling.  the only thing i would have change is  the size of the lockers because a laptop can't fit inside and its very heavy to carry it during day while youre walking.  exept that everything was and still perfect  thanks a lot!
non-respectful staff at the hostel turning the atmosphere of the hostel unconfortable

we went to this hostel because of the low price. staff was pretty chill, not super interested in hanging out, but definitely not mean. right on hollywood blvd, which is great for sightseeing, but to us hollywood was a little trashy. we stayed near santa monica a lot w the bus. no free parking but you can stay at the orange for $15 a night. no curfew was great too, just make sure you make friends with your roommates before you come in at 2am!
the bed is bad, no locker in each room
was a good overall experience. staff was very helpful. thank you for a good stay..

the staff were really really friendly and very helpful. it was in such a good location you step out of the hostel and onto a star. the room was basic but what to be expected from a hostel. it was a really good price and prime location. i would definitely stay here again if i was in la for a couple of days.
need security, many strange people rounding!

i just came from south east asia, staying in hostels that were 10 stars across the board for around $7 a night. the beds are already made upon arrival in se asia, which gives them all a hotel like feel. incredible atmospheres and very clean. so, comparing the value and quality i had down there to this place when i just arrived back in the states really gives h&h a tough run. it was generally clean, staff was on site and helpful, tv room had a stack of dvd&#39;s to watch and was usually quiet.
great value.

the hostel is in a very convenient location (close to many la attractions on the hollywood blvd) and it is quite cheap, however, you get what you pay for. i booked a 6-bed dorm, but was placed into an 8-bed one that smelled horribly - even the staff member himself told me that (and that i can ask to be moved to another room if it is too bad). the hostel does not have any kind of heating, so if you travel during winter, you will be very cold. the main door is always open all day (till late hours)
not a good place at all.
i was very comfortable.  great shower   close to everything  perfect.  nice people  :)

two-words:   location & affordability    pros:             rich, the senior manager at the property was a pleasure to work and conversate with. junior managers, were a hit or miss to talk to in terms of personality. the building is old, smells, but they do clean the entire property daily which was a suitable trade-off.    cons:             it's an old building and the rooms do have a  musty smell to them. the only other con imo was the janitor has a noticeable chip on his shoulder towards life.

the staff were very creepy, rude and annoying - the manager stares at you and peaks into your room when the doors open as well as talks a load of rubbish to you. sense the tone, if i'm not replying i don't want to talk now stop cornering me. it was intimidating & they do not know how to treat customers / eachother. dirty, musty, broken down, horrible atmosphere like a murderer had been there, bathrooms = pure filth and would've been cleaner not using them ( could write more dont have space)
probably my best stay in la. it is in hollywood which is great for sightseeing and such. staff was really helpful in setting up the amenities.
i really enjoyed staying there.

most people stay one night that's what i recommend...the hostel is actually fine on the whole, but just seems a bit dodgy on entry. more than one staff member is hard to talk to and is awkward when asking any questions. location is brilliant but the hostel needs a lick of paint inside, the beds are pretty bad and the carpet is old and worn. no air conditioning is a bit annoying, they do have fans which help but isn't convenient.
horrible hostel .

nice and helpful staff and excellent location but... the rooms are really really small, no space for luggages and almost everything in the kitchen is disposable. that's the only think i really didn't like at all, no respect for the enviroment. it's not difficult or expensive to buy cuttlery and plates and to make guests washing them instead of producing everydays mountains of plastic. please think about it! love our planet!!
pros: location  cons: although the room have been cleaned every day, the room had a bed smell. there's no air conditioning so impossible to stay if the weather is hot.

the breakfast was good.  most of the staff was very very nice and absolutely comfortable to stay with. everything was easy and fast to deal with.  the location is very central but thats also why it can get loud at night.  all in all good job and a nice stay!
staff is really nice and kind .  but room is bad. too hot and bed makes noisy

the hostel was in a good location and that's about it. directly on the walk of fame however the door to the hostel was always left open allowing lots of people to just wander in, the handle to our door nearly off showing someone had tried to break it, very dirty facilities, breakfast stale however the staff were polite

this hostel sits in the heart of hollywood and is well placed for exploring la. the staff were very courteous and waited up late to check us in when our bus was delayed passed midnight for which we were very grateful. the hostel was clean and had a basic kitchen with a small but cosy balcony for chilling out at night. students of music will love the beds as they share your love of making sound and will harmonize to any movement you make. the open staircase entrance is a bit of a security concern

the location of this hostel was unreal, couldn't knock it at all. we were upgraded to an 8 person room with only my group of 5 boys in there with an air conditioner which was great.  downside was that the wifi was basically non-existent the whole time we were there and the towels/facilities needed an upgrade as they were well aged and shocking.  not bad overall but could be better
the location is amazing however our sheets and other linens were dirty. if you get your own room then it's fine but i don't how safe i would feel in a shared room. the staff are helpful.
wi-fi doesn't work at all. my bed didn't have access to a plug.
i only spent one night there, but it was a nice, clean place and in a perfect location. staff was very nice and helpful. i definitely recommend this place.
there were no ac. it was hot as hell

the location of the hostel is excellent! it's located directly at the hollywood blvd. so you are in the centre of one of the tourist spots of la. it's not very clean, but unless you're very fussy it should be ok for a few days. all in all the price is ok concerning the very good location.

this place was ok if you are just looking for a bed. it was clean and in a perfect location to get around with buses and the metro. the staff weren't very helpful with suggestions or directions, no info flyers in reception for trips or tours, and there is absolutely no air con in the rooms and it was unbearably hot that you couldn't sleep properly!!
the hostel had best location. but facility was terrible and old. stuff are good and kind. that's it.
the place was extremely dirty and the bathroom was something out of a saw movie. the beds moves uncontrollably whenever you moved, i was terrified it was going to break!!
do not recommend! many of my stuff including food ans clothes were stolen from the room and no one from the staff cared about it

very small room, no electricity in the room, only one extension for the whole room. very hot, only one fan for the whole room. no security at all, they have only tiny locker, no bag can fit there, everyone can go into the hostel and into the rooms. old mattresses, dirty bathrooms, dirty reception. sum up, worse place that i have stayed. not recommended. don't stay there

hostel had a weird vibe as soon as i arrived. it was more like a halfway house then a hostel really as seemed like a group of people lived there permanently. 'breakfast' was bread and jam.. not even margarine to go on the toast. staff were kind of rude and would come into rooms and ask for your name etc, without even introducing them self . also i think there was a child living there which was kind of weird.  rooms were unbearably hot.  good location though, right in the heart of things.

we enjoyed our stay at hollywood highland hostel, mostly because it's located directly at the walk of fame and the accessibility by metro and bus.  the one thing that was really disappointing though was the breakfast. if it says including breakfast on the website, we would expect a little more than just peanut butter and jelly sandwiches. the kitchen was too small for all the guests, too, so a lot of guests had to eat their breakfast standing.  overall good for the money, but room for improvement.
gross facilities!  vulgar manager! he needs to be fired! kitchen and refrigerator, horribly gross! bad mistake to stay there! never ever again!

if you're scroogy, go for it. you don't have to get up from your bed to see elvis rocking on the street. but you get what you pay for: 6 bed dorm was tight, airless (despite the fan) and loud (because of the fan). it was relatively clean, the staff was nice (even the infamous manager). don't forget to bring your own padlock (although you can buy one in liquor store downstairs).
the hostel was nice for a few days and well located, just the breakfast could be a bit more variant with more options and better quality...

in general all was fine.some persons from the staff were really nice but 2 persons (out of 5 i met) behaved as if somebody forced them to work there.    manager - a really nice person in contrary to what i read before going there.
very very good location and kind staff even there was  no elevator, staff helped me.  and room had has a bath room   price was also good
the hostel is in a good location for the hollywood blvd, and a great place to begin my trip in la.

i really enjoy staying at the hollywood and highland hostel.  richard and his staff always make me feel like i am at home and welcome.  the atmosphere is friendly and the rooms clean.  i would highly recommend this hostel for any travelers in the los angeles area.

right on the hollywood stars walk, prime location. old building, quite a steep stairs, would not recommend with heavy luggage. door creaked very bad, but was oiled when i asked, great service. free breakfast is milk, bread and peanutbutter.

this hostel is great, right in the heart of hollywood boulevard! the room was clean and a good size. there are lockers available for valuables (you'll need your own padlock). the staff were really friendly and helpful and kindly let us store our bags the day we checked out (and use the locker too!). we only had one night so didn't really use the kitchen but it looked good and clean. the manager was a nice guy too. worth the slightly higher cost, would recommend.

great location if you're looking to explore hollywood. i also walked to west hollywood in about 35 minutes (which in my opinion is a much better area to visit!)    the hostel is quite small and quiet, but for what i needed it for it was fine.there's a free breakfast (toast and peanut butter, but who's complaining) and the staff are pretty friendly.     only complaint is there isn't a room for bag holding, so i had to leave my bags in the office and at one point i saw the office unattended.

i stayed here for nearly 2 weeks. i would recommend it! ok its not a 5* hotel. its a hostel, which is way better value than a single room in a hotel. its very clean there are 2-3 staff cleaning for ages every morning. i did have some milk & cereals go awol but this was not the establishments fault & they were very apologetic about it. i would advise any guests to keep food that doesnt need refrigeration in their room! lovely staff. all so helpful & sweet. excellent location with grocery nearby
been visiting and staying at this location for several years and it has actually improved. the hostel is cleaner, staff friendlier and the value is about the best one could get in hollywood.
looks like you are in a ghetto. the staff will remind you that you made a big mistake, and now you pay for it.

the manager a black guy who is drunk every evening. keeps increasing rate and derogates/blames hostels world to be responsible of rates misquotes and mismanagment. the truth is they have no idea of what they are doing. anyone with a room and six bunkers doesnt become a dorm provider. do yourselves a favor, dont book here. stay sonewhere else as hollywood boulevard can be seen within few hours. not much to explore.
the african-american manager opresses his staff and in turn the staff mistreats. who gave them the license to be in hospitality business.
hostels like these make the concept of hostels a failure.
where do i start?! i wouldn't go there again! i wanted to stay in a hostel to meet travelers from around the world and...however it felt like a place for local low income people and...

we enjoyed our stay here. made the most of the fantastic location and nearby amenities. would recommend groups of 5/6 to this hostel to book out entire rooms for security purposes. otherwise great value for money!
too cold inside the room, bad windows!! room and bathroom very clean. bed not comfortable  very good location  nice and helpful workers
it`'s a very good location and the money you pay to stay there is definitely low when compared to other hostels. but the facilities are very very poor and it's not clean at all.
i didn't like that i had to make my own bed. also, i could never check out because there was nobody at the reception when i left.
this place was great! it was the best location for people travelling. i would stay here again in a heart beat!
super nice people, really helpful! location is perfect.
great location, friendly staff. rooms should have heating for days as hot as the last weekend , we were sweating all night long.

when we checked out of the hostel on 14th september, the member of staff was quite rude and direct wth us. there are better ways to wak with your guests. otherwise the stadd were fine and pretty friendly. the security isn't so good, the front door opens onto hollywood boulevard and is always open drng the day and we had a key for our room but could access it without the key. there are some small lockers available to use t store valuables. average breakfast provided of bread with pb&j.

not that bad as in another reviews. and across the street is shopping mall where you can park for 8$ per day but if you stay there for 4 days and than you "lose" the parking ticket you will pay only for a lost ticket 8$. just my experince may be different at your time.

perfect location, but there is no security at all. can't smoke anywhere inside the hostel and are forced out onto the street in the middle of the night at the mercy of hollywoods nightcrawlers. bathrooms are only in the rooms no communal one and not the cleanest.
weid staff, dirty and very old kitchen and bathrooms. the worst hostel i ever been. only the owner is a funny and polite guy

great location but the room was tiny for six people, not to mention very very warm with only a pathetic fan and tiny window for any kind of air. beds felt like you were sleeping at sea - very rocky and some were very squeaky.     the staff were unhelpful and not particularly welcoming, although did allow a refund for a member of our party who was unable to make it until the following evening.    everything was a bit run down and grubby, and there was a stale smell throughout the hostel.
great hostel in a great location, staff very helpful. groceries store below and opposite, everything located conviently

looks shabby--chipping paint, rusty/creaky beds/floors, few outlets & only half of them work, flat pillows, no ac only fan that is still stuffy and they make you keep the windows open to the outside. security is iffy--they offer lockers in a common area, but you must provide a lock. the opening of the hostel onto the street immediately leads up to a long flight of stairs, (not secure if traveling alone with multiple bags as you have to leave one bag in the street while you haul the other up)

so this review may seem a little unfair, however, this is due to receiving an email the day i was due to stay (in fairness it had been sent the night before but i'd had no internet) informing me they had overbooked and could no longer accommodate me and my friend. they did offer to refund my deposit, and suggested two other hostels that might have space, while this effort was appreciated, but to be honest, that just isn't good enough. looks to be a great location though as we drove past.

unser aufenthalt war sehr gut man hat sich wohl gefühlt. die leute die dort gearbeitet haben waren sehr zuvorkommend und hilfsbereit! da man vom hostel direkt aif den hollywood blvd fallen kann war es aber auch sehr laut da man die fenster nicht schließen konnte, weil es so warm war. es waren aber in unserem 4 bett zimmer zwei ventilatoren vorhanden. die betten haben bisschen instabil gewirkt aber sie waren bequem! alles in allem n guter ort fur 1 - 2 nächte im verhältnis zum preis!

we have spent three weeks traveling in 4 states and staying in many different places. but this one is definitely the worst ever. i regret that we decided to take this one in order to have a good location. much better option is to stay in some other areas in the city and then just come to this boulevard just for a short.     even though there was a breakfast included, everything in that kitchen looked disgusting, so we left to have breakfast somewhere else.

honestly as 2 chicks traveling together we were  little creeped out by the staff. there were a lot of inappropriate comments to the both of us which made us feel uncomfortable.    on a positive note it is in a fantastic location, rooms need aircon!
rooms are really small, bathroom dirty, but the location is excellent.

it was there, right on the hollywood bvd.when i first saw the entrance, i felt something was really wrong.i left my wife in the car and took my friend who drowe us to la, inside to check. the steps up to 2'nd floor looked like something from the red lite distrikt with it's red old carpet. when manager would have cash right away, i asked him to show us the room. the room was hot as hell, dirty underwear everywhere on  the floor, messy bed and a dirty towel over a clean bed. never again.

by far the worst hostel i have ever stayed in. booked a 6 man dorm, we were put in a cramped 8 man dorm. the heat was horrendous. we had booked an ensuite, and while there was an ensuite attached to our rooom, it was shared with the entire hostel as we later discovered there were only two working showers in the entire place. above and beyond a disgrace, we would not recommend this kip to our worst enemies. while the location is excellent, this place is expensive for what you get.

the location is excellent although far from the airport. the facilities were limited and the lockers small. bathroom was nice though. to be honest you stay here for the location and its not a terrible hostel. no air conditioning.

great location and staff were friendly but the rooms were very small with one small fan as air conditioning which was not very useful.  breakfast was terrible and kitchen felt dirty.   the bathroom was a state!!! i felt dirtier after i had showered. towels were also at an extra cost.  the atmosphere was strange. another couple staying in the same room actaully i quote said 'can you lock the door on your way out as theres a lot of weirdos around here' - sums it up!    would not stay here again.
staff is nice, dorms are good with a bathroom per dorm. great location.  the night i spent there was very hot though and there was no air con.
best thing about this place is its location, some dorm rooms are facing the busy street.  okay to stay for a few days.but there are better hostels in the neighborhood.

the hostel was ok. linens/pillows are old and should be replaced, and the best rocked and squeaked with even the slightest movement; that should be fixed.    we were happy with the washroom facilities! they were nice and clean/roomy.

great place to begin an adventure. ours started here and we enjoyed every moment. the location is great and really accessible, especially if you want to venture out of hollywood and into la outskirts. the atmosphere was friendly and inviting, as well as the staff, with a huge shout out to the manager, richard, who was always willing to hang out and have a chat! all in all, our experience was great and had us referring to it as 'home'.
the facilities was really bad. they said they offer breakfast but it's hardly to say breakfast. just bread and peanut butter.

very basic hostel but you get what you pay for, no aircon in the rooms and no lockers in rooms (small valuables lockers in the hall though), they also don't have laundry facilities but there is a launderette nearby.really good location  and the staff were friendly, i left too early to take advantage of the free breakfast. if your main concern is location then this hostel is great, close to the subway (connects to the flyaway bus which takes you straight to lax) and its on the walk of fame.

i was there for 3 nights.   horrible hostel stay and worst time.   very shaky, dangerous and very noisy bunker beds.   room was so damn hot. dirty walls.   staffs werent a bit helpful for anything, and had a bad attitude as if they are paying us to stay there.  in short, i recommend to stay here only for its location, which is right on hollywood blvd and hollywood's attraction. but for everything else, i donot recommend this hostel to anyone, and definitely not value for money.

the hostel was very clean and tidy which is great. the other great thing was the en suite bathroom. the downsides are that unfortunately a lot of sketchy people hang out around the front of the hostel and the front door only gets locked late at night so they could easily just walk in. make sure you bring a padlock to lock your valuables away. other downside is that there is zero atmosphere, there are tiny communal areas which nobody seems to use. overall though it's pretty good value for money
beds are not the best, specially if you have the upper ones.

located on hollywood blvd. very noisy all nights, small rooms and a lot of weired people here. staff were ok but apart from that couldnt say too many good things. if you want to stay in hollywood and need a place to sleep its ok i guess, but not more.
great location on hollywood blvd. staff were fantastic and really helpful. highly recommend!

the staff were really great and helpful, alex and richard in particular. they had a free bbq one day which was amazing - even had homemade burgers and salad! the only thing i would say is the rooms are so tiny we couldn't really fit our stuff in but it didn't bother us too much. the location is ideal right on hollywood boulevard and opposite fresh and easy.
i found the hostel good value for money, the rooms were a little small for my liking it was a little squashy in there at times. a part from that the staff were great and very helpful.
at least a ceiling fan in the bedrooms/ some aircon would be good. my room was full and all bar one checked out the next morning because of the heat.

the location and price can't be beat for staying in la, you are right on hollywood blvd a stones throw away from the chinese theater and right out front there is a taxi waiting area as well as a bus stop making getting around a breeze.
the only thing i hate the most is that in my stay of 5 days the wi fi never worked! but in general the place is great and the location too and the staff was very nice! i totally recommend!
great location, in the heart of hollywood. friendly staff too maybe just needs better kitchen facilities. overall a great hostel to stay at
super friendly staff!
great hostel,  awesome staff,  excellent location! it's quiet, not a party hostel (the one down the road is), but friendly atmosphere,  basic brekky,  and good value.
super nice staffs, excellent location, two thumbs up, highly recommended

the best place to stay in hollywood. good charge per room and it has toilet in each room. it is locate a couple street to principal metro station and the best place to visit it is so close from the hostel. good staff. i recommend to you.
the location is just super strategic. that's what you pay for. it wasn't super clean but is ok. at least i'm relieve when i know i'm staying there right in the middle of hollywood.
dirty, dirty!!!  but perfect location..  so i would come back!!!
basic provisions for a clean, tidy stay
the room was small and shabby. only one electric outlet for 4 people. although it looked clean, it smelled something bad and shared kitchen was so dirty that i never used it.
great location! of course, you cannot expect anything fancy for such a low price, but i came late in the night for sleeping and left early in the morning, so it was totally fine for me.
perfect location right on the hollywood blvd, and really helpful, friendly staff including the manager also met other lovely travellers too, ended up extending my stay twice :)

i really enjoyed my la travel with highland hostel. its location was great! also staffs are so kind. and i could eat breakfast like toast with peanut butter and jelly with milk. its cost was reasonable :-) i really love this hostel.

it didnt advertise air-con for our room so i shouldn't complain but it really is difficult to sleep in the heat without it. so we had to open a window but it was bit loud outside. bunk beds a bit squeaky.

first of all, the location is perfect. it is directly ocated at the walk of fame. the staff is freindly and helpful.   for breakfast you will get toast, peanutbutter, jam and coffe.the rooms are small but clean.unfortunetly they don´t have airconditioners so that it gets hot in the rooms.  there is a cheap way getting from the airpot to the hostel by public transport. take free shuttle to bus station and then 2 other buses ( look up on goolge maps).   in general we had a great time at this hostel.

staff were nice except one woman who was very abrupt. it was a fantastic location, right in the thick of things, especially at night. hollywood boulevard is cheesily cool. and its not too far from the sunset strip either.
good location, but not much else is good about the place

we had a great time there. marcus, the responsible, was so nice! people there were funny and cool. the breakfast was simple but good. facilities were not modern but we didn't care. we couldn't have a better location !
wouldn't recommend staying here... very sketchy.  breakfast was a joke  seems like a high school students apartment with lots of bunk beds

bad, some street dude made siren noises outside the place till like 5am. the room was way too small and overcrowded, 4 bunk beds in one room. there is a shower in the room, and everyone stunk to high hell. check out is at 10am, and it is impossible to get any rest. i booked 3 days and stayed one.
very good hostel , which is run very well. staff are all really really kind and welcoming and professional at the same time.

totally ok for that price. the entrance is right on the walk of fame with nice view on the hollywood scenery.  für den preis absolut ok. der eingang befindet sich auf dem walk of fame mit blick auf die hollywood szene.

it's pretty much just place to stay over night. if you're alone it's really hard to find someone to travel and explore with because there's no gather room. everything is about average except for location.
it's a good location on hollywood blvd. relatively small rooms and the lack of power outlets made it sometimes hard to keep your electronics charged.

this place is right on hollywood avenue. the only good thing is the transportation. it is very close to a metro rail station. however, it is really noisy and the surrounding place of bed is dirty. the bed is uncomfortable and you have to pay if you want to have blankets.

location is amazing, very accesible by bus or metro.   the hostel is clean, they clean everyday and eventhough it is a little bit old, it feels clean. the restrooms are very good.  the breakfast is very poor, but i didn't expected much, it would be nice to add maybe some cereal.  some of the staff is very friendly, however there are some who exploded easily. they seemed to always have a problem with some clients, and even though the problems were simple, they made a big deal out of it.

no complaints. however, if you're more chill and laid back, this location is not for you. i ended up leaving the day i arrived and going to the samesun hostel at venice beach, but that is just because hollywood wasn't my style. the guy at the front desk was really kind and helpful and the room was fine. from what i experienced, it was a great place, just not for me because it's in the middle of hollywood :)

need to enforce house rules. i was in a girls only dorm and there were guys hanging out in the room in the middle of the night. also, the door on the room did not automatically lock and the drunk guests would come in and leave the door unlocked for anyone to walk in. i awoke to a guy wandering  looking for his shoes.

for the price this hostel was fine. the staff were friendly and i had stuffed up my booking and they helped me out which was really nice. the hostel itself is quite dated and the interior is quite ordinary but the bathrooms were clean and i didn't feel like it was dirty, just old. the common room was quite small and crowded most of the time but it was fine. the location is one of the best you'll get if you want to see hollywood!

note to anyone staying here: make sure you check out on time! there is an extremly rude woman(maybe the owner or manager) who shouts at everyone at 9.45 to get out. the rooms arn't very clean- and neither are the matresses. its a good location being near the walk of fame etc.... but thats all your paying for.
poor beds shaking a lot. small kitchen, no laundry, no luggage storage. wait for 1 hour for checking in.

the first day we arrived, we were waiting in the office to check in. and the boss came in said 'you ladies please step out for a while, we had something to deal with'. ok, we waited outside for a long time!!! we are customers!! how can you let us go out and wait for your doing your so call 'thing'!  except for the location, i dont like this hostel, kitchen is poor and breakfast is just so so.

i have to say the location made the hostel pretty great. it's right on hollywood and a few steps away is chuck norris' star! they do the best they can with what they have. it is hard to find a place for a hostel in that area. the staff was helpful and they had a few different places to hang out which was nice! i would've like a better "breakfast". it's a pretty small place, but i enjoyed my stay there!
an alright place in a very good location, central hollywood. breakfast is very basic, essentially it's just bread, butter and jam/jelly. lots of colorful characters around

only one electrical outlet in a dorm room, which you had to cross over someone's bed to get to. they should provide extension cords for this.  also, a male staff member stayed in the female dorm for all the nights that i was there, which made it really uncomfortable, especially when there was only one bathroom in the room so you would have to wait til it was free to get change. although he might have been there on invitation, it should be a rule that this is not allowed to happen.

the staff were friendly and helpful. rooms were serviced each day and breakfast available daily. internet connection good. they are still upgrading and renovating, but ensure that everything is running smoothly.

the location is great you are on the strip and you are close by to lots of restaurants and action. the beds were really springy and the rooms are old. the people staying there were awesome. it's a fun place but it wasn't worth the money but again the location was awesome.
the location of this hostel is great, just a few minutes away to many point of interests in hollywood area. i think they need to clean the rooms a bit.
great location on hollywood blvd. rooms and kitchen dirty, no activities. too expensive for what you get..

not a great hostel, the room was stinky and dirty, the common rooms weren't nice, location is good (right next to dolby theater). the staff was incredible, i met 3 different people who worked there and all of them were super friendly and helped me with all my questions. they made my time in la much easier

i have difficult to feel safe, to find a plug, to use the internet... many things.  the location is perfect if you want to know hollywood. but i think the price is too high if you compare with other hostels in other places, but bettter quality
i'm really enjoyed my stay in h

i didn't even check-in. it's not clean at all and the lockers are tiny, they don't even fit a 13 inch laptop!!!! they didn't even accept 100$ bills, i'm glad they didn't because this gave me time to think that in really shouldn't be checking-in.

the place was cramped, great location, but the staff could be a little bit more relaxed..  rooms were a lot smaller than usual and the bathrooms were a little gross ( wearing flip flops recommended)...
great location easy going staff would stay again

great location if you want to stay in hollywood. the manager is welcoming. supermarket across the road and hollywood and highland metro stop nearby. bring earplugs due to location. free breakfast of bread and spreads is always handy. small kitchen if you need to cook, tv room and outside space, small lockers available in the hallway, bring a padlock. rooms are a bit dingy but saying that it is the same with the majority of american hostels, or if you're used to australian hostels you'll be fine.
it's ok for the price. good location as far as hollywood goes

the staff were some of the nicest people i met whilst in la. it was incredibly cheap and had a great location. the only negatives were the atmosphere and the lack of activities the hostel provided. overall though i did enjoy it and would recommend it

average hostel. the staff is made of really nice and friendly people and the hostel is located in the hollywood boulevard so it is very convenient. however, the hostel is very old and needs to be renovated (no air conditionning, small beds). the kitchen is not very convenient if you want to make your own cooking.

i can live with pb&j.   this is a very small hostel in the heart of hollywood blvd. i discovered that i'm not a fan of hollywood, or la when i got there, but the owner, staff (who live there), the residents, and other travellers made my visit to la. for those needing parking, you can park securely and cheaply in the hollywood & highland centre as long as you validate your ticket at their info centre. i recommend pay a few more dollars for female dorm which has been renovated.
the staff were very accommodating. richard, the manager, was friendly and informing.
especially the location if this hostel in amazing. the renovated rooms are really good, and it is definitely value for money.

the hostel is located in hollywood boulevard which is great if you want to be there, breakfast is a joke is peanut butter and jelly every day with the worst coffee ever, staff is nice they are try to make people comfortable instead the hostel is not what people expect to see, but it works if you are just looking for a place to sleep...

hollywood and highland hostel has all brand new plush carpeting in each room.  the walls have also been freshly painted.  the staff treat you like family and that is why i always stay at hollywood and highland.  they have a spacious kitchen and an outdoor patio for people who want to chill and relax. richard is the manager and he will do everything he can to make your stay pleasant.  i highly recommend staying at hollywood and highland.

definitely not worth $30 each a night!! shower so mouldy, pillows stained brown from people sweating on them, they looked at least 15 years old! front door doesn't lock properly. wouldn't stay here again!

although the facilities and cleaniness were just ok we had a very good experience and will definitely recommend it, because of the awesome location and mainly because of the awesome staff- we were always greated with a smile and when we asked for recommendations of stuff to do in la he took the time to write down a whole itinerary for us!
people were very weird. kind of scary. didn't really want to stay that long and it felt unsafe. would recommend to stay somewhere else
the location is really good as it is right at hollywood. however, the beds are dirty, and the room is really small. there's no fan nor aircon, and the window doesn't allow much ventilation.
the staff should be friendlier!

great location, great staff, decent breakfast - pity the bathrooms, plug sockets and light switches were disgustingly dirty, i didn't want to switch the light on or off in the dorm, for fear of catching a disease!   there's another hostel a few doors down for the same price, much cleaner but less character, depends whether you just want a bed for the night in the best location, really.

this hostel is direct on the walk of fame which is pretty cool! so the location is excellent. the staff were also very friendly. could be a bit more cleaner, but its really ok for the price. i would stay there again. only thing i didnt like was that                    you have to pay for using the computer. but i think thats everywhere so in la.

this place was a nightmare and should not be on any hostel sites! it is a locals hotel for drifters. it had filthy floors, stained matresses, no security, and lots of shady characters. there was a prostitute in my room working hollywood blvd. nights and sleeping all day!!! stay away!
terrible!  бомжатник!

this hostel is directly on the hollywood boulevard, just a 2 minutes walk away from the chinese theater, madame tussauds,.... that's awesome. the staff is nice, too and there is a tv room and a kitchen as well.  the rooms aren't the nicest, but if you're staying in hollywood, it won't really matter because most of the time, you're outside.

the room were a bit dirty(in terms of dusty) & the carpets seemed like it was not vacuumed. there was a bit of a weird smell in the room as well. the toilets, some of it were not functioning properly. but the staff were very friendly, excellent service.

the bathrooms were mouldy and didnt have any toilet paper. the whole place smelt disgusting and the rooms were pretty average. if youre just looking for a cheap stay for one night then maybe but otherwise i would give it a big miss!
nice hostel in the middle of hollywood, great staff
if you don't want to spend much, for one night it is ok, but not for more.
excellent location on holywood boulevard

when you want to be in hollywood but have a tight budget, this is the place. the staff is very cool. the bathrooms are pretty done, some leaking tabs, need definitely to be renovated but hot water runs. the kitchen is very small but in general sufficient. for a couple of days it's good.
best best best!
very good location and free breakfast. i met weird people here, but that´s not hostel´s problem.
the staff was awesome! cool area, but they could really use an air-conditions system.
if you want to be in hollywood, why not. but honestly one of the dirtiest hostels in california.
brilliant atmosphere, great location and the staff were really nice!

great spot! but horrible rooms. if you'e looking just for a "room" to sleep - you'll be ok (bring your own sheets!!). the location is great. become a hostel for tourist and not for a plaxe for home-less like people to stay; get some color in the rooms and at least some curtains for the windows. this caused me to cancel  two of my three nights.

this hostel is so messy, dirty and i find the rooms disgusting. the rates are expensive and we had the feeling, that the staff is trying to soak us and another group of travellers up.  the only advantage is the location on the hollywood blvd. but there are cheaper and better possibilities to stay in la. take the other hostel two blocks down the hollywood blvd. its clean, not as expensive as this hostel and it has a nice staff.
very loud rooms being right on the hollywood boulevard. little to no socialising area. dirty and smelly but in a very good location. i would choose the one down the road. no ladies for fun time
great place to stay. it was close to everything and the staff was very friendly. when i come back to los angeles i will stay there again. 10s across the board!
great place!! mike and natalie made me feel at home. chill laid back place. i will stay there again☺

the information of payment is $25 us plus tax ($2.4) the cover $30 us per night, the information of payment should it be more clear in the site. la it's to expensive, so is good deal to stay there for $25 (plus tax) every night.

don't bother staying here, the woman who runs it is extremely unprofessional and very sketchy. if you do decide to stay here, get ready to have your privacy invaded by the owner as she grills you on your mental health. if you do have any sort of mental health condition, she will flat out deny you being able to stay there and will try to forcibly throw you out. she apparently has no idea about disability laws.
great staff and atmosphere, well connected via metro to the sights and downtown of the city. totally worth for what it costs!

i am a young african american woman who tried this for the very first time.  they where really nice!  i would go to them again! just make sure you pay for your stay in cash and show them your plane ticket or however you got there ticket. for 7 night i payed them up front $175 and that's it! i plan to stay there again when i go apartment hunting!

we stayed one night at the lovely timen's house. the staff were very welcoming and ensured that our stay was pleasant. the location of the hostel was great and close to public transport links. the rooms were clean, air conditioned and there was kitchen facilities available. the hosts were kind enough to allow us to leave our luggage with them after we had checked out. we would not hesitate to return.

reserved but arrived and decided not to check in.....  this is just a house in a semi sketchy area, no hostel signage  the people who own it were really shady when i asked if they lived there, the shadiness and the fact that they only accept cash makes me think they're not operating legally.  they were also rude

this was my sixth hostel stay experience and i have to say that timens house made it into my top 2 rather quickly. i love love love, the type of residents that this particular hostel attracts and the owners are incredibly hospitable. there sense of humor was definitely a bonus lol. the only downside was the wait time to use the bathroom and the fact that there wasn't a washer on site. i thoroughly enjoyed my stay at timens and i'm quite certain that it'll be my first choice next time i visit l.a

this hostel only accepts cash and will charge you  $5 extra a night if you're american. at the time i booked that information was not online. the owner got very angry when i brought this up and told me i could go to another hostel. my recommendation is that everyone should just go to another hostel.
very clean.  owners nice and helpful.  do not trust all the reviewd from other people.  it's very pleasant.
this place was not clean at all! i understand, respect& get the reasons why people who have to stay there do but....i couldn't even stay there   unhappy to say that i was unhappy with the place.
a decent place to stay. local to a main train and bus station. mike and natalia are attentive hosts.  i would stay again.

they refused to let me in. the man on the phone was quite rude and challenging despite that i paid for the stay.  "you should read everything ... try to find any hostel that will agree to take you in.." well, i went to another hostel and it was all cool.  also, i am going to check with the aclu if you can bar guests of a certain age.  based on my experience, find another place to stay.

natalie is super nice.. but having to come up with $25 in cash was confusing, as i thought i could pay by card and should have only had $22 left after having paid a $3 deposit online.     all rooms are through-rooms, which means you have to walk through a dorm to either get to another room and/or to the bathroom and/or kitchen. it keeps disturbing people and the already limited privacy becomes an issue. people arriving at all hours (1 am & 5:20 am) did not make it any better.

dear reader,    i stayed at timen's house for 10 days and enjoyed a great stay. michael and natalia are excellent people and helpful. also made some great friends from different parts of the united states and the world.    kind regards,    brian
lovely caring owners and nice room mates. amenities close by and tube station ten mins walk away. would stay again :).
good place to stay. cleaned enough, quite place, good connections to public transports and downtown. take cash to pay the host because the property do not accept credit cards.

not really worth it.     it is clean and has a kitchen and a tv, wifi and a hot shower.   but it is located in a random neighbourhood far away from anything you want to see. there is mainly long term residents rather than travellers. most are nice but there is an old lunatic in the main dorm who will get in ur space. on arrival the owners quizzed us if we had bed bugs which was awkward. they said they accept credit card, but they don't when you get there, so we had to walk to an atm.
bathroom was weird with conjunction on other room. that's not a hostel for travelers, there was actually normal people living there.
hard to understand the hospitality in this house. i was pushed to use their own tumble dryer in order to decontaminate my clothes, obviously under my own cost.

a great location, a walk away from local metro rail red line that stops in hollywood and gets there fast.  a good price with cable tv in all rooms. it is cleaned everyday, friendly staff. i would recommend and will come again.

i would recommend this location for travelers looking to enjoy the la experience while having the convinience of a hostel that feels like home. the timen's were very accommodating and made me feel at home on their property. from check in, i was welcomed by the owners who were very friendly and who accommodated me with a bed that was priced higher than what i had reserved online, just to make me feel at home. the facilities were well kept and offered everything you need for a comfortable stay.

always love staying at the timen's house. its definitely an affordable way to visit hollywood.  also safe, clean, and fun.  the owners live on site and manage the property.  they are both very nice and respectful. the property is cleaned daily and has lockers where you can lock up your items while being out.  its about a 7-10 min walk to the north hollywood red line station.  talk about convince, no need to hassle with ubers or renting a car.  also all residents are super friendly and fun!!!

seriously, this is not a hostel. most people there are locals who lives there. the neighborhood is terrible and not safe and far from anything. the place is really dirty. and the staff, well... there is this couple who manages the place, they are extremely rude and when anything goes just a little different from what they expected they get really angry (i was just asking questions...), very impolite. anyway, stay away from this place, really.

this is a warning, whatever you do, do not stay here!! 1. it's not a safe environment. 2.it's not an actual hostel, it's more a half-way house. locals appear to be living there. 3. the ukrainian couple who own the place are rude/ aggressive. when i checked in she refused to subtract the hworld deposit and still charged me the full rate. 4. i complained and she started shouting/swearing at me. 5. no day storage when ch/out
the staff was really nice and the facilities ar alright. however, it was not really a hostel, there were a couple of people living there. overall an ok hostel.

my stay at the timens house was amazing!  the hostel is located very close to the north hollywood train and bus station which is very convient.  the owners mike and natalie are both very polite and accommodating.  the hostel includes shower, a towel, a kitchen, fridge, tv with many channels (hbo included), bed, and even a pillow! lockerspace is available to secure belongings.  and the people i stayed with are all very friendly and inviting.  there&#39;s no way to beat the value anywhere else!

the timen&#39;s house was a great place to stay. the staff was always friendly and the bedrooms and bathrooms were extremely clean. the timen&#39;s are doing a great job keeping the place clean and safe for their travelers.  the location of the hostel is great, and is walking distance from the subway station and great coffee shops and eateries. the timen&#39;s overall have a great hostel.

great location near to universal studios and metro line however i found the opening hours for check in and questions from 10am to 10pm not very appropriated. staff were friendly however not very flexible or helpful. the place is very clean however blanket was smelling a bit and the place had some maintenance problems.
very bad! don't go
