best hostel ever so nice and clean, friendly and best of all cheap....420 friendly and fun.....quiet....nice guests and staff

i felt insecure in your hostel. i won't recommend it. pple are not travelers they're staying on the long run, this is no hostel. the way the rooms are displayed is really bad. pple are forced to go through other rooms to access theirs or facilities. it's bothersome and feels insecure. lockers in other people's rooms is more than deplorable too. on top of that, there is a bunk bed in the kitchen and only 1 bathroom! show more respect for your guests. plus you "scammed" me 60$, consciously or not.
great value. thanks for your hospitality mike!

it was the worst hostel i have ever been, everything was looking unclean and it has a really bad atmosphere! the first advise that the owner gave to us was how to react if the police approach us and that we shouldn't go out with a knife but use a bottle instead in case of trouble... lol  also the owner's wife was insulting us for no reason, i guess she didn't like the fact that we were from brazil.  we paid but we didn't stay there, we left without asking for our money back.

if you are looking for a cheap place to sleep for the night in hollywood area, you have found it. however, if you are looking for more than that i would not recommend you to bother to book this hostel. make sure you are arrived on time. i meant on time. otherwise the owner would sell your bed to others without notice you. these ukrainian couples could be very mean and showing bad attitudes toward travelers/guests. and you will not meet other travelers as most of people are long-time residence.
the managers were very nice and the hosts also!

nice cozy place. there were no travellers there though. just locals that were on long term stays. anyway, a nice chill atmosphere with friendly people all around. really enjoyed the stay. the neighborhood itself isn&#39;t too great and i wouldn&#39;t advise going around too late into the night. the metro station is fairly close (10-15min walk) and it&#39;s near hollywood so if you wanna tour there it&#39;s a good place to stay. would recommend to others wanting affordable accomodation.

i'll be honest, the only issue is the location. however,  this problem is from the city. la nothing is close, if you rent a car ok, you can find any place just to sleep. otherwise, if you want to use a public transportation or bike, find a place close to santa monica or tourist places.
nice and pleasant stay. good location friendly staff
nice enough place, more of a long term dorm feel to it. lots of pot being smoked. people were okay, though.
convenient location. walkable to metro station and laundromat. thousands of tv channels plus satellite radio in every room. cleaned every afternoon.

natasha and michael were awesome! they are a beautiful ukrainian couple. very friendly and helpful. a girl got her money stolen from a regular guest. so make sure you lock your bags and take your wallet with you everywhere. very good price, and pretty good location, near  a lot of food places. would definitely stay again.v
people are super friendly, very comfortable to live and it's super adorable! recommended!
amazing place
this is not hostel,this is paradise.

i've been to a few hostels and this is by far the worse. in fact its not even a hostel really just a house with as many bunk beds they can cram into a living area (including the kitchen) as they can. we booked for two people and were told after we had paid them that we'd be separated into different areas. people there were nice, owners were nice as well, but overall it was a pretty horrible experience. i wasn't expecting much from a hostel but this was well below expectations. not worth it
the absolute best experience i've had in a hostel! i've never worried about myself or my things, definitely stop by if you're in la!

the owner told us never to leave our belongings out of sight, as the place is full of weirdos hanging out and smoking all day. most of them seemed to be long-term tenants. however, at least the neighborhood seemed safe... timen and his wife are really friendly and welcoming, but alas the place is suffering from bad management. the facilities (including mattress and bedsheets) were really dirty. i would not recommend this hostel, even if you're on a budget.
the place is cheap, but very dirty. the whole estate is weird. all rooms are connected and some people where sleeping in a bunk in the kitchen.

this hostel is horrible!!!!!!!!!  the description on website is nothing match with reality! they are big liar!!!!  and the hostel owner even threaten me for cancellation!!!!!  and the place around the hostel is very very very dangerous!!!!!  if you want to be safe, do not book this hostel, this place the worst experience that i've ever had!!!!!!! i ran away and booked another motel even though the house owner won't let me cancel the reservation, then you can image how bad the situation is.
despite our booking and reservation via hostelworld, we were greeted by a lady only to tell us that there was no such reservation and therefore we had no place to sleep in los angeles.
it is a very good hostel. i would recommend it to anyone that is visiting the area. the owners are very kind and accommodating.

the people who stay here are mostly long timers, not too many travelers.  i had a bunkmate who was having a feud with the landlord when i arrived.  not the vibe i was looking 4. there's a tv in each room, which i don't like.  the rooms are interconnected so even though it says you have a room with 4 beds, there's people from other rooms walking in your "room" since your room could be a living room or the kitchen. i'm surprised they didn't make a closet a room.  as they say, u get what you pay 4.

the service whilest at timens was xtremely good an very loyal an helpful when need be. the only issue was smoking/weed an occasional dis-appearing money an minor things. other was an awesome an relaxing place, close by with plenty in hollywood too do

tv in the room, you cannot sleep well , somebody watch tv in the early morning.  you can not go in , wait out for half hour, no body in the office to open the gate.  no gas to boil water, no microwave.
it was an odd mix of fellow dwellers, with a strange mood in the house.
scary people and didn't live up to the deals we made. tough neighborhood.
great place! mike and his wife run a fun, relaxed, clean, comfortable house...great location, great people! book now, cuz this place is hot!!!
cheapest place we could find - so pretty much as expected. bit lacking in bathrooms and not terribly clean - but absolutely fine if you're just passing through. bit of a hike from the metro.

first of all, this isn't really a hostel, it's simply a house with many bunk beds (including in the kitchen). they willingly leave people to smoke weed in the backyard and none of the doors are ever locked. literally anyone from the street can walk up to your bed without a problem. the bathroom was clean and shower was very nice, but you share this with 12 people. there isn't an option of a check-in past 10pm, so if you arrive late - tough luck! the neighborhood is dodgy! owners are very nice!
when i arrived to the hostel around 10pm, they told be that all the reservation where cancel and the place was full. they didnt let me use internet to find a place.

we booked a dormitory at timen's house for 3 days. we also received a confirmation. at the airport we called from the information centre to this hostel to see how we could get there with public transport. on the telephone we had a person, very rude and very impolite. she said that our booking was cancelled. and that was it. we called again to see what went wrong, to sort it out, with the confirmation number in our hand, but no, no discussion. now were waiting for hostelworld to refund our money.

my stay at the timen house was really awesome!  the owner and his wife are super nice people and the place itself is really chill.  it was a good atmosphere throughout plus it's in a good spot to where you can walk to everything.   they had a beautiful garden full of apple trees and orange trees that we picked and ate fresh!  i really enjoyed the stay, two thumbs up!!

this is my first time staying here, my experience was pleasant. i am a smoker and the owner of the hostel has provided a dedicated smoking area, as well as non smoking areas. the kitchen and bathroom facilities are adequate, and the hosts provide bedding and towels. there are tvs in every room for those who like tv. recommended for other travellers looking for a cheap, quiet place to stay.

timen's house hostel is conveniently located in north hollywood near two trains and several bus routes.  it only took me 15 - 20 min to take the train to the hollywood blvd strip and 30 - 35 min to downtown.  the staff is very friendly and made me feel welcome like if i was at home.  there was no curfew or period of time in which i was required to be out of the facility, unlike some other hostels in the los angeles county area.  i plan on staying here again the next time i visit los angeles.
affordable accommodation near a reasonable walk from north hollywood train station. good hearted owners made me feel welcome and met a number of lovely and interesting guests. louise

good spot walking distance from the north hollywood metro station (a short ride from hollywood) and the noho arts district. the people are friendly, the facilities adequate, with air conditioning, and tvs in every bedroom. overall, a relaxing environment, and a good spot for your stay in la.

this was my best stay in la ever. excellent hostile, very clean environment. very secure. the owners work very hard to keep the riff raff out. everyone here was so nice and polite. fully functioning kitchen. sparkling bathrooms. large new tv's, dish network. fast wifi. if you are going to stay in la, this is definitely the place you want to stay.
bed bugs, stay away from that place.
other than good location, everything seems poor. the first nite i arrive, the 4 bed room was overbooked and i was changed to 10 bed room which was terrible.

nice hosts, but as someone said, it's more a place where they use a part of their house to get backpackers than an hostel. i didn't have a good feeling about this stay but maybe it's me.    pretty clean, just found one cockroach on the kitchen and a another one on the restroom.    so same story, if you are looking for a cheap place, that's work.

there is not much to add than this: the money is invested in all but the hostel. in almos every room there were cockroaches and bugs. the owner seems to be nice, but is a perfidious man, trying to take every dollar out of your pocket that he can. stuff are getting stolen there weekly. so security is a foreign word for them.  all i have to say: try to avoid this hostel. even though it is cheap, it is stil not worth it. there are better alternatives.

i would recommend staying there only if you have hardly any money left for housing. the hostess was very kind and friendly! but i did not liked the host that much, he was a bit rude. furthermore they do mix up the female dorm with man, so future guests if you have a problem with that you should look for something else. also there are some guests there who are staying there for a long time. the floor is old, so if you wake up early other guests complain that you are making to much noise.

a good place in terms of price/place. more like a private place with bed to rent and facilities. it just don't look like a youth hostel so if you want to be in a "traditional" youth hostel this is not the place. but, if you want a cheap bed somewhere in la, with normal convenience and stuff, this is the place.
bedbugs!!!!! my stay was 3 days

i was very pleasantly surprised by how much i enjoyed staying at this hostel. the owners natalie and mike are incredibly kind and generous people. the people that stay there are quite friendly and fun to hang out with. because of the location's proximity to hollywood  there are all sorts of interesting actors
a cool welcome on arrival in the middle of the night, bunk-beds in the kitchen and no living space.
really good stay. the owners have great character too.
wonderful place and people

we lived in this hostel only two days,but was satisfied  with everything.stuff was very nice and friendly(moreover they speak russian and  as we speak too ,it was very comfortable for as). location is really not bad,only 10 min. to get to hollywood.kitchen,bathroom -everything is clean and adequately.

- location did not feel safe, especially at night.   - staff made me feel like i was inconveniencing them, even when asking simple questions.   -room layout poor - you have to pass through another dormitory to get to your own or go to shower/bathroom.  th

we booked a 4 bed dorm for girls only but got put into seperate rooms. 2 of us got put into the kitchen and the other in a room with ladys that lived in the hostel that were fighting all the time. no security facilities available. the location was dodgy and unsafe. i do not reccomend this hostel to anyone.

not so much a travelers hostel as a boarding place. wonderfully friendly and helpful hosts with hard working staff in a home environment. could do with more privacy with the bathroom and shower facilities but it has all the things you need. my stop there was fine for airport and beaches as long as you had a car though traffic in la is probably the worst i experienced in my 5 week road trip. too little public transport in that place to make it fun to experience.
really nice place, everybody friendly. if you need anything, the owners can help you. really cool atmosphere. beautiful place to stay.

very nice couple managing this guest house in north hollywood, they are friendly and always ready when you need them for anything at all. friendly hostel, for those who like animals they even have a cat maggie that comes in from time to time. lovely places, with a warm and friendly atmosphere and good value for money.

there was some difficulties to find the hostel. room wasn't secure at all. we supposed to be in female room... that turns out to be a mix room without any notice. it didn't feel like hostel at all. the location is good only if you willing to visit universal studio or wb studio.

it's not a hostel.. it's just house.. they were selling a bed    it was very dirty toilet and kitchen and so on..     do not recommand.. but cheap..  and if u pay by credit card .. they need extra money...  $5 more..        it was bad experience.. no way....
great hostel   great staffs  great foods  great time to staying there!

i had a great time at timen house. the staff overseen by michael and his wife make the place very comfortable. the facility is clean and people are friendly. the location is close to know public transport and freeways. all the basics of home are there. its a cool place to stay.

this is not regular hostel. it´s more place for people with regular job. during my stay over there i met 90% people who work (or pretend they do) in the city. and it was no sign for hostel. i asked across the street one women where on this street is hostel and she said that here is nothing like it. when i checked the street numbers i found out that i was standing in the front of hostel from opposite site.

staff was friendly. room was clean and absolutely ok and so was the bathroom. security was unfortunately  poor as door isnt locked(nothing got stolen surprisingly though). usually friendly people staying there but awesome price gives you a wide range of individuals. location is pretty good if you buy a metro pass for ony 5dollar/day. price/quality of hostel is awesome, so recommended!
there was very good place to make friend i really enjoyed my stay.
i've been in many hostels, but i would not recommend this hostel

i would recommend timen's house to anyone. the staff are great - very warm and helpful. i felt like i was at home! the location was good in terms of proximity to transport links, food and general conveniences. i felt very comfortable here, and it seemed to attracted really cool people. no complaints.
great hostel and staff, about a 10 min walk to the metro station, very close to hollywood!

timen's house is within easy walking distance of the red line from union station and is easy to find. the area is a bit rough looking but i walked around the area late at night and had no problem (of course use common sense). upon my arrival one of the staff provided me with clean linens for the bed. i found the living areas to be clean and the other visitors were all very personable. i only stayed one night (other plans) but i slept well and would stay again. overall great for a cheap hostel
nothing flash, but it is a good place to sleep in an area where most accomodation is expensive.
very unfriendly and disrespectful roommate!

i was the only one in the entire female only facility. the dorms are all separate from each other. there's no real communal feel. there was a spider in my bed, a moth under my sheets, a spider above my bed and a spider below my bed. i felt unsafe given my dorm was all the way n the back in an area that's completely remote. the door to my building was left open and unlocked. i expressed my concerns to the woman at the front desk who gave me an extremely nasty attitude. do not stay here!
nice quite area. the park next to it provides a nice view to the sea. the private room i got had old side louver windows (rectangular pieces). i could not shut it. it was stuck and broken.
first trip to this hostel.  if you don't have a car it is a little difficult to get to and it is out of the way from local grocery stores.  nice place, too bad it is not open longer.

a little jail-like but fine for a nights stay. very far out from the action which was ok for us given we had a car, but wouldn't recommend if you don't plan in having a vehicle to get around. not a viney hostel, more on the quiet side

i loved the hi south bay! it was exactly what i was looking for - a cosy, quiet spot where i would be able to sleep in the dorm at night without people coming in at all hours. i met some great people, and the views over the bay are spectacular. not for people looking for somewhere close to la or a party hostel and would definitely recommend having a car here as it is about a 20 minute walk to the nearest bus stop.
if you're looking for a relaxed hostel that's cheap and near a beach this is for you.    if your looking for a party hostel and to meet and drink with new people, this is not for you.
spectacular views, best value, nice people and atmosphere
not for the youth.
fantastic    what a lovely place to stay it should be open year-round

we regret a lot to have stayed there. it was not telling the truth in its introductions - no wifi in the dorm room, only in the lounge at rather low speed. it takes you at least 20 min walk to eat anything, if you don't drive, not even a 7-11 around you. i tried to save money by living there, but it cost me over 100$ with uber since the place is so far from anywhere to visit, no public transpotation nearby. more to tell just no space. don't come.
clean, cost efficient, near to bus facilities to take you downtown la and located next to nice views and cabrillo beach.
i had a great stay. thank you

that was my best accommodation ever. the view was spectacular and breathtaking, beautiful place. it doesn't matter that the hostel is far from the city center because of the view. the rooms were super clean and the staff was really nice, just like the people who stay there. the breakfast was self serviced pancake mix, toasts and oats. i highly recommend this place for everyone. it was really friendly.
just a great  experience. thank you so much
fun hostel with a great view, awesome staff and wicked spaghetti nights!
it was our first time staying at a hostel.  everything and everyone was amazing.  the view was fantastic.   we would stay again!  thanks

the furnisher is old and unpleasant. my bed was hard as if i was sleeping on a table, covered with a thin matratc top.  there is no dishwasher. when each person washes its own plate more water will be wasted than by using a dishwasher. some guests just put dirty plates in the sink and leave the kitchen a mess.  internet is very weak and only to use in the common room, often breaks up.  sink in bathroom +wc old with build-up of dirt.  door to room a only to open with strong kick  poor breakfast ...

the view from this location is amazing! a car is definitely a must if you're going to be staying here as this will facilitate moving around the area. i only stayed there for one night, but from what i was able to capture, it's a magnificent place near the la region where one can totally zen out and relax. would definitely stay here again! =)

not in a great location at all and dorms have few facilities considering over 20 people share 2 toilets. is in a beautiful spot however so come here if you want a quiet few days away from the hustle and bustle of la
there wasn't too much to do around this area, but the place was clean for a hostel and the staff was very friendly. great for a 1-2 night stay!

was told that i had to pay an extra 3 dollars per night because i didn't have a hostelling international card, wouldn't have stayed here if i'd known that. they changed bed sheets but the floor was never cleaned, pretty much covered in sand the whole time. i wouldn't recommend staying here if you're planning on exploring la tourist hot spots because it's veeery far away and not any cheaper than other good options.
staff was very helpful and nice. the location is not very ideal. pretty far away from the la people want to see. but it was a quiet affordable place to stay
the staff was friendly. the surrounding was not the best! it was trash bags stacked up outside the building. the parking was very limited. however it was cost efficient.

the view is stunning, beds are clean, rooms are small. there is only one shower for all the rooms, but it was not ever occupied when i needed it. overall was a nice experience, but i could hear everything going on in the hall ways. the doors had a space underneath them that allowed for sound to travel. however, most people were in bed and sleeping by 10pm so it was not a big deal.
mubfirst time in a hostel was a pleasant one. comfortable room, kitchen for cooking, and laundry services were awesome. highly recommend this place!
great experience! first time staying at a hostel, and i&#39;m so glad i gave it a try.
chill hostel with pretty location but very far from the la you&#39;ll want to see as a tourist. an uber to venice beach will cost around $40.
no wifi in dorms - only the main building which is far from the dorms.
great place to stay. the park behind the hostel has an amazing view!

myself and two friends stayed here and didn&#39;t really look into the location before booking. it was very cheap and basically you pay for what you get. if you are planning on the la setting close to tourist attractions and in general close to anything do not stay here. it is a good hour out of the city and inconvenient. if you have a car this might have been easier. very different from the hi hostels that we have stayed in on the east coast

we have been to heaps of hi hostels and all were rad. this place is not friendly, warm or in a good spot. only good points are it's cheap, there's a decent kitchen and a tv room. there's no vibe and nothing to do in the area. note: you will need a car to get to shops/bars whatever. there's nothing close at all. the staff were ok, one of them just spent the whole time on the phone looking for other jobs. mattresses were really uncomfortable. also you can't drink... period :(
helpful and friendly staff but not the ideal location and some of the guests were a bit weird

i haven&#39;t felt this peace and relax since many years ago, i&#39;m very lazy but this hostel made me recover my self, i even went to run in the morning. however, if you are planning to party and meet people, this is not your place, this hostel is like a summer camp for people who want to relax, it&#39;s located in a beautiful cliff with an amazing view to the ocean. staff is unbelievable nice, beside a nice breakfast there is also free food (sometimes), just help your self. very clean and 100% amenities

the location is bad if you don&#39;t have your own car (if you want connection with los angeles). you can walk around for 2-3 days, check the beach and the pacific coast.  there were many bad guests in the hostel: very noisy at night, sitting on the sink (most likely druged) etc.  two roommates didn&#39;t care to be extremly noisy at 7 am, one even agressive.

staff were warm and helpful, really appreciated the free pancake breakfast. facilities are clean and well maintained. had an amazing view out to the water.    cons i guess would be that the wi-fi can&#39;t reach the women&#39;s dorm, so we could only really check the internet in the common building. also there weren&#39;t many people around interested in chatting and making friends, but i guess that&#39;s not the hostels fault.    overall, lovely clean hostel that i&#39;d recommend to people wanting a chill
amazing place, shame about the slow bus and giant hill, but worth it!

staff was friendlier than most hostels. everything was clean for the most part. most other guests polite. only thing that sucks was they had a plumbing issue the morning i was heading out, but they sent maintenance to fix it quickly. great spot by cabrillo beach.

it was very clean and the staff was very helpful and was willing to change reservation mistake i made online. the kitchen was better than you would find at any hotel with real clean utensils. my only small quibble is that the front desk did not give out info on hostels for someone who hasn&#39;t been to one right away, but that&#39;should not a huge deal. i recommend it.

this is an out-of-the-way hostel that was very quiet - good for introverts, not so much for partiers. it was perfect for me as a transit point to/from catalina island.  there&#39;s a nice park with great views nearby. there were only a handful of other travellers staying at the place, which made me worry a bit about security since the park next door has some sketchy people around.  free breakfast was good.  i&#39;d stay here again.
if you want to visit la, venice, santa monica, then it's far way (2 hrs to la downtown). good just if you want to relax out of the city. accommodation is decent and staff friendly.

great place to relax! bit out of the way if your wanting to explore la tho. staff were really friendly! dorm rooms were clean and the free parking was good they shut a gate and a security guy drives laps around the park all night so if you&#39;ve got a vehicle it&#39;s pretty safe! met some nice people there! also some nights they put on a dinner for a small donation and the free breakky was great!

the way they promoted this place was misleading. san pedro is next to the ocean, but the hostel itself is quite far away from the water.e it is an old military style barrack. sounds cool, but wifi was only accessible from the main area and there was only 1 bathroom per barrack (which has 30 beds). they also advertise nightlife entertainment but do not allow alcohol in the hostel (not said in their description). good for families and quiet groups, not for others though. overall i'm disappointed.
it's out of the way.. it's clean and comfortable.

bathrooms should have locks on doors. a couple walked in on me while i was showering.  should be more showers as it took a long time to get one at times. we only used hot water tap.   so both hot and cold water taps would be better if they were working.

my stay here was a very good arrangement as i was there for just a couple of days to getaway. everyone was friendly and helpful. although there was an overall consensus  about a large group of french teens that were too noisy and very loud at night and early morning. besides this factor my stay was pleasant.
this was my first time staying in a hostel and loved it! my girl and i were transferring to california and needed a place to stay until our home was available.

my pro's: friendly, upbeat, welcoming front desk staff     my con's: location very from los angeles on the metro and difficult too arrive too by metro.                  very dark and inadequately lighted area after sunset.                   thieves, thieves ate my food the night before departing and the person had no consideration to open my package food and leave it in the cabinet with there nasty fingers on it.                    upon my 2 night my bed was occupied had to sleep in the library
great hostel, the staff were really friendly and helpful. only thing is it was far away from downtown la. the bus to the hostel runs infrequently. everything else was great.

staff upon check in made me feel like i had significantly inconvenienced her and interrupted her day. location is quite remote but once you arrive there is a beach and a grossery store withing walking distance. on the whole, a nice stay!
this hostel is really lovely, it's just extremely far from central la. staff were great.
nice place stay a from chaos of la

perhaps it's because the us isn't geared towards backpacking, but it found it dreary and old, averagely maintained, and way out in the 'burbs away from any form of shops, including decent supermakets, restaurants, etc.  probably wouldn't stay here again.
very friendly staff....amazing location overseeing the ocean. the food was great due to the holiday - breakfast options are good.

a lovely place in a nice neighborhood. the staff are friendly and helpful, the common areas and rooms were clean and the view is pretty! the location is not so good, but nothing that can't be solved if you have a car or don't mind taking the bus.
hostel is nice/ employees are friendly / location is horrible/ tool me 3 h to go there from union station

if you're looking for a busy party place that shouldn't be your first choice, but if you want to have a chilled and relaxed time this hostel is perfect! guests and staff are very friendly, can't complain about my stay, really enjoyed it! only, if you drive, you should get a car during your stay...
nice and quiet and peaceful which is what i was looking for.  i stayed here last year also.  it was a welcome respite from the traffic and throngs of people in la.

this hostel is in a lovely area, on a hill overlooking the pacific. however, there are no local facilities so you will be entirely reliant on buses/cycles/car to get around. everything was nice enough, but nothing special either. clearly one for those that want some quiet time rather than a party as you won't find one here. also, the wifi was intermittent during my stay and cod only be accessed in the main reception/kitchen and not in the seperate accommodation buildings; a major frustration!

a great hostel if you have a car (which is much more important for la than any other big city).  my window overlooked the friendship bell and the ocean!   quiet place to sleep, clean rooms and sheets, clean bathroom.  highly recommended.
this is a great hostel in a good location. clean and quiet. along way from hollywood, venice etc, so you need a car.  there is a deli and cafe near by but a supermarket is several miles away

if you have a car, this location is ok! about 30min from la downtown. we felt a bit like on a scouting camp because of the building!   for european norms this is quite expensive and the wifi is not that good.

for the price, this was a pretty nice hostel. i've never stayed in one that was so open. it's 32 bunks all in the same room. there are no doors between the beds and the lobby, so i expected it to be pretty noisy at night. they do a great job of implementing quiet hours though so it turned out not to be a problem. they also have earplugs which was really nice. you get a towel to use during the stay. only bad thing i'd say is the bathroom.. mold on shower doors was pretty gross.

i booked a 6mix dorm. but there were only 3bed! (no dorm. no room. just have 3bed. like a studio) in addition they've got a double booking!! so staff said, "you can use the bed only first day. a rest of day you have to use a folding cot. and if you want to cancel, you'll do it." at that time, i was very confused. and then that was about 7:30pm! so i had to find another hostel... it's too awful!!!
cool hostel in great location, good facilities and a great guy in charge. very small and very quiet though.
it's the coolest hostel i have ever stayed
not a usual hostel. like a big room workshop and sleeping area by night.
i'd highly recommend staying in podshare. place was really nice and accessible, location is just a 10 min walk from the metro.

this is probably the worst hostel you will have ever been to. granted the overall quality of hostels in the united states is significantly lower than the rest of the world, you will feel disgusting after staying here. did i mention it's next to impossible find?

pros: the place looks cool, the top bunk provides some privacy, there is communal food, the pods have a personal powerstrip, the staff is nice. cons: the picture shows multiple pods, but there are only two pods, a loft, and three roll out cots in 1 big room at cosmo st, only one bathroom, the door to the street stays open until 10, the pods are next to that door so its hard to get comfy before 10, there was only a tv in the top pod and netflix wasn&#39;t hooked up as stated, & bottom bunk had no tv.

super small hostel, 6 or 7 beds, but very well located. everything is new and everything is in a single space: beds, kitchen, reception, dinning room... i booked a pod, but i stayed on a rolling bed that is set at 10pm and is removed at 1030 am (they only charged me $30). not for people that are looking for privacy. large dining tables and good wifi that are perfec for working on your labtop.
awesome stay, staff is awesome it couldn&#39;t have been any better

the place was nice and chill, and the location is good for people who wants to stay in downtown la.  the only downside i can think of is that considering the way the room and the beds are set up.. i just think $50 is a bit overpriced.

excellent location and the staff are great.  especially that girl from new zealand who's name escapes me!  the only thing i wasn't impressed with was the approximate 30% extra i was required to pay which i was told is city tax.  surely this could be made clear from the start.  so i payed usd40 instead of the usd30 hostel world told me i needed to pay on arrival.
i loved my stay at podshare chill atmosphere and friendly staff who recomend some great places to eat

our group of four european college exchange students stayed just one night at podshare but really want to come back when in la next time. the staff was really nice, welcoming and service-minded. the entire place had a very fresh, youthful vibe to it and there was a clever technical solution for everything from payments to giving information on who is in each "pod". the pods where very cosy and comfortable! location and standard pushes up the price a bit, but definitely worth it!
overall a good experience! location was great!
they only problem with podshare is that it only has one toilet for ten guests.

podshare is in a great location in central hollywood, just around the corner from hollywood boulevard. the hostel itself is a pretty cool idea; in your 'pod' you have everything you might need - plugs, headphones, tv, lamp etc and then you share food/ books etc. the only negative is there is only one bathroom. the best bit about podshare is definitely the staff - the owner elvira was really welcoming and full of useful tips on where to go and what to see. i would definitely recommend a stay!
absolutely loved staying here! great way to meet new people! staff were amazing, excellent location. i could not recommend it enough, would stay here again in a heart beat!
good location, good service, quite average rooms and ok people.

i am very sorry to leave a negative review because it was truly a mismatch of expectation.   the location and staff were fine. it took only like 10 mins walk from metro, and the staff were nice enough to talk to.  but, it looked totally different from online advertisement, and the place we stayed was actually a staff accommodation area. the hostelworld indicated 24 hours for cancellation policy, yet podshare said it would be 48 hours on their side. pretty disappointed out of this confusion.

podshare is an incredible experience that i wholeheartedly recommend. the staff are extremely friendly and go out of their way to make sure your stay in la is as good as it can be. the location is also fantastic and the facilities are among the best i have experienced.

staying at podshare was my first ever experience at a backpackers anywhere in the world and i'm normally more of the 'hotel' type on vacation. so i have no means for comparison however i certainly enjoyed my stay there and would definitely recommend it for any single travelers or anyone looking for something a bit cheaper than a hotel. from what i know/have heard about other backpackers, podshare is very different but in a good way. would recommend to anyone who asked and a great host!!

a great concept. the location was fantastic and the staff very friendly. the facilities were generally good with things like hair straightners, shampoo, computers, tv, wifi etc. there were plenty of cereals for breakfast. the pods were very comfy though inevitably it wasn't the quietest place to sleep. my only qualm would be the bathroom. on the night i stayed there were two extra people sleeping on roll out beds on the floor which meant 10 people for one bathroom (combined shower and toilet).

we have stayed in hostels worldwide and this has to be one of the worst! multiple issues with this hostel that includes; the whole of the window isn't covered by curtain, so very bright, very early, the pods/bathroom/kitchen aren't separate rooms so you can hear everybody's everything, include the idiots who showered every night at 4am- thanks for that, not!, and the staff couldn't have more lack of info of the area if they tried. it is also in an area that feels unsafe.

even tho i didn't spend much time at the hostel, the manager and her staff were extremely polite and inviting. location is a less than 5 min walk from the metro station. abundant restaurants, shopping, tourist attractions nearby. bed was very comfortable and the fact they're not bunk beds makes it more convenient! there are power outlets located everywhere in the building! again didn't spend much time to take full advantage of the place but i'm definitely coming back the next time i stay in la!

amazing facilities! the hostel can be whatever you make it to be, whether you want to make new friends or just to relax by yourself in your amazing pod! the staff were all exceptionally friendly, and fantastic free amenities like wifi, bathroom products, tea/coffee, fruit made the higher price worth it. i stayed there when i had one night in la by myself, which was a perfect choice, but it's not a party hostel whatsoever, nor do they run nightly events.

nice place, people and concept, but they must take care about facilities mantainance. my reading light was broken and the same for the tv of another pod. wi-fi is included but poor quality almost impossible to get connect to the internet.

wonderful location, staff and concept. love the spacious pods with their inbuilt tv's, and basically all that's been done with the limited space (only 10 pods on this unit). good kitchen, bathroom, computer facilities etc. would love to see cleaner bathrooms (although still clean) and i think the guests need to do what's required to clean up after they're done. very upbeat atmosphere with the aspiring actors etc.
the staff was extremely nice and i really can't think of anything i didn't like about this place. the best "hostel" i've seen so far.
highly recommended. good location. staff nice and helpful.   would add access to second bathroom if possible.
really friendly staff, great atmosphere and great location. i'll be coming back.

i have stayed in many hostels throughout europe and north america. in a typical hostel, you have rooms for people to sleep in and a separate common area. that's not the case at the podshare as it is open concept. last night, they had karaoke so i had to deal with extremely loud music and drunk people badly singing until well after midnight. again, you can hear everything from the common area from your bunk as it is open concept.     i was booked in for three nights but left after the first night. the other
perfect for a peaceful stay. no need for any other words.
not enough bathroom facilities. security a bit suspect. location right by walk of fame and metro line. private pods with tv services included.

a very fun and interesting place to stay! a bit more attention needs to be paid to cleaning the pods between occupants--spray & wipe walls, railings and shelves, and vacuum around the mattresses. the sheets, blankets and towels were fresh & clean, as is the rest of the place. it can get a bit noisy some nights, but they supply earplugs which takes care of that issue for those people who need to get up early. friendly & helpful staff makes podshare a great place to stay, and i miss being there!

great place to wind down at, has all the amenities for techies, and i loved it! only issue for me was the door being open a lot and the staff at the door would step away from time to time leaving it unguarded. it wouldn't bother me normally, but the area was downtown hollywood and not on a great looking street. if youre looking for a great place with all the amenities you would get at a nice hotel then definitely stay here. fun vibe, great friendly staff, and right in thick of hollywood!

great place to stay in central hollywood, not far from capitol records tower. unique vibe with individual pods rather than bunks. larger / more luxurious than standard bunks, with added extras like personal tvs, power, etc. all 10 pods are in one large area, although everyone seems to keep quiet at night so it's actually chilled and peaceful most of the time. could do with more bathrooms as there is only one on the ground floor and one on another floor. clean and staff were great! recommended!

great stay with great people! podshare really go out of their way to make you feel welcome!  i thoroughly recommend staying here for the staff & the type of accommodation it's the best there is.... bar none!  5 stars
awesome place to stay. staff members are very nice. place is normally clean. wifi is reliable. very friendly fun atmosphere.

love this place! can see how it is not for everyone, the pods are open ended so there is not as much privacy as some people might like. despite this i found them quite intimate, i'd recommend asking for a pod on the second floor as the height gives you a little more privacy. awesome staff, great location if you're after hollywood. cool vibe, cool kitchen, great shared bathroom. i'll be here again #podlove.

not your regular hostel! at first we were shocked at the open style of the pods and the intimate nature of the hostel but this is what makes it so special. as there is only space for 10 people you feel like you are part of an exclusive club. the staff are completely awesome and played a big part in making our trip. the beds were comfy

stayed a couple of nights in la at podshare. amazing, best hostel i have ever seen. get your own pod with power, tv, free wifi etc etc. the small amount of people staying there means you get to know them really well and make some friends to explore the city.    hollywood itself i didnt like, but staying here made it awesome. helpful staff, cool people, safe area 5/5.

totally thought podshare was a complete scam at first but turned out to be the best 5 days in la. so convenient to majorsights and attractions, but believe me that didn't matter as much as the people you meet at the pod!
nice people, great hostel.... good location.
i was only there for one night... wish i had of stayed longer. everyone is so friendly. close to everything... had an amazing time apart from the cinnamon challenge. thanks guys!

the location of podshare was great.  the staff were great and friendly. the actual pods were nice too.  so there were two main issues that i had with podshare.  the first issue was on my last night there, other podestrians were drinking and partying while i as trying to get to sleep.  podshare needs a quiet time that beings from midnight at minimum.  secondly, one toilet and shower was not enough especially in the morning when everyone need to relieve themselves.

this is a really interesting and conceptual hostel. nothing i would expect to see regularly in the usa. awesome social vibes and cool community feel. the staff were amazing and make you feel like more than just a guest passing through. you can feel the friendliness in the pod-air. the pod set up is really cool and original as well as confortable and the location can't be beat - smack dab in west hollywood. i gave up a free room in a mansion in the hollywood hills to come back and stay here. go!
had a great experience sleeping in the pods. i diffidently recommend staying here as it is a lot different from regular hostels..an the staff are really friendly and helpful....
very good place in a good location, and a very friendly staff.

absolutely loved podshare. definitely reccommend it for anybody who wants to stay right where all the action is happening in hollywood. the staff were beyond friendly, and didn't mind us partying and having a good time. nothing but good things to say about this hostel.

my friends and i had an amazing stay at podshare. by far the best hostel any of us have stayed at, being there was a highlight of our trip. the staff quickly became friends and we loved all the travellers we met!

the staff here is so amazing and makes you feel like family immediately! such a good vibe from everyone who worked and stayed there. you don't need to worry about bringing anything except for clothes and a toothbrush! you are given everything you need. if you want to party and have a good time then i definitely recommend podshare !!!

was an amazing experience at podshare, can't wait to stay here again in the future. your pods have everything needed and the staff make you feel welcome and safe while in the building, also the location is great being so close to hollywood blvd. they offer a podcar transport to airport usually but was able to get a ride to six flags magic mountain for the day, had the best time and would like to thankyou again for that.

a social experiment with a physical address!  i can't speak highly enough of podshare and the podshare staff; elvina, jen, kyle and mykee. i thoroughly enjoyed my stay here. i stayed four nights in total at podshare. 3 + 1 night before flying out from lax.  the facilities were great. the podestrians (other guests) were all fabulous. i found that the average podestrian was well educated, left of centre, adventurous and funny. i had no issues with security here and just love this place. ill b bak!
very friendly and supportive staff/owners at a perfect location. the place is a little small and could in my opinion increase security measures. all in all a great place to stay in la.
fun fun fun i love it worth the money and they have netflix in your pod oh yeah

extraordinary hostel with nice helpful staff. the hostel simple consists out of a sleeping area, lounge, kitchen and bathroom, so don't expect any privacy. there were also more people sleeping in podshare (on air mattresses) than there were pods. but if you'r fine with that (like me) you will like it!
it was good but there was so many ppl for one bathroom. besides that, the place is very clean n the dorms are really nice.

our stay at podshare was a game of two halves.  the night we arrived elvina (the owner) was away and the staff she had left in charge used the opportunity to party in the dorm with some guests, drinking and playing music well into the   early hours. had we only been staying this night i would have written the place off, however the next night elvina returned and everything was great.

i have been staying in hostels for a decade now and i have to say that podshare has the best atmosphere of any hostel that i have ever stayed in.   i immediately felt a sense of community with the other guests and staff.  they have the most friendly and helpful staff that i have ever seen at a hostel.  the location is very nice too, located close to the redline subway and lots of restaurants and other stores.   i highly recommend this hostel!
the place was absolutly brilliant, only problem was there is no telephone so had to walk to a street phone but overall definate 9/10!! will deffo go back! :-d

the location is good. it's just next to hollywood blvd. and close to sunset blvd. there is a good restaurant one block away, called kitchen 24. the facities are also very good. however, what's not so good is that one night, one staff was chatting with friend at midnight and due to the noise i couldn't go to sleep until 3 am.

the people here are nice and talkativeness. they offer me lots of information about the area ,also the owner brought us to a yogurt ice cream shop which are really tasty! besides, the hostel is not just a hostel but almost like a small house, you just share the space, the kitchen and the bathroom with others. in short, this is the best hostel that i ever seen so far.
podshare easily best hostel experience ive had to date  didn't take long to feel right at home, elvina is doing some serious things there  ill be back soon

this was the greatest hostel! i had no real desire to go to hollywood but went because this place looked so cool and it definitely exceeded expectations. i wish there were more podshare's in the world.
best hostel i ever stayed in!! elvina is very helpful and chilled! would absolutely recommend it!!!
had a fab stay, one of the best places i have stayed in.  would recommend highly!!!  thanks again
great hostel with personal atmosphere!

great location in w.hollywood, close to hollywood boulevard and runyon canyon just to name a few. close to cool bars/restaurants. it is clean, security is safe. has a college chill vibe with organised parties/social events (there is fair warning from the manager about this, so it isn’t private and quiet all the time). the manager/staff are hospitable and helpful – trust, they know what’s good in la. i asked about a late night spot for ice cream, they advised a real good spot. affordable price!!

i had an awesome time there!  i was doing an epic 56 hours of travel to get back to new zealand from colombia, and podshare  was an awesome place to chill in between the madness of flights i had.  the owner is super friendly and helpful, and all the peps staying there were really chilled as well.  just a really mint place to stay!

definitely the best place i've stayed in the us, or anywhere for that matter. everything about it is unique, from the networked tvs to the amazing host elvina. podshare's philosophy of getting a 'full experience', not just a bed, is right on the money. it has some real character and charm not found anywhere else. i hung out several times with the other guests, and made some real friends who i'll definitely be staying in touch with. as the former governator would say... i'll be back.
the owner is very friendly and really enjoy the atmosphere! i loved the concept of podshare and will recommend for everyone!
podshare is a new and great way to hosteling.  couldn't have asked for a better place to stay in la.

i really want to recommend the podshare! it was amazing. i had everything i needed, elvina helped me out with everything, and always went the extra mile! i am definately coming back. needless to say the location is perfect, just around the corner from the walk of fame, bus stops and metro station. i couldn't ask for more! natalia.
very nice place! i want to return some day.

podshare is not just a hostel. the amenities are clean and more than what a 'hostel' offers.  it is a home away from home. this is hollywood's hidden secret! great location, value for money and a great way to meet new people. if you missed out on dorm life in college, this is your chance to relive it.

facility info lists shuttle and availability of 4 beds ensuite. neither is true, management knows and refuses to correct their ad. i had to spend an extra $45 in transportation - had i known, i would have chosen the other hostel that did have shuttle service. room was clean but, after adding in the extra $45 and having to sleep 1 mom with 3 teenaged boys in 2 beds - no way!
the light went on every hour during the night. i turned it off every time but it went automatically on again!  furthermore you can hear the street and everyone walking around.
the place is quite run down and the area it's in is quite bad. the only plus is that it's close to the airport.
a last minute one night stop off after a long flight. close to the airport, huge room and amazing comfortable bed! quite pricey but was last minute

be prepared to pay a $50.00 key deposit.  i was told that was mandatory to stay there.  the next morning, the next clerk said i did not pay the deposit so there was nothing to return.  i showed him my receipt for the deposit and he paid it back.  i was really confused, if it was mandatory for me to pay a $50.00 key deposit, why wouldn't the morning desk person know, that of course i paid it, it was mandatory?  really weird!  bathroom tub and toilet - stained but clean.

for the value of the place (and the proximity to lax) the place was a good value.     i had a issue with the check in, charging me $100 extra (and telling me when i check out i will be refunded) i've never had that happen before.    also the hotel room had a weird smell in the room.      pros:  close to lax  free juice and dougnuts in the am    cons: weird billing charges  weird hotel room smell

overall okay.   cons: old and outdated rooms with very little charme, noisy (main street, airport nearby and poorly constructed windows); breakfast not worth mentioning   pros: close to lax, free wifi and free parking, food options nearby
we had a large double room. very clean, quiet and good value for money. as we had a very early flight fro lax the owner was very obliging and put the breakfast out early.
we've cancelled the stay and although the payment was to be made upon arival, we were charged nonetheless. we will fill a visa chargback. have fun with them!
super friendly staff!!! big room, clean, close to airport, good bus connection to santa monica etc.

the wifi didn't work in our room. the hotel is close to the airport which is why we stayed there, it was clean although we could hear arguments in other rooms which made it a bit of a scary place to stay. i'd recommend going elsewhere if you can afford it.

not a very interesting area to stay except for being sort of close to the airport (still an hour walk away). my room was clean and comfortable, and the bathroom was huge! my biggest complaint is that the airport shuttle i asked for at the front desk never showed up.
location is not quite good but it is a nice place to stay if u choose sightseeing in downtown cause the staff can provide useful information.

bedrooms are ok and relatively clean. the noise of airplanes which are passing is at an acceptable level. breakfast was very poor, just a table with a coffee machine and a toaster (but no bread). the breakfast room has the size of a small kitchen were no tables are provided. i guess you are supposed to go back to the hotel room after collecting the food. parking lot gave the impression that it functioned as meeting point of the underworld, especially after sunset.
bag snatching event (not anyone i know, just witnessed it) whilst getting dinner sorta put a downer on the stay.
this was an ok place to stay     miles away from anywhere buy close to lax

rooms were clean and ok. it´s like a motel and not like a hostel, but for a short stay ok. can´t tell anything about breakfast, but theres only breakfast from 7.30 pm to 9 pm and no information about this by check in or somewhere else.

do not expect anything from breakfast, which was only really bad-tasted lemonade, some pre-pack dough and a apple. so very bad for a hotel. furthermore very close to the airport (compared to the rest of la). within 45 - 60 min with public transportation, what only costs $1.50  good place when traveling on low budget to get some rest from the flight.
lots of noise at night.
there was no continental breakfast as promised on the website, only some sweet stuff.
horrible place, the hostel is in the middle of nowhere, horrible staff who don't help you, there is a hostel in front of this that is awesome. i would never recommend this hostel
we were quite happy with the service and the price. it was handy to the airport which was really all we needed.

they had everything we needed. hairdryer, wifi and a fridge. the room was very clean and the bathroom was huge. everything worked, nothing was broken or demaged. the breakfast was nice. tea, coffee, pancakes, donugts, bread, orange juice and so on. really nice :)  i would visit it again

good location near the airport. there is a bus right outside that takes you to and from the airport, so you dont need the expensive shuttle.  the location is quite scary som dont go out after dark, and the breakfast is a muffin and coffee. but if youre just looking for a place to stay before you head to the airport, this one is fine.

i had to pay more than it said on the email, the woman in the reception was rather unfriendly. the door could not be locked with with an extra lock,most motels have an extra lock inside.it was very loud and the pillows were smelling sweat  .the showerhead was broken.i will never chose that hostel again!/

it is a very classic motel, not so close to the airport.  shuttle to airport is expensive and not included.  staff refused to cancel the included breakfast, so we paid for it but didnt enjoy it because our flight was too early in the morning.
the staff was nice, the room was ok although we felt it was a bit expensive. the area didnt seem safe.

the female staffer nice. the man, nice but horrible.  i called 2 weeks before my vaca and shared my flight came in at midnight. i was told there was around the clock check in. i arrived in la and had a major hold up with my rental car. called around 1:45am i was still coming-  the man told me it was too late for me to check in unless i wanted to pay xtra and leave at 7am? i had no where to go.  i sat in a denny's. finally 5am i drove there. a nice woman checkin out gave me her room until morning

the worst thing is that the room smelled someting strange (old??).the security was not enough for this area, and i felt scary and noisy to open the window.even if i asked the front desk how to get to downtown etc, they did not provide information about the bus transit at all. i will not stay there again.

we were really happy with the room. a 15 or 20 minute bus ride from the airport (it's on a public bus route), the room had good heat / air conditioning, the water was hot, the bed was comfortable. we would stay here again... highly recommended.
near airport, not so expensive, everything was ok
its a typical motel for amerika
very satisfied with the room
it will be nice if they let people to chek out little later if they flights are not until late afternoon.
it's great.

i chose this hotel for its nearness to the airport. having just return from a month in thailand, and having stayed in some pretty basic accommodation, i still felt like this place was worse than anyplace i had stayed abroad. it's the kind of place where you have to check the room for bed bugs. all in all, it did the job. but spend the extra 20 dollars and stay somewhere better.
cheap and clean hostel near airport lax, ideal if you need to be quickly to airport, but a little far from touristic places in la.

if you want to go on budget and you do not pretend too much, this place is ok. quite clean, breakfast poor but ok and secure place. but be aware, the place is far away from the downtown (at least 1.5/2 hours by car) and this means that if you do not have a car or you do not like to drive in crazy freeway go somewhere else.

i knew this hotel would be bad when i walked in and the concierge sat behind bullet proof glass. this motel is in a sketchy neighborhood. there are no good grocery stores in the immediate vicinity. the room was dirty. it did not have a blow dryer or a coffee maker. the tub had a brown residue on the bottom. i had to shower with flip flops on. i asked for a non-smoking room and got a smoking room. my clothing reeked the next day.
an extremely nice room for a very good price!!!

if you just need a place to rest while you wait for a connecting flight or just need to get into the time zone, i thought this place was good.  the bed was comfy, the staff picked us up in the shuttle for $5 per person, then because we were too early for check in time, we left our bags and the guy dropped us off at a nearby shopping centre which i thought was nice.    i would recommend this place if you're on a budget.

in my affirmation i should pay less than the man told me at the reception. that was a strange beginning. the room was big, but not nice. the window had a hole and it was sooooo noisy. we slept with oropax and we woke up so often. we had a ugly spider at the ceiling.... if you clean the room of your guests, please kill the spiders!!!

good place to stay if you are just stopping over, not really a hostel just a cheap motel. was pretty clean and the beds we comfortable but the shower was one of the worst i have ever used. pretty scary area. good value for the money only would reccommend for a stop over.

i asked for more towels but the guy said that they don´t have any more. what?? you are a hotel and you don´t have any more towels!? when we came back from dinner we recognized that someone was in our room and took one of the towels which were already in the room. just barefaced and rude!!

i only went here for one night. the rooms are big and very comfortable but it is quite expensive for a backpacker and the location is not good, took at least an hour to get to downtown la by bus. good if you land in la late and are travelling early the next morning, the hotel is located very close to the airport!

it's a cheap hotel, not a hostel, so if you're backpacking and you want to meet people, this would not be the place for you. also, it's not in a very safe area and there are constant sirens along the street. stay here if you have a car and are just passing through.
stayed here because it was very close to lax airport. if not probably wouldn't stay here again.
nice place

- helpful owner!   - near metro station, but somewhat far from downtown. however the supermarket (food4less) and cheap fast food places are near the motel.   - really cheap (especially if you travel in a group of four)  - overall clean  - unfortunately no
good staff who were helpful.
not bad place to stay but location is questionable.  i do recommend staying there overall i was satisfied with my stay.

location is super close to compton and overall not the nicest area to stay in los angeles, but the staff is friendly and accommodating and made sure we had all we needed. 4 people for $70 a night is very cheap. i was comforted by seeing nicer vehicles parked in the parking lot so we were not alone in wanting cheap travel endeavors
a very convenient place to stay for several days while visiting lis angeles, beaches & orange county. close to freeway & metro station. staff cheerful, accommodating & helpful.
the staff we very accommodating with a a change of booking, late check in and late check out. would have been really nice to have a kettle but happy with the microwave and fridge.

a nice motel, but lynwood didn't feel like the safest place to stay. quite far from the tourist destinations and it would be best to have a car if you stay here as the trains are a bit of a hassle. the staff are friendly and helpful.

nice clean room with everything that one needs. quiet even though we expected a loud night with some surprises. close to the metro stop and restaurants. wifi worked great! ceiling window at night during shower was somewhat creepy. felt like someone was watching.

the location is near from the metro station and it's just one line (green line) to the airport. it's very easy to travel everywhere from here. restaurants and food are available near the motel too. i love staying here.
closed to train metro by walking around 5 minutes
staying in mission motel on my first night in los angeles was a great experience. the room was clean enough and quite spacious. wifi connection was excellent too. it was really worth the money.

my experience was really good, i have been other hostels-kind in la before, so i wasn't expecting too much. i had the private room and it's pretty nice, the room is very clean, bathroom works perfect, wifi working good (also this wifi works in different parts of la), and i even had a microwave and fridge.  the owner might look serious but he is really kind and helped me a lot.
the owner is great! helped us a lot!
great price, evwn there is a digital safe in the room, the room is far better than best value inn(given the good price), andy is very friendly, the bed is great! beautiful surrounding
wifi should be upgraded, more pillows in beds.
it is a nice motel with excellent location, mrt green line from air port direct to motel with in 5 minute walking distance, bed sheets are very clean.
the receptionist was very friendly and made us feel very welcome. the motel was well maintained and we had an enjoyable stay.
had a string of prostitutes using the room next door, didn't get much sleep :(
its a quiet place, but far away from everything, if you drive its not a problem

we were three days in a motel. we came late and went after the departure time and staff was accommodating. a big plus is laundry in the area. there are also good internet connection and good location (near metro - green line). the disadvantage was the quarter where live mexicans and we are little different.
great room, plenty of space, good internet connection. nice staff, guy in the office gave us much better room than we paid for.

the staff went into the room before we did and sprayed room spray so it does not smell so bad. there was a really bad smell coming out of the office. the water pressure was insanely high that it almost hurtles to shower there. no breakfast... it isn't a good location so hey could at least offer breakfast.

great value for money, kinda  good location (walking distance to green line - lax connection, bus 60 downtown) on the other hand better have a car than walk those streets (motel itself is an safe spot), motel standard facilities ok, wifi ok, helpful staff!
the hostel itself was very good: the staff was welcoming, nice and helpful. the room was clean and comfortable.  we were disturbed by noisy arrivals in the middle of the night though.
staff were very friendly and helpful. maid cleaned every day. had to pay extra for wifi however and the location is a bit dodgy

price : cheap  location : not so well located for pedestrian (20 min walk from silver line, but far from the touristical place). location is ok with a car ok because very close to highway.  people there are very nice and welcoming.   look : the hotel looks oldy and facilities are old.  to be known though : it is allowed to smoke in the bedroom. so if you're a non smoker be prepared to be in a room after a smoker. (not very enjoyable).

it's a regular motel from united states but they have a swimming pool then i can say that it's can be a difference for your choice. everybody say that it is so far from everything and i agree but thinking better there is no problem to stay so far from the downtown if you rent a car because the traffic in la is terrible and the most popular beachs are far from the downtown. to resume my opinion, if you don't want to pay a lot of money to sleep then chose stay in the sea rock.

it's a regular motel from united states but they have a swimming pool then i can say that it's can be a difference for your choice. everybody say that it is so far from everything and i agree but thinking better there is no problem to stay so far from the downtown if you rent a car because the traffic in la is terrible and the most popular beachs are far from the downtown. to resume my opinion, if you don't want to pay a lot of money to sleep then chose stay in the sea rock.
if you enjoy staying right between compton and inglewood then this is the place for you. in a pretty rough neighbourhood and close to absolutely nothing of interest.

the sea rock inn is very far away from everything, so you definetly need a car. the wifi costs extra. all in all it is good inn, but if you like to party without driving to the clubs, you should take one of the many inn´s in hollywood.

good place to stay for transport.  lax airport 20 mins and 30 dollars in taxi aprox. didn't explore location much, but seemed a little uninteresting. the only reason i ticked average on review for facilities, was because the internet was not working during my stay.

the building was very old and rusty.  windows were thin and almost broken.  not a few of the facilities were broken or missing.  burger restaurant and convenience store were nearby, but the road to them smells terrible.  i can't recommend anybody stay here.
the place was nice micro-atmosphere within the metro l.a. area.
the man on the counter was very friendly. the money was worth it.
room was spacious, we had fridge and microwave. wifi isn't free, also maid took my towel (don't take white towels to hotels). everything was very well (except towel).
very nice staff, very very helpful to me they were

our stay here vas very bad: the carpet in the room was filthy - leave the shower with clean feet and they'll be black with dirt in 1 minute flat. the pool doesn't have a filtration system so expect a skin on top of dead insects and plant matter. the pool also gave me a rash on my nuts which is still present. the location is central but la is so big that everything of interest is about 8 miles away in different directions. the room wreaked of smoke. a very poor hotel indeed.

everything was fine and we enyojed our stay. the room was huge but the bathroomdoor didn't close which was sometimes a little bit annoying.   the facility list on hostelworld.com says "free wifi", but wifi is not included.
really friendly stuff that likes to help you find your locations and get started with this huge city.

on our 1st night here, we witnessed true hollywood stunt just in front of our hostel with police pointing guns at a suspicious vehicle. security in this area is not very good. unless you drive &/or have a tight budget, this can be a good stop point to disneyland & san diego... else you wanna consider other hostel. staff were really helpful but the bullet-proof window at the counter proves this area is complicated. its a place where prostitutes will come at night. else this place is perfect.

it was a very good and clean budget hostel that is good for non-partiers as it has a quiet after 10pm rule. clean room and the fan cooled down the room pretty well even though there was no a/c. the staff were so friendly and helpful thanks so much and it was great that there were laundry facilities available.    my only &#39;complaint&#39; would be that there are two showers in the bathroom and everyone has access so they&#39;re not private and you have to change in the shower cubicle. no biggie though!

i appreciated that the women's bathroom required a key to open, but the lock was nearly impossible: front desk staff had to demonstrate the trick to getting it to open which involved a lot of feeling for a click and then pushing in a certain amount and other such finagling--i never really got the hang of it and there were times i just gave up. lack of ac was difficult to deal with --the days were 90+ degrees and the street noise at night was so loud i had to keep the windows closed.

the staff was super friendly, the hotel was clean at all times, even the common bathrooms. the sheets smelled great (it did enhance my bedtime experience), but the mattress was squeeky a bit and curving in the middle (my bedtime experience lost a few points there).    i thought it was at a walking distance from the beach, but "two miles away from the beach" was actually a one-hour walk? so i took the 8 bus for a dollar back and forth, which wasnt too bad. wifi connection was good.
loved the location as it was neighbourhood-y. santa monica beach

i came late, so there was no staff there on my arrival, but they sent me a long and informative email prior to my arrival, so i know how to get in, and how to find the key to my room. nice staff, nice surroundings.

i had a really pleasant stay here. room was quiet and clean and the bed was comfortable. staff were friendly. the location is a little out of the way but it's a peaceful area and felt safe. i found it to be a nice walk down to santa monica pier and venice beach, though it may be a little far for some.

loud cleaning staff very early in the morning, very thin walls i could hear people walking around and talking upstairs at night.   liked the fridge and microwave in room  friendly, welcoming and helpful staff

good place to stay, clean rooms and helpful staff. 2 toilets and 2 showers on each floor. nice cafe round the corner and bus stop around corner which takes you to the beach. trader joe's 2 blocks away. safe area
the staff were incredibly nice. i was over two hours late for my checkout and didn't get billed any extra. admirable flexibility.
i have only one night in this place. but it was normally, friendly staff, fresh simple room, fresh bathroom

the customer service from lenny at reception was exemplary.  he made every effort possible to ensure my stay at oceanpark hotel was safe and comfortable. he had a great knowledge of the sights to see in los angele and of other states in u.s.a. congratulations to lenny, matt and all the staff at ocean park hotel. i will certainly return and recommend the hotel to everyone, who plans to visit santa monica.

staff very kind and accommodating. showers clean, very hot and refreshing after a long day of hiking. if you know your way around santa monica (los angeles) location is great, bus system conveniently in front of hotel. price you can not beat for la private room at this price is unheard of! highly recommend and will stay again when i return to la. this hotel is simple and offers what a traveler needs, private room, queen bed, clean, safe and quiet.
the location is pretty bad for a hostel...

after staying at the radisson hotel for a couple of nights for a conference, i have to say that my stay at the ocean park hotel was far more enjoyable!  the place has a really great atmosphere - very bright, very clean, very comfortable.  i only stayed at a night but really enjoyed it.  it is a little far from the beach though - about an hour's walk (there might have been a shortcut?).  in any case, if i visit la again this would be where i'd stay! great value for money.
the staff were very friendly and accommodating.

had a good stay here. good location, clean, warm, had everything i needed....except a decent shower! they were awful! no water pressure to speak of and they did that universal bad shower thing of alternating between molten lava hot and liquid nitrogen cold! took forever to get showered as i was jumping in and out the water for the few seconds it was tolerable to do so after waiting for the temperature to come up/go down. seems like a small thing but you've got to have a decent shower.
staff were extremely helpful and great location
nothing spectacular, but value for money. place to put your head, bus stop outside, nice little area and was easy to make ur way into town.nice  cafe next door for breakfast.  what more can you want?
the accomodation was excatly what we needed, with basin in room, bathrooms were a bit small, but overall was a good start to our oe
actually i didn't get any room, they told me that there is no room available, and they did not have any reservation for me, i'm not sure if that's hostelworld mistake or the motel mistake

place is pretty hectic. cheapest room you can find in los angeles so you get what you pay for. pretty sketchy neighbourhood but i didnt have any problems. close to downtown and to a subway station. be careful.
the worst place i have ever been to in my life, people try to break in your room? beggars, prostitutes, smells and very badly kept. if go to la never check in to this hotel
